9_46.shloka: अपरासां च वैडूर्याः कादम्बा इव पक्षिणः।हेमसूत्राणि चान्यासां चक्रवाका इवाभवन्।।5.9.50।।
9_46.translation: The vaidurya worn by women (on the breasts) looked like Kadamba birds while the golden chains put on by some others appeared like ruddy geese.
9_46.word_by_word: परासां च and for some, वैडूर्याः vaidurya, कादम्बाः kadamba, पक्षिणः इव like birds, अन्यासाम् of others, हेमसूत्राणि golden chains ,चक्रवाकाः इव like ruddy geese, अभवन् seemed.

9_47.translation: Their hips were like river banks crowded with swans, karandava and Chakravaka birds shining like rivers.
9_47.word_by_word: पुलिनैरिव like river banks, जघनैः with hips, ताः those women, हंसकारण्डवाकीर्णाः crowded with swans and Karandava birds, चक्रवाकोपशोभिताः abounded with ruddy geese, आपगा इव like rivers, रेजुः were shining.

9_48.shloka: किङ्किणीजालसङ्कोशास्ता हैमविपुलाम्बुजाः।भावग्राहा यशस्तीराः सुप्ता नद्य इवाऽऽबभुः।।5.9.52।।
9_48.translation: With their tiny bells round their girdle looking like buds, the bold golden ornamentslike lotuses, their gestures of love like crocodiles and their radiant beauty like silver banks, the women looked like smoky rivers.
9_48.word_by_word: किङ्किणीजालसङ्कोशाः tiny bells tied round the waist looking like buds, हैमविपुलाम्बुजाः bold golden ornaments looking like lotuses, भावग्राहाः their amorous gestures of love play like crocodiles, यशस्तीराः radiant beauty of silver banks, सुप्ताः sleeping, नद्यः इव resembled rivers, आबभुः appeared.

9_49.shloka: मृदुष्वङ्गेषु कासाञ्चित्कुचाग्रेषु च संस्थिताः।बभुर्वर्भूषणानीव शुभा भूषणराजयः।।5.9.53।।
9_49.translation: The beautiful imprints made by the (heavy) ornaments on the tender limbs, breasts and nipples of some women appeared like many ornaments.
9_49.word_by_word: कासांचित् for some women, मृदुषु on their tender, अङ्गेषु limbs, कुचाग्रेषु च and on the nipples of breasts, संस्थिताः set, शुभाः beautiful, भूषणराजयः collections of ornaments, भूषणानीव like ornaments, बभूवुः appeared.

9_50.shloka: अंशुकान्ताश्च कासाञ्चिन्मुखमारुतकम्पिताः।उपर्युपरि वक्त्राणां व्याधूयन्ते पुनः पुनः।।5.9.54।।
9_50.translation: Shaken by the breath released from their mouths the fringes of the garments of some women were drawn towards their faces again and againfluttering.
9_50.word_by_word: कासाञ्चित् for some, मुखमारुतकम्पिताः shaken by the breath released by their mouth, अंशुकान्ताश्च the fringes of garments, वक्त्राणाम् on their faces, उपर्युपरि drawn, पुनः पुनः again and again, व्याधूयन्ते fluttered.

9_51.shloka: ताः पताका इवोद्धूताः पत्नीनां रुचिरप्रभाः।नानावर्णसुवर्णानां वक्त्रमूलेषु रेजिरे।।5.9.55।।
9_51.translation: The fringes of their garments glowing beautifully close to the faces of the wives (of Ravana) with different beautiful hues, shone splendid like flags.
9_51.word_by_word: नानावर्णसुवर्णानाम् of the women of different beautiful hues, पत्नीनाम् of the wives, वक्त्रमूलेषु on the edges of their faces, ताः those, रुचिरप्रभाः with beautiful glow, उध्दूताः raised, पताकाः इव like flags, रेजिरे shone.

9_52.translation: The eartops of some women endowed with auspicious charm were swinging softly generating a gentle sound by the touch of their breath.
9_52.word_by_word: शुभार्चिषाम् with auspicious radiance, कासाञ्चित् for some, योषिताम् women, कुण्डलानि eartops, अत्र here,मुखमारुतसंसर्गात् by the touch of their breath, मन्दं मन्दम् softly and gently, ववल्गुश्च mild sound of vibration.

9_53.shloka: शर्कराऽसवगन्धैश्च प्रकृत्या सुरभिः सुखः।तासां वदननिश्वासस्सिषेवे रावणं तदा।।5.9.57।।
9_53.translation: The sweet smell of wine emitted from their mouth and the natural fragrance of their breath was refreshing to Ravana  as if it was serving him at that time.
9_53.word_by_word: तदा then, प्रकृत्या natural, शर्करासवगन्धैश्च the sweet smell of wine (made from sugarcane juice), सुरभिः fragrant, सुखः happy, तासाम् their, वदननिश्वासः breath from their mouth, रावणम् Ravana, सिषेवे served.

9_54.translation: Some women of Ravana (overcome by blind passion) smelt again and again the mouths of their cowives next to them  assuming it to be Ravana's.
9_54.word_by_word: काश्चित् some, रावणयोषितः Ravana's wives, रावणाननशङ्काश्च assuming it to be Ravana's face, पुनः पुनः again and again, सपत्नीनाम् of their cowives, मुखानि mouths, उपाजिघ्रन् smelt.

9_55.shloka: अत्यर्थं सक्तमनसो रावणे ता वरस्त्रियः।अस्वतन्त्राः सपत्नीनां प्रियमेवाऽचरंस्तदा।।5.9.59।।
9_55.translation: Even though the beautiful wives (should have been angry with their cowives for smelling their mouths) they behaved pleasingly, having no freedom to act with Ravana
9_55.word_by_word: रावणे at Ravana, अत्यर्थम् therefore, सक्तमनसः devoted to (Ravana), वरस्त्रियः beautiful women, अस्वतन्त्राः having no freedom, तदा then, सपत्नीनाम् of their cowives, प्रियमेव pleasing , आचरन् did.

9_56.shloka: बाहूनुपनिधायान्याः पारिहार्यविभूषितान्।अंशुकानि च रम्याणि प्रमदास्तत्र शिश्यिरे।।5.9.60।।
9_56.translation: Some women slept pillowed on their arms, laying aside their adornments and others had their garment under the head as pillows and lay in sleep.
9_56.word_by_word: अन्याः others, प्रमदाः women, पारिहार्यविभूषितान् laying aside their adornments, बाहून् arms, रम्याणि beautiful, अंशुकानि garment, उपनिधाय placing, तत्र there, शिश्यिरे slept.

9_57.shloka: अन्या वक्षसि चान्यस्यास्तस्याः काचित्पुनर्भुजम्।अपरा त्वङ्कमन्यस्यास्तस्याश्चाप्यपरा भुजौ।।5.9.61।।
9_57.translation: Some women lay placing their arms on the breasts of the other while their own arms were used as pillow by another. One woman placed her head  on the lap of the other and slept.
9_57.word_by_word: अन्याः some women, अन्यस्याः on the other women's, वक्षसि on the chest, काचित् पुनः another again, तस्याः her, भुजम् arms अपरा तु another, अन्यस्याः on the others, अङ्कम् lap, अपरा another, तस्याः her, भुजौ on the arms.

9_58.translation: Given to intoxication and sex, the women slept touching one another's thighs, sides, hips, back and lap of the other, with their limbs intertwined.
9_58.word_by_word: मदस्नेहवशानुगाः given to intoxication and love, अन्योन्यस्य with one another, ऊरुपार्श्वकटीपृष्ठम् on thighs, side, hips and back on the lap of the other, समाश्रिताः had slept, परस्परनिविष्टाङ्ग्यः lay intertwined, one on the other.

9_59.shloka: अन्योन्यभुजसूत्रेण स्त्रीमाला ग्रथिता हि सा।मालेव ग्रथिता सूत्रे शुशुभे मत्तषट्पदा।।5.9.63।।
9_59.translation: Knit with the shoulders of one another like a garland of flowers intertwined with the tipsy bees resting the women shone.
9_59.word_by_word: अन्योन्यभुजसूत्रेण shoulders of one another, ग्रथिता knit, सा that, स्त्रीमाला chain of women, सूत्रे in a thread, ग्रथिता intertwined, मत्तषट्पदा with drunken bees resting on it, मालेव like garland of flowers, शुशुभे shone.

9_60.shloka: लतानां माधवे मासि फुल्लानां वायुसेवनात्।अन्योन्य मालाग्रथितं संसक्तकुसुमोच्चयम्।।5.9.64।।व्यतिवेष्टितसुस्कन्धमन्योन्यभ्रमराकुलम्।आसीद्वनमिवोद्धूतं स्त्रीवनं रावणस्य तत्।।5.9.65।।
9_60.translation: The women of Ravana appeared like a garden in spring. They were as if a cluster ofcreepers blossomed in spring due to the caresses of the breeze. They were knit together as one string forming a garland, flowers of one creeper striking the other. The joints of these creepers had grown strong when tangled together. Shaken by the breeze, the bees resting on one creeper would go to the other.
9_60.word_by_word: अन्योन्यमालाग्रथितम् linked to each other like a chain, संसक्तकुसुमोच्छयम् flowers in a string, व्यतिवेष्टितसुस्कन्धम् tangled together with strong joints, अन्योन्यभ्रमराकुलम् with bees swarming, रावणस्य Ravana's, तत् that, स्त्रीवनम् a garden of women, माधवे मासि in the month of spring, वायुसंसेवनात् by the blowing of the wind, फुल्लानाम् of the blooms, लतानाम् of the creepers, अन्योन्यमालाग्रथितम् one to one linked like a garland, अन्योन्यभ्रमराकुलम् like the swarm of bees, उद्धूतम् shaken, वनमिव like thickets, आसीत् appeared.

9_61.shloka: उचितेष्वपि सुव्यक्तं न तासां योषितां तदा।विवेकः शक्य आधातुं भूषणाङ्गाम्बरस्रजाम्।।5.9.66।।
9_61.translation: It was not possible to distinguish clearly between their jewels, limbs, garments and garlands and to place them in the right spots.
9_61.word_by_word: तदा then, तासां योषिताम् of those women, भूषणाङ्गाम्बरस्रजाम् of ornaments, garments, limbs and garlands, विवेकः to distinguish, सुव्यक्तम् clearly, आधातुम् to place, उचितेष्वपि in right spots, न शक्यः not possible.

9_62.shloka: रावणे सुखसंविष्टे तास्त्रियो विविधप्रभाः।ज्वलन्तः काञ्चना दीपाः प्रैक्षन्तानिमिषा इव।।5.9.67।।
9_62.translation: When Ravana was happily asleep, the gods of light burning on the gold lampposts gazed without winking as it were, at the women, whom they dare  not gaze for fear of waking Ravana.
9_62.word_by_word: रावणे when Ravana, सुखसंविष्टे was sleeping happily, विधप्रभाः gods of lights, ताः स्त्रियः those women, ज्वलन्तः glowing, काञ्चनाः दीपाः इव golden lampposts, अनिमिषाः without winking, प्रैक्षन्त इव gazed at him.

9_63.shloka: राजर्षिपितृदैत्यानां गन्धर्वाणां च योषितः।राक्षसानां च याः कन्यास्तस्य कामवशं गताः।।5.9.68।।
9_63.translation: The women halled from the families of royal sages, ancestral deities, daityas and demons who were infatuated with him.
9_63.word_by_word: राजर्षिपितृदैत्यानाम् of royal sages, ancestral gods and demons, गन्धर्वाणाम् of gandharvas, योषितः women, राक्षसानाम् of ogres, याः कन्याः those girls, तस्य his, कामवशम्गताः they were infatuated with him.

9_64.shloka: युद्धकामेन ताः सर्वा रावणेन हृताः स्त्रियः।समदा मदनेनैव मोहिताः काश्चिदागताः।।5.9.69।।
9_64.translation: Many were brought by Ravana as captives of war and some came on their own deluded by lust.
9_64.word_by_word: सर्वाः all, ताः स्त्रियः those women, युद्धकामेन on account of his love for war, रावणेन by Ravana, हृताः kidnapped, समदाः passionate ones, काश्चित् a few, मदनेन by lust, मोहिताः एव deluded, आगताः came.

9_65.shloka: न तत्र काचित्प्रमदा प्रसह्य वीर्योपपन्नेन गुणेन लब्धा।न चान्यकामापि न चान्यपूर्वा विना वरार्हां जनकात्मजां ताम्।।5.9.70।।
9_65.translation: Except Sita no other woman among them had been taken there by force. They were won only on account of his valour and virtues. None loved any one earlier and none was married to others.
9_65.word_by_word: वरार्हाम् revered, ताम् her, जनकात्मजां विना except Sita, तत्र there, काचित् प्रमदा any women, वीर्योपपन्नेन on account of his valour, प्रसह्य लब्धा obtained forcibly, न not, गुणेन by virtues, अन्यकामापि not in love with others, न च and not, अन्यपूर्वा च married by others earlier, न not.

9_66.shloka: न चाकुलीना न च हीनरूपा नादक्षिणा नानुपचारयुक्ता।भार्याभवत्तस्य न हीनसत्त्वा न चापि कान्तस्य न कामनीया।।5.9.71।।
9_66.translation: None among them was born of a lowly family, nor lacked beauty, kindness, skill, strength or brightness. No one was not lovable to Ravana.
9_66.word_by_word: तस्य his, भार्या wife, अकुलीना lowbred, न च अभवत् did not become, हीनरूपा च without beauty, न not, अदक्षिणा unkind, न not, अनुपचारयुक्ता discourteous, न not, हीनसत्त्वा without strength, न not, कान्तस्य for the lover, न कामनीया च not loveable, न none.

9_67.shloka: बभूव बुद्धिस्तु हरीश्वरस्य यदीदृशी राघवधर्मपत्नी।इमा यथा राक्षसराजभार्याः सुजातमस्येति हि साधुबुद्धेः।।5.9.72।।
9_67.translation: 'If the lawful wife of Rama born of a good family can be allowed to remain with Rama in the same way as the consorts of the lord of demons, how fortunate it would be, thought the wise lord of monkeys'.
9_67.word_by_word: इमाः these, राक्षसराजभार्याः wives of the demon lord, यथा as, राघवधर्मपत्नी Rama's lawful wife, ईदृशी such a lady, अस्य his, सुजातम् born of good family, इति thus, साधुबुद्धेः of the wise, हरीश्वरस्य Hanuman's, बुद्धिस्तु thought also, बभूव was.

9_68.shloka: पुनश्च सोऽचिन्तयादात्तरूपो ध्रुवं विशिष्टा गुणतो हि सीता।अथायमस्यां कृतवान्महात्मा लङ्केश्वरः कष्टमनार्यकर्म।।5.9.73।।
9_68.translation: Hanuman once again assuming his true form said to himself, 'Sita is surely a virtuous lady superior to and more distinguished than them all. Alas, this lord of Lanka committed an ignoble, act (by abducting her).इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये सुन्दरकाण्डे नवमस्सर्गः।Thus ends the ninth sarga of Sundarakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
9_68.word_by_word: सः he, आत्तरूपः assuming his true form, पुनश्च once again, अचिन्तयत् he thought, सीता Sita, ध्रुवम् surely, गुणतः by her virtues, विशिष्टा distinguished one, अथ now, महात्मा great, अयं लङ्केश्वरः that lord of Lanka, अस्याम् in her case, अनार्यम् an unfit act not befitting a noble one, कृतवान् did, कष्टम् alas.

10_1.shloka: [Hanuman chances upon Mandodari, wife of Ravana -- mistakes her for Sita on account of her beauty and charm.]तत्र दिव्योपमं मुख्यं स्फाटिकं रत्नभूषितम्।अवेक्षमाणो हनुमान् ददर्श शयनासनम्।।5.10.1।।दान्तकाञ्चनचित्राङ्गैर्वैडूर्यैश्च वरासनैः।महार्हास्तरणोपेतैरुपपन्नं महाधनैः।।5.10.2।।
10_1.translation: Looking around, Hanuman noticed a bed chamber, with a heavenly dais on which he saw a couch encrusted with crystals, vaidurya, and inlaid with colourful ivory and gold. It had an exquisite rich covering.
10_1.word_by_word: तत्र there, आवेक्षमाणः while looking around, हनुमान् Hanuman, दिव्योपमम् fine, heavenly मुख्यम् foremost, स्फाटिकम् made with crystals, रत्नभूषितम् encrusted with gems, दान्तकाञ्चनचित्राङ्गैः inlaid with colourful ivory and gold, वैडूर्यैः with Vaidurya, महार्हास्तरणोपेतैः with exquisite coverings, महाधनैः rich, वरासनैः fine dais, उपेतम् endowed with, शयनासनम् couch, ददर्श observed.

10_2.shloka: तस्य चैकतमे देशे सोऽग्य्रमालाविभूषितम्।ददर्श पाण्डुरं छत्रं ताराधिपतिसन्निभम्।।5.10.3।।
10_2.translation: Hanuman saw an umbrella in one spot decorated with the best of garlands. The white umbrella looked like the Moon, lord of stars.
10_2.word_by_word: सः that Hanuman, तस्य its, एकतमे in one, देशे spot, अग्य्रमालाविभूषितम् decorated with best of garlands, ताराधिपतिसन्निभम् like the Moon, पाण्डुरम् white, छत्रम् umbrella, ददर्श saw.

10_3.shloka: जातरूपपरिक्षिप्तं चित्रभानुसमप्रभम्।अशोकमालाविततं ददर्श परमासनम्।।5.10.4।।वालव्यजनहस्ताभिर्वीज्यमानं समन्ततः।गन्धैश्च विविधैर्जुष्टं वरधूपेन धूपितम्।।5.10.5।।परमास्तरणास्तीर्णमाविकाजिनसंवृतम्।दामभिर्वरमाल्यानां समन्तादुपशोभितम्।।5.10.6।।
10_3.translation: He saw an exquisite couch made of gold shining wonderfully like the Sun. It was decorated with ashoka flowers. Women were holding fans of chamari deer. It was upholstered with the best of bedspreads made of soft sheep skin and adorned with beautiful strings of flower garlands. Scented with aromatic smoke, it was refreshed with fragrance which had spread all over the place.
10_3.word_by_word: जातरूपपरिक्षिप्तम् made of gold, चित्रभानुसमप्रभम् shining like the Sun, अशोकमालाविततम् decorated with Ashoka flowers, वालव्यजनहस्ताभिः women holding fans made of the hair of chamari deer, समन्ततः all over, वीज्यमानम् he was being, विविधैः several, गन्धैः with fragrants, जुष्टम् full of, वरधूपेन with excellent fragrants, धूपितम्  smoky, परमास्तरणास्तीर्णम् spread with the best of bedspreads, आविकाजिनसंवृतम् covered with soft sheep skin, समन्तात् all over, वरमाल्यानाम् of beautiful garlands, दामभिः by strings, उपशोभितम् delightfullooking, परमासनम् exquisite couch, ददर्श saw.

10_4.shloka: तस्मिन् जीमूतसंकाशं प्रदीप्तोत्तमकुण्डलम्।लोहिताक्षं महाबाहुं महारजतवाससम्।।5.10.7।।लोहितेनानुलिप्ताङ्गं चन्दनेन सुगन्धिना।सन्ध्यारक्तमिवाकाशे तोयदं सतटिद्गणम्।।5.10.8।।वृतमाभरणैर्दिव्यैः सुरूपं कामरूपिणम्।सवृक्षवनगुल्माढ्यं प्रसुप्तमिव मन्दरम्।।5.10.9।।क्रीडित्वोपरतं रात्रौ वराभरणभूषितम्।प्रियं राक्षसकन्यानां राक्षसानां सुखावहम्।।5.10.10।।पीत्वाऽप्युपरतं चापि ददर्श स महाकपिः।भास्वरे शयने वीरं प्रसुप्तं राक्षसाधिपम्।।5.10.11।।
10_4.translation: Hanuman saw the mightyarmed, heroic lord of demons, sleeping with huge bloodshot eyes looking like a cloud, he was adorned with flashing earrings, and clad in robes of silver texture. His body was smeared with red sandal paste of sweet fragrance. Therefore, he looked like a cloud reddened by twilight and flashing with the lightning of his ornaments. He was handsome and could assume any form at will. He looked like Mandara mountain surrounded thickly with  trees and wild bushes. Decked with exquisite ornaments, he was sleeping after dalliance at night on that glittering couch. He was the beloved of the ogresses and bringer of joy to them
10_4.word_by_word: सः that, महाकपिः great monkey, जीमूतसंकाशम् like a cloud, प्रदीप्तोत्तमकुण्डलम् with flashing earrings, लोहिताक्षम् with red eyes, महाबाहुम् of huge arms, महारजतवाससम् adorned in robes of silver texture, लोहितेन  redcoloured, सुगन्धिना fragrants, चन्दनेन of sandal, अनुलिप्ताङ्गम् limbs smeared with, दिव्यैः wonderful, आभरणैः with ornaments, वृतम् decked, सन्ध्यारक्तम् at twilight, सतटिद्गणम् streaked with lightning, आकाशे  in the sky, तोयदमिव like a cloud, सुरूपम् form, कामरूपिणम् one who  could change form at free will, वराभरणभूषितम् adorned with choicest ornaments, रात्रौ in the night, क्रीडित्वा after enjoyment, उपरतम् resting, सवृक्षवनगुल्माढ्यम् rich with trees and wild bushes, प्रसुप्तम् sleeping, मन्दरम् इव like a Mandara mountain, राक्षसकन्यानाम् for ogresses, प्रियम् beloved, राक्षसानाम् for demons, सुखावहम् bringer of joy, पीत्वा after drinking, उपरतम् resting on, तस्मिन् on that, भास्वरे glittering, शयने on bed, प्रसुप्तम् sleeping, वीरम् heroic, राक्षसाधिकम् lord of demons, ददर्श saw.

10_5.translation: Having reached Ravana, who was breathing (hissing) like a snake, Hanuman was for a moment frightened and drew away from him as if he was put to terrible fear.
10_5.word_by_word: सः वानरर्षभः the bull among the vanaras, नागं यथा like a snake, निःश्वसन्तम् breathingheavily, रावणम् Ravana, आसाद्य having reached, परमोद्विग्नः  very frightened, सुभीतवत् like a person in terrible fear, अपासर्पत् drew  away

10_6.shloka: अथाऽऽरोहणमासाद्य वेदिकाऽन्तरमाश्रितः।सुप्तं राक्षसशार्दूलं प्रेक्षते स्म महाकपिः।।5.10.13।।
10_6.translation: The great vanara ascended the stairway and reached another altar and once again looked at the sleeping Ravana, the tiger among demons.
10_6.word_by_word: महाकपिः great vanara, अथ then, आरोहणम् stairway, आसाद्य on reaching, वेदिकान्तरम् another altar, आश्रितः approached, सुप्तम् sleeping, राक्षसशार्दूलम् tiger among ogres, प्रेक्षते स्म glanced once again.

10_7.shloka: शुशुभे राक्षसेन्द्रस्य स्वपतः शयनोत्तमम्।गन्धहस्तिनि संविष्टे यथा प्रस्रवणं महत्।।5.10.14।।
10_7.translation: While the lord of demons lay asleep on the magnificent couch, he  looked like the Prasravana hill with its elephant in rut.
10_7.word_by_word: स्वपतः sleeping, राक्षसेन्द्रस्य lord of rakshasa's, शयनोत्तमम् magnificent couch, गन्धहस्तिनि elephant in rut, संविष्टे is sleeping, महत् great, प्रस्रवणं यथा like Prasravana hill, शुशुभे looked lovely.

10_8.shloka: काञ्चनाङ्गदसन्नध्दै च ददर्श स महात्मनः।विक्षिप्तौ राक्षसेन्द्रस्य भुजाविन्द्रध्वजोपमौ।।5.10.15।।ऐरावतविषाणाग्रैरापीडनकृतव्रणौ।वज्रोल्लिखितपीनांसौ विष्णुचक्रपरिक्षतौ।।5.10.16।।पीनौ समसुजातांसौ संगतौ बलसंयुतौ।सुलक्षणनखाङ्गुष्ठा स्वङ्गुलीतललक्षितौ।।5.10.17।।संहतौ परिघाकारौ वृत्तौ करिकरोपमौ।विक्षिप्तौ शयने शुभ्रे पञ्चशीर्षाविवोरगौ।।5.10.18।।शशक्षतजकल्पेन सुशीतेन सुगन्धिना।चन्दनेन परार्ध्येन स्वनुलिप्तौ स्वलङ्कृतौ।।5.10.19।।उत्तमस्त्रीविमृदितौ गन्धोत्तमनिषेवितौ।यक्षपन्नगगन्धर्वदेवदानवराविणौ।।5.10.20।।
10_8.translation: Hanuman saw the great Ravana's arms, which were like a pair of Indra's flag staff adorned with golden straps. The arms bore the marks of wounds caused by Airavata, (Indra's elephant), torn by the thunderbolt of Indra in war, and wounded by the discus of Lord Visnu. His strong, fleshy, wellbuilt arms, having auspicious thumbnails, shapely fingers and palms, pressed together, resembled the iron crowbars or beam used for main doors. The arms resembled elephant's trunks, tossed on a clean bed,resembling two fivehooded snakes (fingers like hoods), besmeared with cool, fragrant, red sandalpaste of excellent quality which looked red like the hare's blood. They were well massaged  by the best of women with fine, fragrant sandal paste. They were the arms which could make yakshas, pannagas, gods and demons roar in fear at their sight.
10_8.word_by_word: सः that, महात्मनः the great self, राक्षसेन्द्रस्य demon king's, काञ्चनाङ्गदनसद्धौ two arms adorned with golden straps, विक्षिप्तौ ल्यिन्ग lying, इन्द्रध्वजोपमौ like the pair of flag staff of Indra, ऐरावतविषाणाग्रैः torn by Iravata, the vehicle of Indra, आपीडनकृतव्रणौ having scars caused by injury, वज्रोल्लिखितपीनांसौ  arms with scars caused by the thunderbolt of Indra, विष्णुचक्रपरिक्षतौ wounded by Visnu's discus, पीनौ fleshy, समसुजातांसौ wellbuilt, fleshy arms, सङ्गतौ tough, बलसंयुतौ strong, सुलक्षणनखाङ्गुष्ठौ on shapely thumb nails, स्वङ्गुलीतल लक्षितौ on shapely palms and fingers, संहतौ wellfixed, परिघाकारौ like iron crowbars, वृत्तौ rounded, करिकरोपमौ resembling elephant tusk, शुभ्रे on a clean, शयने couch, विक्षिप्तौ lying, पञ्चशीर्षौ like fivehooded, उरगौ इव like two serpents, शशक्षतजकल्पेन like the colour of the hare's blood, सुशीतेन by cool, सुगन्धिना with fragrant, परार्थ्येन fine, चन्दनेन by sandal paste, स्वनुलिप्तौ be smeared, स्वलङ्कृतौ welldecorated, उत्तमस्त्रीविमृदितौ massaged by the best of women, गन्धोत्तमनिषेवितौ anointed by best of fragrants, यक्षपन्नगगन्धर्वदेवदानवराविणौ which can make yakshas, pannagas, gandharvas, gods and demons cry in terror, भुजौ arms, ददर्श saw.

10_9.shloka: ददर्श स कपिस्तत्र बाहू शयनसंस्थितौ।मन्दरस्यांतरे सुप्तौ महाही रुषिताविव।।5.10.21।।
10_9.translation: The vanara, gazed at the arms of Ravana placed on the couch that appeared like two angry snakes asleep in a cave on (the lap) of mount Mandara.
10_9.word_by_word: सः कपिः that vanara, तत्र there, मन्दरस्य mount Mandara's, अन्तरे in the cave, सुप्तौ asleep, रुषितौ angry, महाही इव like two serpents, शयनसंस्थितौ placed on the bed, बाहू two arms, ददर्श saw.

10_10.shloka: ताभ्यां स परिपूर्णाभ्यां भुजाभ्यां राक्षसेश्वरः।शुशुभेऽचलसङ्काशः शृङ्गाभ्यामिव मन्दरः।।5.10.22।।
10_10.translation: The lord of demons looked splendid like a mountain with his long, fully developed arms. He appeared like Mandara mountain with two lofty peaks.
10_10.word_by_word: अचलसङ्काशः (he) appeared like a mountain, सः he, राक्षसेश्वरः lord of demon, परिपूर्णाभ्याम् fully developed, ताभ्याम् with both of them, भुजाभ्याम् with arms, शृङ्गाभ्याम् with two peaks, मन्दरः इव resembled mount Mandara, शुशुभे shone.

10_11.shloka: चूतपुन्नागसुरभिर्वकुलोत्तमसंयुतः।मृष्टान्नरससंयुक्तः पानगन्धपुरस्कृतः।।5.10.23।।तस्य राक्षससिंहस्य निश्चक्राम महामुखात्।शयानस्य विनिःश्वासः पूरयन्निव तद् गृहम्।।5.10.24।।
10_11.translation: The breath released from the huge mouth of that lion of demons carried the fragrance of mango and punnaga as well as excellent Bakula flowers. It exuded the aroma of rich and delicious food and different drink. It was as though pervading the whole chamber.
10_11.word_by_word: शयानस्य while he was sleeping, तस्य राक्षससिंहस्य of that of lion of demons, महामुखात् from his huge mouth, चूतपुन्नागसुरभिः fragrance of Punnaga and Mango blossoms, वकुलोत्तमसंयुतः and mixed with the fragrance of the best of Bakula flowers, मृष्टान्नरससंयुक्तः mixed with aroma of rich food, पानगन्धपुरस्सरः and also of the aroma of drinks, विनिःश्वासः breath, तत् that, गृहम् home, पूरयन्निव  pervading as though, निश्चक्राम spread out.

10_12.shloka: मुक्तामणिविचित्रेण काञ्चनेन विराजितम्।मकुटेनापवृत्तेन कुण्डलोज्वलिताननम्।।5.10.25।।रक्तचन्दनदिग्धेन तथा हारेण शोभिना।पीनायतविशालेन वक्षसाऽभिविराजितम्।।5.10.26।।पाण्डरेणापविद्धेन क्षौमेण क्षतजेक्षणम्।महार्हेण सुसंवीतं पीतेनोत्तमवाससा।।5.10.27।।माषराशिप्रतीकाशं निश्श्वसन्तं भुजङ्गवत्।गाङ्गे महति तोयान्ते प्रसुप्तमिव कुञ्जरम्।।5.10.28।।चतुर्भिः काञ्चनैर्दीपैद्धीप्यमानचतुर्दिशम्।प्रकाशीकृतसर्वाङ्गं मेघं विद्युद्गणैरिव।।5.10.29।।पादमूलगताश्चापि ददर्श सुमहात्मनः।पत्नी: स प्रियभार्यस्य तस्य रक्षःपतेर्गृहे।।5.10.30।।
10_12.translation: Hanuman saw Ravana, whose face was lit up by his earrings. His shining headgear studded with gold and pearls was set aside. His fleshy, broad chest on which the pearl necklace had slightly receded from its position(as he was asleep)  was shining along with the red sandal paste. He had put on a splendid white silken cloth which had also slipped a little and was covered with exquisitely  rich yellow upper garment. His eyes were bloodred. His body was comparable to a heap of blackbeans. He was sighing heavily like a hissing snake. He appeared like an elephant sleeping on the banks of the great river Ganges. With four golden lamps glowing on four sides of the bed,the four directions were illuminated. All his limbs lit up bright (with the glow of lamps), he looked like a cloud with streaks of lightning. His dear wives were seen resting at his feet in the palace of the lord of demons.
10_12.word_by_word: सः that, तस्य रक्षःपतेः of Ravana, the lord of demons, गृहे in the palace, मुक्तामणिविचित्रेणstudded with pearls and gems, काञ्चनेन by gold, अपवृत्तेन kept aside, मकुटेन by a crown, विराजितम् glittering, कुण्डलोज्वलिताननम् face shining with earrings, रक्तचन्दनदिग्धेन smeared with bright red sandal paste, हारेण by a string of pearls, शोभिना shining, पीनायतविशालेन fleshy and broad, वक्षसा on the chest, अभिविराजितम् very splendid, पाण्डरेण white, अपविद्धेन in disarray, क्षौमेण by silken cloth, क्षतजेक्षणम् having bloodred eyes, महार्हेण with an excellent, पीतेन with yellow, उत्तमवाससा with very expensive cloth, सुसंवीतम् covered well,माषराशिप्रतीकाशम् resembling a heap of blackbeans, भुजङ्गवत् like a snake, निःश्वसन्तम् sighing heavily, महति in a large, गाङ्गे on Ganga, तोयान्ते on the edge of water, प्रसुप्तम् sleeping, कुञ्जरम् इव like the elephant, काञ्चनैः golden,चतुर्भिः with four, दीपैः with lamps, दीप्यमानचतुर्दिशम् illumined on all four sides, विद्युद्गणैः by the flashes of lightning, प्रकाशीकृतसर्वाङ्गम् all his limbs lit up, प्रियभार्यस्य and his dear wives, सुमहात्मनः that great Ravana, पादमूलगताः seated at the feet, पत्नीश्च wives, ददर्श saw.

10_13.translation: Hanuman, the leader of vanaras found the wives of Ravana,  whose  faces were bright as the Moon, adorned with beautiful earrings and fresh floral garlands.
10_13.word_by_word: हरियूथपः leader of vanaras, शशिप्रकाशवदनाः women with faces splendid like the Moon, चारुकुण्डलभूषिताः adorned with beautiful earrings, अम्लानमाल्याभरणाः wearing ever fresh garlands of flowers, ददर्श saw.

10_14.translation: Hanuman saw  the women there wearing fine jewellery, performing dances, playing musical instruments, and resting on the lap or leaning on the arms of the demon king.
10_14.word_by_word: हरिः Hanuman, नृत्तवादित्रकुशलाः women proficient in dancing and playing musical instruments, राक्षसेन्द्रभुजाङ्कगाः resting on his arms and lap, वराभरणधारिण्यः wearing fine jewellery,निषण्णाः leaning,ददृशेsaw.

10_15.shloka: वज्रवैडूर्यगर्भाणि श्रवणान्तेषु योषिताम्।ददर्श तापनीयानि कुण्डलान्यङ्गदानि च।।5.10.33।।
10_15.translation: He noticed on the earlobes of the the women gold earrings decked with diamonds and vaidurya. They were wearing shining armlets of gold.
10_15.word_by_word: योषिताम् of those women there, श्रवणान्तेषु fixed to their ears, वज्रवैडूर्यगर्भाणि encrusted with diamonds and Vaidurya, तापनीयानि shining armlets of gold, कुण्डलानि earrings, अङ्गदानि च and Angadas (bracelets worn on upper arms), ददर्श saw.

10_16.translation: There the beautiful moonlike faces of women Illumined by the lovely earrings lay on the cot which looked resplendent like the sky lit up with hosts of stars.
10_16.word_by_word: ललितकुण्डलैः by lovely earrings, चन्द्रोपमैः Moon like, शुभैः by beautiful, तासाम् their, वक्त्रै: with countenance, तत् विमानम् that exceptional cot, तारागणैः with hosts of stars, नभः इव like the sky, विरराज resplendent.

10_17.translation: Exhausted by drinking and indulging in amorous sport, the consorts of Ravana slept here and there with their visible slender waists.
10_17.word_by_word: मदव्यायामखिन्नाः exhausted by drinking, तनुमध्यमाः women of slender waist, ताः those, राक्षसेन्द्रस्य demon king's, योषितः wives, तेषु तेषु here and there, अवकाशेषु after having dalliance, प्रसुप्ताः slept.

10_18.translation: Another woman exceedingly beautiful and a delicate danseuse of beautiful complexion and rhythmic movements held her limbs in a dancing posture (though asleep) due to her habit .
10_18.word_by_word: अन्या a certain woman, नृत्तशालिनी a danseuse, वरवर्णिनी of exceedingly beautiful complexion, कोमलैः with delicate, अङ्गहारैः rythmicmovements of dance, तथैव due to her dance habit, विन्यस्तशुभसर्वाङ्गी held her limbs in a dance posture, प्रसुप्ता slept.

10_19.shloka: काचिद्वीणां परिष्वज्य प्रसुप्ता सम्प्रकाशते।महानदीप्रकीर्णेव नलिनी पोतमाश्रिता।।5.10.37।।
10_19.translation: Another woman slept hugging her veena. She shone like a lotus plant flung in a large river, clinging on to a boat. (Veena is compared to a boat and the woman to a lotusplant in the ambience of flowing waters of the river. The entire hall had put up such a dynamic view showing hectic life of the inmates).
10_19.word_by_word: वीणाम् veena, परिष्वज्य hugging, प्रसुप्ता slept, काचित् one (woman), महानदीप्रकीर्णा floating in a large river, पोतम् a boat, आश्रिता holding, नलिनीव like a lotusplant, सम्प्रकाशते  shines.

10_20.shloka: अन्या कक्षगतेनैव मड्डुकेनासितेक्षणा।प्रसुप्ता भामिनी भाति बालपुत्रेव वत्सला।।5.10.38।।
10_20.translation: A woman with dark eyes asleep with a drum placed in her armpit looked like a beautiful mother holding her loving baby (the drum was hung to her arm with a rope).
10_20.word_by_word: कक्षगतेनैव held on her armpit, मड्डुकेन with Madduka drum, इव like प्रसुप्ता sleeping, अन्याः other, असितेक्षणा darkeyed, वत्सला lovingly, बालपुत्रा held a baby, भामिनीव a beautiful lady, भाति  splendid.

10_21.shloka: पटहं चारुसर्वाङ्गी पीड्य शेते शुभस्तनी।चिरस्य रमणं लब्ध्वा परिष्वज्येव भामिनी।।5.10.39।।
10_21.translation: Another charming beauty endowed with beautiful breasts lay hugging a tambourine as though a passionate woman lay embracing her lover whom she secured after a long time.
10_21.word_by_word: चारुसर्वाङ्गी charming lady, शुभस्तनी of beautiful breasts, भामिनी beauty, चिरस्य a long time, रमणम् pleasure, लब्ध्वा having got, परिष्वज्येव as if hugged, पटहम् a tambourine, पीड्य  held tight, शेते slept.

10_22.shloka: काचिद्वंशं परिष्वज्य सुप्ता कमललोचना।रहः प्रियतमं गृह्य सकामेव च कामिनी।।5.10.40।।
10_22.translation: Yet another lotuseyed lady slept embracing a lute as if a lovelorn woman lay clasping her lover.
10_22.word_by_word: कमललोचना lotuseyed, काचित् yet another lady, वंशम् lute, परिष्वज्य embracing, रहः in privacy, प्रियतमम् lover, गृह्य holding, सकामा in love, कामिनीव like a lover, सुप्ता slept.

10_23.shloka: विपञ्चीं परिगृह्यान्या नियता नृत्तशालिनी।निद्रावशमनुप्राप्ता सह कान्तेव भामिनी।।5.10.41।।
10_23.translation: Another selfpossessed lady, graceful in dance, holding a sevenstringed lute  was as though lying asleep with her beloved.
10_23.word_by_word: नृत्तशालिनी a lady graceful in dance, अन्या other, विपञ्चीम् sevenstringed lute, परिगृह्यholding, नियता selfpossessed one, सहकान्ता along with her lover, इव like, भामिनीव loved one, निद्रावशम् while sleeping, अनुप्राप्ता overtaken.

10_24.translation: Another lady with drunken eyes lay fast asleep holding a drum close to her beautiful bosom with her soft limbs. (These images show that these women were singing and dancing till late night and slept exhausted).
10_24.word_by_word: मत्तलोचना a lady of drunken eyes, अन्या another, कनकसङ्काशै: of golden complexion, मृदुपीनैः soft bosom, मनोहरैः delightful, अङ्गैः limbs, मृदङ्गम् drum, परिपीड्य holding, प्रसुप्ता slept.

10_25.shloka: भुजपार्श्वान्तरस्थेन कक्षगेन कृशोदरी।पणवेव सहानिन्द्या सुप्ता मदकृतश्रमा।।5.10.43।।
10_25.translation: Another lady of slender belly, who had been exhausted by drunkeness was lying with a tabor pressed to her bosom and inserted in her armpit.
10_25.word_by_word: अनिन्द्या flawless, कृशोदरी of slender stomach, मदकृतश्रमा exhausted by drunkenness, भुजपर्श्वान्तरस्थेन pressed to her bosom, कक्षगेन into her armpit, पणवेन सह with tabor, सुप्ता slept

10_26.shloka: डिण्डिमं परिगृह्यान्या तथैवासक्तडिण्डिमा।प्रसुप्ता तरुणं वत्समुपगूह्येव भामिनी।।5.10.44।।
10_26.translation: One lovely woman and another held a drum and slept as if they were hugging their young child.
10_26.word_by_word: आसक्तडिण्डिमा holding a drum, अन्या another one, डिण्डिमम् drum, परिगृह्य having held, तथैव in the same position, तरुणम् young, वत्सम् child, उपगुह्य by holding, इव like  प्रसुप्ता slept,भामिनी lovely lady

10_27.shloka: काचिदाडम्बरं नारी भुजसंयोगपीडितम्।कृत्वा कमलपत्राक्षी प्रसुप्ता मदमोहिता।।5.10.45।।
10_27.translation: Yet another with her eyes like lotus petals deluded with passion tightly held in her arms a musical instrument known as Adambaram and slept.
10_27.word_by_word: कमलपत्राक्षी eyes like lotus petals, काचित् yet another, नारी woman, आडम्बरम् Adambaram, a musical instrument, भुजसंयोगपीडितम् held tightly in her arms, कृत्वा having made, मदमोहिता deluded with passion, प्रसुप्ता slept.

10_28.shloka: कलशीमपविध्यान्या प्रसुप्ता भाति भामिनी।वसन्ते पुष्पशबला मालेव परिमार्जिता।।5.10.46।।
10_28.translation: Another lovely lady was fast asleep, having turned a goblet of water  aside, yet another lay like a garland of variegated flowers in spring season.
10_28.word_by_word: कलशीम् goblet filled with water, अपविध्य by turning aside, प्रसुप्ता slept, अन्या भामिनी another lovely one, वसन्ते in Spring, परिमार्जिता swept away, पुष्पशबला of variegated flowers, मालेव garland like, भाति appeared.

10_29.shloka: पाणिभ्यां च कुचौ काचित्सुवर्णकलशोपमौ।उपगूह्याबला सुप्ता निद्राबलपराजिता।।5.10.47।।
10_29.translation: Overcome with sleep another woman lay pressing with her own hands her golden gobletlike breasts.
10_29.word_by_word: काचित् yet another, अबला woman, पाणिभ्याम् with both her hands, सुवर्णकलशोपमौ like golden goblets, कुचौ breasts, उपगूह्य pressing, निद्राबलपराजिता overpowered with sleep, सुप्ता slept.

10_30.shloka: अन्या कमलपत्राक्षी पूर्णेन्दुसदृशानना।अन्यामालिङ्ग्य सुश्रोणीं प्रसुप्ता मदविह्वला।।5.10.48।।
10_30.translation: One woman with eyes like lotus petals and face like the fullmoon embraced another young woman of beautiful hips  and slept tipsy with drink.
10_30.word_by_word: कमलपत्राक्षी eyes like lotus petals, पूर्णेन्दुसदृशानना face like the fullmoon, अन्या another one, मदविह्वला drowsy with drunkeness, सुश्रोणीम् with beautiful hips, अन्याम् other, आलिङ्ग्य having embraced, प्रसुप्ता slept.

10_31.shloka: आतोद्यानि विचित्राणि परिष्वज्य वरस्त्रियः।निपीड्य च कुचैस्सुप्ता कामिन्यः कामुकानिव।।5.10.49।।
10_31.translation: Some charming maidens held wonderful musical instruments pressing against their bosom and slept like passionate women embracing their loved ones.
10_31.word_by_word: वरस्त्रियः exquisite women, विचित्राणि of many wonderful kinds, आतोद्यानि musical instruments, परिष्वज्य embraced, कामिन्यः passionate women, कामुकानिव as if their loved ones, कुचैः with their bosom, निपीड्य by holding, सुप्ता slept.

10_32.shloka: तासामेकान्तविन्यस्ते शयानां शयने शुभे।ददर्श रूपसम्पन्नामपरां स कपिः स्त्रियम्।।5.10.50।।
10_32.translation: Hanuman saw some maidens lying on separate excellent beds, women richly  endowed with beautysleeping.
10_32.word_by_word: सः कपिः that vanara, तासाम् among them, एकान्तविन्यस्ते lying separately, शुभे excellent, शयने bed, शयानाम् sleeping, रूपसम्पन्नाम् richly endowed with beauty, स्त्रियम् women, ददर्श saw.

10_33.shloka: मुक्तामणिसमायुक्तैर्भूषणैः सुविभूषिताम्।विभूषयन्तीमिव तत्स्वश्रिया भवनोत्तमम्।।5.10.51।।गौरीं कनकवर्णाभामिष्टामन्तः पुरेश्वरीम्।कपिर्मन्दोदरीं तत्र शयानां चारुरूपिणीम्।।5.10.52।।
10_33.translation: Then the vanara saw  a very beautiful woman of golden complexion decked with pearls and gems and with ornaments as if illuminating the excellent mansion with her splendour She was the king's favourite and the chief queen, Mandodari.
10_33.word_by_word: कपिः vanara, मुक्तामणिसमायुक्तै: with pearls and gems, भूषणैः with ornaments, सुविभूषिताम् well decorated, स्वश्रिया by her radiance, तत् that, भवनोत्तमम् that excellent mansion, विभूषयन्तीमिव as if decorating, गौरीम् woman of golden complexion, कनकवर्णाभाम् of golden complexion, इष्टाम् favourite, अन्तःपुरेश्वरीम् queen of the harem, तत्र there, शयानाम् sleeping, चारुरूपिणीम् very beautiful, मन्दोदरीम् Mandodari.

10_34.shloka: स तां दृष्ट्वा महाबाहुर्भूषितां मारुतात्मजः।तर्कयामास सीतेति रूपयौवनसम्पदा।।5.10.53।हर्षेण महता युक्तो ननन्द हरियूथपः।
10_34.translation: On seeing her embellished with ornaments, beauty and charm, the long armed son of the Windgod, the chief of the vanaras thought her to be Sita and rejoiced.
10_34.word_by_word: महाबाहुः with long arms, सः मारुतात्मजः that son of the Windgod, भूषिताम् decorated, ताम् her, दृष्ट्वा on seeing, रूपयौवनसम्पदा by the wealth of her beauty and charm, सीतेति 'this is Sita', तर्कयामास deliberated, हरियूथपः chief of vanara, महता with great, हर्षेण joy, युक्तः endowed, ननन्द rejoiced.

10_35.shloka: आस्फोटयामास चुचुम्ब पुच्छं ननन्द चिक्रीड जगौ जगाम।स्तम्भानरोहन्निपपात भूमौ निदर्शयन् स्वां प्रकृतिं कपीनाम्।।5.10.54।।
10_35.translation: He rejoiced clapping his palms, kissing his tail and jumping up, climbing up the pillars and jumping down on the ground in joy. Thus he exhibited his monkey nature.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये सुन्दरकाण्डे दशमस्सर्गः।Thus ends the tenth sarga of Sundarakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
10_35.word_by_word: आस्फोटयामास clapped his palms, पुच्छम् tail, चुचुम्ब kissed, ननन्द rejoiced, चिक्रीड played, जगौ sang songs, जगाम went about, स्वाम् himself, कपीनाम् of being monkeys, प्रकृतिम् nature, निदर्शयन् while exhibiting, स्तम्भान् pillars, अरोहन् while climbing up, भूमौ on the land, निपपात jumped down.

11_1.shloka: [Hanuman mistakes Mandodari for Sita -- soon dismises his wrong inference -- sees the women of harem lying in disorder -- could not find Sita]अवधूय च तां बुद्धिं बभूवावस्थितस्तदा।जगाम चापरां चिन्तां सीतां प्रति महाकपिः।।5.11.1।।
11_1.translation: The great vanara, having rejected his judgement, started thinking again.
11_1.word_by_word: महाकपिः great vanara, तदा then, ताम् such, बुद्धिम् judgement, अवधूय having rejected, अवस्थितः stood, बभूव remained, सीतां प्रति about Sita, अपराम् again, चिन्ताम् thinking, जगाम started.

11_2.shloka: न रामेण वियुक्ता सा स्वप्तुमर्हति भामिनी।न भोक्तुं वाप्यलङ्कर्तुं न पानमुपसेवितुम्।।5.11.2।।नान्यं नरमुपस्थातुं सुराणामपि चेश्वरम्।न हि रामसमः कश्चिद्विद्यते त्रिदशेष्वपि।।5.11.3।।अन्येयमिति निश्चित्य पानभूमौ चचार सः।
11_2.translation: 'Lovely Sita, being away from Rama, will not sleep, will not eat or drink or adorn herself. How can she approach any other man even if he is the king of gods for there is none equal to Rama even among gods'. Having thus decided, Hanuman strolledabout the banquet hall.
11_2.word_by_word: भामिनी lovely lady, रामेण about Rama, वियुक्ता separated, स्वप्तुम् to sleep, न अर्हति will not, भोक्तुम् न not to eat, अलङ्कर्तुम् to decorate, अपि also, न not, पानम् drinking, उपसेवितुम् to serve, सुराणाम् among gods, ईश्वरमपि even the lord, अन्यम् and others, नरम् man, उपस्थातुम् to approach, न not, हि indeed, रामसमः equal to Rama, कश्चित् any one, त्रिदशेष्वपि even among gods, न विद्यते हि not exist, इयम् this lady, अन्या other, इति thus, निश्चित्य having decided, सः he, पानभूमौ at the banquet, चचार strolled.

11_3.shloka: क्रीडितेनापराः क्लान्ता गीतेन च तथाऽपराः।।5.11.4।।नृत्तेन चापराः क्लान्ताः पानविप्रहतास्तथा।
11_3.translation: Some women were fatigued after sporting, similarly some were exhausted after singing. Others were tired through dancing and some were worn out by continuous drinking.
11_3.word_by_word: पराः other women, क्रीडितेन by sporting, क्लान्ताः fatigued, तथा similarly, अपराः others, गीतेन due to singing, अपराः others, नृत्तेन by dancing, क्लान्ताः tired out, तथा so also, पानविप्रहताः  worn out due to continuous drinking.

11_4.shloka: मुरजेषु मृदङ्गेषु पीठिकासु च संस्थिताः।।5.11.5।।तथाऽऽस्तरणमुख्येषु संविष्टाश्चापराः स्त्रियः।
11_4.translation: Some women reclined on tabors, some on murajas, and some on drums and hassocks while some slept on excellent couches.
11_4.word_by_word: मुरजेषु on murajas, मृदङ्गेषु on tabors, पीठिकासु च on hassocks, संस्थिताः resting, अपराः other, स्त्रियः women, आस्तरणमुख्येषु on exquisite beds, संविष्टाः lying.

11_5.shloka: अङ्गनानां सहस्रेण भूषितेन विभूषणैः।।5.11.6।।रूपसल्लापशीलेन युक्तगीतार्थभाषिणा।देशकालाभियुक्तेन युक्तवाक्याभिधायिना।।5.11.7।।रताभिरतसंसुप्तं ददर्श हरियूथपः।
11_5.translation: The monkey leader saw thousands of  beautiful women asleep after long dalliance. Some of them were adorned with ornaments, some were good at arguments and versed in the appreciation of songs, some were aware of the appropriate time and place and some were adept in right expressions.
11_5.word_by_word: विभूषणैः with ornaments, भूषितेन adorned, रूपसल्लापशीलेन good at arguments, युक्तगीतार्थभाषिणा versed in appreciation, देशकालाभियुक्तेन acquainted with the appropriateness of time and place, युक्तवाक्याभिधायिना good at appropriate expressions,अङ्गनानाम् of women, सहस्रेण thousands, रताभिरतसंसुप्तम् sleeping after long sexual intercourse, हरियूथपः monkey leader, ददर्श saw.

11_6.shloka: तासां मध्ये महाबाहुः शुशुभे राक्षसेश्वरः।।5.11.8।।गोष्ठे महति मुख्यानां गवां मध्ये यथा वृषः।
11_6.translation: In the midst of these women the longarmed lord of demons shone like a (majestic) bull in a big cowshed.
11_6.word_by_word: तासाम् their, मध्ये in the midst, महाबाहुः longarmed, राक्षसेश्वरः lord of ogres, महति a big, गोष्ठे in a shed, गवाम् of cows, मध्ये in the midst, वृषः इव like a bull, शुशुभे  shone.

11_7.shloka: स राक्षसेन्द्रः शुशुभे ताभिः परिवृतस्स्वयम्।।5.11.9।।करेणुभिर्यथाऽरण्ये परिकीर्णो महाद्विपः।
11_7.translation: Surrounded by the women, the demon king shone like a proud elephant attended by many female elephants scattered in a dense forest.
11_7.word_by_word: ताभिः by those women, परिवृतः surrounded, सः राक्षसेन्द्रः the demon king, स्वयम् himself, महारण्ये in a great forest, करेणुभिः with female elphants, परिकीर्णः scattered, महाद्विपः यथा like a proud elephant, शुशुभे shone.

11_8.shloka: सर्वकामैरुपेतां च पानभूमिं महात्मनः।।5.11.10।।ददर्श हरिशार्दूलस्तस्य रक्षःपतेर्गृहे।
11_8.translation: The tiger among vanaras saw at the great Ravana's palace a drinking place where everything one desires was provided.
11_8.word_by_word: हरिशार्दूलः tiger among vanaras, महात्मनः of the great, तस्य his, रक्षःपते: Ravana's, गृहे in the palace, सर्वकामैः with all his, उपेताम् provided, पानभूमिं च drinking place, ददर्श saw.

11_9.shloka: मृगाणां महिषाणां च वराहाणां च भागशः।।5.11.11।।तत्र न्यस्तानि मांसानि पानभूमौ ददर्श सः।
11_9.translation: There at the drinking hall the meat of deer, buffaloes and boars portioned and placed.
11_9.word_by_word: सः he, तत्र there, पानभूमौ at the drinking hall, भागशः in portions, न्यस्तानि placed, मृगाणाम् on the deer, महिषाणां च buffaloes, वराहाणां च pigs, मांसानि meat, ददर्श saw.

11_10.shloka: रौक्मेषु च विशालेषु भाजनेष्वर्धभक्षितान्।।5.11.12।।ददर्श हरिशार्दूलो मयूरान् कुक्कुटांस्तथा।
11_10.translation: The tiger among vanaras also saw there meat of peacocks and chicken placed in large golden vessels, some half eaten.
11_10.word_by_word: हरिशार्दूलः tiger among vanaras, रौक्मेषु in golden, विशालेषु in large ones, भाजनेषु vessels, अर्धभक्षितान् half eaten, मयूरान् peacocks, तथा so also, कुक्कुटान् chicken, ददर्श saw.

11_11.translation: Hanuman saw the meat of pigs and jungle fowls, deer, peacocks and bones marinated with yoghurt and special kinds of salt.
11_11.word_by_word: दधिसौवर्चलायुतान् marinated with yoghurt and special salt, वराहवार्ध्राणसकान् meat of pigs and jungle fowls, हनुमान् Hanuman, अन्ववैक्षत observed, शल्यान् bones, मृगमयूरांश्च deer and peacocks.

11_12.shloka: क्रकरान्विविधान् सिद्धांश्चकोरानर्धभक्षितान्।।5.11.14।।महिषानेकशल्यांश्च छागांश्च कृतनिष्ठितान्।लेह्यानुच्चावचान्पेयान् भोज्यानि विविधानि च।।5.11.15।।
11_12.translation: He saw several kinds of (nonvegetarian) food like cooked meat of fowls, ruddy geese, buffaloes, goats, fishes as well as food for licking. (Food is of four kinds  1) भक्ष्य which can be chewed 2) भोज्य ordinary solid, semisolid food which can be consumed  3) लेह्य food for licking  4) चोष्य liquid food (which can be sipped)).
11_12.word_by_word: विविधान् several types, सिद्धान् cooked, क्रकरान् fowls, अर्धभक्षितान् half eaten, चकोरान् ruddy geese, महिषान् buffaloes, एकशल्यांश्च fishes, छागांश्च goats, उच्चवचान् all sorts of them, लेह्यान् varieties of food that can be licked, पेयान् drinks, विविधानि of many kinds, भोज्यानि eatables.

11_13.translation: The banquet hall looked splendid with food seasoned with salt and sour ingredients. There was ragashadavas (syrup made with grapes, pomegranates, different juices like half ripe mangoes and seasoned with ginger cardomom, butter etc). Heavy chains, anklets and shouldersstraps were thrown aside. (The people relaxed while eating and drinking and discarded heavy ornaments). Many glasses were found scattered or drinks spilt on the floor after use.Many fruits and flowers were kept.
11_13.word_by_word: तथा so also, आम्ललवणोत्तंसैः seasoned with sour and salty ingredients, विविधैः with many types, रागषाडबैः with syrups, अपविद्धै: with discarded, महाधनैः with heavy, हारनूपुरकेयूरैः with chains, anklets, shoulder straps, पानभाजनविक्षिप्तै: with those drinks spilt from the glasses, विविधैः with many, फलैश्च fruits, कृतपुष्पोपहारा with the offerings flowers of, भूः the earth, अधिकम् greatly, श्रियम् rich, पुष्यति looked splendid.

11_14.shloka: तत्र तत्र च विन्यस्तै: सुश्लिष्टैश्शयनासनैः।पानभूमिर्विना वह्निं प्रदीप्तेवोपलक्ष्यते।।5.11.18।।
11_14.translation: Good couches and different kinds of seats were wellarranged in the banquet hall. The place appeared as if it was glowing witout fire.
11_14.word_by_word: पानभूमिः banquet hall, तत्र तत्र here and there, विन्यस्तै: arranged, सुश्लिष्टैः wellarranged, शयनासनैः with beds and seats, विना वह्निम् without fire, प्रदीप्तेव as if glowing, उपलक्ष्यते seemed.

11_15.translation: In the banquet hall there were many types of meat arranged in a number of ways. They were cooked by experts by seasoning them with choicest ingredients.
11_15.word_by_word: बहुप्रकारैः in many ways, विविधैः with many kinds, नरसंस्कारसंस्कृतैः by those seasoneed with many types of ingredients, कुशलसम्पृक्तै: cooked by experts, पृथक् separately, पानभूमिगतैः at the banquet hall, मांसैः with meat.

11_16.shloka: दिव्याः प्रसन्ना विविधाः सुराः कृतसुरा अपि।शर्कराऽसवमाध्वीकपुष्पासवफलासवाः।।5.11.20।।वासचूर्णैश्च विविधैर्मृष्टास्तैस्तैः पृथक् पृथक्।
11_16.translation: There were many types of wonderful and pleasing wine extracted from sugarcane, honey , fruits and flowers. They were good even though fermented and made deliciousby seasoning with aromatic spices.
11_16.word_by_word: दिव्याः wonderful, प्रसन्नाः pleasing, विविधाः many, सुराः wines, शर्करासवमाध्वीकपुष्पासवफलासवाः sugercanejuices, honey, juices made from flowers and fruits, कृतसुराः अपि even though fermented, तैस्तै: as mentioned earlier, विविधैः with many, वासचूर्णैः with spice powders, पृथक् पृथक् diferent and, मृष्टाः were made delicious.

11_17.shloka: सन्तता शुशुभे भूमिर्माल्यैश्च बहुसंस्थितैः।।5.11.21।।हिरण्मयैश्च विविधैर्भाजनैः स्फाटिकैरपि।जाम्बूनदमयैश्चान्यैः करकैरभिसंवृता।।5.11.22।।
11_17.translation: (The banquet hall) appeared beautiful with many kinds of garlands arranged in different locations. Also there were vessels made of pure gold, crystalware and jars spread all over.
11_17.word_by_word: बहुसंस्थितैः arranged in varied styles, माल्यैश्च with garlands, संतता strectched, हिरण्मयैः with those made of gold, स्फाटिकैरपि and crystalware, विविधैः several kinds, भाजनैः with vessels, जाम्बूनदमयैः made of pure gold, अन्यैः by others, करकैः with jars, अभिसंवृता spread all over, भूमिः floor, शुशुभे looked  beautiful.

11_18.shloka: राजतेषु च कुम्भेषु जाम्बूनदमयेषु च।पानश्रेष्ठं तदा भूरि कपिस्तत्र ददर्श ह।।5.11.23।।
11_18.translation: Hanuman saw the best of wines in large quantities kept in silver and pure gold pots.
11_18.word_by_word: कपिः monkey, तदा then, राजतेषु in those made of silver, जाम्बूनदमयेषु च in those made of pure gold, कुम्भेषु in pots, भूरि abundant, पानश्रेष्ठम् best of wines, ददर्श ह saw.

11_19.shloka: ﻿सोऽपश्यच्छातकुम्भानि सीधोर्मणिमयानि च।राजतानि च पूर्णानि भाजनानि महाकपिः।।5.11.24।।
11_19.translation: ﻿The great monkey saw the wine jars made of gold and silver studded with crystals and gems.
11_19.word_by_word: ﻿स: महाकपिः that great monkey, शीधोः of wine, शातकुम्भानि made of gold, मणिमयानि च inlaid with gems also, राजतानि च and silver, पूर्णानि filled, भाजनानि vessels, अपश्यत् saw.

11_20.shloka: क्वचिदल्पावशेषाणि क्वचित्पीतानि सर्वशः।क्वचिन्नैव प्रपीतानि पानानि स ददर्श ह।।5.11.25।।
11_20.translation: He saw wine jars at one place, some fully drained, and at another place not touched at all.
11_20.word_by_word: स he, क्वचित् in one place, अल्पावशेषाणि left over, क्वचित् at one place, सर्वशः fully, पीतानि drained, क्वचित् yet in another spot, नैव प्रपीतानि not touched even a little, पानानि drinks, ददर्श ह saw.

11_21.shloka: क्वचिद् भक्ष्यांश्च विविधान् क्वचित्पानानि भागशः।क्वचिदन्नावशेषाणि पश्यन्वै विचचार ह।।5.11.26।।
11_21.translation: He moved about looking at different types of eatables and drinks arranged separately along with the left over food.
11_21.word_by_word: क्वचित् in one place, विविधान् many types, भक्ष्यांश्च eatables, क्वचित् in another place, भागशः separated, पानानि drinks, क्वचित् in another places, अन्नावशेषाणि left over food, पश्यन् while looking at, विचचार ह he moved about.

11_22.shloka: क्वचित्प्रभिन्नैः करकैः क्वचिदालोलितैर्घटैः।क्वचित्संपृक्तमाल्यानि जलानि च फलानि च।।5.11.27।।
11_22.translation: At some places he saw broken pots, at other places rolling pots and elsewhere flower garlands strewn and mixed up with water and fruits.
11_22.word_by_word: क्वचित् in one place, प्रभिन्नैः with broken, करकैः with pots, क्वचित् at other place, आलोलितैः with rolling, घटैः with pots, क्वचित् somewhere else, संपृक्तमाल्यानि strewn and mixed up flower garlands, जलानि च and water, फलानि च and fruits.

11_23.shloka: शयनान्यत्र नारीणां शुभ्राणि बहुधा पुनः।परस्परं समाश्लिष्य काश्चित्सुप्ता वराङ्गनाः।।5.11.28।।
11_23.translation: Hanuman saw many beds some unused and some occupied by lovely women sleeping, embracing one another.
11_23.word_by_word: अत्र there, नारीणाम् women's, शयनानि beds, पुनः again, बहुधा severally, शुभ्राणि clean (unused) काश्चित् some, वराङ्गनाः lovely women, परस्परम् each other, समाश्लिष्य having embraced, सुप्ताः slept.

11_24.shloka: काश्चिच्च वस्त्रमन्यस्यास्स्वपन्त्याः परिधाय च।आहृत्य चाबलाः सुप्ता निद्राबलपराजिताः।।5.11.29।।
11_24.translation: Overcome with sleep some women pulled clothes of other women and covered their bodies with them.
11_24.word_by_word: काश्चित् some, अबलाः women, निद्राबलपराजिताः succumbed to sleep, स्वपन्त्याः of sleeping women, अन्यस्याः others, वस्त्रम् clothes, आहृत्य after pulling, परिधाय covering their bodies with the same, सुप्ताः slept.

11_25.shloka: तासामुच्छवासवातेन वस्त्रं माल्यं च गात्रजम्।नात्यर्थं स्पन्दते चित्रं प्राप्य मन्दमिवानिलम्।।5.11.30।।
11_25.translation: The lovely clothes and garlands on the bodies of women were moving mildly by their exhalations as if shaken by the gentle breeze.
11_25.word_by_word: तासाम् their, गात्रजम् on their bodies, वस्त्रम् clothes, माल्यं च and garlands, उच्छवासवातेन by their exhaling, मन्दम् mildly, अनिलम् wind, प्राप्य इव as though caught, नात्यर्थम् by that, चित्रम् it is lovely, स्पन्दते moving.

11_26.shloka: चन्दनस्य च शीतस्य शीधोर्मधुरसस्य च।विविधस्य च माल्यस्य धूपस्य विविधस्य च।।5.11.31।।बहुधा मारुतस्तत्र गन्धं विविधमुद्वहन्।
11_26.translation: With the many scents of cool sandal, of sweetsmelling wines of diverse kinds, as well as flower garlands of several types and of incense burning in that hall, the cool wind blew spreading several fragrances all over.
11_26.word_by_word: तत्र there, मारुतः the wind, शीतस्य of cool, चन्दनस्य  of  sandal, शीथोः of the wines, मधुरसस्य च of sweet smelling, विविधस्य of diverse, माल्यस्य and of garlands, विविधस्य of several types, धूपस्य च and of incense, विविधम् several, गन्धम् fragrances, बहुधा in many ways, उद्वहन्  blew.

11_27.shloka: स्नानानां चन्दनानां च धूपानां चैव मूर्छितः।।5.11.32।।प्रववौ सुरभिर्गन्धो विमाने पुष्पके तदा।
11_27.translation: The wind wafting through the Pushpaka chariot carried the fragrance of the cool sandalpaste used in bath and the sweet smell of wines and thick smoke of fragrance spread further.
11_27.word_by_word: तदा then, पुष्पके विमाने in the Pushpaka chariot, स्नानानाम् followed by bath, चन्दनानां च of sandals, धूपानां चैव also incense, सुरभिः sweet smelling wines, गन्धः fragrance, मूर्छितः spread, प्रववौ wafted through.

11_28.shloka: श्यामावदातास्तत्रान्याः काश्चित्कृष्णा वराङ्गनाः।।5.11.33।।काश्चित् काञ्चनवर्णाङ्ग्यः प्रमदा राक्षसालये।
11_28.translation: There in the demons abode were women who were fair, some lovely with dark and others with golden complexion.
11_28.word_by_word: तत्र there, राक्षसालये in the abode of the ogres, अन्याः others, श्यामावदाताः of glowing dark complexion, काश्चित् some, वराङ्गनाः lovely women, कृष्णाः dark in colour, काश्चित् some, प्रमदाः women, काञ्चनवर्णाङ्ग्यः of golden complexion.

11_29.shloka: तासां निद्रावशत्वाच्च मदनेन विमूर्छितम्।।5.11.34।।पद्मिनीनां प्रसुप्तानां रूपमासीद्यथैव हि।
11_29.translation: Withered due to indulgence in sex they were overcome with sleep. The charm of the women was like the lotus creepers with closed lotuses .
11_29.word_by_word: निद्रावशत्वाच्च overwhelmed with sleep, मदनेन च and due to dalliance, विमूर्छितम् exhausted, प्रसुप्तानाम् of the sleeping, तासाम् their, रूपम् charm, प्रसुप्तानाम् of the sleeping, पद्मिनीनाम् of lotus creepers, यथैव as, आसीत् was seen.

11_30.shloka: एवं सर्वमशेषेण रावणान्तः पुरं कपिः।।5.11.35।।ददर्श सुमहातेजाः न ददर्श च जानकीम्।
11_30.translation: Brilliant Hanuman ransacked the harem of Ravana but found no Janaki.
11_30.word_by_word: सुमहातेजाः brilliant, कपिः monkey, एवम् in that way, सर्वम् all, रावणान्तःपुरं harem of Ravana, अशेषेण thoroughly, ददर्श searched, जानकीं च Janaki, न ददर्श did not see.

11_31.shloka: निरीक्षमाणश्च तदा ताः स्त्रियः स महाकपिः।।5.11.36।।जगाम महतीं चिन्तां धर्मसाध्वसशङ्कितः।
11_31.translation: The great monkey was very much worried as he thought he had transgressed the moral code by watching the women.
11_31.word_by_word: तदा then, स्त्रियः women, निरीक्षमाणः while seeing, सः he, महाकपिः the great monkey, धर्मसाध्वसशङ्कितः thinking that he transgressed the moral code, महतीम् great, चिन्ताम् worry, जगाम experienced.

11_32.shloka: परदारावरोधस्य प्रसुप्तस्य निरीक्षणम्।।5.11.37।।इदं खलु ममात्यर्थं धर्मलोपं करिष्यति।
11_32.translation: 'Observing the wives of others in this manner in their inner chambers very much amounts to transgression of moral code  by me'. ( thought he)
11_32.word_by_word: प्रसुप्तस्य of those sleeping, परदारावरोधस्य of the inner chambers of others' wives, इदम् this, मम on my part, निरीक्षणम् observing them, अत्यर्थम् very much, धर्मलोपम् trangression of moral code, करिष्यति will lead to.

11_33.shloka: न हि मे परदाराणां दृष्टिर्विषयवर्तिनी।।5.11.38।।अयं चात्र मया दृष्टः परदारापरिग्रहः।
11_33.translation: 'I did see these wives of another, but not with a sensual mind. I have only seen them but not with foul intention'.
11_33.word_by_word: मे my, दृष्टिः to view, परदाराणाम् others' wives, विषयवर्तिनी sensual, न हि not indeed, अत्र there, मया by me, अयम् this, परदारापरिग्रहः others' wives, दृष्टश्च were seen.

11_34.translation: Another  bright idea struck the highly sensible Hanuman, who had a clear vision of the task ahead-- 'I was firm and singleminded in my direction regarding the task ahead' (thought he).
11_34.word_by_word: मनस्विनः highly sensible, निश्चितैकान्तचित्तस्य struck with a bright idea in a single direction, तस्य his, पुनः again, कार्यनिश्चयदर्शिनी the decision regarding the task ahead, अन्या other, चिन्ता thought, प्रादुरभूत् arose.

11_35.shloka: कामं दृष्टा मया सर्वा विश्वस्ता रावणस्त्रियः।।5.11.40।।न हि मे मनसः किञ्चिद्वैकृत्यमुपजायते।
11_35.translation: 'It is true I saw all the loyal wives of Ravana but without any foul desire. Indeed in my mind no passionate feeling was ever aroused'.
11_35.word_by_word: विश्वस्ताः loyal, सर्वाः all, रावणस्त्रियः wives of Ravana, मया by me, कामं दृष्टाः are seen indeedwithout any foul desire, मे my, मनसः minds, किञ्चित् even a little, वैकृत्यम् passionate feeling, न उपजायते हि indeed not arise.

11_36.shloka: मनो हि हेतुः सर्वेषामिन्द्रियाणां प्रवर्तने।।5.11.41।।शुभाशुभास्ववस्थासु तच्च मे सुव्यवस्थितम्।
11_36.translation: 'Mind propels the sense organs to do good or bad deeds. (But) my mind is firmly esatablished in righteousness'.
11_36.word_by_word: शुभाशुभासु for good and bad, अवस्थासु in all stages, सर्वेषाम् for all, इन्द्रियाणाम् of sense organs, प्रवर्तने in reaction, मनः mind, हेतुः is instrumental, मे my, तच्च that also, सुव्यवस्थितम्  is firmly eastablished.

11_37.shloka: नान्यत्र हि मया शक्या वैदेही परिमार्गितुम्।।5.11.42।।स्त्रियो हि स्त्रीषु दृश्यन्ते सदा सम्परिमार्गणे।
11_37.translation: 'It is not possible for me to look for Vaidehi elsewhere. During such search operations one always looks for women among women.'
11_37.word_by_word: वैदेही Vaidehi, अन्यत्र at other places, परिमार्गितुम् to search, मया by me, न शक्या हि not possible indeed, सदा always, सम्परिमार्गणे during search, स्त्रियः women, स्त्रीषु among women, दृश्यन्ते can be seen.

11_38.shloka: यस्य सत्त्वस्य या योनिस्तस्यां तत्परिमार्ग्यते।न शक्या प्रमदा नष्टा मृगीषु परिमार्गितुम्।।5.11.43।।
11_38.translation: 'One has to search a creature among its own species. It is not possible to find a lost woman in the herd of female deer'.
11_38.word_by_word: यस्य whose, सत्त्वस्य of a being, या whichever, योनिः source, तत् that, तस्याम् in that, परिमार्ग्यते is searched, नष्टा lost, प्रमदा woman, मृगीषु among female deer, परिमार्गितुम् to search, न शक्या not possible.

11_39.shloka: तदिदं मार्गितं तावच्छुद्धेन मनसा मया।।5.11.44।।रावणान्तःपुरं सर्वं दृश्यते न तु जानकी।
11_39.translation: 'I searched all over Ravana's harem with a pure mind but I have not seen Janaki'.
11_39.word_by_word: तत् that, मया by me, शुद्धेन with a pure, मनसा mind, इदम् this, सर्वम् all, रावणान्तःपुरम् Ravana's harem, मार्गितम् searched, जानकी तु but Janaki also, न दृश्यते is not seen.

11_40.translation: Even while valiant Hanuman was looking among the daughters of gods, gandharvas and nagas he could not find Janaki.
11_40.word_by_word: देवगन्धर्वकन्याश्च daughters of gods, gandharvas also, नागकन्याश्च and daughters of nagas, अवेक्षमाणः looked, वीर्यवान् valiant, हनुमान् Hanuman, जानकीम् Janaki, नैवापश्यत did not find.

11_41.shloka: तामपश्यन्कपिस्तत्र पश्यञ्श्चान्या परस्त्रियः।।5.11.46।।अपक्रम्य तदा वीरः प्रध्यातुमुपचक्रमे।
11_41.translation: Heroic Hanuman, unable to find Sita among the women, moved aside and started thinking.
11_41.word_by_word: वीरः hero, कपिः vanara, तत्र there, ताम् her, अपश्यन् not able to see, अन्याः others, परस्त्रियः the wives of others, पश्यञ्श्च and while seeing, तदा then, अपक्रम्य having moved aside, प्रध्यातुम् to contemplate, उपचक्रमे started.

11_42.shloka: स भूयस्तु परं श्रीमान् मारुतिर्यत्नमास्थितः।।5.11.47।।आपानभूमिमुत्सृज्य तद्विचेतुं प्रचक्रमे।
11_42.translation: Illustrious Hanuman left the banquet hall to renew his effort in search of Sita.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीये आदिकाव्ये सुन्दरकाण्डे एकादशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the eleventh sarga of Sundarakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
11_42.word_by_word: श्रीमान् Illustrious, सः मारुतिः Maruti, भूयः once again, परम् great, यत्नम् effort, आस्थितः made, आपानभूमिम् banquet hall, उत्सृज्य leaving, तत् that, विचेतुम् to search, प्रचक्रमे departed.

12_1.shloka: [Hanuman makes a thorough search of Ravana's palace for Sita.]स तस्य मध्ये भवनस्य मारुतिर्लतागृहांश्चित्रगृहान्निशागृहान्।जगाम सीतां प्रति दर्शनोत्सुकोन चैव तां पश्यति चारुदर्शनाम्।।5.12.1।।
12_1.translation: Anxious to find Sita, Hanuman revisited the bowers of creepers, picture galleries and domitories located in the midst of the mansion, but  did not find that beautiful Sita.
12_1.word_by_word: सः मारुतिः Maruti, तस्य of that, भवनस्य mansion's, मध्ये midst, सीतां प्रति towards Sita, दर्शनोत्सुकः with eagerness to find, लतागृहान् homes of creepers, चित्रगृहान् picture galleries, निशागृहान् dormitories for rest at night, जगाम went, चारुदर्शनाम् beautiful lady, ताम् that Sita, न चैव पश्यति did not find her.

12_2.shloka: स चिन्तयामास ततो महाकपिःप्रियामपश्यन्रघुनन्दनस्य ताम्।ध्रुवं हि सीता म्रियते यथा न मेविचिन्वतो दर्शनमेति मैथिली।।5.12.2।।
12_2.translation: The great monkey, unable to find the beloved of Rama thought Sita might not be surviving. So he started thinking, ' I could not see her even though I have searched allover'.
12_2.word_by_word: ततः then, सः महाकपिः that great monkey, रघुनन्दनस्य Rama's, प्रियाम् beloved, ताम् her, अपश्यन् while being unable to find, चिन्तयामास started thinking, मैथिली Mythili, विचिन्वतः while searching, मे to me, यथा as, दर्शनम् her sight, न उपैति not appears, सीता Sita, ध्रुवम् surely, म्रियते dead.

12_3.shloka: सा राक्षसानां प्रवरेण जानकीस्वशीलसंरक्ष्णतत्परा सती।अनेन नूनं प्रति दुष्टकर्मणाहता भवेदार्यपथे परे स्थिता।।5.12.3।।
12_3.translation: 'Janaki, follower of noble path, anxious to protect her chastity must have been killed by the wicked demon king.
12_3.word_by_word: परे best, आर्यपथे on a noble path, स्थिता follower, सा जानकी Janaki,              स्वशीलसंरक्षणतत्परा सती who wishes to protect her chastity, प्रति दुष्टकर्मणा by this evil mind, अनेन by him, राक्षसानां प्रवरेण by the demon king, हता slayed, भवेत् is, नूनम् surely.

12_4.shloka: विरूपरूपा विकृता विवर्चसोमहानना दीर्घविरूपदर्शनाः।समीक्ष्य सा राक्षसराजयोषितोभयाद्विनष्टा जनकेश्वरात्मजा।।5.12.4।।
12_4.translation: 'The daughter of Janaka might have collapsed out of fear, looking at the distorted faces of ugly, tall and monstrous demon maids of Ravana.
12_4.word_by_word: सा that, जनकेश्वरात्मजा daughter of king Janaka, विरूपरूपाः distorted forms, विकृताः ugly, विवर्चसः dull, महाननाः women with huge faces, दीर्घविरूपदर्शनाः tall and deformed, राक्षसराजयोषितः wives of the demon king, समीक्ष्य on looking, भयात् out of fear, विनष्टा died.

12_5.shloka: सीतामदृष्ट्वा ह्यनवाप्य पौरुषंविहृत्य कालं सह वानरैश्चिरम्।न मेऽस्ति सुग्रीवसमीपगा गतिःसुतीक्ष्णदण्डो बलवांश्च वानरः।।5.12.5।।
12_5.translation: 'I have spent a long time with vanaras. I have not  succeded in my efforts to find Sita. I dare not see Sugriva now without finding Sita and without fulfilling my task. Sugriva will punish me severely. There is no way out.'
12_5.word_by_word: सीताम् Sita, अदृष्ट्वा without seeing, पौरुषम् pride of achievement, अनवाप्य without achieving, वानरैः सह accompanied by vanaras, चिरं कालम् for a long time, विहृत्य having passed time, मे to myself, सुग्रीवसमीपगा to approach Sugriva, गतिः way, नास्ति not possible, वानरः vanara, सुतीक्ष्णदण्डः  will punish severely, बलवांश्च powerful.

12_6.shloka: दृष्टमन्तःपुरं सर्वं दृष्टा रावणयोषितः।न सीता दृश्यते साध्वीवृथा जातो मम श्रमः।।5.12.6।।
12_6.translation: 'I have searched all over the harem. Ravana's women have been seen. (Yet) I have not been able to see noble Sita. My efforts have been wasted'.
12_6.word_by_word: सर्वम् everywhere, अन्तःपुरम् the harem, दृष्टम् seen, रावणयोषितः Ravana's women, दृष्टाः are seen, साध्वी noble lady, सीता Sita, न दृश्यते is not seen, मम my, श्रमः efforts, वृथा wasted, जातः gone.

12_7.shloka: किं नु मां वानराः सर्वे गतं वक्ष्यन्ति सङ्गताः।गत्वा तत्र त्वया वीर किं कृतं तद्वदस्व नः।।5.12.7।।
12_7.translation: 'What will the vanaras say when I return? What should I speak when they ask me: O hero, what did you accomplish there?'
12_7.word_by_word: गतम् when I reach, माम् me, सङ्गताः together, सर्वे all, वानराः vanaras, किं नु what indeed, वक्ष्यन्ति they will speak, वीर O hero, तत्र there, गत्वा after going, त्वया by you, किम् what, कृतम् is done, तत् that, नः for us, वदस्व you will say.

12_8.shloka: अदृष्ट्वा किं प्रवक्ष्यामि तामहं जनकात्मजाम्।ध्रुवं प्रायमुपैष्यन्ति कालस्य व्यतिवर्तने।।5.12.8।।
12_8.translation: 'Since the time limit has exceeded and Janaki is not spotted, surely the vanaras would sit and wait unto death. What am I going to say'?
12_8.word_by_word: ताम् her, जनकात्मजाम् Janaki, अदृष्टवा without seeing, किम् what, प्रवक्ष्यामि l am going to say, कालस्य for a long time, व्यतिवर्तने exceeded time limit, ध्रुवम् surely, प्रायम् उपैष्यन्ति they will sit down and wait until death.

12_9.shloka: किं वा वक्ष्यति वृद्धश्च जाम्बवानाङ्गदश्च सः।गतं पारं समुद्रस्य वानराश्च समागताः।।5.12.9।।
12_9.translation: 'What will the elderly Jambavan say? What will young prince Angada and other vanaras collected there say when I reach the seashore to meet them'.
12_9.word_by_word: समुद्रस्य ocean's, पारम् other shore, गतम् on going, वृद्धः elderly, जाम्बवान् Jambavan, किं वा why or else, वक्ष्यति will say, सः he, अङ्गद: च Angada also, समागताः collecting together, वानराश्च and vanaras.

12_10.shloka: अनिर्वेदः श्रियो मूलमनिर्वेदः परं सुखम्।अनिर्वेदो हि सततं सर्वार्थेषु प्रवर्तकः।।5.12.10।।
12_10.translation: Wise Hanuman once again declared, 'being free from despair is the root cause of prosperity. Freedom from despondency gives supreme happiness and leads to success'.
12_10.word_by_word: अनिर्वेदः being free from despair, श्रियः prosperity, मूलम् cause, अनिर्वेदः being free from despondency, परम् supreme, सुखम् happiness, अनिर्वेदः being free from despair, सततम् always, सर्वार्थेषु in all objectives, प्रवर्तकः हि will lead the way.

12_11.shloka: करोति सफलं जन्तोः कर्म यत्तत्करोति सः।तस्मादनिर्वेदकृतं यत्नं चेष्टेऽहमुत्तमम्।।5.12.11।।भूयस्तावद्विचेष्यामि देशान्रावणपालितान्।
12_11.translation: 'The action of a living being certainly bears fruit. Therefore, I shall put forth my best effort without feeling despondent. I will once again search everywhere in Lanka ruled  by Ravana'.
12_11.word_by_word: यत् that, कर्म action, करोति that he will do, जन्तोः of a living being, तत् that, सफलम् fruitful, सः he, करोति will do, तस्मात् therefore, अहम् I, अनिर्वेदकृतम् without experiencing despair, उत्तमम् best, प्रयत्नम् effort, चेष्टे I act, अदृष्टान् not seen, रावणपालितान् ruled by Ravana, देशान् country, विचेष्यामि तावत् search everywhere.

12_12.shloka: आपानशाला विचितास्तथा पुष्पगृहाणि च।।5.12.12।।चित्रशालाश्च विचिता भूयः क्रीडागृहाणि च।निष्कुटान्तररथ्याश्च विमानानि च सर्वशः।।5.12.13।।
12_12.translation: 'I have searched the banquet halls, bowers of creepers, picture galleries and gymnasiums. I have searched everywhere through the paths of gardens and mansions, harems and the Pushpaka chariot also.
12_12.word_by_word: पानशालाः banquet halls, विचिताः searched, तथा so also, पुष्पगृहाणि च bowers of creepers, चित्रशालाश्च picture galleries, विचिताः searched, भूयः further, क्रीडागृहाणि च and sports galleries, निष्कुटान्तररथ्याश्च paths through the gardens and mansions, female apartments, विमानानि च of the chariot, सर्वशः everywhere.

12_13.translation: Thinking thus, he started searching once again the basement cells, temples, homes within homes.
12_13.word_by_word: इति thus, सञ्चिन्त्य thinking over well, भूमीगृहान् underground cells, चैत्यगृहान् temples, गृहातिगृहकानपि homes with many doorways also, भूयोऽपि once again, विचेतुम् to search,उपचक्रमे he started.

12_14.shloka: उत्पतन्निष्पतंश्चापि तिष्ठन्गच्छन् पुनः पुनः।अपावृण्वंश्च द्वाराणि कवाटान्यवघाटयन्।।5.12.15।।प्रविशन्निष्पतंश्चापि प्रपतन्नुत्पतन्नपि।सर्वमप्यवकाशं स विचचार महाकपिः।।5.12.16।।
12_14.translation: The great vanara searched all over again and again jumping up and down, stopping for a while and moving, opening and closing doors, by crossing, entering and exiting, jumping up and down. Thus he moved about and searched whereever there was scope to search
12_14.word_by_word: सः महाकपिः that great vanara, पुनः पुनः again and again, उत्पतन् jumping, निष्पतंश्चापि climbing down, तिष्ठन्  standing, गच्छन् going, द्वाराणि entrance, अपावृण्वन् opening, कवाटानि doors, अवघाटयन् crossing, प्रविशन् entering, निष्पतंश्चापि and coming out, प्रपतन् jumping down, उत्पतन्नपि climbing up, सर्वम् अपि and all over, अवकाशम् scope, विचचार searched.

12_15.shloka: चतुरङ्गुलमात्रोऽपि नावकाशः स विद्यते।रावणान्तःपुरे तस्मिन् यं कपिर्न जगाम सः।।5.12.17।।
12_15.translation: Even a space of four fingers in the inner chambers of Ravana was not left out in his search for Sita.
12_15.word_by_word: तस्मिन् in that, रावणान्तःपुरे in Ravana's inner chambers, सः कपिः monkey, यम् where, न जगाम did not go, सः he, अवकाशः scope, चतुरङ्गुलमात्रोऽपि even four fingers of space, न not विद्यते leaving.

12_16.translation: He moved in the lanes inside the boundary walls, around the shrines, altars, wells and tanks whereever it was possible to look for.
12_16.word_by_word: प्राकारान्तररथ्याश्च lanes inside the boundaries, चैत्यसंश्रयाः around shrines, वेदिकाः altars, दीर्घिकाः wells, पुष्करिण्यश्च tanks, सर्वम् everywhere, तेन by him, अवलोकितम् was seen.

12_17.shloka: राक्षस्यो विविधाकारा विरूपा विकृतास्तथा।दृष्टा हनुमता तत्र न तु सा जनकात्मजा।।5.12.19।।
12_17.translation: Hanuman could see only ogresses of different typesugly, deformed but could not find the daughter of Janaka.
12_17.word_by_word: विविधाकाराः of different types, विरूपाः ugly, तथा so also, विकृताः deformed, राक्षस्यः ogresses, तत्र there, हनुमता by Hanuman, दृष्टाः were seen, सा she, जनकात्मजा तु daughter of Janaka, न not found.

12_18.shloka: रूपेणाप्रतिमा लोके वरा विद्याधरस्त्रियः।दृष्टा हनुमता तत्र न तु राघवनन्दिनी।।5.12.20।।
12_18.translation: Hanuman could see even the women of vidyadharas who were matchless in beauty among women in the world but not Janaki the beloved of Raghava.
12_18.word_by_word: रूपेण in beauty, लोके in the world, अप्रतिमाः incomparable, वराः best, विद्याधरस्त्रियः Vidyadhara women, तत्र there, हनुमता by Hanuman, दृष्टाः were seen, राघवनन्दिनी तु beloved of Raghava, न not find.

12_19.shloka: नागकन्या वरारोहाः पूर्णचन्र्दनिभाननाः।दृष्टा हनुमता तत्र न तु सीता सुमध्यमा।।5.12.21।।
12_19.translation: Hanuman could see there moonfaced daughters of nagas with charming limbs but not the slimwaisted Sita.
12_19.word_by_word: वरारोहाः lovely women with symmetrical limbs, पूर्णचन्र्दनिभाननाः moonfaced women, नागकन्याः daughters of nagas, तत्र there, हनुमता by Hanuman, दृष्टाः were seen, सुमध्यमा a woman of lovely waist, सीता तु Sita, न not found.

12_20.shloka: प्रमथ्य राक्षसेन्द्रेण नागकन्या बलाद्धृताः।दृष्टा हनुमता तत्र न सा जनकनन्दिनी।।5.12.22।।
12_20.translation: Hanuman saw the daghters of nagas kidnapped by Ravana forcibly after victory in war but not Sita, the delight of Janaka.
12_20.word_by_word: राक्षसेन्द्रेण by the demon king, प्रमथ्य defeating, बलात् forcefully, हृताः abducted, नागकन्याः daughters of nagas, तत्र there, हनुमता by Hanuman, दृष्टाः seen, सा that, जनकनन्दिनी न not the delight of Janaka.

12_21.shloka: सोऽपश्यंस्तां महाबाहुः पश्यंश्चान्या वरस्त्रियः।विषसाद मुहुर्धीमान् हनुमान् मारुतात्मजः।।5.12.23।।
12_21.translation: The longarmed Hanuman, son of the Windgod was able to see other great women but not Sita. So he became despondent.
12_21.word_by_word: महाबाहुः longarmed, धीमान् wise one, मारुतात्मजः son of the Wind god, सः हनुमान् Hanuman, ताम् her, अपश्यन् while being unable to see, अन्याः other, वरस्त्रियः great women, पश्यन् while seeing, मुहुः again, विषसाद was sorrowful.

12_22.shloka: उद्योगं वानरेन्द्राणां प्लवनं सागरस्य च।व्यर्थं वीक्ष्यानिलसुतश्चिन्तां पुनरुपागमत्।।5.12.24।।
12_22.translation: The son of the Wind god, the great monkey realised the futility of his efforts in crossing the sea. He brooded again.
12_22.word_by_word: वानरेन्द्राणाम् of the great vanara, उद्योगम् effort, सागरस्य ocean's, प्लवनं च in crossing, व्यर्थम् wasted, वीक्ष्य after seeing that, अनिलसुतः son of the Windgod, पुनः again, चिन्ताम् worry,उपागमत् experienced.

12_23.translation: Hanuman, son of the Windgod, came out of the aerial chariot, mind stricken with grief and started thinking again.इत्यार्षे  श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये सुन्दरकाण्डे द्वादशस्सर्गः।Thus ends the twelfth sarga of Sundarakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
12_23.word_by_word: अथ now, मारुतात्मजः son of the Windgod, हनुमान् Hanuman, विमानात् from the aerialchariot, अवतीर्य after descending, शोकोपहतचेतनः mind stricken with grief, चिन्ताम् worry, उपजगाम he experienced.

13_1.shloka: [Hanuman's soliloquy in despondency.]विमानात्तु सुसम्क्रम्य प्राकारं हरियूथपः।हनुमान्वेगवानासीद्यथा विद्युद्घनान्तरे।।5.13.1।।
13_1.translation: Hanuman, the vanara leader, jumped from the aerial chariot to the boundary wall like a flash of lightning in the clouds.
13_1.word_by_word: हरियूथपः vanara leader, हनुमान् Hanuman, विमानात् from the aerial chariot, प्राकारम् boundary wall, सुसम्क्रम्य jumped, घनान्तरे in the clouds, विद्युत् यथा like the lightning, वेगवान् speedily, आसीत् appeared.

13_2.shloka: सम्परिक्रम्य हनुमान्रावणस्य निवेशनात्।अदृष्ट्वा जानकीं सीतामब्रवीद्वचनं कपिः।।5.13.2।।
13_2.translation: Going round the palace of Ravana, unable to see Janaka's daughter Sita, Hanuman spoke thus to himself:
13_2.word_by_word: कपिः vanara, हनुमान् Hanuman, रावणस्य Ravana's, निवेशनात् from the home, सम्परिक्रम्य going round, जानकीम् Janaka's daughter, सीताम् Sita, अदृष्ट्वा not seeing, वचनम् these words, अब्रवीत् spoke.

13_3.shloka: भूयिष्ठं लोलिता लङ्का रामस्य चरता प्रियम्।न हि पश्यामि वैदेहीं सीतां सर्वाङ्गशोभनाम्।।5.13.3।।
13_3.translation: "I have thoroughly surveyed the entire city of Lanka to please Rama, but I am unable to find Sita of flawless beauty.
13_3.word_by_word: रामस्य Rama's, प्रियम् to please, चरता while doing, लङ्का Lanka, भूयिष्ठम् in and out, लोलिता checked thoroughly, सर्वाङ्गशोभनाम् of beautiful limbs, वैदेहीम् Vaidehi, सीताम् Sita, न हि पश्यामि I have not seen.

13_4.shloka: पल्वलानि तटाकानि सरांसि सरितस्तथा।नद्योऽनूपवनान्ताश्च दुर्गाश्च धरणीधराः।।5.13.4।।लोलिता वसुधा सर्वा न तु पश्यामि जानकीम्।
13_4.translation: "I have searched for Sita thoroughly in waterlogs, lakes, tanks, streams and rivers and all over the woods and among mountains that are difficult to reach. I have searched all over the land but have not been able to find Janaki.
13_4.word_by_word: पल्वलानि waterlogs, तटाकानि tanks, सरांसि lakes, तथा similarly, सरितः streams, नद्यः rivers, अनूपवनान्ताश्च along the woods, दुर्गाः difficult places to reach, धरणीधराः mountains, सर्वा: all, वसुधा over the land, लोलिता searched, जानकीं तु but Janaki, न पश्यामि I have not seen.

13_5.shloka: इह सम्पातिना सीता रावणस्य निवेशने।।5.13.5।।आख्याता गृध्रराजेन न च पश्यामि तामहम्।
13_5.translation: "Sampati, king of vultures had said that Sita is at Ravana's palace. But I have not been able to see her.
13_5.word_by_word: सीता Sita, इह here, रावणस्य Ravana's, निवेशने in his palace, गृध्रराजेन by the king of vultures, सम्पातिना by Sampati, आख्याता has told, अहम् I, ताम् her, न च पश्यामि but have not seen her.

13_6.shloka: किं नु सीताऽथ वैदेही मैथिली जनकात्मजा।।5.13.6।।उपतिष्ठेत विवशा रावणं दुष्टचारिणम्।
13_6.translation: "Can it be that Mythili, daughter of Janaka, dejected and helpless succumbed to the evil intentions of Ravana.
13_6.word_by_word: अथ now, वैदेही princess of Videha, मैथिली Mythili, जनकत्माजा Janaka's daughter, सीता Sita, विवशा dejected helpless, दुष्टचारिणम् a man of evilconduct, रावणम् to Ravana, किं नु उपतिष्ठेत  did she succumb?

13_7.shloka: क्षिप्रमुत्पततो मन्ये सीतामादाय रक्षसः।।5.13.7।।बिभ्यतो रामबाणानामन्तरा पतिता भवेत्।
13_7.translation: "Or, perhaps she might have been dropped midway from the hold of Ravana while he was flying at great speed, afraid of the deadly arrows of Rama?
13_7.word_by_word: रामबाणानाम् of the arrows of Rama, बिभ्यतः out of fear, रक्षसः the demon, सीताम् Sita, आदाय having brought, क्षिप्रम् at great speed, उत्पततः while flying, अन्तरा in the middle, पतिता dropped, भवेत् may be, मन्ये I think.

13_8.shloka: अथवा ह्रियमाणायाः पथि सिद्धनिषेविते।।5.13.8।।मन्ये पतितमार्याया हृदयं प्रेक्ष्य सागरम्।
13_8.translation: "Or, perhaps while being borne away on the path frequented by siddhas, the beloved of Rama might have fallen down (dead), heart broken, on seeing the (vast) sea.
13_8.word_by_word: अथवा or else, सिद्धनिषेविते frequented by siddhas, पथि on the path, ह्रियमाणायाः while being borne away, आर्यायाः of the noble lady, हृदयम् heart, सागरम् sea, प्रेक्ष्य on seeing, पतितम् fallen, मन्ये I think.

13_9.shloka: रावणस्योरुवेगेन भुजाभ्यां पीडितेन च।।5.13.9।।तया मन्ये विशालाक्ष्या त्यक्तं जीवितमार्यया।
13_9.translation: "He thinks, on account of the high speed during the flight of Ravana under thepressure of his arms, the noble, largeeyed lady might have given up her life.
13_9.word_by_word: रावणस्य Ravana's, उरुवेगेन by the high speed in the flight, भुजाभ्याम् with the arms, पीडितेन च being under pressure, विशालाक्ष्या by the largeeyed one, तया by her, आर्यया by the noble lady, जीवितम् life, त्यक्तम् given up, मन्ये I think.

13_10.shloka: उपर्युपरि वा नूनं सागरं क्रमतस्तदा।।5.13.10।।विवेष्टमाना पतिता सागरे जनकात्मजा।
13_10.translation: "Surely, she might have fallen into the sea while wriggling in her effort to extricate herself from the hold of Ravana as he was flying over the sea.
13_10.word_by_word: तदा then, सागरम् उपर्युपरि higher and higher over the sea, क्रमतः for him while he advanced, जनकात्मजा Janaki, विवेष्टमाना wriggling hard to extricate, सागरे in the sea, नूनम् surely, पतिता fallen.

13_11.shloka: अहो क्षुद्रेण वाऽनेन रक्षन्ती शीलमात्मनः।।5.13.11।।अबन्धुर्भक्षिता सीता रावणेन तपस्विनी।
13_11.translation: "Oh poor Sita, distanced from relations, while protecting her chastity helplessly she might have been devoured by cruel Ravana.
13_11.word_by_word: अहो Oh, आत्मनः of her self, शीलम् chastity, रक्षन्ती while protecting, अबन्धुः distanced from relatives, तपस्विनी a helpless woman, सीता Sita, क्षुद्रेण by the cruel one, अनेन by him, रावणेन by Ravana, भक्षिता eaten.

13_12.shloka: अथवा राक्षसेन्द्रस्य पत्नीभिरसितेक्षणा।।5.13.12।।अदुष्टा दुष्टभावाभिर्भक्षिता सा भविष्यति।
13_12.translation: "Or else, the pious, blackeyed Sita might have been eaten by the the cruelnatured wives of the lord of demons.
13_12.word_by_word: अथवा or else, अदुष्टा a pious lady, असितेक्षणा blackeyed one, सा that, दुष्टभावाभिः by the cruelnatured, राक्षसेन्द्रस्य of the lord of rakshasas, पत्नीभिः by wives also, भक्षिता eaten, भविष्यति I think.

13_13.shloka: सम्पूर्णचन्द्रप्रतिमं पद्मपत्रनिभेक्षणम्।।5.13.13।।रामस्य ध्यायती वक्त्रं पञ्चत्वं कृपणा गता।
13_13.translation: "Or, she might have attained death, meditating on Rama, whose face resembles the fullmoon and eyes the lotus petals.
13_13.word_by_word: कृपणा poor lady, सम्पूर्णचन्द्रप्रतिमम् like the fullmoon, पद्मपत्रनिभेक्षणम् with eyes like lotus petals, रामस्य Rama's, वक्त्रम् face, ध्यायती meditating on, पञ्चत्वम् death, गता attained.

13_14.shloka: हा राम लक्ष्मणेत्येवं हाऽयोध्ये चेति मैथिली।।5.13.14।।विलप्य बहु वैदेही न्यस्तदेहा भविष्यति।
13_14.translation: "Or, Vaidehi, the princess of Mithila might have cast off her life grieving intensely and crying, 'Alas, Rama, alas, Lakshmana, alas, Ayodhya'. (Mithila is the name of the  capital city and Videha is the country which was ruled by Janaka. Sita, the princess is known as Vaidehi, Mythili and Janaki).
13_14.word_by_word: वैदेही Vaidehi, मैथिली Mythili, हा राम Alas, Rama, हा लक्ष्मण alas, Lakshmana, हा अयोध्या alas, Ayodhya, इति thus, बहु very much, विलप्य weaping, न्यस्तदेहा cast off life, भविष्यति may be.

13_15.shloka: अथवा निहिता मन्ये रावणस्य निवेशने।।5.13.15।।नूनं लालप्यते सीता पञ्जरस्थेव शारिका।
13_15.translation: "Or, I think Sita might have been imprisoned in a cage like a myna in Ravana's palace. She will be surely crying.
13_15.word_by_word: अथवा or else, रावणस्य Ravana's, निवेशने in his palace, निहिता kept, सीता Sita, पञ्जरस्था in the cage, शारिका इव like myna, नूनम् surely, लालप्यते crying, मन्ये I think.

13_16.shloka: जनकस्य सुता सीता रामपत्नी सुमध्यमा।।5.13.16।।कथमुत्पलपत्राक्षी रावणस्य वशं व्रजेत्।
13_16.translation: "How could Janaki, the daughter of Janaka, Rama's wife, the lady with a beautiful waist and eyes like lotus petals, come under the fold of Ravana?
