13_16.word_by_word: जनकस्य Janaka's, सुता daughter, रामपत्नी Rama's wife, सुमध्यमा a lady of beautiful waist, उत्पलपत्राक्षी eyes like lotus petals, सीता Sita, रावणस्य Ravana's, वशम् fold, कथम् how, व्रजेत् can come under.

13_17.shloka: विनष्टा वा प्रणष्टा वा मृता वा जनकात्मजा।।5.13.17।।रामस्य प्रियभार्यस्य न निवेदयितुं क्षमम्।
13_17.translation: "Whether Janaki is lost or irretrievable or dead is not known The news should not be  reported to Rama, who is very fond of his wife.
13_17.word_by_word: जनकात्मजा Janaka's daughter, विनष्टा वा whether lost, प्रणष्टा वा or whether irretrievable, मृता वा or dead, प्रियभार्यस्य for him who is fond of his wife, रामस्य of Rama, निवेदयितुम् to report, न क्षमम् not proper.

13_18.shloka: निवेद्यमाने दोषस्स्याद्दोषस्स्यादनिवेदने।।5.13.18।।कथं नु खलु कर्तव्यं विषमं प्रतिभाति मे।
13_18.translation: "To carry or not to carry this news to Rama would be a mistake. What shall I do? I am facing a tough situation.
13_18.word_by_word: निवेद्यमाने by informing this, दोषः mistake, स्यात् may be, अनिवेदने by not informing, दोषः mistake, स्यात् may be, कथम् how, कर्तव्यं नु खलु what to do, मे to me, विषमम् difficult, प्रतिभाति appears.

13_19.shloka: अस्मिन्नेवंगते कार्ये प्राप्तकालं क्षमं च किम्।।5.13.19।।भवेदिति मतं भूयो हनुमान्प्रविचारयत्।
13_19.translation: "I wonder what the right course of action is when things have taken such a turn? What is proper for me to do? Hanuman once again deliberated.
13_19.word_by_word: अस्मिन् in this, कार्ये in this regard, एवं गते when things took such a turn, प्राप्तकालम् right time, क्षमम् proper, किम् what, भवेत् will be, इति thus, मतम् opinion, हनुमान् Hanuman, भूयः once again, प्रविचारयत् deliberated.

13_20.shloka: यदि सीतामदृष्ट्वाऽहं वानरेन्द्रपुरीमितः।।5.13.20।।गमिष्यामि ततः को मे पुरुषार्थो भविष्यति।
13_20.translation: "If I return to Kishkinda without seeing Sita of what use is my effort? What have I accomplished? What will happen? (Dharma, Artha, Kama and Moksha are the four Purusharthas or accomplishments in life)
13_20.word_by_word: अहम् I, सीताम् Sita, अदृष्ट्वा without seeing, इतः from here, वानरेन्द्रपुरीम् city of vanaras, गमिष्यामि I reach, यदि if, ततः then, कः what (has been accomplished), पुरुषार्थः accomplishment, भविष्यति will happen.

13_21.shloka: ममेदं लङ्घनं व्यर्थं सागरस्य भविष्यति।।5.13.21।।प्रवेशश्चैव लङ्कायाः राक्षसानां च दर्शनम्।
13_21.translation: "My crossing the ocean, my entry into Lanka and my survey of the demons are all futile.
13_21.word_by_word: मम my, इदम् this, सागरस्य of the ocean, लङ्घनम् crossing, लङ्कायाः of Lanka, प्रवेशश्च entry, राक्षसानाम् of ogres, दर्शनम् seeing, व्यर्थम् futile, भविष्यति would be.

13_22.shloka: किं मां वक्ष्यति सुग्रीवो हरयो वा समागताः।।5.13.22।।किष्किन्धां समनुप्राप्तं तौ वा दशरथात्मजौ।
13_22.translation: "What will Sugriva or even the vanaras and the two sons of Dasaratha say when I reach Kishkinda?
13_22.word_by_word: किष्किन्धाम् at Kishkinda, समनुप्राप्तम् reached, माम् to me, सुग्रीवः Sugriva, किम् what, वक्ष्यतिhe says, समागताः collected, हरयः वा even vanaras, तौ those two, दशरथात्मजौ वा sons of Dasaratha.

13_23.shloka: गत्वा तु यदि काकुत्स्थं वक्ष्यामि परमप्रियम्।।5.13.23।।न दृष्टेति मया सीता ततस्तक्ष्यति जीवितम्।
13_23.translation: "If I report the most unpleasant news that Sita was not found, Rama will give up his life.
13_23.word_by_word: गत्वा after reaching, काकुत्स्थम् Kakutstha, मया by me, सीता Sita, न दृष्टा not seen, इति like this, परम् most, अप्रियम् unpleasant, वक्ष्यामि यदि if I say, ततः then, जीवितम् life, त्यक्ष्यति he will give up.

13_24.shloka: परुषं दारुणं क्रूरं तीक्ष्णमिन्द्रियतापनम्।।5.13.24।।सीतानिमित्तं दुर्वाक्यं श्रुत्वा स न भविष्यति।
13_24.word_by_word: परुषम् harsh, दारुणम् dreadful, क्रूरम् cruel, तीक्ष्णम् sharp, इन्द्रियतापनम् that which can scorch senses, सीतानिमित्तम् about Sita, दुर्वाक्यम् unwelcome words, श्रुत्वा after hearing, सः Rama, न भविष्यति will not live.

13_25.shloka: तं तु कृच्छ्रगतं दृष्ट्वा पञ्चत्वगतमानसम्।।5.13.25।।भृशानुरक्तो मेधावी न भविष्यति लक्ष्मणः।
13_25.translation: "Seeing Rama in such a painful state, wise Lakshmana who has given his life to Rama, to whom he is deeply devoted will also not survive.
13_25.word_by_word: कृच्छ्रगतम्  in painful state, पञ्चत्वगतमानसम् one who has almost given his life, तम् him, दृष्ट्वा seeing, भृशानुरक्तः deeply devoted, मेधावी wise, लक्ष्मणः Lakshmana, न भविष्यति will not survive.

13_26.shloka: विनष्टौ भ्रातरौ श्रुत्वा भरतोऽपि मरिष्यति।।5.13.26।।भरतं च मृतं दृष्ट्वा शत्रुघ्नो न भविष्यति।
13_26.translation: "On hearing the death of both the brothers Bharata will also die. On seeing this Satrughna will also not live.
13_26.word_by_word: भ्रातरौ both brothers, विनष्टौ dead, श्रुत्वा after hearing, भरतोऽपि Bharata also, मरिष्यति will die, मृतम् dead, भरतम् of Bharata, दृष्ट्वा on seeing, शत्रुघ्नश्च even Satrughna, न भविष्यति will not live.

13_27.shloka: पुत्रान्मृतान्समीक्ष्याथ न भविष्यन्ति मातरः।।5.13.27।।कौसल्या च सुमित्रा च कैकेयी च न संशयः।
13_27.word_by_word: अथ then, मातरः mothers, कौसल्या च and Kausalya, सुमित्रा च even Sumitra, कैकेयी च even Kaikeyi, पुत्रान् of sons, मृतान् of their death, समीक्ष्य on seeing, न भविष्यन्ति will not be able to live, संशयः न no doubt.

13_28.shloka: कृतज्ञस्सत्यसन्धश्च सुग्रीवः प्लवगाधिपः।।5.13.28।।रामं तथा गतं दृष्ट्वा ततस्त्यक्ष्यति जीवितम्।
13_28.translation: "On seeing that Rama has ended his life, the grateful and truthful monkey leader,Sugriva will give up his life.
13_28.word_by_word: कृतज्ञः grateful, सत्यसन्धः truthful, प्लवगाधिपः leader of monkeys, सुग्रीवः Sugriva, तथा likewise, गतम् gone, रामम् Rama, दृष्ट्वा on seeing, ततः then, जीवितम् life, त्यक्ष्यति will give up.

13_29.shloka: दुर्मना व्यथिता दीना निरानन्दा तपस्विनी।।5.13.29।।पीडिता भर्तृशोकेन रुमा त्यक्ष्यति जीवितम्।
13_29.translation: "Distressed, disheartened, pained and grieved on account of her husband's death, the virtuous lady Ruma (wife of Sugriva) will be unhappy and die.
13_29.word_by_word: भर्तृशोकेन on account of her husband's grief, पीडिता tormented, दुर्मनाः disheartened, व्यथिता pained, दीना dejected, निरानन्दा unhappy, तपस्विनी helpless, रुमा Ruma, जीवितम् life, त्यक्ष्यति will give up.

13_30.shloka: वालिजेन तु दुःखेन पीडिता शोककर्शिता।।5.13.30।।पञ्चत्वं च गते राज्ञि ताराऽपि न भविष्यति।
13_30.translation: "Tara who is troubled by Vali's death and tortured with grief will not live when king Sugriva dies.
13_30.word_by_word: वालिजेन caused by Vali, दुःखेन by sorrow, पीडिता troubled, शोककर्शिता fertured with grief, तारापि Tara too, राज्ञि when the king, पञ्चत्वम् gone to other world, गते having gone, न भविष्यति will not live

13_31.translation: "On account of his parents death and also because of Sugriva's calamity, Angada will give up his life.
13_31.word_by_word: कुमारः prince, अङ्गदोऽपि Angada also, मातापित्रोः of his mother and father, विनाशेन by death, सुग्रीवस्य Sugriva's, व्यसनेन by calamity, जीवितम् life, कस्मात् why, धारयिष्यति will retain.

13_32.shloka: भर्तृजेन तु दुःखेन ह्यभिभूता वनौकसः।।5.13.32।।शिरांस्यभिहनिष्यन्ति तलैर्मुष्टिभिरेव च।
13_32.translation: "The grief due to the death of their king will make the vanaras hit their heads with their palms and fists.
13_32.word_by_word: नौकसः vanaras, भर्तृजेन on account of the events affecting their king, दुःखेन by grief, अभिभूताः overpowered, तलैः with their palms, मुष्टिभिरेव च and with their fists, शिरांसि their heads, अभिहनिष्यन्ति will hit themselves.

13_33.shloka: सान्त्वेनानुप्रदानेन मानेन च यशस्विना।।5.13.33।।लालिताः कपिराजेन प्राणांस्त्यक्ष्यन्ति वानराः।
13_33.translation: "The vanaras who were reared by the king's kind words, gifts and care will give up their life.
13_33.word_by_word: यशस्स्विना by the illustrious one, कपिराजेन by the king of vanaras, सान्त्वेन by good words, अनुप्रदानेन by offering gifts, मानेन by respecting, लालिताः reared, वानराः vanaras, प्राणान् life, त्यक्ष्यन्ति will give up.

13_34.shloka: न वनेषु न शैलेषु न निरोधेषु वा पुनः।।5.13.34।।क्रीडामनुभविष्यन्ति समेत्य कपिकुञ्जराः।
13_34.translation: "The chiefs among vanaras together will not enjoy their life in the forest or mountains or caves.
13_34.word_by_word: कपिकुञ्जराः chiefs among vanaras, समेत्य collected together, वनेषु in the forest, क्रीडाम् play, न अनुभविष्यन्ति will not enjoy, शैलेषु on the mountains, न निरोधेषु वा or in the caves, पुनः again, न not.

13_35.shloka: सपुत्रदारास्सामात्या भर्तृव्यसनपीडिताः।।5.13.35।।शैलाग्रेभ्यः पतिष्यन्ति समेषु विषमेषु च।
13_35.translation: "Tormented by their king's death the vanaras with their wives, sons and ministers will drop down from the mountain peaks on the rough ground and die.
13_35.word_by_word: सपुत्रदाराः with sons and wives, सामात्याः with ministers together, भर्तृव्यसनपीडिताः tormented by the suffering of their king's death, शैलाग्रेभ्यः from the mountain peaks, समेषु on the plains, विषमेषु च and on uneven grounds, पतिष्यन्ति will fall (drop down).

13_36.shloka: विषमुद्बन्धनं वापि प्रवेशं ज्वलनस्य वा।।5.13.36।।उपवासमथो शस्त्रं प्रचरिष्यन्ति वानराः।
13_36.translation: "The vanaras will put an end to their lives by poisoning or by hanging or by selfimmolation or by killing themselves with weapons or by fasting unto death.
13_36.word_by_word: वानराः vanaras, विषम् poison, उद्बन्धनं वापि or by hanging, ज्वलनस्य in the fire, प्रवेशं वा entering, उपवासम् by fasting, अथो or, शस्त्रम् weapon, प्रचरिष्यन्ति they will use to put an end.

13_37.shloka: घोरमारोदनं मन्ये गते मयि भविष्यति।।5.13.37।।इक्ष्वाकुकुलनाशश्च नाशश्चैव वनौकसाम्।
13_37.translation: "If I go there (without finding Sita), it will cause destruction of the Ikshvakus and vanaras would weep. It would be dreadful.
13_37.word_by_word: मयि गते when I go, इक्ष्वाकुकुलनाशश्च destruction of the Ikshvakus, वनौकसाम् of vanaras, नाशश्चैव destruction, घोरम् dreadful, आरोदनम् weeping, भविष्यति will be, मन्ये I think.

13_38.shloka: सोऽहं नैव गमिष्यामि किष्किन्धां नगरीमितः।।5.13.38।।न च शक्ष्याम्यहं द्रष्टुं सुग्रीवं मैथिलीं विना।
13_38.translation: "I will not go to the city of Kishkinda from here or to Sugriva without finding Mythili. It will not be possible for me to face him.
13_38.word_by_word: अहम् I, इतः from here, किष्किन्धां नगरीम् to the city of Kishkinda, नैव गमिष्यामि I will not go, अहम् I, मैथिलीं Mythili, विना without, सुग्रीवम् Sugriva, द्रष्टुम् to see, न च शक्ष्यामि not possible for me.

13_39.shloka: मय्यगच्छति चेहस्थे धर्मात्मानौ महारथौ।।5.13.39।।आशया तौ धरिष्येते वानराश्च मनस्विनः।
13_39.translation: Both the highsouled warrior princes treading a righteous path as well as the vanaras will survive with a hope of my return if I stay back.
13_39.word_by_word: मयि when I, अगच्छति not go, इहस्थे stay here, धर्मात्मानौ righteous selves, महारथौ great warriors, तौ both, आशया with hope, धरिष्येते both will survive, मनस्विनः highsouled, वानराश्च vanaras also.

13_40.shloka: हस्तादानो मुखादानो नियतो वृक्षमूलिकः।।5.13.40।।वानप्रस्थो भविष्यामि ह्यदृष्ट्वा जनकात्मजाम्।सागरानूपजे देशे बहुमूलफलोदके।।5.13.41।।
13_40.translation: "If Janaki is not found I will stay here and live like a hermit subsisting on whatever is available on this sea shore, which has abundance of roots, fruits and water.
13_40.word_by_word: जनकात्मजाम् Janaka's daughter, अदृष्ट्वा by not seeing, हस्तादानः food available to hand, मुखादानः and mouth, नियतः strictly, बहुमूलफलोदके filled with fruits roots and water, सागरानूपजे on the shore of the sea, देशे here, वृक्षमूलिकः surviving on roots of trees, वानप्रस्थः like a hermit, भविष्यामि I will be.

13_41.shloka: चितां कृत्वा प्रवेक्ष्यामि समिद्धमरणीसुतम्।उपविष्टस्य वा सम्यग्लिङ्गिनीं साधयिष्यतः।।5.13.42।।शरीरं भक्षयिष्यन्ति वायसाः श्वापदानि च।
13_41.translation: "I will prepare a pyre  and enter the fire  so that sea waves wash off the ashes or crows and beasts will eat up my body while i sit fasting unto death.
13_41.word_by_word: चिताम् pyre, कृत्वा having made, समिद्धम् lit, अरणीसुतम् fire sticks (fire), प्रवेक्ष्यामि will enter, वा or else, उपविष्टस्य seated here, लिङ्गिनीम् starving, साधयिष्यतः fast unto death, शरीरम् body, वायसाः crows, श्वापदानि च wild beasts, भक्षयिष्यन्ति  will eat.

13_42.shloka: इदं महर्षिभिर्दृष्टं निर्याणमिति मे मतिः।।5.13.43।।सम्यगापः प्रवेक्ष्यामि न चेत्पश्यामि जानकीम्।
13_42.translation: "I shall enter water and drown myself to death if I am not able to find Janaki. I think this way of ending life has been suggested by great ascetics.
13_42.word_by_word: इदम् this, महर्षिभिः by ascetics, दृष्टम्  seen, निर्याणम् ending of life, इति like this, मे my, मतिः thought, जानकीम् Janaki, न चेत्पश्यामि if I am not able to see, सम्यक् right, आपः water, प्रवेक्ष्यामि will enter.

13_43.shloka: सुजातमूला सुभगा कीर्तिमाला यशस्विनी।।5.13.44।।प्रभग्ना चिररात्रीयं मम सीतामपश्यतः।
13_43.translation: My glory which had a good start (in the form of bringing Rama to Sugriva) and brought fortune to Sugriva and fame to me has been snapped as I could not find Sita.
13_43.word_by_word: सीताम् Sita, अपश्यतः I could not find, मम for me, चिररात्रीयं this long night, सुजातमूला started well, सुभगा lovely, यशस्विनी glorious one, कीर्तिमाला famous one, प्रभग्ना is wasted.

13_44.shloka: तापसो वा भविष्यामि नियतो वृक्षमूलिकः।।5.13.45।।नेतः प्रतिगमिष्यामि तामदृष्ट्वासितेक्षणाम्।
13_44.translation: "I will remain an ascetic and do penance under the tree practising selfcontrol and not go back without seeing the blackeyed Sita.
13_44.word_by_word: नियतः strictly, वृक्षमूलिकः resting under the tree, तापसो वा or an ascetic, भविष्यामि I will remain, असितेक्षणाम् blackeyed, ताम् her, अदृष्टवा without seeing, इतः from here, न प्रतिगमिष्यामि I will not go back.

13_45.shloka: यदीतः प्रतिगच्छामि सीतामनधिगम्य ताम्।।5.13.46।।अङ्गदस्सह तैस्सर्वैर्वानरैर्न भविष्यति।
13_45.translation: "Besides, if I go back without finding Sita all the vanaras including Angada will die.
13_45.word_by_word: ताम् her, सीताम् Sita, अनधिगम्य without finding, इतः from this place, प्रतिगच्छामि यदि if I go back, सर्वैः by all, तै: by those, वानरैः सह along with vanaras, अङ्गदः Angada, न भविष्यति will not live.

13_46.shloka: विनाशे बहवो दोषा जीवन् भद्राणि पश्यति।।5.13.47।।तस्मात्प्राणान् धरिष्यामि ध्रुवो जीवितसङ्गमः।
13_46.translation: "If I commit suicide, I will earn numerous sins. By being alive, I can witness auspicious events. Therefore, I will live, for, happiness can come only to the living.
13_46.word_by_word: विनाशे by comitting suicide, बहवः many, दोषाः sins, जीवन् by living, भद्राणि auspicious events, पश्यति can be experienced, तस्मात् therefore, प्राणान् life, धरिष्यामि I will sustain, जीवितसङ्गमः only a living person, ध्रुवः is certain

13_47.shloka: एवं बहुविधं दुःखं मनसा धरायन्मुहुः।।5.13.48।।नाध्यगच्छत्तदा पारं शोकस्य कपिकुञ्चरः।
13_47.translation: The elephant among monkeys (Hanuman) worrying over and over again, holding his head for long could not reach the end of his grief.
13_47.word_by_word: कपिकुञ्जरः the elephant among monkeys, एवम् that way, बहुविधम् in many ways, दुःखम् grief, मुहुः over and over, मनसा in mind, धारयन् by holding, तदा then, शोकस्य sorrow, पारम् long, नाध्यगच्छात् did not reach of the end.

13_48.shloka: रावणं वा वधिष्यामि दशग्रीवं महाबलम्।।5.13.49।।काममस्तु हृता सीता प्रत्याचीर्णं भविष्यति।
13_48.translation: "I will kill Ravana, this mighty, tenheaded demon. Sita was indeed carried away by him. This (killing him) can be a fitting reply to his evil action. My desire would be fulfilled.
13_48.word_by_word: वा or, दशग्रीवम् tenheaded one, महाबलम् endowed with great strength, रावणम् Ravana, वधिष्यामि I will, हृता dead, सीता Sita, कामम् अस्तु desire will be fulfilled, प्रत्याचीर्णम् fitting reply, भविष्यति will be.

13_49.shloka: अथवैनं समुत्क्षिप्य उपर्युपरि सागरम्।।5.13.50।।रामायोपहरिष्यामि पशुं पशुपतेरिव।
13_49.translation: "Or else, I shall carry him across the sea and put him before Rama like a bull as if he is a sacrificial prey to lord Siva."
13_49.word_by_word: अथवा otherwise, एनम् him, सागरम् उपर्युपरि over the ocean, समुत्क्षिप्य by lifting across (like a sacrificial prey), पशुपतेः to lord Siva, पशुमिव like a bull, रामाय to Rama, उपहरिष्यामि I shall offer.

13_50.shloka: इति चिन्तां समापन्नः सीतामनधिगम्य ताम्।।5.13.51।।ध्यानशोकपरीतात्मा चिन्तयामास वानरः।
13_50.translation: Distressed over his inability to find Sita, Hanuman's mind was overcome with anxiety and he started thinking further.
13_50.word_by_word: वानरः vanara, ताम् her, सीताम् Sita, अनधिगम्य unable to find, इति thus, चिन्ताम् worry, समापन्नः distressed, ध्यानशोकपरीतात्मा whose mind was overcome with anxiety, चिन्तयामास started thinking further.

13_51.shloka: यावत्सीतां हि पश्यामि रामपत्नीं यशस्विनीम्।।5.13.52।।तावदेतां पुरीं लङ्कां विचिनोमि पुनः पुनः।
13_51.translation: "Till I find the virtuous Sita, wife of Rama in this Lanka, I shall keep searching everywhere again and again.
13_51.word_by_word: रामपत्नीम् Rama's wife, यशस्विनीम् famed, सीताम् Sita, यावत् until, पश्यामि I see, तावत् till then, एताम् this, लङ्कां पुरीम् city of Lanka, पुनः पुनः again and again, विचिनोमि I will keep searching.

13_52.shloka: सम्पातिवचनाच्चापि रामं यद्यानयाम्यहम्।।5.13.53।।अपश्यन् राघवो भार्यां निर्धहेत्सर्ववानरान्।
13_52.translation: "Had I brought Raghava following  the words of Sampati, Rama would have burnt all vanaras unable to find his wife.
13_52.word_by_word: सम्पातिवचनात् on Sampati's words, अहम् I, रामम् Rama, आनयामि यदि if I had brought, राघवः Raghava, भार्याम् wife, अपश्यन् unable to see, सर्ववानरान् all vanaras, निर्दहेत् would have burnt.

13_53.shloka: इहैव नियताहारो वत्स्यामि नियतेन्द्रियः।।5.13.54।।न मत्कृते विनश्येयुः सर्वे ते नरवानराः।
13_53.translation: "I will stay here itself, restricting my food and controlling my senses. Let not men and monkeys perish for my fault.
13_53.word_by_word: नियताहारः restricting food, नियतेन्द्रियः controlling senses, इहैव here itself, वत्स्यामि I will stay, मत्कृते for my fault, ते those, नरवानराः naras and vanaras, न विनश्येयुः will not perish.

13_54.shloka: अशोकवनिका चेयं दृश्यते या महाद्रुमा।।5.13.55।।इमामधिगमिष्यामि न हीयं विचिता मया।
13_54.translation: "Here is the Ashoka grove with huge trees. I will go there. I have not looked for her in this place.
13_54.word_by_word: महाद्रुमा huge trees, या such, इयम् this, अशोकवनिका Ashoka grove, दृश्यते is seen, इमाम् there, अधिगमिष्यामि I will go, इयम् here, मया by me, न विचिता हि not looked for.

13_55.shloka: वसून्रुद्रांस्तथाऽदित्यानश्विनौ मरुतोऽपि च।।5.13.56।।नमस्कृत्वा गमिष्यामि रक्षसां शोकवर्धनः।
13_55.translation: "I shall offer salutations to Vasus, Rudras Adityas and Aswinis and proceed to  increase (cause) the sorrow of the demons. (There are eight Vasus, eleven Rudras, twelve Adityas, two Ashwins and fortynine Windgods).
13_55.word_by_word: वसून् Vasus, रुद्रान् Rudras, तथा likewise, आदित्यान् Adityas, अश्विनौ Aswinis, मरुतोऽपि च Maruts also, नमस्कृत्वा after offering salutations, रक्षसाम् of  demons, शोकवर्धनः increase grief, गमिष्यामि will go.

13_56.shloka: जित्वा तु राक्षसान् सर्वानिक्ष्वाकुकुलनन्दिनीम्।।5.13.57।।सम्प्रदास्यामि रामाय यथा सिद्धिं तपस्विने।
13_56.translation: "I will conquer all the ogres and pass them to Sita, the delight of the Ikshvaku family  as an offering and give Rama to her as the fruit of her austerities."
13_56.word_by_word: सर्वान् all, राक्षसान् ogres, जित्वा तु having conquered, इक्ष्वाकुकुलनन्दिनीम् delight of Ikshvaku family, तपस्विने for the ascetic, सिद्धिं यथा an offering like, रामाय to Rama, सम्प्रदास्यामि I will offer.

13_57.translation: The brilliant son of the Windgod, Hanuman, whose senses were overwhelmed with worries, regained his senses in a short while and got up.
13_57.word_by_word: महातेजाः brilliant, मारुतात्मजः son of the Windgod, सः हनुमान् Hanuman, चिन्तावग्रथितेन्द्रियः with senses overwhelmed by worries, मुहूर्तमिव for a while, ध्यात्वा after reflecting, उदतिष्ठत् got up.

13_58.shloka: नमोऽस्तु रामाय सलक्ष्मणाय देव्यै च तस्यै जनकात्मजायै।नमोऽस्तु रुद्रेंद्रयमानिलेभ्यो नमोऽस्तु चन्द्रार्कमरुद्गणेभ्यः।।5.13.59।।
13_58.translation: "My salutations to Lakshmana, Rama and divine daughter of Janaka. Salutations to Rudra, Indra, Yama and Vayu. Salutations to Sun, Moon and Maruts"
13_58.word_by_word: सलक्ष्मणाय along with Lakshmana, रामाय to Rama, नमः salutations, अस्तु I offer, देव्यै to the divine lady, तस्यै to her, जनकात्मजायै च to Janaka's daughter, रुद्रेन्द्रयमानिलेभ्यः to Rudra, Indra, Yama and Vayu, नमः salutations, अस्तु be, चन्द्रार्कमरुद्गणेभ्यः Sun, Moon and Marutas, नमः salutations, अस्तु I offer.

13_59.shloka: स तेभ्यस्तु नमस्कृत्य सुग्रीवाय च मारुतिः।दिशस्सर्वास्समालोक्य ह्यशोकवनिकां प्रति।।5.13.60।।
13_59.translation: Having offered salutations to all gods as well as to Sugriva, he looked at all quarters and left for the Ashoka grove.
13_59.word_by_word: स: मारुतिः that son of the Windgod, तेभ्यः to them, नमस्कृत्य having saluted, सुग्रीवाय च to Sugriva, सर्वाः all, दिशः quarters, समालोक्य looking at, अशोकवनिकाम् Ashoka grove, प्रति towards.

13_60.shloka: स गत्वा मनसा पूर्वमशोकवनिकां शुभाम्।उत्तरं चिन्तयामास वानरो मारुतात्मजः।।5.13.61।।
13_60.translation: Hanuman started thinking again about his task after reaching the auspicious Ashoka grove.
13_60.word_by_word: मारुतात्मजः Hanuman, सः वानरः the vanara, मनसा in his mind, पूर्वम् earlier, शुभाम् auspicious, अशोकवनिकाम् grove of Ashoka, गत्वा after going, उत्तरम् again, चिन्तयामास started thinking.

13_61.shloka: ध्रुवं तु रक्षोबहुला भविष्यति वनाकुला।अशोकवनिका पुण्या सर्वसंस्कारसंस्कृता।।5.13.62।।
13_61.translation: 'This Ashoka grove filled with many trees, guarded by many demons is carefully tended. It must be sacred.
13_61.word_by_word: शोकवनिका Ashoka grove, ध्रुवम् surely, रक्षोबहुला guarded by many demons, वनाकुला with trees, सर्वसंस्कारसंस्कृता carefully tended, पुण्या sacred, भविष्यति it will be.

13_62.shloka: रक्षिणश्चात्र विहिता नूनं रक्षन्ति पादपान्।भगवानपि सर्वात्मा नातिक्षोभं प्रवाति वै।।5.13.63।।संक्षिप्तोऽयं मयाऽत्मा च रामार्थे रावणस्य च।
13_62.translation: "The guards posted there are surely protecting the grove. The divinity  pervading all over me (the wind) must also have been controlled as it is also not blowing violently. I have turned my body small for Rama's cause and also to save myself from Ravana.
13_62.word_by_word: अत्र there, विहिताः posted, रक्षिणश्च guards, पादपान् trees, नूनम् surely, रक्षन्ति they are protecting, सर्वात्मा all pervading, भगवानपि divinity also, नातिक्षोभम् not violent, प्रवाति वै is blowing, मया my, रामार्थे for Rama's sake, रावणस्य च and Ravana also, अयम् this, आत्मा my own self, संक्षिप्तः made small.

13_63.shloka: सिद्धिं मे संविधास्यन्ति देवाः सर्षिगणास्त्विह।।5.13.64।।ब्रह्मा स्वयंभूर्भगवान् देवाश्चैव दिशन्तु मे।सिद्धिमग्निश्च वायुश्च पुरुहूतश्च वज्रभृत्।।5.13.65।।वरुणः पाशहस्तश्च सोमादित्यौ तथैव च।अश्विनौ च महात्मानौ मरुतः शर्व एव च।।5.13.66।।सिद्धिं सर्वाणि भूतानि भूतानां चैव यः प्रभुः।दास्यन्ति मम ये चान्ये ह्यदृष्टाः पथि गोचराः।।5.13.67।।
13_63.translation: May all sages, gods, the selfborn Brahma, Windgod, Indra, the wielder of thunderbolt whose name is invoked in sacrifices, Yama, who carries a rope, Varuna give success and Lord Siva help me. May the Sun, Moon, Aswinis  Marutas assist me. May the gods of the quarters and the lord of all beings help me to succeed. May those whom I could not see also bring success to me.
13_63.word_by_word: सर्षिगणाः (स ऋषिगणा:) along with all sages, देवाः gods, इह here, मे to me, सिद्धिंम् success, संविधास्यन्ति will give, स्वयंभूः selfborn, भगवान् god, ब्रह्मा Brahma, देवाश्चैव and also gods, अग्निश्च and Fire, वायुश्च even Wind, वज्रभृत् Indra, the wielder of thunderbolt, पुरूहूतश्च Indra who is invoked several times in sacrifices, पाशहस्तः holding a rope, वरुणश्च Varuna too, तथैव च so also,सोमादित्यौ Moon and Sun, महात्मानौ all great, अश्विनौ च twin Aswinis also, मरुतः Maruts, शर्वः एव च lord Siva, मे to me, सिद्धिम् success, दिशन्तु many give, सर्वाणि all, भूतानि beings, यः whoever, भूतानाम् of creatures, प्रभु: lord, अन्ये other, ये those, अदृष्टाः not seen, पथि on the way, गोचराः creatures moving on earth, मम to me, सिद्धिम् success, दास्यन्ति will ordain.

13_64.shloka: तदुन्नसं पाण्डुरदन्तमव्रणं शुचिस्मितं पद्मपलाशलोचनम्।द्रक्ष्ये तदार्यावदनं कदान्वहं प्रसन्नताराधिपतुल्यदर्शनम्।।5.13.68।।
13_64.translation: 'Oh when and how would I behold that beautiful noble lady of stainless character, with a Moonlike face, prominent nose, white teeth, pleasant smile and with eyes like lotus petals?
13_64.word_by_word: उन्नसम् with high nose, पाण्डुरदन्तम् with white teeth, अव्रणम् with no wounds, शुचिस्मितम् with pleasing smile, पद्मपलाशलोचनम् eyes like lotus petals, प्रसन्नताराधिपतुल्यदर्शनम् who appears like the pleasant Moon, तत् that, तदार्यावदनम् beautiful face of the noble lady,अहम् I, कदा when, द्रक्ष्ये नु will I see.

13_65.shloka: क्षुद्रेण पापेन नृशंसकर्मणा सुदारुणालङ्कृतवेषधारिणा।बलाभिभूता ह्यबला तपस्विनी कथं नु मे दृष्टिपथेऽद्य सा भवेत्।।5.13.69।।
13_65.translation: "How will I set my eyes on that gentle, frail and suffering thing now, who has been abducted by that mean, cruel sinner of dreadful look?"इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये सुन्दरकाण्डे त्रयोदशस्सर्गः।Thus ends the thirteenth sarga of Sundarakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
13_65.word_by_word: क्षुद्रेण by a mean one, पापेन by a sinner, नृशंसकर्मणा a man of cruel deeds, सुदारुणालङ्कृतवेषधारिणा endowed with a dreadful look, बलाभिभूता overpowered by force, तपस्विनी a suffering lady, सा that, अबला weak, अद्य now, मे my, दृष्टिपथे in the range of my view, कथं how, भवेत् नु will I.

14_1.shloka: [Hanuman ascends the simsupa tree in the Ashoka grove and watches.]स मुहूर्तमिव ध्यात्वा मनसा चाधिगम्य ताम्।अवप्लुतो महातेजाः प्राकारं तस्य वेश्मनः।।5.14.1।।
14_1.translation: Mighty Hanuman lost in thought for a moment, jumped down (the harem) to the boundary wall of the palace.
14_1.word_by_word: महातेजा mighty, सः that (Hanuman), मुहूर्तमिव for a short while, ध्यात्वे lost in thought, ताम् her, मनसा in the mind, अधिगम्य reached, तस्य वेश्मनः of that palace, प्राकारम् boundary, अवप्लुतः jumped.

14_2.shloka: स तु संहृष्टसर्वाङ्गः प्राकारस्थो महाकपिः।पुष्पिताग्रान्वसन्तादौ ददर्श विविधान् द्रुमान्।।5.14.2।।सालानशोकान् भव्यांश्च चंपकांश्च सुपुष्पितान्।उद्दालकान्नागवृक्षांश्चूतान्कपिमुखानपि।।5.14.3।।
14_2.translation: Standing on the boundary wall, the great vanara contracted his body and observed the blossoms on several tree tops---- Salas, lovely Ashoka trees and blossoms of champak, uddalaka, naga, mangoes with their fruits crimson as the snout of a monkey, it being the beginning of Spring.
14_2.word_by_word: प्राकारस्थः from the boundary, सः महाकपिः great vanara, संह्रष्टसर्वाङ्गः contracting his body, वसन्तादौ begining of  spring, पुष्पिताग्रान् blossoms on top, विविधान् several kinds, द्रुमान् trees, ददर्श saw, सालान् Salas, भव्यान् Bhavyas, अशोकान् Ashokas, सुपुष्पितान् blossomed, चम्पकांश्च Champakas, उद्दालकान् Uddalakas, नागवृक्षान् Naga trees, चूतान् Mangoes, कपिमुखानपि as the snout of the monkeys

14_3.shloka: अथाम्रवणसञ्छन्नां लताशतसमावृताम्।ज्यामुक्त इव नाराचः पुप्लुवे वृक्षवाटिकाम्।।5.14.4।।
14_3.translation: He penetrated like an arrow released from a bow the cluster of trees covering mango grove and overgrown with hundreds of creepers.
14_3.word_by_word: अथ and then, आम्रवणसञ्छन्नाम् filled with mango groves, लताशतसमाकुलाम् overgrown with hundreds of creepers, वृक्षवाटिकाम् cluster of trees, ज्यामुक्तः released from bow, नाराचः इव like arrow, पुप्लुवे penetrated.

14_4.shloka: स प्रविश्य विचित्रां तां विहगैरभिनादिताम्।राजतैः कांचनैश्चैव पादपैः सर्वतो वृताम्।।5.14.5।।विहगैर्मृगसङ्घैश्च विचित्रां चित्रकाननाम्।उदितादित्यसङ्काशां ददर्श हनुमान् कपिः।।5.14.6।।वृतां नानाविधैर्वृक्षैः पुष्पोपगफलोपगैः।कोकिलैर्भृङ्गराजैश्च मत्तैर्नित्यनिषेविताम्।।5.14.7।।प्रहृष्टमनुजे काले मृगपक्षिसमाकुले।मत्तबर्हिणसङ्घुष्टां नानाद्विजगणायुताम्।।5.14.8।।
14_4.translation: Entering deep into the grove, Hanuman saw clusters of trees pleasing to look at, herds of animals and flocks of colourful birds singing melodious notes.The grove was surrounded on all sides by silvery and golden trees which looked colourful with flocks of birds and herds of deer. It was full of lovely thickets looking like the rising sun. It was fringed with various trees bearing abundance of fruits and flowers. It was inhabited by intoxicated cuckoos, bees,  proud peacocks and numerous lovely birds.
14_4.word_by_word: कपिः monkey, सः हनुमान् Hanuman, प्रहृष्टमनुजे काले pleasing to people, मृगपक्षिसमाकुले  rendered noisy by herds of animals and flocks of birds, विचित्राम् colourful, विहगैः birds, अभिनादिताम् echoing melodiously, राजतैः with silvery, काञ्चनैश्चैव and by golden, पादपैः with trees, सर्वतः all over, वृताम् surrounded, विहगैः with birds, मृगसङ्घैश्च with herds of deer, विचित्राम् colourful, चित्रकाननाम् lovely thickets, उदितादित्यसङ्काशाम् like the Sun just risen, पुष्पोपगफलोपगैः fringed with abundant flowers and fruits, नानाविधैः of several kinds, वृक्षैः with trees, वृताम् inhabited, मत्तै: with  intoxicated, कोकिलैः with cuckoos, भृङ्गराजैश्च with bees, नित्यनिषेविताम् ever delighting, मत्तबर्हिणसङ्घुष्टाम् flocks of proud peacocks, नानाद्विजगणायुताम् flocks of different birds, ताम् he, प्रविश्य entered, ददर्श saw.

14_5.translation: The vanara who went searching for the paragon of virtue born of a noble family, awakened the birds who were happily asleep in their nests.
14_5.word_by_word: वानरः vanara, वरारोहाम् born of a noble family, अनिन्दिताम् blameless, राजपुत्रीम् princess, मार्गमाणः searching, सुखप्रसुप्तान् happily sleeping, विहगान् birds, बोधयामास awakened.

14_6.shloka: उत्पतद्भिर्द्विजगणैः पक्षैः सालास्समाहताः।अनेकवर्णा विविधा मुमुचुः पुष्पवृष्टयः।।5.14.10।।
14_6.translation: As the birds flew away, the trees hit by the wings of birds showered flowers of different colours.
14_6.word_by_word: उत्पतद्भिः by the flying ones, द्विजगणैः by flocks of birds, पक्षैः with wings, समाहताः hit, सालाः sala, अनेकवर्णाः of different colours, विविधाः many, पुष्पवृष्टयः showers of flowers, मुमुचुः let loose.

14_7.shloka: पुष्पावकीर्णश्शुशुभे हनुमान् मारुतात्मजः।अशोकवनिकामध्ये यथा पुष्पमयो गिरिः।।5.14.11।।
14_7.translation: Covered with flowers, Hanuman shone like a mountain of flowers in the midst of Ashoka grove.
14_7.word_by_word: पुष्पावकीर्णः covered with flowers, मारुतात्मजः son of the Windgod, हनुमान् Hanuman, अशोकवनिकामध्ये in the middle of the Ashoka grove, पुष्पमयः full of flowers, गिरिः यथा like amountain, शुशुभे shone.

14_8.shloka: ﻿दिशस्सर्वाः प्रधावन्तं वृक्षषण्डगतं कपिम्।दृष्ट्वा सर्वाणि भूतानि वसन्त इति मेनिरे।।5.14.12।।
14_8.translation: ﻿Beholding that sprightly monkey running in all directions, its body covered with variegated blossoms fallen from the trees, all living beings there thought that it was Spring personified
14_8.word_by_word: ﻿दृष्ट्वा beholding, दिशस्सर्वाः in all directions, प्रधावन्तं running, वृक्षषण्डगतं variegated flowers shed by trees, कपिम् monkey (Hanuman), सर्वाणि all, भूतानि living beings, वसन्त spring, इति मेनिरे this is spring

14_9.shloka: ﻿वृक्षेभ्यः पतितैः पुष्पैरवकीर्णा पृथग्विदैः।रराज वृक्षेभ्यः तत्र प्रमदेव विभूषिता।।5.14.13।।
14_9.translation: ﻿Strewn with flowers of various colours fallen from the trees of various kinds, the goddess of earth looked charming like a young woman profusely bedecked.
14_9.word_by_word: ﻿पुष्पैरवकीर्णा strewn with flowers of various colours, पृथग्विदैः goddess of earth, पतितैः fallen, वृक्षेभ्यः from the trees of various kinds, रराज charming, तत्र there, प्रमदेव like young woman, विभूषिता profusely bedecked

14_10.shloka: तरस्विना ते तरवस्तरसाभिप्रकम्पिताः।कुसुमानि विचित्राणि ससृजुः कपिना तदा।।5.14.14।।
14_10.translation: ﻿Shaken vigorously by Hanuman of great speed, the trees shed their blooms of variegated colours.
14_10.word_by_word: ﻿तदा then, तरस्विना endowed with speed, कपिना by the monkey, तरसा speedily, अभिप्रकम्पिताः vigorously shaken, ते those, तरवः trees, विचित्राणि colourful, कुसुमानि flowers, ससृजुः showered.

14_11.shloka: निर्धूतपत्रशिखराः शीर्णपुष्पफला द्रुमाः।निक्षिप्तवस्त्राभरणा धूर्ता इव पराजिताः।।5.14.15।।
14_11.translation: The tree tops, shorn of their leaves and flowers and fruits fallen, appeared like gamblers who had lost their stakes and had to lay down their clothes and ornaments.
14_11.word_by_word: निर्धूतपत्रशिखराः with top branches shorn, शीर्णपुष्पफलाः with flowers and fruits shed, द्रुमाः trees, पराजिताः defeated, निक्षिप्तवस्त्राभरणाः with clothes and ornaments lost in gambling, धूर्ता इव like a gambler.

14_12.shloka: हनूमता वेगवता कम्पितास्ते नगोत्तमाः।पुष्पपर्णफलान्याशु मुमुचुः पुष्पशालिनः।।5.14.16।।
14_12.translation: Shaken by the swift Hanuman, even the big trees dropped flowers, fruits and leaves.
14_12.word_by_word: वेगवता by the swift, हनूमता Hanuman, कम्पिताः shaken, पुष्पशालिनः full of flowers and fruits, मुमुचुः dropped.

14_13.shloka: विहङ्गसङ्घैर्हीनास्ते स्कन्धमात्राश्रया द्रुमाः।बभूवुरगमाः सर्वे मारुतेव निर्धुताः।5.14.17।।
14_13.translation: Deserted by the flocks of birds resting on them (flowers and leaves also dropped from branches), the trees were left bare with trunks unable to move.
14_13.word_by_word: सर्वे all, ते द्रुमाः those trees, मारुतेन by Hanuman, विनिर्धुताः laid bare, अगमाः इव trees unable to move, विहङ्गसङ्घै: by flocks of birds, हीनाः deserted, स्कन्धमात्राश्रयाः only resting on the trunks, बभूवुः became.

14_14.shloka: निर्धूतकेशी युवतिर्यथा मृदितवर्णका।निष्पीतशुभदन्तोष्ठी नखैर्दन्तैश्च विक्षता।।5.14.18।।तथा लाङ्गूलहस्तैश्च चरणाभ्यां च मर्दिता।बभूवाशोकवनिका प्रभग्नवरपादपा।।5.14.19।।
14_14.translation: The garden of Ashoka with trees shattered and crushed by Hanuman's tail,  hands and feet, appeared like a woman with dishevelled hair, with her vermilion mark effaced, her bright teeth and lips faded for being kissed and wounded with nails and bitten with teeth (by her lover).
14_14.word_by_word: लाङ्गूलहस्तैश्च with tail and hands, चरणाभ्यां च and with feet, मर्दिता crushed, प्रभग्नवरपादपाः prominent trees shattered, अशोकवनिका Ashoka garden, निर्धूतकेशी hair dishevelled, मृदितवर्णका circular vermilion mark effaced, निष्पीतशुभदन्तोष्ठी with bright teeth and lips kissed, नखैः with nails, दन्तैश्च with teeth also, विक्षता wounded, युवतिः young woman, यथा likewise, तथा that, बभूव appeared.

14_15.shloka: महालतानां दामानि व्यथमत्तरसा कपिः।यथा प्रावृषि विन्ध्यस्य मेघजालानि मारुतः।।5.14.20।।
14_15.translation: Hanuman shook with tremendous speed the huge clusters of creepers hanging there just like stormy wind in rainy season scatters masses of clouds on the Vindhya mountain.
14_15.word_by_word: कपिः monkey, महालतानाम् of huge creepers, दामानि hanging, तरसा with tremendous  speed, मारुतः wind, प्रावृषि in the rainy season, विन्ध्यस्य of Vindhya, मेघजालानि clusters of clouds, यथा like wise, व्यथमत् shook.

14_16.shloka: स तत्र मणिभूमीश्च राजतीश्च मनोरमाः।तथा काञ्चनभूमीश्च ददर्श विचरन्कपिः।।5.14.21।।
14_16.translation: Roaming there the monkey noticed the beautiful floors paved with gems, gold and silver৷৷
14_16.word_by_word: सः he, कपिः the monkey, तत्र there, विचरन् while roaming, मणिभूमीश्च floors with gems, राजतीश्च studded with silver, तथा so also, मनोरमाः pleasing to the eyes, काञ्चनभूमीश्च floors paved with gold, ददर्श saw.

14_17.translation: ﻿He observed ponds of different shapes filled with clear water with steps paved with rich gems, with sands of pearls and corals and bottoms of crystal, which contained beds of lotuses in bloom, adorned with chakravaka birds and resonant with cacklings of swans and sarasas and vatyuhas rubbing their beaks. There were golden platforms built on banks and platforms built of crystals. There were trees on the bank of streams, and nectarlike sacred waters flowing in them surrounded by hundreds of creepers, and Ashoka blossoms scattered everywhere, with thickly grown bushes of different kinds, with lilies in bloom in tanks.
14_17.word_by_word: ﻿परमवारिणा with pure water, पूर्णाः filled, ततस्ततः here and there, महार्हैः with rich, मणिसोपानैः with steps studded with gems, उपपन्नाः endowed with, मुक्ताप्रवालसिकताः with sands of corals and pearls, स्फाटिकान्तरकुट्टिमाः platforms paved with bright crystals, तीरजैः grown on banks, काञ्चनैः by golden, चित्रैः with colourful, तरुभिः with trees, उपशोभिताः looked splendid, फुल्लपद्मोत्पलवनाः with beds of lotuses in bloom, चक्रवाकोपकूजिताः with sounds of Chakravakas, नत्यूहरुतसंघुष्टाः a flocks of Natyuha birds rubbing together, हंससारसनादिताः made noisy with swans and Sarasa birds, दीर्घाभिः by long, द्रुमयुक्ताभिः endowed with trees, अमृतोपमतोयाभिः with nectarlike water, शिवाभिः with auspicious, सरिद्भिः with streamlets, समन्ततः all over, उपसंस्कृताः decorated, लताशतैः with hundreds ofcreepers, अवतताः spread, सन्तानकुसुमावृताः scattered with Ashoka blossoms, नानागुल्मावृतघनाः thick with several bushes, करवीरकृतांतराः lilies in bloom here and there, विविधाकाराः of different shapes, वापीश्च wells.

14_18.translation: He observed ponds of different shapes filled with clear water with steps paved with rich gems, with sands of pearls and corals and bottoms of crystal, which  contained beds of lotuses in bloom, adorned with chakravaka birds and resonant with cacklings of swans and sarasas and vatyuhas rubbing their beaks. There were golden platforms built on banks and platforms built of crystals. There were trees on the bank of streams, and nectarlike sacred waters flowing in them surrounded by hundreds of creepers, and Ashoka blossoms scattered everywhere, with thickly grown bushes of different kinds, with lilies in bloom in tanks.
14_18.word_by_word: परमवारिणा with pure water, पूर्णाः filled, ततस्ततः here and there, महार्हैः with rich, मणिसोपानैः with steps studded with gems, उपपन्नाः endowed with, मुक्ताप्रवालसिकताः with sands of corals and pearls, स्फाटिकान्तरकुट्टिमाः platforms paved with bright crystals, तीरजैः  grown on banks, काञ्चनैः by golden, चित्रैः with colourful, तरुभिः with trees, उपशोभिताः looked splendid, फुल्लपद्मोत्पलवनाः with beds of lotuses in bloom, चक्रवाकोपकूजिताः with sounds of Chakravakas, नत्यूहरुतसंघुष्टाः a flocks of Natyuha birds rubbing together, हंससारसनादिताः made noisy with swans and Sarasa birds, दीर्घाभिः by long, द्रुमयुक्ताभिः endowed with trees, अमृतोपमतोयाभिः with nectarlike water, शिवाभिः with auspicious, सरिद्भिः with streamlets, समन्ततः all over, उपसंस्कृताः decorated, लताशतैः with hundreds ofcreepers, अवतताः spread, सन्तानकुसुमावृताः scattered with Ashoka blossoms, नानागुल्मावृतघनाः thick with several bushes, करवीरकृतांतराः lilies in bloom here and there, विविधाकाराः of different shapes, वापीश्च wells.

14_19.shloka: ततोऽम्बुधरसङ्काशं प्रवृद्धशिखरं गिरिम्।विचित्रकूटं कूटैश्च सर्वतः परिवारितम्।।5.14.27।।शिलागृहैरवततं नानावृक्षैः समावृतम्।ददर्श हरिशार्दूलो रम्यं जगति पर्वतम्।।5.14.28।।
14_19.translation: The tiger among monkeys beheld a delightingful mountain, resembling the raincloud with tall, pleasing peaks, wonderful peaks spread all over the mountain. There were caves built of stone, with a variety of trees.
14_19.word_by_word: ततः then, हरिशार्दूलः a tiger among monkeys, जगति movable, रम्यं पर्वतम् delightful mountain, अम्बुधरसङ्काशम् resembling a rain cloud, प्रवृद्धशिखरम् with a tall peak, विचित्रकूटम् with a collection of wonderful peaks, सर्वतः all over, कूटै: by peaks, परिवारितम् surrounded, शिलागृहैः with caves, अवततम् extending, नानावृक्षैः with different kinds of trees, समावृतम् surrounded, गिरिम् mountain, ददर्श beheld.

14_20.shloka: ददर्श च नगात्तस्मान्नदीं निपतितां कपिः।अङ्कादिव समुत्पत्य प्रियस्य पतितां प्रियाम्।।5.14.29।।जले निपतिताग्रैश्च पादपैरुपशोभिताम्।वार्यमाणामिव क्रुद्धां प्रमदां प्रियबन्धुभिः।।5.14.30।।पुनरावृत्ततोयां च ददर्श स महाकपिः।प्रसन्नामिव कान्तस्य कान्तां पुनरुपस्थिताम्।।5.14.31।।
14_20.translation: Hanuman, the great monkey saw a stream descending from the hill which looked like a beloved jumping down from the thighs of her lover. It was adorned with trees whose boughs touched the water and thus looking like an angry woman leaving her dear lover but detained by her relatives. With the water running backward in circles it appeared as if the beloved has returned to her lover pleased.
14_20.word_by_word: कपिः monkey, तस्मात् from that, नगात् hill, निपतिताम् descending down, नदीं a stream, प्रियस्य beloved's, अङ्कात् from the thighs, समुत्पत्य jumping up, पतिताम् falling down, प्रियाम् इव like a beloved, जले in water, निपतिताग्रैः with the branches bent into water, पादपैः with trees, उपशोभिताम् splendid, प्रियबन्धुभिः by dear relatives, वार्यमाणाम् prevented, क्रुद्धाम् angry one, प्रमदाम् इव like a woman, नदीम् river, ददर्श saw, आवृत्ततोयाम् with water running backwards creating circles, कान्तस्य at the lover, प्रसन्नाम् pleased, पुनः again, उपस्थिताम् approached, कान्तामिव like a woman, सः Hanuman, महाकपिः great monkey, पुनः again, ददर्श saw.

14_21.shloka: तस्या दूरात्सपद्मिन्यो नानाद्विजगणायुताः।ददर्श हरिशार्दूलो हनुमान् मारुतात्मजः।।5.14.32।।
14_21.translation: Not far from there, Hanuman, son of the Windgod sighted lotus ponds filled with different kinds of water birds.
14_21.word_by_word: हरिशार्दूलः tiger among vanaras, मारुतात्मजः son of the Windgod, सः हनुमान् Hanuman, तस्य of that (hill), अदूरात् not far from there, नानाद्विजगणायुताः filled with different flocks of water birds, पद्मिन्यः lotus ponds, ददर्श saw.

14_22.shloka: कृत्रिमां दीर्घिकां चापि पूर्णां शीतेन वारिणा।मणिप्रवरसोपानां मुक्तासिकतशोभिताम्।।5.14.33।।विविधैर्मृगसङ्घैश्च विचित्रां चित्रकाननाम्।प्रासादैस्सुमहद्भिश्च निर्मितैर्विश्वकर्मणा।।5.14.34।।काननैः कृत्रिमैश्चापि सर्वतः समलङ्कृताम्।
14_22.translation: Hanuman saw an oblong pond, full of cool water provided with steps, embellished with gems and beautified with pearl dust as sand on its bank.  Thronged with many kinds of animals, it looked colourful with large mansions constructed by Visvakarma in the artificial woodlands decorated all over.
14_22.word_by_word: शीतेन by cool, वारिणा with water, पूर्णाम् filled with, मणिप्रवरसोपानाम् with steps embellished with gems, मुक्तासिकतशोभिताम् spread over with pearl dust as sand, विविधैः with many kinds, मृगसङ्घैश्च with herds of animals, विचित्राम् wonderful, चित्रकाननाम् having colourful woods, विश्वकर्मणा by Visvakarma, निर्मितैः constructed, सुमहद्भिः by the large, प्रासादैः mansions, कृत्रिमैः artificial, काननैश्चापि woodlands also, सर्वतः all over, समलङ्कृताम् decorated, कृत्रिमाम् artificial, दीर्घिकां चापि lakes.

14_23.translation: There the trees had abundance of flowers and fruits. A few trees were full of leaves and branches spread like parasols. There were raised golden platforms.
14_23.word_by_word: तत्र there, पुष्पोपगफलोपगाः had abundance of flowers and fruits (easily reachable), ये केचित् those few, पादपाः trees, सर्वे all, सच्छत्राः (like) parasols, सवितर्दीकाः having raised benches, सौवर्णवेदिकाः golden platforms.

14_24.shloka: लताप्रतानैर्बहुभिःपर्णैश्च बहुभिर्वृताम्।।5.14.36।।काञ्चनीं शिंशुपामेकां ददर्श हरियूथपः।वृतां हेममयीभिस्तु वेदिकाभिस्समन्ततः।।5.14.37।।
14_24.translation: The monkey leader saw one simsupa tree covered all over with canopies of many climbers and leaves. The tree was surrounded by golden platforms.
14_24.word_by_word: हरियूथपः the monkey leader, बहुभिः with many, लताप्रतानैः with canopies of  climbers, बहुभिः with many, पर्णैश्च with leaves also, वृताम् covered, समन्ततः all over, हेममयीभिः with golden, वेदिकाभिः with platforms, वृताम् surrounded, काञ्चनीम् golden, एकाम् a single, शिंशुपाम् Simsupa tree, ददर्श saw.

14_25.translation: He beheld several pieces of land and streams flowing out of the springs. He also noticed golden trees asresplendent as fire.
14_25.word_by_word: सः he, भूमिभागांश्च pieces of land, गर्तप्रस्रवणानि च streams flowing out of springs, अपरान् other, शिखिसन्निभान् resembling fire, सुवर्णवृक्षान् golden coloured tree, अपश्यत् beheld.

14_26.shloka: तेषां द्रुमाणां प्रभया मेरोरिव दिवाकरः।अमन्यत तदा वीरः काञ्चनोऽस्मीति वानरः।।5.14.39।।
14_26.translation: He saw trees resplendent with golden radiance and thought that he was in the midst of gold like the Sungod getting golden hue by the radiance of Meru, the golden mountain.
14_26.word_by_word: तदा then, वीरः a hero, वानरः vanara, मेरोः of Meru, प्रभया by the radiance, दिवाकरः इव like the Sun, तेषाम् of those, द्रुमाणाम् of tree, प्रभया by the radiance, काञ्चनः golden, अस्मि was, इति thus, अमन्यत thought.

14_27.shloka: तां काञ्चनैस्तरुगणैर्मारुतेन च वीजिताम्।किङ्किणीशतनिर्घोषां दृष्ट्वा विस्मयमागमत्।।5.14.40।।
14_27.translation: Hanuman was wonderstruck to hear the sound produced by rows of golden trees which stood round the simsupa tree. This sound resembled the tinkling of a hundred anklets when the wind passed through (their leaves).
14_27.word_by_word: काञ्चनैः तरुगणैः with golden trees, मारुतेन by the wind, वीजिताम् fanned, किङ्कणी शतनिर्घोषाम् like the tinkling of a hundred anklets, ताम् that (tree), दृष्ट्वा seeing, विस्मयम् wonder, आगमत् struck.

14_28.shloka: स पुष्पिताग्रां रुचिरां तरुणाङ्कुरपल्लवाम्।तामारुह्य महाबाहुश्शिंशुपां पर्णसंवृताम्।।5.14.41।।
14_28.translation: Strongarmed Hanuman climbed up the simsupa tree shining with flowers on its top and surrounded by tender sprouts and leaves. (He said to himself):
14_28.word_by_word: महाबाहुः strongarmed hero, सः he, पुष्पिताग्राम् with flowers blossoming on the top, रुचिराम् lovely, तरुणाङ्कुरपल्लवाम् with tender sprouts and leaves, पर्णसंवृताम् surrounded by leaves, ताम् that, आरुह्य having climbed.

14_29.shloka: इतो द्रक्ष्यामि वैदेहीं रामदर्शनलालसाम्।इतश्चेतश्च दुःखार्तां सम्पतन्तीं यदृच्छया।।5.14.42।।
14_29.translation: "I may see by chance( from this point) Vaidehi tormented with grief anxiously waiting to see Rama while moving about here and there casually.
14_29.word_by_word: रामदर्शनलालसाम् a lady eager to see Rama, वैदेहीम् at Vaidehi, इतः from this place, द्रक्ष्यामि I will see, दुःखार्ताम् a lady filled with sorrow, यदृच्छया casually, इतश्च इतश्च here and there, सम्पतन्तीम् lady moving.

14_30.shloka: अशोकवनिका चेयं दृढं रम्या दुरात्मनः।चम्पकैश्चन्दनैश्चापि वकुलैश्च विभूषिता।।5.14.43।।
14_30.translation: "Surely this beautiful Ashoka grove with delightful champak, chandan and bakula trees belongs to the wicked Ravana."
14_30.word_by_word: दुरात्मनः of the wicked one, इयम् this, अशोकवनिका Ashoka grove, दृढम् surely, रम्याbeautiful, चम्पकैः by Champak, चन्दनैश्च and Chandan, वकुलैश्चापि and with Bakula also, विभूषिता is decorated.

14_31.shloka: इयं च नलिनी रम्या द्विजसङ्घनिषेविता।इमां सा राममहिषी नूनमेष्यति जानकी।।5.14.44।।
14_31.translation: "This lovely lotuspond is frequented by flocks of aquatic birds. Surely Rama's queen Janaki will come to this place.
14_31.word_by_word: द्विजसङ्घनिषेविता frequented by flocks of water birds, इयम् this, नलिनी च  lotuspond, रम्या beautiful, सा she, राममहिषी Rama's queen, जानकी Janaki, नूनम् surely, इमाम् this place, एष्यति she will come.

14_32.shloka: सा रामा राममहिषी राघवस्य प्रिया सती।वनसञ्चारकुशला नूनमेष्यति जानकी।।5.14.45।।
14_32.translation: "Beautiful Janaki, beloved queen of Rama loves to wander in forests. She will surely visit this grove.
14_32.word_by_word: राममहिषी Rama's queen, राघवस्य Raghava's, प्रिया beloved, सती a chaste lady, रामा a beautiful woman, वनसञ्चारकुशला who loves to wander in forests, सा जानकी that Janaki, नूनम् surely, एष्यति she will visit.

14_33.shloka: अथवा मृगशाबाक्षी वनस्यास्य विचक्षणा।वनमेष्यति साऽर्येह रामचिन्तानुकर्शिता।।5.14.46।।
14_33.translation: "Or may be that doeeyed noble lady brooding over Rama will come to this garden she   is familiar with.
14_33.word_by_word: अथवा or may be, मृगशाबाक्षी doeeyed lady, अस्य of this, वनस्य garden's, विचक्षणा familiar with, रामचिन्तानुकर्शिता brooding over Rama, सा that, आर्या noble woman, इह here, वनम् garden, एष्यति will come.

14_34.shloka: रामशोकाभिसन्तप्ता सा देवी वामलोचना।वनवासे रता नित्यमेष्यते वनचारिणी।।5.14.47।।
14_34.translation: "That lovelyeyed queen tormented with grief over separation from Rama will be coming here to stay as she always loves strolling in the forest.
14_34.word_by_word: रामशोकाभिसन्तप्ता tormented with over grief Rama's separation, वामलोचना lovelyeyed one, नित्यम् always, वनवासे in the forest, रता enjoying, सा that, देवी devi, वनचारिणी loves strolling in the forest, एष्यते will come.

14_35.shloka: वनेचराणां सततं नूनं स्पृहयते पुरा।रामस्य दयिता भार्या जनकस्यसुता सती।।5.14.48।।
14_35.translation: "The daughter of Janaka, the  chaste wife of Rama,  used to for the company of those creatures wandering in the forest.
14_35.word_by_word: रामस्य Rama's, दयिता dear, भार्या wife, जनकस्य Janaka's, सुता daughter, सती a chaste lady, पुरा earlier, सततम् always, वनेचराणाम् of creatures wandering in the forest, स्पृहयते she likes, नूनम् surely.

14_36.shloka: सन्ध्याकालमनाः श्यामा ध्रुवमेष्यति जानकी।नदीं चेमां शुभजलां सन्ध्यार्थे वरवर्णिनी।।5.14.49।।
14_36.translation: Surely that lady of lovely complexion, the beautiful Janaki will come to this riverflowing with sacred waters for performing the evening rituals.
14_36.word_by_word: श्यामा beautiful, वरवर्णिनी a lady of lovely complexion, जानकी Janaki, सन्ध्याकालमनाः at the time of twilight, शुभजलाम् sacred waters, इमां नदीम् this river, सन्ध्यार्थे for performing evening ritual, ध्रुवम् surely, एष्यति come.

14_37.shloka: तस्याश्चाप्यनुरूपेयमशोकवनिका शुभा।शुभा या पार्थिवेन्द्रस्य पत्नी रामस्य सम्मता।।5.14.50।।
14_37.translation: To the auspicious Sita,the beloved of Rama, the lord of the world, this Ashoka grove is a befitting place.
14_37.word_by_word: या she, पार्थिवेन्द्रस्य of the lord of the world, रामस्य Rama's, सम्मता beloved, शुभा auspicious, पत्नी wife, तस्याः her, शुभा auspicious, इयम् this, अशोकवनिका this Ashoka grove, अनुरूपापि च and  suitable place.

14_38.shloka: यदि जीवति सा देवी ताराधिपनिभानना।आगमिष्यति साऽवश्यमिमां शिवजलां नदीम्।।5.14.51।।
14_38.translation: "The moonfaced queen will certainly come to this stream of  auspicious water if she is surviving."
14_38.word_by_word: ताराधिपनिभानना moonfaced one, सा देवी that queen, जीवति यदि if she is surviving, सा she, अवश्यम् certainly, इमाम् this, शिवजलाम् a place  of auspicious water, नदीम् river, आगमिष्यति she will come.

14_39.shloka: एवं तु मत्वा हनुमान्महात्मा प्रतीक्षमाणो मनुजेन्द्रपत्नीम्।अवेक्षमाणश्च ददर्श सर्वं सुपुष्पिते पर्णघने निलीनः।।5.14.52।।
14_39.translation: Pondering thus, the highsouled Hanuman remained concealed on the tree loaded with flowers and leaves and waited, looking eagerly for the wife of the lord of the people.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये सुन्दरकाण्डे चतुर्दशस्सर्गः।Thus ends the fourteenth sarga of Sundarakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
14_39.word_by_word: महात्मा highsouled, हनुमान् Hanuman, एवम् thus, मत्वा pondering, मनुजेन्द्रपत्नीम् wife of the lord of the people, प्रतीक्षमाणः waiting, सुपुष्पिते on a profusely bloomed, पर्णघने abundant leaves, निलीनः hid himself, अवेक्षमाणश्च looking down, सर्वम् all over, ददर्श saw.

15_1.shloka: [Hanuman sees Sita.]स वीक्षमाणस्तत्रस्थो मार्गमाणश्च मैथिलीम्।अवेक्षमाणश्च महीं सर्वां तामन्ववैक्षत।।5.15.1।।
15_1.translation: Hanuman looked out from the simsupa tree all around for Mythili scanning the ground below.
15_1.word_by_word: सः he (Hanuman), तत्रस्थः from there, वीक्षमाणः looking out, मैथिलीम् for Mythili, मार्गमाणः searching for, अवेक्षमाणः looking down all around, सर्वाम् everywhere, तां महीम् that ground, अन्ववैक्षत surveyed.

15_2.shloka: सन्तानकलताभिश्च पादपैरुपशोभिताम्।दिव्यगन्धरसोपेतां सर्वतस्समलङ्कृताम्।।5.15.2।।तां स नन्दनसङ्काशां मृगपक्षिभिरावृताम्।हर्म्यप्रासादसम्बाधां कोकिलाकुलनिस्स्वनाम्।।5.15.3।।काञ्चनोत्पलपद्माभिर्वापीभिरुपशोभिताम्।बह्वासनकुथोपेतां बहुभूमिगृहायुताम्।।5.15.4।।सर्वर्तुकुसुमै रम्यां फलवद्भिश्च पादपैः।पुष्पितानामशोकानां श्रिया सूर्योदयप्रभाम्।।5.15.5।।प्रदीप्तामिव तत्रस्थो मारुतिस्समुदैक्षत।निष्पत्रशाखां विहगैः क्रियमाणामिवासकृत्।।5.15.6।।विनिष्पतद्भिः शतशश्चित्रैः पुष्पावतंसकैः।आमूलपुष्पनिचितैरशोकैश्शोकनाशनैः।।5.15.7।।पुष्पभारातिभारैश्च स्पृशद्भिरिव मेदिनीम्।कर्णिकारैः कुसुमितैः किंशुकैश्च सुपुष्पितैः।।5.15.8।।
15_2.translation: Hanuman surveyed from the Simsupa tree the Ashoka grove of trees full of fine fragrance. It looked welldecorated  like the Nandana garden of Indra. It teemed with animals and birds. It was filled with the voices of the cuckoos. It had tall mansions and underground chamber. There were golden lilies and lotuses in the lakes, enchanting couches with rich coverings and trees full of blossoms of all seasons and fruits in abundance With the  Ashoka tree shedding showers of flowers from time to time the place shone with the splendour of Sunrise. It glittered like inflamed fire. The Ashoka tree had  hundreds of colourful birds on the branches. It appeared as if it had branches without leaves which made them look like earornaments (of the grove). Ashoka flowers in bloom hung down to the base of the tree as if to take away the grief of the onlookers. The blossoms of the Karnikara and kimsuka brightened the wholegrove.
15_2.word_by_word: मारुतिः Hanuman, तत्रस्थः from there, सन्तानकलताभिश्च creepers of Ashoka and, पादपैः trees, उपशोभिताम् splendid, दिव्यगन्धरसोपेताम् enriched with fine fragrance, सर्वतः all around, समलङ्कृताम् well decorated, नन्दनसङ्काशाम् resembling Nandana grove of Indra, मृगपक्षिभिः with animals and birds, आवृताम् surrounded, हर्म्यप्रासादसम्बाधाम् with tall mansions, कोकिलाकुलनिस्स्वनाम् filled with the warble of cuckoos, काञ्चनोत्पलपद्माभिः with golden lilies and lotuses, वापीभिः with lakes, उपशोभिताम् enchanting, बह्वासनकुथोपेताम् couches with rich coverings, बहुभूमिगृहायुताम् many underground homes, सर्वर्तुकुसुमैः  trees full of blossoms of all seasons, फलवद्भिः fruits, पादपैः with trees, रम्याम् delightful, पुष्पितानाम् of the blossoms, अशोकानाम् of Ashoka tree, श्रिया with radiance, सूर्योदयप्रभाम् shedding the splendour of the rising Sun, प्रदीप्तामिव as if inflamed, असकृत् often, विनिष्पतद्भिः falling constantly, शतशः in hundreds, विहगैः with birds, निष्पत्रशाखाम् branches without leaves, क्रियमाणाम् इव as if rendering, चित्रैः with colourful, पुष्पावतंसकैः thick with flowers serving as earornaments (of the forest), आमूलपुष्पनिचितैः with blossoms up to the base of trees, शोकनाशनैः which can remove sorrow, अशोकैः with Ashoka, पुष्पभारातिभारैश्च loaded heavily with flowers, मेदिनीम् ground, स्पृशद्भिरिव as if touching, कुसुमितैः with blossoming, कर्णिकारैः with Karnikara flowers, सुपुष्पितैः fully bloomed, किंशुकैः with Kimsukas, ताम् that spot, समुदैक्षत surveyed.

15_3.shloka: स देशः प्रभया तेषां प्रदीप्त इव सर्वतः।पुन्नागास्सप्तपर्णाश्च चम्पकोद्दालकास्तथा।।5.15.9।।विवृद्धमूला बहवश्शोभन्ते स्म सुपुष्पिताः।
15_3.translation: The grove shone bright as if it were inflamed fire with beautiful trees like purnaga, saptaparna, champak and uddalaka in full bloom.
15_3.word_by_word: तेषाम् of those, प्रभया with radiance, सः that, देशः place, सर्वतः all over, प्रदीप्त इव as though inflamed, विवृद्धमूलाः extended its roots, सुपुष्पिताः well bloomed, पुन्नागाः punnagas, सप्तपर्णाश्च saptaparnas and, तथा like wise, चम्पकोद्दालकाः champaka, uddalaka, शोभन्ते स्म shone bright.

15_4.translation: There were thousands of ashoka trees some of which shone like gold, others like the flames of fire and some dark as collyrium.
15_4.word_by_word: तत्र there, सहस्रशः thousands, अशोकाः Ashoka, केचित् some, शातकुम्भनिभाः shone like gold, केचित् some, अग्निशिखोपमाः like the flames of fire, केचित् some, नीलाञ्जनिभाः like the black collyrium.

15_5.shloka: नन्दनं विविधोद्यानं चित्रं चैत्ररथं यथा।।5.15.11।।अतिवृत्तमिवाचिन्त्यं दिव्यं रम्यं श्रिया वृतम्।वितीयमिव चाकाशं पुष्पज्योतिर्गणायुतम्।।5.15.12।।पुष्परत्नशतैश्चित्रं द्वितीयं सागरं यथा।सर्वर्तुपुष्पैर्निचितं पादपैर्मधुगन्धिभिः।।5.15.13।।नानानिनादैरुद्यानं रम्यं मृगगणैर्द्विजैः।अनेकगन्धप्रवहं पुण्यगन्धं मनोरमम्।।5.15.14।।
15_5.translation: The grove with different types of gardens spread over looked like the Nandana garden of Indra and Chaitraratha garden of Kubera. It surpassed every other garden. It was unimaginable in splendour. It was divine and delightful filled with the radiance of countless varieties of blossoms shining like stars, like a second firmament. It was like another ocean filled with precious gems of flowers. It had trees with flowers of honeyscented fragrance. Sounds of animals and birds filled the air. It was pleasing to the heart with various divine fragrances wafted (by the breeze)৷৷
15_5.word_by_word: विविधोद्यानम् with different types of gardens, नन्दनं यथा like the Nandana garden of Indra, चित्रम् colourful, चैत्ररथं यथा like the Chaitraratha garden of Kubera, अतिवृत्तम् surpassing, अचिन्त्यम् unimaginable, दिव्यम् divine, रम्यम् delightful, श्रिया with luminaries, वृतम् surrounded with, पुष्पज्योतिर्गणायुतम् shining with the radiance of countless varieties of blossoms, द्वितीयम् lovely, आकाशमिव like the sky, पुष्परत्नशतैः hundreds of gems in the form of flowers, चित्रम् wonderful, द्वितीयम् a second (besides the four oceans which form the boundary of the earth), सागरम् ocean (firmament), यथा likewise, सर्वर्तुपुष्पैः bearing flowers of all seasons, मधुगन्धिभिः honey scented, पादपैः with trees, निचितम् filled, नानानिनादैः  with various sounds, मृगगणैः by flocks of tamed animals, द्विजैः by birds, रम्यम् enchanting, अनेकगन्धप्रवहम् with various fragrances wafting, पुण्यगन्धम् divine fragrance, मनोरमम् pleasing to the heart.

15_6.shloka: शैलेन्द्रमिव गन्धाढ्यं द्वितीयं गन्धमादनम्।अशोकवनिकायां तु तस्यां वानरपुङ्गवः।।5.15.15।।स ददर्शाविदूरस्थं चैत्यप्रासादमुच्छ्रितम्।मथ्ये स्तम्भसहस्रेण स्थितं कैलासपाण्डुरम्।।5.15.16।।प्रवालकृतसोपानं तप्तकाञ्चनवेदिकम्।मुष्णन्तमिव चक्षूंषि द्योतमानमिव श्रिया।।5.15.17।।विमलं प्रांशुभावत्वादुल्लिखन्तमिवाम्बरम्।
15_6.translation: The monkey leader saw a lofty templelike structure in the midst of the Ashoka grove which was highly fragrant and appeared like another indescribable structure that stood on a thousand pillars like another Gandhamadana mountain. It gleamed white like mount Kailasa. Its stairs were paved with corals. The altars were made of brightly polished gold. This structure glowing with brilliance was as if stealing the eyes. It looked white with light and lofty as though scratching the sky.
15_6.word_by_word: सः वानरपुङ्गवः that monkey leader, तस्याम् in that, अशोकवनिकायाम् in Ashoka grove, मध्ये midst, गन्धाढ्याम् highly fragrant, द्वितीयम् another, गन्धमादनमिव like mount Gandhamadana, स्तम्भसहस्रेण with a thousand pillars, स्थितम् stood by, कैलासपाण्डुरम् white like mount Kailasa, प्रवालकृतसोपानम् having stairs paved with corals, तप्तकाञ्चनवेदिकम् having altars of bright molten gold, चक्षूंषि eyes, मुष्णन्तमिव as if stealing away, श्रिया with brilliance, द्योतमानमिव as if shining, विमलम् white, प्रांशुभावत्वात् due to its light, अम्बरम् sky, उल्लिखन्तमिव as if scratching, अविदूरस्थम् not far from there, उच्छ्रितम् tall, चैत्यप्रासादम् a big  temple ददर्श saw.

15_7.shloka: ततो मलिनसंवीतां राक्षसीभिस्समावृताम्।।5.15.18।।उपवासकृशां दीनां निश्श्वसन्तीं पुनः पुनः।ददर्श शुक्लपक्षादौ चन्द्ररेखामिवामलाम्।।5.15.19।।
15_7.translation: Then he beheld a lady surrounded by female demons. Clad in soiled clothes she looked dejected, emaciated through fasting and was sighing repeatedly. She appeared thin and pale like the crescent Moon at the beginning of the bright fortnight.
15_7.word_by_word: ततः then, मलिनसंवीताम् clad in soiled clothes, राक्षसीभिः by female demons, समावृताम् surrounded, उपवासकृशाम् emaciated through fasting, दीनाम् a pitiable, पुनः पुनः repeatedly, निश्श्वसन्तीम् sighing, शुक्लपक्षादौ at the beginning of the bright fortnight, अमलाम् white, चन्द्ररेखामिव like the crescent Moon, ददर्श saw.

15_8.shloka: मन्दप्रख्यायमानेन रूपेण रुचिरप्रभाम्।पिनद्धां धूमजालेन शिखामिव विभावसोः।।5.15.20।।
15_8.translation: Her form was faintly recognisable. She had a lovely radiance on account of her beautiful form. She looked like the tip of burning fire engulfed in a cloud of smoke.
15_8.word_by_word: मन्दप्रख्यायमानेन faintly recognisable, रूपेण in form, धूमजालेन by a cluster of smoke, पिनद्धाम् engulfed, रुचिरप्रभाम् with bright shine, विभावसोः of fire, शिखामिव like the tip.

15_9.translation: She was wearing an excellent single yellow cloth which was soiled. Unadorned, she looked like a muddy lotuspond bereft of lotuses.
15_9.word_by_word: क्लिष्टेन wornout body, पीतेन by yellow cloth, एकेन only one, उत्तमवाससा choicest cloth, संवीताम् clad in, अनलङ्काराम् without unadorned, सपङ्कम् with dust, विपद्माम् devoid of lotuses, पद्मिनीमिव like a lotus pond.

15_10.shloka: व्रीडितां दुःखसन्तप्तां परिम्लानां तपस्विनीम्।ग्रहेणाङ्गारकेणेव पीडितामिव रोहिणीम्।।5.15.22।।
15_10.translation: She was bashful, tormented with agony, dejected with a withered look. She appeared like the star Rohini oppressed by planet Mars.
15_10.word_by_word: व्रीडिताम् she was bashful, दुःखसन्तप्ताम् she was tormented with agony, परिम्लानाम् withered, तपस्विनीम् a helpless lady, अङ्गारकेण ग्रहेण by the planet Mars, पीडिताम् tormented, रोहिणीम् इव like the Rohini star.

15_11.shloka: अश्रुपूर्णमुखीं दीनां कृशामनशनेन च।शोकध्यानपरां दीनां नित्यं दुःखपरायणाम्।।5.15.23।।
15_11.translation: Her face was filled with tears. She looked dejected and emaciated due to fasting. Always plunged in grief, she looked like one meditating in tears.
15_11.word_by_word: अश्रुपूर्णमुखीम् with her face filled with tears, दीनाम् dejected, अनशनेन by fasting, कृशाम् shrunken, शोकध्यानपराम् meditating in grief, नित्यम् always, दीनाम् dejected, दुःखपरायणाम् overwhelmed with sorrow.

15_12.shloka: प्रियं जनमपश्यन्तीं पश्यन्तीं राक्षसीगणम्।स्वगणेन मृगीं हीनां श्वगणाभिवृतामिव।।5.15.24।।
15_12.translation: Unable to see her dear kith and kin, she sat guarded by ogresses. She appeared like a doe separated from the herd and encircled by a pack of hounds.
15_12.word_by_word: प्रियम् dear, जनम् relatives, अपश्यन्तीम् not seeing, राक्षसीगणम् ogresses, पश्यन्तीम् seeing, स्वगणेन by her own kith, हीनाम् श्वगणाभिवृताम् surrounded by a group of hounds, मृगीम् इव like a female deer.

15_13.shloka: नीलनागाभया वेण्या जघनं गतयैकया।नीलया नीरदापाये वनराज्या महीमिव।।5.15.25।।सुखार्हां दुःखसन्तप्तां व्यसनानामकोविदाम्।
15_13.translation: She (from behind) appeared like the earth covered with a range of trees at the end of rainy season with her single long black braid touching her hips looking like a black serpent. She who deserved to be happy and had not experienced worries was burning in grief. (एकवेणी is a trait of a प्रोषितभर्तृका Sita who was forced to stay in Lanka was a प्रोषितभर्तृका नायिका.)
15_13.word_by_word: जघनम् the hips, गतया by touching, एकया by only one, नीलनागाभया which looked like a black serpent, वेण्या with a braid of hair, नीरदापाये at the close of rainy season, नीलया with a dark one, वनराज्या by a range of forest, महीमिव like the earth, सुखार्हाम् who deserves to be happy, दुःखसन्तप्ताम् burning in grief, व्यसनानाम् of worries, अकोविदाम् who had not experienced.

15_14.shloka: तां समीक्ष्य विशालाक्षीमधिकं मलिनां कृशाम्।।5.15.26।।तर्कयामास सीतेति कारणैरुपपादिभिः।
15_14.translation: After seeing the largeeyed lady worn out and dressed in soiled clothes, Hanuman started deliberating in himself and guessed it was Sita for strong reasons.
15_14.word_by_word: विशालाक्षीम् largeeyed lady, अधिकम् very much, मलिनाम् soiled, कृशाम् thin, ताम् her, समीक्ष्य after observing, उपपादिभिः by establishing, कारणैः with reasons, सीतेति She is Sita, तर्कयामास he started deliberating within himself.

15_15.shloka: ह्रियमाणा तदा तेन रक्षसा कामरूपिणा।।5.15.27।।यथारूपा हि दृष्टा वै तथारूपेयमङ्गना।
15_15.translation: Beholding the form of the largeeyed lady, Hanuman guessed, 'This is similar to the form seen while the demon was kidnapping her'.
15_15.word_by_word: तदा then, कामरूपिणा by one who can assume any form at will, तेन रक्षसा by that demon, ह्रियमाणा being kidnapped, यथारूपा the same form, दृष्टा after seeing, इयम् this, अङ्गना lady, तथारूपा has the same form.

15_16.shloka: पूर्णचन्द्राननां सुभ्रूं चारुवृत्तपयोधराम्।।5.15.28।।कुर्वतीं प्रभयादेवीं सर्वा वितिमिरा दिशः।तां नीलकेशीं बिम्बोष्ठीं सुमध्यां सुप्रतिष्ठिताम्।।5.15.29।।सीतां पद्मपलाशाक्षीं मन्मथस्य रतिं यथा।
15_16.translation: Her face resembled the fullmoon which dispelled the encircling gloom by its radiance. She had a slender waist, beautiful round breasts, shapely eyebrows, red lips, dark hair, and eyes like lotus petals with attractive limbs. She was comparable to Rati, consort of Cupid.
15_16.word_by_word: पूर्णचन्द्राननाम् with face like fullmoon, सुभ्रूम्  with shapely  eyebrows, चारुवृत्तपयोधराम् of beautiful round breasts, सर्वाः all, दिशः directions, प्रभया with radiance, वितिमिराः bright, कुर्वतीम् rendering, देवीम् the queen, नीलकेशीम् one with dark hair, बिम्बोष्ठीम् lips red like Bimba fruit, सुमध्याम् with slenderwaist, सुप्रतिष्ठताम् with pleasing limbs, पद्मपलाशाक्षीम् eyes like lotus petal, मन्मथस्य of Kamadeva, रतिं यथा like Rati, सीताम् Sita.

15_17.shloka: इष्टां सर्वस्य जगतः पूर्णचन्द्रप्रभामिव।।5.15.30।।भूमौ सुतनुमासीनां नियतामिव तापसीम्।
15_17.translation: Just as the radiance of the full moon is cherished by all, this lady was liked by every one in this world. With her lovely figure she was seated on the ground like an austere ascetic.
15_17.word_by_word: पूर्णचन्द्रप्रभामिव like the radiance of fullmoon, सर्वस्य  entire, जगतः world, इष्टाम् favourite, नियताम् austere, तापसीमिव like an ascetic, भूमौ on the ground, आसीनाम् seated, सुतनुम्  lady with a good form.

15_18.shloka: निःश्वासबहुलां भीरुं भुजगेन्द्रवधूमिव।।5.15.31।।शोकजालेन महता विततेन न राजतीम्।
15_18.translation: The timid lady was hissing (sighing) like the consort of the serpent king, who being caught in a widespread cobweb of grief was looking gloomy.
15_18.word_by_word: भीरुम् a timid lady, भुजगेन्द्रवधूमिव like the consort of the serpent lord, निःश्वासबहुलाम्  hissing, महता with great, विततेन (widely spread), शोकजालेन by a cobweb of grief, न राजतीम् was gloomy.

15_19.shloka: संसक्तां धूमजालेन शिखामिव विभावसोः।।5.15.32।।तां स्मृतीमिव सन्दिग्धामृद्धिं निपतितामिव।
15_19.translation: She was like the flames of fire obscured by smoke. She appeared like the text of Smriti of doubtful meaning, a treasure that has been thrown away
15_19.word_by_word: धूमजालेन by a cloud of smoke, संसक्ताम् obscured, विभावसो of fire, शिखामिव like the flames of fire, सन्दिग्धाम् blurred, स्मृतीमिव like memory,  निपतिताम् one who has fallen, ऋद्धिमिव likethe fortune, ताम् her.

15_20.shloka: विहतामिव च श्रद्धामाशां प्रतिहतामिव।।5.15.33।।सोपसर्गां यथा सिद्धिं बुद्धिं सकलुषामिव।
15_20.translation: She was like faith shattered, hope frustrated, desires blocked by obstacles, success vitiated, fame marred and intellect blurred.
15_20.word_by_word: विहतामिव as if lost, श्रद्धाम् faith, आशां hope, प्रतिहताम् obstructed, आशामिव like desires, सोपसर्गाम् inhibited, सिद्धिमिव like success, सकलुषाम् vitiated, बुद्धिमिव like the intellect.

15_21.translation: She appeared like fame besmirched by false allegation. She was pained by the obstruction to meet Rama and emaciated by  abduction.
15_21.word_by_word: अभूतेन with a false, अपवादेन by rumour, निपतिताम् fallen, कीर्तिमिव like the fame, रामोपरोधव्यथिताम् was pained by the obstruction to meet Rama, रक्षोहरणकर्शिताम्  emaciated on account of abduction.

15_22.shloka: अबलां मृगशाबाक्षीं वीक्षमाणां ततस्ततः।।5.15.35।।बाष्पाम्बुपरिपूर्णेन कृष्णवक्राक्षिपक्ष्मणा।वदनेनाप्रसन्नेन निःश्वसन्तीं पुनः पुनः।।5.15.36।।
15_22.translation: The fawneyed lady was looking here and there with her dark, curved eyelashes. Her unhappy face was streaming with tears.
15_22.word_by_word: मृगशाबाक्षीम्  fawneyed, बाष्पाम्बुपरिपूर्णेन eyes filled with tears, कृष्णवक्राक्षिपक्ष्मणा with her dark and curved eyelashes, अप्रसन्नेन unhappy, वदनेन with her face,  ततस्ततः here and there,वीक्षमाणम् looking, अबलाम्  lady.

15_23.translation: Covered with dirt and mud and shorn of adornments even though she deserved them, she looked wretched like the radiance of the Moon muffled by dark clouds.
15_23.word_by_word: मलपङ्कधराम् covered with dirt and mud, दीनाम् wretched, मण्डनार्हाम् one who deserved to be adorned, आमण्डिताम् not wearing any ornaments, कालमेघैः with dark clouds, आवृताम् covered by, नक्षत्रराजस्य king of stars, प्रभामिव like the radiance.

15_24.shloka: तस्य संदिदिहे बुद्धिर्मुहुः सीतां निरीक्ष्य तु।आम्नायानामयोगेन विद्यां प्रशिथिलामिव।।5.15.38।।
15_24.translation: Hanuman did recognise Sita after looking at her carefully again and again even as one is able to make out knowledge of shastriclore forgotten with lapse of time and lack of practice.
15_24.word_by_word: आम्नायानाम् of the great shastriclore, अयोगेन by not practising, प्रशिथिलाम् slackened, विद्यामिव like the knowledge, सीताम् Sita, निरीक्ष्य having observed, तस्य his, बुद्धिस्तु intellect also, मुहुः after seeing carefuly again and again, संदिदिहे doubted.

15_25.shloka: दुःखेन बुबुधे सीतां हनुमाननलङ्कृताम्।संस्कारेण यथा हीनां वाचमर्थान्तरं गताम्।।5.15.39।।
15_25.translation: Just as an unclear expression which has undergone certain changes in meaning due to lack of usage over a long period is understood by virtue of previous practice so also Hanuman had difficulty in recognising Sita who was devoid of any decoration.
15_25.word_by_word: हनुमान Hanuman, अनलङ्कृताम् devoid of decoration, संस्कारेण by virtue of previous practice, हीनाम् devoid, अर्थान्तरम् changing its meaning, गताम् interpreted thus, वाचम् यथा like the words, सीताम् Sita, दुःखेन with great difficulty, बुबुधे he identified.

15_26.shloka: तां समीक्षय विशालाक्षीं राजपुत्रीमनिन्दिताम्।तर्कयामास सीतेति कारणैरुपपादिभिः।।5.15.40।।
15_26.translation: After close observation of different signs and deliberation with reasons he came to the conclusion that the largeeyed lady is the same blameless princess Sita.
15_26.word_by_word: विशालाक्षीम् largeeyed lady, अनिन्दिताम् blameless, तां राजपुत्रीम् that princess, समीक्ष्य after observing, उपपादिभिः by the right signs, कारणैः with reasons, सीतेति Sita only, तर्कयामास he came to conclusion after deliberation.

15_27.shloka: वैदेह्या यानि चाङ्गेषु तदा रामोऽन्वकीर्तयत्।तान्याभरणजालानि गात्रशोभीन्यलक्षयत्।।5.15.41।।सुकृतौ कर्णवेष्टौ च श्वदंष्ट्रौ च सुसंस्थितौ।मणिविद्रुमचित्राणि हस्तेष्वाभरणानि च।।5.15.42।।श्यामानि चिरयुक्तत्वात्तथा संस्थानवन्ति च।
15_27.translation: Hanuman observed the ornaments worn by Vaidehi adding grace to her limbs which Rama had described.They were wellcrafted earrings and wellfit Savdamshtras. Henoticed wonderful, variegated ornaments of corals and gems as well as those worn on hands. They were blackened for long wear and Sita had marks of wearing them on her body.(Note: This is a pair ornaments shaped like dog's teeth. It is not known on which part of the body they were worn).
15_27.word_by_word: तदा then, रामः Rama, यानि those, आभरणजालानि the kind of ornaments, वैदेह्याः for Vaidehi, अङ्गेषु on her limbs, अन्वकीर्तयत् described, गात्रशोभीनि ornaments that add beauty to the limbs, तानि those, अलक्षयत् observed, सुकृतौ wellcrafted, कर्णवेष्टौ च earornaments, सुसंस्थितौ properly fit, श्वदंष्ट्रौ च Svadamshtras also, हस्तेषु on hands, मणिविद्रुमचित्राणि wonderfully variegated with corals and other gems, आभरणानि च ornaments also, चिरयुक्तत्वात् by being used for a long time, श्यामानि blackened, संस्थानवन्ति च with marks of the ornaments formed on the body.

15_28.shloka: तान्यैवेतानि मन्येऽहं यानि रामोऽन्वकीर्तयत्।।5.15.43।।तत्र यान्यवहीनानि तान्यहं नोपलक्षये।यान्यस्या नावहीनानि तानीमानि न संशयः।।5.15.44।।
15_28.translation: "I think these ornaments are the same that were described by Rama. Those dropped (by Sita) are not found on her body. These were not dropped.There is no doubt."
15_28.word_by_word: तानि those, रामः Rama, यानि such of those, अन्वकीर्तयत् he described, तान्येव those only, अहम् I, मन्ये I think, तत्र there, यानि those, अवहीनानि dropped, तानि those, अहम् I, नोपलक्षये I have not seen, अस्याः her, यानि those, नावहीनानि not dropped, तानि those, इमानि only, संशयः doubt, न no.

15_29.shloka: पीतं कनकपट्टाभं स्रस्तं तद्वसनं शुभम्।उत्तरीयं नगासक्तं तदा दृष्टं प्लवङ्गमैः।।5.15.45।।
15_29.translation: "The shining yellow upper garment like a golden cloth was torn. Flung down, it stuck to a tree which the monkeys noticed.
15_29.word_by_word: पीतम् yellow, कनकपट्टाभम् shining like gold cloth, शुभम् auspicious one, उत्तरीयम् upper garment, स्रस्तम् slipped, नगासक्तम् stuck to the tree, तत् that, वस्त्रम् garment, तदा then, प्लवङ्गमैः by monkeys, दृष्टम् seen.

15_30.shloka: भूषणानि च मुख्यानि दृष्टानि धरणीतले।अनयैवापविद्धानि स्वनवन्ति महान्ति च।।5.15.46।।
15_30.translation: "The jingling, choice ornaments were thrown down on the ground.
15_30.word_by_word: नयैव by her alone, धरणीतले on the ground, अपविद्धानि thrown down, स्वनवन्ति making sound, महान्ति excellent, मुख्यानि choicest, भूषणानि च and ornaments, दृष्टानि were seen.

15_31.shloka: इदं चिरगृहीतत्वाद्वसनं क्लिष्टवत्तरम्।तथाऽपि नूनं तद्वर्णं तथा श्रीमद्यथेतरत्।।5.15.47।।
15_31.translation: "This cloth worn long is crumpled. Even then it has retained its shine and looks fresh.
15_31.word_by_word: इदम् this, वसनम् cloth, चिरगृहीतत्वात् worn long, क्लिष्टवत्तरम् crumpled, तथापि even so, नूनम् surely, तद्वर्णम् its colour, इतरत् like another fresh cloth, यथा similar, तथा so, श्रीमत्  shining.

15_32.shloka: इयं कनकवर्णाङ्गी रामस्य महिषी प्रिया।प्रणष्टापि सती याऽस्य मनसो न प्रणश्यति।।5.15.48।।
15_32.translation: "This lady of golden complexion is Rama's beloved queen who does not disappear from his mind, although away.
15_32.word_by_word: कनकवर्णाङ्गी with a golden complexion, इयम् this lady, रामस्य Rama's, प्रिया beloved, महिषी queen, सती wife, या she, प्रणष्टापि even though lost (whereabouts not known till then), अस्य his, मनस: in the mind, न प्रणश्यति does not disappear.

15_33.shloka: इयं सा यत्कृते रामश्चतुर्भिः परितप्यते।कारुण्येनानृशंस्येन शोकेन मदनेन च।।5.15.49।।स्त्री प्रणष्टेति कारुण्यादाश्रितेत्यानृशंस्यतः।पत्नी नष्टेति शोकेन प्रियेति मदनेन च।।5.15.50।।
15_33.translation: "She is that same lady for whom Rama has been passing through compassion, benevolence, grief and passion. He is compassionate considering her a woman, kind and benevolent since she is his dependent, stricken with grief for losing a wife and passionate since she is his beloved.
15_33.word_by_word: यत्कृते for whose sake, रामः Rama, प्रणष्टा lost, स्त्री इति that she is a woman, कारुण्यात् with compassion, आश्रितेति one who sought refuge, अनृशंस्यतः due to gentleness, नष्टा lost, पत्नी इति this is his wife, शोकेन with sorrow, प्रिया इति beloved one, मदनेन with passion, कारुण्येन with compassion, आनृशंस्येन with mercy, शोकेन with sorrow, मदनेन with passion, चतुर्भिः with fourfold concern, परितप्यते he is suffering, सा that one is, इयम् this lady.

15_34.shloka: अस्या देव्या यथा रूपमङ्गप्रत्यङ्गसौष्ठवम्।रामस्य च यथा रूपं तस्येयमसितेक्षणा।।5.15.51।।
15_34.translation: "This blackeyed Sita and her divine,  charming body with perfect limbs are a match for Rama's figure.
15_34.word_by_word: अस्याः her, देव्याः of the devi, रूपम् form, अङ्गप्रत्यङ्गसौष्ठवम् charming body with perfectly symmetrical limbs, यथा as such, च and, तस्य his, रूपम् form, यथा as, इयम् this lady, असितेक्षणा blackeyed .

15_35.shloka: अस्या देव्या मनस्तस्मिंस्तस्य चास्यां प्रतिष्ठितम्।तेनेयं स च धर्मात्मा मुहूर्तमपि जीवति।।5.15.52।।
15_35.translation: "The divine queen's mind is firmly fixed on Rama and his mind, fixed on her. For this reason she and the righteous self (Rama) are able to survive till this moment.
15_35.word_by_word: अस्याः her, देव्याः divine queen's, मनः mind, तस्मिन् in him, तस्य his, अस्यां च in her, प्रतिष्ठितम् firmly fixed, तेन therefore, इयम् this lady, धर्मात्मा the righteous self, स च and he, मुहूर्तमपि for a moment, जीवति alive.

15_36.shloka: दुष्करं कृतवान्रामो हीनो यदनया प्रभुः।धारयत्यात्मनो देहं न शोकेनावसीदति।।5.15.53।।
15_36.translation: "Lord Rama had accomplished a difficult task in sustaining the body this way without allowing it to sink and perish during separation from her.
15_36.word_by_word: प्रभुः lord, रामः Rama, अनया with her, हीनः separated, आत्मनः his, देहम् body, धारयति इति यत् held in this way, शोकेन with grief, न अवसीदति is not perishing, दुष्करम् a task (difficult), कृतवान् accomplished.

15_37.shloka: दुष्करं कुरुते रामो य इमां मत्तकाशिनीम्।सीतां विना महाबाहुर्मुहूर्तमपि जीवति।।5.15.54।।
15_37.translation: "Rama, the strongarmed hero has accomplished a difficult task by surviving even for a moment without this Sita who has intoxicating lustre".
15_37.word_by_word: यः he who, इमाम् such, मत्तकाशिनीम् a lady with intoxicating lustre, सीतां विना without Sita, मुहूर्तमपि even for a while, जीवति survives, महाबाहुः strongarmed, रामः Rama, दुष्करम् difficult, कुरुते is doing.

15_38.shloka: एवं सीतां तदा दृष्ट्वा हृष्टः पवनसम्भवः।जगाम मनसा रामं प्रशशंस च तं प्रभुम्।।5.15.55।।
15_38.translation: On seeing Sita, the son of the Windgod, felt glad at heart and mentally reached Rama the lord of the world. Hanuman was full of praise for Rama.इत्यार्षे  श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये सुन्दरकाण्डे पञ्चदशस्सर्गः।Thus ends the fifteenth sarga in Sundarakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
15_38.word_by_word: पवनसम्भवः son of the Windgod, तदा then, सीताम् Sita, दृष्ट्वा seeing, एवम् that way, हृष्टः was glad, मनसा in mind, रामम् Rama, जगाम reached, तम् him, प्रभुम् lord, प्रशशंस च he praised.

16_1.shloka: [Hanuman's grief over Sita's state.]प्रशस्य तु प्रशस्तव्यां सीतां तां हरिपुङ्गवः।गुणाभिरामं रामं च पुनश्चिन्तापरोऽभवत्।।5.16.1।।
16_1.translation: Hanuman, the bull among monkeys, admired the laudable Sita and the virtuous Rama and once again began to lament.
16_1.word_by_word: हरिपुङ्गवः monkey leader (Hanuman), प्रशस्तव्याम् laudable lady, ताम् her, सीताम् Sita, प्रशस्य admired, गुणाभिरामम् embellished with virtues, रामं च and Rama, पुनः again, चिन्तापरः to lament, अभवत् began.

16_2.shloka: स मुहूर्तमिव ध्यात्वा बाष्पपर्याकुलेक्षणः।सीतामाश्रित्य तेजस्वी हनूमान्विललाप ह।।5.16.2।।
16_2.translation: Sagacious Hanuman, eyes dimmed with tears, thought for a short while on the plight of Sita and lamented
16_2.word_by_word: तेजस्वी sagacious, सः he, हनुमान् Hanuman, मुहूर्तमिव for a short while, ध्यात्वा after thinking, बाष्पपर्याकुलेक्षणः eyes dimmed with tears, सीताम् Sita, आश्रित्य at the plight of, विललाप ह lamented.

16_3.shloka: मान्या गुरुविनीतस्य लक्ष्मणस्य गुरुप्रिया।यदि सीताऽऽपि दुःखार्ता कालो हि दुरतिक्रमः।।5.16.3।।
16_3.translation: "If Sita, who is worshipped by righteous Lakshmana and loved by Rama is tortured like this, it shows it is difficult to trangress the force of time.
16_3.word_by_word: गुरुविनीतस्य welltrained, लक्ष्मणस्य Lakshmana's, मान्या worshipped, गुरुप्रिया loved by elders, सीतापि Sita too, दुःखार्ता यदि if she is also worried like this, कालः time, दुरतिक्रमः हि  difficult to transgress.

16_4.shloka: रामस्य व्यवसायज्ञा लक्ष्मणस्य च धीमतः।नात्यर्थं क्षुभ्यते देवी गङ्गेव जलदागमे।।5.16.4।।
16_4.translation: "Just as river Ganga is not agitated by the rainbearing clouds, this Sita is not perturbed as she is aware of the prowess of Rama and might of Lakshmana.
16_4.word_by_word: रामस्य Rama's, धीमतः prowess, लक्ष्मणस्य च and Lakshmana's, व्यवसायज्ञा might, देवी queen, जलदागमे by seeing the clouds, गङ्गेव like Ganga, अत्यर्थम् exceedingly, न क्षुभ्यते is not agitated.

16_5.translation: "Sri Rama matches Vaidehi perfectly in character, age, behaviour, birth and auspicious signs. She is aware that he is the right person for her. Rama deserves Vaidehi and this blackeyed lady deserves him."
16_5.word_by_word: तुल्यशीलवयोवृत्ताम् perfect match in character, age and behaviour, तुल्याभिजनलक्षणाम् perfect match in in birth and auspicious marks, वैदेहीम् with Vaidehi, राघवः Raghva, अर्हति a right person, इयम् this lady, असितेक्षणा blackeyed one, तम् him, अर्हति deserves.

16_6.shloka: तां दृष्ट्वा नवहेमाभां लोककान्तामिव श्रियम्।जगाम मनसा रामं वचनं चेदमब्रवीत्।।5.16.6।।
16_6.translation: On seeing her glowing like fresh gold resembling goddess Lakshmi who is dear to theentire world, and thinking of Rama, Hanuman said:
16_6.word_by_word: नवहेमाभाम् a lady shining like the fresh gold, श्रियमिव glory, लोककान्ताम् dear to the whole world, ताम् her, दृष्ट्वा on seeing, मनसा mentally, रामम् Rama, जगाम he reached, इदम् thise, वचनं च words, अब्रवीत् said.

16_7.shloka: अस्या हेतोर्विशालाक्ष्या हतो वाली महाबलः।रावणप्रतिमो वीर्ये कबन्धश्च निपातितः।।5.16.7।।
