26_10.word_by_word: निशाचरम् nightranger, विगर्हितम् vile, रावणम् Ravana, अहम् I, सव्येन with the left, चरेणेन अपि even with feet, न स्पृशेयम् will not touch, किं what, पुनः again, काममेयं can I love him.

26_11.shloka: प्रत्याख्यातं न जानाति नात्मानं नात्मनः कुलम्।यो नृशंसस्वभावेन मां प्रार्थयितुमिच्छति।।5.26.11।।
26_11.translation: 'As Ravana has no heart, he pleads to gain me. He is aware of neither his own self nor his family.
26_11.word_by_word: यः he who, नृशंसस्वभावेन due to cruel nature, माम् me, प्रार्थयितुम् for pleading, इच्छति hopes, आत्मानम् his own, प्रत्याख्यातम् loss of fame, न जानाति is not aware, आत्मनः of himself, कुलम् family, न not.

26_12.shloka: छिन्ना भिन्ना विभक्ता वा दीप्तेवाग्नौ प्रदीपिता।रावणं नोपतिष्ठेयं किं प्रलापेन वश्चिरम्।।5.26.12।।
26_12.translation: "Even if I am cut, broken to pieces or burnt in glowing fire, I will not accept Ravana. Why do you shout for so long?
26_12.word_by_word: छिन्ना वा whether cut, भिन्ना broken into pieces, दीप्ते as if burnt, अग्नौ by fire, प्रदीपिता वा or burnt by others, रावणम् Ravana, नोपतिष्ठेयम् I will not accept, चिरम् for long, विभक्ता: or else share, प्रलापेन by empty words, किम् what is the use.

26_13.shloka: ख्यातः प्राज्ञः कृतज्ञश्च सानुक्रोशश्च राघवः।सद्वृत्तो निरनुक्रोशश्शङ्के मद्भाग्यसङ्क्षयात्।।5.26.13।।
26_13.translation: "Rama is renowned, wise, grateful and kindly. It is due to my misfortune that he has turned pitiless to me. There is no doubt.
26_13.word_by_word: राघवः Rama, ख्यातः renowned, प्राज्ञःwise, कृतज्ञ grateful, सानुक्रोशश्च a kind hearted one,सद्वृत्तः well behaved, मद्भाग्यसङ्क्षयात् due to my misfortune, निरनुक्रोशः turned pitiless, शङ्के I doubt.

26_14.shloka: राक्षसानां सहस्राणि जनस्थाने चतुर्दश।येनैकेन निरस्तानि स मां किं नाभिपद्यते।।5.26.14।।
26_14.translation: "He who destroyed fourteen thousand demons singlehanded has not come to protect me. I do not know why.
26_14.word_by_word: एकेन by single one, येन by whom, जनस्थाने at Jansthana, राक्षसानाम् of demons, चतुर्दश fourteen, सहस्राणि thousand, निरस्तानि destroyed, सः he, माम् my, किम् why, नाभिपद्यते not protect me.

26_15.shloka: निरुद्धा रावणेनाहमल्पवीर्येण रक्षसा।समर्थः खलु मे भर्ता रावणं हन्तुमाहवे।।5.26.15।।
26_15.translation: "Rama, my husband, for sure, is capable of killing in battle this Ravana who has held me captive and who is a demon of inferior valour.
26_15.word_by_word: अहम् I, अल्पवीर्येण of inferior valour, रक्षसा by the demon, रावणेन by Ravana, निरुद्धा I am held captive, मे भर्ता my husband, आहवे in battle, रावणम् Ravana, हन्तुम् killing, समर्थः खलु is surely capable.

26_16.shloka: विराधो दण्डकारण्ये येन राक्षसपुङ्गवः।रणे रामेण निहतस्स मां किं नाभिपद्यते।।5.26.16।।
26_16.translation: "Why is Rama who killed Viradha, a bull among demons, in Dandaka forest in the fight not coming to rescue me?
26_16.word_by_word: येन by whom, रामेण by Rama, दण्डकारण्ये in Dandaka forest, रणे in fight, राक्षसपुङ्गवः a bull among demons, विराध: Viradha, निहतः killed, सः that Rama, माम् me, किम् why, नाभिपद्यते not protecting me.

26_17.shloka: कामं मध्ये समुद्रस्य लङ्केयं दुष्प्रधर्षणा।न तु राघवबाणानां गतिरोधो भविष्यति ।।5.26.17।।
26_17.translation: "This Lanka in the middle of the ocean is unassailable. But there is nothing which can resist the arrows of Rama.
26_17.word_by_word: समुद्रस्य ocean's, मध्ये in the middle, इयम् this, लङ्का Lanka, दुष्प्रधर्षणा unassailable, तु but, राघवबाणानाम् by the arrow of Rama, गतिरोध: resist, न भविष्यति will not be.

26_18.shloka: किन्नु तत्कारणं येन रामो दृढपराक्रमः।रक्षसापहृतां भार्यामिष्टां नाभ्यवपद्यते।।5.26.18।।
26_18.translation: "What may be the reason that my loving husband, Rama who is highly powerful has not reached this place to which I was abducted by the demon.
26_18.word_by_word: तत् such, कारणम् reason, किं नु what can be, येन by which, दृढपराक्रमः highly powerful, रामः Rama, रक्षसा by the demon, अपहृताम् abducted, इष्टाम् dear, भार्याम् wife, नाभ्यवपद्यते not reach.

26_19.shloka: इहस्थां मां न जानीते शङ्के लक्ष्मणपूर्वजः।जानन्नपि हि तेजस्वी धर्षणं मर्षयिष्यति।।5.26.19।।
26_19.translation: "The elder brother of Lakshamana does not know that I am here. Or, I'm afraid, the glorious Rama knows and yet tolerates such an outrageous act.
26_19.word_by_word: लक्ष्मणपूर्वजः elder brother of Lakshmana, माम् me, इहस्थाम् that I am here, न जानीते he does not know, शङ्के I doubt, जानन्नपि even if he had known, तेजस्वी glorious, धर्षणम् such an outrageous act, मर्षयिष्यति he is tolerating.

26_20.shloka: हृतेति योऽधिगत्वा मां राघवाय निवेदयेत्।गृध्रराजोऽपि स रणे रावणेन निपातितः।।5.26.20।।
26_20.translation: "Even the king of vultures knows I was borne away. He could have informed Rama. But he has also been thrashed down on the earth by Ravana in the fight.
26_20.word_by_word: यः he who, अधिगत्वा after knowing, हृतेति  is borne away, राघवाय to Raghava, निवेदयेत् inform, सः he, गृध्रराजोऽपि even the king of vultures, रावणेन by Ravana, रणे in fight, निपातितः is thrashed down.

26_21.shloka: कृतं कर्म महत्तेन मां तथाऽभ्यवपद्यता।तिष्ठता रावणद्वन्द्वे वृद्धेनापि जटायुषा।।5.26.21।।
26_21.translation: "Though old, Jatayu did a great help to me by resisting Ravana in the duel and advancing (to confront him.).
26_21.word_by_word: माम् me, तथा then, अभ्यवपद्यता by advancing,  वृद्धेनापि  even being old, रावणद्वन्द्वे in the duel with Ravana, तिष्ठता stood, तेन जटायुषा by that Jatayu, महत् great, कर्म help, कृतम् did.

26_22.shloka: यदि मामिह जानीयाद्वर्तमानां स राघवः।अद्य बाणैरभिक्रुद्धः कुर्याल्लोकमराक्षसम्।।5.26.22।।
26_22.translation: "Had only Raghava known that I was here he would have freed this world of demons with his anger.
26_22.word_by_word: सः he, राघवः Raghava, माम् me, इह here, वर्तमानाम् being here, जानीयाद्यदि if he knew, अभिक्रुद्धः angry, लोकम् this world, बाणैः with arrows, अद्य now, अराक्षसम् free of demons, कुर्यात् he would have made.

26_23.shloka: विधमेच्च पुरीं लङ्कां शोषयेच्च महोदधिम्।रावणस्य च नीचस्य कीर्तिं नाम च नाशयेत्।।5.26.23।।
26_23.translation: "Had Rama known that I am in Lanka he would have blown up this city, dried up the ocean and destroyed the name and fame of the mean Ravana.
26_23.word_by_word: लङ्कां पुरीम् city of Lanka, विधमेच्च he will blow away, महोदधिम् this great ocean, शोषयेच्च will drain it dry, नीचस्य of the mean fellow, रावणस्य Ravana's, कीर्तिम् fame, नाम च and name, नाशयेत् he would have destroyed.

26_24.shloka: ततो निहतनाथानां राक्षसीनां गृहे गृहे।यथाहमेवं रुदती तथा भूयो न संशयः।।5.26.24।।
26_24.translation: "Like me weeping, the cry of ogresses with lost husbands will be heard in every house in Lanka. There is no doubt.
26_24.word_by_word: ततः then, अहम् I, यथा like the way, एवम् in that way, रुदती while crying, तथा similarly, गृहे गृहे in every home, निहतनाथानाम् of those women who lost husbands, राक्षसीनाम् of the ogresses, भूयः again, संशयः no doubt.

26_25.shloka: अन्विष्य रक्षसां लङ्कां कुर्याद्रामस्सलक्ष्मणः।न हि ताभ्यां रिपुर्दृष्टो मुहूर्तमपि जीवति।।5.26.25।।
26_25.translation: "If only Lakshmana and Rama in their quest for Lanka reach here, it is  not possible within their sight for the enemy to survive  even a moment.
26_25.word_by_word: सलक्ष्मणः accompanied by Lakshmana, रामः Rama, रक्षसाम् of the demons, लङ्काम् Lanka, अन्विष्य after searching, कुर्यात् will do, ताभ्याम् by both of them, दृष्टः sight, रिपुः enemy, मुहूर्तमपि even for a moment, न जीवति हि will not be alive.

26_26.shloka: चिताधूमाकुलपथा गृध्रमण्डलसङ्कुला।अचिरेण तु लङ्केयं श्मशानसदृशी भवेत्।।5.26.26।।
26_26.translation: "Very soon this Lanka will be enveloped with smoke from funeral pyres and thronged with flocks of vultures moving in circles. It will be like a burial ground.
26_26.word_by_word: इयम् this, लङ्का Lanka, अचिरेण without delay, चिताधूमकुलपथा with its atreets enveloped with smoke from funeral pyres, गृध्रमण्डलसङ्कुला thronged with flocks of vultures, श्मशानसदृशी like the burial ground, भवेत् will be.

26_27.shloka: अचिरेणैव कालेन प्राप्स्याम्येव मनोरथम्।दुष्प्रस्थानोऽयामाख्याति सर्वेषां वो विपर्ययम्।।5.26.27।।
26_27.translation: "Your bad behaviour forebodes illluck for you.I shall have my desire fulfilled in a short time.
26_27.word_by_word: अचिरेण कालेनैव in a short time, मनोरथम् my desire, प्राप्स्याम्येव I will gain, अयम् this, दुष्प्रस्थानः behaving badly, सर्वेषाम् of all of you, वः you people, विपर्ययम् a reversal of fate, आख्याति  indicates

26_28.shloka: यादृशानीह दृश्यन्ते लङ्कायामशुभानि वै।अचिरेणैव कालेन भविष्यति हतप्रभा।।5.26.28।।
26_28.translation: "Inauspicious signs are seen here in Lanka. In a short time this city will lose its splendour.
26_28.word_by_word: इह here, लङ्कायाम् at Lanka, यादृशानि such, अशुभानि inauspicious signs, दृश्यन्ते are seen, अचिरेणैव कालेन in a short while, हतप्रभा lose its splendour, भविष्यति will be.

26_29.shloka: नूनं लङ्का हते पापे रावणे राक्षसाधमे।शोषं यास्यति दुर्धर्षा प्रमदा विधवा यथा।।5.26.29।।
26_29.translation: "Surely this impregnable Lanka will wither up (lose its splendour) and appear like a widow when this sinful Ravana, a mean demon is killed.
26_29.word_by_word: पापे when the sinner, राक्षसाधमे mean demons, रावणे when Ravana, हते is killed, दुर्धर्षा impregnable, लङ्का Lanka, नूनम् surely, विधवा widow, प्रमदा यथा like a woman, शोषम्wither up, यास्यति truly.

26_30.shloka: पुण्योत्सवसमुत्था च नष्टभर्त्री सराक्षसी।भविष्यति पुरी लङ्का नष्टभर्त्री यथाङ्गना।।5.26.30।।
26_30.translation: "This city of Lanka with many auspicious celebrations will lose its king and all mean ogresses will remain like widows.
26_30.word_by_word: नष्टभर्त्री with the death of the king, लङ्कापुरी the city of Lanka, सराक्षसी along with the ogresses, नष्टभर्त्री with the death of her lord, अङ्गना यथा like a women, पुण्योत्सवसमुत्था च with several auspicious celebrations, भविष्यति will remain.

26_31.shloka: नूनं राक्षसकन्यानां रुदन्तीनां गृहे गृहे।श्रोष्यामि नचिरादेव दुःखार्तानामिह ध्वनिम्।।5.26.31।।
26_31.translation: "I shall surely hear very soon sounds of distressful cry of young ogresses in every household.
26_31.word_by_word: नचिरादेव very soon, इह here, गृहे गृहे at every house, दुःखार्तानाम् distressful cry of women, रुदन्तीनाम् crying, राक्षरकन्यानाम् young ogresses, ध्वनिम् sound, नूनम् surely, श्रोष्यामि I will hear.

26_32.shloka: सान्थकारा हतद्योता हतराक्षसपुङ्गवा।भविष्यति पुरी लङ्का निर्दग्धा रामसायकैः।।5.26.32।।
26_32.translation: "Totally burnt by Rama's arrows, this Lanka will be filled with darkness, and its splendour lost and preeminent demons destroyed.
26_32.word_by_word: लङ्कापुरी the state of Lanka, रामसायकैः with Rama's arrows, निर्दग्धा burnt totally, सान्धकारा  filled with darkness, हतद्योता lost splendour, हतराक्षसपुङ्गवा with powerful demons killed, भविष्यति will be

26_33.shloka: यदि नाम स शूरो मां रामो रक्तान्तलोचनः।जानीयाद्वर्तमानां हि रावणस्य निवेशने।।5.26.33।।अनेन तु नृशंसेन रावणेनाधमेन मे।समयो यस्तु निर्दिष्टस्तस्य कालोऽयमागतः।।5.26.34।।स च मे विहितो मृत्युरस्मिन् दुष्टे न वर्तते।
26_33.translation: "If the heroic Rama of bloodshot eyes comes to know that I am here at Ravana's, the expiry of time limit fixed by this cruel, lowly, foolish Ravana has arrived, this wicked fellow's death is inevitable.
26_33.word_by_word: शूरः heroic, रक्तान्तलोचनः with bloodshot eyes, सः रामः that Rama, माम् me, रावणस्य Ravana's, निवेशने at home, वर्तमानाम् present, यदि that, नाम जानीयात् knows I am here.  नृशंसेन by the cruel one, अधमेन by the lowly person, अनेन by this one, रावणेन by Ravana, यः whichever, समयः time limit, मे to me, निर्दिष्टः is fixed, तस्य its, अयम् this, कालः time, आगतः has arrived, मे to me, विहितः fixed, सः that, मृत्युः death, अस्मिन् in him, दुष्टेन by this wicked fellow, वर्तते is fixed.

26_34.shloka: अकार्यं ये न जानन्ति नैर्ऋताः पापकारिणः।।5.26.35।।अधर्मात्तु महोत्पातो भविष्यति हि सांप्रतम्।नैते धर्मं विजानन्ति राक्षसाः पिशिताशनाः।।5.26.36।।
26_34.translation: Nothing is forbidden for sinful demons. A calamity will befall now due to this adharma. The flesheating ogres are aware of neither dharma nor adharma.
26_34.word_by_word: पापकारिणः sinners, ये those, नैर्ऋताः demons, अकार्यम् a forbidden act, न जानन्ति they know not अधर्मात्तु due to adharma, सांप्रतम् presently, महोत्पातः calamity, भविष्यति will befall, पिशिताशनाः flesheating, एते these, राक्षसाः demons, धर्मम् dharma,न जानन्ति they are not aware.

26_35.shloka: ध्रुवं मां प्रातराशार्थे राक्षसः कल्पयिष्यति।साहं कथं करिष्यामि तं विना प्रियदर्शनम्।।5.26.37।।रामं रक्तान्तनयनमपश्यन्ती सुदुःखिता।
26_35.translation: "This demon is determined to make me his morning meal. How can I do anything in the absence of my lord of pleasing countenance. I am distressed very much by not seeing Rama, possessed of eyes with a reddish tinge in the corners.
26_35.word_by_word: राक्षसः ogre, ध्रुवम् determined, माम् me, प्रातराशार्थे for morning meal, कल्पयिष्यति will make it, सा such, अहम् I, प्रियदर्शनम्  who has pleasing countenance, तं विना without him, कथम् how, करिष्यामि I will  do, रक्तान्तनयनम् one whose eyes have a reddish tinge in the corners, रामम् Rama, अपश्यन्ती without seeing, सुदुःखिता  distressed very much.

26_36.shloka: यदि कश्चित् प्रदाता मे विषस्याद्य भवेदिह।।5.27.38।।क्षिप्रं वैवस्वतं देवं पश्येयं पतिना विना।
26_36.translation: "If I can find some one who can give me poison now I shall soon see the lord of death without my lord.
26_36.word_by_word: अद्य now, मे to me, विषस्य of poison, प्रदाता donor, कश्चित् some one, इह here, भवेद्यदि can give, पतिना  husband विना devoid, क्षिप्रम् soon, देवम् divine, वैवस्वतम् lord of death, पश्येयम् I will see.

26_37.shloka: नाजानाज्जीवतीं रामस्स मां लक्ष्मणपूर्वजः।।5.26.39।।जानन्तौ तौ न कुर्यातां नोर्य्वां हि मम मार्गणम्।
26_37.translation: "Neither Lakshmana nor his elder brother knows that I am here alive. (Had they known) both of them would have ransacked this earth.
26_37.word_by_word: लक्ष्मणपूर्वजः elder brother of Lakshmana, सः रामः that Rama, माम् me, जीवतीम् living, नाजानात् he is not aware तौ both of them, जानन्तौ if they had known, मम my, मार्गणम् search, उर्व्याम् on earth, न कुर्याताम् इति न not undertake.

26_38.shloka: नूनं ममैव शोकेन स वीरो लक्ष्मणाग्रजः।।5.26.40।।देवलोकमितो यातस्त्यक्त्वा देहं महीतले।
26_38.translation: "Would it be that the heroic elder brother of Lakshmana has gone to the abode of gods unable to find me on this earth?
26_38.word_by_word: वीरः heroic one, लक्ष्मणाग्रजःLakshmna's elder brother, सः he, मम my, शोकेनैव suffering, महीतले on this earth, देहम् body, त्यक्त्वा  giving up, इतः from here, देवलोकम् to the abode of gods, यातः gone, नूनम् surely.

26_39.shloka: धन्या देवास्सगन्धर्वाः सिद्धाश्च परमर्षयः।।5.26.41।।मम पश्यन्ति ये नाथं रामं राजीवलोचनम्।
26_39.translation: "Blessed are the gods, gandharvas, and siddhas and great sages who are able to see my lotuseyed lord Rama.
26_39.word_by_word: मम my, नाथम् husband, राजीवलोचनम् with eyes like lotus petals, रामम् Rama, ये those, पश्यन्ति will see, देवाः gods, सगन्धर्वाः along with gandharvas, सिद्धाश्च siddhas, परमर्षयः great sages, धन्याः blessed ones.

26_40.shloka: अथवा न हि तस्यार्थो धर्मकामस्य धीमतः।।5.26.42।।मया रामस्य राजर्षेर्भार्यया परमात्मनः।
26_40.translation: Or that royal sage, wise Rama who always seeks dharma having become one with the supreme spirit has no longer any interest in me?
26_40.word_by_word: अथवा or else, धर्मकामस्य one who is ever seeking dharma, धीमतः wise, राजर्षेः royal sage, परमात्मनः the supreme self, तस्य his, रामस्य Rama's, भार्यया by wife, मया by me, अर्थः interest, न हि dispassion.

26_41.shloka: दृश्यमाने भवेत्प्रीति स्सौहृदं नास्त्यपश्यतः।।5.26.43।।नाशयन्ति कृतघ्नास्तु न रामो नाशयिष्यति।
26_41.translation: "Love attaches itself to one who remains before one's eyes.Friendship fades with separation. The ungrateful destroy love and friendship (as their love is conditioned by frequent meetings). But it cannot happen in case of Rama.
26_41.word_by_word: दृश्यमाने remains before seeing, प्रीतिः love, भवेत् will be, अपश्यतः not see, सौहृदम् friendship, नास्ति does not last, कृतघ्नाः ungrateful one, नाशयन्ति will be destroyed, रामस्तु Rama too, न नाशयिष्यति will not persih.

26_42.shloka: किं नु मे न गुणाः केचित्किं वा भाग्यक्षयो मम।।5.26.44।।                                                                                                       याहं सीदामि रामेण हीना मुख्येन भामिनी।
26_42.translation: "Do I, a charming lady, not have any good fortune because of my past deeds? I wonder how a foremost woman like me seperated from my husband is sinking in grief without Rama. Has my fortune diminished?
26_42.word_by_word: भामिनी charming lady, या whoever, अहम् I, मुख्येन foremost, रामेण विना without Rama, सीदामि  sinking, मे for me, केचित्  some, गुणाः qualities, न किं नु are they not found, किं वा or else, मम my, भाग्यक्षयः fortune is diminished.

26_43.translation: Instead of living separated from noble and brave Rama, a blemishless character and a destroyer of enemies, it is better for me to die.
26_43.word_by_word: अक्लिष्टचारित्रात् of blemishless character, शूरात् from the brave, शत्रुनिबर्हणात् who can destroy his enemy, महात्मनः great self, रामात् from Rama, विहीनायाः seperated, मे me, जीवितात् with life, मर्तुम् to die, श्रेयः it is better for me.

26_44.shloka: अथवा न्यस्तशत्रौ तौ वने मूलफलाशिनौ।।5.26.46।।भ्रातरौ हि नरश्रेष्ठौ संवृत्तौ वनगोचरौ।
26_44.translation: "May be both the brothers, foremost among men, have laid down their arms, and taken to asceticism, subsisting on roots and fruits.
26_44.word_by_word: अथवा or else, नरश्रेष्ठौ both foremost among men, तौ both, भ्रातरौ brothers, न्यतशत्रौ laid down their arms, वने in the forest, मूलफलाशनौ eating roots and fruits, वनगोचरौ roaming in the forest as ascetics, संवृत्तौ become.

26_45.shloka: अथवा राक्षसेन्द्रेण रावणेन दुरात्मना।।5.26.47।।छद्मना घातितौ शूरौ भ्रातरौ रामलक्ष्मणौ।
26_45.translation: "Or else, has this wicked demon king slain both the brothers Rama and Lakshmana by some deceptive means?
26_45.word_by_word: अथवा or else, शूरौ two heroes, भ्रातरौ both brothers, रामलक्ष्मणौ Rama and Lakshmana, दुरात्मना by the wicked one, राक्षसेन्द्रेण by the demon king, रावणेन by Ravana, छद्मना by some clever deceptive means, घातितौ are slain.

26_46.shloka: साऽहमेवङ्गते काले मर्तुमिच्छामि सर्वथा।।5.26.48।।न च मे विहितो मृत्युरस्मिन् दुःखेऽपि वर्तते।
26_46.translation: "By all means I wish to die in these circumstances. However, death is not ordained for me even in this sorrowful state.
26_46.word_by_word: एवङ्गते in the circumstances, काले  at this time, सा such, अहम् I, सर्वथा by all means, मर्तुम् to die, इच्छामि I wish, अस्मिन् in this, दुःखेऽपि in sorrwful state, मे to me, मृत्युः death, विहितः ordained, न वर्तते does not exist.

26_47.shloka: धन्याः खलु महात्मानो मुनयस्त्यक्तकिल्बिषाः।।5.26.49।।जितात्मनो महाभागा येषां न स्तः प्रियाप्रिये।
26_47.translation: Blessed are the exhalted sages who have not committed any sin. They have self control and have subdued their senses. There is no pleasure or displeasure for them.
26_47.word_by_word: महात्मानः great men, त्यक्तकिल्बिषाः who have given up all sins, जितात्मानः those who have selfcontrol, महाभागाः exhalted ones, मुनयः sages, धन्याः खलु are surely blessed, येषाम् for whom, प्रियाप्रिये pleasure or displeasure, न स्तः none.

26_48.shloka: प्रियान्न संभवेद्दुःखमप्रियादधिकं भयम्।।5.26.50।।ताभ्यां हि ये वियुज्यन्ते नमस्तेषां महात्मनाम्।
26_48.translation: "Salutations to those exalted souls who have distanced themselves from pleasure and displeasure. Pleasures may not lead to suffering or displeasure to excessive, meaningless fear for such great souls.
26_48.word_by_word: प्रियात् from a pleasing act, दुःखम् sorrow, अप्रियात् from an unpleasant act, अधिकम् excessive, भयम् fear, न संभवेत् may not result, ये those, ताभ्याम् from both of them, वियुज्यन्ते those who have distanced themselves, तेषाम् for them, महात्मानाम् of the great sages, नमः salutations to them.

26_49.shloka: साहं त्यक्ता प्रियार्हेण रामेण विदितात्मना।।5.26.51।।प्राणांस्त्यक्ष्यामि पापस्य रावणस्य गता वशम्।
26_49.translation: "Separated from the wise Rama who deserves pleasant things I will give up life being under the clutches of the sinful Ravana.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये सुन्दरकाण्डे षडिवंश स्सर्गः।Thus ends the twentysixth sarga of Sundarakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
26_49.word_by_word: प्रियेणैव who deserves pleasant things, विदितात्मना by the knower of the self, रामेण by Rama, त्यक्ता separated, पापस्य sinner's, रावणस्य Ravana's, वशम् clutches, गता reached, सा अहम् that I am, प्राणान् life, त्यक्ष्यामि I will give up.

27_1.shloka: [Trijata narrates her dream]इत्युक्तास्सीतया घोरं राक्षस्यः क्रोधमूर्छिताः।काश्चिज्जग्मुस्तदाख्यातुं रावणस्य तरस्विनः।।5.27.1।।
27_1.translation: Hearing Sita's words, some terrifying demonesses, overwhelmed with anger, went to inform Ravana, who was quick to act.
27_1.word_by_word: सीतया by Sita, इति thus, उक्ताः spoken, राक्षस्यः rakshasis, घोरम् of terrible, क्रोधमूर्छिताः overwhelmed with anger, काश्चित् some, तत् that, तरस्विनः of the swift, रावणस्य to Ravana, आख्यातुम् to inform, जग्मुः went

27_2.translation: The dreadfullooking demonesses once again approached Sita and conveyed her categorically in harsh words the terrible consequences (ahead)
27_2.word_by_word: ततः then, घोरदर्शनाः dreadfullooking, राक्षस्यः demonesses, सीताम् Sita, उपागम्य having reached, अथ and, पुनः once again, अनर्थार्थम् a word leading to terrible consequences, एकार्थम् conveying one meaning, परुषम् harshly, अब्रुवन् spoke.

27_3.shloka: अद्येदानीं तवानार्ये सीते पापविनिश्चये।राक्षस्यो भक्षयिष्यन्ति मांसमेतद्यथासुखम्।।5.27.3।।
27_3.translation: "O vile one you are determined in your evil ways. Today these shedemons will eat away your flesh to their heart's content ".
27_3.word_by_word: अनार्ये vile one, पापविनिश्चये O woman determined in evil ways, सीते O Sita, अद्य today, इदानीम् these, तव your, एतत मांसम् your flesh, राक्षस्यः rakshasa women, यथासुखम् heart's content, भक्षयिष्यन्ति will eat.

27_4.shloka: सीतां ताभिरनार्याभिर्दृष्टवा सन्तर्जितां तदा।राक्षसी त्रिजटा वृद्धा शयाना वाक्यमब्रवीत्।।5.27.4।।
27_4.translation: Then seeing the ignoble shedemons threatening Sita, an old demoness called Trijata, who was lying down there, said:
27_4.word_by_word: तदा then, अनार्याभिः by ignoble women, ताभिः by them, सन्तर्जिताम् threatened, सीताम् Sita, दृष्ट्वा after seeing, शयाना while lying down, वृद्धा old, त्रिजटा Trijata, राक्षसी a demoness, वाक्यम् these words, अब्रवीत् said.

27_5.shloka: आत्मानं खादतानार्या न सीतां भक्षयिष्यथ।जनकस्य सुतामिष्टां स्नुषां दशरथस्य च।।5.27.5।।
27_5.translation: "Devour yourselves now, O ignoble ones, if you will. Do not eat Janaka's favourite daughter, the daughterinlaw of Dasaratha.
27_5.word_by_word: अनार्याः O ignoble ones, आत्मानम् yourselves, खादत devour, जनकस्य Janaka's, इष्टाम् favourite, सुताम् daughter, दशरथस्य Dasaratha's, स्नुषां च and daughterinlaw, सीताम् Sita, न भक्षयिष्यथ do not eat.

27_6.shloka: स्वप्नो ह्यद्य मया दृष्टो दारुणो रोमहर्षणः।राक्षसानामभावाय भर्तुरस्या भवाय च।।5.27.6।।
27_6.translation: "Tonight I had a terrific, horriplating nightmare in which I saw the annihilation of all demons and the triumph of Sita's husband".
27_6.word_by_word: अद्य today, दारुणः terrific, रोमहर्षणः horripilating, स्वप्नः dream, राक्षसानाम् all the demons, अभावाय for the destruction, अस्याः her, भर्तुः husband's, भवाय  triumph, मया by myself, दृष्टः was seen.

27_7.shloka: एवमुक्तास्त्रिजटया राक्षस्यः क्रोधमूर्छिताः।सर्वा एवाब्रुवन्भीतास्त्रिजटां तामिदं वचः।।5.27.7।।
27_7.translation: Seized with fear, the shedemons, overcome with wrath on hearing Trijata's words said to her.
27_7.word_by_word: त्रिजटया by Trijata, एवम् that way, उक्ताः having been spoken, क्रोधमूर्छिताः overcome by wrath, राक्षस्यः shedemons, सर्वाः एव all of them, भीताः terrified, ताम् her, त्रिजटाम् to Trijata, इदम् this, वचः word, अब्रुवन् spoke.

27_8.shloka: कथयस्व त्वया दृष्टः स्वप्नोऽयं कीदृशो निशि।तासां श्रुत्वा तु वचनं राक्षसीनां मुखाच्युतम्।।5.27.8।।उवच वचनं काले त्रिजटा स्वप्नसंश्रितम्।
27_8.translation: "O Trijata, tell us the kind of dream you dreamt last night", they insisted. Hearing the words from the mouth of the shedemons, Trijata told them all about her dream.
27_8.word_by_word: निशि night, त्वया by you, दृष्टः seen, अयम् this, स्वप्नः dream, कीदृशः what did you see, कथयस्व tell, तासाम् of them, राक्षसीनाम् of shedemons, मुखात् from their mouth, च्युतम् slipped, वचनम् word, श्रुत्वा after hearing, त्रिजटा Trijata, काले early morning time, स्वप्नसंश्रितम् all about the dream, वचनम् words, उवाच spoke.

27_9.shloka: गजदन्तमयीं दिव्यां शिबिकामन्तरिक्षगाम्।।5.27.9।।युक्तां हंससहस्रेण स्वयमास्थाय राघवः।शुक्लमाल्याम्बरधरो लक्ष्मणेन सहागतः।।5.27.10।।
27_9.translation: "Rama, in white attire, wearing a garland of white flowers, ascending a palanquin made of ivory drawn by a thousand swans and coursing through the sky with Lakshmana arrived.
27_9.word_by_word: राघवः Rama, शुक्लमाल्याम्बरधरः wearing a garland of white flowers and clad in white attire, गजदन्तमयीम् made of ivory, अन्तरिक्षगाम् coursing through the sky, हंससहस्रेण by a thousand swans, युक्ताम् yoked, शिबिकाम् palanquin, स्वयम् himself, आस्थाय havingascended, लक्ष्मणेन सह accompanied by Lakshmana, आगतः arrived.

27_10.shloka: स्वप्ने चाद्य मया दृष्टा सीता शुक्लाम्बरावृता।सागरेण परिक्षिप्तं श्वेतं पर्वतमास्थिता।।5.27.11।।
27_10.translation: "I also saw Sita in my dream wearing white robes and perched on a white mountain surrounded by the ocean.
27_10.word_by_word: सीता च Sita also, शुक्लाम्बरावृता wearing white robes, सागरेण by the ocean, परिक्षिप्तम् surrounded by, श्वेतम् white, पर्वतम् mountain, आस्थिता perched, मया by me, अद्य now, स्वप्ने in the dream, दृष्टा was seen.

27_11.shloka: रामेण सङ्गता सीता भास्करेण प्रभा यथा।राघवश्च मया दृष्टश्चतुर्दष्ट्रं महागजम्।।5.27.12।।आरूढ श्शैलसङ्काशं चचार सहलक्ष्मणः।
27_11.translation: "Just as light is united with the Sun, I saw Sita united with Rama. I saw Rama with Lakshmana riding a huge, mountainlike elephant having four tusks.
27_11.word_by_word: सीता Sita, रामेण with Rama, प्रभा  light, भास्करेण with the Sun, यथा like, सङ्गता united, रामश्च Rama also, चतुर्द्रंष्ट्रम् having four tusks, शैलसङ्काशम् resembling a mountain, महगजम् huge elephant, आरूढः ascended, मया by me, दृष्टः seen, सहलक्ष्मणः along with Lakshmana, चचार went.

27_12.shloka: ततस्तौ नरशार्दूलौ दीप्यमानौ स्वतेजसा।।5.27.13।।शुक्लमाल्याम्बरधरौ जानकीं पर्युपस्थितौ।
27_12.translation: "Dressed in white garlands and clothes, the two brothers, tigers among men, glowing in their effulgence approached Janaki.
27_12.word_by_word: ततः then, स्वतेजसा by their selfeffulgence, दीप्यमानौ glowing, शुक्लमाल्याम्बरधरौ wearing white garlands and clothes, तौ both, नरशार्दूलौ tigers among men, जानकीम् Janaki, पर्युपस्थितौ came near.

27_13.shloka: ततस्तस्य नगस्याग्रे ह्याकाशस्थस्य दन्तिनः।।5.27.14।।भर्त्रा परिगृहीतस्य जानकी स्कन्धमाश्रिता।
27_13.translation: "Then from the front of the mountain Janaki shifted to the back of the elephant held by her husband waiting in the sky.
27_13.word_by_word: ततः then, जानकी Janaki, तस्य of that, नगस्य mountain's, अग्रे front, भर्त्रा by husband, परिगृहीतस्य held, आकाशस्थस्य waiting in the sky, दन्तिनः of the elephant, स्कन्धम् mounted, आश्रिता took seat.

27_14.shloka: भर्तुरङ्कात्समुत्पत्य ततः कमललोचना।।5.27.15।।चन्द्रसूर्यौ मया दृष्टा पाणिना परिमार्जती।
27_14.translation: "Then I saw the lotuseyed Sita springing up from the lap of her husband and playfully caressing the Moon and Sun with her palms.
27_14.word_by_word: ततः then, कमललोचना lotus eyed Sita, भर्तुः husband's, अङ्कात् from his lap, समुत्पत्य springing up, पाणिना with palms, चन्द्रसूर्यौ Moon and Sun, परिमार्जती as she was caressing, मया me, दृष्टा was seen.

27_15.shloka: ततस्ताभ्यां कुमाराभ्यामास्थित: स गजोत्तमः।।5.27.16।।सीतया च विशालाक्ष्या लङ्काया उपरिस्थितः।
27_15.translation: "Then the excellent elephant was seen halted in the city of Lanka with both princes and the largeeyed Sita mounted on the elephant.
27_15.word_by_word: ततः then, ताभ्याम् by both of them, कुमाराभ्याम् by both the princes, विशालाक्ष्या largeeyed, सीतया च by Sita, आस्थितः held, सः he, गजोत्तमः best of elephants, लङ्कायाः Lanka's, उपरिover, स्थितः stood.

27_16.shloka: पाण्डुरर्षभयुक्तेन रथेनाष्टयुजा स्वयम्।।5.27.17।।इहोपयातः काकुत्स्थ स्सीतया सह भार्यया।
27_16.translation: "Rama accompanied by his wife Sita came on a chariot yoked to eight white oxen.
27_16.word_by_word: काकुत्स्थ: Rama, भार्यया accompanied by wife, सीतया सह along with Sita, पाण्डुरर्षभयुक्तेन yoked by white oxen, अष्टयुजा eight of them, रथेन by a chariot, स्वयम् himself, इह here, उपयातः came.

27_17.shloka: लक्ष्मणेन सह भ्रात्रा सीतया सह वीर्यवान्।।5.27.18।।आरुह्य पुष्पकं दिव्यं विमानं सूर्यसन्निभम्।उत्तरां दिशमालोक्य जगाम पुरुषोत्तमः।।5.27.19।।
27_17.translation: "Valiant Rama, foremost among men, accompanied by his brother Lakshmana and wife Sita went towards the northerly direction in the wonderful Pushpaka chariot that resembled the Sun.
27_17.word_by_word: वीर्यवान् valiant, पुरुषोत्तमः foremost of men, भ्रात्रा with his brother, लक्ष्मणेन with Lakshmana, सीतया सह accompanied by Sita, दिव्यम् wonderful, सूर्यसन्निभम् resembling the Sun, पुष्पकं विमानम् Pushpaka chariot, आरुह्य after ascending, उत्तराम् north, दिशम् direction, आलोक्य seeing, जगाम went.

27_18.shloka: एवं स्वप्ने मया दृष्टो रामो विष्णुपराक्रमः।लक्ष्मणेन सह भ्रात्रा सीतया सह राघवः।।5.27.20।।
27_18.translation: "In this way I saw in my dream Rama as valiant as Lord Visnu accompanied by his brother Lakshmana and his wife Sita.
27_18.word_by_word: विष्णुपराक्रमः valiant as Visnu, राघवः Raghava, रामः Rama, भ्रात्रा with his brother, लक्ष्मणेनalso with Lakshmana, सीतया सह accompanied by Sita, स्वप्ने in dream, एवम् in that way, मया by myself, दृष्टः was seen.

27_19.shloka: न हि रामो महातेजाश्शक्यो जेतुं सुरासुरैः।राक्षसैर्वापि चान्यैर्वा स्वर्गः पापजनैरिव।।5.27.21।।
27_19.translation: "Just as a sinner cannot attain heaven Rama cannot be won by gods or demons, even rakshasas and others.
27_19.word_by_word: महातेजाः very brilliant, रामः Rama, सुरासुरैः by gods and demons, राक्षसैर्वापि and even by demons, अन्यैर्वा and others also, स्वर्गः heaven, पापजनैरिव like sinners, जेतुम् to win, न शक्यः not possible.

27_20.shloka: रावणश्च मया दृष्टः क्षितौ तैलसमुक्षितः।रक्तवासाः पिबन्मत्तः करवीरकृतस्रजः।।5.27.22।।
27_20.translation: "I saw the body of Ravana lying on the ground smeared with oil, clad in red, wearing a garland of lilies and intoxicated with drinking.
27_20.word_by_word: रावणश्च Ravana's, क्षितौ on the ground, तैलसमुक्षितः smeared with oil, रक्तवासाः clad in red clothes, करवीरकृतस्रजः wearing a garland of lilies, पिबन् drinking, मत्तः intoxicated, मया I, दृष्टः was seen.

27_21.shloka: विमानात्पुष्पकादद्य रावणः पतितो भुवि।कृष्यमाणः स्त्रिया दृष्टो मुण्डः कृष्णाम्बरः पुनः।।5.27.23।।
27_21.translation: "Tonight I saw (in another dream) Ravana with shaven head, clad in black clothes, fallen down on the ground from the Pushpaka chariot, being dragged by a woman.
27_21.word_by_word: अद्य today, पुष्पकात् विमानात् from the Pushpaka chariot, भुवि on earth, पतितः fallen down, मुण्डः with shaven head, कृष्णाम्बरः clad in black clothes, रावणः Ravana, स्त्रिया by  a woman, कृष्यमाणः being dragged, पुन: again, दृष्टः saw.

27_22.translation: "He was wearing red garlands and unguents, his body smeared with oil. He was drinking, laughing and dancing, his mind and senses perplexed. He was driving on a chariot yoked to donkeys.
27_22.word_by_word: रक्तमाल्यानुलेपनः wearing red garlands and unguents, तैलम् oil, पिबन् drinking, हसन् laughing, नृत्यन् dancing, भ्रान्तचित्ताकुलेन्द्रियः with mind and snses perplexed, खरयुक्तेन yoked to donkeys, रथेन by the chariot.

27_23.shloka: गर्दभेन ययौ शीघ्रं दक्षिणां दिशमास्थितः।पुनरेव मया दृष्टो रावणो राक्षसेश्वरः।।5.27.25।।पतितोऽ वाक्चिरा रा भूमौ गर्दभाद्भयमोहितः।
27_23.translation: "I saw the demon king Ravana running behind the chariot driven by donkeys in the southerly direction. He was falling with his head bent down and deluded by the fear of the donkey.
27_23.word_by_word: दक्षिणां दिशम् towards southerly direction, आस्थितः started, गर्दभेन after donkey, शीघ्रम् swiftly, ययौ went, राक्षसेश्वरः demon king, रावणः Ravana, भयमोहितः deluded by fear, गर्दभात् of  the donkey, अवाक्चिरा: head bent down, पतितः fallen, मया by me, पुनरेव also, दृष्टः saw.

27_24.shloka: सहसोत्थाय संभ्रान्तो भयार्तो मदविह्वलः।।5.27.26।।उन्मत्त इव दिग्वासा दुर्वाक्यं प्रलपन्बहु।दुर्गन्धं दुस्सहं घोरं तिमिरं नरकोपमम्।।5.27.27।।मलपङ्कं प्रविश्याशु मग्नस्तत्र स रावणः।
27_24.translation: "I saw Ravana, getting up quickly, in a bewildered state, terrorstricken, totally confused in intoxication. He had gone almost insane, naked uttering words of abuse. Plunged into a pool of filth and emitting foul smell he disappeared into a helllike dark chamber.
27_24.word_by_word: स रावणः that Ravana, सहसा quickly, उत्थाय got up, संभ्रान्तः bewildered, भयार्तः terrorstricken, मदविह्वलः intoxicated with wine, दिग्वासाः naked (with sky as garment), उन्मत्त: mad, इव like, बहु many, दुर्वाक्यम् bad words, प्रलपन् uttering, दुर्गन्धम् emitting foul smell, दुस्सहम् words of abuse, घोरम् terrific, तिमिरम् dark,नरकोपमम् helllike, मलपङ्कम् pool of filth, प्रविश्य having disappeared, आशु he was, तत्र there, मग्नः drowned.

27_25.shloka: कण्ठे बद्ध्वा दशग्रीवं प्रमदा रक्तवासिनी।।5.27.28।।काली कर्दमलिप्ताङ्गी दिशं याम्यां प्रकर्षति।
27_25.translation: A dark woman clad in red, body smeared with wet mud was seen dragging the ten-necked Ravana by his neck towards the abode of Yama in the southerly direction.
27_25.word_by_word: रक्तवासिनी a woman clad in red clothes, काली a dark one, कर्दमलिप्ताङ्गी a woman smeared with wet mud, प्रमदा woman, दशग्रीवम् tennecked Ravana, कण्ठे neck, बद्ध्वा having bound, याम्यां दिशम् towards the abode of Yama in the southerly direction, प्रकर्षति was dragging.

27_26.shloka: एवं तत्र मया दृष्टः कुम्भकर्णो निशाचरः।।5.27.29।।रावणस्य सुतास्सर्वे दृष्टास्तैलसमुक्षिताः।
27_26.translation: "There I saw the nightranger, Kumbhakarna and also Ravana's sons, their bodies smeared with oil.
27_26.word_by_word: तत्र there, निशाचरः nightranger, कुम्भकर्णः Kumbhakarna, मया by me, एवम् in this way, दृष्टः was seen, रावणस्य Ravana's, सुताः sons, सर्वे all, तैलसमुक्षिताः body smeared with oil, दृष्टाः was seen.

27_27.shloka: वराहेण दशग्रीवश्शिंशुमारेण चेन्द्रजित्।।5.27.30।।उष्ट्रेण कुम्भकर्णश्च प्रयाता दक्षिणां दिशम्।
27_27.translation: "The tennecked Ravana was seen (this time) riding on a boar, Indrajit on a crocodile and Kumbhakarna on a camel all set towards the southerly direction.
27_27.word_by_word: दशग्रीवः tennecked one, वराहेण by boar, इन्द्रजित् Indrajit, श्शिंशुमारेण च crocodile, कुम्भकर्ण Kumbhakarna, उष्ट्रेण च on a camel, दक्षिणां दिशम् towards the southern direction, प्रयाताः were travelling.

27_28.shloka: एकस्तत्र मया दृष्टः श्वेतच्छत्रो विभीषणः।।5.27.31।।शुक्लमाल्याम्बरधरः शुक्लगन्धानुलेपनः।
27_28.translation: "Only Vibhishana was under a white umbrella clad in white, with white garlands and white sandal paste.
27_28.word_by_word: तत्र there, एकः only one, विभीषणः Vibhishana, श्वेतच्छत्रः with white umbrella, शुक्लमाल्याम्बरधरः wearing white garlands and clothes, शुक्लगन्धानुलेपनः with white sandal paste, मया by me, दृष्टः was seen.

27_29.shloka: शङ्खदुन्धुभिनिर्घोषैर्नृत्तगीतैरलङ्कृतः।।5.27.32।।आरुह्य शैलसङ्काशं मेघस्तनितनिस्स्वनम्।चतुर्दन्तं गजं दिव्यमास्ते तत्र विभीषणः।।5.27.33।।चतुर्भिस्सचिवैः सार्थं वैहायसमुपस्थितः।
27_29.translation: "(Hailed by) the sounds of conches and drums, and of musicians and dancers, Vibhishana was seen ascending on to a decorated fourtust elephant which was huge like a mountain and trumpting like a thundering cloud. He stood there along with four ministers and reached the aerial region.
27_29.word_by_word: विभीषणः Vibhishana, शङ्खदुन्दुभिनिर्घोषैः with sounds of conches and drums, नृत्तगीतैः by  dancers and musicians, अलङ्कृतः decorated, शैलसङ्काशम् like the mountain, मेघस्तनितनिस्स्वनम् trumpetting like a thundering cloud, चतुर्दन्तम् of four tusks, दिव्यम् wonderful, गजम् elephant, आरुह्य on ascending, तत्र there, आस्ते stood there, चतुर्भिः four,सचिवैः सार्थम् with ministers, वैहायसम् in the air, उपस्थितः reached.

27_30.shloka: समाजश्च मया दृष्टो गीतवादित्रनिःस्वनः।।5.27.34।।पिबतां रक्तमाल्यानां रक्षसां रक्तवाससाम्।
27_30.translation: " A large group of demons was seen collected together, drinking, wearing red garlands and red clothes, singing and playing musical instruments.
27_30.word_by_word: पिबताम् of those drinking, रक्तमाल्यानाम् of those putting on flower garlands, रक्तवाससाम् of those wearing red clothes, रक्षसाम् of rakshasas, गीतवादित्रनिःस्वनः sound of singing and playing musical instruments, समाजश्च a group, मया by me, दृष्टः was seen.

27_31.shloka: लङ्का चेयं पुरी रम्या सवाजिरथकुञ्जराः।।5.27.35।।सागरे पतिता दृष्टा भग्नगोपुरतोरणा।
27_31.translation: "I saw this delightful Lanka teeming with horses, chariots and elephants, archways and towers crumbling and falling into the ocean.
27_31.word_by_word: रम्या delightful, इयम् this, लङ्का पुरी च city of Lanka, सवाजिरथकुञ्जरा with horses chariots and elephants, भग्नगोपुरतोरणा crumbling archways and towers, सागरे in the ocean, पतिता fallen, दृष्टा seen.

27_32.shloka: लङ्का दृष्टा मया स्वप्ने रावणेनाभिरक्षिता।।5.27.36।।दग्धा रामस्य दूतेन वानरेण तरस्विना।
27_32.translation: In my dream I saw this city of Lanka protected by Ravana burnt down by a powerfulvanara, a messenger of Rama.
27_32.word_by_word: रावणेन by Ravana, अभिरक्षिता protected, लङ्का Lanka, रामस्य Rama's, दूतेन by a messenger, तरस्विना by powerful, वानरेण by a vanara, दग्धा burnt, मया by me, स्वप्ने in the dream, दृष्टा seen.

27_33.shloka: पीत्वा तैलं प्रनृत्ताश्च प्रहसन्त्यो महास्वनाः।।5.27.37।।लङ्कायां भस्मरूक्षायां सर्वा राक्षसस्त्रियः।
27_33.translation: "All the demonesses in the city of Lanka which had turned dry, reduced to ashes, were dancing, laughing and shouting loudly drunk with oil..
27_33.word_by_word: भस्मरूक्षायाम् in a dry place turned into ashes, लङ्कायाम् in this Lanka, सर्वाः all, राक्षसस्त्रियः demonesses, तैलम् oil, पीत्वा after drinking, प्रहसन्त्यः laughing away, महास्वनाः shouting in a loud voice, प्रनृत्ताः च danced.

27_34.shloka: कुम्भकर्णादयश्चेमे सर्वे राक्षसपुङ्गवाः।।5.27.38।।रक्तं निवसनं गृह्य प्रविष्टा गोमयह्रदे।
27_34.translation: "Kumbhakarna and other demon leaders wearing red clothes entered into a pool of cow dung.
27_34.word_by_word: कुम्भकर्णादयः Kumbhakarna and others, इमे these, सर्वे राक्षसपुङ्गवाः all demon leaders, रक्तम् red coloured, निवसनम् clothes, गृह्य wearing, गोमयह्रदे in a pool of cowdung, प्रविष्टाः entered.

27_35.shloka: अपगच्छत नश्यध्वं सीतामाप्नोति राघवः।।5.27.39।।घातयेत्परमामर्षी युष्मान्सार्थं हि राक्षसैः।
27_35.translation: "(Therefore) go away from here. You will be totally destroyed by Rama who will secure his wife and will kill  all of you along with others in great anger.
27_35.word_by_word: अपगच्छत go away from here, नश्यध्वम् you will be destroyed, राघवः Raghava, सीताम् Sita, आप्नोति he will secure, परमामर्षी a very angry man, राक्षसैः सार्थम् along with the demons totally, युष्मान् you, घातयेत् will kill.

27_36.shloka: प्रियां बहुमतां भार्यां वनवासमनुव्रताम्।।5.27.40।।भर्त्सितां तर्जितां वापि नानुमंस्यति राघवः।
27_36.translation: "Rama will not approve of any one abusing or threatening his venerable, beloved wife, who had led a life of exile with him.
27_36.word_by_word: राघवः Rama, प्रियाम् his beloved, बहुमताम् highly respected one, वनवासम् exile in the forest, अनुव्रताम् followed, भार्याम् wife, भर्त्सिताम् abused, तर्जितां वापि or threatened, नानुमंस्यति he will not approve.

27_37.shloka: तदलं क्रूरवाक्यैश्च सान्त्वमेवाभिधीयताम्।।5.27.41।।अभियाचाम वैदेहीमेतद्धि मम रोचते।
27_37.translation: "Give up these cruel taunts. Speak to her in a cordial manner. We will beg Vaidehi's forgiveness. I like this kind of action.
27_37.word_by_word: तत् then, क्रूरवाक्यैः cruel taunts, अलम् enough, सान्त्वमेव peacefully, अभिधीयताम् it may be said, वैदेहीम् Vaidehi, अभियाचाम we will beg, एतद्धि this itself, मे to me, रोचते is liked.

27_38.shloka: यस्यामेवंविधः स्वप्नो दुःखितायां प्रदृश्यते।।5.27.42।।सा दुःखैर्विविधैर्मुक्ता प्रियं प्राप्नोत्यनुत्तमम्।
27_38.translation: "When any demoness in a sorrowful state dreams this kind of dream, she will be relieved of sorrow and will obtain supreme joy.
27_38.word_by_word: यस्याम् when any woman, दुःखितायाम् when she is sorrowful, एवंविधः this kind of, स्वप्नः dream, प्रदृश्यते is seen, सा she, विविधैः with all kinds of, दुःखैः sorrows, मुक्ता she is relieved, अनुत्तमम् supreme, प्रियम् joy, प्राप्नोति will attain.

27_39.shloka: भर्त्सितामपि याचध्वं राक्षस्यः किं विवक्षया।।5.27.43।।राघवाद्धि भयं घोरं राक्षसानामुपस्थितम्।
27_39.translation: "O demonesses beg her (pardon) now even though you had threatened her earlier. Where is the need to hesitate? There is cause for concern for demons from Rama.
27_39.word_by_word: राक्षस्यः O demonesses, भर्त्सितामपि even if she is threatened this way, याचध्वम् beg her, किम् विवक्षया where is the need to say something, राक्षसानाम् of demons, राघवात् from Rama, घोरम् terrific, भयम् fear, उपस्थितम् will come.

27_40.shloka: प्रणिपातप्रसन्ना हि मैथिली जनकात्मजा।।5.27.44।।अलमेषा परित्रातुं राक्षस्यो महतो भयात्।
27_40.translation: "O shedemons, this Janaka's daughter from Mithila who is capable of protecting you against great dangers will be pleased by your submission.
27_40.word_by_word: राक्षस्यः O shedemons, जनकात्मजा Janaka's daughter, एषा this, मैथिली Mythili, प्रणिपातप्रसन्ना while pleased with your salutations, महतः great, भयात् fear, परित्रातुम् to save, अलम् able.

27_41.shloka: अपि चास्या विशालाक्ष्या न किंचिदुपलक्षये।।5.27.45।।विरूपमपि चाङ्गेषु सुसूक्ष्ममपि लक्षणम्।
27_41.translation: "Look at the signs on her body. There is not a little inauspiciousness in the limbs of the largeeyed princess from Mithila.
27_41.word_by_word: अपि च and not only that, विशालाक्ष्याः of the largeeyed one, अस्याः her, अङ्गेषु in her limbs, सुसूक्ष्ममपि even a little, विरूपम् distortioninauspiciousness, लक्षणम् sign, किञ्चिदपि even a little, न उपलक्षये I do not see.

27_42.shloka: छायावैगुण्यमात्रं तु शङ्के दुःखमुपस्थितम्।।5.27.46।।अदुःखार्हामिमां देवीं वैहायसमुपस्थिताम्।
27_42.translation: A great suffering has befallen a lady who does not deserve to suffer. Therefore, a change in her complexion has occured.
27_42.word_by_word: छायावैगुण्यमात्रं तु only a change in her complexion, वैहायसम् is changed, उपस्थिताम् which she has, अदुःखार्हाम् not deserve to suffer, इमाम् this, देवीम् this queen, दुःखम् grief, उपस्थितम् has befallen, शङ्के I think.

27_43.shloka: अर्थसिद्धिं तु वैदेह्याः पश्याम्यहमुपस्थिताम्।।5.27.47।।राक्षसेन्द्रविनाशं च विजयं राघवस्य च।
27_43.translation: "I see the day of fulfilment for Vaidehi has drawn near. I can also foresee the destruction of the demon king and the triumph of Rama.
27_43.word_by_word: अहम् I, वैदेह्याः for Vaidehi, अर्थसिद्धिं तु fulfilment, उपस्थिताम् approaching, पश्यामि I can see, राक्षसेन्द्रविनाशं च the destruction of the demon king, राघवस्य for Raghava, विजयं च success.

27_44.shloka: निमित्तभूतमेतत्तु श्रोतुमस्या महत्प्रियम्।।5.27.48।।दृश्यते च स्फुरच्चक्षुः पद्मपत्रमिवायतम्।
27_44.translation: "This dream indeed served as an augery for good news about her. Look, her (left) eye which is large like a lotus petal is throbbing.
27_44.word_by_word: अस्याः her, महत् great, प्रियम् good news, श्रोतुम् to hear, निमित्तभूतम् has served as an augery, स्पुरत् throbbing, एतत् this, पद्मपत्रमिव like lotus petals, आयतम् large, चक्षुः eyes, दृश्यते is seen.

27_45.shloka: ईषच्छ हृषितो वास्या दक्षिणाया ह्यदक्षिणः।।5.27.49।।अकस्मादेव वैदेह्या बाहुरेकः प्रकम्पते।
27_45.translation: "The left shoulder of this great Vaidehi has started suddenly throbbing, indicating that she is feeling a bit happy.
27_45.word_by_word: दक्षिणायाः of a capable lady, अस्याः her, वैदेह्याः Vaidehi's, अदक्षिणः that left, एकः बाहुः that shoulder alone, अकस्मादेव suddenly, हृषितः it may be feeling, ईषत् a little bit, प्रकम्पते is throbbing.

27_46.shloka: करेणुहस्तप्रतिम स्सव्यश्चोरुरनुत्तमः।।5.27.50।।वेपमानः सूचयति राघवं पुरतः स्थितम्।
27_46.translation: "Her excellent left thigh, comparable to a female elephant's trunk is trembling, as though indicating that Rama is standing in her presence.
27_46.word_by_word: करेणुहस्तप्रतिमः comparable to a female elephant's trunk, अनुत्तमः excellent, सव्यः the left one, ऊरुः thigh, वेपमानः while trembling, राघवम् Ragahva, पुरतः city, स्थितम् standing, सूचयति as though indicating.

27_47.shloka: पक्षी च शाखानिलयं प्रविष्टःपुनः पुनश्चोत्तमसान्त्ववादी।सुस्वागतां वाचमुदीरयानः पुनःपुनश्चोदयतीव हृष्टः।।5.27.51।।
27_47.translation: "One can see the bird which utters excellent sweet notes indicating happy tidings, entering again and again the foliage of the tree, a delightful bird, as if prompting Sita again and again to rejoice.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये सुन्दरकाण्डे सप्तविंशस्सर्गः।Thus ends the twentyseventh sarga of Sundarakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
27_47.word_by_word: पक्षी च a bird, शाखानिलयम् on the branches, प्रविष्टः entered, पुनः once again, पुनश्च again and again, उत्तमसान्त्वादी the bird which utters excellent sweet notes, सुस्वागतम् वाचम् a happy tiding, उदीरयानः while expressing, हृष्टः joyous, पुनः पुनः again and again, चोदयतीव is as though prompting.

28_1.shloka: [Sita's wailings -- finaly finds some auspicious signs.]सा राक्षसेन्द्रस्य वचो निशम्यतद्रावणस्याप्रियमप्रियार्ता।सीता वितत्रास यथा वनान्तेसिंहाभिपन्ना गजराजकन्या।।5.28.1।।
28_1.translation: After hearing the unpleasant words spoken by the king of demons, which caused restlessness and sorrow to Sita, she was terrified like the young calf of a lordly elephant fallen into the clutches of a lion in the midst of the forest.
28_1.word_by_word: सा सीता that Sita, राक्षसेन्द्रस्य demon king's, रावणस्य Ravana's, अप्रियम् unpleasant news, तत् that, वचः word, निशम्य after hearing, अप्रियार्ता restless, वनान्ते in the midst of the forest, सिंहाभिपन्ना caught by the lion, गजराजकन्या यथा like young calf of a lordly elephant, वितत्रास frightened.

28_2.shloka: सा राक्षसीमध्यगता च भीरुर्वाग्भिर्भृशं रावणतर्जिता च।कान्तारमध्ये विजने विसृष्टाबालेव कन्या विललाप सीता।।5.28.2।।
28_2.translation: Encircled by the demonesses, Sita was repeatedly humiliated by Ravana's cruel words.She wept like a young girl deserted in a desolate forest.
28_2.word_by_word: राक्षसीमध्यगता encircled by the shedemons, भीरुः soft natured, भृशम् excessively, वाग्भि: with words, रावणतर्जिता च threatened by Ravana, सा that, सीता Sita, विजने desolate, कान्तारमध्ये in the midst of the forest, विसृष्टा deserted, बाला young, कन्या इव like a girl, विललाप wept.

28_3.shloka: सत्यं बतेदं प्रवदन्ति लोकेनाकालमृत्युर्भवतीति सन्तः।यत्राहमेवं परिभर्त्स्यमानाजीवामि दीना क्षणमप्यपुण्या।।5.28.3।।
28_3.translation: "Even though I am threatened like this, I am living pitiably because of lack of merit. Indeed I regret my survival due to my bad luck. Elders say that death will not ocurr before its time. It seems to be true.
28_3.word_by_word: लोके in the world, अकालमृत्युः untimely death, न भवति does not occur, इति like this, इदम् thus, सत्यम् true, सन्तः elders, प्रवदन्ति say, यत्र wherever, एवम् this way, परिभर्त्स्यमाना being threatened, अपुण्या who lacks merits, अहम् I am, दीना pitiable, क्षणमपि even a second also, जीवामि I live, बत alas.

28_4.shloka: सुखाद्विहीनं बहुदुःखपूर्णमिदं तु नूनं हृदयं स्थिरं मे।विशीर्यते यन्न सहस्रधाऽद्यवज्राहतं शृङ्गमिवाचलस्य।।5.28.4।।
28_4.translation: "Even though I am devoid of joy, and living in deep agony, my heart bursts not into a thousand pieces like the summit of a mountain hit by thunderbolt (lightning).
28_4.word_by_word: सुखात् of joy, विहीनम् devoid, बहुदुःखपूर्णम् filled with agony, इदम् this, मे my, हृदयम् heart, नूनम् surely, स्थिरम् hard, यत् such, वज्राहतम् hit by a thunderbolt, अचलस्य of a mountain, शृङ्गमिव like the top, सहस्रधा into a thousand pieces, अद्य now, न विशीर्यते it is not breaking.

28_5.shloka: नैवास्ति दोषो मम नूनमत्र वध्याहमस्याप्रियदर्शनस्य।भावं न चास्याहमनुप्रदातु मलं द्विजो मन्त्रमिवाद्विजाय।।5.28.5।।
28_5.translation: "I will not be blamed if I commit suicide now.I stand condemned to death in the hands of this ugly Ravana. I cannot bestow my affection on him or surender to his desire like a brahmin would not like to impart Vedic knowledge to a nonbrahmin. (Better die of my own accord than be killed by a sinful ogre).
28_5.word_by_word: अत्र मम here my, दोषः fault, नैवास्ति is not there, अहम् I am, अप्रियदर्शनस्य ugly, अस्य his, वध्या to be killed, अस्मि I am, अहम् I,  अस्य his, भावम् (surrender) my heart, द्विजः brahmin, अद्विजाय to a nonbrahmin, मन्त्रमिव like the veda mantra, अनुप्रदातुम् to impart, न अलम् not proper.

28_6.translation: "If the lord of the world does not come here before that (time fixed by Ravana) the vile lord of demons will cut me into pieces with weapons just as a barber would cut to pieces the foetus with a sharp knife (in order to save a pregnant woman).
28_6.word_by_word: लोकनाथे the lord of the world, तस्मिन् he, अनागच्छति before he comes here, अनार्यः vile lord, राक्षसेन्द्रः lord of demons, शल्यकृन्तः barber, गर्भस्थजन्तोरिव like the foetus from the womb,  मम my, अङ्गानि limbs, नूनम् surely, शितैः with sharp, शत्रै: with weapons, छेत्स्यति will cut into pieces.

28_7.shloka: दुःखं बतेदं मम दुःखितायामासौ चिरायाधिगमिष्यतो द्वौ।बद्धस्य वध्यस्य तथा निशान्तेराजापराधादिव तस्करस्य।।5.28.7।।
28_7.translation: "Alas, two months is too long a time to wait in grief. I am like a thief captured for offending a king and waiting overnight for execution at day-break.
28_7.word_by_word: राजापराधात् due to offending the king, बद्धस्य captured, निशान्ते by daybreak, वध्यस्य for execution, तस्करस्य इव like that of a thief, दुःखितायाः of a sorrowful, मम to me, द्वौ two, मासौ months, चिराय is a long duration, अधिगमिष्यतः will be spent, इदम् this, दुःखम् grief, बत alas.

28_8.shloka: हा राम हा लक्ष्मण हा सुमित्रेहा राममातः सह मे जनन्या।एषा विपद्याम्यहमल्पभाग्यामहार्णवे नौरिव मूढवाता।।5.28.8।।
28_8.translation: "Alas! Rama, Alas! Lakshmana, Alas! Sumitra, Alas! my mother, Alas! Rama's mother, I am an ill-starred woman going to perish in this way like a light boat capsized in the midst of an ocean when the whirl-wind blows.
28_8.word_by_word: हा राम Alas! Rama, हा लक्ष्मण Alas! Lakshmana, हा सुमित्रे Alas! Sumitra!, मे my, जनन्या सह own mother, हा राममातः Alas! Rama's mother, अल्पभाग्या an ill-starred woman, एषा here, अहम् I, महार्णवे in an ocean, मूढवाता by a whirl-wind, नौरिव like a boat, विपद्यामि I am perished.

28_9.shloka: तरस्विनौ धारयता मृगस्यसत्त्वेन रूपं मनुजेन्द्रपुत्रौ।नूनं विशस्तौ मम कारणात्तौसिंहर्षभौ द्वाविव वैद्युतेन।।5.28.9।।
28_9.translation: "Just like two mighty lions are killed by a bolt of lightning, the two princes must have been killed by a creature in the guise of a deer on my account.
28_9.word_by_word: मृगस्य deer's, रूपम् form, धारयता by taking, सत्त्वेन by a creature, तरस्विनौ these pair of , तौ two, मनुजेन्द्रपुत्रौ princes, वैद्युतेन by bolt of lightning, द्वौ two, सिंहर्षभौ इव two mighty lions, मम कारणात् on my account, नूनम् verily, विशस्तौ are slain.

28_10.shloka: नूनं स कालो मृगरूपधारीमामल्पभाग्यां लुलुभे तदानीम्।यत्रार्यपुत्रं विससर्ज मूढारामानुजं लक्ष्मणपूर्वजं च।।5.28.10।।
28_10.translation: "Verily, it is the spirit of the time that assumed the form of deer and tempted this unfortunate soul. It was foolish of me to send away, the sons of a noble king, Lakshmana and his elder brother.
28_10.word_by_word: नूनम् verily, सः such, कालः the spirit of time, मृगरूपधारी in the guise of a deer, तदानीम् then, अल्पभाग्याम् an unfortunate woman, माम् me, लुलुभे tempted, यत्र wherever, मूढा foolish, रामानुजम् Rama's brother, लक्ष्मणपूर्वजम् Lakshmana's elder brother, आर्यपुत्रं च son of a noble king, विससर्ज sent away.

28_11.shloka: हा राम सत्यव्रत दीर्घबाहोहा पूर्णचन्द्रप्रतिमानवक्त्र।हा जीवलोकस्य हितः प्रियश्चवध्यां न मां वेत्सि हि राक्षसानाम्।।5.28.11।।
28_11.translation: "Alas, O long-armed one unfailing in vows, whose face shines like the full moon. Alas, beloved of all the worlds! you are dear to every one. How is it that you are not aware that I am going to be killed by the demons?
28_11.word_by_word: सत्यव्रत O unfailing in vows, दीर्घबाहो O long-armed one, हा राम Alas! Rama, हा पूर्णचन्द्रप्रतिमानवक्त्र alas! one whose face is like the full moon, हा alas, जीवलोकस्य for all the worlds, हितः benefactor, प्रियश्च dear one, माम् me, राक्षसानाम् for demons, वध्याम् to be killed, न वेत्सि you are not aware.

28_12.shloka: अनन्य दैवत्वमियं क्षमा चभूमौ च शय्या नियमश्च धर्मे।पतिव्रतात्वं विफलं ममेदंकृतं कृतघ्नेष्विव मानुषाणाम्।।5.28.12।।
28_12.translation: "I am devoted to you and to no other god. My hardship in sleeping on the ground, my righteousness, my discipline and chastity have all proved futile like the devotion of an ungrateful person.
28_12.word_by_word: अनन्यदैवत्वम् no god other than you, इयम् this, क्षमा च and tolerance, भूमौ on earth, शय्या sleep, धर्मे in righteousness, नियमश्च discipline, पतिव्रतात्वम् my chastity, मम my, इदम् this, कृतघ्नेषु in case of ungrateful man, मानुषाणाम् of human beings, कृतमिव like the help done, विफलम् is futile.

28_13.shloka: मोघो हि धर्मश्चरितो मयायंतथैकपत्नीत्वामिदं निरर्थम्।या त्वां न पश्यामि कृशा विवर्णाहीना त्वया सङ्गमने निराशा।।5.28.13।।
28_13.translation: "This righteousnes practised by me is in vain like my devotion to you, as I am unable to see you. I am a separated, emaciated, pale with no hope of reuniting with you.
28_13.word_by_word: या I who, त्वाम् you, न पश्यामि I do not see, त्वया by you, हीना deprived, सङ्गमने in reuniting, निराशा no hope, कृशा shrunk, विवर्णा pale, मया  by me, चरितः followed, अयम् this, धर्मः righteousness, मोघः हि is in vain, तथा likewise, इदम् this, एकपन्तीत्वम् devotion to you alone, निरर्थम् meaningless.

28_14.shloka: पितुर्निदेशं नियमेन कृत्वा  वनान्निवृत्तश्चरितव्रतश्च।स्त्रीभिस्तु मन्ये विपुलेक्षणाभिस्त्वं रंस्यसे वीतभयः कृतार्थः।।5.28.14।।
28_14.translation: "Having truly fulfilled your pledge given to your father, you will return from the forest to Ayodhya, rid of all fear, as an accomplished person, will and revel in the company of largeeyed damsels, I think.
28_14.word_by_word: त्वम् you, पितुः father's, निदेशम् command, नियमेन truly, कृत्वा following, चरितव्रतश्च after the completion of the pledge, वनात् from the forest, निवृत्तः you return, वीतभयः rid of fear, कृतार्थः an accomplished one, विपुलेक्षणाभिः largeeyed, स्त्रीभिः with damsels, रंस्यसे be revelling, मन्ये I think.

28_15.shloka: अहं तु राम त्वयि जातकामाचिरं विनाशाय निबद्धभावा।मोघं चरित्वाथ तपो व्रतञ्च त्यक्ष्यामिधिग्जीवितमल्पभाग्याम्।।5.28.15।।
28_15.translation: "O RamaI loved you and concentrated all my love on you for a long time only for my doom. I have observed vows and austerities in vain. I cannot continue it for long. Here I am giving up my life. Fie upon this luckless one (me).
28_15.word_by_word: राम Rama, त्वयि at you, जातकामा I loved, अहं तु I am also, विनाशाय for my doom, चिरम् for long, निबद्धभावा with my feeling of love fixed on you, तपः austerities, व्रतं च and vows, मोघम् in vain, चरित्वाथ after practising, जीवितम् life, त्यक्ष्यामि will be giving up, अल्पभाग्याम् I am unfortunate one, धिक् what a pity

28_16.shloka: सा जीवितं क्षिप्रमहं त्यजेयंविषेण शस्त्रेण शितेन वापि।विषस्य दाता न हि मेऽस्ति कश्चिच्छस्त्रस्य वा वेश्मनि राक्षसस्य।।5.28.16।।
28_16.translation: "I will end my life at once by taking poison or else by a sharp weapon. Alas There is none to give get me poison or a weapon at this demon's residence".
28_16.word_by_word: सा अहम् that I, क्षिप्रम् at once, जीवितम् life, विषेण by poisoning, शितेन by a sharp one, शस्त्रेण by a weapon, वापि or else, त्यजेयम् I give up, राक्षसस्य demon's, वेश्मनि at his residence, मे to me, विषस्य of poison, शस्त्रस्य वा or of weapon, दाता donor, कश्चित् any one, नास्ति is not found.

28_17.shloka: इतीव देवी बहुधा विलप्यसर्वात्मना राममनुस्मरन्ती।प्रवेपमाना परिशुष्कवक्त्रानगोत्तमं पुष्पितमाससाद।।5.28.17।।
28_17.translation: Queen Sita was wailing in many ways, constantly remembering Rama, the soul of all. Shivering, her face pales as she approached the great Simsupa tree in bloom.
28_17.word_by_word: देवी queen, इतीव in that way, बहुधा in many ways, विलप्य  wailing, सर्वात्मना self of all, रामम् Rama, अनुस्मरन्ती constantly remembering, प्रवेपमाना shivering, परिशुष्कवक्त्रा pale face, पुष्पितम् in bloom, नगोत्तमम् great tree, आससाद approached.

28_18.shloka: सा शोकतप्ता बहुधा विचिन्त्यसीताऽथ वेण्युद्ग्रथनं गृहीत्वा।उद्बुध्य वेण्युद्ग्रथनेन शीघ्रमहंगमिष्यामि यमस्य मूलम्।।5.28.18।।
28_18.translation: "Burning in grief, worrying in many ways, Sita took hold of her braid and said", by tying myself with this braid I shall quickly reach the presence of the lord of death".
28_18.word_by_word: शोकाभितप्ता burning with grief, सीता Sita, बहुधा in many ways, विचिन्त्य after worrying, अथ then, वेण्युद्ग्रथनम् braid of her hair, गृहीत्वा holding, अहम् I, वेण्युद्ग्रथनेन by the braid, उद्बुध्य tie, शीघ्रम् quickly, यमस्य lord of death's, मूलम् presence, गमिष्यामि I will reach.

28_19.shloka: उपस्थिता सा मृदुसर्वगात्रीशाखां गृहत्वाऽध नगस्य तस्य।तस्यास्तु रामं प्रविचिन्तयन्त्यारामानुजं स्वं च कुलं शुभाङ्ग्या:।।5.28.19।।शेकानिमित्तानि तथा बहूनिधैर्यार्जितानि प्रवराणि लोके।प्रादुर्निमित्तानि तदा बभूवुःपुरापि सिद्धान्युपलक्षितानि।।5.28.20।।
28_19.translation: Sita of delicate limbs approached the Simsupa tree and held on to a branch and stood. While she was thinking of Rama and Lakshmana and their noble family many  omens of proven results appeared on her auspicious charming body. These omens were dispellers of grief, and harbingers of courage in the world as declared fromancient times. (Now) they manifested themselves.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये सुन्दरकाण्डे अष्टाविंशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the twentyeigth sarga of Sundarakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
28_19.word_by_word: अथ and then, मृदसर्वगात्री lady of delicate limbs, सा she, तस्य of that, नगस्य tree's, शाखाम् branch, गृहीत्वा holding, उपस्थिता stood, रामम् Rama, रामानुजम् Rama's brother, स्वं कुलं च and their family, प्रविचिन्तयन्त्या: was thinking, शुभाङ्ग्याः of charming body, तस्याः तु her, तदा then, शोकानिमित्तानि dispellers of sorrow, धैर्यार्जितानि harbingers of courage, लोके in the world, प्रवराणि foremost, तथा similarly, पुरापि ancient times also, सिद्धानि results, उपलक्षितानि  been proven, बहूनि many, निमित्तानि omens, प्रादुर्भभूवुः manifested.

29_1.shloka: [Sita feels happy seeing auspicious signs.]तथागतां तां व्यथितामनिन्दितां व्यपेतहर्षां परिदीनमानसाम्।शुभां निमित्तानि शुभानि भेजिरे नरं श्रिया जुष्टमिवोपजीविनः।।5.29.1।।
29_1.translation: Like wellwishers flocking round a person on whom fortune is smiling, omens foretelling auspicious happenings in near future appeared to Sita. She was unimpeachable. She was in agony, distressed in mind, bereft of all joy (now) standing under that Simsupa tree.
29_1.word_by_word: तथागताम् as expected, व्यथिताम् agonized lady, अनिन्दिताम् faultless, व्यपेतहर्षाम् bereft of all joy, परिदीनमानसाम् distressed in mind, शुभाम् auspicious, ताम् her, श्रिया with benign favour of fortune, जुष्टम् pleased, नरम् man, उपजीविनः इव like well wishing, शुभानि auspicious, निमित्तानि for the sake, भेजिरे wealthy man.

29_2.shloka: तस्याः शुभं वाममरालपक्ष्म राजीवृतं कृष्णविशालशुक्लम्।प्रास्पन्दतैकं नयनं सुकेश्या मीनाहतं पद्ममिवाभिताम्रम्।।5.29.2।।
29_2.translation: Her left eye with a row of curved eyelashes, the black pupils of the eye in white throbbed in an auspicious manner. The lady  with her long tresses, and throbbing eye appeared like a red lotus gently struck by a fish.
29_2.word_by_word: सुकेश्याः of the lady with beautiful hair, तस्याः her, शुभम् auspicious, अरालपक्ष्मराजीवृतम् surrounded by a row of curved eye lashes, कृष्णविशालशुक्लम् broad black pupils in white, वामनयनम् left eye, मीनाहतम् struck by fish, अभिताम्रम् reddish ring, एकम् one, पद्ममिव like lotus, प्रास्पन्दत throbbed.

29_3.translation: Her stout left arm curved beautifully, fit for excellent agaru and sandal paste once the pillow by her beloved lord for long, throbbed suddenly.
29_3.word_by_word: चार्वञ्चितपीनवृत्तः beautifuly curved round and stout, परार्थ्यकालागरुचन्दनार्हः deserving the application of excellent black agaru and sandal paste, अनुत्तमेन by the best, प्रियेण by the beloved, चिरेण for long, अध्युषितः  used to rest the head, वामः भुजश्च by the left arm, आशु suddenly, समवेपत throbbed.

29_4.shloka: गजेन्द्रहस्तप्रतिमश्च पीनस्तयोर्द्वयोः सम्हतयोः सुजातः।प्रस्पन्दमानः पुनरूरुरस्यारामं पुरस्तात् स्थितमाचचक्षे।।5.29.4।।
29_4.translation: Again her roundshaped left thigh resembling an elephant's trunk started throbbing, presaging union with Rama.
29_4.word_by_word: संहतयोः close to each other, तयोः द्वयोः of those two, गजेन्द्रहस्तप्रतिमः resembling an elephant's trunk, पीनः stout, सुजातः well shaped, अस्याः ऊरुः her thigh, प्रस्पन्दमानः throbbing, रामम् Rama, पुरस्तात् in front, स्थितम् stood, आचचक्षे indicated.

29_5.translation: Her eyes were pristine, teeth wellshaped. The goldhued auspicious sari on her charming limbs was now a little soiled on account of dust. It slipped slightly as she stood up. This augured well for her.
29_5.word_by_word: पुनः again, अमलाक्ष्याः lady with pristine eyes, शिखराग्रदन्त्याः with round edged teeth, चारुगात्य्राः of the lady of beautiful limbs, स्थितायाः standing, शुभम् auspicious, हेमसमानवर्णम् of the colour of gold, ईषत् slightly, रजोध्वस्तमिव slightly dull on account of dust, वासः clothes, किञ्चित् a little, परिस्रंसत slipped.

29_6.shloka: एतैर्निमित्तैरपरैश्च सुभ्रूःसम्बोधिता प्रागपि साधु सिद्धैः।वातातपक्लान्तमिव प्रणष्टंवर्षेण बीजं प्रतिसंजहर्ष।।5.29.6।।
29_6.translation: Reassured by such omens which augured well as tested by time, Sita, with beautiful eyebrows, and deep foresight experienced great joy, like a seed blighted by the wind and the Sun comes back to joyful life through a pleasing shower. (A foreteller is addressed as siddha in sanskrit dramas)
29_6.word_by_word: प्रागपि in the past also, साधु well, सिद्धैः  by seers, एतैः by these, निमित्तै: by the presence of  omens, अपरैश्च and by others, सम्बोधिता addressed, सुभ्रूः a lady with lovely eyebrows, वातप्रक्लान्तम् blighted by wind and heat, प्रणष्टम् dried, बीजम् seed, वर्षेण इव with rain, प्रतिसञ्जहर्ष felt happy.

29_7.translation: Her face shining with beautiful red lips like bimba fruit, sparkling teeth, and curved eyelashes with lovely brows extending up to her hair, she appeared like a Moon released from the mouth of Rahu.
29_7.word_by_word: पुनः again, तस्याः her, बिम्बफलाधरोष्ठम् with lips like bimba fruit, स्वक्षिभ्रुकेशान्तम् beautiful eye brows, अरालपक्ष्म curved eyelashes extending up to her hair, सितचारुदन्तम् white and lovely teeth, वक्त्रम् mouth, राहोः from planet Rahu, मुखात् from face, प्रमुक्तः set free, चन्द्रः इव like the Moon, बभासे shone.

29_8.shloka: सा वीतशोका व्यपनीततन्द्रीशान्तज्वरा हर्षविबुद्धसत्त्वा।अशोभतार्या वदनेन शुक्लेशीतांशुना रात्रिरिवोदितेन।।5.29.8।।
29_8.translation: Revered Sita, completely relieved of grief, exhaustion gone, fears allayed, mind illumined with joy, looked charming with her countenance as a night with the Moon fully risen during the bright fortnight.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये सुन्दरकाण्डे एकोनत्रिंशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the twentyninth sarga of Sundarakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic compsed by sage Valmiki.
29_8.word_by_word: आर्या revered lady, सा she, वीतशोका relieved from grief, व्यपनीततन्द्री a lady relieved from exhaustion, शान्तज्वरा fears allyed, हर्षविबुद्धसत्त्वा a lady with her mind illumined by joy, वदनेन with her countenance, शुक्ले in the bright fortnight, उदितेन risen, शीतांशुना with cool Moon, रात्रिरिव like the night, अशोभत shone.

30_1.shloka: [Hanuman  decides to  praise Rama within Sita's earshot.]हनुमानपि विक्रान्तः सर्वं शुश्राव तत्त्वतः।सीतायास्त्रिजटायाश्च राक्षसीनां च तर्जनम्।।5.30.1।।
30_1.translation: The valiant hero Hanuman heard everything including the lamentation of Sita and the dream of Trijata and the threats of the demonesses.
30_1.word_by_word: विक्रान्तः valiant hero, हनुमानपि Hanuman also, सीतायाश्च Sita's, त्रिजटायाश्च Trijata's, सर्वम् everything, राक्षसीनाम् shedemons, तर्जनम् threatening, तत्त्वतः  in principle, शुश्राव heard.

30_2.shloka: अवेक्षमाणस्तां देवीं देवतामिव नन्दने।ततो बहुविधां चिन्तां चिन्तयामास वानरः।।5.30.2।।
30_2.translation: The sight of Sita who seemed a deity in the Nandana garden of Indra, set a chain of reflections in his mind :
30_2.word_by_word: ततः then, वानरः vanara, नन्दने in the Nandana garden, देवतामिव like the goddess, तां देवीम् to that deitylike Sita, अवेक्षमाणः  looking, बहुविधाम् many ways, चिन्ताम् चिन्तयामास reflected.

30_3.shloka: यां कपीनां सहस्राणि सुबहून्ययुतानि च।दिक्षु सर्वासु मार्गन्ते सेयमासादिता मया।।5.30.3।।
30_3.translation: "This is Sita whom thousands of vanaras are searching in all directions.
30_3.word_by_word: कपीनाम् of vanaras, सुबहूनि many, सहस्राणि thousands, अयुतानि च 10,000 soldiers सर्वासु all over, दिक्षु in directions, याम् whom, मार्गन्ते are searching, सा इयम् that Sita here, मया by myself, आसादिता she is found.

30_4.shloka: चारेण तु सुयुक्तेन शत्रोश्शक्तिमवेक्षता।गूढेन चरता तावदवेक्षितमिदं मया।।5.30.4।।
30_4.translation: "Roaming everywhere incognito to ascertain carefully the strength of the enemy, I have seen everything.
30_4.word_by_word: सुयुक्तेन very carefully, शत्रोः enemy's, शक्तिमवेक्षता while seeing the strength, गूढेन in disguise, चरता roaming, चारेण a spy, मया by myself, इदम् this place, अवेक्षितं तावत् seen everything.

30_5.shloka: राक्षसानां विशेषश्च पुरी चेयमवेक्षिता।राक्षसाधिपतेरस्य प्रभावो रावणस्य च।।5.30.5।।
30_5.translation: "I have seen the ability of the demons and the citadel of Lanka. I have seen the power of Ravana the demon king.
30_5.word_by_word: राक्षसानाम् of the demons, विशेषश्च ability, इयम् this, पुरी च citadel also, अवेक्षिता had been seen, अस्य its, राक्षसाधिपतेः of the lord of demons, रावणस्य Ravana's, प्रभावश्च power also.

30_6.translation: "It is the opportune time for me to comfort Sita eagerly waiting to see her husband who is of immeasurable prowess and who is compassionate to all beings.
30_6.word_by_word: सर्वसत्त्वदयावतः who is compassionate to all, अप्रमेयस्य man of immeasureable prowess, तस्य his, पतिदर्शनकाङ्क्षिणीम् longing to see her husband, भार्याम् wife, समाश्वासयितुम् to console युक्तम् is the right action.

30_7.translation: "The moonfaced Sita had never experienced sorrow before. She sees no end to her sorrow and suffering. I will console her.
30_7.word_by_word: पूर्णचन्द्रनिभाननाम् who has the countenance of a fullmoon, अदृष्टदुःखाम् who has never seen suffering, दुःखार्ताम् experiencing sorrow, दुःखस्य from sorrrow, अन्तम् end, अगच्छतीम् not approaching, एनाम् her, अहम् I, आश्वासयामि will console.

30_8.shloka: यद्यप्यहमिमां देवीं शोकोपहतचेतनाम्।अनाश्वास्य गमिष्यामि दोषवद्गमनं भवेत्।।5.30.8।।
30_8.translation: "If I should return to Kishkindha without reassuring Sita, whose understanding has been clouded in grief I would be blamed.
30_8.word_by_word: शोकोपहतचेतना whose mind is overwhelmed with grief, इमां देवीम् this Sita, अहम् I, अनाश्वस्य without reassuring, यदि गमिष्यामि if I go, गमनम् destination (Kishkinda), दोषवत् is blameworthy, भवेत् would be.

30_9.shloka: गते हि मयि तत्रेयं राजपुत्री यशस्विनी।परित्राणमविन्दन्ती जानकी जीवितं त्यजेत्।।5.30.9।।
30_9.translation: "If I so back, this illustrious princess, Janaki will give up her life, finding no means of deliverance (from this tragic situation).
30_9.word_by_word: मयि when me, तत्र there, गते I go, यशस्विनी renowned, राजपुत्री princess, जानकी Janaki, परित्राणम् deliverance, अविन्दन्ती without getting, जीवितम् life, त्यजेत् she will give up.

30_10.shloka: मया च स महाबाहुः पूर्णचन्द्रनिभाननः।समाश्यासयितुं न्याय्यस्सीतादर्शनलालसः।।5.30.10।।
30_10.translation: "I should provide some comfort to the strongarmed Rama with a face like the fullmoon yearning to see Sita.
30_10.word_by_word: महाबाहुः strongarmed hero, पूर्णचन्द्रनिभाननः face like the fullmoon, सीतादर्शनलालसःyearning to see Sita, सः that Rama, मया by me, समाश्वसयितुम् to provide comfort, न्याय्यः it is proper.

30_11.shloka: निशाचरीणां प्रत्यक्षमनर्हं चाभिभाषितम्।कथन्नु खलु कर्तव्यमिदं कृच्छ्रगतो ह्यहम्।।5.30.11।।
30_11.translation: "I cannot talk to her in the presence of these nightroamers. How can I  discharge my duty in this predicament?
30_11.word_by_word: निशाचरीणाम् of nightrangers, प्रत्यक्षम् in their presence, अभिभाषितम्  talking, अनर्हम् is not proper, इदम् this, कथम् how, कर्तव्यं खलु नु should be fulfilled, अहम् I, कृच्छ्रगतो हि I am in a predicament.

30_12.shloka: अनेन रात्रिशेषेण यदि नाश्वास्यते मया।सर्वथा नास्ति सन्देहः परित्यक्ष्यति जीवितम्।।5.30.12।।
30_12.translation: "If I do not comfort her before the remaining part of the night ends, she will give up her life. There is no doubt about it.
30_12.word_by_word: अनेन by this, रात्रिशेषेण when a part of the night is still left, मया by me, नाश्वास्यते यदि if I do not comfort her, जीवितम् life, परित्यक्ष्यति she will give up, सर्वथा by all means, सन्देहः doubt, नास्ति not.

30_13.shloka: रामश्च यदि पृच्छेन्मां किं मां सीताब्रवीद्वचः।किमहं तं प्रति ब्रूयामसंभाष्य सुमध्यमाम्।।5.30.13।।
30_13.translation: "If Rama enquires about the message of Sita, this lady of beautiful waist, what can I speak without meeting and talking to her?
30_13.word_by_word: सीता Sita, माम् to me, किम् what, वचः words, अब्रवीत् spoke, रामश्च Rama also , माम् I am, पृच्छेद्यदि if he enquires, सुमध्यमाम् lady with beautiful waist, असंभाष्य without talking, अहम् I, तं प्रति to him, किम् what, ब्रूयाम् I can say.

30_14.translation: "If I leave this place without any message from Sita, Rama will burn me with his eyes full of great anger.
30_14.word_by_word: सीतासन्देशरहितम् without any message from Sita, इतः from here, त्वरया at once, गतम् gone, माम् me, काकुत्थ्सः Rama, क्रुद्धः angry, तीव्रेण with a sharp, चक्षुषा with eyes, निर्दहेदपि will burn me.

30_15.shloka: यदि चोद्योजयिष्यामि भर्तारं रामकारणात्।व्यर्थमागमनं तस्य ससैन्यस्य भविष्यति।।5.30.15।।
30_15.translation: "If I get the lord of vanaras and his army for the cause of Rama (without talking to Sita), their arrival will be useless (if Sita would have given up her life by then).
30_15.word_by_word: रामकारणात् for the cause of Rama, भर्तारम् lord of vanaras, यदि च उद्योजयिष्यामि if i motivate him, ससैन्यस्य of him along with his army, तस्य his, आगमनम् coming, व्यर्थम् useless, भविष्यति will become.

30_16.translation: "I shall wait and speak to her slowly and console this deeply distressed lady when I geta chance to speak to her (when  these ogresses are asleep).
30_16.word_by_word: अहम् I, इह here, स्थितः waiting, राक्षसीनाम् of the demonesses, अन्तरम् some chance, आसाद्य after finding, सन्तापबहुलाम् deeply distressed, इमाम् this lady, शनैः slowly, आश्वासयिष्यामि will comfort her.

30_17.shloka: अहं त्वतितनुश्चैव वानरश्च विशेषतः।वाचं चोदाहरिष्यामि मानुषीमिह संस्कृताम्।।5.30.17।।
30_17.translation: I am indeed of small size and that too a monkey. Nevertheless I shall speak in Sanskrit, a language of the common people. (as the she-demons cannot understand that language).
30_17.word_by_word: अहं तु I too, अतितनुश्च small body, विशेषतः more so, वानरश्च a vanara, इह here, सम्स्कृताम् sanskrit language, मानुषीम् of human, वाचं च and talk in, उदाहरिष्यामि I will adopt.

30_18.shloka: यदि वाचं प्रदास्यामि द्विजातिरिव संस्कृताम्।रावणं मन्यमाना मां सीता भीता भविष्यति।।5.30.18।।वानरस्य विशेषेण कथं स्यादभिभाषणम्।
30_18.translation: "If I speak like a brahmin in sanskrit language she would be frightened thinking that I am Ravana and how would a vanara speak?
30_18.word_by_word: द्विजातिरिव like a brahmin, संस्कृताम् sanskrit, वाचम् language, यदि if I प्रदास्यामि will speak, सीता Sita, माम् me, रावणम् Ravana, मन्यमाना thinking, भीता भविष्यति will become scared, विशेषेण specially, वानरस्य vanara's, अभिभाषणम् talking, कथम् how, स्यात् would be.

30_19.shloka: अवश्यमेव वक्तव्यं मानुषं वाक्यमर्थवत्।।5.30.19।।मया सान्त्वयितुं शक्या नान्यथेयमनिन्दिता।
30_19.translation: "I will certainly speak to her meaningfully in the language of the people. Otherwise it isnot possible to pacify the sinless Sita.
30_19.word_by_word: अवश्यमेव certainly, मया by myself, अर्थवत् for that reason, मानुषम् common man's, वाक्यम् language, वक्तव्यम् should speak, अनिन्दिता siness lady, इयम् this, अन्यथा otherwise, सान्त्वयितुम् to pacify her, शक्या possible.

30_20.shloka: सेयमालोक्य मे रूपं जानकी भाषितं तथा।।5.30.20।।रक्षोभिस्त्रासिता पूर्वं भूयस्त्रासं गमिष्यति।
30_20.translation: "Since Janaki has already been frightened by the demons, she will be even more terrified seeing me in this form and hearing me speaking this way.
30_20.word_by_word: पूर्वम् earlier, रक्षोभिः by the demons, त्रासिता frightened, सा इयम् this, जानकी Janaki, मे my, रूपम् form, तथा this way, भाषितम् speaking, आलोक्य on seeing, भूयः again, त्रासम् fear, गमिष्यति will experience.

30_21.shloka: ततो जातपरित्रासा शब्दं कुर्यान्मनस्विनी।।5.30.21।।जानमाना  विशालाक्षी रावणं कामरूपिणम्।
30_21.translation: By seeing me in this form, sensitive largeeyed Sita will scream loudly thinking that I am Ravana who can assume any form at his free will.
30_21.word_by_word: ततः then, मनस्विनी sensitive woman, विशालाक्षी largeeyed, माम् me, कामरूपिणम् who can change form at will, रावणम् to Ravana, जानमाना she may think, जातपरित्रासा frightened, शब्दम् sound, कुर्यात् may make.

30_22.shloka: सीतया च कृते शब्दे सहसा राक्षसीगणा:।नानाप्रहरणो घोर: समेयादन्तकोपम:।।5.30.22।।
30_22.translation: "If Sita screams, the  horde of terrific ogresses will at once gather, armed with dreadful weapons like Yama, the god of death.
30_22.word_by_word: सीतया by Sita's, शब्दे when sound, कृते is made, सहसा at once, नानाप्रहरण: holding different kinds of weapons, घोर: terrific ones, अन्तकोपम: comparable to the lord of death, राक्षसीगण: horde of ogresses, समेयात् would gather.

30_23.shloka: ततो मां सम्परिक्षिप्य सर्वतो विकृताननाः।।5.30.23।।वधे च ग्रहणे चैव कुर्युर्यत्नं यथाबलम्।
30_23.translation: "Then all these hideous ogresses will swarm round me and make efforts to capture me with all their strength and kill me.
30_23.word_by_word: ततः then, विकृताननाः women with hideous faces, माम् at me, सर्वतः from all directions, सम्परिक्षिप्य throwing down, वधे च to kill, ग्रहणे चैव and to capture me, यथाबलम् according to their strength, यत्नम् effort, कुर्युः will make.

30_24.translation: "Seeing me holding big and small branches of large trees and leaping from one place to the other, the ogresses will get scared.
30_24.word_by_word: उत्तमशाखिनाम् of good trees, शाखाः branches, प्रशाखाश्च and side branches, स्कन्धांश्च and trunks, गृह्य by holding, विपरिधावन्तम् running away, दृष्ट्वा seeing, भयशङ्किताः get scared, भवेयुः will be.

30_25.shloka: मम रूपं च सम्प्रेक्ष्य वने विचरतो महत्।।5.30.25।।राक्षस्यो भयवित्रस्ता भवेयुर्विकृताननाः।
30_25.translation: "These ogresses with their hideous faces will be frightened on looking at my huge form moving in this grove.
30_25.word_by_word: विकृताननाः with hideous faces, राक्षस्यः ogresses, वने in the grove, विचरतः roaming, मम me, महत् great, रूपम् form, सम्प्रेक्ष्य glancing, भयवित्रस्ताः very scared, भवेयुः will be.

30_26.translation: "Thereafter the ogresses will draw the attention of demon guards engaged by the king of demons at his residence towards me.
30_26.word_by_word: ततः thereafter, राक्षस्यः ogresses, राक्षसेन्द्रनिवेशने in the residence of the king of demons, राक्षसेन्द्रनियुक्तानाम् engaged by the demon king to guard, रक्षसाम् अपि of the demons also, समाह्वानम् drawing their attention, कुर्युः they will do.

30_27.translation: "Those ogresses due to fear will come speedily, armed with spears, tridents, swords and different kinds of weapons for a combat.
30_27.word_by_word: ते those, तस्मिन् in that, विमर्दे in war, शूलशक्तिनिस्त्रिंशविविधायुधपाणयः holding different kinds of weapons such as spears, tridents and swords, उद्वेगकारणात् due to fear, वेगेन speedily, आपतेयुः will collect.

30_28.shloka: समृद्धस्तैस्तु परितो विधमन् रक्षसां बलम्।।5.30.28।।शक्नुयां न तु संप्राप्तुं परं पारं महोदधेः।
30_28.translation: "With them around me, I may not be able to  reach the other end of the ocean (my strength spent in the combat.)
30_28.word_by_word: तैः by them, परितः around me, समृद्धः filled, रक्षसाम् of demons, बलम् power, विधमन् while subduing, महोदधेः great sea, परं पारम् to the other side, सम्प्राप्तुम् to reach, न शक्नुयाम् not be possib.le

30_29.shloka: मां वा गृह्णीयुराप्लुत्य बहवश्शीघ्रकारिणः।।5.30.29।।स्यादियं चागृहीतार्था मम च ग्रहणं भवेत्।
30_29.translation: "The ogres who are in large numbers, here are very prompt to act. They will jump into the sky and bind me. Sita will not receive the message and I will be taken into custody by the demons.
30_29.word_by_word: शीघ्रकारिणः prompt, बहवः a large number, आप्लुत्य jumping into the sky, माम् me, गृह्णीयुः वा may catch me, इयं च this lady, अगृहीतार्था may not receive the message, स्यात् may be, मम my, ग्रहणं च arrest, भवेत् will be done.

30_30.shloka: हिंसाभिरुचयो हिंस्युरिमां वा जनकात्मजाम्।।5.30.30।।विपन्नं स्यात्ततः कार्यं रामसुग्रीवयोरिदम्।
30_30.translation: "These demons who are keen on indulging in violence will harm Janaka's daughter. Then the mission of Rama and Sugriva will also fail.
30_30.word_by_word: वा or, हिंसाभिरुचयः keen on indulging in violence, इमाम् this lady, जनकात्मजाम् daughter of Janaka, हिंस्युः harm her, ततः then, रामसुग्रीवयोः of Rama and Sugriva, इदम् this, कार्यम् mission, विपन्नं स्यात् will fail.

30_31.shloka: उद्देशे नष्टमार्गेऽस्मिन् राक्षसैः परिवारिते।।5.30.31।।सागरेण परिक्षिप्ते गुप्ते वसति जानकी।
30_31.translation: "Janaki is staying in this untraceable location surrounded by demons. And this location is a secret place surrounded by the ocean .
30_31.word_by_word: जानकी Janaki, नष्टमार्गे in a hidden location, राक्षसैः by the ogres, परिवारिते surrounded, सागरेण by the ocean, परिक्षिप्ते surrounded allover, गुप्ते in a secret place, अस्मिन् in this, उद्धेशे in this, वसति staying.

30_32.shloka: विशस्ते वा गृहीते वा रक्षोभिर्मयि संयुगे।।5.30.32।।नान्यं पश्यामि रामस्य सहायं कार्यसाधने।
30_32.translation: "If I am killed in the combat or captured by the demons, I do not see another person who can help in accomplishing this task.
30_32.word_by_word: मयि me, संयुगे in a battle, रक्षोभिः by ogres, विशस्ते वा if I am killed, गृहीते वा or captured,रामस्य of Rama, कार्यसाधने to accomplish the task, अन्यम् another, सहायम् help, न पश्यामि I do not see.

30_33.shloka: विमृशंश्च न पश्यामि यो हते मयि वानरः।।5.30.33।।शतयोजनविस्तीर्णं लङ्घयेत महोदधिम्।
30_33.translation: "When I am killed here, I cannot see any other vanara who can leap over a hundred yojanas of the ocean (to reach this place).
30_33.word_by_word: मयि when I am, हते killed, यः whosoever, वानरः vanara, शतयोजनविस्तीर्णम् extended over a distance of hundred yojanas, महोदधिम् the ocean, लङ्घयेत् can leap over, विमृशन् च even while reflecting carefully, न पश्यामि I cannot see.

30_34.shloka: कामं हन्तुं समर्थोऽस्मि सहस्राण्यपि रक्षसाम्।।5.30.34।।न तु शक्ष्यामि सम्प्राप्तुं परं पारं महोदधेः।
30_34.translation: "I may be capable of killing even thousands of demons but thereafter (thoroughly exhausted) reach the other side of the ocean.
30_34.word_by_word: रक्षसाम् of demons, सहस्राण्यपि even thousands of them, हन्तुम् to kill, समर्थः capable, अस्मि कामम् I am surely, तु also, महोदधेः of the ocean, परं पारम् to cross over, सम्प्राप्तुम् to reach, न शक्ष्यामि it may not be possible.

30_35.shloka: असत्यानि च युद्धानि संशयो मे न रोचते।।5.30.35।।कश्च निस्संशयं कार्यं कुर्यात्प्राज्ञः ससंशयम्।
30_35.translation: "Battles, no doubt, are unpredictable. Which wise man with a sound intellect will take up a doubtful work unhesitatingly?
30_35.word_by_word: युद्धानि battles, असत्यानि च not true, संशयः doubtful, मे I, न रोचते it does not please me, कः who, प्राज्ञः wise man, निःसंशयम् without any doubt, कार्यम् task, ससंशयम् without any doubt, कुर्यात् will take up.
