30_36.shloka: प्राणत्यागश्च वैदेह्या भवेदनभिभाषणे।।5.30.36।।एष दोषो महान्हि स्यान्मम सीताभिभाषणे।
30_36.translation: "If I talk to Vaidehi it will be a great mistake on my part.If I do not speak to Vaidehi she may give up her life.
30_36.word_by_word: अनभिभाषणे if I do not speak, वैदेह्याः of Vaidehi, प्राणत्यागश्च abandonement of life, भवेत् may be, सीताभिभाषणे on talking to Sita, मम to me, एषः such, महान् great, दोषः drawback, स्यात् will be.

30_37.shloka: भूताश्चार्था विनश्यन्ति देशकालविरोधिताः।।5.30.37।।विक्लबं दूतमासाद्य तमः सूर्योदये यथा।
30_37.translation: "Even well planned diplomatic missions fail like darkness dispelled at Sunrise if the messenger is confused and if the place and time are not propitious for them.
30_37.word_by_word: विक्लबम् a confused person, दूतम् messenger, आसाद्य by appointing, भूताः even sure ones, अर्थाः missions, देशकालविरोधिताः if place and time are not propitious, सूर्योदये at Sunrise, तमः यथा like the darkness, विनश्यन्ति will be destroyed.

30_38.shloka: अर्थानर्थान्तरे बुद्धिनिश्चितापि न शोभते।।5.30.38।।घातयन्ति हि कार्याणि दूताः पण्डितमानिनः।
30_38.translation: "Swinging from a course of action or an action leading to calamity is not proper.Messengers who assume that they are scholars (blinded by ego) destroy their mission.
30_38.word_by_word: अर्थानर्थान्तरे swinging from a course of action or an action leading to calamity, बुद्धि intelligence, निश्चितापि though decided, न शोभते not proper, पण्डितमानिनः selfstyled scholars, दूताः messengers, कार्याणि their missions, घातयन्ति हि will be destroyed.

30_39.shloka: न विनश्येत्कथं कार्यं वैक्लब्यं न कथं भवेत्।।5.30.39।।लङ्घनं च समुद्रस्य कथं नु न वृथा भवेत्।
30_39.translation: "How can the mission succeed? How can failure of mission be avoided? How can the crossing of the great ocean be not wasted?"
30_39.word_by_word: कार्यम् task, कथम् how, न विनश्येत् may not be spoilt, वैक्लब्यम् failure, कथम् how, न भवेत् not be allowed to take place, समुद्रस्य ocean's, लङ्घनं च crossing, कथं नु how indeed, वृथा wasteful, न भवेत् not to be.

30_40.shloka: कथं नु खलु वाक्यं मे शृणुयान्नोद्विजेत वा।इति सञ्चिन्त्य हनुमांश्चकार मतिमान्मतिम्।।5.30.40।।
30_40.translation: Wise Hanuman came to a decision after reflecting in his mind about how not to create fear in Sita (while communicating with her.)
30_40.word_by_word: मे वाक्यम् my words, कथं नु how to, शृणुयायात् she may listen, न उद्विजेत वा and not get agitated, इति thus, सञ्चिन्त्य reflecting, मतिमान् wise, हनुमान् Hanuman, मतिम् in his mind, चकार exercised.

30_41.translation: "By praising Rama who is very dear, who is judicious in action and in whom her mind is absorbed, I will not create fear.
30_41.word_by_word: अक्लिष्टकर्माणम् one who is judicious in action, सुबन्धुम् very dear to her, रामम् Rama, अनुकीर्तयन् by praising him, तद्बन्धुगतमानसाम् since her mind is absorbed in him, एनाम् her, नोद्वेजयिष्यामि I will not create fear.

30_42.shloka: इक्ष्वाकूणां वरिष्ठस्य रामस्य विदितात्मनः।।5.30.42।।शुभानि धर्मयुक्तानि वचनानि समर्पयन्।श्रावयिष्यामि सर्वाणि मधुरां प्रब्रुवन् गिरम्।।5.30.43।।श्रद्धास्यति यथाहीयं तथा सर्वं समादधे।
30_42.translation: "I shall present in auspicious words the esteemed Rama of Ikshvaku family who is a knower of self and make her listen to everything in such a sweet manner that she will trust me.
30_42.word_by_word: इक्ष्वाकूणाम् in Ikshvaku race, वरिष्ठस्य of the esteemed person, विदितात्मनः of the knower of the self, रामस्य Rama's, शुभानि auspicious, वचनानि words, समर्पयन् by offering, मधुराम् sweet, गिरम् word, प्रब्रुवन् while uttering, सर्वाणि everything, श्रावयिष्यामि will make her listen, इयम् this, यथा as, श्रद्धास्यति will trust me, सर्वम् everything, समाददे I will present.

30_43.shloka: इति स बहुविधं महानुभावोजगतिपतेः प्रमदामवेक्षमाणः।मधुरमवितथं जगाद वाक्यंद्रुमविटपान्तरमास्थितो हनूमान्।।5.30.44।।
30_43.translation: Highsouled Hanuman seated on the branch of the tree without being seen began to speak faithfully in praise of the lord of the universe in many ways while looking at her.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये सुन्दरकाण्डे त्रिंशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the thirtieth sarga of Sundarakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
30_43.word_by_word: महानुभावः magnanimous, सः हनूमान् that Hanuman, द्रुमविटपान्तरम् behind the branch of the tree, आस्थितः seated, जगतिपतेः of the lord of the universe, प्रमदाम् wife, अवेक्षमाणः seeing, बहुविधम् in many ways, अवितथम् faithful, वाक्यम् words, इति thus, जगाद spoke

31_1.shloka: [Hanuman sings the story of glory of Rama within Sita's hearing.]एवं बहुविधां चिन्तां चिन्तयित्वा महाकपिः।संश्रवे मधुरं वाक्यं वैदेह्या व्याजहार ह।।5.31.1।।
31_1.translation: After deliberating in several ways the great Hanuman spoke these sweet words to Vaidehi:
31_1.word_by_word: महाकपिः great vanara, एवम् thus, बहुविधाम् in several ways, चिन्ताम् thought, चिन्तयित्वा deliberating in his mind, वैदेह्याः Vaidehi's, संश्रवे hearing, मधुरम् sweet, वाक्यम् words, व्याजहार ह  spoke.

31_2.shloka: राजा दशरथो नाम रथकुञ्जरवाजिमान्।पुण्यशीलो महाकीर्तिरिक्ष्वाकूणां महायशाः।।5.31.2।।
31_2.translation: "There was an illustrious king called Dasaratha in Ikshvaku race, a master of chariots, elephants and horses. He was highly meritorious and renowned.
31_2.word_by_word: रथकुञ्जरवाजिमान् with chariots, elephants and horses, पुण्यशीलः foremost in merits, महाकीर्तिः renowned, इक्ष्वाकूणाम् in Ikshvaku race, महायशाः illustrious, दशरथो नाम called Dasaratha, राजा king.

31_3.shloka: राजर्षीणां गुणश्रेष्ठस्तपसा चर्षिभि स्समः।चक्रवर्तिकुले जातः पुरन्दरसमो बले।।5.31.3।।
31_3.translation: "He was the most virtuous among royal sages, equal to sages in austerity, born in the race of emperors and equal to Indra in might.
31_3.word_by_word: राजर्षीणाम् among sagelike kings, गुणश्रेष्ठः most virtuous one, तपसा in austerity, ऋषिभिः with sages, समः equal, चक्रवर्तिकुले in a dynasty of emperors, जातः born, बले in might, पुरन्दरसमः crusher of citadels like Indra.

31_4.translation: "He was committed to nonviolence, magnanimous, compassionate and one whose strength was truth. He was not only a prosperous king of Ikshvaku family but also a promoter of prosperity of others too.
31_4.word_by_word: अहिंसारतिः committed to nonviolence, अक्षुद्रः magnanimous, घृणी compassionate, सत्यपराक्रमः one whose strength truth, इक्ष्वाकुवंशस्य of Ikshvaku family, मुख्यश्च chief, लक्ष्मीवान् prosperous, लक्ष्मिवर्धनः increaser of riches.

31_5.translation: "Endowed with signs of kingship and vast wealth, he was a bull among rulers of the vast earth, surrounded by the sea. A happy king himself, he was wellknown as a provider of happiness.
31_5.word_by_word: पार्थिवव्यञ्जनैः with signs of kingship, युक्तः endowed, पृथुश्रीः with vast wealth, पार्थिवर्षभः a bull among rulers, चतुरन्तायाम् surrounded by the sea, पृथिव्याम् on the earth, विश्रुतः well known, सुखदः provider of happiness (to people), सुखी happy man.

31_6.shloka: तस्य पुत्रः प्रियो ज्येष्ठस्ताराधिपनिभाननः।रामो नाम विशेषज्ञः श्रेष्ठ स्सर्वधनुष्मताम्।।5.31.6।।
31_6.translation: "His beloved eldest son Rama, whose countenance is like the full moon, is a scholar of all branches of knowledge and is foremost among the bowmen on earth.
31_6.word_by_word: तस्य his, प्रियः beloved, ताराधिपनिभाननः of Moon like face, विशेषज्ञः scholar of all knowledge, सर्वधनुष्मताम् among all those wielders of bow, श्रेष्ठः foremost, रामो नाम called Rama, ज्येष्ठः पुत्रः eldest son.

31_7.shloka: रक्षिता स्वस्य धर्मस्य स्वजनस्य च रक्षिता।रक्षिता जीवलोकस्य धर्मस्य च परन्तपः।।5.31.7।।
31_7.translation: "The scourage of enemies, he is a protector of righteousness and of his kins and all living creatures. He is an embodiment of righteousness.
31_7.word_by_word: परन्तपः scourage of foes, स्वस्य his, धर्मस्य of righteousness, रक्षिता a  protector, स्वजनस्य of his kins, रक्षिता a protector, जीवलोकस्य of all living creatures, धर्मस्य च and of righteousness, रक्षिता protector.

31_8.shloka: तस्य सत्याभिसन्धस्य वृद्धस्य वचनात्पितुः।सभार्यस्सह च भ्रात्रा वीरः प्रव्राजितो वनम्।।5.31.8।।
31_8.translation: "Honouring the word of his aged father who was ever steadfast in truth, Rama left for the forest along with his wife and brother.
31_8.word_by_word: सत्याभिसन्धस्य ever steadfast in truth, वृद्धस्य of the aged, पितुः father, तस्य his, वचनात्  honouring the word, वीरः hero, सभार्यः along with wife, सह च भ्रात्रा and accompanied by his brother, वनम् forest, प्रव्राजितः went as a wanderer.

31_9.shloka: तेन तत्र महारण्ये मृगयां परिधावता।राक्षसा निहताश्शूरा बहवः कामरूपिणः।।5.31.9।।
31_9.translation: "In the deep forest he went round hunting animals and killing the demon warriors who assumed any form at their free will.
31_9.word_by_word: तत्र there, महारण्ये in the thick forest, मृगयाम् hunting, परिधावता while chasing, तेन by him, शूराः warriors, कामरूपिणः those who can assume any form at their will, बहवः many, राक्षसाः demons, निहताः killed.

31_10.shloka: जनस्थानवधं श्रुत्वा हतौ च खरदूषणौ।ततस्त्वमर्षापहृता जानकी रावणेन तु।।5.31.10।।वञ्चयित्वा वने रामं मृगरूपेण मायया।
31_10.translation: "Ravana having heard about the killing of all demons at Janasthana including Khara and Dooshana in the forest, deceived Rama in the guise of a deer and abducted Janaki in anger.
31_10.word_by_word: ततः then, जनस्थानवधम् killing at Janasthana, हतौ killed, खरदूषणौ च Khara and Dooshana, श्रुत्वा having heard, वने in the forest, रामम्  Rama, मृगरूपेण in the form of a deer, मायया by creating illusion, वञ्चयित्वा having deceived, रावणेन by Ravana, जानकी Janaki, अमर्षापहृता abducted out of anger.

31_11.shloka: स मार्गमाणस्तां देवीं रामस्सीतामनिन्दिताम्।।5.31.11।।आससाद वने मित्रं सुग्रीवं नाम वानरम्।
31_11.translation: "While looking for the goddesslike lady, the sinless Sita in the forest, Rama met a monkey called Sugriva and made friendship with him
31_11.word_by_word: सः रामः that Rama, अनिन्दिताम् sinless, देवीम् goddesslike lady, तां सीताम् that Sita, मार्गमाणः looking for, वने in the forest, सुग्रीवं नाम called Sugriva, वानरम् monkey, मित्रम् friendship, आससाद met.

31_12.shloka: तत स्स वालिनं हत्वा रामः परपुरञ्जयः।।5.31.12।।प्रायच्छत्कपिराज्यं तत्सुग्रीवाय महाबलः।
31_12.translation: "Rama, a powerful king, who can win enemy forts killed Vali and offered the monkey kingdom to Sugriva.
31_12.word_by_word: ततः then, परपुरञ्जयः one who can win over enemy forts, महाबलः powerful, सः रामः that Rama, वालिनम् that Vali, हत्वा having killed, तत् that, कपिराज्यम् kingdom of the monkeys, सुग्रीवाय to Sugriva, प्रायच्छत् offered.

31_13.shloka: सुग्रीवेणापि सन्दिष्टा हरयः कामरूपिणः।।5.31.13।।दिक्षु सर्वासु तां देवीं विचिन्वन्ति सहस्रशः।
31_13.translation: "Having received Sugriva's orders thousands of monkeys who can assume any form went searching for that divine queen in all directions.
31_13.word_by_word: सुग्रीवेण by Sugriva, सन्दिष्टाः received orders, कामरूपिणः those who can assume any form, कपयः monkeys, सहस्रशः in thousands, सर्वासु all over, दिक्षु in directions, तां देवीम् that divine queen, विचिन्वन्ति are searching.

31_14.translation: "On hearing the words of Sampati I leaped the wide ocean swiftly crossing a hundred yojanas in quest of the largeeyed Sita.
31_14.word_by_word: अहम् I am, सम्पातिवचनात् by the words of Sampati, वेगवान् swiftly, अस्याः for her, विशालाक्ष्याः largeeyed, हेतोः for the cause, शतयोजनम् a hundred yojanas, आयतम् wide, सागरम् ocean, प्लुतः leaped.

31_15.shloka: यथारूपां यथावर्णां यथालक्ष्मीवतीं च निश्चिताम्।।5.31.15।।अश्रौषं राघवस्याहं सेयमासादिता मया।
31_15.translation: "Surely I have seen here a lady of similar body, of similar complexion, of similar glow and beauty as described by Rama".
31_15.word_by_word: अहम् I, राघवस्य Raghava's, ताम् her, यथारूपाम् of a similar form, यथावर्णाम् of the same complexion, यथालक्ष्मी of similar glow, अश्रौषम् I heard, सा she, इयम् the same one, मया by me, आसादिता has been found.

31_16.shloka: विररामैवमुक्त्वासौ वाचं वानरपुङ्गवः।।5.31.16।।जानकी चापि तच्छ्रुत्वा परं विस्मयमागता।
31_16.translation: Having spoken thus, the great vanara stopped speaking after that. Janaki was wonderstruck by the words of the vanara.
31_16.word_by_word: असौ he, वानरपुङ्गवः chief of the vanaras, एवम् in that way, वाचम् word, उक्त्वा having spoken, विरराम stopped, जानकी चापि even Janaki, तत् that, श्रुत्वा having heard, परम् great, विस्मयम् wonder, आगता felt.

31_17.shloka: ततस्सा वक्रकेशान्ता सुकेशी केशसंवृतम्।।5.31.17।।उन्नम्य वदनं भीरुश्शिंशुपावृक्षमैक्षत।
31_17.translation: Then Sita looked up at the Simsupa tree timidly, her face covered with beautiful curly hair.
31_17.word_by_word: ततः then, वक्रकेशान्ता one who had hair curled up at the ends, भीरुः (timid) lady, क्लेशसंवृतम् covered with hanging hair, सा she, वदनम् face, उन्नम्य by raising, शिंशुपावृक्षम् Simsupa tree, ऐक्षत looked up.

31_18.shloka: निशम्य सीता वचनं कपेश्च दिशश्च सर्वाः प्रदिशश्च वीक्ष्य।स्वयं प्रहर्षं परमं जगाम सर्वात्मना राममनुस्मरन्ती ।।5.31.18।।
31_18.translation: On hearing Hanuman's words Sita looked at all directions and quarters while quietly contemplating on Rama, the self of all and experienced supreme joy.
31_18.word_by_word: सीता Sita, कपेः Hanuman's, वचनम् word, निशम्य after hearing, सर्वाः all, दिशश्च directions, प्रदिशश्च and quarters, वीक्ष्य after observing, स्वयम् herself, सर्वात्मना self of all, रामम् Rama, अनुस्मरन्ती contemplating on, परमम् supreme, प्रहर्षम् joy, जगाम experienced.

31_19.shloka: सा तिर्यगूर्ध्वं च तथाप्यधस्तान्निरीक्षमाणा तमचिन्त्यबुद्धिम्।ददर्श पिङ्गाधिपतेरमात्यं वातात्मजं सूर्यमिवोदयस्थम्।।5.31.19।।
31_19.translation: She looked obliquely, up, and down and saw Hanuman of unimaginable intelligence, the minister of the monkey lord, son of the Windgod, who looked like the rising Sun.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये सुन्दरकाण्डे एकत्रिंशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the thirtyfirst sarga of Sundarakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
31_19.word_by_word: सा she, तिर्यक् obliquely, ऊर्ध्वं च vertically, तथापि so also, अथस्तात् downward, निरीक्षमाणा observing, अचिन्त्यबुद्धिम् of unimaginable intelligence, पिङ्गाधिपतेः of king of monkeys, अमात्यम् minister, उदयस्थम् rising, सूर्यमिव like Sun, तं वातात्मजम् that son of the Windgod, ददर्श saw.

32_1.shloka: [Sita's conjucture]ततश्शाखान्तरे लीनं दृष्ट्वा चलितमानसा।वेष्टितार्जुनवस्त्रं तं विद्युत्सङ्घातपिङ्गलम्।।5.32.1।।
32_1.translation: Sita got perplexed on seeing him (Hanuman), who was tawny in complexion and looked like a cluster of lightnings, clad in white  and hidden in between the branches.
32_1.word_by_word: ततः then, शाखान्तरे in between the branches, लीनम् hidden, वेष्टितार्जुनवस्त्रम्  clad in white, विद्युत्सङ्घातपिङ्गलम् of tawny complexion like a cluster of lightnings, तम् him, दृष्ट्वा  seeing, चलितमानसा got perplexed.

32_2.shloka: सा ददर्श कपिं तत्र प्रश्रितं प्रियवादिनम्।फुल्लाशोकोत्कराभासं तप्तचामीकरेक्षणम्।।5.32.2।।
32_2.translation: There (on the tree) she noticed a monkey like a cluster of fully blossomed Ashoka flower, shining bright, whose eyes were glowing like pure molten gold, speaking softly and pleasingly.
32_2.word_by_word: सा she, तत्र there, फुल्लाशोकोत्कराभासम् bright like fullyblossomed Ashoka flower, तप्तचामीकरेक्षणम् whose eyes are bright like molten gold, प्रश्रितम् was readily approaching, प्रियवादिनम् one who spoke softly and pleasingly, कपिम् monkey, ददर्श saw.

32_3.shloka: मैथिली चिन्तयामास विस्मयं परमं गता।अहो भीममिदं रूपं वानरस्य दुरासदम्।।5.32.3।।दुर्निरीक्षमिति ज्ञात्वा पुनरेव मुमोह सा।
32_3.translation: Astonisted Mythili began thinking. 'Oh this vanara's appearance is frightening. He is terrible to look at. He is inaccessible'. Thinking over this again and again, she fainted.
32_3.word_by_word: मैथिली Mythili, परमम् supreme, विस्मयम् astonishment, गता felt, चिन्तयामास began thinking,अहो Oh, वानरस्य vanara's, दुरासदम् inaccessible, इदम् this, रूपम् appearance, भीमम् frightening, दुर्निरीक्षम् impossible to look at, इति thus, ज्ञात्वा thinking, सा she, पुनरेव once again, मुमोह fainted.

32_4.shloka: विललाप भृशं सीता करुणं भयमोहिता।।5.32.4।।रामरामेति दुःखार्ता लक्ष्मणेति च भामिनी।रुरोद बहुधा सीता मन्दं मन्दस्वरा सती।।5.32.5।।
32_4.translation: Overcome with sorrow and fear, noble Sita sobbed pitiably muttering repeatedly. 'O Rama, O Rama, O Lakshmana'.
32_4.word_by_word: भामिनी a noble lady, सीता Sita, भयमोहिता overcome with fear, दुःखार्ता sorrowful, रामरामेति saying Rama, Rama, लक्ष्मणेति च and Lakshmana also, भृशम् repeatedly, करुणम् pitiably, विललाप cried, सीता Sita, मन्दस्वरा सती in low voice, बहुधा many ways, रुरोद cried.

32_5.shloka: सा तं दृष्ट्वा हरिश्रेष्ठं विनीतवदुपस्थितम्।मैथिली चिन्तयामास स्वप्नोऽयमिति भामिनी।।5.32.6।।
32_5.translation: Noble Sita, seeing the best of vanaras who stood near humbly, began reflecting 'Is this a dream'?
32_5.word_by_word: भामिनी noble lady, सा मैथिली that Maithili, विनीतवत् humbly, उपस्थितम् stood near, तम् him, हरिश्रेष्ठम् best of vanaras, दृष्ट्वा after seeing, अयम् this, स्वप्नः dream, इति thus, चिन्तयामास began thinking.

32_6.shloka: सा वीक्षमाणा पृथुभुग्नवक्त्रं शाखामृगेन्द्रस्य यथोक्तकारम्।ददर्श पिङ्गाधिपते रमात्यं वातात्मजं बुद्धिमतां वरिष्ठम्।।5.32.7।।
32_6.translation: Looking here and there, she saw a monkey with a large, curved face, an obedient servant and a minister of the monkeylord, the foremost among the intelligentia and the son of the Windgod.
32_6.word_by_word: सा she, वीक्षमाणा was looking here and there, पृथुभुग्नवक्त्रम् with a large curved face, शाखामृगेन्द्रस्य of the lord of monkeys, यथोक्तकारम् obedient servant, पिङ्गाधिपते of the king of monkeys, अमात्यम् minister, बुद्धिमताम् among the intelligent, वरिष्ठम् foremost, वातात्मजम् son of the windgod, ददर्श saw.

32_7.shloka: सा तं समीक्ष्यैव भृशं विसंज्ञा गतासुकल्पेन बभूव सीता।चिरेण संज्ञां प्रतिलभ्य भूयो विचिन्तयामास विशालनेत्रा।।5.32.8।।
32_7.translation: The largeeyed Sita lost her senses looking at him. She got back her senses after a long time and started thinking again:
32_7.word_by_word: सा सीता that Sita, तम् him, समीक्ष्यैव after looking at, भृशम् greatly, विसंज्ञा lost senses, गतासुकल्पेव as if she was almost dead, बभूव remained, विशालनेत्रा largeeyed, चिरेण after a long time, संज्ञाम् senses, प्रतिलभ्य after getting back, भूयः again, विचिन्तयामास started thinking

32_8.shloka: स्वप्ने मयाऽयं विकृतोऽद्य दृष्टश्शाखामृगश्शास्त्रगणैर्निषिद्धः।स्वस्त्यस्तु रामाय स लक्ष्मणाय तथा पितुर्मे जनकस्य राज्ञः।।5.32.9।।
32_8.translation: 'Today I saw an ugly monkey in my dream. Its sight in a dream is inauspicious according to sastras. Let it be auspicious for Lakshmana and Rama for the sake of my father Janaka.
32_8.word_by_word: अद्य today, मया by me, विकृतः an ugly form, शास्त्रगणैः by sastras, निषिद्धः prohibited, शाखामृगः monkey, स्वप्ने in a dream, दृष्टः is seen, सलक्ष्मणाय for Lakshmana, रामाय for Rama, तथा so also, मे पितुः my father, जनकस्य राज्ञः of the king Janaka, स्वस्ति auspicious, अस्तु be

32_9.shloka: स्वप्नोऽपि नायं नहि मेऽस्ति निद्रा शोकेन दुःखेन च पीडितायाः।सुखं हि मे नास्ति यतोऽस्मि हीना तेनेन्दुपूर्णप्रतिमाननेन।।5.32.10।।
32_9.translation: "But no, it was not a dream for tormented by grief and sorrow I cannot have a dream. When separated from the moonfaced Rama I have no sleep or pleasure, how can I have dream?
32_9.word_by_word: अयम् this, स्वप्नोऽपि even in a dream, न not, शोकेन with grief, दुःखेन च and with sorrow, पीडितायाः  a tormented woman, मे  to me, निद्रा sleep, नास्ति हि not there, मे to me, सुखम् pleasure, नास्ति हि not there, यतः therefore, इन्दुपूर्णप्रतिमाननेन whose face is like a fullmoon, तेन with him, हीना devoid, अस्मि I am

32_10.shloka: रामेति रामेति सदैव बुद्ध्या विचिन्त्य वाचा ब्रुवती तमेव।तस्यानुरूपां च कथां तदर्थमेवं प्रपश्यामि तथा शृणोमि।।5.32.11।।
32_10.translation: "I am always meditating upon Rama and thinking of him alone. I am talking about things related to him. Because of that I see him and hear him.
32_10.word_by_word: रामेति रामेति only Rama Rama, सदा ऐव always, बुद्ध्या with my brain, विचिन्त्य after thinking, तमेव him alone, ब्रुवती thinking of, तस्य his, अनुरूपाम् favourable, तदर्थम् for his sake, कथाम् talk, एवम् in this way, प्रपश्यामि I am seeing, तथा so  also, शृणोमि I am hearing.

32_11.shloka: अहं हि तस्याद्य मनोभवेन सम्पीडिता तद्गतसर्वभावा।विचिन्तयन्ती सततं तमेव तथैव पश्यामि तथा शृणोमि।।5.32.12।।
32_11.translation: "I am tormented by intense love for Rama, with all my thoughts immersed in him. Since I am constantly thinking of him I see him and hear words about him. (She thinks it is all hallucination.)
32_11.word_by_word: अद्य now, अहम् I, तस्य his, मनोभवेन by love for him, सम्पीडिता tormented, तद्गतसर्वभावा all my thoughts immersed in him, सततम् always, तमेव about him only, विचिन्तयन्ती while I am thinking of, तथैव in a similar manner, पश्यामि I am seeing, तथैव only in such a way, शृणोमि I am listening.

32_12.shloka: मनोरथस्स्यादिति चिन्तयामि तथापि बुद्ध्या च वितर्कयामि।किं कारणं तस्य हि नास्ति रूपं सुव्यक्तरूपश्च वदत्ययं माम्।।5.32.13।।
32_12.translation: "I feel it is only the desire in my mind. Desire has no form. But the one who is addressing me has a form. I cannot understand this.
32_12.word_by_word: मनोरथः desire, स्यात् may be, इति thus, चिन्तयामि I think, बुद्ध्या च thinking, तथा like that, वितर्कयामि I am deliberating, तस्य its, रूपम् form, नास्ति हि is not seen, अयम् this, सुव्यक्तरूपः seen in a manifested form, माम् by me, वदति speaks, कारणम् cause, किम् what?

32_13.shloka: नमोऽस्तु वाचस्पतये सवज्रिणे स्वयंभुवे चैव हुताशनाय च।अनेन चोक्तं यदिदं ममाग्रतो वनौकसा तच्छ तथास्तु नान्यथा।।5.32.14।।
32_13.translation: "My salutations to Indra, Brihaspati, Brahma the creator and also to the firegod. Let all those words spoken by the vanara here in front of me be true and not other than that."इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये सुन्दरकाण्डे द्वात्रिंशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the thirtysecond sarga of Sundarakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
32_13.word_by_word: सवज्रिणे along with Indra, वाचस्पतये for Brihaspati, स्वयंभुवे चैव even for the creator Brahma, हुताशनाय for god of fire, च also, नमः salutations, अस्तु may be, अनेन by him, वनौकसा by the resident of the forest, मम अग्रतः in front of me, यत् whatever, इदम् this, उक्तम् spoken, तत् that, तथा true, अस्तु may be, अन्यथा other than that, न not be.

33_1.shloka: [Sita reveals her story to Hanuman.]सोऽवतीर्य द्रुमात्तस्माद्विद्रुमप्रतिमाननः।विनीतवेषः कृपणः प्रणिपत्योपसृत्य च।।5.33.1।।तामब्रवीन्महातेजा हनूमान्मारुतात्मजः।शिरस्यञ्जलिमाधाय सीतां मधुरया गिरा।।5.33.2।।
33_1.translation: Hanuman, son of the Windgod whose face shone like coral, dressed in a sober manner climbed down the tree, went close to Sita, offered salutations with his palms on his head and spoke in sweet words:
33_1.word_by_word: विद्रुमप्रतिमानन: whose face was like the colour of a coral, महातेजाः shining, मारुतात्मजः son of the Windgod, सः हनुमान् Hanuman, तस्मात् from that, द्रुमात् from the tree, अवतीर्य having climbed down, विनीतवेषः dressed in a sober manner, कृपणः piteous, प्रणिपत्य having offered salutations, उपसृत्य went near her, शिरसि on his head, अञ्चलिम् having folded palms, आधाय placed, तां सीताम् her, Sita, मधुरया in sweet, गिरा words, अब्रवीत् spoke.

33_2.shloka: का नु पद्मपलाशाक्षि क्लिष्टकौशेयवासिनि।द्रुमस्य शाखामालम्ब्य तिष्ठसि त्वमनिन्दिते।।5.33.3।।
33_2.translation: "O blameless lady with eyes like lotus petals, in crumpled silk, holding a branch, and standing, who are you?
33_2.word_by_word: पद्मपलाशाक्षि O one with eyes like lotus petals, क्लिष्टकौशेयवासिनि robed in crumpled silk, अनिन्दिते blameless lady, द्रुमस्य of the tree, शाखाम् branch, आलम्ब्य by holding, तिष्ठसि you are standing, का नु who are you?

33_3.shloka: किमर्थम् तव नेत्राभ्यां वारि स्रवति शोकजम्।पुण्डरीकपलाशाभ्यां विप्रकीर्णमिवोदकम्।।5.33.4।।
33_3.translation: "Why are tears of grief flowing from your eyes like water trickling down a pair of petals of white lotuses?
33_3.word_by_word: पुण्डरीकपलाशाभ्याम् from two petals of white lotus, विप्रकीर्णम् trickled, उदकम् इव like water, तव your, नेत्राभ्याम् from your eyes, शोकजम् tears of grief, वारि water, किमर्थम् for what reason, स्रवति is flowing.

33_4.shloka: सुराणामसुराणां वा नागगन्धर्वरक्षसाम्।यक्षाणां किन्नराणां वा का त्वं भवसि शोभने।।5.33.5।।
33_4.translation: "O noble lady, are you a goddess or a demoness, a naga, a gandharva, a rakshasa, a yaksha or a kinnera?
33_4.word_by_word: शोभने O auspicious one, त्वम् you, सुराणाम् among gods, असुराणां वा or demons, नागगन्धर्वरक्षसाम् of nagas, gandharvas, rakshasas, यक्षाणाम् of yakshas, किन्नराणां वा or kinneras, का who, भवसि you are.

33_5.shloka: का त्वं भवसि रुद्राणां मरुतां वा वरानने।वसूनां हि वरारोहे देवता प्रतिभासि मे।।5.33.6।।
33_5.translation: "O beautiful lady Do you belong to the race of Rudras, or Marutas, or Vasus?. O noble lady, you appear a goddess to me.
33_5.word_by_word: वरानने O beautiful lady, त्वम् you, रुद्राणाम् of the Rudras, मरुतां वा or even Marutas, वसूनाम् of Vasus, का who, भवसि you are, वरारोहे O fine woman, देवता goddess, मे to me, प्रतिभासि  you appear

33_6.shloka: कि नु चन्द्रमसा हीना पतिता विबुधालयात्।रोहिणी ज्योतिषां श्रेष्ठा श्रेष्ठसर्वगुणान्विता।।5.33.7।।
33_6.translation: "are you Rohini, embellished with best virtues among the constellations? Have you come down from the abode of the luminaries separated from the Moon, her lord?
33_6.word_by_word: चन्द्रमसा from the Moon, हीना separated, विबुधालयात् from the abode of the gods, पतिता fallen down, ज्योतिषाम् among the luminaries, श्रेष्ठा best one, श्रेष्ठसर्वगुणान्विता who has all best qualities, रोहिणी Rohini किं नु you may be

33_7.shloka: का त्वं भवसि कल्याणि त्वमनिन्दितलोचने।कोपाद्वा यदि वा मोहाद्भर्तारमसितेक्षणे।।5.33.8।।वसिष्ठं कोपयित्वा त्वं नासि कल्याण्यरुन्धती।
33_7.translation: "O lady of lovely black eyes who are you? Have you by any chance offended your husband out of anger or out of delusion? Are you the auspicious Arundhati dislodged for making your lord Vasistha angry?
33_7.word_by_word: असितेक्षणे O lady of lovely black eyes, त्वम् you, कोपाद्वा or out of anger, यदि वा or else, मोहात् out of delusion, भर्तारम् husband, वसिष्ठम् Vasistha, कोपयित्वा making him angry, कल्याणि O auspicious lady, अरुन्धती Arundhati, नासि are you not

33_8.shloka: को नु पुत्रः पिता भ्राता भर्ता वा ते सुमध्यमे।।5.33.9।।अस्माल्लोकादमुं लोकं गतं त्वमनुशोचसि।
33_8.translation: "O woman of beautiful waist from which world have you come here? For whom are you worrying? Who is your son, father, brother or husband? Are you worrying about some one dead?.
33_8.word_by_word: सुमध्यमे O woman of beautiful waist, अस्मात् from this, लोकात् from the world, अमुं लोकम् to this world, गतम् dead, त्वम् your, अनुशोचसि worrying about, ते your, पुत्रः son, पिता father, भ्राता brother, भर्ता वा or is it husband, को नु is he?

33_9.translation: "From your weeping, your sighing and your touching the earth (gods do not touch the earth) and your signs of sovereignty, I do not think you are a goddess (meaning otherwise she posessed divine grace).
33_9.word_by_word: रोदनात् from your weeping, अतिनिश्श्वासात् breathing heavily, भूमिसंस्पर्शनादपि your touching the ground, राज्ञः royal, संज्ञावधारणात् having signs of sovereignty, त्वाम् you, देवीम् O goddess, अहम् I, न मन्ये I do not think.

33_10.shloka: व्यञ्जनानि च ते यानि लक्षणानि च लक्षये।।5.33.11।।महिषी भूमिपालस्य राजकन्या च मे मता।
33_10.translation: "On the basis of your royal signs and other qualities I infer that you are the daughter of a king or his consort.
33_10.word_by_word: ते your, यानि those, व्यञ्जनानि signs, लक्षणानि च also qualities, लक्षये I see, भूमिपालस्य king's, महिषी consort, राजकन्या च and a princess, मे to me, मता it is felt.

33_11.shloka: रावणेन जनस्थानाद्बलादपदहृता यदि।।5.33.12।।सीता त्वमसि भद्रं ते तन्ममाचक्ष्व पृच्छतः।
33_11.translation: "If you are Sita, who was forcefully borne away by Ravana from Janasthana you may kindly reveal to me freely. May god bless you.
33_11.word_by_word: त्वम् you, जनस्थानात् from Janasthana, रावणेन by Ravana, बलात् forcibly, अपहृता borne away, सीता Sita, असि यदि if you are, तत् that, पृच्छतः  enquiring, मम to me, आचक्ष्व you tell, ते भद्रम् wish you well.

33_12.shloka: यथा हि तव वै दैन्यं रूपं चाप्यतिमानुषम्।।5.33.13।।तपसा चान्वितो वेषस्त्वं राममहिषी ध्रुवम्।
33_12.translation: "Indeed your plight, the superhuman beauty and your robes marked with asceticism, surely tell me that you are Rama's queen."
33_12.word_by_word: तव your, दैन्यम् plight, अतिमानुषम् superhuman, रूपं च and your form, तपसा with austerity, अन्वितः endowed, वेषः your dress, यथा as much, त्वम् you are, ध्रुवम् surely, राममहिषी Rama's queen.

33_13.shloka: सा तस्य वचनं श्रुत्वा रामकीर्तनहर्षिता।।5.33.14।।उवाच वाक्यं वैदेही हनुमन्तं द्रुमाश्रितम्।
33_13.translation: Happy to have heard words of praise of Rama, Vaidehi spoke this to Hanuman, who got up the tree:
33_13.word_by_word: सा वैदेही that Vaidehi, तस्य his, वचनम् word, श्रुत्वा having heard, रामकीर्तनहर्षिता happy to hear words of praise of Rama, द्रुमाश्रितम् on the tree, हनुमन्तम् Hanuman, वाक्यम् these words, उवाच spoke.

33_14.shloka: पृथिव्यां राजसिंहानां मुख्यस्य विदितात्मनः।।5.33.15।।स्नुषा दशरथस्याहं शत्रुसैन्यप्रतापिनः।
33_14.translation: "I am daughterinlaw of king Dasaratha, knower of the self, the foremost among kings on earth and a slayer of enemy army.
33_14.word_by_word: अहम् I am, पृथिव्याम् on earth, राजसिंहानाम् among great kings, मुख्यस्य foremost, विदितात्मनः of the knower of self, शत्रुसैन्यप्रतापिनः of the slayer of enemy army, दशरथस्य Dasaratha's, स्नुषा daughterinlaw.

33_15.shloka: दुहिता जनकस्याहं वैदेहस्य महात्मनः।।5.33.16।।सीतेति नाम नाम्नाऽहं भार्या रामस्य धीमतः।
33_15.translation: "I am daughter of the great soul, Janaka, king of Videha, known as Sita. I am the wife of that sagacious Rama.
33_15.word_by_word: अहम् I am, वैदेहस्य Videha's, महात्मनः great soul, जनकस्य Janaka's, दुहिता daughter, नाम्ना सीतेति नाम Sita by name, अहम् I am, धीमतः of the sagacious, रामस्य Rama's, भार्या wife.

33_16.shloka: समा द्वादश तत्राहं राघवस्य निवेशने।।5.33.17।।भुञ्जाना मानुषान्भोगान्सर्वकामसमृद्धिनी।
33_16.translation: "I enjoyed worldly pleasures in abundance for twelve years at Rama's abode.
33_16.word_by_word: अहम् I am, तत्र there, राघवस्य Rama's, निवेशने the abode, मानुषान् mortal, भोगान् pleasures, भुञ्जाना experiencing, सर्वकामसमृद्धिनी all kinds of pleasures provided, द्वादश twelve, समाः years.

33_17.shloka: तत्र त्रयोदशे वर्षे राज्येनेक्ष्वाकुनन्दनम्।।5.33.18।।अभिषेचयितुं राजा सोपाध्यायः प्रचक्रमे।
33_17.translation: "Then in the thirteenth year king Dasaratha along with the royal preceptor arranged to  coronate Rama, delight of the Ikshvaku family, in the kingdom.
33_17.word_by_word: ततः then, त्रयोदशे in the thirteenth, वर्षे in the year, सोपाध्यायः with his preceptor, राजा the king, इक्ष्वाकुनन्दनम् delight of the Ikshvakus, राज्येन in the kingdom, अभिषेचयितुम् to coronate, प्रचक्रमे arranged.

33_18.shloka: तस्मिन्सम्भ्रियमाणे तु राघवस्याभिषेचने।।5.33.19।।कैकयी नाम भर्तारं देवी वचनमब्रवीत्।
33_18.translation: "While preparations for the coronation were on, queen Kaikeyi said to her husband:
33_18.word_by_word: तस्मिन् in that, राघवस्य Rama's, अभिषेचने in the coronation, सम्भ्रियमाणे while preparations were being made, कैकेयी नाम called Kaikeyi, देवी queen, भर्तारम् to her husband, वचनम् these words, अब्रवीत् spoke.

33_19.shloka: न पिबेयं न खादेयं प्रत्यहं मम भोजनम्।।5.33.20।।एष मे जीवितस्यान्तो रामो यद्यभिषिच्यते।
33_19.translation: 'I shall not drink or eat food, if Rama is coronated. I shall end my life this moment.
33_19.word_by_word: न पिबेयम् I shall not drink, प्रत्यहम् daily, भोजनम् food, न खादेयम् I will not eat, रामः Rama, यदि if, अभिषिच्यते is coronated, एषः this is, मे my, जीवितस्य life's, अन्तः end.

33_20.shloka: यत्तदुक्तं त्वया वाक्यं प्रीत्या नृपतिसत्तम।।5.33.21।।तच्छेन्न वितथं कार्यं वनं गच्छतु राघवः।
33_20.translation: 'O Dasaratha, the foremost among kings if the promise lovingly made by you earlier is not going to be false, Rama should go to the forest'.
33_20.word_by_word: नृपतिसत्तम the foremost among kings, त्वया by you, प्रीत्या lovingly, यत् such, तत् वाक्यम् words, उक्तम् spoken, तत् the same, वितथम् false, न कार्यं that promise, यदि if you please, राघवः Rama, वनम् to the forest, गच्छतु  go.

33_21.shloka: स राजा सत्यवाग्देव्या वरदानमनुस्मरन्।।5.33.22।।मुमोह वचनं श्रुत्वा कैकेय्याः क्रूरमप्रियम्।
33_21.translation: "Remembering the boons the ever truthful king had granted to Kaikeyi, he fainted after hearing her cruel and harsh words.
33_21.word_by_word: सत्यवाक् ever truthful, सः राजा that king, देव्याः to the queen, वरदानम् boons, अनुस्मरन् remembering, कैकेय्याः of Kaikeyi, क्रूरम् cruel, अप्रियम् unpleasant, वचनम् word, श्रुत्वा having heard, मुमोह fainted.

33_22.shloka: ततस्तु स्थविरो राजा सत्ये धर्मे व्यवस्थितः।।5.33.23।।ज्येष्ठं यशस्विनं पुत्रं रुदन्राज्यमयाचत।
33_22.translation: "The aged king who held on to truthfulness and righteousness begged his famed eldest son Rama to return the kingdom.
33_22.word_by_word: ततः then, सत्ये by truth, धर्मे by rigteousness, व्यवस्थितः one who held, स्थविरः aged, राजा king, रुदन् while crying, यशस्विनम् glorious one, ज्येष्ठम् eldest, पुत्रम् son, राज्यम् kingdom, अयाचत begged.

33_23.shloka: स पितुर्वचनं श्रीमानभिषेकात्परं प्रियम्।।5.33.24।।मनसा पूर्वमासाद्य वाचा प्रतिगृहीतवान्।
33_23.translation: "The illustrious Rama who valued his father's word more than sovereignty, bowed to the command of the father.
33_23.word_by_word: श्रीमान् illustrious one, सः he, पितुः father's, वचनम् word, अभिषेकात् more than coronation, परम् supreme, प्रियम् dear, मनसा by his mind, पूर्वम् first, आसाद्य having accepted, वाचा by word, प्रतिगृहीतवान् accepted

33_24.translation: "Rama, whose strength was his truthfulness, gave whatever others sought but would not accept anything in return. He would not speak a harsh word.
33_24.word_by_word: सत्यपराक्रमः one whose truthfulness was his strength, रामः Rama, दद्यात् he give,न प्रतिगृह्णीयात् he will not take, जीवितहेतोर्वा even for his life, किञ्चित् even a little, अप्रियम् harsh, न ब्रूयात् he will not speak .

33_25.shloka: स विहायोत्तरीयाणि महार्हाणि महायशाः।।5.33.26।।विसृज्य मनसा राज्यं जनन्यै मां समादिशत्।
33_25.translation: "Having given up the kingdom  voluntarily, Rama, a highly renowned king cast off his luxurious upper garments and asked me to take care of his mother.
33_25.word_by_word: महायशाः a highly renowned, सः he, महार्हाणि luxurious, उत्तरीयाणि upper garments, विहाय cast off, मनसा whole heartedly, राज्यम् kingdom, विसृज्य having given up, माम् me, जनन्यै to his mother, समादिशत् entrusted.

33_26.shloka: साहं तस्याग्रतस्तूर्णं प्रस्थिता वनचारिणी।।5.33.27।।न हि मे तेन हीनाया वासस्स्वर्गेऽपि रोचते।
33_26.translation: "I, however resolved to live in the forest, marched ahead of him quickly as I did not prefer even heaven without him.
33_26.word_by_word: सा अहम् I myself, वनचारिणी a forestdweller, तूर्णम् quickly, तस्य his, अग्रतः ahead of him, प्रस्थिता started, तेन by him, हीनायाः separated, मे  me, स्वर्गेऽपि न रोचते did not prefer even heaven.

33_27.word_by_word: महाभागः a noble one, मित्रनन्दनः a delight to friends, सौमित्रिः Saumitri, प्रागेव already, पूर्वजस्य eldest brother's, अनुयात्रार्थे to follow him, द्रुमचीरैः an bark, अलङ्कृतः dressed.

33_28.shloka: ते वयं भर्तुरादेशं बहुमान्य दृढव्रताः।।5.33.29।।प्रविष्टास्स्म पुरादृष्टं वनं गम्भीरदर्शनम्।
33_28.translation: "Respecting the king's order and determined firmly, we entered the impenetrable forest.
33_28.word_by_word: ते then वयम् we, भर्तुः king's, आदेशम् order, बहुमान्य respecting, दृढव्रताः resolved firmly, पुरा in the past, अदृष्टम् not seen, गम्भीरदर्शनम् impenetrable, वनम् forest, प्रविष्टाः स्मः weentered.

33_29.shloka: वसतो दण्डकारण्ये तस्याहममितौजसः।।5.33.30।।रक्षसाऽपहृता भार्या रावणेन दुरात्मना।
33_29.translation: "While the most valiant Rama was living in the Dandaka forest, I, his wife was borne away by the evilminded Ravana.
33_29.word_by_word: दण्डकारण्ये in the Dandaka forest, वसतः while living, अमितौजसः the most valiant, तस्य his, भार्या wife, अहम् am, दुरात्मना by evilminded, रावणेन by Ravana, अपहृता was abducted.

33_30.shloka: द्वौ मासौ तेन मे कालो जीवितानुग्रहः कृतः।।5.33.31।।ऊर्ध्वं द्वाभ्यां तु मासाभ्यां ततस्तक्ष्यामि जीवितम्।
33_30.translation: "He has allowed me two months time to live. After two months I will have to give up my life."इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये सुन्दरकाण्डे त्रयस्त्रिंशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the thirtythird sarga of Sundarakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
33_30.word_by_word: तेन by him, द्वौ two, मासौ months, मे to me, जीवितानुग्रहः grant of time to live, कृतः given, ततः then, द्वाभ्याम् after the two, मासाभ्याम् months, ऊर्ध्वम् after that, जीवितम् life, त्यक्ष्यामि I will give up.

34_1.shloka: [Hanuman tells the story of Rama to Sita.]तस्यास्तद्वचनं श्रुत्वा हनुमान्हरिपुङ्गवः।दुःखाद्दुःखाभिभूताया स्सान्त्वमुत्तरमब्रवीत्।।5.34.1।।
34_1.translation: Hearing the words of Sita who was overwhelmed with grief, the monkey leader Hanuman felt sad and thus spoke comforting her:
34_1.word_by_word: हरिपुङ्गवः monkey leader, हनुमान् Hanuman, दुःखात् with sadness, दुःखाभिभूतायाः overwhelmed with grief, तस्याः to her, तत् those, वचनम् words, श्रुत्वा after hearing, सान्त्वम् comforting, उत्तरम् reply, अब्रवीत् spoke.

34_2.shloka: अहं रामस्य सन्देशाद्देवि दूतस्तवागतः।वैदेहि कुशली रामस्त्वां च कौशलमब्रवीत्।।5.34.2।।
34_2.translation: "By the command of Rama I am here as a messenger. He is keeping well. He is well and wishes you well.
34_2.word_by_word: देवि O queen, वैदेहि Vaidehi, अहम् I am, रामस्य Rama's, सन्देशात् by order, तव your, दूतः messenger, आगतः reached, कुशली is well, रामः Rama, त्वां च and you, कुशलम् welfare, अब्रवीत् wished you.

34_3.shloka: यो ब्रह्ममस्त्रं वेदांश्च वेद वेदविदांवरः।स त्वां दाशरथी रामो देवि कौशलमब्रवीत्।।5.34.3।।
34_3.translation: "O godlike lady Rama, son of Dasaratha, master of the Vedas, wielder of Brahmastra wishes you well.
34_3.word_by_word: देवि O godlike lady, वेदविदाम् mastered the Vedas, वरः choicest, यः he is, ब्रह्मम् अस्त्रम् weapon of Brahma (Brahmastra), वेदांश्च and Vedas, वेद knows, सः he, दाशरथिः son of Dasaratha, रामः Rama, त्वाम् you, कौशलम् welfare, अब्रवीत् conveyed.

34_4.translation: "The mighty Lakshmana too, a dear brother and follower of your husband is immersed in grief, and sends salutations to you."
34_4.word_by_word: महातेजाः very mighty, ते भर्तुः your husband, प्रियः dear, अनुचरः follower, लक्ष्मणश्च Lakshmana also, शोकसन्तप्तः immersed in grief, शिरसा with his head in obeisance, ते to you, अभिवादनम् offers salutations, कृतवान् has done.

34_5.shloka: सा तयोः कुशलं देवी निशम्य नरसिंहयोः।प्रीतिसंहृष्टसर्वाङ्गी हनुमन्तमथाब्रवीत्।।5.34.5।।
34_5.translation: On hearing the wellbeing of Rama and Lakshman, lions among men, Sita experienced thrill all over her body. She then  spoke to Hanuman:
34_5.word_by_word: सा देवी that queen, तयोः of both of them, नरसिंहयोः of lions among men, कुशलम् wellbeing, निशम्य on hearing, प्रीतिसंहृष्टसर्वाङ्गी overtaken by joy experienced in all her limbs, अथ then, हनुमन्तम् Hanuman, अब्रवीत् spoke.

34_6.shloka: कल्याणी बत गाथेयं लौकिकी प्रतिभाति मा।एति जीवन्तमानन्दो नरं वर्षशतादपि।।5.34.6।।
34_6.translation: "The adage that 'joy comes to a living being even though it be at the end of  a hundred years' is popular. It appears true in my case".
34_6.word_by_word: जीवन्तम् who lives, नरम् human being, वर्षशतादपि a hundred years, आनन्दः happiness, एति comes, इयम् this, लौकिकी popular, गाथा adage, कल्याणी is auspicious, मा to me, प्रतिभाति appears.

34_7.shloka: तया समागते तस्मिन्प्रीतिरुत्पादिताऽद्भुता।परस्परेण चालापं विश्वस्तौ तौ प्रचक्रतुः।।5.34.7।।
34_7.translation: Hanuman thus created a sense of wonderful joy in her as they came together. Both of them started to converse restoring confidence in each other.
34_7.word_by_word: समागते when the meeting took place, तस्मिन् in him, तथा like that, अद्भुता wonderful, प्रीतिः pleasure, उत्पादिता was created, तौ in both, विश्वस्तौ confiding in the other, परस्परेण each to the other, आलापं च converse, चक्रतुः started.

34_8.translation: Hearing the reply of Sita, who was crying piteously, stricken with grief, the monkey leader, Hanuman moved close to her.
34_8.word_by_word: हरियूथपः leader of the monkey troops, हनुमान् Hanuman, शोकदीनायाः of the piteous lady stricken with grief, तस्याः her, सीतायाः Sita's, तत् that, वचनम् word, श्रुत्वा after hearing, समीपम् close by, उपचक्रमे moved.

34_9.shloka: यथा यथा समीपं स हनुमानुपसर्पति।तथा तथा रावणं सा तं सीता परिशङ्कते।।5.34.9।।
34_9.translation: As Hanuman started slowly drawing close, Sita suspected he might be Ravana.
34_9.word_by_word: सः हनुमान् Hanuman, यथा यथा slowly that way, समीपम् near, उपसर्पति started moving, तथा तथा in the same way, सा सीता that Sita, तम् him, रावणम् Ravana, परिशङ्कते suspected.

34_10.shloka: अहो धिग्दुष्कृतमिदं कथितं हि यदस्य मे।रूपान्तरमुपागम्य स एवायं हि रावणः।।5.34.10।।
34_10.translation: "Ohshame on me. I have told him my story which should not have been said. This is verily Ravana come in a disguise".
34_10.word_by_word: अहो Oh, धिक् fie upon, मे to myself, इदम् this, अस्य to him, कथितम् story, दुष्कृतम् that which should not have been said, अयम् he, रूपान्तरम् in cognito, उपागम्य has come, सः रावणः हि verily he is Ravana.

34_11.shloka: तामशोकस्य शाखां सा विमुक्त्वा शोककर्शिता।तस्यामेवानवद्याङ्गी धरण्यां समुपाविशत्।।5.34.11।।
34_11.translation: So saying Sita of flawless limbs, emaciated with grief, left the branch of Ashoka tree held by her and squatted on the ground.
34_11.word_by_word: अनवद्याङ्गी who has flawless limbs, सा she, अशोकस्य Ashoka tree's, ताम् that, शाखाम् branch, विमुक्त्वा later leaving, शोककर्शिता emaciated out of sorrow, तस्याम् on that, धरण्यामेव on the ground, समुपाविशत् sat near.

34_12.shloka: हनुमानपि दुःखार्तां तां दृष्ट्वा भयमोहिताम्।अवन्दत महाबाहुस्ततस्तां जनकात्मजाम्।।5.34.12।।सा चैनं भयवित्रस्ता भूयो नैवाभ्युदैक्षत।
34_12.translation: The longarmed Hanuman saw Sita, who was stricken with grief and deluded with fear. He prostrated to her. But out of fear she did not look at him.
34_12.word_by_word: महाबाहुः longarmed one, हनुमानपि Hanuman too, दुःखार्ताम् sorrowful lady, भयमोहिताम् deluded with fear, ताम् her, दृष्ट्वा on seeing, ततः then, तां जनकात्मजाम् the daughter of Janaka, अवन्दत prostrated, सा च and she, भयवित्रस्ता trembling with fear, एनम् him, भूयः again, नाभ्युदैक्षत did not look at him.

34_13.shloka: तं दृष्ट्वा वन्दमानं तु सीता शशिनिभानना।।5.34.13।।अब्रवीद्धीर्घमुच्छवस्य वानरं मधुरस्वरा।
34_13.translation: On seeing the vanara prostrated, the moonfaced lady, sighed deeply and spoke to him in a sweet voice:
34_13.word_by_word: शशिनिभानना moonfaced lady, सीता Sita, तम् him, वन्दमानम् prostrating, दृष्ट्वा on seeing, दीर्घम् deep, उच्छवस्य after breathing out, मधुरस्वरा in a sweet voice, वानरम् to vanara, अब्रवीत् said.

34_14.shloka: मायां प्रविष्टो मायावी यदि त्वं रावणस्स्वयम्।।5.34.14।।उत्पादयसि मे भूयस्सन्तापं तन्न शोभनम्।
34_14.translation: "If you are that trickster Ravana who appears incognito before me, it is not good for you. You are causing grief again.
34_14.word_by_word: त्वम् you, मायाम् disguised, प्रविष्टः entered, मायावी trickster, स्वयम् yourself, रावणः यदि if you are Ravana, मे to me, भूयः again, सन्तापम् grief, उत्पादयसि you have created, तत् that, शोभनम् न not good.

34_15.shloka: स्वं परित्यज्य रूपं यः परिव्राजकरूपध्रुत्।जनस्थाने मया दृष्टस्त्वं स एवासि रावणः।।5.34.15।।
34_15.translation: "You are the same Ravana who took the guise of a mendicant, giving up your real form and came to Janasthana.
34_15.word_by_word: यः रावणः that Ravana, स्वं रूपम् his own form, परित्यज्य after giving up, परिव्राजकरूपवान् taking the form of a mendicant, जनस्थाने in Janasthana, मया by me, दृष्टः seen, त्वं you, स एव असि you are the same one.

34_16.shloka: उपवासकृशां दीनां कामरूप निशाचर।सन्तापयसि मां भूयस्सन्तप्तां तन्न शोभनम्।।5.34.16।।
34_16.translation: "Oh you are one who can assume any form at will. You are a nightstalker. It is not good for you to cause pain to me who is already emaciated through fasting, who is pitiable and who is already afflicted.
34_16.word_by_word: कामरूप one who can assume any form, निशाचर nightstalker, उपवासकृशां an emaciated lady, सन्तप्तां a lady stricken with grief, दीनां pitiable, माम् me, भूयः again, सन्तापं grief, सन्तापयसि you are making me sorrowful, तत् that, शोभनं न not good for you.

34_17.shloka: अथवा नैतदेवं हि यन्मया परिशङ्कितम्।।5.34.17।।मनसो हि मम प्रीतिरुत्पन्ना तव दर्शनात्।
34_17.translation: "May be my suspicion is not correct Because I am experiencing pleasure in my mind in your presence.
34_17.word_by_word: अथवा or may be, मया by me, यत् that which, परिशङ्कितम् that I am suspecting, एतत् because, एवम् all this, न हि not true, तव your, दर्शनात् by your presence, मम my, मनसः mind, प्रीतिः pleased, उत्पन्ना हि is generated.

34_18.shloka: यदि रामस्य दूतस्त्वमागतो भद्रमस्तु ते।।5.34.18।।पृच्छामि त्वां हरिश्रेष्ठ प्रिया रामकथा हि मे।
34_18.translation: "O great vanara, If on the other hand you have come here as Rama's messenger I wish you well. I love Rama's story. Tell me.
34_18.word_by_word: त्वम् you, रामस्य Rama's, दूतः messenger, आगतः यदि if you have come here, ते to you, भद्रम् be auspicious, अस्तु be, हरिश्रेष्ठ O great vanara, मे to me, रामकथा Rama'story, प्रिया हि dear, त्वाम् you, पृच्छामि I ask you.

34_19.shloka: गुणान्रामस्य कथय प्रियस्य मम वानर।।5.34.19।।चित्तं हरसि मे सौम्य नदीकूलं यथा रयः।
34_19.translation: "O vanara Rama's virtues are dear to me to hear. O gentle one just as the current of the river wears away its banks, my mind is lured by your presence.
34_19.word_by_word: वानर vanara, मम my, प्रियस्य dear lord's, रामस्य Rama's, गुणान् virtues, कथय you may tell me, सौम्य O gentle one, नदीकूलम् river bank, रयः यथा like the current of water, मे my, चित्तम् mind, हरसि you are luring.

34_20.shloka: अहो स्वप्नस्य सुखता याहमेवं चिराहृता।।5.34.20।।प्रेषितं नाम पश्यामि राघवेण वनौकसम्।
34_20.translation: "Oh I have been seeing the person sent by Rama in my dream for a long time. This is a pleasant dream to me.
34_20.word_by_word: स्वप्नस्य of a dream, सुखता pleasure, अहो Oh, चिराहृता kept dreaming for a long time, या that, राघवेण by Rama, प्रेषितं नाम  person sent, वनौकसम् vanara, एवम् that way, पश्यामि I am seeing.

34_21.shloka: स्वप्नेऽपि यद्यहं वीरं राघवं सहलक्ष्मणम्।।5.34.21।।पश्येयं नावसीदेयं स्वप्नोऽपि मम मत्सरी।
34_21.translation: "Even if I can see the heroic Rama together with Lakshmana in my dream my pain will be gone. Even the dream is inimical to me (I cannot sleep and thus cannot dream.)
34_21.word_by_word: अहम् I, स्वप्नेऽपि even in a dream, सहलक्ष्मणम् along with Lakshmana, वीरम् heroic, राघवम् Rama, पश्येयं यदि if I can see, नावसीदेयम् I will not be despondent, मम my, स्वप्नोऽपि even the dream, मत्सरी inimical to me.

34_22.shloka: नाहं स्वप्नमिमं मन्ये स्वप्ने दृष्ट्वा हि वानरम्।।5.34.22।।न शक्योऽभ्युदयः प्राप्तुं प्राप्तश्चाभ्युदयो मम।
34_22.translation: "I do not think it is a dream. Pleasure cannot be experienced by seeing a vanara in a dream. I experience pleasure now (seeing a monkey in a dream is a bad omen).
34_22.word_by_word: अहम् I am, इमम् this, स्वप्नम् dream, न मन्ये I do not think so, स्वप्ने in a dream, वानरम् vanara, दृष्ट्वा having seen, अभ्युदयः welfare, प्राप्तुम् to attain, न शक्यः not possible, मम tome, अभ्युदयः pleasure, प्राप्तश्च is experienced.

34_23.shloka: किन्नु स्याचित्तमोहोऽयं भवेद्वातगतिस्त्वियम्।।5.34.23।।उन्मादजो विकारो वा स्यादियं मृगतृष्णिका।
34_23.translation: "Can this be a delusion of my mind or a mental imbalance (resulting in movement of the mind in the body). Is it a malady born of  my madness? Or is it a mirage?
34_23.word_by_word: अयम् this, चित्तमोहः delusion in the mind, स्यात् किं नु why do I feel like this? इयम् this kind of, वातगतिः mental inbalance, भवेत् may be, उन्मादजः developed due to madness, विकारो वा or else is it a change?, इयम् this, मृगतृष्णिका a mirage, स्यात् may be.

34_24.shloka: अथवा नायमुन्मादो मोहोऽप्युन्मादलक्षणः।।5.34.24।।सम्बुध्ये चाहमात्मानमियं चापि वनौकसम्।
34_24.translation: "No, this cannot be insanity. nor even delusion. But I recognise this vanara well"
34_24.word_by_word: अथवा if not, अयम् this, उन्मादः insanity, उन्मादलक्षणः sign of insanity, मोहोऽपि delusion also, न not, अहम् I, आत्मानम् myself, इमम् this, वनौकसम् vanara, सम्बुध्ये recognise.

34_25.shloka: इत्येवं बहुधा सीता सम्प्रधार्य बलाबलम्।।5.34.25।।रक्षसां कामरूपत्वान्मेने तं राक्षसाधिपम्।
34_25.translation: Considering the strength and weakness of demons in that manner Sita thought that Hanuman was none other than the king of demons who can asume any form at will.
34_25.word_by_word: सीता Sita, इत्येवम् in this manner, बलाबलम् strength and weakness, बहुधा in many ways, सम्प्रधार्य after considering, रक्षसाम् of demons, कामरूपत्वात्  taking any form at will, तम् him, राक्षसाधिपम् king of demons, मेने he thought.

34_26.shloka: एतां बुद्धिं तदा कृत्वा सीता सा तनुमध्यमा।।5.34.26।।न प्रतिव्याजहाराथ वानरं जनकात्मजा।
34_26.translation: Having entertained such thoughts, Sita, the lady with a fairwaist, daughter of Janaka,  did not respond to the vanara.
34_26.word_by_word: तदा then, तनुमध्यमा lady with a fair waist, जनकात्मजा Janaka's daughter, सा सीता that Sita, एताम् in this way, बुद्धिम् thought, कृत्वा having entertained, अथ then, वानरम् to vanara, न प्रतिव्याजहार did not respond.

34_27.translation: Hanuman, son of the Windgod understood what was going on in Sita's mind and spoke pleasing words that brought joy in her.
34_27.word_by_word: मारुतात्मजः son of the Windgod, हनुमान् Hanuman, सीतायाः Sita's, चिन्तितम् thought, बुद्ध्वा understood, तदा then, ताम् her, श्रोत्रानुकूलैः pleasing to hear, वचनैः by the words, सम्प्रहर्षयत् pleased.

34_28.shloka: आदित्य इव तेजस्वी लोककान्तश्शशी यथा।।5.34.28।।राजा सर्वस्य लोकस्य देवो वैश्रवणो यथा।विक्रमेणोपपन्नश्च यथा विष्णुर्महायशाः।।5.34.29।।
34_28.translation: "Rama is glorious as the Sun, brings delight to the whole world like the Moon, is theking of kings like Vaisravana,  and renowned like Visnu endowed with valour.
34_28.word_by_word: आदित्य इव like the Sun, तेजस्वी glorious, शशी यथा like the Moon, लोककान्तः brings delight to the whole world, देवः god, वैश्रवणो यथा like Vaisravana, सर्वस्य of all, लोकस्य of the worlds, राजा king, महायशाः is renowned, विष्णुः यथा like Visnu, विक्रमेण in valour, उपपन्नश्च endowed .

34_29.shloka: सत्यवादी मधुरवाग्देवो वाचस्पतिर्यथा।रूपवान्सुभग श्रीमान् कन्दर्प इव मूर्तिमान्।।5.34.30।।
34_29.translation: "He is truthful in speech like Brihaspati, prosperous (like Kubera), sweettongued, handsome, graceful like Kamadeva.
34_29.word_by_word: सत्यवादी truthful in speech, देवः god, वाचस्पतिर्यथा like Brihaspati, मधुरवाक् sweet tongued, रूपवान् handsome, सुभगः graceful, श्रीमान् prosperous, मूर्तिमान् a personification, कन्दर्पः इव like Kamadeva.

34_30.shloka: स्थानक्रोधः प्रहर्ता च श्रेष्ठो लोके महारथः।बाहुच्छायामवष्टब्धो यस्य लोको महात्मनः।।5.34.31।।
34_30.translation: "He shows anger to one who deserves it, he is the foremost charioteer of the world and he is a great self under the shadow of whose shoulders the whole world takes refuge.
34_30.word_by_word: स्थानक्रोधः who shows anger to the proper person, प्रहर्ता च who punishes, लोके the world, श्रेष्ठः supreme, महारथः great charioteer, लोकः in the world, यस्य whose, महात्मनः of the great self, बाहुच्छायामवष्टब्धो under the shadow of whose shoulders refuge is taken.

34_31.shloka: अपकृष्याश्रमपदान्मृगरूपेण राघवम्।शून्ये येनापनीतासि तस्य द्रक्ष्यसि यत्फलम्।।5.34.32।।
34_31.translation: "You will see the consequences of the action of Ravana who abducted you deceitfully in the form of deer when Rama was away from the hermitage.
34_31.word_by_word: येन since, राघवम् Rama, मृगरूपेण in the form of a deer, आश्रमपदात् from the hermitage, अपकृष्य were abducted, शून्ये isolated place, अपनीता you are borne away, असि you, तस्य its, यत्फलम् result, द्रक्ष्यसि you will see.

34_32.shloka: न चिराद्रावणं संख्ये यो वधिष्यति वीर्यवान्।रोषप्रमुक्तैरिषुभिर्ज्वलद्भिरिव पावकैः।।5.34.33।।तेनाहं प्रेषितो दूत स्त्वत्सकाशमिहागतः।त्वद्वियोगेन दुःखार्त स्स त्वां कौशलमब्रवीत्।।5.34.34।।
34_32.translation: "Heroic Rama will soon release many scorching, fiery arrows in anger and kill Ravana. I seek your permission as an envoy of Rama. Filled with grief by your separation, he has made inquiries about your welfare.
34_32.word_by_word: वीर्यवान् heroic, यः who, नचिरात् soon, रोषप्रमुक्तै: released in great anger, ज्वलद्भिः by burning, पावकैः इव like fire, इषुभि with arrows, संख्ये in war, रावणम् Ravana, वधिष्यति would slay, तेन therefore, दूतः envoy, प्रेषितः sent, इह here, त्वत्सकाशम् your presence, आगतः I have come, त्वद्वियोगेन due to separation from you, दुःखार्तः filled with sorrow, सः he, त्वाम् to you, कौशलम् welfare, अब्रवीत् asking.

34_33.translation: "The brilliant, longarmed Lakshmana, delight of Sumitra enquires about your welfare and offers salutations to you.
34_33.word_by_word: महातेजाः brilliant, सुमित्रानन्दस्सवर्धनः delight of Sumitra, महाबाहुः longarmed one, सः लक्ष्मणश्च Lakshmna, त्वाम् to you, अभिवाद्य offering salutations, कौशलम् welfare, अब्रवीत् enquired.

34_34.shloka: रामस्य च सखा देवि सुग्रीवो नाम वानरः।राजा वानरमुख्यानां स त्वां कौशलमब्रवीत्।।5.34.36।।
34_34.translation: "O goddess like lady Rama's friend Sugriva, king of vanara chieftans inquires about your wellbeing.
34_34.word_by_word: देवि O goddesslike lady, रामस्य Rama's, सखा friend, वानरमुख्यानाम् of vanara chiefs, राजा king, सुग्रीवो नाम called Sugriva, सः वानरः  that vanara, त्वाम् you, कौशलम् wellbeing, अब्रवीत्asked.

34_35.shloka: नित्यं स्मरति रामस्त्वां ससुग्रीव स्सलक्ष्मणः।दिष्ट्या जीवसि वैदेहि राक्षसीवशमागता।।5.34.37।।
34_35.translation: "O Vaidehi Rama, Lakshmana and Sugriva always remember you. Luckily you are alive even though you are under the clutches of shedemons.
34_35.word_by_word: ससुग्रीवः together with Sugriva, सलक्ष्मणः and Lakshmna, रामः Rama, त्वाम् you, नित्यम् always, स्मरति remembers, वैदेहि Vaidehi, राक्षसीवशम् under the clutches of shedemons, आगता come, दिष्ट्या luckily, जीवसि you are alive.

34_36.shloka: नचिराद्द्रक्ष्यसे रामं लक्ष्मणं च महाबलम्।मध्ये वानरकोटीनां सुग्रीवं चामितौजसम्।।5.34.38।।
34_36.translation: "Very soon you will see mighty Rama, Lakshmana and Sugriva of unlimited prowess surrounded by crores of vanaras.
34_36.word_by_word: रामम् Rama, महाबलम् mighty, लक्ष्मणं Lakshmana, वानरकोटीनाम् among crores of vanaras, मध्ये in the midst, अमितौजसम् of a hero of unlimited prowess, सुग्रीवं च also Sugriva, नचिरात् very soon, द्रक्ष्यसे you will see.

34_37.shloka: अहं सुग्रीवसचिवो हनुमान्नाम वानरः।प्रविष्टो नगरीं लङ्कां लङ्घयित्वा महोदधिम्।।5.34.39।।
34_37.translation: "I am Sugriva's minister known as Hanuman, a vanara who entered the city of Lanka after leaping over the great ocean.
34_37.word_by_word: अहम् I am, सुग्रीवसचिवः minister of Sugriva, हनुमान्नाम called Hanuman, वानरः a vanara, महोदधिम् great ocean, लङ्घयित्वा having leaped, लङ्कां नगरीम् city of Lanka, प्रविष्टः I have entered.

34_38.shloka: कृत्वा मूर्ध्नि पदन्यासं रावणस्य दुरात्मनः।त्वां द्रष्टुमुपयातोऽहं समाश्रित्य पराक्रमम्।।5.34.40।।
34_38.translation: "Setting my foot with my valour on the head of the cruelminded Ravana, using my valour,  I came here to see you.
34_38.word_by_word: दुरात्मनः cruelminded, रावणस्य Ravana's, मूर्ध्नि: on the head, पदन्यासम् placing my foot, कृत्वा of having done, पराक्रमम् valour, समाश्रित्य using, अहम् I, त्वाम् you, द्रष्टुम् to see, उपयातः came here.

34_39.shloka: नाहमस्मि तथा देवि यथा मामवगच्छसि।विशङ्का त्यज्यतामेषा श्रद्धत्स्व वदतो मम।।5.34.41।।
34_39.translation: "O goddesslike lady I am not  a deceitful person as you suppose me to be. Shake off your suspicion as I speak to you and trust me."इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये सुन्दरकाण्डे चतुस्त्रिंशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the thirtyfourth sarga of Sundarakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
34_39.word_by_word: देवि O goddesslike lady, माम् me, यथा as, अवगच्छसि you suppose, अहम् I, तथा like that, नास्मि I am not, एषा such, विशङ्का suspicion, त्यज्यताम् shake off, वदतः as I speak, मम my, श्रद्धत्स्व you may trust.

35_1.shloka: [Hanuman further narrates his story to Sita -- Gives description of Rama and Lakshmana]तां तु रामकथां श्रुत्वा वैदेही वानरर्षभात्।उवाच वचनं सान्त्वमिदं मधुरया गिरा।।5.35.1।।
35_1.translation: On hearing about Rama from the bull among vanaras, thus spoke Vaidehi politely in a sweet voice:
35_1.word_by_word: वैदेही Vaidehi, वानरर्षभात् from the bull among vanaras, ताम् that, रामकथाम् Rama's story, श्रुत्वा heard, मधुरया in sweet, गिरा word, सान्त्वम् polite, इदम् these, वचनम् words, उवाच spoke.

35_2.shloka: क्व ते रामेण संसर्गः कथं जानासि लक्ष्मणम्।वानराणां नराणां च कथमासीत्समागमः।।5.35.2।।
35_2.translation: "Where did you come in contact with Rama? How did you assess Lakshmana? How did an alliance of vanaras and humans take place?
35_2.word_by_word: ते to you, रामेण with Rama, संसर्गः contact, क्व where, लक्ष्मणम् Lakshmana, कथम् how, जानासि do you assess, वानराणाम् of vanaras, नराणां च a human, समागमः union, कथम् how, आसीत् took place.

35_3.shloka: यानि रामस्य लिङ्गानि लक्ष्मणस्य च वानर।तानि भूयस्समाचक्ष्व न मां शोकस्समाविशेत्।।5.35.3।।
35_3.translation: "O vanara tell me all about the identification marks of Rama and Lakshmana again so that grief does not enter my mind.
35_3.word_by_word: वानर O vanara, रामस्य Rama's, लक्ष्मणस्य च and Lakshmana's, यानि those, लिङ्गानि identification marks, तानि those, समाचक्ष्व you may tell, माम् to me, भूयः again, शोकः sorrow, न not, समाविशेत् entire account.

35_4.shloka: कीदृशं तस्य संस्थानं रूपं रामस्य कीदृशम्।कथमूरू कथं बाहू लक्ष्मणस्य च शंस मे।।5.35.4।।
35_4.translation: "What does Rama look like? And Laksmana? How are his thighs, arms? Tell me".
35_4.word_by_word: तस्य his, रामस्य Rama's, लक्ष्मणस्य Lakshmana's, संस्थानम् form, कीदृशम् how, रूपम् form, कीदृशम् how does his look, ऊरू thighs, कथम् how, बाहू arms, कथम् how, मे to me, शंस tell.

35_5.translation: Questioned thus by Vaidehi, Hanuman, son of the Windgod started describing Rama's physique as it is.
35_5.word_by_word: वैदेह्या by Vaidehi, एवम् in that manner, उक्तः spoken, मारुतात्मजः son of the Windgod, हनुमान् Hanuman, ततः thereafter, रामम् Rama, यथातत्त्वम् as it is, आख्यातुम् to describe, उपचक्रमे he started telling.

35_6.shloka: जानन्ती बत दिष्ट्या मां वैदेहि परिपृच्छसि।भर्तुः कमलपत्त्राक्षि संस्थानं लक्ष्मणस्य च।।5.35.6।।
35_6.translation: "O Vaidehi with eyes like lotus petals although you know your husband's and Lakshmana's form and distinguishing marks, it is my good fortune that you asked me(to describe them).
35_6.word_by_word: कमलपत्त्राक्षि eyes like lotus petals, वैदेहि Vaidehi, जानन्ती even though you know, दिष्ट्या by good fortune, भर्तुः husband's, लक्ष्मणस्य च and Lakshmana's, संस्थानम् form and distinguishing marks, परिपृच्छसि have asked, बत indeed.

35_7.shloka: यानि रामस्य चिह्नानि लक्ष्मणस्य च यानि वै।लक्षितानि विशालाक्षि वदतश्शृणु तानि मे।।5.35.7।।
35_7.translation: "O largeeyed lady I will describe those distinguishing marks of Rama and Lakshmana Listen.
35_7.word_by_word: विशालाक्षि O largeeyed lady, रामस्य Rama's, यानि लक्षणानि those distinguishing marks, लक्ष्मणस्य च and Lakshmana's, यानि those, लक्षितानि signs, तानि them, वदतः as I describe, मे myself, शृणु listen.

35_8.translation: "O daughter of Janaka Rama with eyes like lotus petals is a person born with a delightful form, richly endowed with indescribable charm and politeness.
35_8.word_by_word: जनकात्मजे O Janaka's daughter, रामः Rama, कमलपत्त्राक्षः one who has eyes like lotus petals, सर्वसत्त्वमनोहरः one who delights all beings, रूपदाक्षिण्यसम्पन्नः endowed richly with charm and politeness, प्रसूतः born with.

35_9.shloka: तेजसाऽदित्य सङ्काशः क्षमया पृथिवीसमः।बृहस्पतिसमो बुद्ध्या यशसा वासवोपमः।।5.35.9।।
35_9.translation: "He vies with the Sun in effulgence, with earth in forbearance, with Brihaspati in intelligence, and in fame with Indra.
35_9.word_by_word: तेजसा in effulgence, आदित्यसङ्काशः vies with the Sun, क्षमया in tolerance, पृथिवीसमः equals the earth, बुद्ध्या in intelligence, बृहस्पतिसमः equal to Brihaspathi, यशसा in fame, वासवोपमः equals Indra.

35_10.shloka: रक्षिता जीवलोकस्य स्वजनस्याभिरक्षिता।रक्षिता स्वस्य वृत्तस्य धर्मस्य च परन्तपः।।5.35.10।।
35_10.translation: "Rama is a protector of the entire world of living beings not to speak of his own people. He is a protector of his own race. He guards righteousness. He is a scorcher of enemies.
35_10.word_by_word: परन्तपः scorcher of enemies, जीवलोकस्य of the world of living beings, रक्षिता protector, स्वजनस्य of his own people, अभिरक्षिता protector, स्वस्य of his own, वृत्तस्य of the race, धर्मस्य च and guards righteousness

35_11.shloka: रामो भामिनि लोकस्य चातुर्वर्ण्यस्य रक्षिता।मर्यादानां च लोकस्य कर्ता कारयिता च सः।।5.35.11।।
35_11.translation: "O beautiful lady Rama is a protector of the four classes of society (Brahmana, Kshatriya, Vaisya and Sudra) in the world. He follows codes of conduct and makes others follow them.
35_11.word_by_word: भामिनि O beautiful lady, रामः Rama, लोकस्य world's, चातुर्वर्ण्यस्य of the four classes of society, रक्षिता protector, सः he, लोकानाम् of all the worlds, मर्यादानाम् code and conduct, कर्ता maker, कारयिताचैव will make others follow.

35_12.translation: "He is luminous and highly revered. He observes vow of selfcontrol. He is steadfast and recognises services rendered by sages. He is aware of the rites and the ways of administration.
35_12.word_by_word: अर्चिष्मान् luminous, अत्यर्थम् intensely, अर्चितः worshipped, ब्रह्मचर्यव्रते observing the vow of selfcontrol, स्थितः one who is steadfast, साधूनाम् for the holy men, उपकारज्ञः recognises right action, कर्मणाम् rites, प्रचारज्ञश्च  of the ways of  administration.

35_13.translation: "He is welltrained in statecraft. He is devoted to brahmins. Endowed with an excellent conduct, he is learned in scriptures and a scorcher of enemies.
35_13.word_by_word: राजविद्याविनीतश्च welltrained in statecraft, ब्राह्मणानाम् of the brahmins, उपासिता a devotee, श्रुतवान् learned in scriptures, शीलसम्पन्नः endowed with excellent conduct, विनीतः is disciplined, परन्तपः  is a scorcher of enemies.

35_14.shloka: यजुर्वेदविनीतश्च वेदविद्भिस्सुपूजितः।धनुर्वेदे च वेदेषु वेदाङ्गेषु च निष्ठितः।।5.35.14।।
35_14.translation: "He is versed in Yajurveda and is respected by Vedic scholars. He has mastered Dhanurveda and other Vedas and auxillary Vedas as well.
35_14.word_by_word: यजुर्वेदविनीतश्च versed in Yajurveda, वेदविद्भिः by the knowers of the Vedas, सुपूजितः respected, धनुर्वेदे च and in Dhanurveda also, वेदेषु in other Vedas also, वेदाङ्गेषु च Vedangas (auxillary Vedas) also, निष्ठितः is an expert.

35_15.shloka: विपुलांसो महाबाहुः कम्बुग्रीवश्शुभाननः।गूढजत्रुस्सुताम्राक्षो रामो देवि जनै श्श्रुतः।।5.35.15।।
35_15.translation: "O godlike lady Rama has broad shoulders, strong arms, conchshaped neck and an auspicious countenance. With his fleshy round arms and copperyred eyes, he is renowned in all the worlds.
35_15.word_by_word: देवि goddess like lady, रामः Rama, विपुलां सः broadshouldered, महाबाहुः strongarmed, कम्बुग्रीवः with conchshaped neck, शुभाननः with an auspicious countenance, गूढजत्रुः has round shoulders, सुताम्राक्षः copperyred eyes  जनैः in all worlds, श्रुतः renowned.

35_16.shloka: दुन्दुभिस्वननिर्घोष स्स्निग्धवर्णः प्रतापवान्।सम स्समविभक्ताङ्गो वर्णं श्यामं समाश्रितः।।5.35.16।।
35_16.translation: "His tone is resonant like drums, he has a beautiful, dark, shining complexion. He has symmetrical, well proportioned limbs. He is neither too tall nor too short.
35_16.word_by_word: दुन्दुभिस्वननिर्घोषः his tone is resonant like the drums, स्निग्धवर्णः has beautiful shining complexion, प्रतापवान् full of valour, समः not too tall or short, समविभक्ताङ्गः his limbs are symmetrical, श्यामम् dark, वर्णम् colour, समाश्रितः has proportionate limbs.

35_17.shloka: त्रिस्थिरस्त्रिप्रलम्बश्च त्रिसमस्त्रिषु चोन्नतः।त्रिताम्रस्त्रिषु च स्निग्धो गम्भीरस्त्रिषु नित्यशः।।5.35.17।।
35_17.translation: "He has three stiff parts, three long parts, three even parts, three shining parts, elevated in three parts, has three raised parts, his body has lines in three parts and is  of coppery reddish colour in three parts. He has a majestic look.
35_17.word_by_word: त्रिस्थिरः has the three stiff limbs (chest, fist and wrists), त्रिप्रलम्बश्च long in three (arms, eyebrows and scrotum), त्रिसमः has three even parts (locks of hair, knees and testicles), त्रिषु elevated in three parts (abdomen, navel and chest), उन्नतः raised, त्रिषु च all the three parts (soles, nails and eyes), स्निग्धः has coppery reddish colour, नित्यशः all over, त्रिषु in the three parts (the underlines of feet, the hair and the reproductive  organs), गम्भीरः is majestic.

35_18.translation: "He has three folds in the skin of his neck and belly, is depressed in the middle of his soles and the nipples, undersized at four placesthe neck, penis, shanks and back, has three spirals on his head, has four lines under his thumb, has four lines on his forehead, he is a person with four cubits in height and symmetrical arms, cheeks and thighs.
35_18.word_by_word: त्रिवलीवान् has three folds on his neck, स्त्र्यवनतः his nipples and middle of his soles are depressed, चतुर्व्यङ्गः four parts of his body are depressedneck, penis, shanks and back, त्रिशीर्षवान् has three spirals in the head, चतुष्कलः has four lines under his thumb, चतुर्लेखः has four lines on the forehead, चतुष्किष्कुः he is four cubits in height, चतुस्समः he has arms, knees, cheeks and thighs well proportioned

35_19.translation: "He is a person with his pairs of eyebrows, nostrils, eyes, ears, lips, nipples, elbows, wrists, knees, testicles, loins, arms, legs and buttocks in good symmetry he has four sharp teeth. He walks in different gaits like a lion, leopard, elephant and bull as occasion demands he has sharp nose, charming lips and jaws. He has smooth hair, eyes, skin, teeth and feet and his eight parts of his body namely back, trunk, limbs, fingers, toes, eyes and testicles are long.
35_19.word_by_word: चतुर्दशसमद्वन्द्वः he is person with the fourteen parts of his body (eyebrows, nostrils, eyes, ears, lips, nipples, elbows, wrists, knees, testicles, loins, arms, legs and buttocks) in good proportion, चतुर्दंष्ट्रः he is one with four sharp teeth, चतुर्गतिः he moves like a lion, leopard, elephant and bull as occasion demands, महोष्ठहनुनासश्च he has sharp nose, charming lips and jaws, पञ्चस्निग्ध: he is one with five smooth parts (hair, eyes, skin, teeth and feet), अष्टवंशवान् his eight parts of the body (backbone, trunk, limbs, fingers, toes, nose, eyes and testicles) are long.

35_20.translation: "Ten limbs of the body resemble lotuses. He has proportionate limbs. He is known by the virtue of his spledour, fame and glory. Both his teeth and eyes are fair. Six parts of his body are elevated, nine parts of his body are fine and sharp. He pursues spiritual merit, worldly comfort and sensual delight in three periods of the dayforenoon, midday and evening. He always adopts the righteous way of life.
35_20.word_by_word: राघवः Rama, दशपद्मः ten lotuslike limbs (eyes, face, mouth, tongue, lips, cheeks, nipples, nails, feet and hands), दशबृहत् he is one with ten wellproportioned limbs (head, forehead, ears, neck, chest, heart, belly, hands, legs, buttocks), त्रिभिः covered with three aspects (splendour, fame and glory), व्याप्तः well known, द्विशुक्लवान् two white limbs teeth and eyes, षडुन्नतः he has six elevated  limbs (nose, shoulders, forehead, chest and arm pits), नवतनुः has nine fine features (moustache, nails, knuckles, beard, skin, hair, penis, acumen, perception), त्रिभिः he pursues spiritual merit, worldlycomforts and sensual delight in three periodsforenoon, middday and evening of the day, व्याप्नोति follows righteous principles.

35_21.translation: "He is ever established in truth and righteousness. He is prosperous and desires to accumulate wealth in order to shower favour on others. He knows the right use of time and place in discharging his duties. He has endeared himself to all by his words.
35_21.word_by_word: सत्यधर्मपरः established in truth and righteousness, श्रीमान् prosperous, सङ्ग्रहानुग्रहे रतः he is involved in both accumulation and favourable disposition towards others, देशकालविभागज्ञः who discharges his duties at proper time and place, सर्वलोकप्रियंवदः who is loved by all for his endearing words.

35_22.shloka: भ्राता तस्य च द्वैमात्रस्सौमित्रिरपराजितः।अनुरागेण रूपेण गुणैश्चैव तथाविधः।।5.35.22।।
35_22.translation: "His invincible brother Saumitri born of a different mother is a replica of Rama in affection, charm and virtues.
35_22.word_by_word: तस्य his, द्वैमात्रः born of a different mother, भ्राता brother, अपराजितः one who has never been defeated, सौमित्रिः Saumitri, अनुरागेण in affection, रूपेण in charm, गुणैश्चैव in virtues, तथाविधः similar to him.

35_23.translation: "While earnestly searching for you all over the earth both tigers among men came in contact with us.
35_23.word_by_word: नरशार्दूलौ tiger among men, तौ they, उभौ both, त्वद्दर्शनसमुत्सुकौ eager to see you, कृत्स्नाम् entire, महीम् earth, विचिन्वन्तौ both searching for, अस्माभिः by us, अभिसङ्गतौ they met us.

35_24.shloka: त्वामेव मार्गमाणौ तौ विचरन्तौ वसुन्धराम्।ददर्शतुर्मृगपतिं पूर्वजेनावरोपितम्।।5.35.24।।ऋश्यमूकस्य पृष्ठे तु बहुपादपसङ्कुले।भ्रातुर्भयार्तमासीनं सुग्रीवं प्रियदर्शनम्।।5.35.25।।
35_24.translation: "While both of them were wandering, searching for you all over the earth they saw Sugriva, the lord of animals who had been thrown out of kingship by his elder brother and was living on the mountain Rshyamuka frightened of him.
35_24.word_by_word: त्वामेव for you, मार्गमाणौ while searching, वसुन्धराम् all over the earth, विचरन्तौ while both were wandering, तौ they both, बहुपादपसङ्कुले filled with many trees, ऋश्यमूकस्य पृष्ठे on the mountain Rshyamuka, आसीनम् seated, पूर्वजेन by the elder brother, अवरोपितम् one who has been thrown out, भ्रातुः brother's, भयार्तम् frightened, प्रियदर्शनम् one who is pleasing to see, मृगपतिम् lord of animals, सुग्रीवम् Sugriva, ददर्शतुः both of them saw.

35_25.shloka: वयं तु हरिराजं तं सुग्रीवं सत्यसङ्गरम्।परिचर्यामहे राज्यात्पूर्वजेनावरोपितम्।।5.35.26।।
35_25.translation: "Sugriva, king of vanaras who is committed to defend truth has been deposed from the kingdom by his elder brother. We keep attending on him.
35_25.word_by_word: वयं तु we too, पूर्वजेन by his elder brother, राज्यात् from the kingdom, अवरोपितम् deposed, सत्यसङ्गरम् one who is committed to truth, हरिराजम् king of vanaras, तम् him, सुग्रीवम् Sugriva, परिचर्यामहे we serve him.

35_26.shloka: ततस्तौ चीरवसनौ धनुः प्रवरपाणिनौ।ऋश्यमूकस्य शैलस्य रम्यं देशमुपागतौ।।5.35.27।।
35_26.translation: "Both the princes clad in bark robes and armed with powerful bows reached the beautiful location of Rshyamukha mountain.
35_26.word_by_word: ततः then, चीरवसनौ clad in bark robes, धनुःप्रवरपाणिनौ armed with powerful bows, तौ both, ऋश्यमूकस्य शैलस्य on the Rshyamukha mountain, रम्यम् beautiful, देशम् location, उपागतौ both reached.

35_27.shloka: स तौ दृष्ट्वा नरव्याघ्रौ धन्विनौ वानरर्षभः।अवप्लुतो गिरेस्तस्य शिखरं भयमोहितः।।5.35.28।।
35_27.translation: "On seeing the tigers among men armed with bows, Sugriva, the bull among vanaras jumped from the mountain deluded with fear and reached the peak.
35_27.word_by_word: सः he, वानरर्षभः bull among vanaras, धन्विनौ armed with bows, तौ both of them, नरव्याघ्रौ tigers among men, दृष्ट्वा on seeing, भयमोहितः deluded with fear, तस्य from that, गिरेः mountain, शिखरम् top, अभिप्लुतः jumped.

35_28.shloka: ततस्स शिखरे तस्मिन्वानरेन्द्रो व्यवस्थितः।तयोस्समीपं मामेव प्रेषयामास सत्वरम्।।5.35.29।।
35_28.translation: "Thereafter the lord of vanaras staying on the mountain top quickly sent me to meet both of them.
35_28.word_by_word: ततः thereafter, सः he, वानरेन्द्रः lord of vanaras, तस्मिन् on that, शिखरे mountain top, व्यवस्थितः staying there, मामेव me only, तयोः of both of them, समीपम् towads, सत्वरम् quickly, प्रेषयामास sent.

35_29.word_by_word: अहम् I, सुग्रीववचनात् according to the instruction of Sugriva, पुरुषव्याघ्रौ two tigers among men, प्रभू two lords, रूपलक्षणसम्पन्नौ both endowed with charming appearance and auspicious marks, तौ both, कृताञ्जलिः joined palms in salutation, उपस्थितः approached.

35_30.shloka: तौ परिज्ञाततत्त्वार्थौ मया प्रीतिसमन्वितौ।पृष्ठमारोप्य तं देशं प्रापितौ पुरुषर्षभौ।।5.35.31।।
35_30.translation: "I recognised the true status of  both the mighty men who were filled with joy, placed them on my back, and reached the mountaintop.
35_30.word_by_word: परिज्ञाततत्त्वर्थौ realised the true position, प्रीतिसमन्वितौ filled with pleasure, पुरुषर्षभौ two bulls among men, तौ both, मया by me, पृष्ठम् back, आरोप्य placing, तं देशम् to that place, प्रापितौ carried.

35_31.shloka: निवेदितौ च तत्त्वेन सुग्रीवाय महात्मने।तयोरन्योन्यसल्लापाद्भृशं प्रीतिरजायत।।5.35.32।।
35_31.translation: "I reported faithfully about both the highsouled men to Sugriva. As they got to know each other through conversation a fast friendship developed between them.
35_31.word_by_word: महात्मने to the great self, सुग्रीवाय to Sugriva, तत्त्वेन faithfully, निवेदितौ reported by me, तयोः of both of them, अन्योन्यसल्लापात् got to know each other through conversation, भृशम् fond, प्रीतिः friendship, अजायत developed.

35_32.word_by_word: ततः then, प्रीतिसम्पन्नौ full of joy, तौ both, हरीश्वरनरेश्वरौ king of monkeys and the king of people, पूर्ववृत्तया with their past, कथया with account, परस्परकृताश्वासौ they consoled each other.

35_33.shloka: ततस्स सान्त्वयामास सुग्रीवं लक्ष्मणाग्रजः।स्त्रीहेतोर्वालिना भ्रात्रा निरस्तमुरुतेजसा।।5.35.34।।
35_33.translation: "Then Rama, consoled Sugriva who was dethroned and abandoned on acount of a woman by his brother Vali, endowed with great prowess.
35_33.word_by_word: ततः thereafter, सः he, लक्ष्मणाग्रजः the elder brother of Lakshmana, उरुतेजसा with great prowess, भ्रात्रा by the brother, वालिना by Vali, स्त्रीहेतो on account of a woman, निरस्तम्  deposed, सुग्रीवम् Sugriva, सान्त्वयामास consoled.

35_34.shloka: ततस्त्वन्नाशजं शोकं रामस्याक्लिष्टकर्मणः।लक्ष्मणो वानरेन्द्राय सुग्रीवाय न्यवेदयत्।।5.35.35।।
35_34.translation: "Then Lakshmana spoke to the lord of vanaras, Sugriva about your loss and the grief caused to Rama, who is adept in accomplishing difficult deeds with ease.
35_34.word_by_word: ततः then, लक्ष्मणः Lakshmana, अक्लिष्टकर्मणः one who is adept in accomplishing tasks with ease, रामस्य Rama's, त्वन्नाशजम् on account of your loss, शोकम् grief, वानरेन्द्राय to the lord of vanaras, सुग्रीवाय to Sugriva, न्यवेदयत् revealed.

35_35.shloka: स श्रुत्वा वानरेन्द्रस्तु लक्ष्मणेनेरितं वचः।तदासीन्निष्प्रभोऽत्यर्थं ग्रहग्रस्त इवांशुमान्।।5.35.36।।
35_35.translation: "Having heard the words of Lakshmana, the king of vanaras became extremely lustreless like the Sun overshadowed by the planet Rahu.
35_35.word_by_word: सः he, वानरेन्द्रस्तु to the king of vanaras, लक्ष्मणेन by Lakshmana, ईरितम् spoken वचः words, श्रुत्वा having heard, तदा then, ग्रहग्रस्तः overshadowed by the planet, अंशुमानिव like the Sun, अत्यर्थम् extremely, निष्प्रभः lustreless, आसीत् became.

35_36.shloka: ततस्त्वद्गात्रशोभीनि रक्षसा ह्रियमाणया।यान्याभरणजालानि पातितानि महीतले।।5.35.37।।तानि सर्वाणि रामाय आनीय हरियूथपाः।संहृष्टा दर्शयामासुर्गतिं तु न विदुस्तव।।5.35.38।।
35_36.word_by_word: ततः at that time, रक्षसा by the demon, ह्रियमाणया when you were borne away, त्वद्गात्रशोभिनी adorned your limbs, यानि those, आभरणजालानि bundle of ornaments, पातितानि dropped down, तानि सर्वाणि all of them, आनीय brought, हरियूथपाः vanara leaders, संहृष्टाः with great joy, रामाय to Rama, दर्शयामासुः showed, तव your, गतिं तु whereabouts, न विदुः did not know.

35_37.shloka: तानि रामाय दत्तानि मयैवोपहृतानि च।स्वनवन्त्यवकीर्णानि तस्मिन्विगतचेतसि।।5.35.39।।
35_37.translation: "I collected the ornaments and gave them to Rama. He lost his senses on seeing thejingling ornaments scattered.
35_37.word_by_word: मयैव by me, उपहृतानि collected, तानि those ornaments, रामाय to Rama, दत्तानि gave, तस्मिन् them, विगतचेतसि lost senses, स्वनवन्ति making jingling sound, अवकीर्णानि having scattered.

35_38.shloka: तान्यङ्के दर्शनीयानि कृत्वा बहुविधं तव।तेन देवप्रकाशेन देवेन परिदेवितम्।।5.35.40।।
35_38.translation: "The divine self who is effulgent like god wailed in many ways placing the beautiful ornaments on his lap.
35_38.word_by_word: दर्शनीयानि beautiful ones, तव your, तानि those, अङ्के on his lap, कृत्वा having placed, देवप्रकाशेन by an effulgent one looking like the divine, तेन by him, देवेन divine self, बहुविधम् in many ways, परिदेवितम् wailed.

35_39.translation: "Rama looked at them and wept clasping them again and again in grief which inflamed like fire.
35_39.word_by_word: तानि them, पश्यतः as looked at, रुदतः while he wept, पुनः पुनः again and again, ताम्यतश्च  regretting, दाशरथेः Dasaratha's son Rama's, शोकहुताशनम् fire in the form of grief, तानि them, प्रादीपयन् inflamed.

35_40.shloka: शयितं च चिरं तेन दुःखार्तेन महात्मना।मयापि विविधैर्वाक्यैः कृच्छ्रादुत्थापितः पुनः।।5.35.42।।
35_40.translation: "Rama, the great self, immersed in sorrow lay down on the ground. I also consoled him with great difficulty and helped him to get up.
35_40.word_by_word: दुःखार्तेन immersed in sorrow, तेन by him, महात्मना by the great self, शयितं च lay down, मयापि by me also, विविधैः by many, वाक्यैः by words, कृच्छ्रात् with great difficulty, पुनः again, उत्थापितः helped to get up.

35_41.shloka: तानि दृष्ट्वा महाबाहुर्दर्शयित्वा मुहुर्मुहुः।राघवस्सह सौमित्रिस्सुग्रीवे स न्यवेदयत्।।5.35.43।।
35_41.translation: "Longarmed Rama along with Lakshmana looked at them again and again and gave them to the care of Sugriva.
35_41.word_by_word: महाबाहुः longarmed one, सः राघवः that Rama, सहसौमित्रिः along with Lakshmana, तानि those, मुहुः मुहुः again and again, दर्शयित्वा after showing, सुग्रीवे to Sugriva, न्यवेदयत् presented.

35_42.shloka: स तवादर्शनादार्ये राघवः परितप्यते।महता ज्वलता नित्यमग्निनेवाग्निपर्वतः।।5.35.44।।
35_42.translation: "O divine lady on account of your separation he is ever blazing like a mountain of fire (Samvartaka).
35_42.word_by_word: आर्ये O divine lady, सः राघवः that Rama, तव your, अदर्शनात् separation from you, नित्यम् always, ज्वलता burning, महता great, अग्निना in fire, अग्निपर्वतः इव like a mountain of fire, परितप्यते  ever blazing.

35_43.shloka: त्वत्कृते तमनिद्रा च शोकश्चिन्ता च राघवम्।तापयन्ति महात्मानमग्न्यगारमिवाग्नयः।।5.35.45।।
35_43.translation: "Rama is burning like a furnace by (three fires) sleeplessness, grief and intense anxiety just as the three sacred fires keep a firesanctuary intensely heated.
35_43.word_by_word: त्वत्कृते on account of, महात्मानम् the great one, तं राघवम् that Rama, अनिद्रा च not sleeping, शोकः grief, चिन्ता च intense anxiety, अग्न्यगारम् like a furnace, अग्नयः इव like the three fires, तापयन्ति keep intensely heated.

35_44.shloka: तवादर्शनशोकेन राघवः प्रविचाल्यते।महता भूमिकम्पेन महानिव शिलोच्चयः।।5.35.46।।
35_44.translation: "On account of sorrow caused by not being able to see you, Rama of Raghu dynasty is shaken up like a lofty mountain is shaken by earthquake.
35_44.word_by_word: तव your, अदर्शनशोकेन by the sorrow of not being able to see you, राघवः Rama of Raghu dynasty, महता with great, भूमिकम्पेन by earthquake, महान् great, शिलोच्छयः lofty mountain, प्रविचाल्यते is shaken.

35_45.shloka: काननानि सुरम्याणि नदीः प्रस्रवणानि च।चरन्न रतिमाप्नोति त्वामपश्यन्नृपात्मजे।।5.35.47।।
35_45.translation: "Oh princess unable to see you, Rama has found no joy in roaming delightful forests, rivers and streams.
35_45.word_by_word: नृपात्मजे daughter of a king, त्वाम् you, अपश्यन् unable to see, सुरम्याणि very delightful, काननानि forests, नदीः rivers, प्रस्रवणानि च and streams, चरन् while moving, रतिम् happiness, न आप्नोति not finding.

35_46.shloka: स त्वां मनुजशार्दूलः क्षिप्रं प्राप्स्यति राघवः।समित्रबान्धवं हत्वा रावणं जनकात्मजे।।5.35.48।।
35_46.translation: "Oh daughter of Janaka after killing Ravana, along with his friends and relatives Rama, the tiger among men, will meet you.
