35_46.word_by_word: जनकात्मजे Oh daughter of Janaka, मनुजशार्दूलः a tiger among men, सः राघवः that Rama, समित्रबान्धवम् along with his friends and relatives, रावणम् Ravana, हत्वा after killing, त्वाम् you, क्षिप्रम् soon, प्राप्स्यति will attain.

35_47.shloka: सहितौ रामसुग्रीवावुभावकुरुतां तदा।समयं वालिनं हन्तुं तव चान्वेषणं तथा।।5.35.49।।
35_47.translation: "(Having become friends) Rama and Sugriva together reached an agreement to kill Vali and search for you.
35_47.word_by_word: तदा then, रामसुग्रीवौ Rama and Sugriva, उभौ both, सहितौ together with, वालिनम् Vali, हन्तुम् to kill, तथा likewise, तव your, अन्वेषणम् search, समयम् agreement, अकुरुताम् reached.

35_48.shloka: ततस्ताभ्यां कुमाराभ्यां वीराभ्यां स हरीश्वरः।किष्किन्धां समुपागम्य वाली युद्धे निपातितः।।5.35.50।।
35_48.translation: "Thereafter both the princes together arrived at Kishkinda and killed Vali, king of vanaras in a combat.
35_48.word_by_word: ततः thereafter, वीराभ्याम् by both the heroes, ताभ्याम् by both of them, कुमाराभ्याम् by both princes, किष्किन्धाम् to Kishkinda, समुपागम्य after reaching, हरीश्वरः king of vanaras, सः that, वाली Vali, युद्धे in war, निपातितः killed.

35_49.shloka: ततो निहत्य तरसा रामो वालिनमाहवे।सर्वर्क्षहरिसङ्घानां सुग्रीवमकरोत्पतिम्।।5.35.51।।
35_49.translation: "Then Rama quickly killed Vali in a combat and made Sugriva the lord of all troops of vanaras and bears.
35_49.word_by_word: ततः then, रामः Rama, आहवे in a combat, तरसा quickly, वालिनम् Vali, निहत्य killed, सुग्रीवम् Sugriva, सर्वर्क्षहरिसङ्घानाम् for all troops of vanaras, पतिम् king, अकरोत् made.

35_50.shloka: रामसुग्रीवयोरैक्यं देव्येवं समजायत।हनुमन्तं च मां विद्धि तयोर्दूतमिहागतम्।।5.35.52।।
35_50.translation: "Oh Illustrious lady In that manner alliance was established between Rama and Sugriva. Know me to be Hanuman, arrived here as their messenger.
35_50.word_by_word: देवि Oh Illustrious lady, रामसुग्रीवयोः of both Rama and Sugriva, ऐक्यम् alliance, एवम् in that way, समजायत established, माम् me, तयोः their, दूतम् messenger, आगतम् came here, हनुमन्तम् Hanuman, विद्धि you may know.

35_51.shloka: स्वराज्यं प्राप्य सुग्रीवस्समानीय हरीश्वरान्।त्वदर्थं प्रेषयामास दिशो दश महाबलान्।।5.35.53।।
35_51.translation: "Having obtained his kingdom Sugriva despatched the vanara leaders to all ten directions (to search for you).
35_51.word_by_word: सुग्रीवः Sugriva, स्वराज्यम् his kingdom, प्राप्य having obtained, महाबलान् great army, हरीश्वरान् monkey leaders, समानीय after collecting, त्वदर्थम् for your sake, दश ten, दिशः directions, प्रेषयामास sent.

35_52.shloka: आदिष्टा वानरेन्द्रेण सुग्रीवेण महौजसा।अद्रिराजप्रतीकाशास्सर्वतः प्रस्थितौ महीम्।।5.35.54।।
35_52.translation: "Following Sugriva's orders, the powerful monkey leaders huge as the Himalayas, king of mountains went all over the earth (searching).
35_52.word_by_word: वानरेन्द्रेण by the monkey leaders, महौजसा very powerful one, सुग्रीवेण by Sugriva, आदिष्टाः ordered, अद्रिराजप्रतीकाशाः huge as the Himalayas, king of mountains, सर्वतः all over, महीम् the earth, प्रस्थिता started moving.

35_53.shloka: ततस्ते मार्गमाणा वै सुग्रीववचनातुराः।चरन्ति वसुधां कृत्स्नां वयमन्ये च वानराः।।5.35.55।।
35_53.translation: "Following Sugriva's orders, we, the monkeys, since then are moving about searchingthe entire earth eager to find you or to carry out Sugriva's orders.
35_53.word_by_word: ततः then, ते they, वयम् we, अन्ये others, वानराः च and the vanaras, सुग्रीववचनातुराः eager to carry out Sugriva's order, मार्गमाणाः while searching, कृत्स्नाम् entire, वसुधाम् the earth, चरन्ति we are moving about.

35_54.word_by_word: लक्ष्मीवान् prosperous, वालिसूनुः Vali's son, महाबलः mighty, अङ्गदो नाम called Angada, हरिशार्दूलः a tiger among vanaras, त्रिभागबलसंवृतः together with one third of the army, प्रस्थितः departed.

35_55.shloka: तेषां नो विप्रणष्टानां विन्ध्ये पर्वतसत्तमे।भृशं शोकपरीतानामहोरात्रगणा गताः।।5.35.57।।
35_55.translation: "We wasted many nights and days immersed in disappointment (for not being able to find you) and we missed our path in the great Vindhya mountain.
35_55.word_by_word: विन्ध्ये in Vindhya, पर्वतसत्तमे in the great mountain, विप्रणष्टानाम् of those who were lost, भृशम् greatly, शोकपरीतानाम् of those immersed in sorrow, तेषाम् of all of them, नः of us, अहोरात्रगणाः many nights and days, गताःpassed

35_56.shloka: ते वयं कार्यनैराश्यात्कालस्यातिक्रमेण च।भयाच्च कपिराजस्य प्राणांस्त्यक्तुं व्यवस्थिताः।।5.35.58।।
35_56.translation: "We decided to give up our lives due to disappointment, transgression of the time limit  fixed for us and fear of the monkey lord (fear of facing the king without finding you).
35_56.word_by_word: ते वयम् we were, कार्यनैराश्यात् disappointed, कालस्य of the time limit, अतिक्रमेण च exceeding, कपिराजस्य of monkey king's, भयाच्च out of fear also, प्राणान् life also, त्यक्तुम् to give up, व्यवस्थिताः decided.

35_57.shloka: विचित्य वनदुर्गाणि गिरिप्रस्रवणानि च।अनासाद्य पदं देव्याः प्राणांस्त्यक्तुं समुद्यताः।।5.35.59।।
35_57.translation: "We decided to give up our lives since we were unable to see the feet of the queen (Sita) even after searching the forest fortresses and the (banks of) mountain streams.
35_57.word_by_word: वनदुर्गाणि impenetrable forest forts, गिरिप्रस्रवणानि च mountain streams, विचित्य having searched, देव्याः the queen's, पदम् feet, अनासाद्य by not getting, प्राणान् life, त्यक्तुम् to give up, समुद्यताः we decided.

35_58.shloka: दृष्ट्वा प्रायोपविष्टांश्च सर्वान्वानरपुङ्गवान्।भृशं शोकार्णवे मग्नः पर्यदेवयदङ्गदः।।5.35.60।।तव नाशं च वैदेहि वालिनश्च वधं तथा।प्रायोपवेशमस्माकं मरणं च जटायुषः।।5.35.61।।
35_58.word_by_word: वैदेहि oh Vaidehi, प्रायोपविष्टान् when we decided to die, सर्वान् all, वानरपुङ्गवान् vanara leaders, दृष्ट्वा on seeing, अङ्गदः Angada, भृशम् intensely, शोकार्णवे in the sea of sorrow, मग्नः plunged, तव yourself, नाशं च not found, तथा वालिनः similarly Vali's, वधं च and his killing, जटायुषः Jatayu's, मरणं च death also, अस्माकम् all of us, प्रायोपवेशम् decision to die, पर्यदेवयत् he was grieved.

35_59.translation: "When we were disappointed (in tracing you) and were at the point of death having been commanded by the king (that whosoever overstays would be killed) a gigantic powerful bird appeared to fulfil our task.
35_59.word_by_word: स्वामिसन्देशात् according to the king's cmmand (that who ever overstays would be killed), निराशानाम् disappointed, मुमूर्षताम् when we were desiring to die, तेषाम् for such of us, नः tous, कार्यहेतोरिव as if to fulfil the task, वीर्यवान् powerful, महान् gigantic, शकुनिः bird, आयातः came.

35_60.shloka: गृध्रराजस्य सोदर्यः सम्पातिर्नाम गृध्रराट्।श्रुत्वा भ्रातृवधं कोपादिदं वचनमब्रवीत्।।5.35.63।।
35_60.translation: "That king of vultures, Sampati was the brother of king of birds Jatayu. Hearing about the death of his younger brother Sampati felt distresed and spoke in anger:
35_60.word_by_word: गृध्रराजस्य of the king of vultures, सोदर्यः brother, सम्पातिर्नाम called Sampati, गृध्रराट् king of birds, भ्रातृवधम् death of Jatayu, श्रुत्वा on hearing, कोपात् with anger, इदम् this, वचनम् word, अब्रवीत् spoke.

35_61.shloka: यवीयान्केन मे भ्राता हतः क्व च निपातितः।एतदाख्यातुमिच्छामि भवद्भिर्वानरोत्तमाः।।5.35.64।।
35_61.translation: 'O best of vanaras by whom was my younger brother killed? Where was he dropped down? I wish you to tell me all about that.
35_61.word_by_word: मे my, यवीयान् younger, भ्राता brother, केन by whom, हतः was killed, क्व where, निपातितः was he dropped, वानरोत्तमाः of best of vanaras, भवद्भिः by you, एतत् this, आख्यातुम् to tell, इच्छामि I desire.

35_62.shloka: अङ्गदोऽकथयत्तस्य जनस्थाने महद्वधम्।रक्षसा भीमरूपेण त्वामुद्दिश्य यथातथम्।।5.35.65।।
35_62.word_by_word: त्वाम् you, उद्दिश्य aiming at, भीमरूपेण by a dreadful person, रक्षसा by the demon, जनस्थाने in Janasthana, महद्वधम् great killing, यथातथम् as it happened faithfully, अङ्गदः Angada, तस्यto him, अकथयत् told.

35_63.shloka: जटायुषो वधं श्रुत्वा दुःखितस्सोऽरुणात्मजः।त्वां शशंस वरारोहे वसन्तीं रावणालये।।5.35.66।।
35_63.translation: "Having heard about the death of Jatayu, O charming lady that Sampati Aruna's son felt sad and told us that you are at Ravana's palace.
35_63.word_by_word: वरारोहे oh charming lady, सः he, अरुणात्मजः Aruna's son, जटायुषः Jatayu's, वधं death, श्रुत्वा having heard, दुःखितः became sad, त्वाम् yourself, रावणालये in Ravana's palace, वसन्तीम् living, शशंस narrated to us.

35_64.shloka: तस्य तद्वचनं श्रुत्वा सम्पातेः प्रीतिवर्धनम्।अङ्गदप्रमुखास्तूर्णं ततस्सम्प्रस्थिता वयम्।।5.35.67।।
35_64.translation: "Having heard Sampati's encouraging words all of us led by Angada departed immediately.
35_64.word_by_word: तस्य his, सम्पातेः Samapati's, प्रीतिवर्धनम् that which was pleasing, तत् that, वचनम् word, श्रुत्वा having heard, अङ्गदप्रमुखाः Angada and others, वयम् all of us, तूर्णम् quickly, ततः from there, प्रस्थिताः departed.

35_65.translation: "The happy monkeys were satisfied. Enthusiastic about seeing you, they rose from the Vindhya mountain and reached the limit of the sea  shore in the north.
35_65.word_by_word: प्लवङ्गमाः vanaras, त्वद्दर्शनकृतोत्साहा enthused to see you, हृष्टाः joyfully, तुष्टाः satisfied, विन्ध्यात् from Vindhya, उत्थाय having got up, सागरस्य towards the sea, उत्तरम् अन्तम् the limit of the northern direction, सम्प्राप्ताः reached.

35_66.word_by_word: अङ्गदप्रमुखाः Angada and other leaders, सर्वे all, त्वद्दर्शनमुत्सुकाः enthusiastic to see you, वेलोपान्तम् sea shore, उपस्थिताः reached, भीताः they were frightened, पुनः again, चिन्ताम् worry, जग्मुः felt.

35_67.shloka: अथाहं हरिसैन्यस्य सागरं प्रेक्ष्य सीदतः।व्यवधूय भयं तीव्रं योजनानां शतं प्लुतः।।5.35.70।।
35_67.translation: "When the vanara army was feeling despondent at the sight of the ocean, I leaped across the sea, a hundred yojanas, pushing aside  all my fear.
35_67.word_by_word: अथ then, अहम् I, सागरम् ocean, प्रेक्ष्य after looking at, सीदतः in desperate mood, हरिसैन्यस्य Vanara army's, तीव्रम् intense, भयम् fear, व्यवधूय after pushing aside, योजनानाम् of yojanas, शतम् one hundred, प्लुतः leaped.

35_68.shloka: लङ्का चापि मया रात्रौ प्रविष्टा राक्षसाकुला।रावणश्च मया दृष्टस्त्वं च शोकपरिप्लुता।।5.35.71।।
35_68.translation: "I entered at night the city of Lanka teeming with demons and saw Ravana and saw you immersed in sorrow.
35_68.word_by_word: राक्षसाकुला filled with demons, लङ्का चापि Lanka also, मया by me, रात्रौ at night, प्रविष्टा entered, मया by me, रावणश्च Ravana also, दृष्टः is seen, शोकपरिप्लुता immersed in sorrow, त्वं च you also.

35_69.shloka: एतत्ते सर्वमाख्यातं यथावृत्तमनन्दिते।अभिभाषस्व मां देवि दूतो दाशरथेरहम्।।5.35.72।।
35_69.translation: "O sinless lady I have given you a faithful account. I am a messenger of Dasaratha's son. And you may speak now, O divine lady
35_69.word_by_word: अनिन्दिते O sinless lady, देवि O divine lady, एतत् this, सर्वम् everything, यथावृत्तम् as it happened, ते to you, आख्यातम् narrated, माम् me, अभिभाषस्व you may speak, अहम् I, दाशरथेः Dasaratha's son, दूतः messenger.

35_70.shloka: तं मां रामकृतोद्योगं त्वन्निमित्तमिहागतम्।सुग्रीवसचिवं देवि बुद्ध्यस्व पवनात्मजम्।।5.35.73।।
35_70.translation: "O divine lady Know that I have come here for your cause carrying out the mission of Rama. I am Sugriva'a minister and son of the Windgod.
35_70.word_by_word: देवि O divine lady, तं माम् such me, रामकृतोद्योगम् have taken up Rama's mission, त्वन्निमित्तम् on your account, इह here, आगतम् came, सुग्रीवसचिवम् minister of Sugriva, पवनात्मजम् son of Vayu, बुद्ध्यस्व you may know.

35_71.shloka: कुशली तव काकुत्स्थस्सर्वशस्त्रभृतां वरः।गुरोराराधने युक्तो लक्ष्मणश्च सुलक्षणः।।5.35.74।।
35_71.translation: "Your lord Rama of Kakutstha race, supreme among wielders of weapons is doing well. So is venerable Lakshmana endowed with auspicious signs engaged in serving him.
35_71.word_by_word: सर्वशस्त्रभृताम् among all wielders of weapons, वरः supreme, तव your, काकुत्स्थ Rama of the Kakutstha race, कुशली he is keeping well, गुरोः of his venerable teacher, आराधने in service, युक्तः engaged, सुलक्षणः a man of auspicious signs, लक्ष्मणश्च Lakshmana also.

35_72.shloka: तस्य वीर्यवतो देवि भर्तुस्तव हिते रतः।अहमेकस्तु सम्प्राप्त स्सुग्रीववचनादिह।।5.35.75।।
35_72.translation: "O queen seeking the welfare of your Valiant husband I came here at the behest of Sugriva all alone.
35_72.word_by_word: देवि O queen, वीर्यवतः of valourous, तव your, भर्तुः husband's, तस्य his, हिते seeking welfare, रतः engaged, अहम् I, सुग्रीववचनात् at the behest of Sugriva, इह here, एकः alone, प्राप्तः reached.

35_73.translation: "I can assume any form at my will. I searched for you without any help moving in the southern direction and reached this place .
35_73.word_by_word: त्वन्मार्गविचयैषिणा while searching for your location, कामरूपिणा by a person who can take any form at will, असहायेन without any help, चरता while moving, मया by myself, इयम् this, दक्षिणा दिक् southern direction, अनुक्रान्ता reached.

35_74.translation: "Fortunately for me I can finally dispel the fear of the vanara chiefs who are regretting your loss, by letting them know that you have been found.
35_74.word_by_word: दिष्ट्या fortunately for me, अहम् I, त्वन्नाशम् your loss, अनुशोचताम् regretting, हरिसैन्यानाम् of the vanara army, सन्तापम् grief, तव your, अभिगमशंसनात् by letting them know, अपनेष्यामि I will dispel their sorrow.

35_75.shloka: दिष्ट्या हि मम न व्यर्थं देवि सागरलङ्घनम्।प्राप्स्याम्यहमिदं दिष्ट्या त्वद्दर्शनकृतं यशः।।5.35.78।।
35_75.translation: "Oh queen luckily for me, crossing the ocean has not gone in vain. I am fortunate because I will attain fame of finding you.
35_75.word_by_word: देवि oh queen, दिष्ट्या luckily, मम my, सागरलङ्घनम् crossing the ocean, न व्यर्थम् is not wasted, दिष्ट्या fortunately, अहम् I, त्वद्दर्शनकृतम् by the act of seeing you, इदम् thus, यशः fame, प्राप्स्यामि I will attain.

35_76.shloka: राघवश्च महावीर्यः क्षिप्रं त्वामभिपत्स्यते।समित्रबान्धवं हत्वा रावणं राक्षसाधिपम्।।5.35.79।।
35_76.translation: "Mighty Raghava will take you after killing Ravana, the king of demons along with his kith and kin.
35_76.word_by_word: महावीर्यः mighty hero, राघवश्च Raghava, समित्रबान्धवम् accompanied by friends and relatives, राक्षसाधिपम् king of demons, रावणम् Ravana, हत्वा after killing, क्षिप्रम् very soon, त्वाम् yourself, अभिपत्स्यते will reach you.

35_77.shloka: माल्यवान्नाम वैदेहि गिरीणामुत्तमो गिरिः।ततो गच्छति गोकर्णं पर्वतं केसरी हरिः।।5.35.80।।
35_77.translation: "Oh Vaidehi there is a famous mountain called Malyavan. From there a monkey called Kesari went to mount Gokarna.
35_77.word_by_word: वैदेहि Vaidehi, गिरीणाम् among the mountains, उत्तमः the best one, माल्यवान्नाम Malyavan, गिरिः mountain, ततः from there, केसरी Kesari, हरिः monkey, गोकर्णम् Gokarna, पर्वतम् mountain, गच्छति went.

35_78.shloka: स च देवर्षिभिर्दिष्टः पिता मम महाकपिः।तीर्थे नदीपतेः पुण्ये शम्बसादनमुद्धरत्।।5.35.81।।
35_78.translation: "He (Kesari) is said to be my father by the divine sages. He retrieved a piece of land in a holy spot of that sea shore and killed Sambasadana, a demon who was oppressing righteous people.
35_78.word_by_word: देवर्षिभिः by the divine sages, दिष्टः predicted, मम my, पिता father, सः महाकपिः that great monkey, नदीपतेः of lord of rivers, ocean, पुण्ये holy, तीर्थे in a place, शम्बसादनम् Sambasadanam, उद्धरत् raised.

35_79.shloka: तस्याहं हरिणः क्षेत्रे जातो वातेन मैथिलि।हनुमानिति विख्यातो लोके स्वेनैव कर्मणा।।5.35.82।।
35_79.translation: "O Mythili I was born in that land retrieved by the Windgod. I am known as Hanuman by virtue of my own action.
35_79.word_by_word: मैथिलि Mythili, अहम् I, तस्य his, हरिणः monkey's, क्षेत्रे in the land, वातेन by the Windgod, जातः born, स्वेन कर्मणा एव by my own act, लोके by people, हनुमानिति Hanuman, विख्यातः came to be known.

35_80.shloka: विश्वासार्थं तु वैदेहि भर्तुरुक्ता मया गुणाः।अचिराद्राघवो देवि त्वामितो नयिताऽनघे।।5.35.83।।
35_80.translation: "In order to inspire confidence in you about me I have narrated the virtues of your husband. O sinless queen Rama will take you from here very soon".
35_80.word_by_word: वैदेहि Vaidehi, विश्वासार्थम् for inspiring confidence, मया by me, भर्तुः  your husband's, गुणाः qualities, उक्ताः are described, देवि O queen, राघवः Raghava, अचिरात् very soon, त्वाम् you, इतः from here, नयिता he will take you away, अनघे lady free from sins.

35_81.translation: The griefstricken Sita trusted him by his logical presentation of reasons as well as identifications. She believed that he was a messenger (of Rama).
35_81.word_by_word: शोककर्शिता tormented by grief, सीता Sita, एवम् in that way, हेतुभिः with possible reasons, विश्वासिता having trusted, उपपन्नैः by the evidences, अभिज्ञानैः with identification, तम् him, दूतम् as a messenger, अवगच्छति she understood.

35_82.shloka: अतुलं च गता हर्षं प्रहर्षेण च जानकी।नेत्राभ्यां वक्रपक्ष्माभ्यां मुमोचानन्दजं जलम्।।5.35.85।।
35_82.translation: Janaki experienced immeasurable happiness and shed tears of joy through her curved eyes.
35_82.word_by_word: जानकी Janaki, अतुलम् immeasurable, हर्षम् happiness, गता च experienced, प्रहर्षेण in her joy, वक्रपक्ष्माभ्याम् through her curved eyelashes, नेत्राभ्याम् from both eyes, आनन्दजम् arising out of joy, जलम् tears, मुमोच shed.

35_83.shloka: चारु तद्वदनं तस्यास्ताम्रशुक्लायतेक्षणम्।अशोभत विशालाक्ष्या राहुमुक्त इवोडुराट्।।5.35.86।।
35_83.translation: Her face with large eyes with a tinge of red corners shone like the Moon released from Rahu.
35_83.word_by_word: विशालाक्ष्याः of largeeyed lady, तस्याः her, चारु lovely, ताम्रशुक्लायतेक्षणम् having wide white eyes with tinge of red corners, तत् that, वदनम् face, राहुमुक्तः released from Rahu, उडुराडिव like the Moon, अशोभत shone.

35_84.shloka: हनुमन्तं कपिं व्यक्तं मन्यते नान्यथेति सा।अथोवाच हनूमांस्तामुत्तरं प्रियदर्शनाम्।।5.35.87।।
35_84.translation: She realised that the monkey was none other than Hanuman. Then he looked at her who was pleasing to see and spoke again:
35_84.word_by_word: सा she, हनुमन्तम् Hanuman, व्यक्तम् clearly, कपिम् the monkey, मन्यते realised, अन्यथा इति none other than, अथ then, हनूमान् Hanuman, प्रियदर्शनाम् a lady pleasing to see, ताम् her,उत्तराम् later, उवाच spoke.

35_85.shloka: एतत्ते सर्वमाख्यातं समाश्वसिहि मैथिलि।किं करोमि कथं वा ते रोचते प्रतियाम्यहम्।।5.35.88।।
35_85.translation: "Mythili, everything I intended to say has been narrated to you. Calm yourself down. What shall I do? Or else, tell me what pleases you. I shall go back.
35_85.word_by_word: मैथिलि Mythili, ते to you, एतत् सर्वम् everything, आख्यातम् is narrated, समाश्वसिहि calm down, किम् what, करोमि shall I do, ते to you, कथं वा or how, रोचते it pleases, अहम् I, प्रतियामि I will go back.

35_86.shloka: हतेऽसुरे संयति शम्बसादने कपिप्रवीरेण महर्षिचोदनात्।ततोऽस्मि वायुप्रभवो हि मैथिलि प्रभावतस्तत्प्रतिमश्च वानरः।।5.35.89।।
35_86.translation: "(My father) a mighty monkey killed Sambasadana in a battle on the command of a great seer. I am a vanara (born to a monkey) by the impact of the Windgod. I am equal to the Windgod in power."इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये सुन्दरकाण्डे पञ्चत्रिंशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the thirtyfifth sarga of Sundarakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
35_86.word_by_word: मैथिलि Maithili, संयति in a fight, शम्बसादने Sambasadana, असुरे when the demon, कपिप्रवरेण mighty monkey, महर्षिचोदनात् by the command of great sage, हते सति where he was slain, अथ then, वायुप्रभवः by the spread of wind, प्रभावतः by his prowess, तत्प्रतिमः equal to him, वानरः vanara, अस्मि I am.

36_1.shloka: [Hanuman hands over the signet ring to Sita]भूय एव महातेजा हनूमान्पवनात्मजः।अब्रवीत्प्रश्रितं वाक्यं सीताप्रत्ययकारणात्।।5.36.1।।
36_1.translation: Mighty Hanuman, the son of the Windgod again spoke to Sita humbly to inspire confidence in her.
36_1.word_by_word: महातेजाः mighty, पवनात्मजः son of the Windgod, हनुमान् Hanuman, सीताप्रत्ययकारणात् in order to inspire trust in Sita, भूय एव again this way, प्रश्रितम् humbly, वाक्यम् these words, अब्रवीत् said.

36_2.shloka: वानरोऽहं महाभागे दूतो रामस्य धीमतः।रामनामाङ्कितं चेदं पश्य देव्यङ्गुलीयकम्।।5.36.2।।
36_2.translation: "O noble lady I am a vanara, an envoy of learned Rama. You see this ring with Rama's name inscribed on it, O godlike lady
36_2.word_by_word: महाभागे O noble lady, अहम् I am, धीमतः learned, रामस्य Rama's, दूतः envoy, वानरः vanara, देवि O godlike lady, रामनामाङ्कितम् which has the name of Rama inscribed, इदम् this, अङ्गुलीयकं च ring also, पश्य you see.

36_3.shloka: प्रत्ययार्थं तवाऽनीतं तेन दत्तं महात्मना।समाश्वसिहि भद्रं ते क्षीणदुःखफला ह्यसि।।5.36.3।।
36_3.translation: "Be calm. Be blessed. Your sorrows have come to an end. This (the ring) is given by the great self, Rama, to make you trust me.
36_3.word_by_word: महात्मना greatself, तेन by him, दत्तम् given, तव your, प्रत्ययार्थम् to make you trust, अनीतम् is brought, समाश्वसिहि be calm, ते to you, भद्रम् let you be auspicious, क्षीणदुःखफला your sorows ended, असि हि indeed.

36_4.shloka: गृहीत्वा प्रेक्षमाणा सा भर्तुः करविभूषणम्।भर्तारमिव सम्प्राप्ता जानकी मुदिताऽभवत्।।5.36.4।।
36_4.translation: She received the ornament that adorned her husband's hand and gazed at it and felt delighted as though her husband had arrived.
36_4.word_by_word: भर्तुः husband, करविभूषणम् ornament that adorned his hand, गृहीत्वा having received, प्रेक्षमाणा gazing, सा जानकी Janaki, भर्तारम् husband, सम्प्राप्ता इव as if reached, मुदिता delighted, अभवत् became.

36_5.shloka: चारु तद्वदनं तस्यास्ताम्रशुक्लायतेक्षणम्।अशोभत विशालाक्ष्या राहुमुक्त इवोडुराट्।।5.36.5।।
36_5.translation: Her beautiful countenance with large white eyes with a reddish tinge in the corners shone like the Moon released from Rahu.
36_5.word_by_word: तस्यास्ताम्रशुक्लायतेक्षणम् her white eyes with reddish tinge at the corners of the eyes, चारु beautiful, तद्वदनं her countenance, विशालाक्ष्या largeeyed, राहुमुक्त released by Rahu, इवोडुराट् like the Moon अशोभत shone

36_6.shloka: ततस्सा ह्रीमती बाला भर्तृसन्देशहर्षिता।परितुष्टा प्रियं कृत्वा प्रशशंस महाकपिम्।।5.36.6।।
36_6.translation: Young Sita felt delighted about her husband's news and blushed. By praising him for his action, she pleased the great monkey.
36_6.word_by_word: ततः then, बाला young lady, सा that Sita, भर्तृसन्देशहर्षिता delighted at the news of her husband, ह्रीमती blushing lady, परितुष्टा felt happy, प्रियम् pleasing, कृत्वा action, महाकपिम् by the great monkey, प्रशशंस praised.

36_7.shloka: विक्रान्तस्त्वं समर्थस्त्वं प्राज्ञस्त्वं वानरोत्तम।येनेदं राक्षसपदं त्वयैकेन प्रधर्षितम्।।5.36.7।।
36_7.translation: "O foremost among the vanaras you have trespassed the abodes of demons all alone. You are mighty and capable and wise.
36_7.word_by_word: वानरोत्तम O foremost among the vanaras, एकेन single handed, येन by which, त्वया by you, इदम् this, राक्षसपदम् demon's abode, प्रधर्षितम् assailed, त्वम् you, विक्रान्तः you are very brave, त्वम् you, समर्थः are able, त्वम् you, प्राज्ञः are wise.

36_8.translation: "You with your admirable prowess have reduced this ocean which is an abode of crocodiles stretching over a hundred yojanas to a cow's hoof mark.
36_8.word_by_word: विक्रमश्लाघनीयेन by your admirable prowess, क्रमता advancing, शतयोजनविस्तीर्णः extended over a hundred yojanas, मकरालयः abode of crocodiles, सागरः ocean, गोष्पदीकृतः is reduced to calf's hoof mark.

36_9.shloka: न हि त्वां प्राकृतं मन्ये वानरं वानरर्षभ।यस्य ते नास्ति सन्त्रासो रावणान्नापि सम्भ्रमः।।5.36.9।।
36_9.translation: "I do not think you are an ordinary monkey. You have no fear or excitement about Ravana. You are a bull among vanaras.
36_9.word_by_word: वानरर्षभ O bull among vanaras, यस्य of whom, ते to you, रावणात् from Ravana, सन्त्रासः fear, नास्ति not there, सम्भ्रमः अपि even excitement, न not, त्वाम् for you, प्राकृतम् ordinary, वानरम् monkey, न मन्ये I do not think.

36_10.shloka: अर्हसे च कपिश्रेष्ठ मया समभिभाषितुम्।यद्यसि प्रेषितस्तेन रामेण विदितात्मना।।5.36.10।।
36_10.translation: "O best of monkeys As you have been sent by Rama, the knower of the self, it is proper for me to converse with you.
36_10.word_by_word: कपिश्रेष्ठ O best among monkeys, विदितात्मना by a knower of self, तेन by him, रामेण by Rama, प्रेषितः sent, असि यदि you are, मया by me, समभिभाषितुम् to converse, अर्हसे you deserve.

36_11.shloka: प्रेषयिष्यति दुर्धर्षो रामो न ह्यपरीक्षितम्।पराक्रममविज्ञाय मत्सकाशं विशेषतः।।5.36.11।।
36_11.translation: "The formidable Rama will not send any one specially to me without testing him or knowing his valour.
36_11.word_by_word: दुर्धर्षः formidable, रामः Rama, पराक्रमम् valour, अविज्ञाय without knowing, अपरीक्षितम् without testing, न प्रेषयिष्यति हि would not send any body, विशेषतः specially, मत्सकाशम् to me.

36_12.shloka: दिष्ट्या च कुशली रामो धर्मात्मा सत्यसङ्गरः।लक्ष्मणश्च महातेजास्सुमित्रानन्दवर्धनः।।5.36.12।।
36_12.translation: "To my luck, righteous Rama who abides in truth and glorious Lakshmana who enhances the joy of Sumitra are keeping well.
36_12.word_by_word: दिष्ट्या luckily, धर्मात्मा righteous, सत्यसङ्गरः one who follows truth, रामः Rama, महातेजाः glorious, सुमित्रानन्दवर्धनः enhancer of Sumitra's joy, लक्ष्मणश्च Lakshmana also, कुशली well.

36_13.shloka: कुशली यदि काकुत्स्थः किं नु सागरमेखलाम्।महीं दहति कोपेन युगान्ताग्निरिवोत्थितः।।5.36.13।।
36_13.translation: "Indeed if Kakutstha is well wherefore does he not burn the oceangirdled earth in his rage as (the earth is burnt) at the time of dissolution of the era?
36_13.word_by_word: काकुत्स्थः Kakutsthas, कुशली यदि if he is keeping well, उत्थितः generated, युगान्ताग्निरिव at the time of dissolution of the era, सागरमेखलाम् oceangirdled, महीम् earth, कोपेन with his rage, किम् why, न दहति not burning?

36_14.shloka: अथवा शक्तिमन्तौ तौ सुराणामपि निग्रहे।ममैव तु न दुःखानामस्ति मन्ये विपर्ययः।।5.36.14।।
36_14.translation: "Both of them are capable of subduing even the gods. I think the reversal of  my fate is reason for their inaction.
36_14.word_by_word: अथवा or else, तौ both, सुराणामपि even gods, निग्रहे in subduing, शक्तिमन्तौ both are capable, तु but, मम my, दुःखानामेव for my sorrow, विपर्ययः disaster, नास्ति not there, मन्ये I think.

36_15.shloka: कच्चिन्न व्यथितो रामः कच्चिन्न परितप्यते।उत्तराणि च कार्याणि कुरुते पुरुषोत्तमः।।5.36.15।।
36_15.translation: "Is Rama the greatest among men not depressed? Does he not feel helpless? He is (perhaps) taking necessary steps (for my recovery).
36_15.word_by_word: रामः Rama, न व्यथितः कच्चित् whether not depressed, न परितप्यते कच्चित् indeed not suffering, पुरुषोत्तमः great among men, उत्तराणि necessary steps, कार्याणि action, कुरुते will be carrying out perhaps?

36_16.shloka: कच्चिन्न दीन स्सम्भ्रान्तः कार्येषु न च मुह्यति।कच्चित्पुरुषकार्याणि कुरुते नृपतेस्सुतः।।5.36.16।।
36_16.translation: "I suppose prince Rama is not too depressed or perplexed to attend to his work. He will (perhaps) be doing the duties expected of a manly person.
36_16.word_by_word: नृपतेः सुतः king's son, दीनः depressed, सम्भ्रान्तः perplexed, न कच्चित् not indeed, कार्येषु at work, न च मुह्यति is not spoiling, पुरुषकार्याणि the actions of men of achievement, कच्चित्कुरुते surely he is doing I trust

36_17.translation: "Tell me if Rama, scorcher of enemies, desirous of victory is following a two-fold policy (confrontation and conciliation) A tough enemy cannot be defeated by following this method. A three-fold strategy has to be adopted in this case (confrontation, conciliation and creation of dissension among his foes) to be victorious. I hope he is well-disposed to his friends and has a good team!
36_17.word_by_word: परन्तपः scorcher of enemies, द्विविधम् two kinds, उपायम् strategies, त्रिविधोपायमपि even three kinds of trategies, सेवते following, विजगीषुः he who desires to be victorious, मित्रेषु with friends, सुहृत् कच्चित् has a good team indeed

36_18.translation: "I hope he is making new friends, who desire his friendship. Hopefully, Rama is well honoured  by his allies.
36_18.word_by_word: मित्राणि allies, कच्चित् लभते hope he will be making, मित्रैः with allies, अपि अभिगम्यते will want his friendship, कल्याणमित्रश्च कच्चित् hope he has good allies, मित्रैश्च by his allies, अपि पुरस्कृतः honoured

36_19.shloka: कच्चिदाशास्ति देवानां प्रसादं पार्थिवात्मजः।कच्चित्पुरुषकारं च दैवं च प्रतिपद्यते।।5.36.19।।
36_19.translation: "Does the prince ever seek the blessings of gods or fall back upon personal effort as well as providence?
36_19.word_by_word: पार्थिवात्मजः prince, देवानाम् of gods, प्रसादम् blessings, आशास्ति कच्चित् is there any hope,पुरुषकारं च his personal efforts, दैवं च providence, प्रतिपद्यते he obeys

36_20.shloka: कच्चिन्न विगतस्नेहः प्रवासान्मयि राघवः।कच्चिन्मां व्यसनादस्मान्मोक्षयिष्यति वानर।।5.36.20।।
36_20.translation: "I hope Rama is not devoid of love towards me by  my separation. O Vanara, hope he will liberate me from this misery.
36_20.word_by_word: राघवः Rama, प्रवासात् due to separation, मयि in me विगतस्नेहः devoid of love, न कच्चित् suppose not, वानर vanara, माम् me, अस्मात् from this, व्यसनात् worry, मोक्षयिष्यति कच्चित् will liberate me from this

36_21.translation: "I hope Rama who deserves happiness and not suffering has not become depressed now , having experienced a spate of sorrows.
36_21.word_by_word: नित्यम् always, सुखानाम् delight, उचितः one who deserves, असुखानाम् of difficulties, अनौचितः he does not deserve, राघवः Rama, उत्तरम् later, दुःखम् sorrow, आसाद्य having experienced, न सीदति कच्चित्  hope he is not depressed

36_22.shloka: कौसल्यायास्तथा कच्चित्सुमित्रायास्तथैव च।अभीक्ष्णं श्रूयते कच्चित्कुशलं भरतस्य च।।5.36.22।।
36_22.translation: "I hope he regularly receives news about the welfare of Kausalya, Sumitra and Bharata.
36_22.word_by_word: कौसल्यायाः Kausalya's, तथा in the same manner, सुमित्रायाः Sumitra's, तथैव च in the same way, भरतस्य Bharata's, कुशलम् welfare, अभीक्ष्णम् constantly, श्रूयते कच्चित् hope he is hearing

36_23.shloka: मन्निमित्तेन मानार्हः कच्चिच्छोकेन राघवः।कच्चिन्नान्यमना रामः कच्चिन्मां तारयिष्यति।।5.36.23।।
36_23.translation: "I hope respectable Rama is not too absentminded for being immersed in sorrow on my account. Hope he will save me.
36_23.word_by_word: मानार्हः respectable, राघवः Rama, मन्निमित्तेन on my account, शोकेन because of sorrow, कच्चित् I hope, रामः Rama, नअन्यमनाः he is not absent minded, न कच्चित् may be, माम् me, कच्चित् तारयिष्यति will he save me?

36_24.shloka: कच्चिदक्षौहिणीं भीमां भरतो भ्रातृवत्सलः।ध्वजिनीं मन्त्रिभिर्गुप्तां प्रेषयिष्यति मत्कृते।।5.36.24।।
36_24.translation: "Will Bharata, the devoted brother, send his formidable army of one akshavhini protected by ministers for my cause? I trust he will. (Akshauhini  109350 foot soldiers  65610 horse soldiers  21860 elephants soldiers on chariot)
36_24.word_by_word: भ्रातृवत्सलः devoted to brother, भरतः Bharata, मत्कृते for my sake, मन्त्रिभिः with his ministers, गुप्ताम् protected, भीमाम् formidable, अक्षौहिणीम् ध्वजिनीम् akshauhini army, कच्चित् प्रेषयिष्यति  I trust he will send

36_25.translation: "I trust that the illustrious Sugriva surrounded  by valiant vanaras who use their teeth and nails as weapons will reach this place.
36_25.word_by_word: मत्कृते for my sake, श्रीमान् illustrious, वानराधिपतिः king of vanaras, सुग्रीवः Sugriva, दन्तनखायुधै: those who use their teeth and nails as weapons, वीरैः with valiant ones, हरिभिः with vanaras, वृतः surrounded, एष्वति कच्चित् trust he will reach.

36_26.translation: "Hope heroic Lakshmana, enhancer of the joy of Sumitra, who has mastered the use of weapons will blow away the demons through a network of arrows.
36_26.word_by_word: शूरः hero, सुमित्रानन्दवर्धनः who enhances Sumitra's delight, अस्त्रवित् a master of weapons, लक्ष्मणः Lakshmana, शरजालेन by network of arrows, राक्षसान् demons, कच्चित् विधमिष्यति trust he will blow away.

36_27.shloka: रौद्रेण कच्चिदस्त्रेण ज्वलता निहतं रणे।द्रक्ष्याम्यल्पेन कालेन रावणं ससुहृज्जनम्।।5.36.27।।
36_27.translation: "Can I hope to see Ravana and his relatives slain in the battle by fiery weapons in a short time?
36_27.word_by_word: ज्वलता burning, रौद्रेण with anger, अस्त्रेण by weapon, रणे in the battle, ससुहृज्जनम् along with his relatives, निहतम् slain, रावणम् Ravana, अल्पेन कालेन  in a short time, द्रक्ष्यामि कच्चित् hope to see.

36_28.shloka: कच्चिन्न तद्धेमसमानवर्णं तस्याननं पद्मसमानगन्धि।मया विना शुष्यति शोकदीनं जलक्षये पद्ममिवातपेन।।5.36.28।।
36_28.translation: "Hope, Rama's moonlike face without me with its golden complexion and lotus fragrance must not have been pale and withered with tears like the lotus in a pond scorched by the heat.
36_28.word_by_word: तस्य his, हेमसमानवर्णम् complexion like gold, पद्मसमानगन्धि fragrance  like  lotus, तत् that, आननम् face, मया विना without me, शोकदीनम् pale with grief, जलक्षये when water dries up, आतपेन due to heat, पद्ममिव like a lotus, न शुष्यति कच्चित् not scorched

36_29.shloka: धर्मापदेशात्त्यजतश्च राज्यं मां चाप्यरण्यं नयतः पदातिम्।नासीद्व्यथा यस्य न भीर्न शोकः कच्चित्स धैर्यं हृदये करोति।।5.36.29।।
36_29.translation: "Rama has given up sovereignty for the sake of establishing righteousness and led me into the forest on foot.He had not then felt any fear, anxiety or grief at heart.Rama showed patience, instead. Hope he retains them.
36_29.word_by_word: धर्मापदेशात् for the cause of establishing righteousness, राज्यम् sovereignty, त्यजतः given up, मां चापि including me, पदातिम् on foot, अरण्यम् to the forest, नयतः conducted, यस्य whose, व्यथा agony, नासीत् not shown, भीः fear, न not, शोकः grief, न not, सः he, हृदये at heart, धैर्यम् courage, करोति कच्चित् will sustain I hope.

36_30.shloka: न चास्य माता न पिता च नान्यः स्नेहाद्विशिष्टोऽस्ति मया समो वा।तावत्त्वहं दूत जिजीविषेयं यावत्प्रवृत्तिं शृणुयां प्रियस्य।।5.36.30।।
36_30.translation: "His love for me is superior to his love for his father, mother or any one else. O messenger, I wish to survive till I hear any  news from my dear lord."
36_30.word_by_word: अस्य his, स्नेहात् due to love, मया with me, समो वा equal or, विशिष्टः superior, माता mother, न not, पिता father, न not, अन्यः any one else, नास्ति not  there, दूत messenger, प्रियस्य beloved's, प्रवृत्तिम् news, यावत् until, शृणुयाम् I may hear, तावत्तु so long, अहम् I, जिजीविषेयम् I wish to survive.

36_31.shloka: इतीव देवी वचनं महार्थं तं वानरेन्द्रं मधुरार्थमुक्त्वा।श्रोतुं पुनस्तस्य वचोऽभिरामं रामार्थयुक्तं विरराम रामा।।5.36.31।।
36_31.translation: The godlike lady, having spoken to the vanara leader in a very meaningful and sweet manner about her beloved Rama, she remained silent, waiting to hear Hanuman'sattractive words of description of Rama once again.
36_31.word_by_word: देवी queen, तं वानरेन्द्रम् that vanara leader, महार्थम् very meaningful, मधुरार्थम् sweet, वचनम् word, उक्त्वा having spoken, तस्य his, अभिरामम्  loving Rama, रामार्थयुक्तम् said for Rama's cause, वचः word, पुनः again, श्रोतुम् to hear, विरराम stopped.

36_32.translation: Having heard Sita, Hanuman endowed with fearsome power placed his folded hands on his head and said this:
36_32.word_by_word: भीमविक्रमः fearsome power, मारुतिः Maruti, सीतायाः Sita's, वचनम् word, श्रुत्वा on hearing, शिरसि on his head, अञ्जलिम् both his hands, आधाय placing, उत्तरम् reply, वाक्यम् words, अब्रवीत् said.

36_33.shloka: न त्वामिहस्थां जानीते रामः कमललोचने।तेन त्वां नानयत्याशु शचीमिव पुरन्दरः।।5.36.33।।
36_33.translation: "O lotuseyed one Rama knows not that you are here. Therefore he has not taken you away immediately as did Indra to rescue his wife Sachi.
36_33.word_by_word: कमललोचने lotuseyed, त्वाम् you, इहस्थाम् being here, रामः Rama, न जानीते he does not know, तेन therefore, पुरन्दरः Indra, शचीमिव like Sachi, त्वाम् you, आशु immediately, नानयति he is not taking away.

36_34.shloka: श्रुत्वैव तु वचो मह्यं क्षिप्रमेष्यति राघवः।चमूं प्रकर्षन्महतीं हर्यृक्षगणसङ्कुलाम्।।5.36.34।।
36_34.translation: "As soon as he hears your words from me, Rama will reach (here), leading a huge army of powerful troops ofvanarasand bears.
36_34.word_by_word: मह्यं my, वचः word, श्रुत्वैव तु after hearing, राघवः Rama, हर्यृक्षगणसङ्कुलाम् troops of vanaras and bears, महतीम् huge, चमूम् army, प्रकर्षन् leading, क्षिप्रम् at once, एष्यति will approach.

36_35.shloka: विष्टम्भयित्वा बाणौघैरक्षोभ्यं वरुणालयम्।करिष्यति पुरीं लङ्कां काकुत्स्थः शान्तराक्षसाम्।।5.36.35।।
36_35.translation: "Kakutstha Rama will still the imperturbable abode of Varuna (ocean) by the torrent of his arrows and rid the city of Lanka of all the demons.
36_35.word_by_word: काकुत्स्थः Kakutstha, अक्षोभ्यम् imperturbable, वरुणालयम् abode of Varuna, बाणौघैः by torrent of arrows, विष्टम्भयित्वा make still, लङ्कां पुरीम् city of Lanka, शान्तराक्षसाम् all the demons, करिष्यति will make.

36_36.shloka: तत्र यद्यन्तरा मृत्युर्यदि देवास्सहासुराः।स्थास्यन्ति पथि रामस्य स तानपि वधिष्यति।।5.36.36।।
36_36.translation: "Thereafter, whoever comes Rama's way,  be it  gods or demons or even death or any one else he will destroy them.
36_36.word_by_word: तत्र there, रामस्य Rama's, पथि on his way, अन्तरा in between, मृत्युः death, सहासुराः including all demons, देवाः gods, स्थास्यन्ति यदि if they obstruct, सः he, तानपि even them, वधिष्यति will slay.

36_37.shloka: तवादर्शनजेनार्ये शोकेन स परिप्लुतः।न शर्म लभते रामस्सिंहार्दित इव द्विपः।।5.36.37।।
36_37.translation: "O noble lady not being able to see you, Rama is immersed in an ocean of sorrow, he has no solace like an elephant tormented by a lion.
36_37.word_by_word: आर्ये O noble lady, सः रामः that Rama, तव your, अदर्शनजेन on account of not seeing you, शोकेन in sorrow, परिप्लुतः immersed, सिंहार्दितः tormented by a lion, द्विपः इव like an elephant, शर्म न लभते is not happy.

36_38.shloka: मलयेन च विन्ध्येन मेरुणा मन्दरेण च।दर्दुरेण च ते देवि शपे मूलफलेन च।।5.36.38।।यथा सुनयनं वल्गु बिम्बोष्ठं चारु कुण्डलम् ।मुखं द्रक्ष्यसि रामस्य पूर्णचन्द्रमिवोदितम्।।5.36.39।।
36_38.translation: "O Sita I swear in the name of mountains like Malaya, Vindhya, Meru, and Dardura (the abodes of monkeys and bears) and  by the roots and fruits as well (which are the food of vanaras). you will soon behold Rama with beautiful eyes, red lips like bimba fruit, lovely earrings and a countenance resembling the full moon.
36_38.word_by_word: देवि O Sita, मलयेन च by Malaya mountain, विन्ध्येन by Vindhya, मेरुणा by Meru, दर्दुरेण by Dardura, मूलफलेन by roots and fruits, ते to you, शपे I swear, यथा as, सुनयनम्  with beautiful eyes, वल्गु बिम्बोष्ठम् lips like bimba fruit, चारु कुण्डलम् with lovely earrings, उदितम् risen, पूर्णचन्द्रमिव like the fullmoon, रामस्य Rama's, मुखम् face, द्रक्ष्यसि you will see.

36_39.shloka: क्षिप्रं द्रक्ष्यसि वैदेहि रामं प्रस्रवणे गिरौ।शतक्रतुमिवासीनं नागराजस्य मूर्धनि।।5.36.40।।
36_39.translation: "O Vaidehi, you will soon see Rama seated on the Prasravana mountain just as Indra (who performed a hundred sacrifices) seated on the back of the king of elephants.
36_39.word_by_word: वैदेहि Vaidehi, प्रस्रवणे गिरौ on mount Prasravana, रामम् Rama, नागराजस्य elephant's, मूर्धनि on the back, आसीनम् seated, शतक्रतुम् इव like Indra who has performed a hundred sacrifices, क्षिप्रम् soon, द्रक्ष्यसि you will see.

36_40.shloka: न मांसं राघवो भुङक्ते न चाऽपि मधु सेवते।वन्यं सुविहितं नित्यं भक्तमश्नाति पञ्चमम्।।5.36.41।।
36_40.translation: "Rama is not eating meat, nor drinking wine. He takes only the one fifth of a meal(sanctioned for an ascetic) available in the forest.
36_40.word_by_word: राघवः Rama, मांसम् meat, न भुङक्ते not eating, मधुचापि even wine, न सेवते he is not taking, नित्यम् always, पञ्चमम् fifth meal, सुविहितम् prescribed for, वन्यम् available in the forest, भुक्तम् food, अश्नाति eats.

36_41.translation: "Since you left, Rama has been always thinking sincerely of you, no longer drives away flies or mosquitoes nor insects or serpents from his body (his mind entirely fixed on you).
36_41.word_by_word: राघवः Rama, त्वद्गतेन thinking of you, अन्तरात्मना with heart, गात्रात् from his limbs, दंशान् flies, नैव अपनयेत् will not drive away, मशकान् mosquitoes, न not, कीटान् insects, न not, सरीसृपान् serpents, न not.

36_42.shloka: नित्यं ध्यानपरो रामो नित्यं शोकपरायणः।नान्यच्चिन्तयते किञ्चित्स तु कामवशं गतः।।5.36.43।।
36_42.translation: "Rama is always lost in thought. He is totally given to grief. Absorbed in love for you, he thinks of none else৷৷
36_42.word_by_word: रामः Rama, नित्यम् ever, ध्यानपरः reflecting on you, नित्यम् ever, शोकपरायणः totally given to grief, सः he, कामवशं गतः absorbed in love for you, अन्यत् no other thoughts, न चिन्तयते he is not thinking.

36_43.shloka: अनिद्रस्सततं रामस्सुप्तोऽपि च नरोत्तमः।सीतेति मधुरां वाणीं व्याहरन्प्रतिबुध्यते।।5.36.44।।
36_43.translation: "Rama, the best of men never goes to sleep and even if he drops off to sleep he mutters 'Sita, Sita' in a sweet voice in his sleep.
36_43.word_by_word: रामः Rama, सततम् always, अनिद्रः he does not sleep, नरोत्तमः best of men, सुप्तोऽपि even if he sleeps, सीतेति calling out 'Sita', मधुराम् sweet, वाणीम् voice, व्याहरन् uttering, प्रतिबुध्यते he wakes up.

36_44.shloka: दृष्ट्वा फलं वा पुष्पं वा यद्वाऽन्यत्सुमनोहरम्।बहुशो हा प्रियेत्येवं श्वसंस्त्वामभिभाषते।।5.36.45।।
36_44.translation: "Sighing deeply whenever Rama sees a fruit or a flower or any such delightful thing, he remembers you and calls you out again and again, saying, 'alas, my darling '
36_44.word_by_word: फलं वा fruit or, पुष्पं वा or flowers, यद्वा such similar, सुमनोहरम् delightful, अन्यत् any other thing, दृष्ट्वा seeing, श्वसन् while, हा प्रियेत्येवम् alas, darling, त्वाम् you, बहुशः in many, अभिभाषते speaks.

36_45.shloka: स देवि नित्यं परितप्यमान स्त्वामेव सीतेत्यभिभाषमाणः।धृतव्रतो राजसुतो महात्मा तवैव लाभाय कृतप्रयत्नः।।5.36.46।।
36_45.translation: "O divine lady prince Rama is ceaselessly suffering. He keeps talking to you in air. The determined Rama is only thinking of your recovery ".
36_45.word_by_word: देवि godlike lady, महात्मा great self, सः Rama, राजसुतः son of a king, नित्यम् always, परितप्यमानः suffering, सीतेति saying Sita, त्वामेव you only, अभिभाषमाणः keeps talking in the air, धृतव्रतः firm in his decision, तव your, लाभाय to secure you only, कृतप्रयत्नः makes efforts.

36_46.shloka: सा रामसङ्कीर्तनवीतशोका रामस्य शोकेन समानशोका।शरन्मुखे साम्बुदशेषचन्द्रा निशेव वैदेहसुता बभूव।।5.36.47।।
36_46.translation: Her sorrow was mitigated by references made by Hanuman about Rama.She felt equally sad when she heard about Rama's agony. The princess from Videha appeared like a night at the advent of autumn, with the Moon looking partly muffled by clouds and partly bright.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये सुन्दरकाण्डे षट्त्रिंशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the thirtysixth sarga of Sundarakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
36_46.word_by_word: रामस्य Rama's, शोकेन because of  his sorrow, समानशोका equally sad, रामसङ्कीर्तनवीतशोका devoid of sorrow on hearing about Rama, सा she, वैदेहसुता the daughter of Videha, शरन्मुखे at the advent of autumn, साम्बुदशेषचन्द्रा Moon muffled by clouds, निशेव like the night, बभूव appeared.

37_1.shloka: [Hanuman offers to carry Sita back to RamaSita politely Sita declines -- appeals to Hanuman to get Rama to take her.]सीता तद्वचनं श्रुत्वा पूर्णचन्द्रनिभानना।हनूमन्तमुवाचेदं धर्मार्थसहितं वचः।।5.37.1।।
37_1.translation: To the righteous words (about Rama's grief) of Hanuman, Sita with a face like the full moon replied.
37_1.word_by_word: पूर्णचन्द्रनिभानना face like the full moon, सीता Sita, तद्वचनम् that word, श्रुत्वा having heard, हनूमन्तम् Hanuman, इदम् this, धर्मार्थसहितम् full of righteousness, वचः word, उवाच spoke.

37_2.shloka: अमृतं विषसंसृष्टं त्वया वानर भाषितम्।यच्च नान्यमना रामो यच्च शोकपरायणः ।।5.37.2।।
37_2.translation: "O vanara you have told me that Rama has his mind always fixed on me, not on others and you have also said that he is sad. It is like offering me poison mixed with nectar.
37_2.word_by_word: वानर O vanara, रामः Rama, अन्यमनाः न not thinking of others,  इति यत् that way, इति च यत् and this way also (that he is sad), त्वया by you, भाषितम् spoken, विषसंसृष्टम् mixed with poison, अमृतम् nectar.

37_3.shloka: ऐश्वर्ये वा सुविस्तीर्णे व्यसने वा सुदारुणे।रज्ज्वेव पुरुषं बद्ध्वा कृतान्तः परिकर्षति।।5.37.3।।
37_3.translation: "Death snatches a man tied with a cord, whether he is rolling in luxury or sinking in adversity.
37_3.word_by_word: कृतान्तः death, पुरुषम् a man, रज्ज्वा with a cord, बद्ध्वा इव like tying, सुविस्त्रीर्णे in the great, ऐश्वर्ये वा in fortune, सुदारुणे deeply sunk, व्यसने वा  in adversity, परिकर्षति will snatch.

37_4.shloka: विधिर्नूनमसंहार्यः प्राणिनां प्लवगोत्तम।सौमित्रिं मां च रामं च व्यसनै: पश्य मोहितान्।।5.37.4।।
37_4.translation: "O best of vanaras surely it is not possible for living beings to overcome destiny. You see how Sri Rama, Saumitri, and my own self are all   afflicted with grief.
37_4.word_by_word: प्लवगोत्तम O best of vanaras, प्राणिनाम् for living beings, नूनम् surely, विधिः destiny, असंहार्यः it cannot be overcome, व्यसनैः with sorrows, मोहितान् afflicted, सौमित्रिम् Saumitri, मां च me too, रामं च Rama also, पश्य you see.

37_5.shloka: शोकस्यास्य कदा पारं राघवोऽधिगमिष्यति।प्लवमानः परिश्रान्तो हतनौ स्सागरे यथा।।5.37.5।।
37_5.translation: "When will Raghava reach the shore of this ocean of grief? He is like a man who has suffered a ship wreck, trying to swim?
37_5.word_by_word: सागरे in the ocean, हतनौः in shipwreck, प्लवमानः while getting drowned, परिश्रान्तः यथा  who has suffered, राघवः Rama, अस्य of this, शोकस्य from grief, पारम् the shore, कदा when, अधिगमिष्यति will he reach.

37_6.shloka: राक्षसानां वधं कृत्वा सूदयित्वा च रावणम्।लङ्कामुन्मूलितां कृत्वा कदा द्रक्ष्यति मां पतिः।।5.37.6।।
37_6.translation: "When will my husband see me after killing the demons including Ravana and uprooting Lanka?
37_6.word_by_word: पतिः husband, राक्षसानाम् of all the demons, वधम् killing, कृत्वा after doing, रावणं च and Ravana, सूदयित्वा after killing, लङ्काम् Lanka, उन्मूलिताम् uprooting, कृत्वा after doing, माम् कदा when me, द्रक्ष्यति he will see.

37_7.shloka: स वाच्यस्संत्वरस्वेति यावदेव न पूर्यते।अयं संवत्सरः कालस्तावद्धि मम जीवितम्।।5.37.7।।
37_7.translation: "One year's time has been given (by Ravana) to me.  Rama should be informed to be quick in reaching before the completion of the time limit and that I will survive till then only.
37_7.word_by_word: अयम् this, संवत्सरः कालः one year's time, यावदेव until then, न पूर्यते before it is completed, संत्वरस्वेति you may be quick, सः he, वाच्यः he should be informed, मम I, जीवितम् life, तावद्धि till then only.

37_8.shloka: वर्तते दशमो मासो द्वौ तु शेषौ प्लवङ्गम।रावणेन नृशंसेन समयो यः कृतो मम।।5.37.8।।
37_8.translation: "O vanara this is the end of the tenth month. Only two more months are left. This is the condition laid by the wicked Ravana in my case.
37_8.word_by_word: प्लवङ्गम O vanara, नृशंसेन रावणेन by the wicked Ravana, मम to me, यः such, समयः time, कृतः given, दशमः tenth, मासः month, वर्तते is running, द्वौ तु two only, शेषौ remain.

37_9.shloka: विभीषणेन च भ्रात्रा मम निर्यातनं प्रति।अनुनीतः प्रयत्नेन न च तत्कुरुते मतिम्।।5.37.9।।
37_9.translation: "Vibhisana made efforts to advise Ravana for my restoration. But Ravana has not agreed to that.
37_9.word_by_word: भ्रात्रा by the brother, विभीषणेन by Vibhisana, मम my, निर्यातनं प्रति for my restoration, प्रयत्नेन made efforts, अनुनीतः he was advised gently, तत् such, मतिम् thought, न कुरुते he has not agreed.

37_10.shloka: मम प्रतिप्रदानं हि रावणस्य न रोचते।रावणं मार्गते संख्ये मृत्युः कालवशं गतम्।।5.37.10।।
37_10.translation: "Ravana did not like to return me having fallen into the death trap. Death lies in wait for him in battle.
37_10.word_by_word: मम my, प्रतिप्रदानम् returning, रावणस्य to Ravana, न रोचते is not liked, कालवशं गतम् fallen into the trap of time, रावणम् Ravana, संख्ये in a battle, मृत्युः death, मार्गते  is searching.

37_11.shloka: ज्येष्ठा कन्या नला नाम विभीषणसुता कपे।तया ममेदमाख्यातं मात्रा प्रहितया स्वयम्।।5.37.11।।
37_11.translation: "O vanara Nala the eldest daughter of Vibhisana sent by her mother came here personally and reported this to me.
37_11.word_by_word: कपे O vanara, नला Nala, ज्येष्ठा eldest daughter, विभीषणसुता daughter of Vibhisana, मात्रा प्रहितया sent by her mother, तया by her, स्वयम् personally, इदम् here, मम to me, आख्यातम् reported.

37_12.shloka: असंशयं हरिश्रेष्ठ क्षिप्रं मां प्राप्स्यते पतिः।अन्तरात्मा च मे शुद्धस्तस्मिंश्च बहवो गुणाः।।5.37.12।।
37_12.translation: "O eminent vanara no doubt my lord will soon reach this place. My pure conscience tells me that Rama has many virtues.
37_12.word_by_word: हरिश्रेष्ठ O eminent vanara, पतिः my lord, क्षिप्रम् soon, माम् me, असंशयम् no doubt, प्राप्स्यति he will reach, मे my, अन्तरात्मा च inner self also, शुद्धः pure, तस्मिंश्च in that, बहवः many, गुणाः are virtues.

37_13.shloka: उत्साहः पौरुषं सत्त्वमानृशंस्यं कृतज्ञता।विक्रमश्च प्रभावश्च सन्ति वानर राघवे।।5.37.13।।
37_13.translation: "O vanara Rama is endowed with perseverance, manliness, prowess, kindness, gratitude, competence and power.
37_13.word_by_word: वानरvanara, राघवे in Rama, उत्साहः perseverance, पौरुषम् manliness, सत्त्वम् prowess, अनृशंस्यम् kindness, कृतज्ञता gratitude, विक्रमश्च competence, प्रभावश्च power, सन्ति endowed.

37_14.shloka: चतुर्दशसहस्राणि राक्षसानां जघान यः।जनस्थाने विना भ्रात्रा शत्रुः कस्तस्य नोद्विजेत् ।।5.37.14।।
37_14.translation: "At Janasthana without the help of his brother also he slew fourteen thousand demons. Which enemy will not tremble before him?
37_14.word_by_word: यः whoever, जनस्थाने in Janasthana, विना भ्रात्रा without his brother also, राक्षसानाम् demons, चतुर्दशसहस्राणि fourteen thousand, जघान slew, तस्य his, कः who, शत्रुः enemy, नोद्विजेत् will not tremble.

37_15.shloka: न स शक्यस्तुलयितुं व्यसनैः पुरुषर्षभः।अहं तस्य प्रभावज्ञा शक्रस्येव पुलोमजा ।।5.37.15।।
37_15.translation: "O bull among men he will not be shaken by calamities. Just as Sachi, the daughter of Puloma knows Indra's might I know Rama's.
37_15.word_by_word: पुरुषर्षभः bull among men, सः he, व्यसनैः in calamities, तुलयितुम् shaken, न शक्यः not possible, पुलोमजा daughter of Puloma, शक्रस्येव just as Indra, अहम् I, तस्य his, प्रभावज्ञा know his might.

37_16.translation: "O monkey the valiant Rama is like the Sungod shoofing a dazzling volley of arrows which will dry up the sea of enemy forces."
37_16.word_by_word: कपे O monkey, शूरः valiant, रामदिवाकर: Rama the Sun, शरजालांशुमान् with his volley ofdazzling arrows, शत्रुरक्षोमयम् enemy forces of the demons, तोयम् water, उपशोषम् will dry up, नयिष्यति will effect.

37_17.shloka: इति सञ्जल्पमानां तां रामार्थे शोककर्शिताम्।आश्रुसम्पूर्णनयनामुवाच वचनं कपिः।।5.37.17।।
37_17.translation: While Sita, tormented with grief on account of Rama was thus speaking, her eyes filled with tears, the monkey said:
37_17.word_by_word: इति thus, सञ्जल्पमानाम् while she was speaking freely, रामार्थे on account of Rama, शोककर्शिताम् emaciated with sorrow, अश्रु सम्पूर्णनयनाम् her eyes filled with tears, ताम् her, कपिः vanara, वचनम् word, उवाच spoke.

37_18.shloka: श्रुत्वैव तु वचो मह्यं क्षिप्रमेष्यति राघवः।चमूं प्रकर्षन्महतीं हर्यृक्षगणसङ्कुलाम्।।5.37.18।।
37_18.translation: "On hearing me Rama will reach soon with a huge army of vanaras and bears.
37_18.word_by_word: राघवः Rama, श्रुत्वैव तु after hearing this, वचः word, मह्यं by me, क्षिप्रम् soon, ऐष्यति he will reach, चमूं an army, प्रकर्षन् while leading, महतीं huge, हर्यृक्षगणसङ्कुलाम् with an army of vanaras and bears.

37_19.shloka: अथवा मोचयिष्यामि त्वामद्यैव वरानने।अस्माद्धुःखादुपारोह मम पृष्ठमनिन्दिते।।5.37.19।।
37_19.translation: "O beautiful lady, if you please, I shall redeem you today itself from grief. You may ride on my back, O blameless lady.
37_19.word_by_word: अथवा or, वरानने O lady with a beautiful face, त्वाम् you, अद्यैव now itself, अस्मात् from this, दुःखात् from grief, मोचयिष्यामि I shall redeem you, अनिन्दिते O blameles one, मम my, पृष्ठम् back, उपारोह you may  ascend.

37_20.shloka: त्वां हि पृष्ठगतां कृत्वा सन्तरिष्यामि सागरम्।शक्तिरस्ति हि मे वोढुं लङ्कामपि सरावणाम् ।।5.37.20।।
37_20.translation: "Placing you on my back I shall cross the ocean. Indeed, I have the capacity to carry the entire city of Lanka along with Ravana.
37_20.word_by_word: त्वाम् you, पृष्ठगताम् placing you on my back, कृत्वा on doing so, सागरम् ocean, सन्तरिष्यामि I can cross over, सरावणाम् along with Ravana, लङ्कामपि even Lanka, वोढुम् to carry, मे to me, शक्ति capacity, अस्ति हि indeed I have.

37_21.shloka: अहं प्रस्रवणस्थाय राघवायाद्य मैथिलि।प्रापयिष्यामि शक्राय हव्यं हुतमिवानलः।।5.37.21।।
37_21.translation: "O Mythili Just as oblations offered to the sacred fire goes to Indra, I shall offer you today to Rama waiting on the Prasravana mountain.
37_21.word_by_word: मैथिलि O Mythili, अनलः sacred fire, हुतम्  put into fire, हव्यम् oblations, शक्राय by Indra, अहम् I, प्रस्रवणस्थाय to a person staying on Prasravan mountain, राघवाय to Rama, अद्यैव प्रापयिष्यामि I will take you today itself.

37_22.shloka: द्रक्ष्यस्यद्वैव वैदेहि राघवं सहलक्ष्मणम्।व्यवसायसमायुक्तं विष्णुं दैत्यवधे यथा।।5.37.22।।
37_22.translation: "O Vaidehi you will see Rama and Lakshmana making all out efforts like Lord Visnu to kill the demons.
37_22.word_by_word: वैदेहि Vaidehi, दैत्यवधे in the killing of demons, व्यवसायसमायुक्तम् making all out efforts, विष्णुं यथा like Visnu, सहलक्ष्मणम् together with Lakshmana, राघवम् Rama, अद्यैव right now, द्रक्ष्यसि you will see.

37_23.translation: Mighty Rama staying in asram ill be enthused to see you seated on my back like Lord Purandara (Indra) seated on the back of the lord of elephants (Airavata)
37_23.word_by_word: त्वद्दर्शनकृतोत्साहम् enthused in seeing you, आश्रमस्थम् staying in his asram, महाबलम् mighty, नागराजस्य of the king of elephants Airavatam, मूर्धनि on the back, आसीनम् seated, पुरन्दरमिव like the destroyer of citadels (Indra).

37_24.shloka: पृष्ठमारोह मे देवि मा विकाङ्क्षस्व शोभने।योगमन्विच्छ रामेण शशाङ्केनेव रोहिणी।।5.37.24।।
37_24.translation: "O god like lady climb up my back. Do not be reluctant. Join Rama just as Rohini unites with the Moon, O beautiful one
37_24.word_by_word: देवि O god like lady, मम my, पृष्ठम् back, आरोह climb up, शोभने O beautiful one, मा विकाङ्क्षस्व do not be reluctant, रोहिणी Rohini, शशाङ्केनेव like joining with the Moon, रामेण with Rama, योगम् union, अन्विच्छ you may become.

37_25.shloka: कथयन्तीव चन्द्रेण सूर्येण च महार्चिषा।मत्पृष्ठमधिरुह्य त्वं तराकाशमहार्णवौ।।5.37.25।।
37_25.translation: "Climb on my back and cross the ocean through space in the flaming light, conversing with Moon and Sun.
37_25.word_by_word: त्वम् you, मत्पृष्ठम् my back, अधिरुह्य after climbing up, चन्द्रेण with the Moon, महार्चिषा  flaming light, सूर्येण with the Sun, कथयन्तीव conversing, आकाशमहार्णवौ sky and ocean, तर cross.

37_26.shloka: न हि मे सम्प्रयातस्य त्वामितो नयतोऽङ्गने।अनुगन्तुं गतिं शक्तास्सर्वे लङ्कानिवासिनः।।5.37.26।।
37_26.translation: "O beautiful lady it is not possible for all the inhabitants of Lanka together to follow me while I carry you from this place.
37_26.word_by_word: अङ्गने O beautiful lady, त्वाम् you, इतः from the place, नयतः while carrying, सम्प्रयातस्य joined together, मे my, गतिम् speed, अनुगन्तुम् to follow me, सर्वे all, लङ्कानिवासिनः the inhabitants of Lanka, न शक्ताः not possible for any one.

37_27.shloka: यथैवाहमिह प्राप्तस्तथैवाहमसंशयः।यास्यामि पश्य वैदेहि त्वामुद्यम्य विहायसम्।।5.37.27।।
37_27.translation: "O Vaidehi just as I reached here I shall beyond doubt take you on my back in the same way across the sky without any difficulty. See.
37_27.word_by_word: वैदेहि Vaidehi, यथैवाहमिह just as I reached here, प्राप्तस्तथैव in the same way I reached, अहम I, त्वामुद्यम्य taking you on my back, यास्यामि will go, विहायसम् across the sky, नसंशयः no doubt, पश्य you may see.

37_28.translation: When Mythili heard the wonderful proposal from Hanuman, the best of vanaras, she experienced immense joy in every limb of her body and said:
37_28.word_by_word: मैथिली तु Mythili also, हरिश्रेष्ठात् from the best of vanaras, अद्भुतम् wonderful, वचनम् word, श्रुत्वा on hearing, हर्षविस्मितसर्वाङ्गी experienced immense joy in every limb of her body, अथ then, हनुमन्तम् Hanuman, अब्रवीत् said.

37_29.shloka: हनुमन्दूरमध्वानं कथं मां वोढुमिच्छसि।तदेव खलु ते मन्ये कपित्वं हरियूथप।।5.37.29।।
37_29.translation: "Hanuman how do you intend to carry me to such a distant place? Indeed, it is your monkey nature, I suppose.
37_29.word_by_word: हनुमन् Hanuman, दूरम् distant, अध्वानम् path, माम् me, वोढुम् carry, कथम् how, इच्छसि you intend, हरियूथप O leader of vanaras, ते you, कपित्वम् monkey nature, तदेव खलु indeed that is, मन्ये I think.

37_30.shloka: कथं वाल्पशरीरस्त्वं मामितो नेतुमिच्छसि।सकाशं मानवेन्द्रस्य भर्तुर्मे प्लवगर्षभ।।5.37.30।।
37_30.translation: "O bull among monkeys you have  such a small body. How can you intend to carry me from here to my husband, the lord of men"?
37_30.word_by_word: प्लवगर्षभ O bull among monkeys, अल्पशरीरः small body, त्वम् you, इतः from here, मे my, भर्तुः to my husband, मानवेन्द्रस्य lord of men, सकाशम् presence of, नेतुम् to carry, कथं वा how is it, इच्छसि you intend.

37_31.shloka: सीताया वचनं श्रुत्वा हनुमान्मारुतात्मजः।चिन्तयामास लक्ष्मीवान्नवं परिभवं कृतम्।।5.37.31।।
37_31.translation: On hearing Sita's new belittling statement about him, Hanuman, the illustrious son of the Windgod reflected:
37_31.word_by_word: मारुतात्मजः son of the Windgod, लक्ष्मीवान् illustrious one, हनुमान् Hanuman, सीतायाः Sita's, वचनम् word, श्रुत्वा on hearing, नवम् new, परिभवम् कृतम् insult hurled, चिन्तयामास he thought.

37_32.shloka: न मे जानाति सत्त्वं वा प्रभावं वाऽसितेक्षणा।तस्मात्पश्यतु वैदेही यद्रूपं मम कामतः।।5.37.32।।
37_32.translation: 'Blackeyed Sita is not aware of my strength or my power. Therefore let her see the real (huge) form that I can assume at my free will'.
37_32.word_by_word: असितेक्षणा blackeyed, वैदेही Vaidehi, मे my, सत्त्वं वा strength, प्रभावं वा my power, न जानाति she is not aware, तस्मात् therefore, कामतः freely, मम my, यत् that real, रूपम् form, पश्यतु see.

37_33.translation: Thinking thus, Hanuman, the noble monkey, crusher of enemies, started revealing his real form to Vaidehi.
37_33.word_by_word: प्लवगसत्तमः the noble monkey, अरिमर्दनः crusher of enemies,हनुमान् Hanuman, इति in that way, सञ्चिन्त्य thinking that way, तदा then, स्वरूपम् his real form, वैदेह्याः to Vaidehi, दर्शयामास he revealed.

37_34.translation: The wise bull among monkeys, jumped down from the tree and started growing in size in order to instil confidence in Sita.
37_34.word_by_word: धीमान् wise, प्लवगर्षभः bull among monkeys, सः he, तस्मात् पादपात् from the tree, अप्लुत्य jumping down, ततः from there, सीताप्रत्ययकारणात् in order to instil confidence in Sita, वर्धितुम् to grow in size, आरेभे started.

37_35.shloka: मेरुमन्दरसङ्काशो बभौ दीप्तानलप्रभः।अग्रतो व्यवतस्थे च सीताया वानरोत्तमः।।5.37.35।।
37_35.translation: Hanuman, the foremost of the vanaras resembling mount Meru or Mandara stood there glowing like blazing fire in front of Sita.
37_35.word_by_word: वानरोत्तमः foremost among vanaras, मेरुमन्दरसङ्काशः like mount Meru or Mandara, दीप्तानलप्रभः glowing like blazing fire, बभौ appeared, सीतायाः Sita's, अग्रतः in front, व्यवतस्थेच and stood there.

37_36.translation: Resembling a mountain in size, with a red face, with teeth and nails strong like  diamond, the vanara in dreadful form said to Vaidehi:
37_36.word_by_word: पर्वतसङ्काशः resembling a mountain, ताम्रवक्त्रः one who has a red face, महाबलः very strong, वज्रदंष्ट्रनखः teeth and nails as strong as diamonds, भीम: dreadful, हरिः vanara, वैदेहीम् to Vaidehi, इदम् this, अब्रवीत् said.

37_37.shloka: सपर्वतवनोद्देशां साट्टप्राकारतोरणाम्।लङ्कामिमां सनाथां वा नयितुं शक्तिरस्ति मे।।5.37.37।।
37_37.translation: "I have the capacity to carry away this entire Lanka uprooted with its mountains, gardens, forts, ramparts and gateways along with the king.
37_37.word_by_word: सपर्वतवनोद्देशाम् filled with mountains and gardens, साट्टप्राकारतोरणाम् forts,  ramparts and gateways, सनाथाम् along with its king, इमाम् this, लङ्कां वा Lanka itself, नयितुम्  carried away, मे my, शक्ति: capacity, अस्ति is there.

37_38.shloka: तदवस्थाप्यतां बुद्धिरलं देवि विकाङ्क्षया।विशोकं कुरु वैदेहि राघवं सहलक्ष्मणम्।।5.37.38।।
37_38.translation: "O queen it is enough. Give up this unworthy attitude. Be stable. O Vaidehi, rid Lakshmana and Rama of grief".
37_38.word_by_word: देवि queen, तत् so, विकाङ्क्ष्या with unworthy attitude, अलम् enough, बुद्धि: intellect, अवस्थाप्यताम् be stable, वैदेहि Vaidehi, सहलक्ष्मणम् with Lakshmana, राघवम् Rama, विशोकम् rid of sorrow, कुरु do.

37_39.shloka: तं दृष्ट्वा भीमसङ्काशमुवाच जनकात्मजा।पद्मपत्रविशालाक्षी मारुतस्यौरसं सुतम्।।5.37.39।।
37_39.translation: Seeing the son of Maruta in dreadful form, the broad lotus petaleyed daughter of Janaka with eyes as large as lotus petals replied :
37_39.word_by_word: पद्मपत्रविशालाक्षी with eyes large like lotus petals, जनकात्मा daughter of Janaka, भीमसङ्काशम् dreadful to viewers, मारुतस्य Maruta's, औरसं सुतम् own son, तम् him, दृष्ट्वा on seeing, उवाच said.

37_40.shloka: तव सत्त्वं बलं चैव विजानामि महाकपे।वायोरिव गतिं चैव तेजश्चाग्नेरिवाद्भुतम्।।5.37.40।।
37_40.translation: "O great monkey I have understood your strength and power. Your speed is like the Windgod's and your power is astonishing and splendid.
37_40.word_by_word: महाकपे O great monkey, तव your, सत्त्वम् strength, बलं चैव and power, वायोरिव like the Windgod's, गतिम् speed, आग्नेरिव like fire's, अद्भुतम् astonishing, तेजश्च splendour, विजानामि I have understood

37_41.shloka: प्राकृतोऽन्यः कथं चेमां भूमिमागन्तुमर्हति।उदधेरप्रमेयस्य पारं वानरपुङ्गव।।5.37.41।।
37_41.translation: "O chief of vanaras how could an ordinary person be capable of reaching this land on far off shore of the immeasurable ocean?
37_41.word_by_word: वानरपुङ्गव O chief of vanaras, प्राकृतः an ordinary one, अन्यः other, अप्रमेयस्य of an immeasurable one, उदधेः ocean's, पारम् far off shore, इमाम् this, भूमिम् this land, आगन्तुम् reach, कथम् how, अर्हति fit.

37_42.shloka: जानामि गमने शक्तिं नयने चापि ते मम।अवश्यं सम्प्रधार्याशु कार्यसिद्धिर्महात्मनः।।5.37.42।।
37_42.translation: "I know you are capable of carrying me on your journey. I am sure about the quick success of your mission which has been carried out after careful planning.
37_42.word_by_word: गमने in making the journey, मम me, नयने in  taking, शक्तिम् power, जानामि I know, महात्मनः of the great soul, कार्यसिददि success of the mission, अवश्यम् surely, आशु immediately, सम्प्रधार्या after planning properly

37_43.shloka: अयुक्तं तु कपिश्रेष्ठ मम गन्तुं त्वयाऽनघ।वायुवेगसवेगस्य वेगो मां मोहयेत्तव।।5.37.43।।
37_43.translation: "O sinless and foremost monkey going with you is not proper for me. Your windlike speed will render me unconscious.
37_43.word_by_word: अनघ sinless one, कपिश्रेष्ठ foremost monkey, त्वया by you, मम my, गन्तुम् to go with, अयुक्तम् not proper, वायुवेगसवेगस्य of a person with the speed of the wind, तव your, वेगः speed, माम् me, मोहयेत् will render me unconscious.

37_44.shloka: अहमाकाशमापन्ना ह्युपर्युपरि सागरम्।प्रपतेयं हि ते पृष्ठाद्भयाद्वेगेव गच्छतः।।5.37.44।।
37_44.translation: "When you fly over the ocean in the sky  speedily I may tumble down from your back by your speed out of fear.
37_44.word_by_word: सागरम् उपर्युपरि above the ocean, आकाशम् sky, अहम् I, वेगेन speedily, गच्छतः when you go, ते your, पृष्ठात् from the back, भयात् out of fear, आपन्ना when I reach, प्रपतेयम् I may tumble down.

37_45.shloka: पतिता सागरे चाहं तिमिनक्रझषाकुले।भवेयमाशु विवशा यादसामन्नमुत्तमम्।।5.37.45।।
37_45.word_by_word: तिमिनक्रझषाकुले filled with whales, crocodiles and fish, सागरे in the ocean, पतिता fallen in, अहम् I, विवशा helpless, आशु immediately, यादसाम् of aquatic animals, उत्तमम् very good, अन्नम् food, भवेयम् I will be.

37_46.shloka: न च शक्ष्ये त्वया सार्धं गन्तुं शत्रुविनाशन।कलत्रवति सन्देहस्त्वय्यपि स्यादसंशयः।।5.37.46।।
37_46.translation: "O destroyer of foes, it is not possible for me to go with you. Further, when you are burdened with a woman you will also fall into danger (because of me), no doubt.
37_46.word_by_word: शत्रुविनाशन O destroyer of foes, त्वया सार्थम् along with you, गन्तुम् to go, न शक्ष्ये च I have no power, कलत्रवति when burdened with a woman, त्वय्यपि with you also, संदेहः doubt, स्यात् may be, असंशयः there is no doubt.

37_47.shloka: ह्रियमाणां तु मां दृष्ट्वा राक्षसा भीमविक्रमाः।अनुगच्छेयुरादिष्टा रावणेन दुरात्मना।।5.37.47।।
37_47.translation: "When I am seen (while being carried away) by the demons of fearsome valour they will pursue you, ordered by the wicked Ravana.
37_47.word_by_word: ह्रियमाणाम् while I am, माम् me, दृष्ट्वा after seeing, भीमविक्रमाः of fearsome valour, राक्षसाः demons, दुरात्मना by evilminded, रावणेन by Ravana, आदिष्टाः ordered, अनुगच्छेयुः they will pursue

37_48.shloka: तैस्त्वं परिवृतश्शूरैश्शूलमुद्गरपाणिभिः।भवेस्त्वं संशयं प्राप्तो मया वीर कलत्रवान्।।5.37.48।।
37_48.translation: "O heroic monkey as the warriors armed with spears and maces surround you and attack, your life will be in danger, because of me.
37_48.word_by_word: त्वम् you, शूलमुद्गरपाणिभिः by those wielding spears and mace, तैः by them, शूरैः by warriors, परिवृतः surrounded, वीर O hero, मया by me, कलत्रवान् one who has a wife, त्वम् you, संशयम् doubt, प्राप्तः have been, भवेः  you.

37_49.shloka: सायुधा बहवो व्योम्नि राक्षसास्त्वं निरायुधः।कथं शक्ष्यसि संयातुं मां चैव परिरक्षितुम्।।5.37.49।।
37_49.translation: "The demons are in large number and they will be armed with weapons. You are unarmed. How can you fight and protect me?
37_49.word_by_word: व्योम्नि in the sky, सायुधाः will be armed with weapons, राक्षसाः demons, बहवः many, त्वम् you, निरायुधः unarmed, संयातुम् to fight, माम् me, परिरक्षितुं च and safeguard, कथम् how, शक्ष्यसि you will be capable?

37_50.shloka: युध्यमानस्य रक्षोभिस्तव तैः क्रूरकर्मभिः।प्रपतेयं हि ते पृष्ठाद्भयार्ता कपिसत्तम।।5.37.50।।
37_50.translation: "O noble monkey while you are engaged in fighting with those demons of wicked deeds, I may drop down out of fear.
37_50.word_by_word: कपिसत्तम O noble monkey, तव your, क्रूरकर्मभिः by those of wicked deeds, तैः by them, रक्षोभिः by the demons, युध्यमानस्य for you while engaged in fighting, भयार्ता out of fear, ते your, पृष्ठात् from the back, प्रपतेयं हि I will drop down.

37_51.shloka: अथ रक्षांसि भीमानि महान्ति बलवन्ति च।कथञ्चित्सांपराये त्वां जयेयुः कपिसत्तम।।5.37.51।।
37_51.translation: "O noble monkey the massive, fearsome and powerful demons may defeat you in the fight in any way.
37_51.word_by_word: कपिसत्तम O noble monkey, अथ then, भीमानि fearsome, महान्ति massive, बलवन्ति च powerful, रक्षांसि demons, सांपराये in the fight, कथञ्चित् in any case, त्वाम् you, जयेयुः win over.

37_52.shloka: अथवा युध्यमानस्य पतेयं विमुखस्य ते।पतितां च गृहीत्वा मां नयेयुः पापराक्षसाः।।5.37.52।।
37_52.translation: "Or else, while you are engaged in fighting and turn your attention the other way I might fall down and the sinful ogres may bear me away.
37_52.word_by_word: अथवा or else, युध्यमानस्य for you while engaged in the fighting, ते for you, विमुखस्य while you turn your attention other way, पतेयम् I may fall down, पतिताम् when I have fallen down, माम् me, गृहीत्वा taking hold, पापराक्षसाः wretched rakshasas, नयेयुः may take me away.

37_53.shloka: मां वा हरेयुस्त्वद्धस्ताद्विशसेयुरथापि वा।अव्यवस्थौ हि दृश्येते युद्धे जयपराजयौ।।5.37.53।।
37_53.translation: "They may snatch me away from your hands or cut me to pieces. Success or defeat is uncertain in a war.
37_53.word_by_word: त्वत् हस्तात् from your hand, माम् me, हरेयुः they may take one away, अथापि वा or rather, विशसेयुः may cut me, युद्धे in the fight, जयपराजयौ success or failure, अव्यवस्थौ not sure, दृश्येते हि they appear.

37_54.shloka: अहं वापि विपद्येयं रक्षोभिरभितर्जिता।त्वत्प्रयत्नो हरिश्रेष्ठ भवेन्निष्फल एव तु।।5.37.54।।
37_54.translation: "In such a case, caught and intimidated by the demons I may die. Then your efforts will be wasted.
37_54.word_by_word: रक्षोभिः caught by the ogres, अभितर्जिता very much threatened, अहम् I, विपद्येयं वापि or else Imay die, हरिश्रेष्ठ best of monkeys, त्वत्प्रयत्नः your effort, निष्फल एव will be wasteful, तु indeed, भवेत् may be.

37_55.shloka: कामं त्वमसि पर्याप्तो निहन्तुं सर्वराक्षसान्।राघवस्य यशो हीयेत्त्वया शस्तैस्तु राक्षसैः।।5.37.55।।
37_55.translation: "It may be that you can kill  all the demons but by such an act the fame of Rama will be diminished. (He cannot give his strength a trial)
37_55.word_by_word: त्वम् you, सर्वराक्षसान् all the ogres, निहन्तुम् to slay, पर्याप्तः अपि कामम् it may be you can do the task, त्वया by you, शस्तै by those killed, राक्षसैः by demons, राघवस्य Rama's, यशः fame, हीयेत् will diminish.

37_56.shloka: अथवाऽदाय रक्षांसि न्यसेयुस्सम्वृते हि माम्।यत्र ते नाभिजानीयुर्हरयो नापि राघवौ।।5.37.56।।
37_56.translation: "Or else, the ogres will carry me  and conceal me in a secret place which the vanaras or Rama and Lakshmana may not know.
37_56.word_by_word: अथवा or else, रक्षांसि the ogres, माम् me, आदाय after taking, यत्र where, ते हरयः those of you vanaras, राघवौ अपि and even Rama and Lakshmana, नाभिजानीयुः may not know, संवृते in a secret place, न्यसेयु: they may hide.

37_57.shloka: आरम्भस्तु मदर्थोऽयं ततस्तव निरर्थकः।त्वया हि सह रामस्य महानागमने गुणः।।5.37.57।।
37_57.translation: "All your effort for my sake would be futile. Hence Rama's arrival along with you will be of great benefit.
37_57.word_by_word: ततः then, मदर्थः for my sake, तव your, आरम्भस्तु effort, निरर्थकः futile, त्वया सह along with you, रामस्य Rama, आगमने coming here, महान् great, गुणः merit.

37_58.shloka: मयि जीवितमायत्तं राघवस्य महात्मनः।भ्रात्रूणां च महाबाहो तव राजकुलस्य च।।5.37.58।।
37_58.translation: "O strongarmed Hanuman your life and the life of the great self Rama, of his brother, and relatives of your king is dependent upon my survival.
37_58.word_by_word: महाबाहो strongarmed one, महात्मनः of the great self, राघवस्य Rama's, भ्रात्रूणाम् of his brothers, तव your, राजकुलस्य of the relatives of your king, जीवितम् life, मयि in me, आयत्तम् is dependent.

37_59.shloka: तौ निराशौ मदर्थं तु शोकसन्तापकर्शितौ।सह सर्वर्क्षहरिभिस्त्यक्ष्यतः प्राणसङ्ग्रहम्।।5.37.59।।
37_59.translation: "Both Rama and Lakshmana who are emaciated with sorrow and suffering on account of me will give up their lives along with vanaras and bears.
37_59.word_by_word: मदर्थम् for my sake, शोकसन्तापकर्शितौ emaciated with sorrow and suffering, तौ they both, निराशौ with no hope of finding me, सर्वर्क्षहरिभिः सह along with all vanaras and bears, प्राणसङ्ग्रहम् the five elements of which life is made, त्यक्ष्यतः will give up.

37_60.shloka: भर्तुर्भक्तिं पुरस्कृत्य रामादन्यस्य वानर।न स्पृशामि शरीरं तु पुंसो वानरपुङ्गव।।5.37.60।।
37_60.translation: "O chief of vanaras I cherish my devotion towards Rama alone and not touch the body of any other man.
37_60.word_by_word: वानरपुङ्गव O chief of vanaras, वानर vanara, भर्तुः husband's, भक्तिम् devotion, पुरस्कृत्य after cherishing, रामात् from Rama, अन्यस्य other, पुंसः man's, शरीरं तु body, न स्पृशामि I do not touch.

37_61.shloka: यदहं गात्रसंस्पर्शं रावणस्य बलाद्गता।अनीशा किं करिष्यामि विनाथा विवशा सती।।5.37.61।।
37_61.translation: "I had no control over myself. I was helpless and my husband was not present when I had to bear the touch of Ravana's limbs. What can I do?
37_61.word_by_word: अहम् I, बलात् by force, रावणस्य Ravana's, गात्रसंस्पर्शम् touch of his body, गता यत् that I had to experience, अनीशा having no control over my self, विवशा सती a helpless woman, विनाथा without my husband, किं करिष्यामि what can I do?

37_62.shloka: यदि रामो दशग्रीवमिह हत्त्वा सबान्धवम्।मामितो गृह्य गच्छेत तत्तस्य सदृशं भवेत्।।5.37.62।।
37_62.translation: "It will be proper if Rama comes here, kills Ravana along with all his relations and takes me away.
37_62.word_by_word: रामः Rama, सबान्धवम् along with his relations, दशग्रीवम् Ravana, इह here, हत्त्वा after killing, माम् me, इतः from here, गृह्य taking, गच्छेत यदि and if he goes, तत् then, तस्य his, सदृशम् proper, भवेत् it will be.

37_63.shloka: श्रुता हि दृष्टाश्च मया पराक्रमा महात्मनस्तस्य रणावमर्दिनः।न देवगन्धर्वभुजङ्गराक्षसा भवन्ति रामेण समा हि संयुगे।।5.37.63।।
37_63.translation: "I have seen and heard about Rama's conquest of enemies and his valiant deeds in war. Indeed, gods gandharvas, nagas or even demons cannot match him in war.
37_63.word_by_word: रणावमर्दिनः of the crusher of enemies, महात्मनः great self, तस्य his, पराक्रमाः valiant deeds, मया by me, श्रुताः heard, दृष्टाश्च witnessed, संयुगे in war, देवगन्धर्वभुजङ्गराक्षसाः whether gods, gandharvas, nagas or demons, रामेण by Rama, समाः equal, नहि not indeed.

37_64.shloka: समीक्ष्य तं संयति चित्रकार्मुकम् महाबलं वासवतुल्यविक्रमम्।सलक्ष्मणं को विषहेत राघवं हुताशनं दीप्तमिवानिलेरितम्।।5.37.64।।
37_64.translation: "After seeing Rama who is equal to lord Indra in valour. He is like blazing fire whipped by wind, wielding a wonderful bow, who can withstand the power of strong Rama accompanied by Lakshmana in war?
37_64.word_by_word: चित्रकार्मुकम् wielder of a powerful bow, महाबलम् endowed with great strength, वासवतुल्यविक्रमम् equal to Vasava in valour, सलक्ष्मणम् along with Lakshmana, अनिलेरितम् whipped by wind, दीप्तम् blazing, हुताशनमिव like the fire, तं राघवम् him, Rama, सयति in war, समीक्ष्य facing, कः who, विषहेतः can withstand.

37_65.shloka: सलक्ष्मणं राघवमाजिमर्दनं दिशागजं मत्तमिव व्यवस्थितम्।सहेत को वानरमुख्य संयुगे युगान्तसूर्यप्रतिमं शरार्चिषम्।।5.37.65।।
37_65.translation: "O chief of vanaras who can withstand Rama accompanied by Lakshmana, the conqueror of enemies? His arrows resemble the rays of the Sun at the time of the deluge, steady like the elephants who support the quarters of the earth.
37_65.word_by_word: वानरमुख्य chief of vanaras, सलक्ष्मणम् with Lakshmana, आजिमर्दनम् crusher of enemies in war, मत्तम् intoxicated, दिशागजमिव like the elephant supporting quarter of the earth, व्यवस्थितम् steady, शरार्चिषम् arrows of rays, युगान्तसूर्यप्रतिमम् resembling the Sun at the at the time of the deluge, राघवम् Rama, संयुगे in a war, कः who, सहेत can withstand.

37_66.shloka: स मे हरिश्रेष्ठ सलक्ष्मणं पतिं सयूथपं क्षिप्रमिहोपपादय।चिराय रामं प्रति शोककर्शितां कुरुष्व मां वानरमुख्य हर्षिताम्।।5.37.66।।
37_66.translation: "O foremost of the vanaras get Rama here along with Lakshmana and the lord of vanara troops quickly. O chief of vanaras this way you can bring happiness to one like me who is emaciated with suffering on account of Rama.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये सुन्दरकाण्डे सप्तत्रिंशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the thirtyseventh sarga of Sundarakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
37_66.word_by_word: हरिश्रेष्ठ O foremost of the vanaras, सः he, सलक्ष्मणम् with Lakshmana, सयूथपम् along with army troops, पतिम् lord, क्षिप्रम् quick, इह here, उपपादय bring, वानरमुख्य chief of vanaras, रामं प्रति with Rama, चिराय for a long time, शोककर्शिताम् emaciated with suffering, माम् me, हर्षिताम् a happy lady, कुरुष्व you may make.

38_1.shloka: [Hanuman carries the episode of Kakasura and the Chudamani from Sita to Rama as a mark of identification]ततस्स कपिशार्दूलस्तेन वाक्येन तोषितः।सीतामुवाच तच्छृत्वा वाक्यं वाक्यविशारदः।।5.38.1।।
38_1.translation: Satisfied with the words of Sita, the tiger among monkeys, who was eloquent in speech said:
38_1.word_by_word: ततः then, वाक्यविशारदः eloquent in speech, सः कपिशार्दूलः tiger among monkeys, तत् वाक्यम् those words, श्रुत्वा hearing, तेन वाक्येन by those words, तोषितः contented with, सीताम् to Sita, उवाच said.

38_2.shloka: युक्तरूपं त्वया देवि भाषितं शुभदर्शने।सदृशं स्त्रीस्वभावस्य साध्वीनां विनयस्य च।।5.38.2।।
38_2.translation: "O queen O lady of auspicious appearance your words are most appropriate to and characteristic of a modest virtuous woman.
38_2.word_by_word: शुभदर्शने whose appearance is auspicious, देवि queen, त्वया you, भाषितम् spoken, युक्तरूपम् is in accordance with your nature, स्त्रीस्वभावस्य of feminine nature, साध्वीनाम् of virtuous women, विनयस्य च and of the modesty, सदृशम् appropriate.

38_3.shloka: स्त्रीत्वं न तु समर्थं हि सागरं व्यतिवर्तितुम्।मामधिष्ठाय विस्तीर्णं शतयोजनमायतम्।।5.38.3।।
38_3.translation: "It may not be possible for a woman to cross on my back the vast ocean stretching over a hundred yojanas. It is not possible for a woman.
38_3.word_by_word: माम् me, अधिष्ठाय after climbing up, विस्तीर्णम् vast, शतयोजनम् of hundred yojanas, आयतम् wide, सागरम् the ocean, व्यतिवर्तितुम् to cross, स्त्रीत्वम् for a woman, न समर्थं हि is not possible.

38_4.shloka: द्वितीयं कारणं यच्च ब्रवीषि विनयान्विते।रामादन्यस्य नार्हामि संस्पर्शमिति जानकि ।।5.38.4।।एतत्ते सदृशं देवि पत्न्यास्तस्य महात्मनः।का ह्यन्या त्वामृते देवि ब्रूयाद्वचनमीदृशम्।।5.38.5।।
38_4.translation: "O humble lady the second reason given by you, 'I ought not to touch a person other than Rama' is well said and worthy of you, being the wife of the great soul. Who else can speak such words?
38_4.word_by_word: विनयान्विते O lady with humility etc., जानकि Janaki, रामात् from Rama, अन्यस्य of others, संस्पर्शम् touch, नार्हिमि I do not want, यत् that which, द्वितीयम् second, कारणम् reason, ब्रवीषि you said, एतत् that, तस्य his, महात्मनः of the great soul, पत्न्याः of the wife, ते to you, सदृशम् appropriate, देवि O queen, त्वाम् your, ऋते excepting, अन्या other than, का who else, ईदृशम् such, वचनम् word, ब्रूयात् will speak.

38_5.shloka: श्रोष्यते चैव काकुत्स्थ: सर्वं निरवशेषतः।चेष्टितं यत्त्वया देवि भाषितं मम चाग्रतः।।5.38.6।।
38_5.translation: "O queen Kakutstha Rama will hear from me fully all that has been said and done by you in my presence without any omission.
38_5.word_by_word: काकुत्स्थ: Rama the scion of the Kakutstha family, सर्वं all, देवि queen, त्वया your, यत् what ever, चेष्टितम् is done, मम my, अग्रतः presence, भाषितं च you have spoken, सर्वम् all, निरवशेषतः without omission, श्रोष्यते च will hear.

38_6.translation: "O queen my heart is drenched with love for Rama and desires to please him for many reasons. Therefore these words have been spoken by me.
38_6.word_by_word: देवि O queen, बहुभिः with many, कारणैः with reasons, रामप्रियचिकीर्षया desiring to please Rama, स्नेहप्रस्कन्नमनसा mind is sprinkled with love, मया by me, एतत् this, समुदीरितम् uttered.

38_7.translation: "Crossing the ocean and entering Lanka are  difficult. But I accomplished it. Hence my proposal.
38_7.word_by_word: लङ्कायाः of Lanka, दुष्प्रवेशत्वात् difficult to enter, महोदधेः of the ocean, दुस्तरत्वात् difficult to cross, आत्मनः of my self, सामर्थ्याश्चैव because of my capacity, मया by me, एतत् all this, समुदीरितम् pronounced.

38_8.shloka: इच्छामि त्वां समानेतुमद्यैव रघुबन्धुना।गुरुस्नेहेन भक्त्या च नान्यथैतदुदाहृतम्।।5.38.9।।
38_8.translation: "I offered to take you today itself out of my love and devotion to Rama with a desire to unite you with him and not with any other intention.
38_8.word_by_word: गुरुस्नेहेन out of love for my master, भक्त्या च and devotion, त्वाम् you, रघुबन्धुना with Rama, अद्यैव today itself, समानेतुम् to take, इच्छामि desirous of, एतत् all this, अन्यथा any other, न उदाहृतम् not mentioned otherwise.

38_9.shloka: यदि नोत्सहसे यातुं मया सार्थमनिन्दिते।अभिज्ञानं प्रयच्छ त्वं जानीयाद्राघवो हि यत्।।5.38.10।।
38_9.translation: "O blameless lady If you wish not to accompany me you may give me a token of identification to let Rama know about my coming here and seeing you".
38_9.word_by_word: अनिन्दिते O blameless lady, मया सार्थम् along with me, यातुम् to go, नोत्सहसे यदि if not desiring, यत् that, राघवः Rama, जानीयात् coming and seeing you, अभिज्ञानम् to let him know, त्वम् you, प्रयच्छ you may give me a token of identity.

38_10.shloka: एवमुक्ता हनुमता सीता सुरसुतोपमा।उवाच वचनं मन्दं बाष्पप्रग्रथिताक्षरम्।।5.38.11।।इदं श्रेष्ठमभिज्ञानं ब्रूयास्त्वं तु मम प्रियम्।
38_10.translation: Having heard Hanuman, Sita, a child of god, said these words in a low tone. Choked with tears, 'Carry this token of identity to my dear husband':
38_10.word_by_word: हनुमता by Hanuman, एवम् in that way, उक्ता having been addressed, सुरसुतोपमा resembling a god's daughter, सीता Sita, बाष्पप्रग्रथिताक्षरम् words choked with tears, वचनम् word, मन्दम् in low tone, उवाच said, त्वं तु you also, मम my, प्रियम् dear, श्रेष्ठम् best, इदम् thus, अभिज्ञानम् token of identity, ब्रूयाः said.

38_11.shloka: शैलस्य चित्रकूटस्य पादे पूर्वोत्तरे पुरा।।5.38.12।।तापसाश्रमवासिन्याः प्राज्यमूलफलोदके।तस्मिन्सिद्धाश्रमे देशे मन्दाकिन्या विदूरतः।।5.38.13।।तस्योपवनषण्डेषु नानापुष्पसुगन्धिषु।विहृत्य सलिले क्लिन्ना ममाङ्के समुपाविशमः।।5.38.14।।
