38_11.translation: 'Long ago we were staying at Siddhasrama. This hermitage was situated to the northeast at the foot of Chitrakuta mountain which was not far from the river Mandakini. It had abundant roots, fruits and water. You sported with me in the gardens which were fragrant with many types of flowers and ponds. You sat down on my lap with wet clothes in the hermitage'.
38_11.word_by_word: पुरा earlier, चित्रकूटस्य शैलस्य on the mountain of Chitrakuta, पूर्वोत्तरे in the northeast, पादे on foot, प्राज्यमूलफलोदके with abundant roots fruits and water, तस्मिन् in that, सिद्धाश्रमे Siddhasrama, देशे in a region, मन्दाकिन्याध्यविदूरतः not far from Mandakini river, तस्य of him, नानापुष्पसुगन्धिषु many kinds of fragrant flowers, उपवनषण्डेषु in gardens, सलिले in water, विहृत्य  after sporting, क्लिन्नः wet, तापसाश्रमवासिन्याः hermitages of ascetics, मम me,अङ्के the body, समुपाविशः you were seated.

38_12.shloka: ततो मांससमायुक्तो वायसः पर्यतुण्डयत्।तमहं लोष्टमुद्यम्य वारयामिस्म वायसम्।।5.38.15।।
38_12.translation: 'Then a crow greedy of flesh began to peck my bossom with its beak. I took a clod of earth and warded him off.
38_12.word_by_word: ततः then, मांससमायुक्तः it brought meat, वायसः crow, पर्यतुण्डयत् went round with its beak and pecked, अहम् I, लोष्टम् clod of earth, उद्यम्य by lifting, तम् him, वायसम् that crow, वारयामि स्म I presented him.

38_13.shloka: दारयन्स च मां काकस्तत्त्रैव परिलीयते।न चाप्युपारमन्मांसाद्भक्षार्थि बलिभोजनः।।5.38.16।।
38_13.translation: 'The crow was an eater of offerings, hungry for food began to peck me again and again for flesh.He did not stop.
38_13.word_by_word: सः काकः that crow, माम् me, दारयन् while pecking, तत्रैव there itself, परिलीयते waited, भक्षार्थि hungry for food, सः he, बलिभोजनः eater of offerings, मांसात् flesh, न उपारमच्चापि was not giving up.

38_14.shloka: उत्कर्षन्त्यां च रशनां क्रुद्धायां मयि पक्षिणि।स्रस्यमाने च वसने ततो दृष्टा त्वया ह्यहम्।।5.38.17।।
38_14.translation: 'My upper cloth was slipping. I was trying to pull up my waist string angrily when you saw me.
38_14.word_by_word: मयि I, पक्षिणि by the crow, क्रुद्धायाम् when I was angry, वसने when the cloth, स्रस्यमाने च wasslipping, रशनाम् waist string, उत्कर्षन्त्यां च as I was pulling up, ततः then, त्वया by you, अहम् I, दृष्टा seen.

38_15.shloka: त्वयाऽपहसिता चाहं क्रुद्धा संलज्जिता तदा।भक्षगृध्नेन काकेन दारिता त्वामुपागता।।5.38.18।।
38_15.translation: 'Then you made fun of me, and I became angry. I was abashed. Torn by the voracious bird I sought your shelter.
38_15.word_by_word: तदा then, क्रुद्धा enraged, अहम् I, त्वया your, अपहसिता made fun of me, संलज्जिता  embarassed, भक्षगृध्नेन by the voracious bird, काकेन by the crow, दारिता torn, त्वाम् you, उपागता  sought.

38_16.shloka: आसीनस्य च ते श्रान्ता पुनरुत्सङ्गमाविशम्।क्रुध्यन्ती च प्रहृष्टेन त्वयाऽहं परिसान्त्विता।।5.38.19।।
38_16.translation: 'Exhausted, I sat on your lap again. Seeing my angry face you pacified me. You were happy (to see me draw close).
38_16.word_by_word: श्रान्ता exhausted, आसीनस्य when you sat, ते your, उत्सङ्गम् lap, पुनः again, आविशम् settled again, क्रुध्यन्ती seeing me angry, अहम् I, प्रहृष्टेन happily, त्वया by you, परिसान्त्विता you pacified me.

38_17.shloka: बाष्पपूर्णमुखी मन्दं चक्षुषी परिमार्जती।लक्षिताऽहं त्वया नाथ वायसेन प्रकोपिता।।5.38.20।।
38_17.translation: 'O lord when I was angered by the crow and my face was filled with tears, you marked me wiping my eyes.
38_17.word_by_word: नाथ O lord, वायसेन by the crow, प्रकोपिता angered, बाष्पपूर्णमुखी face filled with tears, मन्दम् slowly, चक्षुषी eyes, परिमार्जती while wiping, अहम् I was, त्वया you, लक्षिता marked.

38_18.shloka: परिश्रमात्प्रसुप्ता च राघवाङ्केऽप्यहं चिरम्।पर्यायेण प्रसुप्तश्च ममाङ्के भरताग्रजः।।5.38.21।।
38_18.translation: 'Totally exhausted I slept on your lap for a long time, and in turn you slept on my lap later.
38_18.word_by_word: अहमपि I too, परिश्रमात् due to exhaustion, राघवाङ्के on Rama's lap, चिरम् for long time, प्रसुप्ता च I slept, पर्यायेण in turn, भरताग्रजः Bharata's elder brother, मम my, अङ्के on the lap, प्रसुप्तः slept.

38_19.shloka: स तत्र पुनरेवाथ वायसस्समुपागमत्।ततस्सुप्तप्रबुद्धां मां रामस्याङ्कात्समुत्थिताम्।।5.38.22।।वायसस्सहसागम्य विददार स्तनान्तरे।पुनः पुनरथोत्पत्य विददार स मां भृशम्।।5.38.23।।
38_19.translation: 'The crow came back again and clawed me in the space between my breasts even after I woke up after slumber from Rama's lap. Flying, it tore my bosom again and again.
38_19.word_by_word: अथ and then, सः वायसः that crow, पुनरेव again, तत्र there, समुपागमत् came back, ततः then, सः he, वायसः crow, सहसा atonce, आगम्य having come, सुप्तप्रबुद्धाम् awakened from sleep, रामस्य Rama's, अङ्कात् from the lap, समुत्थिताम् risen, माम् myself, स्तनान्तरे between my breasts, विददार clawed, अथ and, पुनः again, उत्पत्य flying, माम् myself, भृशम् repeatedly, विददार clawed down.

38_20.shloka: ततस्समुक्षितो रामो मुक्तैश्शोणितबिन्दुभिः।वायसेन ततस्तेन बलवत्क्लिश्यमानया।।5.38.24।।स मया बोधितश्श्रीमान्सुखसुप्तः परन्तपः।
38_20.translation: 'At the touch of the drops of blood dripping from my body, tormented by seeing me distressed with the dripping blood, you were awakened, you who were an illustrious scorcher of foes.
38_20.word_by_word: ततः then, रामः Rama, मुक्तै: dripping, शोणितबिन्दुभिः drops of blood, समुक्षितः seeing, ततः then, तेन वायसेन by that crow, बलवत् forcibly, क्लिश्यमानया tormented, मया by me, श्रीमान् illustrious, परन्तपः scorcher of foes, सुखसुप्तः happily sleeping, सः he, बोधितः he was awakened.

38_21.shloka: स मां दृष्ट्वा महाबाहुर्वितुन्नां स्तनयोस्तदा।।5.38.25।।आशीविष इव क्रुद्धश्वसन्वाक्यमभाषत।
38_21.translation: 'O strongarmed Rama, seeing my torn breasts, you became angry like a hissing serpent  and hissing said :
38_21.word_by_word: महाबाहुः strong armed, सः Rama, तदा then, स्तनयोः in the breasts, वितुन्नाम् wounded, माम् me, दृष्ट्वा on seeing, क्रुद्धः angered, आशीविष इव like a (hissing) snake, श्वसन् breathing hard, वाक्यम् these words, अभाषत spoke.

38_22.shloka: केन ते नागनासोरु विक्षतं वै स्तनान्तरम्।।5.38.26।।कः क्रीडति सरोषेण पञ्चवक्त्रेण भोगिना।
38_22.translation: 'O Sita with a beautiful lap like an elephant trunk by whom is your bosom wounded? Who is sporting with an angry fivehooded snake?
38_22.word_by_word: नागनासोरु lady whose thighs look like elephant's trunk, सीता Sita, स्तनान्तरम् your breasts, केन by whom, विक्षतं वै wounded, सरोषेण with the angry, पञ्चवक्त्रेण fivehooded, भोगिना by the serpent, कः who, क्रीडति sporting.

38_23.translation: 'Then looking around, you saw the crow facing me with sharp, bloodstained claws.
38_23.word_by_word: ततः then, वीक्षमाणः while glancing, सरुधिरैः with blood stained, तीक्ष्णैः with sharp ones, नखैः with nails, मामेव me, अभिमुखम् facing me, स्थितम् standing, तं वायसम् that crow, समुदैक्षत वै he saw.

38_24.shloka: पुत्त्रः किल स शक्रस्य वायसः पततां वरः।।5.38.28।।धरान्तरगतश्शीघ्रं पवनस्य गतौ समः।
38_24.translation: 'This crow was the best of birds. He was surely Indra's son who had covered a long distance with great speed and his speed was like the Windgod's.
38_24.word_by_word: पतताम् of the birds, वरः eminent, सः वायसः that crow, शक्रस्य Indra's, पुत्रः किल it is said that he is the son, धरान्तरगतः he covered a long distance, शीघ्रम् in great speed, गतौ in movement, पवनस्य Windgod's, समः matching.

38_25.shloka: ततस्तस्मिन्महाबाहुः कोपसंवर्तितेक्षणः।।5.38.29।।वायसे कृतवान्क्रूरां मतिं मतिमतां वरः।
38_25.translation: 'Then you, the strongarmed and best among the wise, your eyeballs rolling in fury, made up your mind about the cruel crow.
38_25.word_by_word: ततः then, मतिमताम् among the wise, वरः best, महाबाहुः strongarmed, कोपसंवर्तितेक्षणः with eye balls rolling in anger, तस्मिन् him, वायसे at the crow, क्रूराम् cruel, मतिम् mind, कृतवान् made up.

38_26.shloka: स दर्भं संस्तराद्गृह्य ब्राह्मेणास्त्रेण योजयत्।।5.38.30।।स दीप्त इव कालाग्निर्जज्वालाभिमुखो द्विजम्।
38_26.translation: 'Taking out a blade of darbha grass from your mat, you invoked the weapon of Brahma by reciting the mantra. Then you discharged it which blazed like the fire of death and went spearheading towards the crow.
38_26.word_by_word: सः he, Rama, संस्तरात् from his darbha mat, दर्भम् darbha grass, गृह्य took out, ब्राह्मेण अस्त्रेण invoked the weapon of Brahma into it by reciting the mantra, योजयत् discharged, सः that, दीप्तः blazed, कालाग्निरिव like the fire of death, द्विजम् the bird, अभिमुखः towards, जज्वाल glowed.

38_27.shloka: स तं प्रदीप्तं चिक्षेप दर्भं तं वायसं प्रति।।5.38.31।।ततस्तं वायसं दर्भस्सोम्बरेऽनुजगाम ह।
38_27.translation: 'Then you threw the burning darbha grass at the crow and it chased him in the sky.
38_27.word_by_word: सः he, प्रदीप्तम् glowing, तं दर्भम् that darbha, तं वायसं प्रति him, the crow in turn, चिक्षेप threw, ततः then, सः दर्भः that darbha, तं वायसम् that crow, अम्बरे in the sky, अनुजगाम ह followed.

38_28.shloka: अनुसृष्टस्तदा काको जगाम विविधां गतिम्।।5.38.32।।लोककाम इमं लोकं सर्वं वै विचचार ह।
38_28.translation: 'Then that crow flew to many places seeking asylum all over the universe chased by the blade of grass.
38_28.word_by_word: तदा then, काकः that crow, अनुसृष्टः one who was followed, विविधाम् many, गतिम् places, जगाम went, लोककामः the entire universe desiring safety, इमम् this, सर्वम् all, लोकम् worlds, विचचार ह went round.

38_29.shloka: स पित्रा च परित्यक्तस्सुरैश्च समहर्षिभिः।।5.38.33।।त्रीन्लोकान्सम्परिक्रम्य तमेव शरणं गतः।
38_29.translation: 'Then the crow went round all the three worlds, having been rejected by his father Indra, including all the sages and gods. Refused by all he came back to Rama seeking shelter.
38_29.word_by_word: सः he, त्रीन् three, लोकान् worlds, सम्परिक्रम्य having gone round, पित्रा च and to his fatheralso, समहर्षिभिः including the sages, सुरैश्च by gods, परित्यक्तः rejected, तमेव him alone, शरणं गतः went seeking refuge.

38_30.shloka: स तं निपतितं भूमौ शरण्यश्शरणागतम्।।5.38.34।।वधार्हमपि काकुत्स्थ: कृपया पर्यपालयत्।
38_30.translation: 'Seeing the crow fallen on the ground, O Kakutstha, you who are a saviour of those who seek refuge saved him out of compassion, even though he deserved to be killed.
38_30.word_by_word: शरण्यः saviour, सः काकुत्स्थ: that Kakutstha, शरणागतम् one who sought refuge, भूमौ on the ground, निपतितम् fallen on the ground, तम् him, वधार्हमपि even though deserves to be killed, कृपया out of compassion, पर्यपालयत् saved.

38_31.shloka: परिद्यूनं विषण्णं च स तमायान्तमब्रवीत्।।5.38.35।।मोघं कर्तुं न शक्यं तु ब्राह्ममस्त्रं तदुच्यताम्।
38_31.translation: 'Rama, you saw the crow in pain and despondency who returned to you and said that it is not possible to make Brahma's weapon ineffectual.You may tell now. (what should be done.)
38_31.word_by_word: सः Rama, परिद्यूनम् pained, विषण्णम् despondent, आयान्तम् he reached, तम् him, अब्रवीत् said, ब्राह्मम् अस्त्रम् Brahma weapon, मोघम् in vain, कर्तुम् to do, न शक्यं तु not possible, तत् that, उच्यताम् tell.

38_32.shloka: हिनस्तु दक्षिणाक्षि त्वच्छर इत्यथ सोऽब्रवीत्।।5.38.36।।ततस्तस्याक्षि काकस्य हिनस्ति स्म स दक्षिणम्।दत्त्वा स दक्षिणं नेत्रं प्राणेभ्यः परिरक्षितः।।5.38.37।।
38_32.translation: 'Then that crow said, 'let my right eye be blinded'. you then hit the right eye of the crow'. Thus the crow offered his right eye and saved himself.
38_32.word_by_word: अथ and then, सः that, त्वच्छरः your arrow, दक्षिणाक्षि right eye, हिनस्तु may be blinded, इति thus, अब्रवीत् said, ततः then, सः he, तस्य काकस्य that crow's, दक्षिणम् right, अक्षि eye, हिनस्ति स्म blinded by hitting, सः that, दक्षिणम् right, दत्त्वा having offered, प्राणेभ्यः from life, परिरक्षितः protected.

38_33.shloka: स रामाय नमस्कृत्य राज्ञे दशरथाय च।विसृष्टस्तेन वीरेण प्रतिपेदे स्वमालयम्।।5.38.38।।
38_33.translation: 'That crow offered salutations to you Rama and king Dasaratha, thereafter took permission and went to his own dwelling.
38_33.word_by_word: सः that crow, रामाय to Rama, राज्ञे to the king, दशरथाय च and to Dasaratha, नमस्कृत्य having offered salutations, तेन by him, वीरेण by the warrior, विसृष्टः permitted to leave, स्वम् his own, आलयम् dwelling, प्रतिपेदे went reached.

38_34.shloka: मत्कृते काकमात्रे तु ब्रह्मास्त्रं समुदीरितम्।कस्माद्यो मां हरेत्त्वत्तः क्षमसे तं महीपते।।5.38.39।।
38_34.translation: '(Addressing Rama as though he was present before her, Sita said) 'O lord of the earth for my sake you released the weapon of Brahma on a crow. What makes you excuse him who has abducted me?
38_34.word_by_word: महीपते lord of the earth, मत्कृते for the sake of, काकमात्रे on a mere crow, ब्रह्मास्त्रम् weapon of Brahma, समुदीरितम् released, त्वत्तः from you, माम् me, यः he who, अहरत् abducted, तम् him, कस्मात् why, क्षमसे you excuse him.

38_35.shloka: स कुरुष्व महोत्साहः कृपां मयि नरर्षभ।त्वया नाथवती नाथ ह्यनाथा इव दृश्यते।।5.38.40।।
38_35.translation: 'O bull among men you are so loving to me. I am like an orphan. Be kind to me. She who has found her lord in you stays without a protector.
38_35.word_by_word: नरर्षभ bull among men, सः Rama, महोत्साहः one with great love, मयि in me, कृपाम् compassion, कुरुष्व bestow, नाथ O lord, त्वया your, नाथवती I have been protected, अनाथा इव like an orphan, दृश्यते  appears.

38_36.shloka: आनृशंस्यं परो धर्मस्तवत्त्त ऐव मया श्रुतः।जानामि त्वां महावीर्यं महोत्साहं महाबलम्।।5.38.41।।अपारपारमक्षोभ्यं गाम्भीर्यात्सागरोपमम्।भर्तारं ससमुद्राया धरण्या वासवोपमम्।।5.38.42।।
38_36.translation: 'O my supreme lord I know you are kind, righteous, valiant, vigroous, mighty. You are boundless, calm and deep like the ocean. You are lord of earth and the seas and compeer of Vasava. I have heard from you that motiveless compassion is the best way to make one righteous.
38_36.word_by_word: अनृशंस्यम् kindness, परः supreme, धर्मः is righteous, मया by me, त्वत्तः एव from you alone,श्रुतः heard, त्वाम् you, महावीर्यम् heroic, महोत्साहम् vigour, महाबलम् mighty, अपारपारम् boundless, अक्षोभ्यम् never to be stirred, गाम्भीर्यात् with depth, सागरोपमम् like the ocean, ससमुद्रायाः inclusive of seas, धरण्याः of the earth, भर्तारम् lord, वासवोपमम् like Vasava, जानामि I know.

38_37.shloka: एवमस्त्रविदां श्रेष्ठस्सत्यवान्बलवानपि।किमर्थमस्त्रं रक्षस्सु न योजयसि राघव।।5.38.43।।
38_37.translation: 'Even though you are an expert in the use of weapons, truthful and strong. (Yet) whyare you not using weapons aganst the demons?'
38_37.word_by_word: राघव Rama, एवम् in that way, अस्त्रविदाम् among the users of weapons, श्रेष्ठः expert, सत्यवान् truthful, बलवानपि even strong, रक्षस्सु demons, अस्त्रम् weapon, किमर्थम् why, न योजयसि you are not using?

38_38.shloka: न नागा नाऽपि गन्धर्वा नासुरा न मरुद्गणाः।रामस्य समरे वेगं शक्ताः प्रतिसमाधितुं।।5.38.44।।
38_38.translation: (Now Sita turns to Hanuman and says) "In war serpents, gandharvas, demons or Marutas cannot withstand the speed of Rama's arrows and hit back.
38_38.word_by_word: समरे in war, रामस्य Rama's, वेगम् speed, प्रतिसमाधितुम् to hit back, नागाः serpents, न शक्ताः not able, गन्धर्वा अपि even gandharvas, न not, असुराः demons, न not, मरुद्गणाः marutas, न not.

38_39.shloka: तस्य वीर्यवतः कश्चिद्यद्यस्ति मयि सम्भ्रमः।किमर्थं न शरैस्तीक्ष्णै: क्षयं नयति राक्षसान्।।5.38.45।।
38_39.translation: "Does Rama have a little anxiety about me? If he has, why does he, a disciplined hero, not  put an end to the demons with his sharp arrows?
38_39.word_by_word: वीर्यवतः hero of great discipline, तस्य his, मयि in me, कश्चित् even a little, सम्भ्रमः hurry, अस्ति यदि if he has, तीक्ष्णैः with sharp, शरैः with arrows, राक्षसान् at the demons, किमर्थम् why, क्षयम् destroy, न नयति not killing.

38_40.shloka: भ्रातुरादेशमादाय लक्ष्मणो वा परन्तपः।कस्य हेतोर्न मां वीरः परित्राति महाबलः।।5.38.46।।
38_40.translation: "Or, why does the mighty hero, Lakshmana, who is a scorcher of enemies, not come to my rescue taking the orders from his brother?
38_40.word_by_word: परन्तपः scorcher of enemies, महाबलः mighty, वीरः hero, लक्ष्मणो वा even Lakshmana, भ्रातुः brother, आदेशम् order, आदाय after taking, कस्य हेतोः for what reason, माम् me, न परित्राति not rescue.

38_41.shloka: यदि तौ पुरुषव्याघ्रौ वाय्वग्निसमतेजसौ।सुराणामपि दुर्धर्षौ किमर्थं मामुपेक्षतः।।5.38.47।।
38_41.translation: "Both Rama and Lakshmana are tigers among men who resemble wind and fire in power and have the unassailability of the gods. Wherefore are they disregarding me?.
38_41.word_by_word: वाय्वग्निसमतेजसौ resembling wind and fire in power, पुरुषव्याघ्रौ two tigers among men, तौ they both, सुराणाम् even the gods, दुर्धर्षौ यदि अपि even though unassailable also, माम् me, किमर्थम् how is it, उपेक्षतः disregarding.

38_42.shloka: ममैव दुष्कृतं किञ्चिन्महदस्ति न संशयः।समर्थावपि तौ यन्मां नावेक्षेते परन्तपौ।।5.38.48।।
38_42.translation: "Perhaps I must have committed an atrocious sin. There is no doubt. For although both of them are scorchers of enemies, they deliver me not."
38_42.word_by_word: ममैव mine alone, महत् atrocious, किञ्चित् some, दुष्कृतम् sin, अस्ति is committed, संशयः doubt, न no, यत् because, समर्थावपि although capable, परन्तपौ both scorchers of enemies, तौ both, माम् me, न आवेक्षेते not deliver.

38_43.shloka: वैदेह्या वचनं श्रुत्वा करुणं साश्रुभाषितम्।अथाब्रवीन्महातेजा हनुमान्मारुतात्मजः।।5.38.49।।
38_43.translation: Hearing the piteous words of Vaidehi and beholding her eyes filled with tears, the Windgod's son, lustrous Hanuman replied thus:.
38_43.word_by_word: अथ and then, महातेजाः lustrous, मारुतात्मजः Windgod's son, हनुमान् Hanuman, वैदेह्या Vaidehi's, साश्रु with tears, करुणम् piteous, भाषितम् spoken, वचनम् words, श्रुत्वा having heard, अब्रवीत् said.

38_44.shloka: त्वच्छोकविमुखो रामो देवि सत्येन ते शपे।रामे दुःखाभिपन्ने च लक्ष्मणः परितप्यते।।5.38.50।।
38_44.translation: "O godlike lady Rama is not averse to your misery. On my word this is true. Rama is immersed in sorrow. Even Lakshmana wails.
38_44.word_by_word: देवि Devi, रामः Rama, त्वच्छोकविमुखः he is averse to your misery, सत्येन truly, ते your, शपे I vow, रामे when Rama, दुःखाभिपन्ने immersed in sorrow, लक्ष्मणः च even Lakshmana, परितप्यते wails.

38_45.shloka: कथञ्चिद्भवती दृष्टा न कालः परिदेवितुम्।इमं मुहूर्तं दुःखानां द्रक्ष्यस्यन्तमनिन्दिते।।5.38.51।।
38_45.translation: "I could find you with difficulty. This is not the time to wail. O blameless lady take it, your sorrow has come to an end at this moment.
38_45.word_by_word: कथञ्चित् with difficulty, भवती your self, दृष्टा could be found, परिदेवितुम् wailing, कालः time, न not, अनिन्दिते blameless lady, इमम् this, मुहूर्तम् moment, दुःखानाम् all sorrrow, अन्तम् end, द्रक्ष्यसि you will see.

38_46.shloka: तावुभौ पुरुषव्याघ्रौ राजपुत्रौ महाबलौ।त्वद्दर्शनकृतोत्साहौ लङ्कां भस्मीकरिष्यतः।।5.38.52।।
38_46.translation: "Both the mighty brothers, tigers among men, are eager to see you. Both the princes will reduce this Lanka  into ashes.
38_46.word_by_word: पुरुषव्याघ्रौ two tigers among men, महाबलौ mighty, त्वद्दर्शनकृतोत्साहौ eager to see you, उभौ both, तौ राजपुत्रौ those two princes, लङ्काम् this Lanka, भस्मीकरिष्यतः will reduce to ashes.

38_47.shloka: हत्त्वा च समरे क्रूरं रावणं सहबान्धवम्।राघवस्त्वां विशालाक्षि नेष्यति स्वां पुरीं प्रति।।5.38.53।।
38_47.translation: "O largeeyed lady cruel Ravana along with his relatives will be killed by Rama in war and Rama will return to his city with you.
38_47.word_by_word: विशालाक्षि O largeeyed lady, राघवः Rama, समरे in war, सहबान्धवम् along with relatives, क्रूरम् cruel, रावणम् Ravana, हत्वा after killing, स्वां पुरीं प्रति towards his city, त्वाम् you, नेष्यति he will be taking you.

38_48.shloka: ब्रूहि यद्राघवो वाच्यो लक्ष्मणश्च महाबलः।सुग्रीवो वापि तेजस्वी हरयोऽपि समागताः।।5.38.54।।
38_48.translation: "Communicate your message to mighty Rama and Lakshamana, to brilliant Sugriva and even the vanaras who gather there.
38_48.word_by_word: राघवः Rama, यत् whichever, वाच्यः you may like to convey, महाबलः mighty Rama, लक्ष्मणश्च and Lakshmana, तेजस्वी brilliant, सुग्रीवो वापि and Sugriva also, समागताः those who collect there, हरयोऽपि even the vanaras, ब्रूहि say.

38_49.shloka: इत्युक्तवति तस्मिंस्तु सीता सुरसुतोपमा।उवाच शोकसन्तप्ता हनुमन्तं प्लवङ्गमम्।।5.38.55।।
38_49.translation: "Hanuman having spoken this way, Sita, resembling a god's daughter, grieving, thus addressed Hanuman:
38_49.word_by_word: तस्मिन् when he, इति in that way, उक्तवति when he said, सुरसुतोपमा lady resembling a god's daughter, सीता Sita, शोकसन्तप्ता filled with grief, प्लवङ्गमम् to vanara, हनुमन्तम् Hanuman, उवाच said

38_50.shloka: कौसल्या लोकभर्तारं सुषुवे यं मनस्विनी।तं ममार्थे सुखं पृच्छ शिरसा चाभिवादय।।5.38.56।।
38_50.translation: "Bow to Rama and offer salutations on my behalf. Inquiries concerning his welfare should be addressed to Rama, whom virtuous Kausalya bore as a son.
38_50.word_by_word: लोकभर्तारम् lord of the world, यम् whom, मनस्विनी sensitive woman, कौसल्या Kausalya, सुषुवे bore, तम् him, मदर्थे on my behalf, सुखम् welfare, पृच्छ you may inquire into, शिरसा bybowing, अभिवादय च offer salutations.

38_51.shloka: स्रजश्च सर्वरत्नानि प्रिया याश्च वराङ्गनाः।ऐश्वर्यं च विशालायां पृथिव्यामपि दुर्लभम्।।5.38.57।।पितरं मातरं चैव सम्मान्याभिप्रसाद्य च।अनुप्रव्रजितो रामं सुमित्रा येन सुप्रजाः।।5.38.58।।
38_51.word_by_word: येन by whom, सुमित्रा Sumitra, सुप्रजाः has attained the title of blessed mother, स्रजश्च garlands, सर्वरत्नानि all jewels, प्रियाः dear, याः those, वराङ्गनाः best of women, विशालायाम् in the vast, पृथिव्याम् in the whole earth, दुर्लभम् most difficult to attain, ऐश्वर्यं चापि prosperity also, पितरम् father, मातरं चापि even mother, सम्मान्य having respected, अभिप्रसाद्य  pleased by adopting the life of an ascetic, च and, रामम् with Rama, अनुप्रव्रजितः accompanied.

38_52.shloka: आनुकूल्येन धर्मात्मा त्यक्त्वा सुखमनुत्तमम्।अनुगच्छति काकुत्स्थं भ्रातरं पालयन्वने।।5.38.59।।
38_52.translation: "Great, righteous Lakshmana had given up his pleasures and followed his brother Rama in his favour into the forest to be able to serve him.
38_52.word_by_word: धर्मात्मा righteous self, अनुत्तमम् great, सुखम् pleasures, त्यक्त्वा having given up, भ्रातरम् his brother, काकुत्स्थम् Kakustha Rama, वने to the forest, आनुकूल्येन in his favour, पालयन् while serving, अनुगच्छति followed.

38_53.shloka: सिंहस्कन्धो महाबाहुर्मनस्वी प्रियदर्शिनः।पितृवद्वर्तते रामे मातृवन्मां समाचरन्।।5.38.60।।
38_53.translation: "Lakshmana, who has lionshoulders and strong arms, who is handsome, who takes Rama as his father and treats me as his own mother.
38_53.word_by_word: सिंहस्कन्ध: lionshoulders, महाबाहुः strongarmed one, मनस्वी highsouled, प्रियदर्शनः a handsome person, माम् me, मातृवत् like his mother, समाचरन् while treating, रामे with Rama, पितृवत् as his father, वर्तते conducts.

38_54.shloka: ह्रियमाणां तदा वीरो न तु मां वेद लक्ष्मणः।वृद्धोपसेवी लक्ष्मीवान् शक्तो न बहुभाषिता।।5.38.61।।राजपुत्रः प्रियः श्रेष्ठः सदृशः श्वशुरस्य मे।
38_54.translation: "Heroic Lakshmana, did not know while I was borne away. He is prosperous, foremost in serving elders. He is energetic and reserved in his speech like my fatherinlaw. He is a prince dear (to his brother).
38_54.word_by_word: वीरः hero, लक्ष्मणः Lakshmana, तदा then, माम् me, ह्रियमाणाम् while I was borne away, न वेद not know, वृद्धोपसेवी serving elders, लक्ष्मीवान् prosperous, शक्तः energetic, न बहुभाषिता limited in speech, मे my, श्वशुरस्य of my fatherinlaw, सदृशः resembles, प्रियः dear, श्रेष्ठः foremost, राजपुत्रः prince.

38_55.shloka: ममः प्रियतरो नित्यं भ्राता रामस्य लक्ष्मणः।।5.38.62।।नियुक्तो धुरि यस्यां तु तामुद्वहति वीर्यवान्।
38_55.translation: "Rama's brother Lakshmana is always dear to me. Heroic Lakshmana will discharge whichever responsibility is entrusted to him.
38_55.word_by_word: रामस्य Rama's, भ्राता brother, लक्ष्मणः Lakshmana, नित्यम् always, मम to me, प्रियतरः loving, वीर्यवान् heroic, यस्याम् in whichever, धुरि task, नियुक्तः he is entrusted, ताम् such a job, उद्वहति executes.

38_56.shloka: यं दृष्ट्वा राघवो नैव वृत्तमार्यमनुस्मरेत्।।5.38.63।।स ममार्थाय कुशलं वक्तव्यो वचनान्मम।
38_56.translation: "He is Lakshmana for whose care and support Rama did not miss the noble king Dasaratha (during exile). Convey him my words of enquiry about his wellbeing.
38_56.word_by_word: यम् who, दृष्ट्वा after seeing, राघवः Rama, वृत्तम् support, आर्यम् noble, न अनुस्मरेत् not remembering, सः he, मम my, अर्थाय sake, मम on me, वचनात् words, कुशलम् welfare, वक्तव्यः that I have enquired.

38_57.shloka: मृदुर्नित्यं शुचिर्दक्षः प्रियो रामस्य लक्ष्मणः।।5.38.64।।यथा हि वानरश्रेष्ठ दुःखक्षयकरो भवेत्।त्वमस्मिन्कार्यनिर्योगे प्रमाणं हरिसत्तमः।।5.38.65।।
38_57.translation: "Lakshmana is soft, pure, competent and dear to Rama. O great vanara, act in such a manner that Lakshmana can mitigate my suffering. O great monkey, the best of vanaras you are competent in accomplishing this task.
38_57.word_by_word: वानरश्रेष्ठः excellent vanara, हरिसत्तम: esteemed vanaras, मृदुः gentle, नित्यम् always, शुचिः pure, दक्षः competent, रामस्य Rama's, प्रियः beloved, लक्ष्मणः Lakshmana, यथा as such, दुःखक्षयकरः who mitigates suffering, भवेत् will be, अस्मिन् in that, कार्यनिर्योगे in a task, त्वम् you, प्रमाणम् authority.

38_58.shloka: राघवस्त्वत्समारम्भान्मयि यत्नपरो भवेत्।इदं ब्रूयाश्च मे नाथं शूरं रामं पुनः पुनः।।5.38.66।।
38_58.translation: "By your efforts alone my husband will try for my release. You may tell these words to my heroic husband, Rama, again and again.
38_58.word_by_word: राघवः Rama, त्वत्समारम्भात् by your efforts alone, मयि regarding me, यत्नपरः one who makes efforts, भवेत् will be, मे my, नाथम् husband, शूरम् powerful hero, रामम् Rama, पुनः पुनः again and again, इदम् this, ब्रूयाः may tell.

38_59.shloka: जीवितं धारयिष्यामि मासं दशरथात्मज।ऊर्ध्वं मासान्न जीवेयं सत्येनाहं ब्रवीमि ते।।5.38.67।।
38_59.translation: "I will hold on to life  only for a month. Beyond, I will not survive. I swear by truth. You may tell this to Rama.
38_59.word_by_word: दशरथात्मज Dasaratha's son, Rama, मासम् a month, जीवितम् life, धारयिष्यामि will hold on to life, मासात् after a month, ऊर्ध्वम् beyond that, न जीवेयम् I will not live, अहम् I, सत्येन on truth, ते to you, ब्रवीमि I am telling.

38_60.shloka: रावणेनोपरुद्धां मां निकृत्य पापकर्मणा।त्रातुमर्हसि वीर त्वं पातालादिव कौशिकीम्।।5.38.68।।
38_60.translation: "O heroic Rama just as Kausik was rescued from the underworld it behoves you to deliver me from imprisonment of wicked Ravana".
38_60.word_by_word: वीर hero, पापकर्मणा by the wicked, रावणेन by Ravana, निकृत्य after insulting, उपरुद्धाम् imprisonment, माम् me, त्वम् you, पातालात् from the underworld or Pataala, कौशिकीमिव like Kausik, त्रातुम् rescue me, अर्हसि is proper.

38_61.shloka: ततो वस्त्रगतं मुक्त्वा दिव्यं चूडामणिं शुभम्।प्रदेयो राघवायेति सीता हनुमते ददौ।।5.38.69।।
38_61.translation: Then Sita took out the exquisite and auspicious Chudamani worn on the head, untied from her clothes and gave it to Hanuman to be presented to Rama.
38_61.word_by_word: ततः then, सीता Sita, वस्त्रगतम् tied up in clothes, शुभम् auspicious, दिव्यम् exquisite, चूडामणिम् Chudamani, an ornament worn on the head, मुक्त्वा took out, राघवाय to Rama, प्रदेयः to be given, इति thus, हनुमते to Hanuman, ददौ gave.

38_62.shloka: प्रतिगृह्य ततो वीरो मणिरत्नमनुत्तमम्।अङ्गुल्या योजयामास न ह्यस्य प्राभवद्भुजः।।5.38.70।।
38_62.translation: Then Hanuman, taking the extraordinary jewel and placed it on his finger as it was not fitting to his arm.
38_62.word_by_word: ततः then, वीरः hero, अनुत्तमम् very great, मणिरत्नम् jewel, प्रतिगृह्य after taking, अङ्गुल्या on his finger, योजयामास placed अस्य to his, भुजः arm, न प्राभवत् हि was not fitting.

38_63.shloka: मणिरत्नं कपिवरः प्रतिगृह्याभिवाद्य च।सीतां प्रदक्षिणं कृत्वा प्रणतः पार्व्शतः स्थितः।।5.38.71।।
38_63.translation: Having recieved the jewel from Sita and circumambulated her, Hanuman offered salutations to  her and stood by her.
38_63.word_by_word: कपिवरः best of vanaras, मणिरत्नम् jewel, प्रतिगृह्य after taking, सीताम् from Sita, अभिवाद्य च having saluted, प्रदक्षिणं कृत्वा having circumambulated, प्रणतः humbly, पार्श्वतः by the side, स्थितः stood.

38_64.shloka: हर्षेण महता युक्तः सीतादर्शनजेन सः।हृदयेन गतो रामं शरीरेण तु विष्ठितः।।5.38.72।।
38_64.translation: Hanuman stood there physically, with great joy gazing at Sita, but mentally he was with Rama.
38_64.word_by_word: सः he, सीतादर्शनजेन by seeing Sita, महता with a great, हर्षेण joy, युक्तः endowed, हृदयेन his mind, रामम् to Rama, गतः went, शरीरेण तु but body, विष्ठितः stood there.

38_65.shloka: मणिवरमुपगृह्य तं महार्हं जनकनृपात्मजया धृतं प्रभावात्।गिरिरिव पवनावधूतमुक्तः सुखितमनाः प्रतिसङ्क्रमं प्रपेदे।।5.38.73।।
38_65.translation: Having received the most precious jewel from the daughter of Janaka, Hanuman prepared to return like a mountain released from the impact of the wind.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये सुन्दरकाण्डे अष्टत्रिंशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the thirtyeighth sarga of Sundarakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
38_65.word_by_word: महार्हम् precious, जनकनृपात्मजया by Janaka's daughter, धृतम् borne, तं मणिवरम् that great jewel, उपगृह्य taking, प्रभावात् by its glow, पवनावधूतमुक्तः shaken by wind and released, गिरिरिव like a mountain, सुखितमनाः pleased, प्रतिसङ्क्रमम् to return, प्रपेदे prepared.

39_1.shloka: [Sita further appeals to Hanuman]मणिं दत्त्वा ततः सीता हनूमन्तमथाब्रवीत्।अभिज्ञानमभिज्ञातमेतद्रामस्य तत्त्वतः।।5.39.1।।
39_1.translation: Sita gave the jewel to Hanuman and said, "This signet ornament is known to Rama very well".
39_1.word_by_word: सीता Sita, मणिं Jewel, दत्त्वा having given, ततः that way, हनूमन्तम् to Hanuman, अब्रवीत् said, एतत् this, रामस्य to Rama, अभिज्ञात known, तत्त्वतः truly, अभिज्ञानम् signet.

39_2.shloka: मणिं तु दृष्ट्वा रामो वै त्रयाणां संस्मरिष्यति।वीरो जनन्या मम च राज्ञो दशरथस्य च।।5.39.2।।
39_2.translation: "Seeing this jewel,Rama will recall three of us, my mother, myself and the king Dasaratha" (as this was given by her mother at her marriage.)
39_2.word_by_word: मणिम् jewel, दृष्ट्वा after seeing, रामः Rama, त्रयाणाम् of three of us, जनन्याः of the mother, मम च me and, राज्ञः king, दशरथस्य च Dasaratha and, संस्मरिष्यति will recall.

39_3.shloka: स भूयस्त्वं समुत्साहे चोदितो हरिसत्तम।अस्मिन्कार्यसमारम्भे प्रचिन्तय यदुत्तरम्।।5.39.3।।
39_3.translation: "Great Hanuman you are enthused now. You may think over the future course of action.
39_3.word_by_word: हरिसत्तम great Hanuman, सः such Rama, त्वम् you, भूयः again, समुत्साहचोदितः prompted by enthusiasm, अस्मिन् in this, कार्यसमारम्भे in this effort, यत् that, उत्तरम् now, प्रचिन्तय think over.

39_4.shloka: त्वमस्मिन्कार्यनिर्योगे प्रमाणं हरिसत्तम।हनुमन्यत्नमास्थाय दुःखक्षयकरो भव।।5.39.4।।तस्य चिन्तयतो यत्नो दुःखक्षयकरो भवेत्।
39_4.translation: "O best of monkeys it is your  responsibility to carry out this task. O Hanuman think carefully of that. Take the initiative to reduce my suffering. I am confident that you can do it."
39_4.word_by_word: हरिसत्तम O best of monkeys, अस्मिन् in this, कार्यनिर्योगे in carrying out this task, त्वम् you, प्रमाणम् are responsible, हनुमान् Hanuman, यत्नम् initiative, आस्थाय after making, दुःखक्षयकरः reducer of suffering, भव you are, तस्य for him, चिन्तयतः  thinking, यत्नः effort, दुःखक्षयकरः reducer of grief, भवेत् become.

39_5.shloka: स तथेति प्रतिज्ञाय मारुतिर्भीमविक्रमः।।5.39.5।।शिरसा वन्ध्य वैदेहीं गमनायोपचक्रमे।
39_5.translation: Hanuman possessed with fierce valour said to Vaidehi, 'so be it' and bowed his head, and offered salutations before he departed.
39_5.word_by_word: भीमविक्रमः possessed with fierceful valour, सः मारुतिः that Maruti, तथेति so be it, प्रतिज्ञाय promised, वैदेहीम् to Vaidehi, शिरसा with his head, वन्ध्य having offered salutation, गमनाय to depart, उपचक्रमे started.

39_6.shloka: ज्ञात्वा सम्प्रस्थितं देवी वानरं मारुतात्मजम्।।5.39.6।।बाष्पगद्गदया वाचा मैथिली वाक्यमब्रवीत्।
39_6.translation: The noble lady, Sita, having been fully convinced about Hanuman and realising that he is about to start, her voice was choked with tears. She said these words:
39_6.word_by_word: देवी noble lady, मैथिली Mythili, मारुतात्मजम् Maruti's son, वानरम् vanara, सम्प्रस्थितम् who had started, ज्ञात्वा having realised, बाष्पगद्गदया with voice choked with tears, वाचा with speech, वाक्यम् these words, अब्रवीत् said.

39_7.shloka: कुशलं हनुमन्ब्रूयाः सहितौ रामलक्ष्मणौ।।5.39.7।।सुग्रीवं च सहामात्यं वृद्धान् सर्वांश्च वानरान्।ब्रूयास्त्वं वानरश्रेष्ठ कुशलं धर्मसंहितम्।।5.39.8।।
39_7.translation: "O Hanuman the great communicate my welfare  to both Rama and Lakshmana, to Sugriva, his ministers, elderly vanaras in righteous order.
39_7.word_by_word: वानरश्रेष्ठः O great vanara, हनुमन् O Hanuman, सहितौ both, रामलक्ष्मणौ Rama and Lakshmana, कुशलम् welfare, ब्रूयाः you may communicate, सहामात्यम् along with his ministers, सुग्रीवं च and Sugriva, वृद्धान् elders, सर्वान् all, वानरान् vanaras, त्वम् you, धर्मसंहितम् righteous manner, कुशलम् welfare, ब्रूयाः you may communicate

39_8.shloka: यथा स च महाबाहुर्मां तारयति राघवः।अस्माद्धुःखाम्बुसंरोधात्त्वं समाधातुमर्हसि।।5.39.9।।
39_8.translation: "You must pacify the strongarmed Rama in a manner by which he will help me to cross the ocean of grief and rlieve me.
39_8.word_by_word: महाबाहुः strongarmed, सः राघवः that Rama, अस्मात् from this, दुःखाम्बुसंरोधात् relieve me from this ocean of grief, यथा that way, तारयति he helps me to cross, त्वम् you, समाधातुम् to pacify, अर्हसि you may.

39_9.shloka: जीवन्तीं मां यथा रामः सम्भावयति कीर्तिमान्।तत्तथा हनुमन्वाच्यं वाचा धर्ममवाप्नुहि।।5.39.10।।
39_9.translation: "Let the illustrious Rama take me alive. Help me with your (persuasive) words and you will acquire merit.
39_9.word_by_word: हनुमान् Hanuman, कीर्तिमान् illustrious one, रामः Rama, माम् me, जीवन्तीम् while I am alove, यथा in such way, सम्भावयति will take me, तत् that, तथा that way, वाच्यम् words, वाचा tell, धर्मम् righteous, अवाप्नुहि you will acquire.

39_10.shloka: नित्यमुत्साहयुक्ताश्च वाचश्रुत्वा त्वयेरिताः।वर्धिष्यते दाशरथेः पौरुषं मदवाप्तये।।5.39.11।।
39_10.translation: "On hearing your ever spirited words his manliness to get me back will be charged.
39_10.word_by_word: त्वया you, ईरिताः spoken, उत्साहयुक्ताः full of determination for action, वाचः words, नित्यम् ever, श्रुत्वा after hearing, मदवाप्तये for acquiring me, दाशरथेः son of Dasaratha, पौरुषम् manliness, वर्धिष्यते will increase.

39_11.shloka: मत्सन्देशयुता वाचस्त्वत्तश्श्रुत्वा च राघवः।पराक्रमविधिं वीरो विधिवत्संविधास्यति।।5.39.12।।
39_11.word_by_word: वीरः hero, राघवः Rama, त्वत्तः from you, मत्सन्देशयुताः with repetition of my message, वाचः words, श्रुत्वा after hearing, विधिवत् arrange duly, पराक्रमविधम् following his valour, संविधास्यति will make efforts.

39_12.translation: "Having heard Sita's words, Hanuman, son of Maruta, placed his folded palms over his head in reverence and replied:
39_12.word_by_word: मारुतात्मजः son of Maruta, हनुमान् Hanuman, सीतायाः Sita's, वचनम् words, श्रुत्वा after listening, शिरसि on his head, अञ्जलिम् folded palms, आधाय placed, उत्तरम् replied, वाक्यम् these words, अब्रवीत् said.

39_13.shloka: क्षिप्रमेष्यति काकुत्स्थो हार्यृक्षप्रवरैर्वृतः।यस्ते युधि विजित्यारीन्शोकं व्यपनयिष्यति।।5.39.14।।
39_13.translation: "Kakutstha Rama, accompanied by vanaras and bears will reach here soon and conquer the enemies in war and relieve your grief.
39_13.word_by_word: काकुत्स्थ: Kakutstha, हर्यृक्षप्रवरैः with vanaras and bears, क्षिप्रम् at once, एष्यति he will hasten, यः he, युधि in war, अरीन् enemies, विजित्य winning over, ते your, शोकम् grief, व्यपनयिष्यति will relieve.

39_14.shloka: न हि पश्यामि मर्त्येषु नासुरेषु सुरेषु वा।यस्तस्य क्षिपतो बाणान्स्थातुमुत्सहतेऽग्रतः।।5.39.15।।
39_14.translation: "I do not see any one among humans or demons or even among gods who can face his arrows when released.
39_14.word_by_word: यः when he, बाणान् arrows, क्षिपतः while he releases, तस्य  his, अग्रतः in front, स्थातुम् to stand, उत्सहते will have, मर्त्येषु among humans, नासुरेषु or among demons, सुरेषु वा or among gods, न हि पश्यामि I do not see.

39_15.shloka: अप्यर्कमपि पर्जन्यमपि वैवस्वतं यमम्।स हि सोढुं रणे शक्तस्तव हेतोर्विशेषतः।।5.39.16।।
39_15.translation: "Indeed, Rama is capable of conquering even the Sungod, or the raingod or Yama (the son of the Sun) specially for your sake.
39_15.word_by_word: सः he, रणे in war, अर्कमपि even the Sun, पर्जन्यमपि or the raingod, वैवस्वतम् son of the Sun, यमम् Yama the lord of death, सोढुम् to hear, शक्तः capable, तव हेतोः for you, विशेषतः specially.

39_16.shloka: स हि सागरपर्यन्तां महीं शासितुमीहति।त्वन्निमित्तो हि रामस्य जयो जनकनन्दिनि।।5.39.17।।
39_16.translation: "Rama is fit to rule the entire earth surrounded by the ocean. O delight of Janaka he will succeed in serving your cause."
39_16.word_by_word: सः he, सागरपर्यन्ताम् surrounded by the entire ocean, महीम् earth, शासितुम् to rule, अर्हति हि is fit, जनकनन्दिनि O Janaka's delight, रामस्य Rama's, जयः victory, त्वन्निमित्तो हि for your sake only.

39_17.shloka: तस्य तद्वचनं श्रुत्वा सम्यक्सत्यं सुभाषितम्।जानकी बहुमेनेऽथ वचनं चेदमब्रवीत्।।5.39.18।।
39_17.translation: On hearing the truthful, proper, pleasing words by Hanuman whom she held in great esteem, Sita said this:
39_17.word_by_word: जानकी Janaki, तस्य his, सत्यम् truth, सम्यक् proper, सुभाषितम् good words, तत् that, वचनम् words, श्रुत्वा on hearing, बहुमेने held in great esteem, अथ then, इदम् thus, वचनं च and the word, अब्रवीत् said.

39_18.shloka: ततस्तं प्रस्थितं सीता वीक्षमाणा पुनः पुनः।भर्तृस्नेहान्वितं वाक्यं सौहार्दादनुमानयत्।।5.39.19।।
39_18.translation: Sita again and again looked at Hanuman who was about to start. She made him understand her words conveying her love for Rama.
39_18.word_by_word: ततः then, सीता Sita, प्रस्थितम् ready to start, तम् him, पुनः पुनः again and again, वीक्षमाणा looking at, भर्तृस्नेहान्वितम् conveying her love to Rama, वाक्यम् word, सौहार्दात् goodhearted, अनुमानयत् she made him understand.

39_19.shloka: यदि वा मन्यसे वीर वसैकाहमरिन्दम।कस्मिंश्चित्संवृते देशे विश्रान्तःश्वो गमिष्यसि।।5.39.20।।
39_19.translation: "O destroyer of enemies if you think of halting for a day you may do so in a solitary location and leave tomorrow.
39_19.word_by_word: अरिन्दम O destroyer of enemies, वीर hero, मन्यसे यदि if you  think so, कस्मिंश्चित् some where, संवृते in a closed space, देशे in location, एकाहम् for one day, वस you may stay, विश्रान्तः rest, श्वः tomorrow, गमिष्यसि you may go.

39_20.shloka: मम चेदल्पभाग्याया सान्निध्यात्तव वानर।अस्य शोकस्य महतो मुहूर्तं मोक्षणं भवेत्।।5.39.21।।
39_20.translation: "Your presence will relieve me of my suffering, if you stay here for a while.
39_20.word_by_word: वानर vanara, तव your, सान्निध्यात् by the presence, अल्पभाग्यायाः of an unfortunate woman, मम to me, महतः great, अस्य शोकस्य from the suffering, मुहूर्तम् for a short while, मोक्षणम् relief, भवेत् चेत् will be.

39_21.shloka: गते हि हरिशार्दूल पुनरागमनाय तु।प्राणानामपि सन्देहो मम स्यान्नात्र संशयः।।5.39.22।।
39_21.translation: "O tiger among vanaras if you leave this place to come again, my life will be uncertain, (if your coming is uncertain). There is no doubt about it.
39_21.word_by_word: हरिशार्दूल O tiger among vanaras, पुनरागमनाय for your visit once again, गते when you go, मम for me, प्राणानामपि and for my life, सन्देहः doubt, स्यात् will be, अत्र here, सन्देहः doubt, न no.

39_22.shloka: तवादर्शनजः शोको भूयो मां परितापयेत्।दुःखाद्धुःखपरामृष्टां दीपयन्निव वानर।।5.39.23।।
39_22.translation: "My agony would be increased further by not seeing you. It would be inflamming my agony and I would be even more pained.
39_22.word_by_word: वानर vanara, दुःखात् agonised, दुःखपरामृष्टाम् agony increased further, माम् me, तव your,अदर्शनजः not seeing you, शोकः sorrow, दीपयन्निव as if inflamming my agony, भूयः again, परितापयेत् it will trouble me.

39_23.shloka: अयं च वीर सन्देहस्तिष्ठतीव ममाग्रतः।सुमहांस्त्वत्सहायेषु हर्यृक्षेषु हरीश्वरः।।5.39.24।।
39_23.translation: "O heroic chief of vanaras I am doubtful as to whether vanaras and bears can extend help?
39_23.word_by_word: वीर hero, हरीश्वर chief of vanaras, त्वत्सहायेषु your helpless, हर्यृक्षेषु among vanaras and bears, अयम् this, सुमहान् great, सन्देहः doubtful, मम अग्रतः in front of me, तिष्ठतीव dwells in my mind.

39_24.shloka: कथं नु खलु दुष्पारं तरिष्यन्ति महोदधिम्।तानि हर्यृक्षसैन्यानि तौ वा नरवरात्मजौ।।5.39.25।।
39_24.translation: "How can the army of vanaras and bears, for that matter, princes Rama and Lakshmana negotiate the ocean, which is difficult to cross?
39_24.word_by_word: तानि those, हर्यृक्षसैन्यानि army of vanaras and bears, तौ they both, Rama and Lakshmana, नरवरात्मजौ princes, दुष्पारम् difficult to cross, महोदधिम्  ocean, कथं नु how indeed, तरिष्यन्ति they can cross.

39_25.shloka: त्रयाणामेव भूतानां सागरस्यास्य लङ्घने।शक्तिस्स्याद्वैनतेयस्य तव वा मारुतस्य वा।।5.39.26।।
39_25.translation: "It is only three beings who have the capacity to leap over this ocean. Garuda, or you or the Windgod.
39_25.word_by_word: अस्य of this, सागरस्य ocean's, लङ्घने to leap, वैनतेयस्य वा for Bainateya (Garuda) or, तव वा or you, मारुतस्य or Windgod वा or, त्रयाणाम् for these three, भूतानाम् living beings, शक्तिः energy, स्यात् have.

39_26.shloka: तदस्मिन्कार्यनिर्योगे वीरैवं दुरतिक्रमे।किं पश्यसि समाधानं त्वं हि कार्यविदां वरः।।5.39.27।।
39_26.translation: "What means do you, being the foremost hero among the three who are capable performing this difficult task, foresee?
39_26.word_by_word: वीर hero, तत् such, एवम् in that way, दुरतिक्रमे in a very difficult task, अस्मिन् in this, कार्यनिर्योगे the task, किम् what, समाधानम् means, पश्यसि you foresee, त्वम् you, कार्यविदाम् among those who are capable, वरः हि foremost.

39_27.shloka: काममस्य त्वमेवैकः कार्यस्य परिसाधने।पर्याप्तः परवीरघ्न यशस्यस्ते फलोदयः।।5.39.28।।
39_27.translation: "O slayer of enemy heroes if you alone can accomplish this task the fame of doing this will be yours.
39_27.word_by_word: परवीरघ्न slayer of enemy heroes, अस्य कार्यस्य this task, परिसाधने to accomplish, त्वम् you, एक एव alone are, पर्याप्तः कामम् are competent, ते to you, फलोदयः fruit, यशस्यः of the accomplishment.

39_28.shloka: बलैस्समग्रैर्यदि मां रावणं जित्य संयुगे।विजयी स्वपुरं यायात्तत्तस्य सदृशं भवेत्।।5.39.29।।
39_28.translation: "It would be worthy of Rama if he with his entire army emerges victorious over Ravanain a battle and takes me to his city.
39_28.word_by_word: संयुगे in war, समग्रैः with  the entire, बलैः with army, रावणम् Ravana, जित्य after winning, माम् me, विजयी victorious , स्वपुरम् his own city, यायात् यदि if he can reach, तत् that, तस्य his, सदृशम् worthy of him, भवेत् will be.

39_29.shloka: शरैस्तु सङ्कुलां कृत्वा लङ्कां परबलार्दनः।मां नयेद्यदि काकुत्स्थः तत्तस्य सदृशं भवेत्।।5.39.30।।
39_29.translation: "If Kakutstha (Rama), slayer of the enemy army fills the entire Lanka with his arrows and takes me, then his action will be worthy of him.
39_29.word_by_word: परबलार्दनः slayer of enemy army, काकुत्स्थः Kakutstha, लङ्काम् Lanka, शरैः with arrows, सङ्कुलाम् an agitated place, कृत्वा does, माम् me, नयेद्यदि if he takes, तत् that, तस्य his action, सदृशम् agreeable, भवेत् will be.

39_30.shloka: तद्यथा तस्य विक्रान्तमनुरूपं महात्मनः।भवेदाहवशूरस्य तथा त्वमुपपादय।।5.39.31।।
39_30.translation: "You may make arrangement in such a manner that, that great self, the hero in war makes his victorious march which is worthy of him."
39_30.word_by_word: तत् that, महात्मनः of the great self, आहवशूरस्य of the hero in war, तस्य his, अनुरूपम् worthy of him, विक्रान्तम् victorious, यथा in such a way, भवेत् will be, तथा in that way, त्वम् you, उपपादय you may make arrangement.

39_31.shloka: तदर्थोपहितं वाक्यं प्रश्रितं हेतुसंहितम्।निशम्य हनुमान्शेषं वाक्यमुत्तरमब्रवीत्।।5.39.32।।
39_31.translation: Having heard the meaningful, courteous and logical words of Sita, Hanuman replied:
39_31.word_by_word: हनुमान् Hanuman, अर्थोपहितम् meaningful, प्रश्रितम् courteous, हेतुसंहितम् logical, तत् those, वाक्यम् words, निशम्य having heard, शेषम् the rest, वाक्यम् word, अब्रवीत् said, उत्तरं in reply.

39_32.translation: "O Devi the lord of monkeys, Sugriva heads the army of vanaras and bears. He is richly endowed with satvaguna and is determined to accomplish your cause and free you from sorrow.
39_32.word_by_word: देवि Devi, हर्यृक्षसैन्यानाम् of the army of vanaras and bears, ईश्वरः lord, प्लवतां वरः foremost among monkeys, सत्त्वसम्पन्नः richly endowed with satvaguna, सुग्रीवः Sugriva, तव अर्धे for your sake, कृतनिश्चयः detemined to accomplish.

39_33.shloka: स वानरसहस्राणां कोटीभिरभिसंवृतः।क्षिप्रमेष्यति वैदेहि राक्षसानां निबर्हणः।।5.39.34।।
39_33.translation: "O Vaidehi Sugriva will reach this place with thousands of crores of vanaras very soon and would kill all the ogres.
39_33.word_by_word: वैदेहि Vaidehi, सः he, the Sugriva, वानरसहस्राणाम् of thousands of vanaras, कोटीभिः with crores of them, अभिसंवृतः is surrounded, राक्षसानाम् of all the ogres, निबर्हणः will destroy, क्षिप्रम् swiftly, एष्यति he will reach.

39_34.shloka: तस्य विक्रमसम्पन्नास्सत्त्ववन्तो महाबलाः।मनस्सङ्कल्पसम्पाता निदेशे हरयः स्थिताः।।5.39.35।।
39_34.translation: "Valiant, virtuous and powerful vanaras who can leap with the speed of mind are awaiting orders (of Sugriva).
39_34.word_by_word: विक्रमसम्पन्नाः powerful, सत्त्ववन्तः virtuous, महाबलाः mighty, मनस्सङ्कल्पसम्पाताः who can leap with the speed of mind, हरयः vanaras, तस्य his, निदेशे at his command, स्थिताः awaiting.

39_35.shloka: येषां नोपरि नाधस्तान्न तिर्यक्सज्जते गतिः।न च कर्मसु सीदन्ति महत्स्वमिततेजसः।।5.39.36।।
39_35.translation: "Their course cannot be impeded either upward, or downward or right or left. They  are indeed very brilliant and would never fail in any task.
39_35.word_by_word: येषाम् for those monkeys, गतिः movement, उपरि upward, न सज्जते  do not get impeded, अधस्तात्  downward, न not, तिर्यक्  horizontally, न not, अमिततेजसः very brilliant ones, महत्सु any kind, कर्मसु of task, न सीदन्ति do not care

39_36.translation: "They have often circumambulated the earth including its oceans and mountains through the aerial path with great enthusiasm.
39_36.word_by_word: महोत्साहैः by the enthusiastic, वायुमार्गानुसारिभिः following aerial path, तैः by them, असकृत् repeatedly, ससागरधराधरा with the oceans and mountains, भूमिः earth, प्रदक्षिणीकृता has been circumambulated.

39_37.shloka: मद्विशिष्टाश्च तुल्याश्च सन्ति तत्र वनौकसः।मत्तः प्रत्यवरः कश्चिन्नास्ति सुग्रीवसन्निधौ।।5.39.38।।
39_37.translation: "The vanaras under Sugriva who move in the forest are more powerful than me or equal to me. None is inferior to me.
39_37.word_by_word: तत्र there, मद्विशिष्टाश्च more powerful than me, तुल्याश्च those equal to me, वनौकसः vanaras who move in the forest, सन्ति are, मत्तः to me, प्रत्यवरः inferior, कश्चित् not even one, सुग्रीवसन्निधौ under Sugriva, नास्ति not there.

39_38.shloka: अहं तावदिह प्राप्तः किं पुनस्ते महाबलाः।न हि प्रकृष्टाः प्रेष्यन्ते प्रेष्यन्ते हीतरे जनाः।।5.39.39।।
39_38.translation: "If I have managed to come here, why not the other powerful ones? The superior leaders are not sent (as messengers). Only ordinary ones like me are.
39_38.word_by_word: अहं तावत् I have, इह here, अनुप्राप्तः reached, महाबलाः very powerful, ते to you, किं पुनः whynot others, प्रकृष्टाः the best ones, न प्रेष्यन्ते हि will not be sent, इतरे others, जनाः ordinary ones, प्रेष्यन्ते हि will be sent.

39_39.shloka: तदलं परितापेन देवि शोको व्यपैतु ते।एकोत्पातेन ते लङ्कामेष्यन्ति हरियूथपाः।।5.39.40।।
39_39.translation: "O noble lady therefore, give up your agony. Enough of your lamentation. The monkey troops will reach this place in one stride.
39_39.word_by_word: देवि noble lady, तत् therefore, परितापेन with lamentation, अलम् enough, ते your, शोकः agony, व्यपैतु may be given up, ते those, हरियूथपाः monkey troops, एकोत्पातेन in one stride, लङ्काम् to Lanka, एष्यन्ति will reach.

39_40.shloka: मम पृष्ठगतौ तौ च चन्द्रसूर्याविवोदितौ।त्वत्सकाशं महासत्त्वौ नृसिंहावागमिष्यतः।।5.39.41।।
39_40.translation: "Both the valiant Rama and Lakshmana, lions among men, looking brilliant like Sun and Moon will come to you riding on my back.
39_40.word_by_word: महासत्त्वौ both great men, नृसिंहौ both lions among men, तौ च and both, मम my, पृष्ठगतौ on my back, उदितौ just risen, चन्द्रसूर्याविव like Sun and Moon, त्वत्सकाशम् to your presence, आगमिष्यतः will come.

39_41.shloka: ततो वीरौ नरवरौ सहितौ रामलक्ष्मणौ।आगम्य नगरीं लङ्कां सायकैर्विधमिष्यतः।।5.39.42।।
39_41.translation: "Both the heroes, Rama and Lakshmana will come and blow up the city of Lanka with their unfailing arrows.
39_41.word_by_word: ततः then, वीरौ two heroes, नरवरौ both the princes, रामलक्ष्मणौ Rama and Lakshmana, सहितौ together, आगम्य on coming, लङ्कां नगरीम् to the city of Lanka, सायकैः with their arrows, विधमिष्यतः will blow away.

39_42.shloka: सगणं रावणं हत्त्वा राघवो रघुनन्दनः।त्वामादाय वरारोहे स्वपुरीं प्रतियास्यति।।5.39.43।।
39_42.translation: "O beautiful lady Raghava, the delight of the Raghu race would kill Ravana and his kins and return with you to his city৷৷
39_42.word_by_word: वरारोहे O beautiful lady, रघुनन्दनः the delight of the Raghu race, राघवः Rama, सगणम् along with his kins, रावणम् Ravana, हत्त्वा on killing, त्वाम् you, आदाय after taking you, स्वपुरीम् their city, प्रतियास्यति would go back.

39_43.shloka: तदाश्वसिहि भद्रं ते भव त्वं कालकाङ्क्षिणी।नचिराद्द्रक्ष्यसे रामं प्रज्वलन्तमिवानलम्।।5.39.44।।
39_43.translation: "Therefore, count the days and rest assured. Let it be auspicious to you. You will shortly see Rama burning like fire.
39_43.word_by_word: तत् therefore, आश्वसिहि rest assured, ते भद्रम् let it be auspicious to you, त्वम् you, कालकाङ्क्षिणी count your time, भव be, प्रज्वलन्तम् burning, अनलम् इव like the fire, रामम् Rama, नचिरात् shortly, द्रक्ष्यसे would see.

39_44.translation: "When Ravana is slain, with his sons, ministers and kith and kin, you will reunite withRama as Rohini unites with the Moon.
39_44.word_by_word: सपुत्रामात्यबान्धवे along with his sons, ministers and relatives, अस्मिन् when, राक्षसेन्द्रे the king of demons, निहते killed, त्वम् you, रोहिणी Rohini, शशाङ्केनेव like the Moon, रामेण with Rama, समेष्यसि you will reunite.

39_45.shloka: क्षिप्रं त्वं देवि शोकस्य पारं यास्यसि मैथिलि।रावणं चैव रामेण निहतं द्रक्ष्यसेऽचिरात्।।5.39.46।।
39_45.translation: "O queen Mythili you come to the end of your sorrow and will soon see Ravana killed by Rama".
39_45.word_by_word: देवि queen, मैथिलि Mythili, त्वम् you, क्षिप्रम् soon, शोकस्य grief, पारम् to the other shore, यास्यसि will go, अचिरात् very shortly, रामेण by Rama, रावणम् Ravana, निहतं slain, द्रक्ष्यसे चैव you will see.

39_46.shloka: एवमाश्वास्य वैदेहीं हनुमान्मारुतात्मजः।गमनाय मतिं कृत्वा वैदेहीं पुनरब्रवीत्।।5.39.47।।
39_46.translation: Having thus consoled Vaidehi, Hanuman, son of the Windgod resolved to depart. Once again he spoke to Vadehi:
39_46.word_by_word: मारुतात्मजः son of the Windgod, हनुमान् Hanuman, वैदेहीम् to Vaidehi, एवम् in that manner, आश्वास्य having consoled, गमनाय to depart, मतिम् thought, कृत्वा after resolving, पुनः again, वैदेहीम् to Vaidehi, अब्रवीत् said.

39_47.shloka: तमरिघ्नं कृतात्मानं क्षिप्रं द्रक्ष्यसि राघवम्।लक्ष्मणं च धनुष्पाणिं लङ्काद्वारमुपागतम्।।5.39.48।।
39_47.translation: "Very soon you would see the slayer of foes, who is an accomplished wielder of the bow (Rama) along with Lakshmana at the entrance of Lanka.
39_47.word_by_word: लङ्काद्वारम् at the entrance of Lanka, उपागतम् reached, अरिघ्नम् slayer of foes, कृतात्मानम् an accomplished man, तं राघवम् that Rama, धनुष्पाणिम् wielder of bow, लक्ष्मणं च and Lakshmana, क्षिप्रम् very soon, द्रक्ष्यसि you will see.

39_48.translation: "You will soon see heroic vanaras whose weapons are their teeth, who are like lion and tiger in their valour. They are (mighty) like wellbred elephants.
39_48.word_by_word: नखदंष्ट्रायुधान् whose nails and teeth are their weapons, वीरान् heroes, सिंहशार्दूलविक्रमान् resembling lion and tiger in valour, वारणेन्द्राभान् who resemble wellbred elephants, सङ्गतान् reach, वानरान् vanaras, क्षिप्रम् soon, द्रक्ष्यसि you will see.

39_49.translation: "O respectable lady you would see many troops of vanara chiefs who resemble clouds hovering on the mountain peaks of Lankaroaring.
39_49.word_by_word: आर्ये respectable lady, शैलाम्बुदनिकाशानाम् whose body is like clouds on mountain, नर्दताम् of the roaring, कपिमुख्यानाम् of the chiefs of vanaras, अनेकशः  in many ways, यूधानि troops, लङ्कामलयसानुषु on the  mountain of Lanka.

39_50.shloka: स तु मर्मणि घोरेण ताडितो मन्मथेषुणा।न शर्म लभते रामस्सिंहार्धित इव द्विपः।।5.39.51।।
39_50.translation: "Rama is tormented by the dreadful arrows of the god of love pierced into vitals, like an elephant hit by a lion. He has no happiness in life.
39_50.word_by_word: सः रामः that Rama, घोरेण by the dreadful, मन्मथेषुणा arrows of god of love, मर्मणि pierced into vitals, ताडितः hit, सिंहार्दितः hit by a lion, द्विपः इव like an elephant, न शर्म लभते is not happy

39_51.shloka: मा रुदो देवि शोकेन माभूत्ते मनसोऽप्रियम्।शचीव पत्या शक्रेण भर्त्रा नाथवती ह्यसि।।5.39.52।।
39_51.translation: "O devi weep no more.Entertain no unpleasant thoughts.You have a great husband, just as Sachi has her lord Indra.
39_51.word_by_word: देवि devi, शोकेन with sorrow, मा रुदः do not cry, ते your, मनसः in mind, अप्रियम् unpleasant, माभूत् no thought be entertained, पत्या with a husband शक्रेण to Indra, शचीव like Sachi, भर्त्रा by your husband, नाथवती you have a great husband, असि हि you are.

39_52.shloka: रामाद्विशिष्टः कोऽन्योऽस्ति कश्चित्सौमित्रिणा समः।अग्निमारुतकल्पौ तौ भ्रातरौ तव संश्रयौ।।5.39.53।।
39_52.translation: "Who is superior to Rama? Who is equal to Lakshmana? Both the brothers are like Fire and Wind. They are your refuge.
39_52.word_by_word: रामात् than Rama, विशिष्टः more distinguished, अन्यः others, कः who is there, अस्ति is, सौमित्रिणा to Lakshmana, समः equal, कश्चित् who is there, अग्निमारुतकल्पौ equal to fire and wind, तौ भ्रातरौ both brothers, तव your, संश्रयौ they are your refuge.

39_53.shloka: नास्मिंश्चिरं वत्स्यसि देवि देशे रक्षोगणैरध्युषितेऽतिरौद्रे।न ते चिरादामगमनं प्रियस्य क्षमस्व मत्सङ्गमकालमात्रम्।।5.39.54।।
39_53.translation: "O noble lady You will not stay longer in this country, which is a strong hold of hosts of demons and a dreadful place It will not be very long before you unite with your beloved. Pray, have  patience till then.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये सुन्दरकाण्डे एकोनचत्वारिंशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the thirtyninth sarga of Sundarakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
39_53.word_by_word: देवि noble lady, रक्षोगणैः by the hosts of ogres, अध्युषिते in a stronghold, अतिरौद्रे in a dreadful place, अस्मिन् देशे country, चिरम् not very long, न वत्स्यसि will not stay, ते प्रियस्य with your beloved, आगमनम् coming, न चिरात् not very long, मत्सङ्गमकालमात्रम् for this period, क्षमस्व pardon me.

40_1.shloka: [Sita permits Hanuman to depart]श्रुत्वा तु वचनं तस्य वायुसूनोर्महात्मनः।उवाचात्महितं वाक्यं सीता सुरसुतोपमा।।5.40.1।।
40_1.translation: Sita who was like the daughter of the gods heard the son of the Windgod for her benefit and replied:
40_1.word_by_word: महात्मनः great soul, तस्य his, वायुसूनोः son of the Windgod, वचनम् words, श्रुत्वा having heard, सुरसुतोपमा like the daughter of gods, सीता Sita, आत्महितम् for her benefit, वाक्यम् words, उवाच spoke.

40_2.shloka: त्वां दृष्ट्वा प्रियवक्तारं सम्प्रहृष्यामि वानरः।अर्धसञ्जातसस्येव वृष्टिं प्राप्य वसुन्धरा।।5.40.2।।
40_2.translation: "O vanara just as the earth feels happy when the half grown crops receive rain, I feel happy after seeing you. You have been speaking pleasing words
40_2.word_by_word: वानर vanara, प्रियवक्तारम् who has been speaking pleasing words, त्वाम् you दृष्ट्वा after seeing, अर्धसञ्जातसस्या as half grown, वसुन्धरा earth, वृष्टिम् rain, प्राप्येव as if begotten, सम्प्रहृष्यामि I feel happy.

40_3.shloka: यथा तं पुरुषव्याघ्रं गात्रैश्शोकाभिकर्शितैः।संस्पृशेयं सकामाहं तथा कुरु दयां मयि।।5.40.3।।
40_3.translation: "Be kind to me and act in such a manner that I may embrace my lord passionately withmy body emaciated with grief.
40_3.word_by_word: सकामम् a passionate lady, अहम् I, शोकाभिकर्शितैः emaciated with suffering, गात्रैः with limbs, तं पुरुषव्याघ्रम् him that tiger among men, यथा as, संस्पृशेयम् I may touch, तथा in that way, मयि in me, दयाम् kindness, कुरु do.

40_4.shloka: अभिज्ञानं च रामस्य दद्या हरिगणोत्तम।क्षिप्तामिषीकां काकस्य कोपादेकाक्षिशातनीम्।।5.40.4।।
40_4.translation: "O best leader of vanaras remind Rama about the incident of the release of a blade of grass in anger blinding one of the eyes of the crow narrated to you.
40_4.word_by_word: हरिगणोत्तम best leader of the vanaras, कोपात् with anger, क्षिप्ताम् released, काकस्य crow's, एकाक्षिशातनीम् blinding one eye, इषीकाम् by a blade of grass, रामस्य to Rama, अभिज्ञानम् as a token, दद्याः give.

40_5.shloka: मनश्शिलायास्तिलको गण्डपार्श्वे निवेशितः।त्वया प्रणष्टे तिलके तं किल स्मर्तुमर्हसि।।5.40.5।।
40_5.translation: '(Further remind him), 'When my tilaka mark was erased, you painted tilaka with a stone (manassita pigment) nearby. O Rama you should remember that (incident).
40_5.word_by_word: तिलके when tilaka mark, प्रणष्टे got erased, त्वया by you, मनश्शिलायाः with a grind stone, तिलकः tilaka (mark on forehead), गण्डपार्श्वे stone near by, निवेशितः किल painted indeed, तम् that tilaka, स्मर्तुम् to remember, अर्हसि you will.

40_6.shloka: स वीर्यवान्कथं सीतां हृतां समनुमन्यसे।वसन्तीं रक्षसां मध्ये महेन्द्रवरुणोपमः।।5.40.6।।
40_6.translation: 'Rama you are like Indra and Varuna in valiance. How are you tolerating Sita seized, dwelling among the demons?
40_6.word_by_word: वीर्यवान् valiant, महेन्द्रवरुणोपमः comparable to Varuna and Indra, सः Rama, हृताम् seized, रक्षसाम् of rakshasas, मध्ये in the midst of, वसन्तीम् dwelling, सीताम् Sita, कथम् how, समनुमन्यसे he will agree.

40_7.shloka: एष चूडामणिर्दिव्यो मया सुपरिरक्षितः।एतं दृष्ट्वा प्रहृष्यामि व्यसने त्वामिवानघ।।5.40.7।।
40_7.translation: "O sinless Rama this wonderful Chudamani of mine has been carefully safeguarded. Seeing this is like seeing you when I am in distress.
40_7.word_by_word: अनघ sinless, दिव्यः wonderful, एषः this, चूडामणिः Chudamani, मया of mine, सुपरिरक्षितः carefully safe guared, व्यसने in distress, एतम् this one, दृष्ट्वा seeing, त्वामिव like you here, प्रहृष्यामि look at it.

40_8.shloka: एष निर्यातितश्श्रीमान्मया ते वारिसम्भवः।अतः परं न शक्ष्यामि जीवितुं शोकलालसा।।5.40.8।।
40_8.translation: "I am sending you this (Chudamani) born of the sea. O glorious Rama and now engrossed in grief it is not possible for me to live.
40_8.word_by_word: श्रीमान् glorious one, वारिसम्भवः born of the sea, एषः this, ते to you, निर्यातितः is returned, शोकलालसा engrossed in grief, अतः परम् beyond this, जीवितुम् to live, न शक्ष्यामि it is not possible for me.

40_9.shloka: असह्यानि च दुःखानि वाचश्च हृदयच्छिदः।राक्षसीनां सुघोराणां त्वत्कृते मर्षयाम्यहम्।।5.40.9।।
40_9.translation: "I am tolerating this unbearable grief, and the words of the dreadful ogresses piercing my heart. Only for you.
40_9.word_by_word: अहम् I, असह्यानि unbearable, दुःखानि grief, सुघोराणाम् of dreadful ones, राक्षसीनाम् of ogresses, हृदयच्छिदः piercing my heart, वाचश्च utterings, त्वत्कृते your sake, मर्षयामि I am enduring.

40_10.shloka: धारयिष्यामि मासं तु जीवितं शत्रुसूदन।ऊर्ध्वं मासान्न जीविष्ये त्वया हीना नृपात्मज।।5.40.10।।
40_10.translation: "O subduer of enemies O prince I will hold on to life only for a month. I will not survive beyond a month in your absence.
40_10.word_by_word: शत्रुसूदन O subduer of enemies, नृपात्मज O prince, मासं तु for one month only, जीवितम् life, धारयिष्यामि will survive, त्वया you, हीना separated, मासात् for one month only, ऊर्ध्वम् beyond that, न जीविष्ये will not live.

40_11.shloka: घोरो राक्षसराजोऽयं दृष्टिश्च न सुखा मयि।त्वां च श्रुत्वा विपद्यन्तं न जीवेयमहं क्षणम्।।5.40.11।।
40_11.translation: "The demon king is frightful. He looks at me with immoral (lusty) eyes. I do not wish to live even for a moment after hearing about the adversities (you have faced)."
40_11.word_by_word: अयम् this, राक्षसराजः demon king, घोरः fearsome, मयि at me, दृष्टिः look, सुखा moral, न no, त्वाम् you, विपद्यन्तम् facing calamities, श्रुत्वा hearing, अहम् I, क्षणम् even a moment, न जीवेयम् I will not survive.

40_12.shloka: वैदेह्या वचनं श्रुत्वा करुणं साश्रु भाषितम्।अथाब्रवीन्महातेजा हनुमान्मारुतात्मजः।।5.40.12।।
40_12.translation: Hearing the words of Sita who was weeping piteously, brilliant Hanuman said this:
40_12.word_by_word: अथ then, महातेजाः a brilliant one, मारुतात्मजः son of the Windgod, हनुमान् Hanuman, साश्रु weeping, भाषितम् words spoken, करुणम् piteously, वैदेह्याः Vaidehi's, वचनम् words, श्रुत्वा on hearing, अब्रवीत् said.

40_13.shloka: त्वच्छोकविमुखो रामो देवि सत्येन ते शपे।रामे दुःखाभिभूते तु लक्ष्मणः परितप्यते।।5.40.13।।
40_13.translation: "O irreproachable lady I swear by you that Rama has grown averse to everything out of grief of separation from you. When Rama is in grief even Lakshmana gets immersed in sorrow.
40_13.word_by_word: देवि O irreproachable lady, रामः Rama, त्वच्छोकविमुखः out of grief he is not showing any  interest in life, सत्येन truly, ते to you, शपे I promise, रामे when Rama, दुःखाभिभूते he is in grief, लक्ष्मणः च even Lakshmana, परितप्यते is immersed in sorrow.

40_14.shloka: कथञ्चिद्भवती दृष्टा न कालः परिशोचितुम्।इमं मुहूर्तं दुःखानामन्तं द्रक्ष्यसि भामिनि।।5.40.14।।
40_14.translation: "O beautiful lady somehow I could meet you. This is not the time to worry about. You will see the end of suffering at this very moment.
40_14.word_by_word: कथञ्चित् somehow, भवती you, दृष्टा seen, परिशोचितम् to worry, कालः time, न not, भामिनि a beautiful lady, इमम् this, मुहूर्तम् moment, दुःखानाम् for grief, अन्तम् end, द्रक्ष्यसि you can see.

40_15.translation: "Both the princes are tigers among men and crushers of enemies. They are determined to see you, and will reduce Lanka to ashes.
40_15.word_by_word: पुरुषव्याघ्रौ tigers among men, अरिन्दमौ crusher of enemies, त्वद्दर्शनकृतोत्साहौ very determined to see you, उभौ both, तौ राजपुत्रौ both the princes, लङ्काम् Lanka, भस्मीकरिष्यतः will reduce to ashes.

40_16.shloka: हत्त्वा च समरे क्रूरं रावणं सहबान्धवम्।राघवौ त्वां विशालाक्षि स्वां पुरीं प्रापयिष्यतः।।5.40.16।।
40_16.translation: "O largeeyed lady Killing in war the vile Ravana, the demon king and all his relatives, Rama would take you back to his own city৷৷
40_16.word_by_word: विशालाक्षि largeeyed one, राघवः Rama, समरे in war, सहबान्धवम् along with relatives, क्रूरम् vile, रावणम् Ravana, हत्वा after killing, स्वां पुरीं प्रति to his own city, त्वाम् you, प्रापयिष्यतः willtake you back.

40_17.shloka: यत्तु रामो विजानीयादभिज्ञानमनिन्दिते।प्रीतिसञ्जननं तस्य भूयस्त्वं दातुमर्हसि।।5.40.17।।
40_17.translation: "O unimpeachable lady give one more identification which would make him more happy".
40_17.word_by_word: अनिन्दिते blameless lady, रामः Rama, यत् that which, अभिज्ञानम् knows, विजानीयात् to identify you, तस्य your, प्रीतिसञ्जननम् that which makes him more happy, भूयः one more, त्वम् you, दातुम् may give, अर्हसि is proper.

40_18.shloka: साब्रवीद्दत्तमेवेति मयाभिज्ञानमुत्तमम्।एतदेव हि रामस्य दृष्ट्वा मत्केशभूषणम्।।5.40.18।।श्रद्धेयं हनुमन्वाक्यं तव वीर भविष्यति।
40_18.translation: "I have already given the best identification. When you hand this jewel used on my hair to him,  he will believe what you tell him".
40_18.word_by_word: मया mine, उत्तमम् best, अभिज्ञानम् identification, दत्तमेव already given, इति this, सा she, अब्रवीत् said, वीर hero, हनुमान् Hanuman, एतत् all this, मत्केशभूषणम् my jewel for the hair, दृष्ट्वा seeing, तव his, वाक्यम् words, रामस्य Rama's, श्रद्धेयम् what you tell, भविष्यति will believe.

40_19.shloka: स तं मणिवरं गृह्य श्रीमान्प्लवगसत्तमः।।5.40.19।।प्रणम्य शिरसा देवीं गमनायोपचक्रमे।
40_19.translation: The illustrious vanara held the ornament, prostrated to Sita and prepared to depart.
40_19.word_by_word: श्रीमान् illustrious one, सः he, प्लवगसत्तमः best of vanaras, मणिवरम् best jewel, गृह्य holding,देवीम् to Sita, शिरसा by his head, प्रणम्य prostrated, गमनाय to depart, उपचक्रमे started.

40_20.shloka: तमुत्पातकृतोत्साहमवेक्ष्य हरिपुङ्गवम्।।5.40.20।।वर्धमानं महावेगमुवाच जनकात्मजा।अश्रुपूर्णमुखी दीना बाष्पगद्गदया गिरा।।5.40.21।।
40_20.translation: Seeing Hanuman eager to leap, enlarging his body quickly, she appeared pitiable with her face filled with tears and throat choked.
40_20.word_by_word: जनकात्मजा Janaka's daughter, उत्पातकृतोत्साहम् risen up eager to leap, वर्धमानम् enlarging, महावेगम् very swiftly, तं हरिपुङ्गवम् him the chief of vanaras, आवेक्ष्य looking at him, अश्रुपूर्णमुखी her face filled with tears, दीना pitiably, बाष्पगद्गदया throat choked with tears, गिरा with these words, उवाच spoke.

40_21.shloka: हनुमन्सिंहसङ्काशौ भ्रातरौ रामलक्ष्मणौ।सुग्रीवं च सहामात्यं सर्वान् ब्रूयाह्यनामयम्।।5.40.22।।
40_21.translation: "O Hanuman to the lionlike brothers Rama and Lakshmana, to Sugriva  including his ministers and to every one convey my good wishes.
40_21.word_by_word: हनुमान् Hanuman, भ्रातरौ brothers, सिंहसङ्काशौ both comparable to lion, रामलक्ष्मणौ to Rama and Lakshmana, सहामात्यम् along with ministers, सुग्रीवं च and Sugriva, सर्वान् to all, अनामयम् wellbeing, ब्रूयाः convey.

40_22.shloka: यथा च स महाबाहुर्मां तारयति राघवः।अस्माद्दु:खाम्बुसम्रोधात्त्वं समाधातुमर्हसि।।5.40.23।।
40_22.translation: "You should make efforts in such a manner that the mightyarmed Rama will help me in crossing the cean of sorrow.
40_22.word_by_word: महाबाहुः mightyarmed, सः राघवः that Rama, अस्मात् from this, दुःखाम्बुसंशेधात् from this ocean of sorrow, यथा in such a way, तारयति will help to cross, त्वम् you, समाधातुम् tomake efforts, अर्हसि it is proper.

40_23.shloka: इमं च तीव्रं मम शोकवेगं रक्षोभिरेभिः परिभर्त्सनं च।ब्रूयास्तु रामस्य गतस्समीपम् शिवश्च तेऽध्वाऽस्तु हरिप्रवीर।।5.40.24।।
40_23.translation: "Foremost vanara tell Rama about my intense grief as well as the threats of the demons. May your journey be happy.
40_23.word_by_word: हरिप्रवीर foremost vanara, रामस्य to Rama, समीपम् near, गतः after going, मम my, इमम् this, तीव्रम् intense, शोकवेगम् of grief, एभिः by these, रक्षोभिः by the rakshasas, परिभर्त्सनं च threats also, ब्रूयाः you nararte, ते to you, अध्वा journey, शिवः happy, अस्तु let it be.

40_24.shloka: स राजपुत्र्य्राप्रतिवेदितार्थः कपिः कृतार्थः परिहृष्टचेताः।अल्पावशेषं प्रसमीक्ष्य कार्यं दिशं ह्युदीचीं मनसा जगाम।।5.40.25।।
40_24.translation: Hanuman understood the message of princess Sita and felt delighted at heart at his accomplishment. Considering the small task yet to be accomplished he reached the northern shore mentally (He thought of Rama who waited in Kishkinda which is in the northern direction).इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये सुन्दरकाण्डे चत्वारिंशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the fortieth sarga of Sundarakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
40_24.word_by_word: सः that, कपिः vanara, राजपुत्र्या by the princess, प्रतिवेदितार्थः understood the message, कृतार्थः accomplished, परिहृष्टचेताः delighted at heart, कार्यम् task, अल्पावशेषम् a small left over, प्रसमीक्ष्य after considering, उदीचीम् north, दिशम् direction, मनसा mentally, जगम reached.

41_1.shloka: [Hanuman decides to meet Ravana and measure his strength]स च वाग्भिः प्रशस्ताभिर्गमिष्यन्पूजितस्तया।तस्माद्देशादपक्रम्य चिन्तयामास वानरः।।5.41.1।।
41_1.translation: Having been honoured and praised by Sita's words, Hanuman prepared to depart from Sita's presence.
41_1.word_by_word: गमिष्यन् to depart, सः वानरः that vanara, तया by her, प्रशस्ताभिः with choicest, वाग्भिः with words, पूजितः honoured, तस्मात् from that, देशात् from location, अपक्रम्य moved, चिन्तयामास started thinking.

41_2.shloka: अल्पशेषमिदं कार्यं दृष्टेयमसितेक्षणा।त्रीनुपायानतिक्रम्य चतुर्थ: इह विद्यते।।5.41.2।।
41_2.word_by_word: इदं कार्यम् this work, अल्पशेषम् little more remains, इयम् this, असितेक्षणा blackeyed lady, दृष्टा seen, त्रीन् three expedientsnegotiation, presentation and, dissension (Sama, Dana, Bheda), उपायान् strategies, अतिक्रम्य crossing, इह here, चतुर्थ fourth (expedient) punishment (Danda), विद्यते remains.

41_3.shloka: न साम रक्षस्सु गुणाय कल्पते न दानमर्थोपचितेषु युज्यते।न भेदसाध्या बलदर्पिता जनाः पराक्रमस्त्वेव ममेह रोचते।।5.41.3।।
41_3.translation: 'With demons, negotiation is of no use. They are wealthy, they need no gifts. Proud of their stregth, the demons will not yield to dissension. I think only by using power it can be done.
41_3.word_by_word: रक्षस्सु with demons, साम negotiation, गुणाय for any merit, न कल्पते does not lead, अर्थोपचितेषु being wealthy, दानम् gifts, न युज्यते not proper, बलदर्पिताः proud of theirstrength, जनाः people, भेदसाध्याः will not yield by sowing seeds of dissension, न not, इह here, मम my, पराक्रमस्त्वेव only by valour, रोचते  pleases me.

41_4.shloka: न चास्य कार्यस्य पराक्रमादृते विनिश्चयः कश्चिदिहोपपद्यते।हतप्रवीरा हि रणे हि राक्षसाः कथञ्चिदीयुर्यदिहाद्य मार्दवम्।।5.41.4।।
41_4.translation: 'Other than power, there is no way to accomplish the task of ascertaining their strength. If I slay a few strong ogres somehow they may soften a little and yield.
41_4.word_by_word: इह here, अस्य of this, कार्यस्य of the task, पराक्रमात् ऋते other than power, विनिश्चयः a decision, कश्चित् even one, इह here, न उपपद्यते not hold good, यत् that, रणे in fight, हतप्रवीराः slay a few heroes, राक्षसाः ogres, अद्य to day, इह here, कथञ्चित् somehow, मार्दवम् soften, ईयुः will yield.

41_5.shloka: कार्ये कर्मणि निर्दिष्टे यो बहून्यपि साधयेत्।पूर्वकार्याविरोधेन स कार्यं कर्तुमर्हति।।5.41.5।।
41_5.translation: 'He, who can perform tasks in addition to the objective accomplished without affecting it, is really worthy.
41_5.word_by_word: कार्ये in a work to be accomplished, कर्मणि in a work, निर्दिष्टे when the work is entrusted, यः he who, पूर्वकार्याविरोधेन without affecting the earlier work, बहून्यपि many, साधयेत् will achieve, सः he, कार्यम् task, कर्तुम् to do, अर्हति is fit.

41_6.shloka: न ह्येकस्साधको हेतुस्स्वल्पस्यापीह कर्मणः।यो ह्यर्थं बहुधा वेद स समर्थोऽर्थसाधने।।5.41.6।।
41_6.translation: 'There are ways more than one even to perform a small work. And the capable know it.
41_6.word_by_word: इह here, स्वल्पस्य of a trivial task, अपि also, कर्मणः of the task, साधकः effective, हेतुः cause,एकः one, न हि is not, यः he who, अर्थम् as an object, बहुधा in many ways (means of doing), वेद knows, सः he, अर्थसाधने in achieving the task, समर्थः capable.

41_7.shloka: इहैव तावत्कृतनिश्चयो ह्यहं यदि व्रजेयं प्लवगेश्वरालयम्।परात्मसम्मर्दविशेषतत्त्ववित्ततः कृतं स्यान्मम भर्तृशासनम्।।5.41.7।।
41_7.translation: 'If I ascertain the difference in the strength of enemies and vanaras in war here itself and return to Kishkinda, the abode of vanaras, then I would have executed the orders of my lord properly.
41_7.word_by_word: अहम् I, इहैव here itself, तावत् therefore, परात्मसम्मर्दविशेषतत्त्ववित् by understanding the difference between the strength of enemy forces and our strength in war, प्लवगेश्वरालयम् abode of vanaras, व्रजेयं यदि if I go, ततः then, मम my, भर्तृशासनम् the orders of my lord, कृतम् executed, स्यात् well.

41_8.shloka: कथं नु खल्वद्य भवेत्सुखागतं प्रसह्य युद्धं मम राक्षसैः सह।तथैव खल्वात्मबलं च सारवत्सम्मानयेन्मां च रणे दशाननः।।5.41.8।।
41_8.translation: 'How can I have enduring war with the ogres today? How will my visit to this place end in happy return? Only in a combat this tenheaded Ravana will guage his strength and mine
41_8.word_by_word: अद्य today, मम for me, राक्षसैः सह with ogres, प्रसह्य enduring, युद्धम् war, कथं नु how to, सुखागतम् happy coming, भवेत् may be, तथैव in that way, आत्मबलं च our strength, सारवत् substantial, सः he, दशाननः च tenheaded Ravana's, माम् me, रणे in fight, मानयेत्  measure.

41_9.shloka: ततस्समासाद्य रणे दशाननं समन्त्रिवर्गं सबलप्रयायिनम्।हृदि स्थितं तस्य मतं बलं च वै सुखेन मत्त्वाऽहमितः पुनर्व्रजे।।5.41.9।।
41_9.translation: 'I can return happily only after I gauge the tenheaded Ravana's army in war, his strength, his companions including the ministers and his mind.
41_9.word_by_word: ततः thereafter, समन्त्रिवर्गम् along with the ministers, सबलप्रयायिनम् and army chiefs marching forward, दशाननम् tenheaded Ravana, रणे in war, समासाद्य after finding out, तस्य his, हृदि in his mind, स्थितम् established, मतम् feeling, बलं च वै strength, मत्त्वा knowing, अहम् I, इतः from here, सुखेन happily, पुनः again, व्रजे can go.

41_10.translation: 'This Ashoka garden of Ravana filled with different kinds of trees and creepers is a feast to the eyes and mind. It is an excellent garden like the Nandana  garden of Indra.
41_10.word_by_word: नृशंसस्य wicked Ravana's, अस्य his, इदम् this (Ashoka garden), नेत्रमनःकान्तम् feast to the eyes and mind, नानाद्रुमलतायुतम् filled with different kinds of trees and creepers, उत्तमम् excellent, वनम् garden, नन्दनोपमम् like the Nandana garden of Indra.

41_11.shloka: इदं विध्वंसयिष्यामि शुष्कं वनमिवानलः।अस्मिन्भग्ने ततः कोपं करिष्यति दशाननः।।5.41.11।।
41_11.translation: 'I will devastate this garden, just as fire destroys a dried up forest. This will enrage Ravana.
41_11.word_by_word: शुष्कम् dried up, वनम् forest, अनलः इव like fire, इदम् this, विध्वंसयिष्यामि will destroy, अस्मिन् when this, भग्ने devastate, ततः then, दशाननः Ravana, कोपम्  anger, करिष्यति will exhibit.

41_12.shloka: ततो महत्साश्वमहारथद्विपं बलं समादेक्ष्यति राक्षसाधिपः।त्रिशूलकालायसपट्टिसायुधं ततो महद्युद्धमिदं भविष्यति।।5.41.12।।
41_12.translation: 'Then the demon king will order the horses, chariots and elephants and army equipped with tridents and spears to march against me. A great war will take place.
41_12.word_by_word: ततः then, राक्षसाधिपः king of ogres, साश्वमहारथद्विपम् with horses, chariots and elephants, महत् great, त्रिशूलकालायसपट्टिसायुधम् armed with tridents, black iron spears, बलम् army,समादेक्ष्यति will order, ततः then, इदम् this, महत् great, युद्धम् war, भविष्यति will take place.

41_13.shloka: अहं तु तैः संयति चण्डविक्रमै स्समेत्य रक्षोभिरसह्य विक्रमः।निहत्य तद्रावणचोदितं बलं सुखं गमिष्यामि कपीश्वरालयम्।।5.41.13।।
41_13.translation: 'I will fight with the ogres sent by Ravana, endowed with fierce strength and irresistible valour. After destroying their army I will go to the abode of vanaras happily'.
41_13.word_by_word: अहं तु I on my part, चण्डविक्रमैः with those endowed with fierce strength, तैः with them, रक्षोभिः by demons, संयति in fight, समेत्य colliding, असह्यविक्रमः irresistible valour, रावणचोदितम् sent by Ravana, तत् that, बलम् army, निहत्य after destroying, सुखम् happily, कपीश्वरालयम् to the abode of vanaras, गमिष्यामि I will go.

41_14.translation: Furious Maruti endowed with fierce valour started uprooting the trees with the speed sprung from his thighs like the Windgod.
41_14.word_by_word: ततः then, भीमविक्रमः a vanara of fierce valour, मारुतिः Maruti, क्रुद्धः furious one, अथ and then, महता with great, ऊरुवेगेन with speed sprung from his thighs, मारुतवत् like the Windgod, द्रुमान् trees, क्षेप्तुम् to uproot, आरभत् started.

41_15.translation: Then Hanuman felled a variety of trees and vines inhabited by intoxicated birds in the beautiful garden meant for womenfolk.
41_15.word_by_word: ततः then, वीरः hero, हनुमान् Hanuman, मत्तद्विजसमाघुष्टम् filled with intoxicated birds, नानाद्रुमलतायुतम् with variety of trees and vines, प्रमदावनम् garden grown for women folk, बभञ्ज felled.

41_16.translation: That garden looked ugly with uprooted trees, breached ponds and powdered mountain peaks.
41_16.word_by_word: तत् वनम् that garden, मथितैः with destroyed, वृक्षैः trees, भिन्नैः with breached, सलिलाशयैः ponds, चूर्णितैः powdered, पर्वताग्रैश्च mountain peaks, अप्रियदर्शनम् unpleasant appearance, बभूव remained.

41_17.shloka: नानाशकुन्तविरुतैः प्रभिन्नैस्सलिलाशयैः।ताम्रैः किसलयैः क्लान्तै: क्लान्तद्रुमलतायुतम्।।5.41.17।।न बभौ तद्वनं तत्र दावानलहतं यथा।व्याकुलावरणा रेजुर्विह्वला इव ता लताः।।5.41.18।।
41_17.translation: Vines and trees wilted, birds shrieking, the embankments of ponds destroyed, its tender coppery red shoots withered, the garden looked as though it is burnt by forest fire and the climbers looked like women shivering in fear with their robes disarrayed.
41_17.word_by_word: कलान्तद्रुमलतायुतम् with wilted vines and trees, तत् वनम् that garden, नानाशकुन्तविरुतैः with birds shrieking with different kinds of sounds, प्रभिन्नैः with smashed, सलिलाशयैः with ponds of water, क्लान्तै: withered, ताम्रैः with red ones only, किसलयैः with tender shoots, दावानलहतंरणाः like burntin forest fire, ताः लताः those climbers, विह्वलाः इव like women with their robes disarrayed, रेजुः trembling in fear.

41_18.shloka: लतागृहैश्चित्रगृहैश्च नाशितैर्महोरगैर्व्यालमृगैश्च निर्धुतैः।शिलागृहैरुन्मथितैस्तथा गृहैः प्रणष्टरूपं तदभून्महद्वनम्।।5.41.19।।
41_18.translation: The great garden lay disfigured, with the arbours and the picture galleries ruined, huge serpents and wild animals scattered, with stone houses and sheds destroyed.
41_18.word_by_word: महत् great, तत् वनम् that garden, नाशितैः ruined, लतागृहैः arbours, चित्रगृहैः picture galleries, निर्धुतैः destroyed, महोरगैः huge serpents, व्यालमृगैश्च and even with wild animals, तथा in the same manner, उन्मथितैः scattered, शिलागृहैः stone houses, गृहैः with houses, प्रणष्टरूपम् disfigured, अभूत् became.

41_19.shloka: सा विह्वलाऽशोकलताप्रताना वनस्थली शोकलताप्रताना।जाता दशास्यप्रमदावनस्य कपेर्बलाद्धि प्रमदावनस्य।।5.41.20।।
41_19.translation: The pleasuregarden of Ravana appeared as though it was spreading the creepers of sorrow, since it was totally destroyed by the monkey who had set out to protect a woman. प्रमदावनस्य  of the pleasure garden, प्रमदाअवनस्य of the hero who came to protect a lady.
41_19.word_by_word: दशास्यप्रमदावनस्य of that pleasure garden of the tenheaded Ravana, प्रमदावनस्य कपेः with the strength of the monkey who had set out to protect a lady (Sita), सा वनस्थली that garden, बलात् by force, विह्वला destroyed, शोकलताप्रताना was spreading out creepers of sorrow, जाता appeared.

41_20.shloka: स तस्य कृत्वार्थपतेर्महाकपिर्महद्व्यलीकं मनसो महात्मनः।युयुत्सुरेको बहुभिर्महाबलैश्शिया ज्वलंस्तोरणमास्थितः कपिः।।5.41.21।।
41_20.translation: The great vanara having perpetrated mischief, rousing anger in the mind of the great lord of wealth, stood at the exit doorway ready to combat singlehanded with many warriors in that  mighty army blazing in glory.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये सुन्दरकाण्डे एकचत्वारिंशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the fortyfirst sarga of Sundarakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
41_20.word_by_word: सः महाकपिः that great vanara, महात्मनः of the great self, तस्य his, अर्थपतेः of the lord of wealth, मनसः in mind, महत् great, व्यलीकम् unpleasantness, कृत्वा having caused, महाबलैः mighty, बहुभिः many, एकः singlehanded, युयुत्सुः ready to fight, श्रिया blazing, ज्वलन् glowing, तोरणम् exit doorway, आस्थितः stood.

42_1.shloka: [Hanuman ruins Ashoka garden -- kills eighty thousand kinkaras]ततः पक्षिनिनादेन वृक्षभङ्गस्वनेन च।बभूवुस्त्राससम्भ्रान्तास्सर्वे लङ्कानिवासिनः।।5.42.1।।
42_1.translation: The residents of Lanka panicked at the shrieking sounds of birds and cracking sounds of trees.
42_1.word_by_word: ततः thereafter, पक्षिनिनादेन by the sounds of birds, वृक्षभङ्गस्वनेन by the cracking sound of trees, सर्वे all, लङ्कानिवासिनः the residents of Lanka, त्राससम्भ्रान्ताः were panicked, बभूवुः became.

42_2.shloka: विद्रुताश्च भयत्रस्ता विनेदुर्मृगपक्षिणः।रक्षसां च निमित्तानि क्रूराणि प्रतिपेदिरे।।5.42.2।।
42_2.translation: The frightened beasts and birds ran and flew, screeching in all directions. Fierce portents appeared to the demons.
42_2.word_by_word: मृगपक्षिणः beasts and birds, विद्रुता: ran and flown away, भयत्रस्ताः became scared, विनेदुः screeching in all directions, रक्षसां च for the ogres, क्रूराणि fierce, निमित्तानि portents, प्रतिपेदिरे appeared.

42_3.shloka: ततो गतायां निद्रायां राक्षस्यो विकृताननाः।तद्वनं ददृशुर्भग्नं तं च वीरं महाकपिम्।।5.42.3।।
42_3.translation: Hideouslooking ogresses, awakened from sleep, saw the garden devastated by the heroic Vanara.
42_3.word_by_word: ततः then, विकृताननाः women of hideous faces, राक्षस्यः ogressses, निद्रायाम् in sleep, गतायाम् was awakened, भग्नम् devastated, तत् that, वनम् garden, वीरम् hero, तं महाकपिं च that great vanara, ददृशुः saw.

42_4.shloka: स ता दृष्ट्वा महाबाहुर्महासत्त्वो महाबलः।चकार सुमहद्रूपं राक्षसीनां भयावहम्।।5.42.4।।
42_4.translation: When the powerful, mighty and strongarmed Hanuman saw the ogresses he assumed a very huge form in order to strike terror in them.
