42_4.word_by_word: महाबाहुः strong armed one, महासत्त्वः a great hero, महाबलः mighty, सः he, Hanuman, ताः the women, दृष्ट्वा seeing, राक्षसीनाम् for the ogresses, भयावहम् to create fear, सुमहत् very huge, रूपम् form, चकार assumed.

42_5.shloka: ततस्तं गिरिसङ्काशमतिकायं महाबलम्।राक्षस्यो वानरं दृष्ट्वा पप्रच्छुर्जनकात्मजाम्।।5.42.5।।
42_5.translation: Then, seeing the huge body of the mighty vanara resembling a mountain the ogresses questioned Janaki about him.
42_5.word_by_word: ततः then, गिरिसङ्काशम् looking like a mountain, अतिकायम् of huge body, महाबलम्  mighty, तं वानरम् that vanara, दृष्ट्वा after seeing, राक्षस्यः ogresses, जनकात्मजाम् Janaki, पप्रच्छुः questioned.

42_6.shloka: कोऽयं कस्य कुतो वायं किं निमित्तमिहागतः।कथं त्वया सहानेन संवादः कृत इत्युत।।5.42.6।।
42_6.translation: "Who is he? By whom has he been sent? From where and why did he come here? What dialogue  did you have with him?
42_6.word_by_word: अयम् this person, कः who, कस्य whose, अयम् he, कुतः from where, किं निमित्तम् for what purpose, इह here, आगतः he has come, उत or, अनेन by him, त्वया सह with you, संवादः talk, कृतः  made.

42_7.shloka: आचक्ष्व नो विशालाक्षि मा भूत्ते सुभगे भयम्।संवादमसितापाङ्गे त्वया किं कृतवानयम्।।5.42.7।।
42_7.translation: "O lovely, largeeyed lady O auspicious one have no fear. What conversation did he have with you? Tell us".
42_7.word_by_word: विशालाक्षि largeeyed lady, नः to us, आचक्ष्व O you may tell, सुभगे O auspicious one, ते to you, भयम् fear, मा भूत् let there be none, असितापाङ्गे O lady with dark sideglances, अयम् this, त्वया with you, किम् what, संवादम् dialogue, कृतवान् he had.

42_8.shloka: अथाब्रवीन्महासाध्वी सीता सर्वाङ्गसुन्दरी।रक्षसां भीमरूपाणां विज्ञाने मम का गतिः।।5.42.8।।
42_8.translation: Chaste and beautiful Sita said, "How do I know about the ogresses who assume many fierce forms?"
42_8.word_by_word: अथ then, महासाध्वी a chaste lady, सर्वाङ्गसुन्दरी a lady of beautiful limbs, सीता Sita, तदा then, अब्रवीत् said, भीमरूपाणाम् of fierce form, रक्षसाम् of ogresses, विज्ञाने in knowing, गतिः direction, मम to me, का what?

42_9.shloka: यूयमेवाभिजानीत योऽयं यद्वा करिष्यति।अहिरेव ह्यहेः पादान्विजानाति न संशयः।।5.42.9।।
42_9.translation: "You alone can know about who he is and what he is about. A serpent alone knows the movement (footprints) of another serpent. There is no doubt about it.
42_9.word_by_word: अयम् this, यः whoever, यद्वा what, करिष्यति he is about, यूयमेव you alone, अभिजानीत you may find out, अहेः of a serpent, पादान् feet, अहिरेव a serpent alone, विजानाति  knows, संशयः doubt, न no.

42_10.shloka: अहमप्यस्य भीतास्मि नैनं जानामि को न्वयं।वेद्मि राक्षसमेवैनं कामरूपिणमागतम्।।5.42.10।।
42_10.translation: "I am also scared of him. I do not know who he is. I think he is a demon, who came here assuming a form of his choice.
42_10.word_by_word: अहमपि I am also, अस्य at him, भीता अस्मि I am scared of,  एनम् him, को नु who he is, अयम् this person, न जानामि I do not know, एनम् him, आगतम् came, कामरूपिणम् who has assumed his desired form in various ways, राक्षसमेव demon only, वेद्मि I think.

42_11.shloka: वैदेह्या वचनं श्रुत्वा राक्षस्यो विद्रुता दिशः।स्थिताः काश्चिद्गताः काश्चिद्रावणाय निवेदितुम्।।5.42.11।।
42_11.translation: LIstening to Vaidehi's words the ogresses divided themselves and fled in all directions. While some stood there, others went to report to Ravana.
42_11.word_by_word: वैदेह्याः Vaidehi's, वचनम् words, श्रुत्वा after listening to, राक्षस्यः ogresses, दिशः in all directions, विद्रुताः ran, काश्चित् some, स्थिताः stood there, काश्चित् some, रावणाय to Ravana, निवेदितुम् to report, गताः fled.

42_12.shloka: रावणस्य समीपे तु राक्षस्यो विकृताननाः।विरूपं वानरं भीममाख्यातुमुपचक्रमुः।।5.42.12।।
42_12.translation: The uglyfaced ogresses went to the presence of Ravana and reported about the frightening form of the vanara.
42_12.word_by_word: विकृताननाः uglyfaced, राक्षस्यः shedemons, रावणस्य to Ravana, समीपे presence, विरूपम्  disfigured, भीमम् frightening, वानरम् vanara, आख्यातुम् to report, उपचक्रमुः started.

42_13.translation: "Your majesty an extremely powerful and frightening Vanara had a dialogue with Sita. He is stationed in the midst of Ashoka garden.
42_13.word_by_word: राजन् O king, सीतया with Sita, कृतसंवादः had a dialogue, भीमवपुः fearsome figure, अमितविक्रमः very powerful, कपिः vanara, अशोकवनिकामध्ये in the midst of Ashoka garden, तिष्ठति is stationed.

42_14.shloka: न च तं जानकी सीता हरिं हरिणलोचना।अस्माभिर्बहुधा पृष्टा निवेदयितुमिच्छति।।5.42.14।।
42_14.translation: "The deereyed Sita is not willing to disclose to us his identity even when we questioned her.
42_14.word_by_word: हरिणलोचना deereyed, जानकी Janaki, सीता Sita, अस्माभिः by us, पृष्टा questioned, तम् about him, निवेदयितुम् to disclose, न इच्छति not willing.

42_15.shloka: वासवस्य भवेद्दूतो दूतो वैश्रवणस्य वा।प्रेषितो वापि रामेण सीतान्वेषणकाङ्क्षया।।5.42.15।।
42_15.translation: "He may be an envoy of Indra or Kubera or of Rama sent with an intent to trace Sita.
42_15.word_by_word: वासवस्य Vasava's, दूतः envoy, वैश्रवणस्य Vaisravana's, दूतो वा is he an envoy, सीतान्वेषणकाङ्क्षया or one who has come to trace Sita, रामेण by Rama, प्रेषितो वापि or sent, भवेत् may be.

42_16.shloka: तेन त्वद्भुतरूपेण यत्तत्तव मनोहरम्।नानामृगगणाकीर्णं प्रमृष्टं प्रमदावनम्।।5.42.16।।
42_16.translation: "Your beautiful pleasure garden filled with a variety of beasts has been ruined by this wonderful figure.
42_16.word_by_word: अद्भुतरूपेण by a person of wonderful form, तेन  by him, मनोहरम् delightful, नानामृगगणाकीर्णम् filled with various kinds of animals, यत् such, तव your, प्रमदावनम् beautiful pleasure garden, प्रमृष्टम् ruined.

42_17.shloka: न तत्र कश्चिदुद्देशो यस्तेन न विनाशितः।यत्र सा जानकी सीता स तेन न विनाशितः।।5.42.17।।
42_17.translation: There is not a single place that has not been ruined by him there. Only the place where Janaka's daughter, Sita is resting has not been touched.
42_17.word_by_word: तेन by him, यः whichever, न विनाशितः not ruined, उद्देशः place, तत्र there, कश्चित् even one, न not, सा that, जानकी Janaki, सीता Sita, यत्र wherever, सः that place, तेन by him, न विनाशितः not ruined.

42_18.shloka: जानकीरक्षणार्थं वा श्रमाद्वा नोपलभ्यते।अथवा कश्श्रमस्तस्य सैव तेनाभिरक्षिता।।5.42.18।।
42_18.translation: "It is not clear whether he spared that place for protecting Janakai or he stopped due to exhaustion. What is fatigue for him? It must be to save her that she is spared by him.
42_18.word_by_word: जानकीरक्षणार्थं वा is it to protect Janaki, श्रमाद्वा or is it because he was tired, नोपलभ्यते we are not able to understand, अथवा or else, तस्य his, श्रमः tiresomeness, कः what, तेन by him, सैव she alone, अभिरक्षिता is spared.

42_19.shloka: चारुपल्लवपुष्पाढ्यं यं सीता स्वयमास्थिता।प्रवृद्धश्शिंशुपावृक्ष स्स च तेनाभिरक्षितः।।5.42.19।।
42_19.translation: "He has spared the simsupa tree with lovely, tender leaves and flowers which is a chosen  resort by Sita.
42_19.word_by_word: सीता Sita, चारुपल्लवपुष्पाढ्यम् a tree with lovely tender leaves and flowers, यम् whom, स्वयम् personally, आस्थिता she resorted, सः that, प्रवृद्धः large, शिंशुपावृक्षः simsupa tree, तेन by him, अभिरक्षितः is saved from destruction.

42_20.shloka: तस्योग्ररूपस्योग्र त्वं दण्डमाज्ञातुमर्हसि।सीता सम्भाषिता येन तद्वनं च विनाशितम्।।5.42.20।।
42_20.translation: "Your highness should take severe action on that person of fierce appearance with whom Sita dared to speak, and by whom the garden is ruined.
42_20.word_by_word: येन whomsoever, सीता Sita, सम्भाषिता had dialogue, तत् वनं च that garden also, विनाशितम् has been ruined, तस्य his, उग्ररूपस्य of a fierce form, त्वम् you, उग्रम् severe, दण्डम् punishment, आज्ञातुम् to order, अर्हसि is proper

42_21.shloka: मनः परिगृहीतां तां तव रक्षोगणेश्वर।कस्सीतामभिभाषेत यो न स्यात्त्यक्तजीवितः।।5.42.21।।
42_21.translation: "O lord of the demon clan Who dares to talk to Sita if he has not given up all hope of life, since she is desired by you".
42_21.word_by_word: रक्षोगणेश्वर O lord of the demon clan, मनः परिगृहीताम् one who is desired by you, तां सीताम् that Sita, यः whoever, त्यक्तजीवितः given up hope of life, न स्यात् if not, कः who, अभिभाषेत he will dare to talk.

42_22.shloka: राक्षसीनां वचश्त्रुत्वा रावणो राक्षसेश्वरः।हुताग्निरिव जज्वाल कोपसंवर्तितेक्षणः।।5.42.22।।
42_22.translation: On listening to the report of the ogresses, Ravana, the lord of demons flared up like blazing flame of a sacrificial fire, his eyeballs rolling in rage.
42_22.word_by_word: राक्षसेश्वरः lord of ogres, रावणः Ravana, राक्षसीनाम् shedemons, वचः words, श्रुत्वा after hearing, कोपसंवर्तितेक्षणः his eyeballs rolling in anger, हुताग्निरिव like sacrificial fire into which offering is made,जज्वाल flared.

42_23.shloka: तस्य क्रुद्धस्य नेत्राभ्यां प्रापतन्नास्रबिन्दवः।दीप्ताभ्यामिव दीपाभ्यां सार्चिष स्स्नेहबिन्दवः।।5.42.23।।
42_23.translation: From his angry eyes fell down drops of tears just as burning drops of oil drip from two burning lamps.
42_23.word_by_word: क्रुद्धस्य of the angry, तस्य his, नेत्राभ्याम् from both the eyes, दीप्ताभ्याम् burning ones, दीपाभ्याम् from two lamps, सार्चिषः with flames, स्नेहबिन्दवः इव like drops of oil, अस्रबिन्दवः drops of tears, प्रापतन् fell down.

42_24.translation: Then powerful Ravana commanded heroic demons called kinkaras who vied in strength to catch Hanuman.
42_24.word_by_word: महातेजाः powerful, हनूमतः Hanuman's, निग्रहार्थम् to catch, आत्मनः his, सदृशान् equals, शूरान् heroes, किङ्करान्नाम called kinkaras, राक्षसान् demons, व्यादिदेश commanded.

42_25.shloka: तेषामशीतिसाहस्रं किङ्कराणां तरस्विनाम्।निर्ययुर्भवनात्तस्मात्कूटमुद्गरपाणयः।।5.42.25।।महोदरा महादंष्ट्रा घोररूपा महाबलाः।युद्धाभिमनसस्सर्वे हनुमद्ग्रहणोद्यताः।।5.42.26।।
42_25.translation: Eighty thousand powerful  kinkaras (a clan of demons), largebellied, with large teeth and of dreadful appearance, swift in action, armed with hammers and clubs marched from there, resolved to capture Hanuman.
42_25.word_by_word: तरस्विनाम् of swiftmoving ones, तेषां किङ्कराणाम् of the kinkaras, अशीतिसाहस्रम् eighty thousand, महोदराः largebellied, महादंष्ट्राः largetoothed, घोररूपाः dreadfullooking, महाबलाः powerful, युद्धाभिमनसः ready to fight in war, सर्वे all, कूटमुद्गरपाणयः hammers and clubs, हनुमद्ग्रहणोद्यताः resolved to capture Hanuman, तस्मात् from that, भवनात् building, निर्ययुः came out.

42_26.shloka: ते कपीन्द्रं समासाद्य तोरणस्थमवस्थितम्।अभिपेतुर्महावेगाः पतङ्गा इव पावकम्।।5.42.27।।
42_26.translation: The kinkaras rushed towards the leader of vanaras who stood near the archway like the moths rushing towards the flame.
42_26.word_by_word: ते they, तोरणस्थम् near the archway, अवस्थितम् stood ready, कपीन्द्रम् leader of vanaras, समासाद्य having approached, महावेगाः swift ones, पतङ्गाः moths, पावकम् इव like rushing into the flame, अभिपेतुः rushed.

42_27.translation: They assailed Hanuman with iron maces, crowbars edged with gold and shining arrows resembling the Sun.
42_27.word_by_word: ते they, विचित्राभिः with wonderful ones, गदाभिः with iron maces, काञ्चनाङ्गदैः edged with gold, परिघैः with crowbars, आदित्यसन्निभैः resembling the Sun, शरैश्च with arrows, वानरश्रेष्ठम् best of vanaras, आजघ्नुः assailed.

42_28.shloka: मुद्गरैः पट्टिशैश्शूलैः प्रासतोमरशक्तिभिः।परिवार्य हनूमन्तं सहसा तस्थुरग्रतः।।5.42.29।।
42_28.translation: They quickly surrounded Hanuman and stood with hammers, sharpedged spears, tridents, barbed missiles and powerful javelins.
42_28.word_by_word: मुद्गरैः with hammers, पट्टि with sharpedged spears, शूलैः with tridents, प्रासतोमरशक्तिभिः with barbed missiles and powerful javelins, सहसा at once, हनूमन्तम् Hanuman, परिवार्य surrounded, अग्रतः in front of him, तस्थुः stood.

42_29.shloka: हनुमानपि तेजस्वी श्रीमान्पर्वतसन्निभः।क्षितावाविध्य लाङ्गूलं ननाद च महास्वनम्।।5.42.30।।
42_29.translation: Gigantic Hanuman, illustrious and brilliant, roared and waved his tail striking it with force on the ground causing loud sound.
42_29.word_by_word: तेजस्वी brilliant, श्रीमान् illustrious one, पर्वतसन्निभः resembling a mountain, हनुमानपि Hanuman also, लाङ्गूलम् tail, क्षितौ on the ground, आविध्य waved, महास्वनम् causing loud sound, ननाद च roared.

42_30.shloka: स भूत्वा सुमहाकायो हनुमान्मारुतात्मजः।धृष्टमास्फोटयामास लङ्कां शब्देन पूरयन्।।5.42.31।।
42_30.translation: Hanuman, son of Maruti, enlarged his body to a huge size and patted himself wildly  making loud noise that echoed the entire Lanka.
42_30.word_by_word: मारुतात्मजः Maruti's son, सः हनुमान् that Hanuman, सुमहाकायः with a huge body, भूत्वा assuming, शब्देन by the sound, लङ्काम् entire Lanka, पूरयन् echoed, धृष्टम् wildly, अस्फोटयामास patted.

42_31.translation: By the highly frightening sound caused by Hanuman patting, the birds from the sky fell down making a loud noise and Hanuman proclaimed in a loud voice as follows:
42_31.word_by_word: सानुनादिना by the frightening echoing sound, महता with great, तस्य his, अस्फोटितशब्देन by the sound of the patting, विहङ्गाः birds, गगनात् from the sky, पेतुः fell down, उच्चैः with a loud noise, इदम् thus, अघोषयत् च proclaimed.

42_32.shloka: जयत्यतिबलो रामो लक्ष्मणश्च महाबलः।राजा जयति सुग्रीवो राघवेणाभिपालितः।।5.42.33।।
42_32.translation: "Victory to Rama, the mighty and powerful, Victory to Lakshmana. Victory to king Sugriva who is ruled by Rama."
42_32.word_by_word: अतिबलः mighty, रामः Rama, जयति is victorious, महाबलः powerful, लक्ष्मणश्च Lakshmana also, राघवेण by Rama, अभिपालितः ruled, राजा king, सुग्रीवः Sugriva, जयति is victorious.

42_33.translation: "I, son of the Windgod, destroyer of hostile armies, am a servant of Rama, the lord of Kosala kingdom, a man of unwearied action.
42_33.word_by_word: शत्रुसैन्यानाम् of the enemy army, निहन्ता killer, मारुतात्मजः son of the Windgod, हनुमान् Hanuman, अहम् I am, कोसलेन्द्रस्य of the lord of Kosala kingdom, अक्लिष्टकर्मणः a man of unwearied action, रामस्य Rama's, दासः servant.

42_34.shloka: न रावणसहस्रं मे युद्धे प्रतिबलं भवेत्।शिलाभिस्तु प्रहरतः पादपैश्च सहस्रशः।।5.42.35।।
42_34.translation: Even a thousand Ravanas will not match me in strength when I pound stones and trees in a thousand ways.
42_34.word_by_word: सहस्रशः a thousand ways, शिलाभिः with stones, पादपैश्च with even trees, प्रहरतः while I pound, मे to me, युद्धे in war, रावणसहस्रम् a thousand Ravanas, प्रतिबलम् match in strength, न भवेत् will not.

42_35.shloka: अर्दयित्वा पुरीं लङ्कामभिवाद्य च मैथिलीम्।समृद्धार्थो गमिष्यामि मिषतां सर्वरक्षसाम्।।5.42.36।।
42_35.translation: "I shall destroy the city of Lanka and pay my respects to Mythili right under the nose of all demons. I will return with my purpose accomplished.
42_35.word_by_word: सर्वरक्षसाम् all ogres, मिषताम् as they gaze, लङ्कां पुरीम् city of Lanka, अर्दयित्वा shall destroy, मैथिलीम् to Mythili, अभिवाद्य च and pay respects, समृद्धार्थः having accomplished my purpose, गमिष्यामि I will return.

42_36.translation: Terrified on hearing the roar, the kinkaras looked at the towering Hanuman who seemed like a cloud in twilight (red in colour).
42_36.word_by_word: ते they, तस्य his, सन्नादशब्देन with the sound of hearing, भयशङ्किता: errified, अभवन् seemed, सन्ध्यामेघमिव like a cloud in twilight, उन्नतम् towering, हनूमन्तम् Hanuman, ददृशुश्च saw.

42_37.translation: Obeying their king's commnad, putting aside their fear, the kinkaras freely attacked the vanara  from all directions with dreadful weapons.
42_37.word_by_word: ततः then, ते they, राक्षसाः demons, स्वामिसन्देशनिःशङ्का: on account the king's command putting aside their fear, चित्रैः with dreadful, प्रहरणैः with weapons, कपिम् the vanara, अभिपेतुः attacked him.

42_38.shloka: स तैः परिवृतश्शूरैस्सर्वतस्सुमहाबलः।आससादाऽयसं भीमं परिघं तोरणाश्रितम्।।5.42.39।।
42_38.translation: Extremely powerful Hanuman surrounded by heroes all over, on his part went to the archway and picked up a terrific iron beam.
42_38.word_by_word: सुमहाबलः exceesively powerful one, सः he, Hanuman, शूरैः with heroes, तैः with those, सर्वतः all over, परिवृतः surrounded, तोरणाश्रितम् near the  archway, भीमम् terrific, आयसम् a weapon made of iron, परिघम् iron beam, आससाद picked up.

42_39.shloka: स तं परिघमादाय जघान रजनीचरान्।स पन्नगमिवादाय स्फुरन्तं विनतासुतः।।5.42.40।।विचचाराम्बरे वीरः परिगृह्य च मारुतिः।
42_39.translation: Hanuman, the mighty hero, seized the iron beam and struck the kinkaras, just as Garuda, the son of Vinata shoots up a struggling serpent and starts taking strides in the sky with the weapon in his hand (like Indra with his thunderbolt did with demons).
42_39.word_by_word: सः he, तं परिघम् that iron beam, आदाय took hold, रजनीचरान् nightrangers, जघान struck them, वीरः hero, सः मारुतिः that Maruti, विनतासुतः just as Vinatha's son, स्फुरन्तम् shoots, पन्नगम् serpent, आदाय seized, परिगृह्य took hold, अम्बरे in the sky, विचचार started moving.

42_40.translation: The great Windgod's son killed the kinkaras, and returned to the archway desiring further combat.
42_40.word_by_word: वीरः hero, सः मारुतात्मजः that Windgod's son, वीरान् heroes, किङ्करान् kinkaras, राक्षसान् ogres, हत्वा having killed, पुनः again, युद्धाकाङ्क्षी desiring further combat, तोरणम् archway, समुपाश्रितः reached.

42_41.translation: Then a few surviving ogres took to their heels after getting over that shock and reported to Ravana of the destruction of the kinkaras in the combat
42_41.word_by_word: ततः then, तत्र that, तस्मात् from fear, भयात् out of fear, मुक्ताः relieved, कतिचित् some, राक्षसाः ogres, सर्वान् all, किङ्करान् kinkaras, निहतान् killed, रावणाय to Ravana, न्यवेदयन् reported.

42_42.shloka: स राक्षसानां निहतं महद्बलं निशम्य राजा परिवृत्तलोचनः।समादिदेशाप्रतिमं पराक्रमे प्रहस्तपुत्रं समरे सुदुर्जयम्।।5.42.43।।
42_42.translation: The mighty demon king having heard about the killing of the formidable army of ogres, his eyes rolling in rage, commanded the son of Prahasta, who is difficult to conquer and matchless in war.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये सुन्दरकाण्डे द्विचत्वारिंशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the fortysecond sarga of Sundarakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
42_42.word_by_word: स he, राजा king, राक्षसानाम् of ogres, महत् mighty, बलम् army, निहतम् killed, निशम्य after hearing, परिवृत्तलोचनः with his eyes rolling, पराक्रमे in valour, अप्रतिमम् matchless, समरे in war, सुदुर्जयम् difficult to conquer, प्रहस्तपुत्रम् son of Prahasta, समादिदेश commanded.

43_1.shloka: [Hanuman destroys the demons in the palace]ततस्स किङ्करान्हत्वा हनुमान्ध्यानमास्थितः।वनं भग्नं मया चैत्यप्रासादो न विनाशितः।।5.43.1।।तस्मात्प्रासादमप्येवं भीमं विध्वंसयाम्यहं।इति सञ्चिन्त्य मनसा हनुमान्दर्शयन्बलम्।।5.43.2।।चैत्यप्रासादमाप्लुत्य मेरुशृङ्गमिवोन्नतम्।आरुरोह कपिश्रेष्ठो हनुमान्मारुतात्मजः।।5.43.3।।
43_1.translation: Having slain the kinkaras, Hanuman stood and reflected, ' I have ruined the garden and not the palatial buildings that are like temples (Chaityas)'. Then Hanuman, son of the Windgod, decided in his mind to show his strength and jumped on to the top of the palatial building that appeared like the peak of mount Meru.
43_1.word_by_word: ततः then, सः हनुमान् that Hanuman, किङ्करान् kinkaras, हत्त्वा having slain, ध्यानम् reflected, आस्थितः resumed, मया by me, वनम् garden, भग्नम् destroyed, चैत्यप्रासादः the Chaitya palace, न विनाशितः not ruined, तस्मात् therefore, अद्य now, अहम् I, भीमम् fearsome, प्रासादम् building, एवम् in this way, विध्वंसयामि I will destroy, कपिश्रेष्ठः foremost of vanaras, मारुतात्मजः son of the Windgod, हनुमान् Hanuman, मनसा in his mind, इति thus, सञ्चिन्त्य thinking, बलम् strength, दर्शयन्  showed, मेरुशृङ्गमिव like the peak of mount Meru, उन्नतम् tall, चैत्यप्रासादम् Chaitya palace, उत्ल्पुत्य jumped, आरुरोह climbed

43_2.shloka: आरुह्य गिरिसङ्काशं प्रासादं हरियूथपः।बभौ स सुमहातेजाः प्रतिसूर्य इवोदितः।।5.43.4।।
43_2.translation: The powerful vanara leader climbed the tall, palatial building which resembled a mountain. He looked like another Sun, just risen.
43_2.word_by_word: हरियूथपः vanara leader, सुमहातेजाः brilliant, सः he, गिरिसङ्काशम् resembling a mountain, प्रासादम् palace, आरुह्य after climbing, उदितः rising, प्रतिसूर्यः इव like another Sun, बभौlooked

43_3.translation: Having destroyed the fine palace building, the indomitable Hanuman was blazing with glory like the mountain Pariyatra. (one of the seven Kula mountains viz., Mahendra, Malaya, Sahya, Shuktiman, Riksha, Vindhya and Pariyatra)
43_3.word_by_word: हनुमान् Hanuman, दुर्धर्षम् indomitable, उत्तमम् fine, चैत्यप्रासादम् palace building, सम्प्रधृष्य च  having surrounded लक्ष्म्या with glory, प्रज्वलन् blazing, पारियात्रोपमः like mountain Pariyatra, अभवत् appeared

43_4.shloka: स भूत्वा सुमहाकायः प्रभावान्मारुतात्मजः।धृष्टमास्फोटयामास लङ्कां शब्देन पूरयन्।।5.43.6।।
43_4.translation: Hanuman heaved his body  huge  with his prowess and patted his arms loudly filling the city of Lanka with that terrible sound.
43_4.word_by_word: सः मारुतात्मजः that son of the Wind god, प्रभावात् by his prowess, सुमहाकायः of a huge body, भूत्वा being, शब्देन by the sound, लङ्काम् Lanka, पूरयन् while filling, धृष्टम् roughly, अस्फोटयामास started patting (his arms)

43_5.translation: By the deafening sound caused by the patting, the birds fell down and the guards of the palace lost consciousness.
43_5.word_by_word: तस्य by the, श्रोत्रघातिना by the deafening sound, महता with a loud, अस्फोटितशब्देन with the sound of patting, तत्र there, विहङ्गमाः birds, पेतुः fell down, चैत्यपालाश्च guards of the palace, मोहिताः lost consciousness.

43_6.shloka: अस्त्रविज्जयतां रामो लक्ष्मणश्च महाबलः।राजा जयति सुग्रीवो राघवेणाभिपालितः।।5.43.8।।
43_6.translation: 'May Sri Rama, unsurpassed in the use of missiles be victorious May his brother, mighty Lakshmana, a matchless warrior be victorious. May King Sugriva ruled by Rama be victorious.'
43_6.word_by_word: अस्त्रवित् knowledgeable about all missiles, रामः Rama, जयताम् be victorious, महाबलः matchless warrior, लक्ष्मणश्च Lakshmana also, राघवेण by Rama, अभिपालितः ruled, राजा king, सुग्रीवः Sugriva, जयति be victorious.

43_7.translation: 'I am the son of the Windgod, destroyer of enemy army. I am a servant of Rama, the king of Kosala who can accomplish any task with ease.
43_7.word_by_word: शत्रुसैन्यानाम् of enemy army, निहन्ता killer, मारुतात्मजः son of the Windgod, हनुमान् Hanuman, अहम् I, कोसलेन्द्रस्य king of Kosala's, अक्लिष्टकर्मणः one who can  acomplish any task with ease, रामस्य Rama's, दासः servant.

43_8.shloka: न रावणसहस्रं मे युद्धे प्रतिबलं भवेत्।शिलाभिस्तु प्रहरतः पादपैश्च सहस्रशः।।5.43.10।।
43_8.translation: 'Not even a thousand Ravanas can stand my might  in combat as I start assailing them with thousands of  rocks or even trees.
43_8.word_by_word: सहस्रशः in a thousand ways, शिलाभिः with rocks, पादपैश्च or even with trees, प्रहरतः hurling, मे to me, युद्धे in war, रावणसहस्रम् a thousand Ravanas, प्रतिबलम् match in might, तु also, न भवेत् not be.

43_9.shloka: अर्दयित्वा पुरीं लङ्कामभिवाद्य च मैथिलीम्।समृद्धार्थो गमिष्यामि मिषतां सर्वरक्षसाम्।।5.43.11।।
43_9.translation: 'I shall return only after accomplishing the destruction of the city of Lanka and offering obeisance to Sita, while all demons keep looking at me'.
43_9.word_by_word: सर्वरक्षसाम् of all ogres, मिषताम् they keep looking, लङ्कां पुरीम् city of Lanka, अर्थयित्वा destroying, मैथिलीम् Mythili, अभिवाद्य च offering obeisance, समृद्धार्थः having accomplished the task, गमिष्यामि return to.

43_10.translation: Having made proclamations that way from the top of the Vimana (palace) the monkey leader roared making terrific sound frightening the ogres.
43_10.word_by_word: हरियूथपः monkey leader, विमानस्थः standing on the vimana, चैत्यस्थान् of the palace, एवम् that way, उक्त्वा having said, भीमनिर्ह्रादः making terrific sound, रक्षसाम् to the ogres, भयम् fear, जनयन् while creating, ननाद roared.

43_11.shloka: तेन शब्देन महता चैत्यपालाश्शतं ययुः।गृहीत्वा विविधानस्त्रान्प्रासान्खङ्गान्परश्वथान्।।5.43.13।।विसृजन्तो महाकाया मारुतिं पर्यवारयन्।
43_11.translation: Hearing the terrific sound, a hundred gigantic guards of the palace set forth, holding different kinds of weapons like darts, swords and axes and hurled at Maruti surrounding him.
43_11.word_by_word: महता with terrific, तेन शब्देन by that sound, शतम् hundred, चैत्यपालाः guards of the palace, विविधान् many, अस्त्रान् weapons, प्रासान् darts, खङ्गान् swords, परश्वथान् axes, गृहीत्वा after picking, ययुः marked, महाकायाः those of huge bodies, विसृजन्तः hurling, मारुतिम् Maruti, पर्यवारयन् surrounded.

43_12.translation: Holding astonishing maces decorated with gold, iron crowbars and sharp arrows resembling the rays of the Sun the ogres hit Hanuman, the foremost of vanaras.
43_12.word_by_word: ते they, विचित्राभिः with astonishing, गदाभिः with maces, काञ्चनाङ्गदैः maces decorated with gold, परिघैः with crowbars, आदित्यसन्निभैः sharp like the Sun's rays, बाणैश्च with arrows, वानरश्रेष्ठम् foremost of vanaras, अजघ्नुः hit.

43_13.shloka: आवर्त इव गङ्गायास्तोयस्य विपुलो महान्।परिक्षिप्य हरिश्रेष्ठं स बभौ रक्षसां गणः।।5.43.15।।
43_13.translation: The demons surrounding the great monkey looked like a big whirlpool of the water of the river Ganga.
43_13.word_by_word: सः that, रक्षसां गणः horde of ogres, हरिश्रेष्ठम् best of vanaras, परिक्षिप्य having surrounded, गङ्गायाः of the river Ganga, तोयस्य of the water, महान् huge, विपुलः big, आवर्त इव like a whirlpool, बभौ looked.

43_14.shloka: ततो वातात्मजः क्रुद्धो भीम रूपं समास्थितः।।5.43.16।।प्रासादस्य महन्तस्य स्तम्बं हेमपरिष्कृतम्।उत्पाटयित्वा वेगेन हनुमान्पवनात्मजः।।5.43.17।।ततस्तं भ्रामयामास शतधारं महाबलः।
43_14.translation: Thereupon the infuriated son of the Windgod, assumed a fearsome form, uprooted a pillar of the palace decked with gold and holding that hundred edged pillar whirled it round swiftly.
43_14.word_by_word: ततः then, वातात्मज son of the Windgod, क्रुद्धः infuriated, भीमम् fearsome, रूपम् form, समास्थितः assumed, महान् great, पवनात्मजः son of the Windgod, महाबलः mighty, हनुमान् Hanuman, तस्य प्रासादस्य of that palace, हेमपरिष्कृतम् decked with gold, स्तम्भं pillar, उत्पाटयित्वा uprooted, ततः then, शतधारम् holding a hundred edged, तम् that, वेगेन swiftly, भ्रामयामास whirled round.

43_15.shloka: तत्र चाग्निस्समभवत्प्रासादश्चाप्यदह्यत।।5.43.18।।दह्यमानं ततो दृष्ट्वा प्रासादं हरियूथपः।स राक्षसशतं हत्त्वा वज्रेणेन्द्र इवासुरान्।।5.43.19।।अन्तरिक्षे स्थितश्श्तीमानिदं वचनमब्रवीत्।
43_15.translation: Thereafter fire was generated (through friction) and with if the palace blazed. Hanuman saw the palace burning. He killed a hundred demons there as Indra killed demons with his thunderbolt. (The whirling pillar that generated fire apeared like a thunderbolt) Later he stood in the air and proclaimed this:
43_15.word_by_word: तत्र thereafter, अग्नि: च and fire, समभवत् was created, प्रासादश्च the palace, अपि also, अदह्यत was burnt, ततः then, सः हरियूथपः Hanuman, दृष्ट्वा after seeing, इन्द्रः Indra, वज्रेण with a thunderbolt, असुरानिव like the ogres, राक्षसशतम् a hundred ogres, हत्त्वा having killed, श्रीमान् illustrous, अन्तरिक्षे in the aerial region, स्थितः stood, इदम् this, वचनम् word, अब्रवीत् proclaimed.

43_16.shloka: मादृशानां सहस्राणि विसृष्टानि महात्मनाम्।।5.43.20।।बलिनां वानरेन्द्राणां सुग्रीववशवर्तिनाम्।अटन्ति वसुधां कृत्स्नां वयमन्ये च वानराः।।5.43.21।।
43_16.translation: "Thousands of huge and mighty monkeys, equal to me, loyal to king Sugriva, are coming under the orders and have been recruited from the entire earth. They  are the best among monkeys.
43_16.word_by_word: महात्मनाम् huge, बलिनाम् of mighty, सुग्रीववशवर्तिनाम् of those loyal to Sugriva, मादृशानाम् ofpeople like me, वानरेन्द्राणाम् of the best of  vanara leaders, सहस्राणि in thousands, विसृष्टानि are despatched, वयम् we, अन्ये others, वानराश्च and vanaras, कृत्स्नाम् entire, वसुधाम् the earth, अटन्ति we are wandering.

43_17.translation: "Of them some have the strength equal to ten elephants, others are ten times stronger, and still others have a thousand elephants' strength.
43_17.word_by_word: केचित् some, दशनागबलाः have ten elephants strength, केचित् some, दशगुणोत्तराः ten hundred elephants strength, केचित् some, नागसहस्रस्य thousand elephants strength, तुल्यविक्रमाः equal in power, बभूवुः will be.

43_18.translation: "Some have the strength of flood waters, some are powerful as wind and yet others have strength beyond measure.
43_18.word_by_word: केचित् some, ओघबलाः strong as flood, सन्ति there are, केचित् some, वायुबलोपमाः have the power of wind, तत्र there, अन्ये others, हरियूथपाः leaders of monkeys, अप्रमेयबलाश्च of immeasureable strength, आसन् there are.

43_19.shloka: ईदृग्विधैस्तु हरिभिर्वृतो दन्तनखायुधैः।शतैश्शतसहस्रैश्च कोटीभिरयुतैरपि।।5.43.24।।आगमिष्यति सुग्रीवः सर्वेषां वो निषूदनः।
43_19.translation: "Sugriva will come here with hundreds of thousands of crores of vanaras who would be fighting with their teeth and nails as weapons.
43_19.word_by_word: ईद्दृग्विधैः endowed with such warriors, दन्त अपितु नखायुधै: by those using teeth and nails as weapons, शतैः in hundreds, अयुतैः in ayuta (ten thousand), शतसहस्रैः a hundred thousand, कोटीभिः in crores, हरिभिः with vanaras also, वृतः surrounded, सुग्रीवः Sugriva, सर्वेषाम् of all of them, वः you, निषूदनः killer, आगमिष्यति would come here.

43_20.shloka: नेयमस्ति पुरी लङ्का न यूयं न च रावणः।5.43.25।।यस्मादिक्ष्वाकुनाथेन बद्धं वैरं महात्मना।
43_20.translation: "You have established great enmity with the noble lord of Ikshvaku dynasty. Neither this Lanka will endure nor you, nor even Ravana will be traced.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये सुन्दरकाण्डे त्रिचत्वारिशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the fortythird sarga of Sundarakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
43_20.word_by_word: यस्मात् since, महात्मना with great self, इक्ष्वाकुनाथेन with the lord of Ikshvaku dynasty, वैरम् enmity, बद्धम् is bound, इयम् this, लङ्कापुरी city of Lanka, नास्ति will not be found, यूयम् even you, न not, रावणः च and Ravana, न also.

44_1.shloka: [Killing of Jambumali by Hanuman]सन्दिष्टो राक्षसेन्द्रेण प्रहस्तस्य सुतो बली।जम्बुमाली महादंष्ट्रो निर्जगाम धनुर्धरः।।5.44.1।।रक्तमाल्याम्बरधरस्स्रग्वी रुचिरकुण्डलः।महान्विवृत्तनयनश्चण्डस्समरदुर्जयः।।5.44.2।।धनुश्शक्रधनुः प्रख्यं महद्रुचिरसायकम्।विष्फारयाणो वेगेन वज्राशनिसमस्वनम्।।5.44.3।।
44_1.translation: Commanded  by the demon king, Jambumali the invincible son of Prahasta, who had large teeth in front, big rolling eyes, red flower garland, red robes and a chaplet with beautiful earrings. He went round twanging his producing thunderous sound. His arrows were huge, shining and beautiful.
44_1.word_by_word: महादंष्ट्रः one with big front teeth, धनुर्धरः bow in hand, रक्तमाल्याम्बरधरः adorned with a garland of red flowers and red clothes, स्रग्वी wearing a chaplet, रुचिरकुण्डलः with beautiful earrings, महान् great, विवृत्तनयनः who had big round eyes, चण्डः fierce, समरदुर्जयः  invincible in war, बली mighty, प्रहस्तस्य सुतः son of Prahasta,जम्बुमाली Jambumali,राक्षसेन्द्रेण by the demon king, सन्दिष्टः commanded, महत् huge, रुचिरसायकम् who had radiant arrows, वज्राशनिसमस्वनम् making sounds like thunderbolt, शक्रधनुःप्रख्यम् like Indra's splendid bow (a rainbow), धनुः bow, वेगेन very swiftly, विष्फारयाणः as if thundering, निर्जगाम went out.

44_2.shloka: तस्य विष्फारघोषेण धनुषो महता दिशः।प्रदिशश्च नभश्चैव सहसा समपूर्यत।।5.44.4।।
44_2.translation: All directions including the intermediate directions and the sky were filled with that loud sound produced by his twang.
44_2.word_by_word: तस्य his, धनुषः bow's, महता by the huge, विष्फारघोषेण by the twang, दिशः all directions,प्रदिशश्चैव and intermediate directions, नभश्चैव heavens also, सहसा at once, समपूर्यत were filled.

44_3.shloka: रथेन खरयुक्तेन तमागतमुदीक्ष्य सः।हनुमान्वेगसम्पन्नो जहर्ष च ननाद च।।5.44.5।।
44_3.translation: Seeing him coming in a chariot drawn by donkeys, Hanuman who was swift to act was glad (to have an opportunity to fight) and made a loud noise.
44_3.word_by_word: खरयुक्तेन drawn by donkeys, रथेन by the chariot, आगतम् reached, तम् him, उदीक्षय after seeing, सः हनुमान् that Hanuman, वेगसम्पन्नः who was endowed with speed, जहर्ष च felt glad, ननाद च and made a loud noise.

44_4.shloka: तं तोरणविटङ्कस्थं हनुमन्तं महाकपिम्।जम्बुमाली महाबाहुर्विव्याध निशितैश्शरैः।।5.44.6।।
44_4.translation: Strongarmed Jambumali with his sharp arrows hit great Hanuman who stood on top of the exit archway.
44_4.word_by_word: महाबाहुः strongarmed one, जम्बुमाली Jambumali, तोरणविटङ्कस्थम् who stood on top of the exit archway, महाकपिम् great monkey, तं हनुमन्तम् that Hanuman, निशितैः with sharp, शरैः with arrows, विव्याध hit hard.

44_5.shloka: अर्धचन्द्रेण वदने शिरस्येकेन कर्णिना।बाह्वोर्विव्याध नाराचैर्दशभिस्तं कपीश्वरम्।।5.44.7।।
44_5.translation: Jambumali released a crescentshaped arrow on the face, one earshaped (barbed) arrow on the head and ten iron arrows into the arms of the lord of monkeys.
44_5.word_by_word: अर्धचन्द्रेण with a crescentshaped arrow, वदने on the face, एकेन with one, कर्णिना ear shaped arrow, शिरसि on the head, दशभिः ten, नाराचैः iron arrows, बाह्वोः into the arms, तं कपीश्वरम् that lord of monkeys, विव्याध hit.

44_6.shloka: तस्य तच्छुशुभे ताम्रं शरेणाभिहतं मुखम्।शरदीवाम्बुजं फुल्लं विद्धं भास्कररश्मिना।।5.44.8।।
44_6.translation: His red face struck by an arrow appeared like a fullblown lotus in autumn season hit  by  the rays of the Sun.
44_6.word_by_word: शरेण by an arrow, अभिहतम् struck, ताम्रम् reddish, तत् his, मुखम् face, शरदि in autumn, भास्करश्मिना with Sun's radiance, विद्धम् hit, फुल्लम् blown, अम्बुजमिव like a lotus, शुशुभे appeared.

44_7.shloka: तत्तस्य रक्तं रक्तेन रञ्जितं शुशुभे मुखम्।यथाकाशे महापद्मं सिक्तं चन्दनबिन्दुभिः।।5.44.9।।
44_7.translation: His red face  stained with blood was glowing bright like red lotus in the sky sprinkled with drops of red sandal.
44_7.word_by_word: रक्तेन by blood, रञ्जितम् glowing, रक्तम् red, तस्य his, तत् that, मुखम् face, चन्दनबिन्दुभिः with sandal drops, सिक्तम् sprinkled, आकाशे in the sky, महापद्मं यथा like a great lotus, शुशुभे looked bright.

44_8.shloka: चुकोप बाणाभिहतो राक्षसस्य महाकपिः।ततः पार्श्वेऽतिविपुलां ददर्श महतीं शिलाम्।।5.44.10।।
44_8.translation: Struck by the shafts of the ogre, the great monkey was enraged and happened to seea huge,  heavy rock lying beside him on the ground.
44_8.word_by_word: बाणाभिहतः struck by the shafts, महाकपिः great monkey, राक्षसस्य of the demon, चुकोप enraged, ततः then, पार्श्वे lying beside, अतिविपुलाम् huge, महतीम् on the ground, शिलाम् rock, ददर्श he saw.

44_9.shloka: तरसा तां समुत्पाट्य चिक्षेप बलवद्भली।तां शरैर्दशभिः क्रुद्धस्ताडयामास राक्षसः।।5.44.11।।
44_9.translation: Powerful Hanuman with all vehemence lifted the rock and hurled it at the giant which he angrily smashed with ten arrows.
44_9.word_by_word: बली a powerful one, ताम् that boulder, तरसा with vehemence, समुत्पाट्य having lifted, बलवत् with his strength, चिक्षेप hurled, राक्षसः giant, क्रुद्धः angrily, ताम् that rock, दशभिः with ten, शरैः with arrows, ताडयामास smashed.

44_10.shloka: विपन्नं कर्म तद्दृष्ट्वा हनुमांश्चण्डविक्रमः।सालं विपुलमुत्पाट्य भ्रामयामास वीर्यवान्।।5.44.12।।
44_10.translation: Hanuman, a strong, powerful and fierce warrior pulled out a sala tree and whirled it. Seeing that his attempt has failed.
44_10.word_by_word: चण्डविक्रमः who had fierce power, वीर्यवान् a warrior, हनुमान् Hanuman, तत् that कर्म action, विपन्नम् failed, दृष्ट्वा seeing, विपुलम् huge, सालम् sala tree, उत्पाट्य pulled out, भ्रामयामास whirled.

44_11.shloka: भ्रामयन्तं कपिं दृष्ट्वा सालवृक्षं महाबलम्।चिक्षेप सुबहून्बाणान्जम्बुमाली महाबलः।।5.44.13।।
44_11.translation: Gigantic Jambumali seeing the mighty Hanuman whirling the sala tree fired many arrows at him.
44_11.word_by_word: महाबलः mighty, जम्बुमाली Jambumali, सालवृक्षम् sala tree, भ्रामयन्तम् after whirling, महाबलम् mighty, कपिम् monkey, दृष्ट्वा after seeing, सुबहून् many, बाणान् arrows, चिक्षेप fired.

44_12.shloka: सालं चतुर्भिश्चिच्छेद वानरं पञ्चभिर्भुजे।उरस्येकेन बाणेन दशभिस्तु स्तनान्तरे।।5.44.14।।
44_12.translation: He struck the sala tree with four arows, the arm of Hanuman with five arrows, chest with one, the hollow of the chest with ten more arrows.
44_12.word_by_word: सालम् sala tree, चतुर्भिः with four, चिच्छेद cut off, वानरम् vanara, पञ्चभिः with five, भुजे on his arm, उरसि on his chest, एकेन बाणेन with one arrow, स्तनान्तरे in the hollow of the chest, दशभिः with ten.

44_13.shloka: स शरैः पूरिततनु: क्रोधेन महता वृतः।तमेव परिघं गृह्य भ्रामयामास वेगितः।।5.44.15।।
44_13.translation: Hanuman filled with arrows all over his body, seized an iron spear (which he made use of in the initial battle) and impetuously spun it in  intense anger.
44_13.word_by_word: शरैः arrows, पूरिततनु: the body was filled, सः that, महता intense, क्रोधेन with anger, वृतः endowed, वेगितः speedily, तं परिघमेव the same iron spear, गृह्य seized, भ्रामयामास started whirling.

44_14.translation: Hanuman of immeasurable strength hurled the iron spear after turning it round and round at high speed on the broad chest of Jambumali.
44_14.word_by_word: बलोत्कटः of immeasurable strength, अतिवेगः a hero of great speed, परिघम् iron spear, अतिवेगेन with great speed, भ्रामयित्वा after turning round and round, जम्बुमालेः on Jambumali, महोरसि on the broad chest, पातयामास hurled.

44_15.shloka: तस्य चैव शिरो नास्ति न बाहू न च जानुनी।न धनुर्न रथो नाश्वास्तत्रादृश्यन्त नेषवः।।5.44.17।।
44_15.translation: Neither his head could be discerned nor his arms, knees, nor bow, chariot nor donkeys. Nothing was seen.
44_15.word_by_word: तत्र there, तस्य his, शिरः चैव even head, नास्ति not there, बाहू shoulders, न not, जानुनी knees, न not, धनुः bow, न not, रथः chariot, न not, अश्वाः donkeys, horses, नादृश्यन्तः not there to discern, इषवः न nothing was seen.

44_16.shloka: स हतस्सहसा तेन जम्बुमाली महाबलः।पपात निहतो भूमौ चूर्णिताङ्गविभूषणः।।5.44.18।।
44_16.translation: Mighty Jambumali killed  by that blow dropped down dead at once with his ornaments reduced to powder.
44_16.word_by_word: तेन by that blow, हतः killed, महाबलः mighty, जम्बुमाली Jambumali, सहसा inconsiderately, निहतः having been killed, चूर्णिताङ्गविभूषणः with his ornaments reduced to powder, भूमौ on the floor, पपात fell down.

44_17.shloka: जम्बुमालिं च निहतं किङ्करांश्च महाबलान्।चुक्रोध रावणश्शुत्वा कोपसंरक्तलोचनः।।5.44.19।।
44_17.translation: Ravana's eyes became bloodshot in anger when he heard about the death of Jambumali and of the strong army of kinkaras.
44_17.word_by_word: रावणः Ravana, जम्बुमालिं च even Jambumali, निहतम् being klled, महाबलान् of great strength, किंकरांश्च and kinkaras also, श्रुत्वा hearing, कोपसंरक्तलोचनः bloodshot eyes, चुक्रोध got enraged.

44_18.shloka: स रोषसंवर्तितताम्रलोचनः प्रहस्तपुत्त्रे निहते महाबले।अमात्यपुत्त्रानतिवीर्यविक्रमान् समादिदेशाशु निशाचरेश्वरः।।5.44.20।।
44_18.translation: When the mighty son of Prahasta was killed, infuriated Ravana, his eyes red and rolling, commanded the highly valiant sons of ministers.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये सुन्दरकाण्डे चतुश्चत्वारिंशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the fortyfourth sarga of Sundarakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
44_18.word_by_word: महाबले who had great strength, प्रहस्तपुत्त्रे Prahasta's son, निहते killed, सः निशाचरेश्वरः demon king, रोषसंवर्तितताम्रलोचनः his eyes red and rolling in anger, आशु quickly, अतिवीर्यविक्रमान् highly valiant wariors, अमात्यपुत्रान् sons of ministers, समादिदेश commanded.

45_1.shloka: [Hanuman kills the seven sons of Ravana's chief minister]ततस्ते राक्षसेन्द्रेण चोदिता मन्त्रिणस्सुताः।निर्ययुर्भवनात्तस्मात्सप्तसप्तार्चिवर्चसः।।5.45.1।।महाबलपरीवारा धनुष्मन्तो महाबलाः।कृतास्त्रास्त्रविदां श्रेष्ठाः परस्परजयैषिणः।।5.45.2।।हेमजालपरिक्षिप्तैर्ध्वजवद्भिः पताकिभिः।तोयदस्वननिर्घोषैर्वाजियुक्तैर्महारथैः।।5.45.3।।तप्तकाञ्चनचित्राणि चापान्यमितविक्रमाः।विस्फारयन्तस्संहृष्टास्तटित्वन्त इवाम्बुदाः।।5.45.4।।
45_1.translation: Commanded by Ravana, the seven sons of minister blazing like fire followed by large army of experts in archery, possessing great valour, armed with weapons, being distinguished wielders of weapons, skilled in the use of weapons, who were equally capable of conquering each other sallied forth gladly to fight with Hanuman. They drove chariots yoked with horses which were decked with golden mesh, holding totem staffs (a figure engraved to identify a hero) and flags, neighing like clouds. The valiantheroes were sporting and making sounds like stormy  clouds wielding wonderful bows glittering like molten gold, shining like lightning. As they marched from the palace they looked like  stormy clouds accompanied by lightning.
45_1.word_by_word: ततः then, सप्तार्चिवर्चसः energetic like fire, महाबलपरीवाराः endowed with great army, धनुष्मन्तः experts in archery, महाबलाः mighty, कृतास्त्राः अस्त्रविदाम् distinguished wielders of weapons, श्रेष्ठाः foremost, परस्परजयैषिणः wished to conquer each other, अमितविक्रमाः very valiant, सप्त seven, ते they, मन्त्रिणः ministers, सुताः sons, राक्षसेन्द्रेण by the lord of ogres, चोदिताः directed, संहृष्टाः gladly, तप्तकाञ्चनचित्राणि decked with shining gold, चापानि bows, विष्फारयन्तः by sporting, तटित्वन्तः shining with lightning, अम्बुदाः इव like storm clouds, हेमजलपरिक्षिप्तैः decked with golden mesh, ध्वजवद्भिः bearing staffs, पताकिभिः with flags,तोयदस्वननिर्घोषैः making sounds like stormy clouds, वाजियुक्तै: yoked to horses,महारथैः with great chariots, तस्मात् from that, भवनात् from the palace, निर्ययुः departed.

45_2.translation: Their mothers and relatives and their friends were struck with grief when they learnt about the kinkaras killed.
45_2.word_by_word: ततः then, तेषाम् their, सबान्धवसुहृज्जनाः with friends and relatives, जनन्यस्तु mothers, किंकरान् kinkaras, हतान् killed, विदित्वा having known, कसम्भ्रान्ताः were agitated with grief, बभूवुः became.

45_3.translation: The barnished golden ornaments worn by them were shining as they brushed shoulders with one another (eager to fight first) to attack Hanuman who stood waiting at the main archway.
45_3.word_by_word: तप्तकाञ्चनभूषणाः barnished ornaments of gold, ते they, परस्परसङ्घर्षात् by dashing against each other, तोरणस्थम् at the main archway, अवस्थितम् stood, हनूमन्तम् Hanuman, अभिपेतुः attacked.

45_4.shloka: सृजन्तो बाणवृष्टिं ते रथगर्जितनिस्स्वनाः।वृष्टिमन्त इवांभोदा विचेरुर्नैऋताम्बुदाः।।5.45.7।।
45_4.translation: They went roaring with their chariots rattling, sending forth torrents of arrows like the stormy clouds thundering.
45_4.word_by_word: रथगर्जितनिस्वनाः the rattling of the chariots mixed with the roaring of the warriors, ते they, नैऋताम्बुदाः the clouds of demons, बाणवृष्टिम् torrent of arrows, सृजन्तः sent forth, वृष्टिमन्तः thundering, अम्भोदाः इव like the storm clouds, विचेरुः went about.

45_5.translation: Later, Hanuman covered with showers of arrows scattered all over appeared like the king of mountains shot with showers of rain.
45_5.word_by_word: ततः then, ताभिः by them, शरवृष्टिभिः by the shower of arrows, अवकीर्णः scattered all over, हनुमान् Hanuman, वृष्टिभिः with shower of rain, संवृताकारः covered, शैलराडिव like the king of mountains, अभवत् appeared.

45_6.shloka: स शरान्मोघयामास तेषामाशुचरः कपिः।रथवेगं च वीराणां विचरन्विमलेऽम्बरे।।5.45.9।।
45_6.translation: Then the monkey moving fast in the clear sky rendered the arrows of the giant heroes and speeding chariots futile.
45_6.word_by_word: आशुचरः moving fast, सः कपिः that monkey, विमले in the clear, अम्बरे  sky, विचरन् moving, तेषां वीराणाम् of the heroes, शरान् by the arrows, रथवेगं च and the speed of their chariot, मोघयामास rendered futile.

45_7.shloka: स तैः क्रीडन्धनुष्मद्भिर्व्योम्नि वीरः प्रकाशते।धनुष्मद्भिर्यथा मेघैर्मारुतः प्रभुरम्बरे।।5.45.10।।
45_7.translation: Sporting in the sky with the giants who held bows in their hands, Hanuman shone like the powerful Windgod sporting in the sky surrrounded by rambling dark clouds.
45_7.word_by_word: व्योम्नि in the sky, धनुष्मद्भिः with those bows in their hands, तैः by them, क्रीडन् while sporting, सः वीरः that hero, अम्बरे in the sky, धनुष्मद्भिः armed with rainbow, मेघैः by the clouds, प्रभुः god, मारुतः यथा like the wind, प्रकाशते shining.

45_8.shloka: स कृत्वा निनदं घोरं त्रासयंस्तां महाचमूम्।चकार हनुमान्वेगं तेषु रक्षस्सु वीर्यवान्।।5.45.11।।
45_8.translation: Valiant Hanuman making terrific sound and frightening the army of ogres marched swiftly.
45_8.word_by_word: वीर्यवान् valiant one, सः he, घोरम् terrific, निनदम् sound, कृत्वा making, ताम् that, महाचमूम् great army, त्रासयन् frightening, तेषु रक्षस्सु those ogres, वेगम् speed, चकार created.

45_9.translation: The scorcher of enemies, Hanuman hit some ogres with his palm, some with his feet and some with his fist and pierced some with his nails.
45_9.word_by_word: परन्तपः scorcher of enemies, कांश्चित् some, तलेन with palm, अभ्यहनत् hit, कांश्चित् some, पादैः with feet, कांश्चित् some, मुष्टिना with fist, अभ्यहनत् struck, कांश्चित् some, नखैः with nails, व्यदारयत् pierced .

45_10.shloka: प्रममाथोरसा कांश्चिदूरुभ्यामपरान्कपिः।केचित्तस्य निनादेन तत्रैव पतिता भुवि।।5.45.13।।
45_10.translation: The monkey strangled some with his chest and some between his thighs. A few fell down dead on the ground hearing his roaring noise.
45_10.word_by_word: कपिः monkey, कांश्चित् some, उरसा with his chest, अपरान् and others, ऊरुभ्याम् with his thighs, प्रममाथ strangled, केचित् a few, तस्य his, निनादेन by the roar, तत्रैव there itself, भुवि on the ground, पतिताः fell down.

45_11.shloka: ततस्तेष्ववसन्नेषु भूमौ निपतितेषु च।तत्सैन्यमगमत्सर्वं दिशोदश भयार्दितम्।।5.45.14।।
45_11.translation: Struck by fear on seeing Hanuman, the seven sons of ministers dropped down dead on the ground, and their army fled in all the ten directions.
45_11.word_by_word: तेषु when they (sons of minister), अवसन्नेषु were annexed, भूमौ on the ground, निपतितेषु च when fallen dead on the ground, ततः then, सर्वम् all, तत् that, सैन्यम् army, भयार्दितम् struck with fear, दश दिशः in all ten directions, अगमत् fled.

45_12.translation: The elephants trumpeted discordantly out of fear, the horses fell down on the ground and even the chariots with seats, parasols and flag staffs broken were strewn all over the ground.
45_12.word_by_word: नागाः elephants, विस्वरम् discordantly, विनेदुः trumpeted in fear, वाजिनः horses, भुवि on ground, निपेतुः fell down, भूश्च the earth also, भग्ननीडध्वजच्छत्रैः with broken seats, parasols, flag staffs, रथैः by chariots, कीर्णा अभवत् strewn all over.

45_13.shloka: स्रवता रुधिरेणाथ स्रवन्त्यो दर्शिताः पथि।विविधैश्च स्वरैर्लङ्का ननाद विकृतं तदा।।5.45.16।।
45_13.translation: Streams of blood flowed and Lanka was filled with many kinds of horrifying sounds of cries.
45_13.word_by_word: अथ then, स्रवता flowing, रुधिरेण by blood, पथि way, स्रवन्त्यः flowed, दर्शिताः seen, तदा then, लङ्का Lanka, विविधैः with many, स्वरैः with sounds, विकृतम् horrifying cries, ननाद roared.

45_14.shloka: स तान्प्रवृद्धान्विनिहत्य राक्षसान् महाबलश्चण्डपराक्रमः कपिः।युयुत्सुरन्यैः पुनरेव राक्षसै स्तमेव वीरोऽभिजगाम तोरणम्।।5.45.17।।
45_14.translation: Having killed the ogres who were old and strong, the valiant and mighty Hanuman, wishing to slay the other ogres advanced towards the archway.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये सुन्दरकाण्डे पञ्चचत्वारिंशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the fortyfifth sarga of Sundarakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
45_14.word_by_word: वीरः hero, महाबलः mighty one, चण्डपराक्रमः whose valiance was fierce, सः कपिः that Hanuman, प्रवृद्धान् the ogres who were old and grew stronger, तान् राक्षसान् those gaints, विनिहृत्य slayed, अन्यैः others, राक्षसैः by ogres, युयुत्सुः desiring to wage war, पुनरेव once again, तम् that, तोरणमेव archway, अभिजगाम went forth.

46_1.shloka: [Five Generals of Ravana done to death by Hanuman in war]हतान्मन्त्रिसुतान् बुद्ध्वा वानरेण महात्मना।रावणस्संवृताकारश्चकार मतिमुत्तमाम्।।5.46.1।।
46_1.translation: Coming to know that the seven sons of the ministers were slain by the great vanara,  Ravana, who had concealed his feelings of agony thought of a good plan.
46_1.word_by_word: रावणः Ravana, महात्मना the great, वानरेण by the vanara, मन्त्रिसुतान् sons of the ministers, हतान् killed, बुद्द्वा knowing, संवृताकारः who had concealed his agony, उत्तमाम् good, मतिम् thought, चकार formulated.

46_2.shloka: स विरूपाक्षयूपाक्षौ दुर्धरं चैव राक्षसम्।प्रघसं भासकर्णं च पञ्चसेनाग्रनायकान्।।5.46.2।।सन्दिदेश दशग्रीवो वीरान्नयविशारदान्।हनुमद्ग्रहणव्यग्रान्वायुवेगसमान्युधि।।5.46.3।।
46_2.translation: The tenheaded Ravana, eager to capture Hanuman, commanded his five army Generals called Virupaksha, Yupaksha, Durdhara, Praghasa and Bhaskarna, who were great warriorstatesmen valiant and, equal to wind in speed.
46_2.word_by_word: सः दशग्रीवः the tenheaded Ravana, वीरान् warriors, नयविशारदान् skilled in statecraft, हनुमद्ग्रहणव्यग्रान् eager to capture Hanuman, युथि in battle, वायुवेगसमान् equal to wind in speed, विरूपाक्षयूपाक्षौ Virupaksha and Yupaksha, दुर्धरम् Durdhara, राक्षसं चैव also a giant, प्रघसम् Praghasa, भासकर्णं च Bhaskarna and, सेनाग्रनायकान् army Generals पञ्च five,सन्दिदेश commanded.

46_3.translation: "O Army generals march with a large, strong army with horses, chariots and elephants and punish the vanara.
46_3.word_by_word: सेनाग्रगाः O Army generals, सर्वे all, महाबलपरिग्रहाः accompanied by large, strong army, सवाजिरथमातङ्गाः along with horses, chariots and elphants, यात march, सः कपिः that vanara, शास्यताम्  punish, इति thus.

46_4.shloka: यत्नैश्च खलु भाव्यं स्यात्तमासाद्य वनालयम्।कर्म चापि समाधेयं देशकालाविरोधिनम्।।5.46.5।।
46_4.translation: "Go to that forestdweller and make all efforts to impose on him punishment appropriate to time and place (keeping in view the harm he has done).
46_4.word_by_word: तम् him, वनालयम् a forestdweller, आसाद्य after reaching, यत्नैः च with all efforts, भाव्यम् should be engaged, देशकालाविरोधिनम् that which is not against time and space, कर्म चापि even action, समाधेयम् should be done.

46_5.shloka: न ह्यहं तं कपिं मन्ये कर्मणा प्रतितर्कयन्।सर्वथा तन्महद्भूतं महाबलपरिग्रहम्।।5.46.6।।
46_5.translation: "Judging again and again from all actions, I do not think he is an ordinary monkey. He is a being endowed with great strength.
46_5.word_by_word: अहम् I, कर्मणा by his actions, प्रतितर्कयन् judging again and again,तम् him, कपिम् monkey, न मन्ये I do not think, सर्वथा by all its actions, तत् that, महाबलपरिग्रहम् endowed with great strength, महत् great, भूतम् a being.

46_6.shloka: भवेदिन्द्रेण वा सृष्टमस्मदर्थं तपोबलात्।सनागयक्षगन्धर्वा देवासुरमहर्षयः।।5.46.7।।युष्माभिस्सहितैस्सर्वैर्मया सह विनिर्जिताः।तैरवश्यं विधातव्यं व्यलीकं किञ्चिदेव नः।।5.46.8।।तदेव नात्र सन्देहः प्रसह्य परिगृह्यताम्।नावमान्यो भवद्भिश्च हरिर्धीरपराक्रमः।।5.46.9।।
46_6.translation: "To me it appears he is created by Indra with his ascetic power (for punishing us). I have subdued nagas, yakshas, gandharvas and even gods, asuras and ascetics with your help. So you should certainly bring him here without doing any harm. Capture the monkey forcibly. Do not insult that mighty monkey.
46_6.word_by_word: अस्मदर्धम् it seems to me, तपोबलात् by ascetic power, इन्द्रेण by Indra, सृष्टं वा may be created, भवेत् may be, सहितैः along with, सर्वैः by all, युष्माभिः of you, मया by me, सनागयक्षगन्धर्वाः nagas, yakshas, gandharvas,देवासुरमहर्षयः gods, demons and ascetics, विनिर्जिताः subdued, तैः by them, नः us, किञ्चिदेव even a little, व्यलीकम् harm, अवश्यम् certainly, विधातव्यम् should be done, तदेव this is same reaction, अत्र in this case, सन्देहः doubt, न no, प्रसह्य with force, परिगृह्यताम् he may be captured, धीरपराक्रमः a warrior of heroic strength, हरिः monkey, भवद्भि by you also, नावमान्यः should not be insulted.

46_7.shloka: दृष्टा हि हरयः पूर्वं मया विपुलविक्रमाः।वाली च सहसुग्रीवो जाम्बवांश्च महाबलः।।5.46.10।।नीलस्सेनापतिश्चैव ये चान्ये द्विविदादयः।नैवं तेषां गतिर्भीमा न तेजो न पराक्रमः।।5.46.11।।न मतिर्न बलोत्साहौ न रूपपरिकल्पनम्।
46_7.translation: "Earlier I have seen monkeys of immense prowess, like Vali and Sugriva as well as Jambavan, the bear. Also I have seen the army general, Nila, Dvivida and others. They do not have such tremendous splendour or movement valour, intellect and strength and energy. They did not have such ability to change form at their will.
46_7.word_by_word: पूर्वम् earlier, मया by me, विपुलविक्रमाः of immense prowess, हरयः monkeys, सहसुग्रीवः with Sugriva, वाली च and Vali, महाबलः mighty, जाम्बवांश्च and Jambavan, सेनापतिः army chief, नीलः Nila, द्विविदादयः Dvivida and others, अन्ये च and others, ये those, दृष्टाः हि have seen, तेषाम् for them, गतिः movement, एवम् that way, भीमा tremendous, न not, तेजः splendour,पराक्रमः valour, न not, मतिः intellect, न not, बलोत्साहौ strength and energy, रूपपरिकल्पनम् ability to change form at will.

46_8.shloka: महत्सत्त्वमिदं ज्ञेयं कपिरूपं व्यवस्थितम्।।5.46.12।।प्रयत्नं महदास्थाय क्रियतामस्य निग्रहः।
46_8.translation: "It should be understood that he has taken the form of a monkey. You have to put in extraordinary effort to capture him by acting in a suitable manner.
46_8.word_by_word: इदम् this, कपिरूपम् a monkey form, व्यवस्थितम् concluded, महत् great, सत्त्वम्  being, ज्ञेयम् It should be understood, महत् extraordinary, प्रयत्नम् effort, आस्थाय by putting up, अस्य his, निग्रहः capture, क्रियताम् do.

46_9.translation: "Even Indra, suras, asuras and humans and the three worlds together are incompetent to stand before you in a battlefield.
46_9.word_by_word: सेन्द्राः including Indra, ससुरासुरमानवाः suras, asuras and humans together, त्रयः all the three, लोकाः worlds, रणाजिरे in the battlefield, भवताम् your, अग्रतः in front, स्थातुम् to stand, न पर्याप्ताः not competent, कामम् indeed.

46_10.shloka: तथापि तु नयज्ञेन जयमाकाङ्क्षता रणे।।5.46.14।।आत्मा रक्ष्यः प्रयत्नेन युद्धसिद्धिर्हि चञ्चला।
46_10.translation: "Even then, you should safeguard yourself with great effort adopting warstrategies in an intelligent  manner to be victorious, for success in war is uncertain.
46_10.word_by_word: तथापि तु even then, रणे in a war, जयम् victory, आकाङ्क्षता while desiring, नयज्ञेन bycarefully adopting war strategies in an intelligent manner, प्रयत्नेन making effort, आत्मा your own self, रक्ष्यः should be protected, युद्धसिद्धिः victory in war, चञ्चला हि is uncertain.

46_11.shloka: ते स्वामिवचनं सर्वे प्रतिगृह्य महौजसः।।5.46.15।।समुत्पेतुर्महावेगा हुताशसमतेजसः।रथैर्मत्तैश्च मातङ्गैर्वाजिभिश्च महाजवैः।।5.46.16।।शस्त्रैश्च विविधैस्तीक्ष्णैस्सर्वैश्चोपचिता बलैः।
46_11.translation: Taking King's order, the strong and swift warriors, resplendent as the flame of sacrificial fire sallied forth with their army on chariots, on the back of rutting elephants,  some on swift horses equipped with sharp weapons of many kinds.
46_11.word_by_word: महौजसः very strong, हुताशसमतेजसः resplendant as sacrificial fire, ते सर्वे all of them, स्वामिवचनम् king's words, प्रतिगृह्य accepting, महावेगाः who were swift, रथैः with chariots, मत्तै intoxicated, मातङ्गै: with elephants, महाजवैः of great speed, वाजिभिश्च with horses, तीक्ष्णैः sharp, विविधैः many kinds, शस्त्रै: with weapons, सर्वे all, बलैः strong army, उपचिताः collecting,समुत्पेतुः sallied forth together

46_12.shloka: ततस्तं ददृशुर्वीरा दीप्यमानं महाकपिम्।।5.46.17।।रश्मिमन्तमिवोद्यन्तं स्वतेजोरश्मिमालिनम्।तोरणस्थं महोत्साहं महासत्त्वं महाबलम्।।5.46.18।।
46_12.translation: The heroic giants caught sight of the vanara, who was blazing  encircled as though hewas by the rays of his own glory, looking like the rising Sun. He was endowed with extraordinary agility, intelligence, and tremendous strength standing, waiting at the archway.
46_12.word_by_word: ततः then, वीराः heroes, स्वतेजोरश्मिमालिनम् shining like the Sungod with his own effulgence, उद्यन्तम् a rising one, रश्मिमन्तमिव like the Sun, दीप्यमानम् shining, तोरणस्थम् standing at the archway, महोत्साहम् extraordinary agility, महासत्त्वम् intelligent,महाबलम् endowed with tremendous strength, तं महाकपिम् him the vanara, ददृशुः saw.

46_13.shloka: महामतिं महावेगं महाकायं महाबलम्।तं समीक्ष्यैव ते सर्वे दिक्षु सर्वास्ववस्थिताः।।5.46.19।।तै स्तै: प्रहरणैर्भीमैरभिपेतुस्ततस्ततः।
46_13.translation: Having observed the tremendous strength, intelligence and swiftness in action of Hanuman, the generals of the army positioned at all directions and assailed him with dreadful weapons.
46_13.word_by_word: सर्वे all, महामतिम् highly intelligent, महावेगम् very swift, महाकायम् having a huge body, महाबलम् tremendous strength, तम् him, समीक्ष्यैव having observed, सर्वासु in all, दिक्षु directions, अवस्थिताः positioned, ततस्ततः here and there, भीमैः with dreadful, स्तैस्तै: with different, प्रहरणैः with weapons, अभिपेतुः attacked.

46_14.translation: Durdhara pierced into the head of Hanuman with five sharp arrows and polished steel shafts with yellow tips (gold) shining like red lotus petals. They were like petals of lilies thrown on the head of Hanuman (causing no pain).
46_14.word_by_word: तीक्ष्णाः sharp, शिताः sharp, पीतमुखाः steel shafts with polished yellow tips (of gold), उत्पलपत्राभाः shining like petals of lilies, आयसाः steel shafts made of iron, पञ्च five, शराः arrows, दुर्धरेण by Durdhara, तस्य his, शिरसि  on his head, निपातिताः pierced.

46_15.shloka: स तैः पञ्चभिराविद्धश्शरैश्शिरसि वानरः।।5.46.21।।उत्पपात नदन् व्योम्नि दिशो दश विनादयन्।
46_15.translation: With five arrows pierced in the head of the vanara, Hanuman leaped into the sky with terrible roar, which resounded in all the ten directions.
46_15.word_by_word: वानरः vanara, तैः them, पञ्चभिः by those five, शरैः with arrows, शिरसि on the head, अविद्धः pierced in, नदन् roared, दशदिशः the ten directions, विनादयन् making a loud noise, व्योम्नि in the sky, उत्पपात leaped.

46_16.translation: Then the powerful, hero, Durdhara, mounted on his chariot, fastened his bowstring and hit Hanuman with hundreds of sharp arrows.
46_16.word_by_word: ततः thereafter, महाबलः powerful, वीरः hero, दुर्धरः Durdhara, सरथः with his the chariot, सज्यकार्मुकः with his string fastened, तीक्ष्णैः sharp, शरशतैः hundreds of arrows, किरन् while hitting, अभिपेदे attacked.

46_17.shloka: स कपिर्वारयामास तं व्योम्नि शरवर्षिणम्।।5.46.23।।वृष्टिमन्तं पयोदान्ते पयोदमिव मारुतः।
46_17.translation: The great monkey kept away the showering arrows like the wind prevents raincloud from showering rain drops at the end of monsoon.
46_17.word_by_word: सः कपिः that vanara, व्योम्नि in the sky, शरवर्षिणम् showering of arrows, तम् on him, पयोदान्ते at the end of the rainy season, वृष्टिमन्तम् showering rain drops, पयोदम् a cloud, मारुतः इव like the wind, वारयामास prevented.

46_18.shloka: अर्ध्यमानस्ततस्तेन दुर्धरेणानिलात्मजः।।5.46.24।।चकार कदनं भूयो व्यवर्धत च वेगवान्।
46_18.translation: When the son of the Windgod was attacked by Durdhara, he again grew in size
46_18.word_by_word: तेन by him, दुर्धरेण by Durdhara, अर्ध्यमानः attacked, अनिलात्मजः son of the Windgod, ततः then, कदनम् battle, चकार fought, वेगवान् swift hero, भूयः again, व्यवर्धत  grew in size.

46_19.shloka: स दूरं सहसोत्पत्य दुर्धरस्य रथे हरिः।।5.46.25।।निपपात महावेगो विद्युद्राशिर्गिराविव।
46_19.translation: Hanuman suddenly leaped far off into the air at high speed and fell on Durdhara's chariot just like a thunderous lightning falls on a mountain.
46_19.word_by_word: सः हरिः that vanara, दूरं far off, सहसा at once, उत्पत्य leaped, महावेगः in high speed, गिरौ on the mountain, विद्युद्राशिरिव like flashes of lightning, दुर्धरस्य Durdhara's, रथे on the chariot, निपपात fell on.

46_20.shloka: ततस्स मथिताष्टाश्वं रथं भग्नाक्षकूबरम्।।5.46.26।।विहाय न्यपतद्भूमौ दुर्धरस्त्यक्तजीवितः।
46_20.translation: Having lost his chariot, the horses yoked to it killed, its axle and pole broken to pieces, Durdhara fell down dead from the chariot.
46_20.word_by_word: ततः then, सः he, मथिताष्टाश्वम् eight horses killed, भग्नाक्षकूबरम् with its axle and wooden frame (to which the yoke is fixed) broken, रथम् chariot, विहाय left, त्यक्तजीवितः devoid of life, भूमौ on the ground, न्यपतत् fell.

46_21.shloka: तं विरूपाक्षयूपाक्षौ दृष्ट्वा निपतितं भुवि।।5.46.27।।सञ्जातरोषौ दुर्धर्षावुत्पेतुररिन्दमौ।
46_21.translation: Seeing the body of Durdhara fallen on the ground, enraged Virupaksha and Yupaksha, the unassailable crushers of enemies leaped towards him.
46_21.word_by_word: दुर्धर्षौ  unassailable warriors, अरिन्दमौ  crushers of enemies, विरूपाक्षयूपाक्षौ Virupaksha and Yupaksha, भुवि on the ground, निपतितम् fallen, तम् him, दृष्ट्वा seeing, सञ्जातरोषौ enraged, उत्पेतुः leaped at him.

46_22.shloka: स ताभ्यां सहसोत्पत्य विष्ठितो विमलेऽम्बरे।।5.46.28।।मुद्गराभ्यां महाबाहुर्वक्षस्यभिहतः कपिः।
46_22.translation: As the strongarmed vanara stood stationed in the clear white sky both the generals leaped into the sky and hit him all of a sudden with two iron hammers.
46_22.word_by_word: विमले in a clear white, अम्बरे in the sky, विष्ठितः stood, महाबाहुः greatarmed one, सः कपिः that vanara, ताभ्याम् by both of them, सहसा all of a sudden, उत्पत्य having leapt, मुद्गराभ्याम् with two iron hammers, वक्षसि on the chest, अभिहतः  hit.

46_23.translation: Powerful Hanuman, an equal to Garuda in valour fell down while resisting the swift generals.
46_23.word_by_word: महाबलः powerful, सुपर्णसमविक्रमः equal to Suparna (Garuda) in valour, वेगवतोः of those two who were swift in action, तयोः of both of them, वेगम् speed, विनिहत्य resisting, पुनः again, भूमौ on the ground, निपपात fell.

46_24.shloka: स सालवृक्षमासाद्य तमुत्पाट्य च वानरः।।5.46.30।।तावुभौ राक्षसौ वीरौ जघान पवनात्मजः।
46_24.translation: Then the son of the Windgod seized a sala tree uprooted it, lifted it and smashed the two giant generals with it.
46_24.word_by_word: वानरः vanara, सः पवनात्मजः that son of the Windgod, सालवृक्षम् sala tree, आसाद्य seized, तम् that, उत्पाट्य च and uprooted, तौ उभौ both of them, वीरौ generals, राक्षसौ two giants,जघान slew.

46_25.shloka: ततस्तांस्त्रीन्हतान्ज्ञात्वा वानरेण तरस्विना।।5.46.31।।अभिपेदे महावेगः प्रसह्य प्रघसो हरिम्।भासकर्णश्च सङ्कृद्धश्शूलमादाय वीर्यवान्।।5.46.32।।
46_25.translation: Finding all the three generals dead, swift Praghasa advanced towards the Vanara and attacked him. Valiant Bhasakarna also lifted a trident and attacked him. Both were famous for swift and violent action in war
46_25.word_by_word: ततः then, तरस्विना by the swift, वानरेण by the vanara, तान् त्रीन् those three, हतान् killed, ज्ञात्वा after knowing, प्रघसः Praghasa, महावेगः endowed with swift action, प्रसह्य violently, अभिपेदे attacked, वीर्यवान् courageous, भासकर्णश्च with Bhasakarna, सङ्कृद्धः angry one, शूलम् trident, आदाय by lifting.

46_26.shloka: एकतः कपिशार्दूलं यशस्विनमवस्थितम्।पट्टिसेन शिताग्रेण प्रघसः प्रत्ययोधयत्।।5.46.33।।भासकर्णश्च शूलेन राक्षसः कपिसत्तमम्।
46_26.translation: Praghasa fought back the glorious tiger among vanaras with a sharp crowbar on one side and Bhaskarana attacked with a spear from the other.
46_26.word_by_word: यशस्विनम् renowned, कपिशार्दूलम् tiger among monkeys, एकतः on one side, अवस्थितम् तम् stationed, प्रघसः Praghasa, शिताग्रेण with sharp weapon, पट्टिसेन iron crowbar, कपिसत्तमम् foremost of the monkeys, प्रत्ययोधयत् fought back, भासकर्णः Bhaskarna, राक्षसः giant, शूलेन with spear.

46_27.translation: Attacked by both the generals, the fur on the vanara's body was smeared with blood from his wounded limbs, shining like the rising Sun smeared with blood became furious.
46_27.word_by_word: ताभ्याम् by both of them, विक्षतैः with wounded ones, गात्रैः with his limbs, असृग्दिग्धतनूरुहः his fur smeared with blood, सः वानरः that vanara, बालसूर्यसमप्रभः was shining like the rising Sun, क्रुद्धः angry, अभवत् became.

46_28.shloka: समुत्पाट्य गिरेश्शृङ्गं समृगव्यालपादपम्।।5.46.35।।जघान हनुमान् वीरो राक्षसौ कपिकुञ्जरः।
46_28.translation: Hanuman, a courageous and mighty elephant among the monkeys uprooted a mountain peak along with its animals, serpents and trees and killed both the demon generals.
46_28.word_by_word: कपिकुञ्जरः a mighty elephant among the monkeys, वीरः courageous, हनुमान् Hanuman, समृगव्यालपादपम् along with animals serpents and trees, गिरेः शृङ्गम् mountain peak, समुत्पाट्य having uprooted, राक्षसौ both the giants,जघान  killed.

46_29.shloka: ततस्तेष्ववसन्नेषु सेनापतिषु पञ्चसु।।5.46.36।।बलं तदवशेषं च नाशयामास वानरः।
46_29.translation: When the five army chiefs were killed, Hanuman began to destoy the remaining army force.
46_29.word_by_word: ततः then, तेषु those, पञ्चसु all the five, सेनापतिषु army chiefs, अवसन्नेषु when they died, वानरः vanara, तत् that, अवशेषम् remaining, बलम् army, नाशयामास destroyed.

46_30.shloka: अश्वैरश्वान् गजैर्नागान् योधैर्योधान् रथैरथान्।।5.46.37।।स कपिर्नाशयामास सहस्राक्ष इवासुरान्।
46_30.translation: The vanara pitted horses against horses, elephants against elephants, warriors against warriors and chariots against chariots as Indra destroyed demons.
46_30.word_by_word: सः कपिः that vanara,सहस्राक्षः thousandeyed Indra, असुरानिव as he did (destroyed) demons, अश्वैः with horses, अश्वान् horses, गजैः with elephants, नागान् elephants, योधैः with warriors, योधान् warriors, रथैः with chariots, रथान् chariots, नाशयामास destroyed.

46_31.shloka: हतैर्नागैश्च तुरगैर्भग्नाक्षैश्च महारथैः।।5.46.38।।हतैश्च राक्षसैर्भूमी रुद्धमार्गा समन्ततः।
46_31.translation: There was no path (one could not move forward) with elephants, and horses killed and with broken axles of great chariots and smashed chariots spread all over the way.
46_31.word_by_word: हतैः with killed ones, नागैः with elephants, तुरगैः with horses, भग्नाक्षैः with broken axles, महारथैश्च by great chariots, हतैः with smashed ones, राक्षसैः with giants, भूमिः the ground, समन्ततः all over, रुद्धमार्गा the path was obstructed

46_32.shloka: ततः कपिस्तान्ध्वजिनीपतीन् रणे निहत्य वीरान्सबलान्सवाहनान्।समीक्ष्य वीरः परिगृह्य तोरणं कृतक्षणः काल इव प्रजाक्षये।।5.46.39।।
46_32.translation: Then the heroic monkey having killed the army generals and their army and destroyed their vehicles in war came back to the archway after reviewing and stood like the timespirit bent upon the destruction of humanity.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये सुन्दरकाण्डे षट्चत्वारिंशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the fortysixth sarga of Sundarakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
46_32.word_by_word: ततः then, वीरः the hero, कपिः monkey, वीरान् the generals, सबलान्  along with that army, सवाहनान् their vehicles, तान् those, ध्वजिनीपतीन् army chiefs, रणे in war, निहत्य having killed, समीक्ष्य after reviewing, तोरणम् archway, परिगृह्य after holding, प्रजाक्षये  bent upon destruction of humanity, कालः इव like timespirit, कृतक्षणः celebrated.

47_1.shloka: [Death of Prince Aksha in the combat with Hanuman]सेनापतीन्पञ्च स तु प्रमापितान् हनूमता सानुचरान्सवाहनान्।समीक्ष्य राजा समरोद्धतोन्मुखं कुमारमक्षं प्रसमैक्षताग्रतः।।5.47.1।।
47_1.translation: Hearing the sad news of death of the five army generals including their followers and destruction of their vehicles, King (Ravana) gave a suggestive look at prince Aksha who was inclined to fight the war.
47_1.word_by_word: राजा the king, सानुचरान् with the followers,सवाहनान् and their vehicles, पञ्च five, सेनापतीन् generals of the army, हनुमता by Hanuman, प्रमापितान् killed, समीक्ष्य seeing, समरोद्धतोन्मुखम् inclined to fight the war, अग्रतः in front of him, कुमारम् the prince, अक्षम् Aksha, प्रसमैक्षत turned his attention to.

47_2.shloka: स तस्य दृष्ट्यर्पणसम्प्रचोदितः प्रतापवान्काञ्चनचित्रकार्मुकः।समुत्पपाताथ सदस्युदीरितो द्विजातिमुख्यैर्हविषेव पावकः।।5.47.2।।
47_2.translation: Spurred by the mere glance of Ravana, the glorious Aksha with his wonderful bow inlaid with gold sprang up from the royal assembly just as flame rises from firesanctuary when oblations are poured in by reputed brahmins.
47_2.word_by_word: अथ and then, तस्य his, दृष्ट्यर्पणसम्प्रचोदितः spurred by the glance of the king, प्रतापवान् glorious, सः that, काञ्चनचित्रकार्मुकः holding a marvellous bow inlaid with gold, सदसि  the royal assembly, द्विजातिमुख्यैः by the reputed brahmins, हविषा with oblations, उदीरितः kindled, पावकः इव like the firesanctuary, समुत्पपात sprang up.

47_3.shloka: ततो महद्बालदिवाकरप्रभं प्रतप्तजाम्बूनदजालसन्ततम्।रथं समास्थाय ययौ स वीर्यवान्महाहरिं तं प्रति नैरृतर्षभः।।5.47.3।।
47_3.translation: Ascending a glittering chariot inlaid with pure gold Aksha, the courageous bull among giants looking splendid like the rising Sun, marched forth towards the great vanara.
47_3.word_by_word: ततः then, वीर्यवान् courageous, सः नैरृतर्षभः that bull among giants, बालदिवाकरप्रभम् splendid like the rising Sun, प्रतप्तजाम्बूनदजालसन्ततम् glittering like the stretch of pure gold, महत् great, रथम् chariot, समास्थाय having ascended, तम् him, महाहरिं प्रति towards the great vanara, ययौ marched.

47_4.translation: The chariot was (strong as it was) gained by his austerities of high order. It was overlaid with pure gold armour, fixed with flags, and staff, studded with precious gems, yoked to the best of eight horses and endowed with the speed of mind.
47_4.word_by_word: ततः then, तपः सङ्ग्रहसञ्चयार्जितम् gained by the austerities of high order, प्रतप्तजाम्बूनदजालशोभितम् overlaid with the pure gold armour, पताकिनम् having a flag, रत्नविभूषितध्वजम् with flag staff studded with precious gems, मनोजवाष्टाश्ववरैः with eight choice horses endowed with the speed of mind, सुयोजितम् yoked.

47_5.translation: (The chariot) was unassailable to suras or asuras.It moved without touching the ground, it could fly in air and had the splendour of the Sun. It was equipped readily with quivers, eight swords, javelins and clubs placed in right order.
47_5.word_by_word: सुरासुराधृष्यम् unassailable to suras and asuras, असङ्गचारिणम् moved without touching the ground, रविप्रभम् with the spledour of Sun,व्योमचरम् that which can fly in air, समाहितम् equipped readily, सतूणम् with quivers, अष्टासि निबद्धबन्धुरम् with eight swords (readily placed)fastened, यथाक्रमावेशितशक्तितोमरम्  javelins and clubs placed in right place in order.

47_6.shloka: विराजमानं प्रतिपूर्णवस्तुना सहेमदाम्ना शशिसूर्यवर्चसा।दिवाकराभं रथमास्थितस्ततस्स निर्जगामामरतुल्यविक्रमः।।5.47.6।।
47_6.translation: Prince Aksha, whose courage was equal to that of gods, shone like the Sun. He ascended the splendid chariot decked with golden garlands shining like Sun and Moon, equipped with all weapons, bows and shields etc, he went out.
47_6.word_by_word: ततः then, अमरतुल्यविक्रमः equal to gods in courage, सः he, सहेमदाम्ना with a golden garland, शशिसूर्यवर्चसा bright as Moon and Sun, प्रतिपूर्णवस्तुना equipped with all weapons, bows and shields etc, विराजमानम् glowing, दिवाकराभम् shining like the Sun, रथम् chariot, आस्थितः ascended, निर्जगाम went out.

47_7.shloka: स पूरयन्खं च महीं च साचलां तुरङ्गमातङ्गमहारथस्वनैः।बलैस्समेतैस्सहि तोरणस्थितं समर्थमासीनमुपागमत्कपिम्।।5.47.7।।
47_7.translation: Seated on the chariot he (Aksha) sallied forth along with the army filling the entire earth and mountains with the sounds of horses, elephants and rumblings of big chariots and reached the portal where the great vanara stood.
47_7.word_by_word: सः he, तुरङ्गमातङ्गमहारथस्वनैः with the sounds of horses, elephants and chariot, खं च and sky, साचलाम् including mountains, महीं च and earth, पूरयन् while filling, समेतैः together, बलैः सह with army, तोरणस्थितम् stood at the gate, समर्थम् efficient one, आसीनम् seated, महाकपिम् great vanara, उपागमत् reached.

47_8.shloka: स तं समासाद्य हरिं हरीक्षणो युगान्तकालाग्निमिव प्रजाक्षये।अवस्थितं विस्मितजातसम्भ्रम स्समैक्षताक्षो बहुमानचक्षुषा।।5.47.8।।
47_8.translation: The lioneyed Aksha saw the vanara who appeared like the cosmic fire at the time of dissolution of the universe. The prince was astonished and struck with awe (at themajestic form of the Vanara) and looked at him with great  respect.
47_8.word_by_word: हरीक्षणः who had eyes like that of a lion, सः अक्षः that Aksha, प्रजाक्षये at the time of destruction of the universe, अवस्थितम् appeared, कालाग्निम् इव like the cosmic fire at the time of dissolution, तम् him, हरिम् vanara,, समासाद्य  reached, विस्मितजातसम्भ्रमः astonished with awe, बहुमानचक्षुषा with great respect, समैक्षत saw.

47_9.shloka: स तस्य वेगं च कपेर्महात्मनः पराक्रमं चारिषु पार्थिवात्मजः।विचारयन्स्वं च बलं महाबलो हिमक्षये सूर्य इवाभिवर्धते।।5.47.9।।
47_9.translation: Aksha, the mighty prince judging the speed and prowess of the monkey with his own in confronting enemies and the strength of the monkey, began to swell up in spirit like the glow of the Sun at the end of winter.
47_9.word_by_word: महाबलः mighty, पार्थिवात्मजः  prince, सः he, महात्मनः  great self, तस्य कपेः of the monkey, वेगं च and speed, अरिषु at the enemies, पराक्रमं च prowess, स्वम् his, बलं च even strength, विचारयन् judging, हिमक्षये at the end of winter, सूर्य इव like the Sun, अभिवर्धते  began to swell up in spirit

47_10.shloka: स जातमन्युः प्रसमीक्ष्य विक्रमं स्थिरं स्थिरस्सम्यति दुर्निवारणम्।समाहितात्मा हनुमन्तमाहवे प्रचोदयामास शरैस्त्रिभि श्शितैः।।5.47.10।।
47_10.translation: Knowing that it is difficult to win Hanuman who was steady and of irresistible valour Aksha was angry. Remaining steady, with full attention, he provoked the vanara to fight and released three sharp arrows.
47_10.word_by_word: संयति in war, दुर्निवारणम् irresistible, स्थिरम् steady, विक्रमम् valour, प्रसमीक्ष्य recognising, सः that Aksha, जातमन्युः became angry, स्थिरः stable, समाहितात्मा with full attention, हनुमन्तम् Hanuman, शितैः with sharp, त्रिभिः with three शरैः  arrows, आहवे in the battle, प्रचोदयामास provoked

47_11.shloka: ततः कपिं तं प्रसमीक्ष्य गर्वितं जितश्रमं शत्रुपराजयोर्जितम्।अवैक्षताक्षस्समुदीर्णमानसस्सबाणपाणिः प्रगृहीतकार्मुकः।।5.47.11।।
47_11.translation: Then Aksha contempuously looked at Hanuman who had conquered his fatigue and was determined to defeat the enemy. Holding in his hands his bow and arrows proudly, he reflected.
47_11.word_by_word: तः then, सः अक्षः that Aksha, गर्वितम् with pride, शत्रुपराजयोर्जितम् who was intent to conquer the enemy, तं कपिम् him, that Hanuman, जितश्रमम् who conquered, प्रसमीक्ष्य  considered, बाणपाणिः with bow and arrows in hand, प्रगृहीतकार्मुकः holding a bow,समुदीर्णमानसः reflected in his mind, अवैक्षत looked

47_12.shloka: स हेमनिष्काङ्गदचारुकुण्डल स्समाससादाऽशुपराक्रमः कपिम्।तयोर्बभूवाप्रतिमस्समागम स्सुरासुराणामपि सम्भ्रमप्रदः।।5.47.12।।
47_12.translation: Adorned with armlets studded with golden coins and lovely earrings Aksha advanced instantaneously to meet the monkey. Their matchless combat excuitement and enthusiasm even among gods and demons.
47_12.word_by_word: आशुपराक्रमः an energetic hero, हेमनिष्काङ्गदचारुकुण्डलः wearing golden armlets studded with gold coins and lovely earrings, सः that, कपिम् monkey, समाससाद reached, तयोः both of them, अप्रतिमः matchless, समागमः combat, सुरासुराणामपि even for suras and asuras, सम्भ्रमप्रद: creating enthusiasm, अभूत् became

47_13.shloka: ररास भूमिर्न तताप भानुमा न्वनौ न वायुः प्रचाचल चाचलः।कपेः कुमारस्य च वीक्ष्य संयुगं ननाद च द्यौरुदधिश्च चुक्षुभे।।5.47.13।।
47_13.translation: Witnessing the fight between Hanuman and Prince Aksha, even the earth shrieked in agony, the Sun became dim, the wind stopped blowing, mountains were shaken, the sky thundered and even the ocean was agitated.
47_13.word_by_word: कपेः of Hanuman, कुमारस्य च and of the prince, संयुगम् in battle, वीक्ष्य after seeing, भूमिः earth, ररास  shrieked in agony, भानुमान् even Sun, न तताप  became dim, वायुः wind, न वनौ blew not, अचलः च mountains, प्रचचाल shaken, द्यौः sky, ननाद च thundered, उदधिश्च even the ocean, चुक्षुभे was agitated

47_14.translation: Heroic Aksha, who was good at targeting correctly, with due  concentration struck the vanara on his head with three goldenshafted, winged arrows with feathers smeared with poison which resembled serpents.
47_14.word_by_word: ततः then, अथ there, वीरः hero, समाधिसम्योगविमोक्षतत्त्ववित्  good at targeting and releasing with due concentration, सः he, सुमुखान् of good looking, सुवर्णपुङ्खान् goldenshafted (touching the bowstring), पतत्रिणः  winged arrows with feathers, सविषान् smeared with poison, उरगानिव like serpents, त्रीन् three, शरान् arrows, कपिमूर्ध्नि on the head of the vanara, अपातयत् struck

47_15.shloka: स तै श्शरैर्मूर्ध्नि समं निपातितैः क्षरन्नसृग्दिग्धविवृत्तलोचनः।नवोदितादित्यनिभ श्शरांशुमान् व्यराजतादित्य इवांशुमालिकः।।5.47.15।।
47_15.translation: With the three arrows shot on his forehead simultaneously his eyes were drenched with flowing blood and with arrows shining like rays he appeared like the rising Sun, garlanded by glowing rays.
47_15.word_by_word: समम् simultaneously, मूर्ध्नि on the head, निपातितैः shot at, तैः by those शरैः by arrows, क्षरन् flowing, असृग्दिग्धविवृत्तलोचनः eyes wetted with red blood flowing down, नवोदितादित्यनिभः glittering like the rising Sun, शरांशुमान् arrows appeared like rays, सः he, अंशुमालिकः garlanded by rays, आदित्य इव like the Sun, व्यराजत glowed

47_16.shloka: ततस्स पिङ्गाधिपमन्त्रिसत्तमः समीक्ष्य तं राजवरात्मजं रणे।उदग्रचित्रायुधचित्रकार्मुकं जहर्ष चापूर्यत चाहवोन्मुखः।।5.47.16।।
47_16.translation: Hanuman, the esteemed minister of the copperyeyed Sugriva observed the prince holding manifold splendid weapons. He rejoiced, grew in size ready to fight, making the necessary prepararions (taking the required position).
47_16.word_by_word: ततः then, सः he, Hanuman, पिङ्गाधिपमन्त्रिसत्तमः esteemed minister of the copperyeyed Sugriva, उदग्रचित्रायुधचित्रकार्मुकम् holding manifold splendid weapons raised, तम् him, राजवरात्मजम् that prince, समीक्ष्य  observed, जहर्ष rejoiced, आहवोन्मुखः became ready for the battle, अपूर्यत च made the necessary preparations

47_17.shloka: स मन्दराग्रस्थ इवांशुमालिको विवृद्धकोपो बलवीर्यसंयुतः।कुमारमक्षं सबलं सवाहनं ददाह नेत्राग्निमरीचिभिस्तदा।।5.47.17।।
47_17.translation: Huge Hanuman, endowed with strength and valour looked  like the rising Sun on the peak of mount Mandara. He looked at prince Aksha and his army as well as his vehicles as though he was burning them with the rays emerging from his fiery eyes.
47_17.word_by_word: मन्दराग्रस्थः Sun shining on the peak of mount Mandara, इव just as, बलवीर्यसंयुतः endowed with strength and valour, सः he, Hanuman, विवृद्धकोपः his anger grew, सबलम् with his army, सवाहनम् including all vehicles, कुमारम् king's son, अक्षम् Aksha, तदा then, नेत्राग्निमरीचिभिः with the fiery rays emerging from the fiery eyes, ददाह  consumed

47_18.shloka: ततस्स बाणासनचित्रकार्मुक श्शरप्रवर्षो युधि राक्षसाम्बुदः।शरान्मुमोचाशु हरीश्वराचले वलाहको वृष्टिमिवाचलोत्तमे।।5.47.18।।
47_18.translation: Aksha, with his wonderful quiver and bow, began to rain rapidly a shower of arrows in the battle, on the mountainlike monkeylord just as a cloud rains on a mountain.
47_18.word_by_word: ततः then, बाणासनचित्रकार्मुकः endowed with a quiver and a wonderful bow, शरप्रवर्षः rain of arrows, सः राक्षसाम्बुदः that cloud of a demon, युधि in battle, आशु  quickly, हरीश्वराचले on the mountain of Hanuman, वलाहकः cloud, अचलोत्तमे on a great mountain, वृष्टिमिव like showers of rain, शरान् arrows, मुमोच released

47_19.shloka: ततः कपिस्तं रणचण्डविक्रमं विवृद्धतेजोबलवीर्यसंयुतम्।कुमारमक्षं प्रसमीक्ष्य संयुगे ननाद हर्षाद् घनतुल्यविक्रमम्।।5.47.19।।
47_19.translation: Then Hanuman saw prince Aksha, endowed with excessive splendour, power andenergy advancing in a fierce manner like a cloud in the battle. Then Hanuman happy (to see the heroic prince) roared like a clap of thunder.
47_19.word_by_word: ततः then, कपिः Hanuman, रणचण्डविक्रमम् showing fierce valour, विवृद्धतेजोबलवीर्यसंयुतम् endowed with excessive splendour, power and energy, घनतुल्यविक्रमम् who had valour equal to a cloud, तम् him, कुमारम् अक्षम् prince Aksha, संयुगे in battle, प्रसमीक्ष्य after observing, हर्षात् happily, ननाद roared

47_20.shloka: स बालभावाद्युधि वीर्यदर्पितः प्रवृद्धमन्युः क्षतजोपमेक्षणः।समाससादाप्रतिमं कपिं रणे गजो महाकूपमिवावृतं तृणैः।।5.47.20।।
47_20.translation: Young Aksha, proud of his valour with eyes bloodshot in anger rushed towards the matchless Hanuman, just as an elephant would approach a huge pitfall covered with grass.
47_20.word_by_word: बालभावात् being young, युधि in battle, वीर्यदर्पितः puffed with the pride of his valour, प्रवृद्धमन्युः enraged, क्षतजोपमेक्षणः with bloodred eyes, सः he, रणे in fight, अप्रतिमम् matchless, कपिम् monkey, गजः elephant, तृणैः with grass, आवृतम् covered, महाकूपमिव like a huge pitfall, समाससाद rushed towards

47_21.shloka: स तेन बाणैः प्रसभं निपातितैश्चकार नादं घननादनिस्स्वनः।समुत्पपाताशु नभस्स मारुतिर्भुजोरुविक्षेपणघोरदर्शनः।।5.47.21।।
