55_17.translation: 'If the two princes know about Sita's loss they will die and when they are dead Sugriva would perish along with all his relatives.
55_17.word_by_word: सीतायाम् When Sita, विनष्टायाम् is lost, तौ उभौ those two, विनशिष्यतः will die, तयोः of those two, विनाशे when they are dead, सबन्धुः including all relatives, सुग्रीवः Sugriva, विनशिष्यति will perish.

55_18.shloka: एतदेव वचश्श्रुत्वा भरतो भ्रातृवत्सलः।धर्मात्मा सहशत्रुघ्नः कथं शक्ष्यति जीवितुम्।।5.55.18।।
55_18.translation: 'How will the loving righteous brother, Bharata along with Satrughna survive after hearing this?
55_18.word_by_word: एतदेव this alone, वचः word, श्रुत्वा having heard, भ्रातृवत्सलः a loving brother, धर्मात्मा righteous one, सहशत्रुघ्नः along with Satrughna, भरतः Bharata, जीवितुम् to live, कथम् how, शक्ष्यति he can.

55_19.translation: 'When the righteous Ikshvaku race perishes the people would be tormented by grief and remorse. There is no doubt.
55_19.word_by_word: धर्मिष्ठे when the righteous, इक्ष्वाकुवंशे Ikshvaku race, नाशम् will perish, गते when it happens, सर्वाः all, प्रजाः people, असंशयम् there is no doubt, शोकसन्तापपीडिताः tormented by grief and remorse, भविष्यन्ति would be.

55_20.translation: 'I have failed in seeking dharma and artha. It is evident is that I am a destroyer of the world because I was overtaken by anger. How unfortunate I am'
55_20.word_by_word: तत् then, भाग्यरहितः unfortunate, लुप्तधर्मार्थसङ्ग्रहः failed to secure dharma and artha, रोषदोषपरीतात्मा overwhelmed with anger, अहम् I, व्यक्तम् this is evident, लोकनाशनः  destroyer of the whole world.

55_21.translation: When Hanuman was thus bemoaning, good omens as in the past appeared before him. He started reflecting once again:
55_21.word_by_word: तस्य when he, इति thus, चिन्तयतः while he was bemoaning, साक्षात् directly witnessed, पूर्वमपि earlier, उपलब्धानि experienced, निमित्तानि omens, उपपेदिरे पुनः once again  appeared, अचिन्तयत् he reflected upon them again.

55_22.shloka: अथवा चारुसर्वाङ्गी रक्षिता स्वेन तेजसा।न नशिष्यति कल्याणी नाग्निरग्नौ प्रवर्तते।।5.55.22।।
55_22.translation: 'On the other hand a beautiful and auspicious lady like Sita will be protected by her own splendour and will not perish as fire cannot extinguish fire. (Sita is pure like fire. Here the great sage Valmiki is suggesting the future incident in which Sita emerged safe from 'Agnipariksha' or fireordeal.)
55_22.word_by_word: अथवा or else, चारुसर्वाङ्गी lady of beautiful limbs, स्वेन by her own, तेजसा by splendour, रक्षिता is protected, कल्याणी auspicious lady, न नशिष्यति will not perish, अग्निः fire, अग्नौ at fire, न प्रवर्तते cannot actbe effective.

55_23.shloka: न हि धर्मात्मनस्तस्य भार्याममिततेजसः।स्वचारित्राभिगुप्तां तां स्प्रष्टुमर्हति पावकः।।5.55.23।।
55_23.translation: 'Fire cannot touch that lady who is protected by her own chastity and who is wedded to the righteous man of immasureable glory.
55_23.word_by_word: धर्मात्मनः of the righteous one, अमिततेजसः of a man of immeasureable glory, तस्य his, भार्याम् wife, स्वचारित्राभिगुप्ताम् protected by her own chastity, ताम् her, पावकः fire, स्प्रष्टुम् to touch, नार्हति हि cannot.

55_24.shloka: नूनं रामप्रभावेण वैदेह्यास्सुकृतेन च।यन्मां दहनकर्मायं नादहद्धव्यवाहनः।।5.55.24।।
55_24.translation: 'Fire, the consumer of oblations who has the property of burning has not burnt me and this is surely on account of Rama's power and Vaidehi's merits.
55_24.word_by_word: दहनकर्मा fire who consumes, अयम् this, हन्यवाहनः the consumer of oblations, माम् me, नादहत् did not burn, इति यत् and this is, नूनम् surely, रामप्रभावेण by Rama's power, वैदेह्याः Vaidehi's, सुकृतेन च by her merits also.

55_25.shloka: त्रयाणां भरतादीनां भ्रात्रूणां देवता च या।रामस्य च मन: कान्ता सा कथं विनशिष्यति।।5.55.25।।
55_25.translation: 'To Bharata, Lakshmana and Satrughna she is a goddess and she is dear to Rama's heart, how would she perish?
55_25.word_by_word: या such lady, भरतादीनाम् of Bharata and others, त्रयाणाम् of all the three, देवताः च is treated as a goddess, रामस्य Rama's, मनः कान्ता dear to his heart, सा she, कथम् how, विनशिष्यति will she be destroyed?

55_26.shloka: यद्वा दहनकर्मायं सर्वत्र प्रभुरव्ययः।न मे दहति लाङ्गूलं कथमार्यां प्रधक्ष्यति।।5.55.26।
55_26.translation: 'If not so, the firegod who never fails in burning has not burnt my tail. How will he burn noble Sita?'
55_26.word_by_word: यद्वा or if, सर्वत्र everywhere, प्रभुः lord, अव्ययः that which never fails, अयम् this, दहनकर्मा burning firegod, मे my, लङ्गूलम् tail, न दहति has not burnt, आर्याम् noble Sita, कथम् how, प्रधक्ष्यति will he burn.

55_27.translation: Then Hanuman thought of the appearance of mountain Hiranyanabha in the midst of water, a wonderful phenomenon.
55_27.word_by_word: तदा then, हनुमान् Hanuman, विस्मितः wondered, जलमध्ये in the midst of water, हिरण्यनाभस्य of Hiranyanabha's, गिरेः mountain, प्रदर्शनम् appearing, तत्र there, पुनः again, अचिन्तयत् thought.

55_28.shloka: तपसा सत्यवाक्येन अनन्यत्वाच्च भर्तरि।अपि सा निर्दहेदग्निं न तामग्निः प्रधक्ष्यति।।5.55.28।।
55_28.translation: 'By virtue of her power of asceticism, power of truthfulness and exclusive devotion towards her husband, she may consume the fire. Fire will not burn her'.
55_28.word_by_word: तपसा by asceticism, सत्यवाक्येन by adhering to truth, भर्तरि towards her husband, अनन्यत्वाच्च completeexclusive devotion, सा she, अग्निम् fire, निर्दहेत् अपि may even burn, ताम् her, अग्निः fire, न प्रधक्ष्यति is not capable of burning.

55_29.shloka: स तथा चिन्तयंस्तत्र देव्या धर्मपरिग्रहम्।शुश्राव हनुमान्वाक्यं चारणानां महात्मनाम्।।5.55.29।।
55_29.translation: As Hanuman was thinking so, he heard the words of the great charanas who were praising the queen's power of righteousness.
55_29.word_by_word: तत्र there, तथा so, देव्याः queen's, धर्मपरिग्रहम् power of righteousness, चिन्तयन् while thinking, सः हनुमान् that Hanuman, महात्मनाम् of the great ones, चारणानाम् of charanas (heavenly birds moving in the sky), वाक्यम् word, शुश्राव heard.

55_30.shloka: अहो खलु कृतं कर्म दुष्करं हि हनूमता।अग्निं विसृजताऽभीक्ष्णं भीमं राक्षसवेश्मनि।।5.55.30।।
55_30.translation: 'Oh Hanuman has indeed accomplished the marvellous task of spreading the terrific fire on the demons buildings.
55_30.word_by_word: राक्षसवेश्मनि in the demons buildings, आभीक्ष्णम् excessively, भीमम् terrific, अग्निम् fire, विसृजता spreading, हनूमता by Hanuman, दुष्करम् marvellous, कर्म task, कृतं खलु has been done verily, अहो Oh

55_31.translation: The city is crowded with women, children and old demons running (in a bid to save themselves). The loud wails of demons resounded in the mountaincaves. It was as if the city was shrieking loudly.
55_31.word_by_word: प्रपलायितरक्षस्त्रीबालवृद्धसमाकुला crowded with children, women and old demons running (in a bid to save their lives), जनकोलाहलाध्माता loud with the wails of demons people, अद्रिकन्दरे with the cave like houses, क्रन्दन्ती इव as if  wailing loudly.

55_32.shloka: दग्धेयं नगरी सर्वा साट्टप्राकारतोरणा।जानकी न च दग्धेति विस्मयोऽद्भुत एव नः।।5.55.32।।
55_32.translation: 'The city with its towering markets, ramparts and portals is burnt, but Janaki is not. It is really wonderful, strange
55_32.word_by_word: साट्टप्राकारतोरणा with towering markets ramparts and portals, इयम् this, नगरी city, सर्वा entirely, दग्धा is burnt, जानकी च and Janaki, न दग्धा is not burnt, इति thus, नः for us, अद्भुतः wonderful, विस्मयः एव It is surprising.

55_33.shloka: स निमित्तैश्च दृष्टार्थैः कारणैश्च महागुणैः।ऋषिवाक्यैश्च हनुमानभवत्प्रीतमानसः।।5.55.33।।
55_33.translation: With omens that proved to be right and for good reasons and from the words of the sages (charanas), Hanuman felt happy.
55_33.word_by_word: सः हनूमान् that Hanuman, दृष्ठार्थैः with proofs having seen, निमित्तै: with omens, महागुणैः  good tidings, कारणैश्च and by reasons, ऋषिवाक्यैश्च by the sages words, प्रीतमानसः happy at heart, अभवत् became.

55_34.shloka: ततः कपिः प्राप्तमनोरथार्थस्तामक्षतां राजसुतां विदित्वा।प्रत्यक्षतस्तां पुनरेव दृष्टवा प्रतिप्रयाणाय मतिं चकार।।5.55.34।।
55_34.translation: Hanuman, having fulfilled his desires and knowing that Sita is not hurt, thought of departing after meeting Sita once again (to testify that she is really safe).इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये सुन्दरकाण्डे पञ्चपञ्चाशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the fiftyfifth sarga of Sundarakanda  of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
55_34.word_by_word: ततः then, कपिः Hanuman, प्राप्तमनोरथार्थः with his desires fulfilled, तां राजसुताम् the princess, अक्षताम् not hurt, विदित्वा after knowing, ताम् her, पुनरेव once again, प्रत्यक्षतः directly, दृष्ट्वा after seeing, प्रतिप्रयाणाय for departing, मतिम् thought, चकार entertained.

56_1.shloka: [Hanuman takes leave of Sita -- sets out for the northern shore -- Description of Arishta mountain]ततस्तु शिंशुपामूले जानकीं पर्युपस्थिताम्।अभिवाद्याब्रवीद्दिष्ट्या पश्यामि त्वामिहाक्षताम्।।5.56.1।।
56_1.translation: Then Hanuman offered salutations to Janaki, stationed at the foot of the simsupa tree, and said, "Luckily I see you unscathed."
56_1.word_by_word: ततः then, शिंशुपामूले under the simsupa tree, पर्युपस्थिताम् stationed, जानकीम् Janakai, अभिवाद्य offered salutation, अब्रवीत् said, दिष्ट्या luckily, अक्षताम् unscathed, त्वाम् you, इह here, पश्यामि I see you.

56_2.shloka: ततस्तं प्रस्थितं सीता वीक्षमाणा पुनः पुनः।भर्तृस्नेहान्वितं वाक्यं हनुमन्तमभाषत।।5.56.2।।
56_2.translation: Looking at Hanuman again and again, as he was ready to start on his return journey, thus spoke Sita expressing her love for her husband:
56_2.word_by_word: ततः then, प्रस्थितम् him who was ready to start his journey, तं हनुमन्तम् that Hanuman, पुनः पुनः again and again, वीक्षमाणा looking at him, सीता Sita, भर्तृस्नेहान्वितम् showing her love for her husband, वाक्यम् this word, अभाषत spoke.

56_3.shloka: काममस्य त्वमेवैकः कार्यस्य परिसाधने।पर्याप्तः परवीरघ्न यशस्यस्ते बलोदयः।।5.56.3।।
56_3.translation: "O destroyer of foes, you are capable of rescuing me singlehanded. Your success will  raise your strength and bring glory.
56_3.word_by_word: परवीरघ्नः destroyer of foes, अस्य कार्यस्य of this task, परिसाधने in this task (of rescuing), त्वम् you, एकः एव singlehanded, कामम् indeed, पर्याप्तः capable, ते to you, बलोदयः rise of strength, यशस्यः will bring glory.

56_4.shloka: शरैस्तु सङ्कुलां कृत्वा लङ्कां परबलार्दनः।मां नयेद्यदि काकुत्स्थस्तत्तस्य सदृशं भवेत्।।5.56.4।।
56_4.translation: "If Kakutstha Rama, the slayer of enemy forces comes to Lanka, fills it with his arrows and takes me back, it will be worthy of him.
56_4.word_by_word: परबलार्दनः slayer of enemy forces,काकुत्स्थः Kakutstha,लङ्काम् to Lanka, शरैः तु with arrows indeed, सङ्कुलाम् spreading, कृत्वा all over, माम् me, नयेद्यदि if he takes me, तत् that, तस्य for him, सदृशम् worthy, भवेत् will be.

56_5.shloka: तद्यथा तस्य विक्रान्तमनुरूपं महात्मनः।भवत्याहवशूरस्य तथा त्वमुपपादय।।5.56.5।।
56_5.translation: "You should act in such a manner that the exalted Rama, who is chivalrous in the battlefield, exhibits his valour worthy of his stature".
56_5.word_by_word: तत् that, महात्मनः the exalted, आहवशूरस्य who is chivalrous in the battle, तस्य his, विक्रान्तम् heroic advance, अनुरूपम् worthy of his stature, यथा as such, भवति will be, तथा that manner, त्वम् you, उपपादय act.

56_6.shloka: तदर्थोपहितं वाक्यं प्रश्रितं हेतुसंहितम्।निशम्य हनुमांस्तस्या वाक्यमुत्तरमब्रवीत्।।5.56.6।।
56_6.translation: Hearing her meaningful reply which was welldisposed and reasonable, Hanumanreplied:
56_6.word_by_word: हनुमान् Hanuman, प्रश्रितम् properly inclined, हेतुसंहितम् support with reason, अर्थोपहितम् meaningful, तस्याः  her, तत् that, वाक्यम् word, निशम्य after hearing, उत्तरम् reply, वाक्यम् these words, अब्रवीत् spoke.

56_7.shloka: क्षिप्रमेष्यति काकुत्स्थः हर्यृक्षप्रवरैर्वृतः।यस्ते युधि विजित्यारीन् शोकं व्यपनयिष्यति।।5.56.7।।
56_7.translation: "Rama will come soon with the best of vanaras and bears. He would win the battle and remove your sorrrow.
56_7.word_by_word: काकुत्स्थः Kakutstha, हर्यृक्षप्रवरैः with the foremost among vanaras and bears, वृतः surrounded, क्षिप्रम् very soon, एष्यति he will come, यः he who, युधि in battle, अरीन् enemies, विजित्य having won, ते your, शोकम् sorrow, व्यपनयिष्यति will remove.

56_8.shloka: एवमाश्वास्य वैदेहीं हनुमान् मारुतात्मजः।गमनाय मतिं कृत्वा वैदेहीमभ्यवादयत्।।5.56.8।।
56_8.translation: Hanuman, son of the Windgod having consoled Vaidehi, saluted her respectfully and decided to depart.
56_8.word_by_word: मारुतात्मजः son of the Windgod, हनुमान् Hanuman, वैदेहीम् to Vaidehi, एवम् in that way, आश्वास्य having consoled, गमनाय to depart, मतिम् his mind, कृत्वा after deciding, वैदेहीम् to Vaidehi, अभ्यवादयत् respectfully saluted.

56_9.translation: Then Hanuman, the crusher of enemies, a tiger among vanaras anxious to see his lord ascended the mount Arishta.
56_9.word_by_word: ततः then, अरिमर्दनः crusher of foes, सः he, कपिशार्दूलः a tiger among vanaras, स्वामिसन्दर्शनोत्सुकः anxious to see his lord, अरिष्टम् Arishta, गिरिश्रेष्ठम् excellent mountain, आरुरोह ascended.

56_10.translation: Mount Arishta was full of blue forestranges with choicest tall padmaka trees. With clouds hanging on the slopes of mountain peaks, it appeared as though the mountain was wrapped in an upper garment.
56_10.word_by_word: तुङ्गपद्मकजुष्टाभि: by those choicest tall padmaka trees, नीलाभिः by dark ones, वनराजिभिः with forest ranges, शृङ्गान्तरविलम्बिभिः hanging down from the spaces between the peaks of mountain, अम्भोदैः the rainy clouds, सोत्तरीयमिव as if covered with an upper garment.

56_11.translation: As if the mountain was awakened from sleep by the rays of the blessed Sun. With the colour of glowing minerals exuding, it was as if the mountain was looking out with his eyes open. (The minerals underneath the mud appear when wind blows removing the dust covering them. The glowing minerals are fancied to be eyes of the mountain.)
56_11.word_by_word: शुभैः with auspicious ones, दिवाकरकरैः with Sun's rays, प्रीत्या affectionately, बोध्यमानमिव as if he was being awakened, उद्धूतैः with those pushed up (by wind), लोचनैरिव like with the eyes, धातुभिः with the minerals, उन्मिषन्तमिव as if he opening.

56_12.translation: With the loud sounds of masses of gurgling waters, the mountain appeared as thoughit was standing and reciting (the Vedas) loudly. With murmuring sounds of different waterfalls, it appeared as though the mountain was singing. (The sage differentiates the steadily trickling watersound from the rhythmic musical sounds of waterfalls.)
56_12.word_by_word: मन्द्रैः with loud, तोयौघनिस्वनैः sounds of gurgling masses of waters, प्राधीतमिव as if reciting (loudly), विस्पष्टैः with clear sounds, नानाप्रस्रवणस्वनैः with different kinds of sounds of waterfalls, प्रगीतमिव as if singing, पर्वतम् mountain.

56_13.translation: With the tall devadaru trees on the mountain, it appeared as if the sages were standing with shoulders lifted up and performing penance. The sounds of waterfalls filled all over with reverberations.
56_13.word_by_word: अत्युच्चैः by the tall ones, देवदारुभिः with devadaru trees, ऊर्ध्वबाहुमिव as if with raised hands, स्थितम् standing, प्रपातजलनिर्घोषैः with the sounds of waterfalls, सर्वतः all over, प्राक्रुष्टमिव like the reverberations

56_14.translation: The mountain appeared as if trembling with the dark clouds of autumn. The shrill sounds pasing through the hollow bamboos filled with air appeared as if it was producing sweet musical notes.
56_14.word_by_word: श्यामैः with dark ones, कम्पमानैः with shaking, शरद्वनैः clouds of autumn, वेपमानमिव as if trembling, वेणुभिः कीचकैः with hollow bamboos, मारुतोद्धूतैः hit by the wind, कीचकैः hollow bamboos rattling in the wind, कूजन्तमिव appearing like the warbling sound.

56_15.translation: The mountain was as though hissing like a dreadful, poisonous snake. With the caves standing majestically covered with mist, the mountain appeared as if it was meditating.
56_15.word_by_word: घोरैः with dreadful ones, आशीविषोत्तमैः with poisonous snakes, निःश्वसन्तमिव as if hissing, नीहारकृतगम्भीरैः with majestically covered heavy mist, गह्वरैः with caves, ध्यायन्तमिव as though meditating, controlling all senses.

56_16.translation: With the ranges of foothills appearing like the feet of clouds traversing, with its peaks like garlands of clouds traversing over the mountain, it made one feel it was yawning.
56_16.word_by_word: मेघपादनिभैः appearing like the feet of clouds, पादैः with its feet, सर्वत: all over, प्रक्रान्तमिव as if traversing, अभ्रमालिभिः with ranges of clouds, शिखरैः with its peaks, आकाशे in the sky, जृम्भमाणमिव as if yawning.

56_17.shloka: कूटैश्च बहुधा कीर्णैश्शोभितं बहुकन्दरैः।सालतालाश्वकर्णैश्च वंशैश्च बहुभिर्वृतम्।।5.56.17।।
56_17.translation: With many kinds of caves and peaks scattered all over, the mountain looked delightful. It was canopied with numerous trees like Sal, palms, Aswakarnas and bamboos.
56_17.word_by_word: बहुधा many kinds, कीर्णैः scattered with, बहुकन्दरैः with many caves, कूटैश्च with mountain peaks, शोभितम् delighting, बहुभिः with many, सालतालाश्वकर्णैश्च with Sal, palms, Aswakarna trees and, वंशैश्च with bamboos and reeds, वृतम् canopied with.

56_18.translation: It was spread with creepers filled with beautiful flowers and herds of animals. The colourful minerals flowing down decorated the mountain.
56_18.word_by_word: विततैः with those spread out, पुष्पवद्भिः with those filled with flowers, लतावितानैः with creepers stretched all over, अलङ्कृतम् decorated, नानामृगगणाकीर्णम् crowded with herds of animals, धातुनिष्यन्दभूषितम् decorated with colourful minerals dropping down.

56_19.translation: There were many streams of water flowing and rocks making it difficult for the streams to flow. The mountain was inhabited by sages, yakshas, gandharvas, kinnaras and nagas, and uragas.
56_19.word_by_word: बहुप्रस्रवणोपेतम् full of waterfalls, शिलासञ्चयसङ्कटम् with heaps of rocks making (the streams' flow difficult), महर्षियक्षगन्धर्वकिन्नरोरगसेवितम् attended with sages, yakshas, gandharvas, kinnaras and nagas.

56_20.translation: The clusters of creepers, and trees bearing tasty fruits and roots were uprooted. There were caves inhabited by lions. Herds of tigers were scattered all over (by the impetus of Hanuman's pressure on the mountain).
56_20.word_by_word: लतापादपसङ्घातम् with clusters of creepers and trees, सिंहाध्युषितकन्दरम् caves inhabited by lions, व्याघ्रसङ्घसमाकीर्णम् herds of tigers scattered all over, स्वादुमूलफलद्रुमम् full of trees bearing tasty roots and fruits.

56_21.translation: Anxious to see Rama soon, the son of the Windgod ascended the mountain happily.
56_21.word_by_word: पवनात्मजः son of the Windgod, हनुमान् Hanuman, रामदर्शनशीघ्रेण anxious to see Rama soon, प्रहर्षेण with joy, अभिचोदितः  prompted, तं पर्वतम् that mountain, आरुरोह ascended.

56_22.translation: Crushed under Hanuman's feet the rocks making a loud noise on the beautiful mountain ranges rolled down, reduced to powder.
56_22.word_by_word: ततः then, रम्येषु in delightful ones, गिरिसानुषु on mountain ranges, तेन by him, पादतलाक्रान्ताः crushed by his feet, शिलाः rocks, सघोषाः making loud sound, चूर्णीकृताः reduced to powder, समशीर्यन्त rolled down.

56_23.shloka: स तमारुह्य शैलेन्द्रं व्यवर्धत महाकपिः।दक्षिणादुत्तरं पारं प्रार्थयन् लवणाम्भसः।।5.56.23।।
56_23.translation: On ascending the king of mountains, desiring to reach the northern shore of the saltwater ocean from the Southern shore, he enlarged his body (in preparation to leap).
56_23.word_by_word: सः महाकपिः that great Hanuman, लवणाम्भसः of the saltwater ocean, दक्षिणात् from the South, उत्तरं पारम् towards northern shore, प्रार्थयन् desiring, तं शैलेन्द्रम् that king of mountains, आरुह्य having ascended, व्यवर्धत started enlarging body.

56_24.shloka: अधिरुह्य ततो वीरः पर्वतं पवनात्मजः।ददर्श सागरं भीमं मीनोरगनिषेवितम्।।5.56.24।।
56_24.translation: Then the heroic son of the Windgod, who had ascended the mountain saw the dreadful ocean inhabited by fishes and snakes.
56_24.word_by_word: ततः then, वीरः hero, पवनात्मजः son of the Windgod, पर्वतम् mountain, अधिरुह्य having ascended, मीनोरगनिषेवितम् inhabited by fishes and sankes, भीमम् dreadful, सागरम् ocean, ददर्श saw.

56_25.shloka: स मारुत इवाऽकाशं मारुतस्यात्मसम्भवः।प्रपेदे हरिशार्दूलो दक्षिणादुत्तरां दिशम्।।5.56.25।।
56_25.translation: Hanuman, the tiger among monkeys leaped into the sky like the Windgod from the south to the north shore.
56_25.word_by_word: मारुतस्य Windgod's, आत्मसम्भवः son, सः हरिशार्दूलः that tiger among monkeys, दक्षिणात् from the south, उत्तरांदिशम् towards northern side, मारुतः इव like the windgod, आकाशम् sky, प्रपेदे leaped.

56_26.shloka: स तदा पीडितस्तेन कपिना पर्वतोत्तमः।ररास सह तैर्भूतैः प्रविशन्वसुधातलम्।।5.56.26।।कम्पमानैश्च शिखरैः पतद्भिरपि च द्रुमैः।
56_26.translation: Pressed under the feet of Hanuman, the great mountain made loud sound sinking into the earth along with all its creatures, with its shaken mountain peaks and uprooted trees dropping down.
56_26.word_by_word: तदा then, तेन कपिना by that vanara, पीडितः pressed, सः पर्वतोत्तमः that great mountain, तैः those, भूतैः सह along with the creatures, वसुधातलम् to the earth, प्रविशन् while entering, कम्पमानैः with shaking, शिखरैः with peaks, पतद्भिः with dropped, द्रुमैः with trees, ररास crushed down making great sound.

56_27.translation: Shaken by the violent force of Hanuman's thighs, the blossoming trees fell on theground like sickmen hit by Indra's thunderbolt.
56_27.word_by_word: तस्य his, ऊरुवेगात् with the force of his thighs, मथिताः shaken, पुष्पशालिनः trees with blossoms, पादपाः trees, रुग्णाः men suffering with diseases, शक्रायुधहता इव as if struck by Indra's thunderbolt, भूतले on the ground, निपेतुः fell.

56_28.shloka: कन्दरान्तरसंस्थानां पीडितानां महौजसाम्।।5.56.28।।सिंहानां निनदो भीमो नभो भिन्दन् स शुश्रुवे।
56_28.translation: The dreadful roar of strong lions, lying in mountaincaves was heard cracking the sky when they were crushed in the turmoil.
56_28.word_by_word: कन्दरान्तरसंस्थानाम् of those residing in mountain caves, पीडितानाम् of those crushed, महौजसाम् of the powerful ones, सिंहानाम् of lions, भीमः terrific, सः निनदः that noise, नभः sky, भिन्दन् as if breaking, शुश्रुवे was heard.

56_29.translation: The Vidyadharis with their clothes slipped and ornaments disarrayed in fear, at once flew from the mountain.
56_29.word_by_word: विद्याधर्यः Vidyadharis, त्रस्तव्यावृत्तवसनाः with their clothes slipped with fear, व्याकुलीकृतभूषणाः with ornaments disarrayed, सहसा at ones, धरणीधरात् from the mountain, समुत्पेतुः flew.

56_30.shloka: अतिप्रमाणा बलिनो दीप्तजिह्वा महाविषाः।।5.56.30।।निपीडितशिरोग्रीवा व्यचेष्टन्त महाहयः।
56_30.translation: Highly powerful, huge and poisonous snakes with their glowing tongues protruded, pressed on their heads and necks (by Hanuman).
56_30.word_by_word: अतिप्रमाणाः very big ones in size, बलिनः strong ones, दीप्तजिह्वाः with glowing tongues, महाविषाः highly poisonous, महाहयः huge snakes, निपीडितशिरोग्रीवाः pressed on their heads and necks, व्यचेष्टन्त started protruding.

56_31.translation: Then the kinnaras, uragas, gandhravas, yakshas and vidyadharas left the tortured mountain and occupied the sky.
56_31.word_by_word: तदा then, किन्नरोरगगन्धर्वयक्षविद्याधराः kinnaras, uragas, gandharvas, yakshas and vidyadharas, पीडितम् tormented, तं नगवरम् that mountain, त्यक्त्वा having left, गगनम् to the sky, आस्थिताः occupied.

56_32.shloka: स च भूमिधरः श्रीमान्बलिना तेन पीडितः।।5.56.32।।सवृक्षशिखरोदग्रः प्रविवेश रसातलम्।
56_32.translation: Crushed by the powerful Hanuman, that prosperous mountain with its trees standing and tall peaks sank into the underworld.
56_32.word_by_word: बलिना by the powerful one, तेन by him, पीडितः crushed, सवृक्षशिखरोदग्रः along with its trees and standing tall peaks, श्रीमान् prosperous, सः भूमिधरश्च that mountain, रसातलम् underworld, प्रविवेश entered.

56_33.translation: That mountain of ten yojanas in width and thirty yojanas in height got levelled with the earth.
56_33.word_by_word: दशयोजनविस्तारः ten yojanas in width, त्रिंशद्योजनम् thirty yojanas, उच्छ्रितः in height, सः धराधरः that mountain, धरण्याम् along with, समताम् equal, यातः reduced, बभूव became.

56_34.translation: Eager to leap the terrific ocean lashed by huge waves hitting the shore Hanuman rose up effortlessly and jumped into the sky.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये सुन्दरकाण्डे षट्पञ्चाशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the  fiftysixth sarga of Sundarakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
56_34.word_by_word: सः हरिः that vanara, भीमम् terrific, कल्लोलास्फालवेलान्तम् with huge waves dashing towards the shore, लवणार्णवम् ocean of saltwater, सलीलम् easily, लिलङ्घयिषुः desiring to cross, नभः sky, उत्पपात leaped.

57_1.shloka: [Hanuman reaches the northern shore -- announces to vanaras, Angada and Jambavan about his seeing Sita -- every one rejoices to hear the news of Sita.]स चन्द्रकुमुदं रम्यं सार्ककारण्डवं शुभम्।तिष्यश्रवणकादम्बमभ्रशैवालशाद्वलम्।।5.57.1।।पुनर्वसुमहामीनं लोहिताङ्गमहाग्रहम्।ऐरावतमहाद्वीपं स्वातिहंसविलोलितम्।।5.57.2।।वातसङ्घातजातोर्मि चन्द्रांशुशिशिराम्बुमत्।भुजङ्गयक्षगन्धर्वप्रबुद्धकमलोत्पलम्।।5.57.3।।हनुमान्मारुतगतिर्महानौरिव सागरम्।अपारमपरिश्रान्तः पुप्लुवे गगनार्णवम् ।।5.57.4।।
57_1.translation: Hanuman leaped ike the Windgod, unwearied across the sky, as a huge boat crosses an ocean. The ocean was graced with a swan, the sky with constellation of Swati with fullblown lotuses and water lilies, like the nagas, yakshas, and gandharvas gathered together. The Moon in the sky was like a white lotus, the Sun like a waterfowl, theauspicious Tishya and Shravana like the sweetvoiced swans, and the clouds like duckweeds and green grassy spots on the shore. The Punarvasu star was like a large fish and the planet Mars was like a crocodile. Airavata was like the great island. The waves produced by the wind were like cool moonlight in the cold water.
57_1.word_by_word: मारुतगतिः like the Windgod, हनुमान् Hanuman, अपरिश्रान्तः nwearied, सचन्द्रकुमुदम् Moon for a white lotus, सार्ककारण्डवम् Sun for a waterfowl, शुभम् auspicious, तिष्यश्रवणकादम्बम् Tishya and Shravana for sweetvoiced swans, अभ्रशैवालशाद्वलम् clouds for duckweeds and grassy spots on the shores, पुनर्वसुमहामीनम् Punarvasu constellation for large fish, लोहिताङ्गमहाग्रहम् the planet Mars for a crocodile, ऐरावतमहाद्वीपम् Airavata for a large island, स्वातिहंसविलोलितम् Swati for swan in water, वातसङ्घातजातोर्मि waves produced by wind for its billows, चन्द्रांशुश्शिराम्बुमत् cool Moonbeams for cold waters, भुजङ्गयक्षगन्धर्वप्रबुद्धकमलोत्पलम् nagas, yakshas, gandharvas together as fully blossomed lotuses, अपारम् गगनार्णवम् another ocean like, महानौ: huge boat, सागरम् इव like the ocean, पुप्लुवे flew across.

57_2.shloka: ग्रसमान इवाकाशं ताराधिपमिवोल्लिखन्।हरन्निव सनक्षत्रं गगनं सार्कमण्डलम्।।5.57.5।।मारुतस्यात्मजः श्रीमान्कपिर्व्योमचरो महान्।हनुमान्मेघजालानि विकर्षन्निव गच्छति।।5.57.6।।
57_2.translation: Great Hanuman, son of the Windgod, flew through the abode of the Windgod as if he was swallowing the space, scratching the  Moon, lord of the stars, as if seizing the heavens along with the constellation of Sun and stars and as though he was drawing the clusters of clouds.
57_2.word_by_word: मारुतस्य Windgod's, आत्मजः son, श्रीमान् prosperous, महान् great, कपिः monkey, हनुमान् Hanuman, व्योमचरः who moves through the wind, आकाशम् sky, ग्रसमानः इव as if swallowing, ताराधिपम् lord of stars, उल्लिखन्निव as if scratching, सनक्षत्रम् with the stars, सार्कमण्डलम् constellation of Sun, गगनम् sky, हरन्निव as if seizing, मेघजालानि विकर्षन्निव drawing the clusters of clouds, गच्छति flew.

57_3.translation: (In contact with Hanuman) the clouds shone forth brilliantly in white and black, in blue and yellow and in greenish red colour.
57_3.word_by_word: पाण्डरारुणवर्णानि of white and black colour, नीलमाञ्जिष्ठकानि च and of blue yellow colour, हरितारुणवर्णानि of greenish red colour, महाभ्राणि shone briliantly, चकाशिरे made their appearance.

57_4.shloka: प्रविशन्नभ्रजालानि निष्पतंश्च पुनः पुनः।प्रच्छन्नश्च प्रकाशश्च चन्द्रमा इव लक्ष्यते।।5.57.8।।
57_4.translation: With his exist and entrances into the mass of clouds, his appearances and disappearances among the clouds, he looked like the Moon.
57_4.word_by_word: अभ्रजालानि into the mass of clouds, प्रविशन् entering, पुनः पुनः again and again, निष्पतंश्च disappearing, प्रच्छन्नश्च covered by, प्रकाशश्च shining again, चन्द्रमाः like the Moon, लक्ष्यते was appearing.

57_5.translation: Passing through the clouds, appearing and disappearing, the heroic Hanuman clad in white was like the Moon in the white sky.
57_5.word_by_word: तदा then, विविधाभ्रघनासन्नगोचरः passing through the clouds clad in white, धवळाम्बरः white sky, दृश्यादृश्यतनुः appearing and disappearing, वीरः hero, अम्बरे in the sky, चन्द्रायते like the Moon.

57_6.shloka: तार्क्ष्यायमाणो गगने बभासे वायुनन्दनः।दारयन्मेघबृन्दानि निष्पतंश्च पुनः पुनः।।5.57.10।।नदन्नादेन महता मेघस्वनमहास्वनः।
57_6.translation: As he made his way through flakes of clouds, again and again appearing and disappearing, Hanuman the delight of the Windgod shone in the sky roaring like a thundering cloud. He looked like Garuda.
57_6.word_by_word: मेघबृन्दानि through flakes of clouds, दारयन् making way, पुनः पुनः again and again, निष्पतंश्च disappearing, महता great, नादेन in loud voice, नदन् noise, मेघस्वनमहास्वनः roaring like thundering clouds, वायुनन्दनः the delight of the Windgod, गगने in the sky, तार्क्ष्यायमाणः like Garuda, बभासे shone.

57_7.shloka: प्रवरान्राक्षसान् हत्वा नाम विश्राव्य चात्मनः।।5.57.11।।आकुलां नगरीं कृत्वा व्यथयित्वा च रावणम्।अर्दयित्वा बलं घोरं वैदेहीमभिवाद्य च।।5.57.12।।आजगाम महातेजाः पुनर्मध्येन सागरम्।
57_7.translation: The glorious Hanuman, having killed eminent ogres and thereby making himself widely known, having caused havoc to the city of Lanka and  terrific sorrow to Ravana by tormenting the army, offered salutations to Vaidehi from midocean and continued his journey.
57_7.word_by_word: महातेजाः glorious, प्रवरान् eminent, राक्षसान् ogres हत्वा having killed, आत्मनः himself, नाम name, विश्राव्य widely known, नगरीम् in the city, आकुलाम् having caused havoc, कृत्वा  done, रावणम् Ravana, व्यथयित्वा having caused sorrow, घोरम् terrific, बलम् army, अर्दयित्वा having tormented, वैदेहीम् to Vaidehi, अभिवाद्य च having offered salutation, पुनः again, सागरं मध्येन to cross the ocean, आजगाम departed.

57_8.shloka: पर्वतेन्द्रं सुनाभं च समुपस्पृश्य वीर्यवान्।।5.57.13।।ज्यामुक्त इव नाराचो महावेगोऽभ्युपागतः।
57_8.translation: The valiant Hanuman touched the lord of mountains fondly and went with great speed just as an arrow released from the centre of a powerful bowstring.
57_8.word_by_word: वीर्यवान् hero, पर्वतेन्द्रम् lord of mountains,सुनाभं च from the centre, समुपस्पृश्य touched fondly, ज्यामुक्तः telling everything, नाराचः इव like the arrow from a powerful bowstring, महावेगः with great speed, अभ्युपागतः went.

57_9.shloka: स किञ्चिदनुसम्प्राप्तः समालोक्य महागिरिम्।।5.57.14।।महेन्द्रं मेघसङ्काशं ननाद हरिपुङ्गवः।
57_9.translation: The chief of the monkeys arrived near, and beholding the face of the Mahendra mountain, which resembled a mass of clouds, thundered.
57_9.word_by_word: सः he, हरिपुङ्गवः chief of monkeys, महागिरिम् great mountain, मेघसङ्काशम् resembling the mass of cloud, महेन्द्रम् Mahendra, किञ्चित् a little, अनुसम्प्राप्तः coming near, समालोक्य beholding, ननाद thundered.

57_10.shloka: स पूरयामास कपिर्दिशो दश समन्ततः।।5.57.15।।नदन्नादेन महता मेघस्वनमहास्वनः।
57_10.translation: The thundering noise of Hanuman filled all the ten directions with great sound.
57_10.word_by_word: मेघस्वनमहास्वनः one who makes a thundering noise, सः कपिः that Hanuman, नदन् noise, महता great, नादेन by the noise, दश दिशः all the ten directions, समन्ततः all over, पूरयामास filled.

57_11.shloka: स तं देशमनुप्राप्तः सुहृद्धर्शनलालसः।।5.57.16।।ननाद हरिशार्दूलो लाङ्गूलं चाप्यकम्पयत्।
57_11.translation: Having sighted the place of his companions and waiting to see them for long that tiger among monkeys made a loud noise and shook his tail in joy.
57_11.word_by_word: तं देशम् that place, अनुप्राप्तः having sighted, सुहृद्धर्शनलालसः waiting to see his companions, सः हरिशार्दूलः that tiger among monkeys, ननाद made loud noise, लाङ्गूलम् his tail, अकम्पयच्च shook in joy.

57_12.shloka: तस्य नानद्यमानस्य सुपर्णचरिते पथि।।5.57.17।।फलतीवास्य घोषेण गगनं सार्कमण्डलम्।
57_12.translation: By the terrific sounds made by Hanuman in joy, it seemed as though the pathway of Garuda, the sky along with the Sun's orbit was splitting.
57_12.word_by_word: सुपर्णचरिते the path way of Suparna, पथि lord, नानद्यमानस्य making terrific sound, अस्य by his, घोषेण sound, सार्कमण्डलम् the Sun's orbit, गगनम् the sky, फलति इव as if splitting.

57_13.shloka: ये तु तत्रोत्तरे तीरे समुद्रस्य महाबलाः।।5.57.18।।पूर्वं संविष्ठिताश्शूरा वायुपुत्रदिदृक्षवः।महतो वातनुन्नस्य तोयदस्येव गर्जितम्।।5.57.19।।शुश्रुवुस्ते तदा घोषमूरुवेगं हनूमतः।
57_13.translation: Thereafter the brave and powerful monkeys waiting on the northern shore of the ocean for the arrival of the son of the Windgod, heard the roar and thundering sound of the stormy cloud produced by the sweeping motion of Hanuman's thighs propelled by the speed of his movement.
57_13.word_by_word: तत्र thereafter, समुद्रस्य ocean's, उत्तरे तीरे northern shore, पूर्वम् earlier, संविष्ठिताः waiting, महाबलाः powerful (monkeys), शूराः brave, वायुपुत्रदिदृक्षवः awaiting the arrival of the son of the Windgod, ये those, ते what, तदा then, वातनुन्नस्य by the impact of sweeping motion of his thighs, महतः great, तोयदस्य stormy cloud's, गर्जितम् इव like the thundering noise, हनूमतः of Hanuman, घोषम् roaring, ऊरुवेगम् by the speed, शुश्रुवुः heard.

57_14.shloka: ते दीनमनसस्सर्वे शुश्रुवुः काननौकसः।।5.57.20।।वानरेन्द्रस्य निर्घोषं पर्जन्यनिनदोपमम्।
57_14.translation: All the vanaras who were feeling dejected and waiting anxiously heard the noise of Hanuman that sounded like a thundering cloud.
57_14.word_by_word: दीनमनसः dejected at heart, ते they, सर्वे all, काननौकसः with eagerness, वानरेन्द्रस्य chief of vanara's, पर्जन्यनिनदोपमम् like the thundering of clouds, निर्घोषम् noise, शुश्रुवुः heard.

57_15.shloka: निशम्य नदतो नादं वानरास्ते समन्ततः।।5.57.21।।बभूवुरुत्सुकास्सर्वे सुहृद्धर्शनकाङ्क्षिणः।
57_15.translation: On hearing the loud voice of Hanuman, all the vanaras were longing to see their friend.
57_15.word_by_word: समन्ततः together, सर्वे all of them, ते वानराः those vanaras, नदतः chattering, नादम् voice, निशम्य hearing, सुहृद्धर्शनकाङ्क्षिणः waiting to see their friend, उत्सुकाः eager, बभूवुः became.

57_16.shloka: जाम्बवान् स हरिश्रेष्ठः प्रीतिसंहृष्टमानसः।।5.57.22।।उपामन्त्र्य हरीन् सर्वानिदं वचनमब्रवीत्।
57_16.translation: Jambavan the chief of vanaras became very happy at heart and called all the vanaras and spoke:
57_16.word_by_word: हरिश्रेष्ठः chief of vanaras, सः जाम्बवान् that Jambavan, प्रीतिसंहृष्टमानसः very happy at heart, सर्वान् all, हरीन् monkeys, उपामन्त्य्र called, इदम् these, वचनम् words, अब्रवीत् spoke.

57_17.shloka: सर्वथा कृतकार्योऽसौ हनुमान्नात्र संशयः।।5.57.23।।न ह्यस्याकृतकार्यस्य नाद एवंविधो भवेत्।
57_17.translation: "Oh Hanuman is always successful. If he has not, he would not make sounds in this manner".
57_17.word_by_word: असौ Oh that, हनुमान् Hanuman, सर्वथा always, कृतकार्यः successful, अकृतकार्यस्य if he was not successsful, अस्य his, नादः sound, एवंविधः in this manner, न भवेत् हि will not be so.

57_18.shloka: तस्य बाहूरुवेगं च निनादं च महात्मनः।।5.57.24।।निशम्य हरयो हृष्टाः समुत्पेतुस्ततस्ततः।
57_18.translation: Hearing the sound of his dashing movements of arms and thighs the vanaras jumpedabout in joy, then and there.
57_18.word_by_word: महात्मनः great self, तस्य his, बहूरुवेगं च speed of his arms and thighs, निनादं च sounds, निशम्य rejoiced, हृष्टाः joyful, हरयः vanaras, ततस्ततः then and there, समुत्पेतुः jumped in joy.

57_19.shloka: ते नगाग्रान्नगाग्राणि शिखराच्छिखराणि च।।5.57.25।।प्रहृष्टाः समपद्यन्त हनूमन्तं दिदृक्षवः।
57_19.translation: The vanaras were very happy. Longing to see Hanuman, they jumped from one tree top to another and from one peak of a mountain to the other.
57_19.word_by_word: ते those vanaras, प्रहृष्टाः very happy, हनूमन्तम् Hanuman, दिदृक्षवः longing to see him, नगाग्रात् from the top of a tree, नगाग्राणि to another tree top, शिखरात् from the peak of mountain, शिखराणि च to another peak of a mountain, समपद्यन्त jumped.

57_20.shloka: ते प्रीताः पादपाग्रेषु गृह्य शाखाः सुविष्ठिताः।।5.57.26।।वासांसीव प्रशाखाश्च समाविध्यन्त वानराः।
57_20.translation: Waiting for Hanuman, the vanaras jumped from the tree tops holding the branches. They shook the branches just like clothes to welcome friends.
57_20.word_by_word: ते वानराः those vanaras, प्रीताः happily, पादपाग्रेषु from the tree top, शाखाः branches, गृह्य holding, सुविष्ठिताः waiting, प्रशाखाः the branches, वासांसीव like clothes, समाविध्यन्त shook them.

57_21.shloka: गिरिगह्वरसंलीनो यथा गर्जति मारुतः।।5.57.27।।एवं जगर्ज बलवान् हनुमान्मारुतात्मजः।
57_21.translation: Hanuman, the powerful son of the Windgod roared like the wind captured in a mountain cave would.
57_21.word_by_word: गिरिगह्वरसंलीनः like the wind in the mountain caves, मारुतः wind, यथा similarly, गर्जति roared, बलवान् powerful, मारुतात्मजः son of the Windgod, हनुमान् Hanuman, एवम् in that way, जगर्ज roared.

57_22.shloka: तमभ्रघनसङ्काशमापतन्तं महाकपिम्।।5.57.28।।दृष्ट्वा ते वानरास्सर्वे तस्थुः प्राञ्जलयस्तदा।
57_22.translation: (On seeing) Hanuman, who was resembling a heavy cloud approaching, the vanaras stood with folded hands.
57_22.word_by_word: तदा then, अभ्रघनसङ्काशम् resembling heavy cloud, आपतन्तम् approaching, तं महाकपिम् that great vanara, दृष्ट्वा having seen, ते those, वानराः vanaras, प्राञ्जलयः with folded hands, तस्थुः stood.

57_23.shloka: ततस्तु वेगवांस्तस्य गिरेर्गिरिनिभः कपिः।।5.57.29।।निपपात महेन्द्रस्य शिखरे पादपाकुले।
57_23.translation: Thereafter the vanara, who resembled a mountain, descended with great speed on the summit of mount Mahendra full of trees.
57_23.word_by_word: ततः thereafter, गिरिनिभः of mountain size, वेगवान् with great speed, कपिः monkey, तस्य on that, महेन्द्रस्य Mahendra's,  गिरेः mountain, पादपाकुले full of trees, शिखरे summit, निपपात descended.

57_24.translation: Overwhelmed with immeasurable joy, Hanuman descended from the sky like the mountain with its wings cut off and dropped on the bank of a mountain stream.
57_24.word_by_word: हर्षेण आपूर्यमाणः full of immeasurable joy, असौ that, छिन्नपक्षः with wings cut off, धरणीधरः इव like a mountain, रम्ये delighted, पर्वन्तिर्झरे on the bank of the mountain stream, आकाशात् from the sky, पपात landed.

57_25.shloka: ततस्ते प्रीतमनसस्सर्वे वानरपुङ्गवाः।।5.57.31।।हनुमन्तं महात्मानं परिवार्योपतस्थिरे।परिवार्य च ते सर्वे परां प्रीतिमुपागताः।।5.57.32।।
57_25.translation: Feeling very happy at heart all the vanara leaders gathered around Hanuman. They  stood motionless with extreme happiness.
57_25.word_by_word: ततः then, सर्वे all, ते of them, वानरपुङ्गवाः vanara leaders, प्रीतमनसः happy at heart, महात्मानम् that great self, हनुमन्तम् to Hanuman, परिवार्य surrounded, उपतस्थिरे without moving, ते सर्वे all of them, परिवार्य around, पराम् extreme, प्रीतिम् joyful, उपागताः became.

57_26.shloka: प्रहृष्टवदना स्सर्वे तमरोगमुपागतम्।उपायनानि चादाय मूलानि च फलानि च।।5.57.33।।प्रत्यर्चयन् हरिश्रेष्ठं हरयो मारुतात्मजम्।
57_26.translation: The vanaras were filled with joy seeing Hanuman who returned unhurt. They offered roots and fruits to him. Hanuman on his part offered salutations to the foremost of the monkeys.
57_26.word_by_word: सर्वे हरयः the vanaras, प्रहृष्टवदनाः face filled with joy, मूलानि च even roots, फलानि च and fruits, उपायनानि gifts, आदाय offered, आरोगम् without being hurt, उपागतम् returned, हरिश्रेष्ठम् foremost of monkeys, मारुतात्मजम् son of the Windgod, प्रत्यर्पयन् offered salutations.

57_27.translation: The great Hanuman also offered salutations to elders, preceptors such as Jambavan and other leaders. He also saluted the young Angada.
57_27.word_by_word: तदा then, महाकपिः great monkey, हनुमांस्तु Hanuman also, गुरून् preceptors, वृद्धान् elders, जाम्बवत्प्रमुखान् Jambavan and other leaders, कुमारम् to the young, अङ्गदं चैव Angada also, अवन्दत  saluted.

57_28.shloka: स ताभ्यां पूजितः पूज्यः कपिभिश्च प्रसादितः।।5.57.35।।दृष्टा सीतेति विक्रान्त स्संक्षेपेण न्यवेदयत्।
57_28.translation: The valiant Hanuman worthy of worship having been honoured by both Jambavan and Angada was pleased. He responded briefly, saying 'Saw Sita'.
57_28.word_by_word: विक्रान्तः valiant one, पूज्यः worthy of worship, सः he, ताभ्याम् both, पूजितः having been honoured, कपिभिः by vanaras also, प्रसादितः pleased, सीता Sita, दृष्टा saw, इति this, सङ्क्षेपेण briefly, न्यवेदयत् revealed.

57_29.shloka: निषसाद च हस्तेन गृहीत्वा वालिनस्सुतम्।।5.57.36।।रमणीये वनोद्देशे महेन्द्रस्य गिरेस्तदा।
57_29.translation: Then holding the hand of Vali's son he sat down at a beautiful location of the garden of mountain Mahendra.
57_29.word_by_word: तदा then, वालिनः Vali's, सुतम् son, हस्तेन with hand, गृहीत्वा holding, महेन्द्रस्य गिरेः Mahendra mountain, रमणीये beautiful, वनोद्धेशे place of the garden, निषसाद च sat down.

57_30.shloka: हनुमानब्रवीद्धृष्टस्तदा तान्वानरर्षभान्।।5.57.37।।अशोकवनिकासंस्था दृष्टा सा जनकात्मजा।रक्षमाणा सुघोराभी राक्षसीभिरनिन्दिता।।5.57.38।।एकवेणीधरा बाला रामदर्शनलालसा।उपवासपरिश्रान्ता जटिला मलिना कृशा।।5.57.39।।
57_30.translation: Hanuman felt happy and told Angada, the bull of vanaras, "I saw Sita in the groves of Ashoka guarded by dreadful ogres. She is blameless, eager to see Rama. She is wearing a single braid of hair. She is young and emaciated due to fasting. Her hair is matted and soiled".
57_30.word_by_word: तदा then, हृष्टः became happy, हनुमान् Hanuman, तान् them, वानरर्षभान् bull among vanaras, अब्रवीत् said, अशोकवनिकासंस्था in the groves of Ashoka trees, सुघोराभिः verydreadful, राक्षसीभिः demons, रक्ष्यमाणा guarded by, अनिन्दिता blameless lady, एकवेणीधरा having one braid, बाला young, रामदर्शनलालसा with eagerness to see Rama, उपवासपरिश्रान्ता emaciated due to fasting, जटिला hair matted, मलिना soiled, कृशा weakened, सा जनकात्मजा that Janaka's daughter, दृष्टा saw.

57_31.shloka: ततो दृष्टेति वचनं महार्थममृतोपमम्।निशम्य मारुतेस्सर्वे मुदिता वानराभवन्।।5.57.40।।
57_31.translation: Then hearing Hanuman's meaningful and nectarlike words all the vanaras rejoiced.
57_31.word_by_word: ततः then, दृष्टा seeing, इति thus, मारुतेः Hanuman, महार्थम् most meaningful, अमृतोपमम् like nectar, वचनम् these words, निशम्य hearing, सर्वे all, वानराः vanara, मुदिताः joyful, अभवन् remained.

57_32.shloka: क्ष्वेलन्त्यन्ये नदन्त्यन्ये गर्जन्त्यन्ये महाबलाः।चक्रुः किलकिलामन्ये प्रतिगर्जन्ति चापरे।।5.57.41।।
57_32.translation: Some powerful vanaras howled, some chattered, some roared and some screamed, going round and round and others echoed the sounds.
57_32.word_by_word: महाबलाः powerful, अन्ये others, क्ष्वेलन्ति howled, अन्ये some others, नदन्ति chattered, अन्ये some others, गर्जन्ति roared like lion, अन्ये some, किलकिलाम् screamed, चक्रुः round and round, आपरे went, प्रतिगर्जन्ति echoed the roaring.

57_33.translation: Some elephantlike vanaras who were excited and felt overjoyed lifted their long and beautiful tails and hit them on the ground.
57_33.word_by_word: प्रहृष्टाः very exited with joy, केचित् a few, कपिकुञ्जराः elephants among monkeys, उच्छ्रितलाङ्गूलाः lifted their tails, आयताञ्चितदीर्घाणि beautiful and long ones, लाङ्गूलानि tails, प्रविव्यधुः hit on the ground.

57_34.shloka: अपरे च हनूमन्तं वानरा वारणोपमम्।आप्लुत्य गिरिशृङ्गेभ्यस्संस्पृशन्ति स्म हर्षिताः।।5.57.43।।
57_34.translation: A few vanaras jumped down from the mountain top and hugged the elephantlike Hanuman.
57_34.word_by_word: आपरे a few, वानराः vanaras, हर्षिताः in happiness, गिरिशृङ्गेभ्यः from the top of the mountain, आप्लुत्य jumped down, वारणोपमम् elephantlike, हनूमन्तम् Hanuman, संस्पृशन्ति स्म hugged.

57_35.translation: And hearing Hanuman's sweetest words, Angada addressed the heroic vanaras
57_35.word_by_word: अथ and then, अङ्गदः Angada, उक्तवाक्यम् words spoken, हनूमन्तम् by Hanuman, सर्वेषाम् all of them, हरिवीराणाम् vanara heroes, मध्ये midst, उत्तमम् best, वचनम् words, अब्रवीत् spoke.

57_36.shloka: सत्त्वे वीर्ये न ते कश्चित्समो वानर विद्यते।यदवप्लुत्य विस्तीर्णं सागरं पुनरागतः।।5.57.45।।
57_36.translation: "O vanara you have leaped such a wide ocean and have returned. In strength and valour. There is none equal to you.
57_36.word_by_word: वानर vanara, यत् such, विस्तीर्णम् wide, सागरम् ocean, अवप्लुत्य leaping, पुनः again, आगतः returned, सत्त्वे in strength, वीर्ये in valour, ते to you, समः equal, कश्चित् none, न विद्यते not known.

57_37.shloka: अहो स्वामिनि ते भक्तिरहो वीर्यमहो धृतिः।दिष्ट्या दृष्टा त्वया देवी रामपत्नी यशस्विनी।।5.57.46।।दिष्ट्या त्यक्ष्यति काकुत्स्थ श्शोकं सीतावियोगजम्।
57_37.translation: "O your devotion to the king, O your valour, fortitude  and courage is admirable. You could see Rama's wife, an illustrious lady. This is a matter of our good luck. Rama will (now) shed the sorrow due to separation from Sita.
57_37.word_by_word: स्वामिनि to the king, ते to you, भक्तिः devotion, अहो Oh, वीर्यम् valour, अहो Oh, धृतिः fortitude, अहो Oh, दिष्ट्या courage, त्वया of yours, रामपत्नी Rama's wife, यशस्विनी illustrious, देवी wife, दृष्टा saw, दिष्ट्या our luck, काकुत्स्थः Rama, सीतावियोगजम् born of separation from Sita, शोकम् grief, त्यक्ष्यति will be removed.

57_38.shloka: ततोऽङ्गदं हनूमन्तं जाम्बवन्तं च वानराः।।5.57.47।।परिवार्य प्रमुदिता भेजिरे विपुलाश्शिलाः।
57_38.translation: Then the vanaras went round all the three Angada, Hanuman and Jambavan. Out of joy they lay down on the huge rocks.
57_38.word_by_word: ततः then, वानराः vanaras, प्रमुदिताः very happily, अङ्गदम् Angada's, हनूमन्तम् Hanuman, जाम्बवन्तं च and Jambavan, परिवार्य and going round, विपुलाः extensive, शिलाः rocks, भेजिरे betook to.

57_39.shloka: श्रोतुकामास्समुद्रस्य लङ्घनं वानरोत्तमाः।।5.57.48।।दर्शनं चापि लङ्कायास्सीताया रावणस्य च।तस्थुः प्राञ्जलयस्सर्वे हनुमद्वचनोन्मुखाः।।5.57.49।।
57_39.translation: All the vanaras longing to listen to Hanuman about his crossing the ocean, seeing Lanka, Sita and Ravana kept looking at the face of Hanuman.
57_39.word_by_word: सर्वे all, वानरोत्तमाः best of vanaras, समुद्रस्य at the ocean, लङ्घनम् crossing, लङ्कायाः of Lanka, सीतायाः about Sita, रावणस्य च and Ravana, दर्शनं चापि and seeing, श्रोतुकामाः longing to listen, प्राञ्जलयः with folded palms, हनुमद्वचनोन्मुखाः from the mouth of Hanuman, तस्थुः kept watching.

57_40.shloka: तस्थौ तत्राङ्गदः श्रीमान् वानरैर्बहुभिर्वृतः।उपास्यमानो विबुधैर्दिवि देवपतिर्यथा।।5.57.50।।
57_40.translation: Surrounded by many great vanaras, Angada was shining like Indra, lord of the gods attended by the gods in heaven.
57_40.word_by_word: तत्र there, श्रीमान् great, बहुभिः many, वानरैः vanaras, वृतः surrounded, अङ्गदः Angada, दिवि heaven, विबुधैः by gods, उपास्यमानः attended by, देवपति: यथा like the lord of gods, तस्थौ shining.

57_41.shloka: हनूमता कीर्तिमता यशस्विना तथाङ्गदेनाङ्गदबद्धबाहुना।मुदा तदाऽध्यासितमुन्नतं महन्महीधराग्रं ज्वलितं श्रियाभवत्।।5.57.51।।
57_41.translation: The mountain peak graced by famous Hanuman and renowned Angada bedecked with armlets seated on top joyfully, appeared prosperous and splendid.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये सुन्दरकाण्डे सप्तपञ्चाशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the fiftyseventh sarga of Sundarakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
57_41.word_by_word: कीर्तिमता famed, हनूमता Hanuman, तथा that way, यशस्विना renowned, अङ्गदबद्धबाहुना bedecked with armlets, अङ्गदेन by Angada, तदा then, मुदा joyfully, अध्यासितम् seated, उन्नतम् high, महत् great, महीधराग्रम् top of the mountain, तदा then, या propsperous, ज्वलितं splendid, अभवत् remained.

58_1.shloka: [Hanuman narrates all the incidents starting from his departure for Lanka till his return.]ततस्तस्य गिरेः शृङ्गे महेन्द्रस्य महाबलाः।हनुमत्प्रमुखाः प्रीतिं हरयो जग्मुरुत्तमाम्।।5.58.1।।
58_1.translation: Then the mighty Hanuman and other vanaras having assembled on the summit of mountain Mahendra and felt vey much happy.
58_1.word_by_word: ततः then, महाबलाः mighty, हनुमत्प्रमुखाः Hanuman the foremost, हरयः among vanaras, तस्य that, महेन्द्रस्यगिरेः on the mountain Mahendra, शृङ्गे summit, उत्तमाम् very much, प्रीतिम् rejoiced, जग्मुः went.

58_2.translation: Thereafter, very delighted Jambavan inquired Hanuman most affectionately of all that happened.
58_2.word_by_word: ततः thereafter, प्रीतिसंहृष्टः very delighted, जाम्बवान् Jambavan, प्रीतिमन्तम् very affectionately, महाकपिम् great monkey, अनिलात्मजम् Hanuman, कार्यवृत्तान्तम् all that happened, अपृच्छत् inquired.

58_3.shloka: कथं दृष्टा त्वया देवी कथं वा तत्र वर्तते।तस्यां वा स कथंवृत्तः क्रूरकर्मा दशाननः।।5.58.3।।
58_3.translation: "How did you find the godlike lady? How was she? How was the tenheaded one, cruel in action, behaving with her? You may narrate what she said.
58_3.word_by_word: देवी divine lady, त्वया by you, कथम् how, दृष्टा was she found, तत्र there, कथं वा how is she, वर्तते behaving, क्रूरकर्मा cruel in action, सः दशाननः that tenheaded one, तस्याम् with her, कथंवृत्तः you narrate (what she said).

58_4.shloka: तत्त्वतस्सर्वमेतन्नः प्रब्रूहि त्वं महाकपे।श्रुतार्थाश्चिन्तयिष्यामो भूयः कार्यविनिश्चयम्।।5.58.4।।
58_4.translation: "O Hanuman, tell us in detail  the entire thing. On hearing it, we will think about the next course of action.
58_4.word_by_word: महाकपे great vanara, एतत् all that, सर्वम् entire, तत्त्वतः truly, त्वम् you, नः us, प्रब्रूहि after knowing, श्रुतार्थाः after hearing, भूयःकार्यविनिश्चयम् next course of action, चिन्तयिष्यामः will think .

58_5.shloka: यश्चार्थस्तत्त्र वक्तव्यो गतैरस्माभिरात्मवान्।रक्षितव्यं च यत्तत्र तद्भवान्व्याकरोतु नः।।5.58.5।।
58_5.translation: "You are wise and you should tell us in detail what is to be told and what has to be hidden when we report."
58_5.word_by_word: गतैः when we go, अस्माभिः we too, तत्र there, यः that which, अर्थः meaningful, वक्तव्यः will tell, यत् that which, तत्र there, रक्षितव्यं च to be hidden, तत् that, आत्मवान् yourself, भवान् you are wise, नः to us, व्याकरोतु tell us in detail.

58_6.shloka: स नियुक्तस्ततस्तेन सम्प्रहृष्टतनूरुहः।प्रणम्य शिरसा देव्यै सीतायै प्रत्यभाषत।।5.58.6।।
58_6.translation: Having been asked (by Jambavan and others) Hanuman with horripilations all over hisbody, bowed down and saluted in the direction of queen Sita and began:
58_6.word_by_word: तेन by him, नियुक्तः having been asked, सः he, सम्प्रहृष्टतनूरुहः horripilations all over his body out of joy, ततः then, देव्यै to queen, सीतायै to Sita, शिरसा bowed down head, प्रणम्य saluted, प्रत्यभाषत began telling.

58_7.shloka: प्रत्यक्षमेव भवतां महेन्द्राग्रात्खामाप्लुतः।उदधेर्दक्षिणं पारं काङ्क्षमाण स्समाहितः।।5.58.7।।
58_7.translation: "I rose upwards leaping into the sky, intent on reaching the southern shore from the mountain Mahendra.It has been witnessed directly by all of you.
58_7.word_by_word: उदधेः rose up, दक्षिणम् southern, पारम् shore, काङ्क्षमाणः you have seen, समाहितः intent on, भवताम् all of you, प्रत्यक्षमेव directly, महेन्द्राग्रात् Mahendra mountain, खम् sky, आप्लुतः leaping.

58_8.shloka: गच्छतश्च हि मे घोरं विघ्नरूपमिवाभवत्।काञ्चनं शिखरं दिव्यं पश्यामि सुमनोहरम्।।5.58.8।।
58_8.translation: "Even as I was leaping I saw a terrific and wonderful golden peak which came as if to obstruct me on my path.
58_8.word_by_word: गच्छतः while I was going, मे I, घोरम् terrific, विघ्नरूपमिव like a form that came to obstruct, अभवत् saw, काञ्चनम् golden, दिव्यम् wonderful, सुमनोहरम् very beautiful, शिखरम् peak of mountain, पश्यामि saw.

58_9.shloka: स्थितं पन्धानमावृत्य मेने विघ्नं च तं नगम्।उपसङ्गम्य तं दिव्यं काञ्चनं नगसत्तमम्।।5.58.9।।कृता मे मनसा बुद्धिर्भेत्तव्योऽयं मयेति च।
58_9.translation: "The mountain stood on my way turning towards me in order to obstruct me. Then I resolved in my mind that this great, wonderful, golden mountain has to be smashed.
58_9.word_by_word: पन्थानम् on my way, आवृत्य turning towards, स्थितम् stood, तं नगम् that mountain, विघ्नम् to obstruct, मेने my path, दिव्यम् wonderful, काञ्चनम् golden, तं नगसत्तमम् that great mountain, उपसङ्गम्य meeting, अयम् this, मया by me, भेत्तव्यः इति this should be broken, मे मनसा in my mind, बुद्धिः कृता resolved.

58_10.shloka: प्रहतं च मया तस्य लाङ्गूलेन महागिरेः।।5.58.10।।शिखरं सूर्यसङ्काशं व्यशीर्यत सहस्रधा।
58_10.translation: "Hit by my tail the great mountain peak, which was radiating like the Sun was shattered into a thousand pieces.
58_10.word_by_word: मया by me, लाङ्गूलेन with my tail, प्रहतम् hit, तस्य महागिरेः that great mountain, सूर्यसङ्काशम् radiating like the Sun, शिखरम् peak, सहस्रधा a thousand pieces, व्यशीर्यत shattered.

58_11.shloka: व्यवसायं च तं बुद्ध्वा स होवाच महागिरिः।।5.58.11।पुत्त्रेति मधुरां वाणीं मनः प्रह्लादयन्निव।
58_11.translation: "Perceiving that I am going to smash him he spoke to me in a sweet tone delighting my heart, addressing me like a son.
58_11.word_by_word: सः महागिरिः that great mountain, तम् him, व्यवसायम् going to smash, बुद्ध्वा perceiving, मनः my mind, प्रह्लादयन्निव delighting, पुत्त्र इति like a son, मधुराम् sweet, वाणीम् tone, उवाच ह spoke.

58_12.shloka: पितृव्यं चापि मां विद्धि सखायं मातरिश्वनः।।5.58.12।।मैनाकमिति विख्यातं निवसन्तं महोदधौ।
58_12.translation: 'Know me to be a friend of windgod and so I am like your father's brother. I am dwelling in this great ocean and known as Mainaka.
58_12.word_by_word: महोदधौ in the great ocean, निवसन्तम् residing, मातरिश्वनः winddeity, सखायम् friend, विख्यातम् called, माम् I, मैनाकमिति Mainaka, पितृव्यं चापि like father's brother, विद्धि you may know.

58_13.shloka: पक्षवन्तः पुरा पुत्त्र बभूवुः पर्वतोत्तमाः।।5.58.13।।छन्दतः पृथिवीं चेरुर्बाधमानाः समन्ततः।
58_13.translation: 'O son in the past, foremost of the mountains too had wings and they used to range  at will all over the earth tormenting all.
58_13.word_by_word: पुत्त्र O son, पुरा in the past, पर्वतोत्तमाः the foremost of mountains, पक्षवन्तः had wings, बभूवुः had, बाधमानाः tormenting, छन्दतः at will, समन्ततः all over, पृथिवीम् the earth, चेरुः ranging.

58_14.shloka: श्रुत्वा नगानां चरितं महेन्द्रः पाकशासनः।।5.58.14।।चिच्छेद भगवान् पक्षान्वज्रेणैषां सहस्रशः।
58_14.translation: 'Mahendra, the killer of ogre Paka, heard the story (of the cruel deeds) of mountains and cut off their wings into a thousand pieces with his thunderbolt.
58_14.word_by_word: पाकशासनः who killed Paka (an ogre), भगवान् god, महेन्द्रः Mahendra, नगानाम् of the mountains, चरितम् the story (of their cruel deeds), श्रुत्वा on hearing, एषाम् their, पक्षान् wings, वज्रेण by the thuinderbolt, सहस्रशः into a thousand pieces, चिच्छेद cut off.

58_15.shloka: अहं तु मोक्षितस्तस्मात्तव पित्रा महात्मना।।5.58.15।।मारुतेन तदा वत्स प्रक्षिप्तोऽस्मि महार्णवे।
58_15.translation: 'O son I was saved from Indra by your kind father Maruta who dropped me in this great  ocean.
58_15.word_by_word: वत्स O Son, अहं तु I was also, तव your, पित्रा father, महात्मना great self, मारुतेन of Maruta's, तदा so also, तस्मात् your, मोक्षितः dropped, महार्णवे in this great ocean, प्रक्षिप्तः saved from Indra, अस्मि I am.

58_16.shloka: रामस्य च मया साह्ये वर्तितव्यमरिन्दम।।5.58.16।।रामो धर्मभृतां श्रेष्ठो महेन्द्रसमविक्रमः।
58_16.translation: 'O subduer of enemiesI must make efforts to help Rama the foremost among the righteous, for I have received help (from your father) who is equal to Indra in valour'.
58_16.word_by_word: अरिन्दम subduer of enemies, मया by me, रामस्य Rama's, साह्ये received help, वर्तितव्यम् has to make efforts, महेन्द्रसमविक्रमः equal to Mahendra in valour, रामः Rama, धर्मभृताम् among the righteous, श्रेष्ठः foremost.

58_17.shloka: एतच्छ्रुत्वा वचस्तस्य मैनाकस्य महात्मनः।।5.58.17।।कार्यमावेद्य तु गिरेरुद्यतं च मनो मम।तेन चाहमनुज्ञातो मैनाकेन महात्मना।।5.58.18।।
58_17.translation: "When I heard Mainaka, I told him about my intention to go up. That great self Mainaka allowed me.
58_17.word_by_word: महात्मनः great self, तस्य मैनाकस्य that Mainaka's, वचः words, श्रुत्वा having heard, कार्यम् task, गिरेः mountain, आवेद्य told, मम my, मनः mind, उद्यतम् to go, अहम् I, तेन to him, महात्मना the great self, मैनाकेन by Mainaka, अनुज्ञातश्च granted permission.

58_18.shloka: स चाप्यन्तर्हितः शैलो मानुषेण वपुष्मता।शरीरेण महाशैलः शैलेन च महोदधौ।।5.58.19।।
58_18.translation: "Then the huge mountain in human form concealed as huge mountains remain hidden in the ocean.
58_18.word_by_word: सः he, शैलः mountain, मानुषेण in human form, वपुष्मता अन्तर्हितः concealed, महाशैलः huge mountain, शैलेन in mountain form, शरीरेण च in the form, महोदधौ great ocean, अन्तर्हितः remained hidden.

58_19.shloka: उत्तमं जवमास्थाय शेषं पन्थानमास्थितः।ततोऽहं सुचिरं कालं वेगेनाभ्यागमं पथि।।5.58.20।।
58_19.translation: "Then with great speed I proceeded on my path. It took a long time to cross the ocean.
58_19.word_by_word: ततः then, अहम् I, उत्तमम् excellent, जवम् speed, आस्थाय catching, शेषम् rest of, पन्थानम् the path, आस्थितः to cross, सुचिरं कालम् long time, वेगेन speedily, अभ्यागमम् went on.

58_20.shloka: ततः पश्याम्यहं देवीं सुरसां नागमातरम्।समुद्रमध्ये सा देवी वचनं मामभाषत।।5.58.21।।
58_20.translation: "I saw Surasa, the mother of serpents in the midst of the ocean and she said:
58_20.word_by_word: ततः then, अहम् I, नागमातरम् mother of serpents, सुरसाम्  Surasa, पश्यामि saw, सा देवी that lady, समुद्रमध्ये in the midst of the ocean, माम् me, वचनम् these words, अभाषत said.

58_21.shloka: मम भक्षः प्रदिष्टस्त्वममरैर्हरिसत्तम।अतस्त्वां भक्षयिष्यामि विहितस्त्वं चिरस्य मे।।5.58.22।।
58_21.translation: 'O powerful monkey you are destined to be my food provided by the immortals. Therefore, I will eat you as I have I found you after a long time. (of unsatiated hunger).'
58_21.word_by_word: हरिसत्तम powerful monkey, त्वम् you, मम my, भक्षः food, अमरैः immortals,प्रदिष्टः destined, अतः as such, त्वाम् you, भक्षयिष्यामि I will eat you, त्वम् you, मे my, चिरस्य after a long time, विहितः found you.

58_22.shloka: एवमुक्त स्सुरसया प्राञ्जलिः प्रणतः स्थितः।विवर्णवदनो भूत्वा वाक्यं चेदमुदीरयम्।।5.58.23।।
58_22.translation: "When addressed thus by Surasa, I bowed low with joined palms, stood before her with my face turned pale, and said:
58_22.word_by_word: सुरसया by Surasa, एवम् in that way, उक्तः having spoken, प्राञ्जलिः offered salutationswith folded palms, प्रणतः bent low, स्थितः stood, विवर्णवदनः face turned pale, भूत्वा became, इदम् these, वाक्यं च and words, उदीरयम् uttered.

58_23.shloka: रामो दाशरथिः श्रीमान् प्रविष्टो दण्डकावनम्।लक्ष्मणेन सह भ्रात्रा सीतया च परन्तपः।।5.58.24।।
58_23.translation: 'Dasaratha's son, the illustrious Rama, a scorcher of enemies, accompanied by his brother Lakshmana and wife Sita entered Dandaka forest.
58_23.word_by_word: दाशरथिः Dasaratha's son, श्रीमान् illustrious, परन्तपः scorcher of enemies, रामः Rama, दण्डकावनम् Dandaka forest, भ्रात्रा brother, लक्ष्मणेन सह accompanied by Lakshmana, सीतया च and Sita, प्रविष्टः entered.

58_24.shloka: तस्य सीता हृता भार्या रावणेन दुरात्मना।तस्या स्सङ्काशं दूतोऽहं गमिष्ये रामशासनात्।।5.58.25।।
58_24.translation: 'His wife was abducted by the evilminded Ravana. By Rama's command I am going to meet her as messenger from Rama.'
58_24.word_by_word: तस्य his, भार्या wife, सीता Sita, दुरात्मना evil minded, रावणेन by Ravana, हृता abducted, अहम् I, रामशासनात् by Rama's command, दूतः messenger, तस्याः her, सङ्काशम् to meet, गमिष्ये going.

58_25.shloka: कर्तुमर्हसि रामस्य साहाय्यं विषये सती।अथवा मैथिलीं दृष्ट्वा रामं चाक्लिष्टकारिणम्।।5.58.26।।आगमिष्यामि ते वक्त्रं सत्यं प्रतिशृणोमि ते।
58_25.translation: "I told her that it is proper for her (living in the domain of Rama) to help his queen and wife. Or else, I promised after I disclose to Rama, Sita's whereabouts, I will come and enter her mouth.
58_25.word_by_word: विषये king's wife, सती wife, रामस्य Rama's, साहाय्यम् help, कर्तुम् will do, अर्हसि fit, अथवा orelse, मैथिलीम् when Mythili, अक्लिष्टकारिणम् after revealing about her, रामं च and Rama, दृष्ट्वा seeing, ते to you, वक्त्रम् mouth, आगमिष्यामि will enter, सत्यम् it is true, ते you, प्रतिशृणोमि promise.

58_26.shloka: एवमुक्ता मया सा तु सुरसा कामरूपिणी।5.58.27।।अब्रवीन्नातिवर्तेत कश्चिदेष वरो मम।
58_26.word_by_word: मया by me, एवम् in that way, उक्ता having said, कामरूपिणी who can assume any form at will, सा सुरसा that Surasa, अब्रवीत् said, कश्चित् none, नातिवर्तेत can escape, एषः thus, मम I have, वरः a boon.

58_27.translation: "When Surasa said this I who was ten yojanas in height increased  by fifteen yojanas.
58_27.word_by_word: सुरसया when Surasa, एवम् in that way, उक्तः spoke, दशयोजनम् ten yojanas, आयतः in length, अहम् I, ततः then, क्षणेन in a moment, अर्थगुणविस्तारः fifteen yojanas, बभूव grew in size.

58_28.shloka: मत्प्रमाणानुरूपं च व्यादितं च मुखं तया।।5.58.29।।तद्दृष्ट्वा व्यादितं चास्यं ह्रस्वं ह्यकरवं वपुः।तस्मिन्मुहूर्ते च पुनर्बभूवाङ्गुष्ठमात्रकः।।5.58.30।।
58_28.translation: "She too opened her mouth wide enough for my size. Seeing her distending her mouth, in a moment I became small equal to the size of thumb and came out.
58_28.word_by_word: तया to go, मुखम् mouth, मत्प्रमाणानुरूपम् commensurate with my size, व्यादितम् opened, व्यादितम् when she opened, तत् that, आस्यम् her, दृष्ट्वा seeing, वपुः form, ह्रस्वम् turned away, आकरवम् to move, तस्मिन् from her, मुहूर्ते in a moment, पुनः again, अङ्गुष्ठमात्रकः of the size of thumb, बभूव became.

58_29.shloka: अभिपत्याशु तद्वक्त्रं निर्गतोऽहं ततः क्षणात्।अब्रवीत्सुरसा देवी स्वेन रूपेण मां पुनः।।5.58.31।।
58_29.translation: "Then Surasa assumed her natural form again in a moment and said this to me:
58_29.word_by_word: ततः then, अहम् I, आशु she, तद्वक्त्रम् her mouth, अभिपत्य seeing, क्षणात् in a moment, निर्गतः came out, देवी lady, सुरसा Surasa, स्वेन natural, रूपेण form assumed, पुनः again, माम् to me, अब्रवीत् said.

58_30.shloka: अर्थसिद्ध्यै हरिश्रेष्ठ गच्छ सौम्य यथासुखम्।समानय च वैदेहीं राघवेण महात्मना।।5.58.32।।सुखी भव महाबाहो प्रीताऽस्मि तव वानर।
58_30.translation: 'O noble vanara O foremost of the vanaras go and accomplish the task.Unite the great Rama with Vaidehi.O strongarmed vanara, be happy. I am pleased with you'.
58_30.word_by_word: सौम्य O noble one, हरिश्रेष्ठ foremost of vanaras, अर्थसिद्ध्यै accomplish the task, यथासुखम् happily, गच्छ going, वैदेहीम् Vaidehi, महात्मना great self, राघवेण to Raghava, समानय unite, महाबाहो strongarmed, वानर vanara, सुखी be happy, भव you, तव you, प्रीता pleased, अस्मि I am.

58_31.shloka: ततोऽहं साधु साध्विति सर्वभूतैः प्रशंसितः।।5.58.33।।ततोऽन्तरिक्षं विपुलं प्लुतोऽहं गरुडो यथा।
58_31.translation: "Then all creatures praised me saying 'well done well done'. Then I leaped into the vast sky like Garuda.
58_31.word_by_word: ततः then, अहम् I, सर्वभूतैः all creatures, साधु साध्विति well done, well done, प्रशंसितः praised, ततः then, अहम् I, गरुडो यथा like Garuda, विपुलम् vast, अन्तरिक्षम् sky, प्लुतः leapt .

58_32.shloka: छाया मे निगृहीता च न च पश्यामि किंचन।।5.58.34।।सोऽहं विहतवेगस्तु दिशो दश विलोकयन्।न किञ्चित्तत्र पश्यामि येन मेऽपहृता गतिः।।5.58.35।।
58_32.translation: "Then I was captured by a shadow of some one. I could not see and I reduced my speed and looked around in all the ten directions. I could not see the one who seized me.
58_32.word_by_word: मे my, छाया shadow, निगृहीता held, किञ्चन by some one, न च पश्यामि I could not see, विहतवेगः reduced my speed, सः अहम् I, दश दिशः all the ten directions, विलोकयन् looked around, येन even then, मे to me, गतिः one that approached, अपहृता that which seized, किञ्चित् not seen, तत्र न च पश्यामि was not seen.

58_33.shloka: ततो मे बुद्धिरुत्पन्ना किन्नाम गगने मम।ईदृशो विघ्न उत्पन्नो रूपं यत्र न दृश्यते।।5.58.36।।
58_33.word_by_word: ततः then, मे my, बुद्धिः intellect, उत्पन्ना arose, मम in me, गगने in the sky, यत्र there, रूपम् form, न दृश्यते not able to see, किं नाम what is her name, ईदृशः not able to discern, विघ्नः  obstructing, उत्पन्नः thought.

58_34.shloka: अधोभागेन मे दृष्टि श्शोचता पातिता मया।ततोऽद्राक्षमहं भीमां राक्षसीं सलिलेशयाम्।।5.58.37।।
58_34.translation: "Thinking so I looked down into the water and there I saw a terrific shedemon.
58_34.word_by_word: शोचता thinking so, मया by me, अधोभागेन down, मे I, दृष्टिः saw, पातिता down, ततः there, अहम् I, भीमाम् terrific, सलिलेशयाम् in the water, राक्षसीम् shedemon, अद्राक्षम् I saw.

58_35.shloka: प्रहस्य च महानादमुक्तोऽहं भीमया तया।अवस्थितमसम्भ्रान्तमिदं वाक्यमशोभनम्।।5.58.38।।
58_35.translation: "She was frightening and  laughed in loud voice without any hesitation. Steadfast she uttered these ominous words to me:
58_35.word_by_word: भीमया frightening, तया she was, महानादम् loud voice, प्रहस्य laughed, अवस्थितम् without any hesitation, असम्भ्रान्तम् steadfast, इदम् this, अशोभनम् inauspicious, वाक्यम् these words, अहम् to me, उक्तः said.

58_36.shloka: क्वासि गन्ता महाकाय क्षुधिताया ममेप्सितः।भक्षः प्रीणय मे देहं चिरमाहारवर्जितम्।।5.58.39।।
58_36.translation: 'O huge monkey where are you going? I am hungry since long. I am going without food and must eat you. Make me satisfied'.
58_36.word_by_word: महाकाय one with a huge body, क्व where, गन्ता going, असि you are, क्षुधितायाः I am hungry, मम my, ईप्सितः I am eager, भक्षः to eat, चिरम् for long time, आहारवर्जितम् without food, मे my, देहम् body, प्रीणय make me satisfied.

58_37.shloka: बाढमित्येव तां वाणीं प्रत्यगृह्णामहं ततः।अस्यप्रमाणादधिकं तस्याः कायमपूरयम्।।5.58.40।।
58_37.translation: "I said 'well' and enlarged my body more than her mouth could hold.
58_37.word_by_word: अहम् I am, बाढम् इत्येव saying well, तां वाणीम् her mouth, प्रत्यगृह्णाम् ततः then, तस्याः her, अस्यप्रमाणात् more than her size, अधिकम् bigger, कायम् size body, अपूरयम् grew.

58_38.shloka: तस्याश्चास्यं महद्भीमं वर्धते मम भक्षणे।न च मां साधु बुबुधे मम वा विकृतं कृतम्।।5.58.41।।
58_38.translation: "She opened her huge mouth to eat me as she did not know that I had already assumed a huge ugly form on my own.
58_38.word_by_word: तस्याः her, महत् huge, भीमम् fierce, आस्यं च mouth, मम भक्षणे to eat me, वर्धते increased, माम् myself, कृतम् did, मम my, विकृतम् ugly, साधु on my own, न बुबुधे not know.

58_39.shloka: ततोऽहं विपुलं रूपं संक्षिप्य निमिषान्तरात्।तस्या हृदयमादाय प्रपतामि नभ:स्थलम्।।5.58.42।।
58_39.translation: "In a moment I reduced from a huge form to a small one, entered her heart and sprang into the sky.
58_39.word_by_word: ततः then, अहम् I, निमिषान्तरात् in a moment, विपुलम् vast, रूपम् form, संक्षिप्य reduced, तस्याः from her, हृदयम् heart, आदाय entered, नभस्थलम् into the sky, प्रपतामि  sprang up.

58_40.shloka: सा विसृष्टभुजा भीमा पपात लवणाम्भसि।मया पर्वतसङ्काशा निकृत्तहृदया सती।।5.58.43।।
58_40.translation: "She who resembled a mountain fell into the ocean with her arms hanging down when I pulled out her heart.
58_40.word_by_word: भीमा fierce, पर्वतसङ्काशा resembling mountain, सा she, मया my, निकृत्तहृदया pulled out her heart, सती she, विसृष्टभुजा hanging down her arms, लवणाम्भसि into the ocean, पपात fell.

58_41.shloka: शृणोमि खगतानां च सिद्धानां चारणैस्सह।राक्षसी सिंहिका भीमा क्षिप्रं हनुमता हता।।5.58.44।।
58_41.translation: "I heard the charanas and siddhas residing in the sky talking to each other that the fierce ogres Simhika has been killed by Hanuman in a moment.
58_41.word_by_word: चारणैः सह including charanas, खगतानाम् residing in the sky, सिद्धानाम् siddhas, भीमा fierce, राक्षसी ogres सिंहिका Simhika, क्षिप्रम् in a moment, हनुमता by Hanuman, हता slain, शृणोमि (talking to each other) I heard.

58_42.shloka: तां हत्वा पुनरेवाहं कृत्यमात्ययिकं स्मरन्।गत्वा चाह महध्वानं पश्यामि नगमण्डितम्।।5.58.45।।दक्षिणं तीरमुदधेर्लङ्का यत्र च सा पुरी।
58_42.translation: "Having slained Simhika, I thought of the huge feat that I have done. I remembered the big mission before me and went to the southern shore of the ocean and saw Lanka full of trees.
58_42.word_by_word: अहम् I, ताम् her, हत्वा having slain, पुनरेव once again, अत्ययिकम् huge, कृत्यम् feat, स्मरन् remembered, महत् अध्वानम् huge mission, गत्वा went, यत्र there, सा that, लङ्कापुरी city of Lanka, उदधेः full of trees, दक्षिणं तीरम् southern shore, पश्यामि saw.

58_43.shloka: अस्तं दिनकरे याते रक्षसां निलयं पुरम्।।5.58.46।।प्रविष्टोऽहमविज्ञातो रक्षोभिर्भीमविक्रमैः।
58_43.word_by_word: दिनकरे Sun, अस्तं याते after setting, अहम् I, भीमविक्रमैः of fierce valour, रक्षोभिः guarded,   अविज्ञातः unnoticed, रक्षसाम् demons, निलयम् abode, पुरम् city, प्रविष्टः entered.

58_44.shloka: तत्र प्रविशतश्चापि कल्पान्तघनसन्निभा।।5.58.47।।अट्टहासं विमुञ्चन्ती नारी काप्युत्थिता पुरः।
58_44.word_by_word: तत्र there, प्रविशतः as I entered, पुरः the city, कल्पान्तघनसन्निभा like a cloud at the dissolution of the universe, कापि behaving like, नारी woman, अट्टहासम् yelling, विमुञ्चन्ती stood in front, उत्थिता opposing me.

58_45.shloka: जिघांसन्तीं ततस्तां तु ज्वलदग्निशिरोरुहाम्।।5.58.48।।सव्यमुष्टिप्रहारेण पराजित्य सुभैरवाम्।प्रदोषकाले प्रविशं भीतयाऽहं तयोदितः।।5.58.49।।
58_45.translation: "Then the frightening form, with its hair burning like sacrificial fire, emerged to kill me. I defeated her hittting with my left fist and entered the city at sunset time.
58_45.word_by_word: ततः then, जिघांसन्तीम् burning, ज्वलदग्निशिरोरुहाम् hair like the sacrificial fire, सुभैरवाम्  frightening form, ताम् her, सव्यमुष्टिप्रहारेण hit with the fist of the left hand, पराजित्य after defeating, प्रदोषकाले at the sunset time, प्रविशम् entered, भीतया fearful form, तया she, अहम् me, उदितः risen.

58_46.shloka: अहं लङ्कापुरी वीर निर्जिता विक्रमेण ते।यस्मात्तस्माद्विजेतासि सर्वरक्षांस्यशेषतः।।5.58.50।।
58_46.translation: 'O hero I am the presiding deity of Lanka whom you have won by your valour. Therefore you will win many demons she foretold.
58_46.word_by_word: वीर hero, अहम् I, लङ्कापुरी the deity of Lanka, यस्मात् I am, ते by your, विक्रमणे by your valour, निर्जिता won, तस्मात् therefore, सर्वरक्षांसि all demons, अशेषतः many, विजेतासि will win.

58_47.shloka: तत्राहं सर्वरात्रं तु विचिन्वन् जनकात्मजाम्।रावणान्तःपुरगतो न चापश्यं सुमध्यमाम्।।5.58.51।।
58_47.translation: "There when I went to the harem of Ravana and searched all night, I did not find the fairwaisted Janaka's daughter.
58_47.word_by_word: अहम् I am, तत्र there, रावणान्तःपुरगतः Ravana's harem, सर्वरात्रम् all night, जनकात्मजाम् Janaka's daughter, विचिन्वन् searched also, सुमध्यमाम् fairwaisted lady, न अपश्यं च and not seen.

58_48.shloka: तत स्सीतामपश्यंस्तु रावणस्य निवेशने।शोकसागरमासाद्य न पारमुपलक्षये।।5.58.52।।
58_48.translation: "Not able to find Sita at the residence of Ravana I was immersed in an ocean of endless sorrow and did not know what to do.
58_48.word_by_word: रावणस्य Ravana's, निवेशने residence, सीताम् Sita, अपश्यंस्तु not able to find, ततः then, शोकसागरम् ocean of sorrow, आसाद्य immersed, पारम् endless, न उपलक्षये did not know.

58_49.shloka: शोचता च मया दृष्टं प्राकारेण समावृतम्।काञ्चनेन विकृष्टेन गृहोपवनमुत्तमम्।।5.58.53।।
58_49.translation: "While worrying like that I saw a long golden boundary wall surrounding a splendid home garden. (upabana)
58_49.word_by_word: शोचता worrying so, मया by me, काञ्चनेन golden, विकृष्टेन long, प्राकारेण boundary wall, समावृतम् surrounding, उत्तमम् very splendid, गृहोपवनम् home garden, दृष्टम् seen.

58_50.shloka: स प्राकारमवप्लुत्य पश्यामि बहुपादपम्।अशोकवनिकामध्ये शिंशुपापादपो महान्।।5.58.54।।तमारुह्य च पश्यामि काञ्चनं कदलीवनम्।
58_50.translation: "I crossed that boundary wall and saw many kinds of trees and in the midst of that Ashoka garden, a huge Simsupa tree. I ascended it and saw rows of banana plants.
58_50.word_by_word: सः that, प्राकारम् boundary wall, अवप्लुत्य crossed, बहुपादपम् many kinds of trees, पश्यामि saw, अशोकवनिकामध्ये in the midst of Ashoka garden, महान् huge, शिंशुपापादपः Simsupa tree, तम् that, आरुह्य ascended, काञ्चनम् golden, कदलीवनम् rows of banana plants, पश्यामि saw.

58_51.shloka: अदूरे शिंशुपावृक्षात्पश्यामि वरवर्णिनीम्।।5.58.55।।श्यामां कमलपत्राक्षीमुपवासकृशाननाम्।तदेकवासस्संवीतां रजोध्वस्तशिरोरुहाम्।।5.58.56।।शोकसन्तापदीनाङ्गीं सीतां भर्तृहिते स्थिताम्।राक्षसीभिर्विरूपाभिः क्रूराभिरभिसंवृताम्।।5.58.57।।मांसशोणितभक्षाभिर्व्याघ्रीभिर्हरिणीमिव।
58_51.translation: "Not far from the Simsupa tree I saw beautiful Sita, of dark complexion, with eyes like lotus petals, whose face was emaciated due to fasting, wearing only a single sari (the same one since her abduction) her locks filled with dust, pathetic looking,  immersed in sorrow, meditating on her husband seated like a doe encircled by tigresses, surrounded by ugly and cruel shedemons fed on flesh and blood.
58_51.word_by_word: शिंशुपावृक्षात् from the Simsupa tree, अदूरात् not far from there, वरवर्णिनीम् beautiful, श्यामाम् dark complexioned, कमलपत्राक्षीम् with eyes like lotus petals, उपवासकृशाननाम्  whose face was emaciated due to fasting, तदेकवासःसंवीताम् wearing only a single sari, रजोध्वस्तशिरोरुहाम् hair filled with dust, शोकसन्तापदीनाङ्गीम् patheticlooking in grief, भर्तृहिते well wisher of husband, स्थिताम् seated, विरूपाभिः ugly, क्रूराभिः cruel also, मांसशोणितभक्षाभिः who were fed with flesh and blood, राक्षसीभिः shedemons, व्याघ्रीभिः tigress, हरिणीमिव like a doe, अभिसंवृताम् collected around, सीताम् Sita, पश्यामि I saw.

58_52.shloka: सा मया राक्षसीमध्ये तर्ज्यमाना मुहुर्मुहुः।।5.58.58।।एकवेणीधरा दीना भर्तृचिन्तापरायणा।भूमिशय्या विवर्णाङ्गी पद्मिनीव हिमागमे।।5.58.59।।रावणाद्विनिवृत्तार्था मर्तव्यकृतनिश्चया।कथञ्चिन्मृगशाबाक्षी तूर्णमासादिता मया।।5.58.60।।
58_52.word_by_word: मुहुर्मुहुः again and again, तर्ज्यमाना intimidated, एकवेणीधरा wearing a single braid, दीना miserable, भर्तृचिन्तापरायणा engrossed in sorrow about her husband, भूमिशय्या on account of lying on the bare ground, विवर्णाङ्गी become pale, हिमागमे at the onset of winter, पद्मिनीव like the lotuses, रावणात् by Ravana, विनिवृत्तार्थाम् not knowing the way to escape, र्तव्यकृन्तिश्चया determined to give up life, सा she, मया by me, राक्षसीमध्ये in the midst of demonesses, आसादिता seated, मृगशाबाक्षी fawneyed, मया by me, कथञ्चित् some how, तूर्णम् quickly, आसादिता saw.

58_53.shloka: तां दृष्ट्वा तादृशीं नारीं रामपत्नीं यशस्विनीम्।तत्रैव शिंशुपावृक्षे पश्यन्नहमवस्थितः।।5.58.61।।
58_53.translation: "I remained there looking on that renowned wife of Rama from the Simsupa tree.
58_53.word_by_word: अहम् I am, तादृशीम् seeing her, नारीम् woman, यशस्विनीम् renowned one, तां रामपत्नीम् that Rama's wife, दृष्ट्वा on seeing, तत्र there, शिंशुपावृक्षे एव from the Simsupa tree only, पश्यन् saw, अवस्थितः stayed.

58_54.translation: "Then I heard a deep sound mixed with jingling golden girdles and anklets coming from Ravana's residence.
58_54.word_by_word: ततः then, रावणस्य Ravana's, निवेशने residence, काञ्चीनूपुरमिश्रितम् sound of jingling bells of gold, अधिकगम्भीरम् very majestic, हलहलाशब्दम् making a loud noise, शृणोमि I heard.

58_55.shloka: ततोऽहं परमोद्विग्नः स्वं रूपं प्रत्यसंहरम्।अहं तु शिंशुपावृक्षे पक्षीव गहने स्थितः।।5.58.63।।
58_55.translation: "I was scared and contracted my body size and stood on the Simsupa tree like a bird in the sky.
58_55.word_by_word: ततः then, अहम् I, परमोद्विग्नः very scared, स्वं रूपम् my form, प्रत्यसंहरम् contracted my body, अहं तु I also, गहने sky, शिंशुपावृक्षे in the Simsupa tree, पक्षीव like a bird, स्थितः stood.

58_56.shloka: ततो रावणदाराश्च रावणश्च महाबलः।तं देशं समनुप्राप्ता यत्र सीताऽभवत् स्थिता।।5.58.64।।
58_56.translation: "Then arrived the powerful Ravana with his consorts to that place where Sita was and stood there.
58_56.word_by_word: ततः then, रावणदाराश्च Ravana's consorts, महाबलः powerful, रावणश्च Ravana's, सीता Sita, यत्र there, स्थिता stood, अभवत् came, तम् to her, देशम् location, समनुप्राप्ताः reached.

58_57.shloka: तं दृष्ट्वाथ वरारोहा सीता रक्षोगणेश्वरम्।सङ्कुच्योरूस्तनौ पीनौ बाहुभ्यां परिरभ्य च।।5.58.65।।
58_57.translation: "On seeing Ravana, the king of demons, beautiful Sita, full of fear hid her face and plump breasts between her thighs.
58_57.word_by_word: अथ and then, वरारोहा beautiful one, सीता Sita, रक्षोगणेश्वरम् king of demon troops, तम् her, दृष्ट्वा seeing, ऊरू thighs, बाहुभ्याम् shoulders, सङ्कुच्य folded across, पीनौ plumpy,स्तनौ breasts, परिरभ्य च covered.

58_58.shloka: वित्रस्तां परमोद्विग्नां वीक्षमाणां ततस्ततः।त्राणं किञ्चिदपश्यन्तीं वेपमानां तपस्विनीम्।।5.58.66।।तामुवाच दशग्रीवस्सीतां परमदुःखिताम्।अवाक्चिराः प्रपतितो बहुमन्यस्व मामिति।।5.58.67।।
58_58.translation: "Sita was full of fear and worry, looked here and there without any protector to pacify. She was trembling in fear. To that Sita, the tenheaded Ravana bent his head down and said, 'trust me and respect me'.
58_58.word_by_word: वित्रस्ताम् full of fear, परमोद्विग्नाम् very much worried, ततस्ततः here and there, वीक्षमाणाम् looking, किञ्चित् not even one, त्राणम् protector, अपश्यन्तीम् not seen, वेपमानाम् trembling, तपस्विनीम् one in meditation, परमदुःखिताम् very sorrowful, तां सीताम् that Sita, दशग्रीवः tenheaded, अवाक्चिराः bending the head down, प्रतितः trust, माम् me, बहुमन्यस्व respect, इति this, उवाच spoke.

58_59.shloka: यदि चेत्त्वं तु दर्पान्मां नाभिनन्दसि गर्विते।द्वौ मासावन्तरं सीते पास्यामि रुधिरं तव।।5.58.68।।
58_59.translation: 'O Sita if in your pride, you do not respect me, I will see (drink) your blood in two months.
58_59.word_by_word: गर्विते in your pride, सीते Sita, त्वम् your, दर्पात् with pride, माम् me, नाभिनन्दसि यदि चेत् if you do not respect me, द्वौ मासौ अन्तरम् in two months time, तव your, रुधिरम् blood, पास्यामि I will see.

58_60.shloka: एतच्छ्रुत्वा वचस्तस्य रावणस्य दुरात्मनः।उवाच परमक्रुद्धा सीता वचनमुत्तमम्।।5.58.69।।
58_60.translation: "Hearing the words of evilminded Ravana, Sita became very angry and spoke these approprate words:
58_60.word_by_word: दुरात्मनः evilminded one, तस्य your, रावणस्य Ravana's, एतत् all these, वचः words, श्रुत्वा hearing, सीता Sita, परमक्रुद्धा very angry, उत्तमम् good, वचनम् these words, उवाच spoke.

58_61.shloka: राक्षसाधम रामस्य भार्याममिततेजसः।इक्ष्वाकुकुलनाथस्य स्नुषां दशरथस्य च।।5.58.70।।अवाच्यं वदतो जिह्वा कथं न पतिता तव।
58_61.translation: 'O lowly demon I am the wife of valiant Rama and daughterinlaw of Dasaratha, the king of Ikshvaku race. How is it your tongue that spoke unspeakable words has not fallen down?
58_61.word_by_word: राक्षसाधम lowly rakshasa, अमिततेजसः highly valourous one, रामस्य Rama's, भार्याम् wife, इक्ष्वाकुकुलनाथस्य of the king of Ikshvaku race, दशरथस्य Dasaratha's, स्नुषां च daughterinlaw, अवाच्यम् unspeakable, वदतः words, तव your, जिह्वा tongue, कथम् how, न पतिता not fallen.

58_62.shloka: किञ्चिद्वीर्यं तवानार्य यो मां भर्तुरसन्निधौ।।5.58.71।।अपहृत्याऽऽगतः पाप ते नादृष्टो महात्मना।
58_62.translation: 'O ignoble one when my husband was away, you came and abducted me unseen by the great Rama. You do not have even a little courage (to win me through a straight fight).
58_62.word_by_word: नार्य ignoble, पाप sinner, यः such you, भर्तुः husband, असन्निधौ not near, माम् me, अपहृत्य abducted, महात्मना great, तेन by his, अदृष्टः without being seen, आगतः came, तव your, वीर्यम् courage, किञ्चित् not have little.

58_63.shloka: न त्वं रामस्य सदृशो दास्येऽप्यस्य न युज्यसे।।5.58.72।।यज्ञीय स्सत्यवादी च रणश्लाघी च राघवः।
58_63.translation: 'You are not equal to Rama and not even fit to be his servant. He does yagnas and always abides in truth. He is valiant in war.
58_63.word_by_word: त्वम् you, रामस्य Rama's, सदृशः not equal, न not, अस्य his, दास्येऽपि even of servant, न युज्यसे not fit to be, राघवः Rama, यज्ञीयः does yagnas, सत्यवादी always abides in truth, रणश्लाघी च and valiant in war.

58_64.shloka: जानक्या परुषं वाक्यमेवमुक्तो दशाननः।।5.58.73।।जज्वाल सहसा कोपाच्चितास्थ इव पावकः।
58_64.translation: "Thus addressed harshly by Janaki, the tenheaded Ravana blazed up in anger suddenly like the flame of the funeral pyre.
58_64.word_by_word: जानक्या by Janaki, एवम् in that way, परुषम् harsh, उक्तः spoken, दशाननः tenheaded one, सहसा suddenly, चितास्थः in the funeral pyre, पावकः इव like fire, कोपात् in anger, जज्वाल like flame.

58_65.shloka: विवृत्य नयने क्रूरे मुष्टिमुद्यम्य दक्षिणम्।।5.58.74।।मैथिलीं हन्तुमारब्ध: स्त्रीभिर्हाहाकृतं तदा।
58_65.translation: "Then the wicked Ravana raised his eyebrows and his right fist to strike at Sita and even the shedemon there raised their voice saying, ' alas, alas '
