58_65.word_by_word: क्रूरे wicked, नयने eyes, विवृत्य opened, दक्षिणम् right hand, मुष्टिम् fist, उद्यम्य raised, मैथिलीम् Mythili, हन्तुम् to kill, आरब्धः started, तदा then, स्त्रीभिः even the women there, हाहाकृतम् raised their voice saying, alas

58_66.shloka: स्त्रीणां मध्यात्समुत्पत्य तस्य भार्या दुरात्मनः।।5.58.75।।वरा मन्दोदरी नाम तया स प्रतिषेधितः।
58_66.translation: "Evilminded Ravana's wife Mandodari, a noble one among women came forward from the midst and prevented him.
58_66.word_by_word: दुरात्मनः evilminded, तस्य his, भार्या wife, मन्दोदरी नाम named Mandodari, वरा noble one, स्त्रीणाम् among women, मध्यात् from the midst, समुत्पत्य came, तया forward, सः he, प्रतिषेधितः objected.

58_67.shloka: उक्तश्च मधुरां वाणीं तया स मदनार्दितः।।5.58.76।।सीतया तव किं कार्यं महेन्द्रसमविक्रमः।
58_67.translation: "She spoke sweetly to Ravana, who was tormented by the god of love saying, 'For what purpose do you desire Sita? You are equal to Mahendra in might'.
58_67.word_by_word: मदनार्दितः  tormented by god of love, सः he, तया such, मधुराम् sweet, वाणीम् words, उक्तश्च having spoken, महेन्द्रसमविक्रमः equal to Mahendra in might, सीतया Sita, तव your, किं कार्यम् for what purpose.

58_68.shloka: देवगन्धर्वकन्याभिर्यक्षकन्याभिरेव च।।5.58.77।।सार्धं प्रभो रमस्वेह सीतया किं करिष्यसि।
58_68.translation: 'O lord you enjoy with the daughters of gods, gandharvas and even the young ladies of yakshas. Why do you need Sita?'
58_68.word_by_word: प्रभो O Lord, देवगन्धर्वकन्याभिः even gods and  daughters of gandharvas, यक्षकन्याभिरेवच even young yaksha ladies, सार्धम् all, इह here, रमस्व enjoy, सीतया with Sita, किं करिष्यसि why do you need.

58_69.shloka: ततस्ताभिस्समेताभिर्नारीभिस्स महाबलः।।5.58.78।।प्रसाद्य सहसा नीतो भवनं स्वं निशाचरः।
58_69.translation: "Then all the women got together and stopped the mighty nightranger, Ravana and quickly took him back to his mansion.
58_69.word_by_word: ततः then, महाबलः mighty, सः निशाचरः nightwanderer, समेताभिः together, ताभिः नारीभिः all the women, प्रसाद्य  sprang up, सहसा quickly, स्वं भवनम् his mansion, नीतः took.

58_70.shloka: याते तस्मिन् दशग्रीवे राक्षस्यो विकृताननाः।।5.58.79।।सीतां निर्भर्त्सयामासुर्वाक्यैः क्रूरैस्सुदारुणैः।
58_70.word_by_word: तस्मिन् दशग्रीवे when that tenheaded one, याते went, विकृताननाः those uglyfaced ones, राक्षस्यः demons, क्रूरैः cruel, सुदारुणैः frightful, वाक्यैः words, सीताम् to Sita, निर्भर्त्सयामासुः threatened.

58_71.shloka: तृणवद्भाषितं तासां गणयामास जानकी।।5.58.80।।गर्जितं च तदा तासां सीतां प्राप्य निरर्थकम्।
58_71.translation: "Janaki did not care for their words of threat, as though they were a blade of grass and of no use to her.
58_71.word_by_word: जानकी Janaki, तासाम् those, भाषितम् words, तृणवत् like a blade of grass, गणयामास not cared, तदा then, तासाम् they, गर्जितम् frightened, सीताम् Sita, प्राप्य uttered, निरर्थकम् were of no use.

58_72.shloka: वृथागर्जितनिश्चेष्टा राक्षस्यः पिशिताशनाः।।5.58.81।।रावणाय शशंसुस्ताः सीताध्यवसितं महत्।
58_72.translation: "Since the threatenings of the shedemons were of no use the ogresses who live on flesh and blood reported to Ravana about great Sita's formidable determination.
58_72.word_by_word: पिशिताशनाः flesh eaters, ताः राक्षस्यः those demonesses, वृथागर्जितनिश्चेष्टाः since their threatenings were of no use, महत् great, तत् that, सीताद्यवसितम् Sita's determination wasformidable, रावणाय to Ravana, शशंसुः reported.

58_73.translation: "Then all of them gave up hope of their efforts and scattered around her, succumbed to sleep.
58_73.word_by_word: ततः then, सर्वाः all, ताः those, सहिताः together, निहताशाः given up hope, निरुद्यमाः given up their efforts, ताम् they, समन्तात् all over, परिक्षिप्य scattered around, निद्रावशम् to sleep, उपागताः succumbed.

58_74.shloka: तासु चैव प्रसुप्तासु सीता भर्तृहिते रता।।5.58.83।।विलप्य करुणं दीना प्रशुशोच सुदुःखिता।
58_74.word_by_word: तासु them, प्रसुप्तासु after sleeping, भर्तृहिते wellwisher of the husband, रता one who remained, सीता Sita, दीना miserable, करुणम् pathetically, विलप्य crying, सुदुःखिता very sad, प्रशुशोच lamented.

58_75.shloka: तासां मध्यात्समुत्थाय त्रिजटा वाक्यमब्रवीत्।।5.58.84।।आत्मानं खादत क्षिप्रं न सीता विनशिष्यति।जनकस्यात्मजा साध्वी स्नुषा दशरथस्य च।।5.58.85।।
58_75.translation: "From the midst of all of them got up Trijata, saying, 'You eat me if you like. Know that Janaka's daughter is a chaste woman and is the daughterinlaw of Dasaratha. She cannot be destroyed'.
58_75.word_by_word: तासाम् all of them, मध्यात् midst, समुत्थाय got up, त्रिजटा Trijata, वाक्यम् these words, अब्रवीत् said, क्षिप्रम् at once, आत्मानम् you, खादत eat me, जनकस्य Janaka's, आत्मजा daughter,साध्वी chaste, दशरथस्य Dasaratha's, स्नुषा daughterinlaw, सीता Sita, न विनशिष्यति not be destroyed.

58_76.shloka: स्वप्नो ह्यद्य मया दृष्टो दारुणो रोमहर्षणः।रक्षसां च विनाशाय भर्तुरस्या जयाय च।।5.58.86।।
58_76.translation: 'Today I saw in my dream, a dreadful and horripilating scene of destruction of demons and even victory of Sita's husband.
58_76.word_by_word: रक्षसाम् rakshasas, विनाशाय च even destruction, अस्याः her, भर्तुः husband's, जयाय च even victory, अद्य today, मया to me, दारुणः dreadful, रोमहर्षणः horripilating experience, स्वप्नः in dream, दृष्टः saw.

58_77.translation: 'To protect the demon clan from destruction by Rama, it is enough if we beg her (pardon). Indeed, I think that way.
58_77.word_by_word: अस्मात् from that, राघवात् by Rama, राक्षसीगणम् rakshasa clan, परित्रातुम् to protect, अलम् enough, वैदेहीम् Vaidehi's, अभियाचाम will beg her, एतत् by that, मम our, रोचते हि thinking indeed.

58_78.shloka: यस्या ह्येवंविधस्स्वप्नो दुःखितायाः प्रदृश्यते।सा दुःखैर्विविधैर्मुक्ता सुखमाप्नोत्यनुत्तमम्।।5.58.88।।प्रणिपातप्रसन्ना हि मैथिली जनकात्मजा।
58_78.translation: 'Whoever in a sorrowful state sees such kind of dream, would be not only relieved of all sorrows but will experience immense happiness. Janaka's daughter Sita will bless us with protection if we pray her.
58_78.word_by_word: यस्याः whoever, दुःखितायाः is in sorrow, एवं विधः in this way, स्वप्नः dream, प्रदृश्यते sees, सा that, विविधैः many, दुःखै grief, विमुक्ता will be relieved, अनुत्तमम् immense, सुखम् happiness, आप्नोति will result, जनकात्मजा Janaka's daughter, मैथिली Maithili, प्रणिपातप्रसन्ना हि will bless us if we pray her.

58_79.shloka: ततस्सा ह्रीमती बाला भर्तुर्विजयहर्षिता।।5.58.89।।अवोचद्यदि तत्तथ्यं भवेयं शरणं हि वः।
58_79.translation: 'On hearing the words (of Trijata) that 'Rama will succeed', young and bashful Sita felt happy and said that 'If it comes true I will protect thee'.
58_79.word_by_word: ततः then, ह्रीमती bashful, बाला young, सा that Sita, भर्तुः husband, विजयहर्षिता feeling happy that he will succeed, अवोचत् hearing the words, तत् that, तथ्यं यदि comes true, वः thee, शरणम् protect, भवेयम् I will.

58_80.shloka: तां चाहं तादृशीं दृष्ट्वा सीताया दारुणां दशाम्।चिन्तयामास विक्रान्तो न च मे निर्वृतं मनः।।5.58.90।।
58_80.translation: "Seeing Sita's deplorable state, her illluck and her dread, I began  to worry and had no peace of mind.
58_80.word_by_word: अहम् I, विक्रान्तः heroic, सीतायाः Sita, तादृशीम् seeing her deplorable state, ताम् her, दारुणाम् dreadful, दशाम् state, दृष्ट्वा on seeing, चिन्तयामास started worrying, मे myself, मनः in mind, न निर्वृतम् not had peace.

58_81.shloka: सम्भाषणार्थं च मया जानक्याश्चिन्तितो विधिः।।5.58.91।।इक्ष्वाकूणां हि वंशस्तु ततो मम पुरस्कृतः।
58_81.translation: "I thought of a strategy to enter into conversation with Janaki that is to praise the Ikshvaku race.
58_81.word_by_word: मया I am, जानक्याः with Janaki, सम्भाषणार्थम् to enter into conversation, विधि strategy, चिन्तितः thought, ततः that, इक्ष्वाकूणाम् in Ikshvaku, वंशस्तु in the race, मम my, पुरस्कृतः to praise.

58_82.shloka: श्रुत्वा तु गदितां वाचं राजर्षिगणपूजिताम्।।5.58.92।।प्रत्यभाषत मां देवी बाष्पैः पिहितलोचना।
58_82.translation: "The divine lady heard my enumeration, sanctifying the royal seers. She replied me, with  her eyes blinded by tears:
58_82.word_by_word: देवी the divine lady, राजर्षिगणपूजिताम् sanctified by the names of royal seers, गदिताम् enumerated, वाचम् words, श्रुत्वा heard, बाष्पैः tears, पिहितलोचना eyes blinded, माम् me, प्रत्यभाषत replied.

58_83.shloka: कस्त्वं केन कथं चेह प्राप्तो वानरपुङ्गवः।।5.58.93।।का च रामेण ते प्रीतिस्तन्मे शंसितुमर्हसि।
58_83.translation: "O foremost of vanaras who are you? Why and how have you come here? How did you make friendship with Rama? Tell me all that in detail.
58_83.word_by_word: वानरपुङ्गव foremost of vanaras, त्वम् you, कः who, केन why, कथम् how, इह here, प्राप्तः could come, ते to you, रामेण with Rama, प्रीतिः friendship, का tell, तत् that, मे to me, शंसितुम् in detail, अर्हसि it is prpoer.

58_84.shloka: तस्यास्तद्वचनं श्रुत्वा ह्यहमप्यब्रुवं वचः।।5.58.94।।देवि रामस्य भर्तुस्ते सहायो भीमविक्रमः।सुग्रीवो नाम विक्रान्तो वानरेन्द्रो महाबलः।।5.58.95।।
58_84.translation: "Hearing her I also said, 'O queen Sugriva, the warrior of fierce valour and king of monkeys developed friendship with your husband'.
58_84.word_by_word: तस्याः तत् her those, वचनम् words, श्रुत्वा hearing, अहमपि I also, वचः these words, अब्रुवम् spoke, देवि O queen, ते to your, भर्तुः husband, सहायः help, महाबलः mighty, भीमविक्रमः fierce valour, सुग्रीवो नाम named Sugriva, विक्रान्तः warrior, वानरेन्द्रः king of monkeys.

58_85.shloka: तस्य मां विद्धि भृत्यं त्वं हनुमन्तमिहागतम्।भर्त्राहं प्रेषितस्तुभ्यं रामेणाक्लिष्टकर्मणा।।5.58.96।।
58_85.translation: 'I came here as a servant sent by your tireless husband to find you.
58_85.word_by_word: इह here, आगतम् I came, माम् me, तस्य his, भृत्यम् servant, त्वम् you, विद्धि to find, अहम् I, भर्त्रा by your husband, अक्लिष्टकर्मणा tireless in action, रामेण by Rama, तुभ्यम् for your sake, प्रेषितः sent me.

58_86.shloka: इदं च पुरुषव्याघ्रः श्रीमान् दाशरथिः स्वयम्।अङ्गुलीयमभिज्ञानमदात्तुभ्यं यशस्विनि।।5.58.97।।
58_86.translation: 'O glorious lady the tiger among men, the illustrious son of Dasaratha himself sent this ring to you as a taken of identity.
58_86.word_by_word: यशस्विनि O glorious lady, पुरुषव्याघ्रः tiger among men, श्रीमान् illustrious, दाशरथिः Dasaratha's son, स्वयम् himself, इदम् this, अङ्गुलीयम् this ring, तुभ्यम् to you, अभिज्ञानम् to recognise, अदात् sent.

58_87.shloka: तदिच्छामि त्वयाऽऽज्ञप्तं देवि किं करवाण्यहम्।रामलक्ष्मणयोः पार्श्वं नयामि त्वां किमुत्तरम्।।5.58.98।।
58_87.translation: 'O venerable lady I seek your order. What should I do? Should I take you to  Rama and Lakshmana? What do you say?
58_87.word_by_word: देवि O venerable lady, तत् that, त्वया by your, आज्ञप्तम् order, इच्छामि wish to know, अहम् I, किम् what, करवाणि to do, त्वाम् you, रामलक्ष्मणयोः both Rama and Lakshmana, पार्श्वम् to them, नयामि take you, उत्तरम् back, किम् what do you say?

58_88.shloka: एतच्छ्रुत्वा विदित्वा च सीता जनकनन्दिनी।आहरावणमुत्साद्य राघवो मां नयत्विति।।5.58.99।।
58_88.translation: "Having heard all that (Hanuman said) Sita, the delight of Janaka thought over and said, 'Rama should kill Ravana and take me'.
58_88.word_by_word: जनकनन्दिनी delight of Janaka, सीता Sita, एतत् all this, श्रुत्वा having heard, विदित्त्वा च thought over, राघवः Rama, रावणम् Ravana, उत्साद्य slaying, माम् me, नयतु should take, इति this, आह she said.

58_89.translation: "Then bowing down I saluted the noble and blameless queen Sita to give a signet, which would be very pleasing to Rama.
58_89.word_by_word: अहम् I am, आर्याम् noble, अनिन्दिताम् flawless, देवीम् queen, शिरसा bowing, प्रणम्य saluted, राघवस्य to Rama, मनोह्लादम् very pleasing to his mind, अभिज्ञानम् to recognise, अयाचिषम् signet.

58_90.shloka: अथ मामब्रवीत्सीता गृह्यतामयमुत्तमः।मणिर्येन महाबाहू रामस्त्वां बहुमन्यते।।5.58.101।।
58_90.translation: "Sita then said to me, 'Take this best of gems and present it to the longarmed Rama as a token'.
58_90.word_by_word: अथ and then, सीता Sita, माम् to me, अब्रवीत् said, उत्तमः best, अयम् this, मणिः gem, गृह्यताम् take, येन by this, महाबाहुः longarmed, रामः Rama, त्वाम् you, बहुमन्यते  presented to him.

58_91.shloka: इत्युक्त्वा तु वरारोहा मणिप्रवरमद्भुतम्।प्रायच्छत्परमोद्विग्ना वाचा मां सन्दिदेशह।।5.58.102।।
58_91.translation: "Having said so, the noble lady delivered a wonderful jewel with supreme message to me in a sorrowful mood.
58_91.word_by_word: वरारोहा fairhipped lady, इति thus, उक्त्वा having delivered, अद्भुतम् wonderful, मणिप्रवरम् excellent jewel, प्रायच्छत् gave, परमोद्विग्ना in an anxious state, माम् me, वाचा spoke, सन्दिदेश ह message.

58_92.translation: "Reminded by her again (that Rama should turn up soon to take her), I offered reverential salutations by circumambulating her.
58_92.word_by_word: ततः then, अहम् I, तस्यै her, राजपुत्र्यै princess, प्रणम्य saluted, समाहितः with focused mind, इह here, अभ्युद्गतमानसः should come soon, प्रदक्षिणम् circumambulated, परिक्रामम् went round.

58_93.shloka: उक्तोऽहं पुनरेवेदं निश्चित्य मनसा तया।हनुमन्मम वृत्तान्तं वक्तुमर्हसि राघवे।।5.58.104।।
58_93.word_by_word: अहम् I, तया to her, मनसा in mind, निश्चित्य determined, पुनरेव again, उक्तः said, हनुमान् Hanuman, राघवे to Rama, मम my, वृत्तान्तम् all about my story, वक्तुम् you tell, अर्हसि I wish.

58_94.shloka: यथा श्रुत्वैव न चिरात्तावुभौ रामलक्ष्मणौ।सुग्रीवसहितौ वीरावुपेयातां तथा कुरु।।5.58.105।।
58_94.translation: 'O heroic Hanuman narrate in such a way that by hearing you both Rama and Lakshmana will come here soon, accompanied by Sugriva.
58_94.word_by_word: वीरौ heroic one, तौ they both, रामलक्ष्मणौ Rama and Lakshmana, उभौ both, श्रुत्वैव on hearing, सुग्रीवसहितौ accompanied by Sugriva, न चिरात् not very late, यथा that way, उपेयाताम् coming here, तथा that way, कुरु you may do.

58_95.shloka: यद्यन्यथा भवेदेतद्द्वौ मासौ जीवितं मम।न मां द्रक्ष्यति काकुत्स्थो म्रिये साहमनाथवत्।।5.58.106।।
58_95.translation: 'Otherwise with none to protect me, I will live only  for two months.I will die like an orphan and he will not see me'.
58_95.word_by_word: अन्यथा otherwise, भवेद्यदि with none to protect, मम I, जीवितम् life, द्वौ two, मासौ months only, काकुत्स्थ to Rama, माम् me, न द्रक्ष्यति not see, सा अहम् that I, अनाथवत् like an orphan, म्रिये will die.

58_96.shloka: तच्छ्रुत्वा करुणं वाक्यं क्रोधो मामभ्यवर्तत।उत्तरं च मया दृष्टं कार्यशेषमनन्तरम्।।5.58.107।।
58_96.translation: "When I heard her pathetic appeal, I was overtaken by anger. I perceived the task left over for me to do.
58_96.word_by_word: करुणम् pathetic, तत् these, वाक्यम् words, श्रुत्वा having heard, माम् me, क्रोधः anger, अभ्यवर्तत overtaken, उत्तरम् reply, अनन्तरम् after that, कार्यशेषम् left over task, मया by me, दृष्टम् perceived.

58_97.shloka: ततोऽवर्धत मे कायस्तदा पर्वतसन्निभः।युद्धकाङ्क्षी वनं तच्च विनाशयितुमारभे।।5.58.108।।
58_97.translation: "Thereafter, I increased my body to the size of a mountain, intent on fighting and started destroying the pleasure garden.
58_97.word_by_word: ततः that, तदा then, मे I, कायः body, पर्वतसन्निभः like a mountain, अवर्धत increased, युद्धकाङ्क्षी intent on fighting, तत् that, वनम् garden, विनाशयितुम् to destroy, आरभे started.

58_98.shloka: तद्भग्नं वनषण्डं तु भ्रान्तत्रस्तमृगद्विजम्।प्रतिबुद्धा निरीक्षन्ते राक्षस्यो विकृताननाः।।5.58.109।।
58_98.translation: "Those uglyfaced ogresses woke up and saw the devastated garden and terrified beasts and birds.
58_98.word_by_word: विकृताननाः uglyfaced, राक्षस्यः ogresses, प्रतिबुद्धाः woke up and saw, भग्नम् broken, भ्रान्तत्रस्तमृगद्विजम् terrified birds and beasts, तत् that, वनषण्डम् destroyed garden, निरीक्षन्ते saw.

58_99.shloka: मां च दृष्ट्वा वने तस्मिन् समागम्य ततस्ततः।ता स्समभ्यागताः क्षिप्रं रावणायाचचक्षिरे।।5.58.110।।
58_99.word_by_word: ततस्ततः here and there, समागम्य collecting together, तस्मिन् वने in that garden, माम् me, दृष्ट्वा saw, ताः them, क्षिप्रम् at once, समभ्यागताः understood, रावणाय to Ravana, आचचक्षिरे thus reported.

58_100.shloka: राजस्वनमिदं दुर्गं तव भग्नं दुरात्मना।वानरेण ह्यविज्ञाय तव वीर्यं महाबल।।5.58.111।।
58_100.translation: 'O powerful king an evilminded vanara has destroyed the inaccessible pleasure garden not knowing your valour.
58_100.word_by_word: महाबल powerful, राजन् king, दुरात्मना evilminded, वानरेण by a vanara, तव your, वीर्यम्valour, अविज्ञाय not knowing, दुर्गम् inaccessible, तव your, इदं वनम् this garden, भग्नम् destroyed.

58_101.shloka: दुर्बुद्धेस्तस्य राजेन्द्र तव विप्रियकारिणः।वधमाज्ञापय क्षिप्रं यथासौ विलयं व्रजेत्।।5.58.112।।
58_101.translation: 'O king may orders be issued to kill this wickedminded vanara wandering aimlessly. He has done contrary to your interest.
58_101.word_by_word: राजेन्द्र O king, असौ यथा this, विलयम् aimlessly, व्रजेत् wanderer, तव your, विप्रियकारिणः who has done contrary to your interest, दुर्बुध्देः wickedminded, तस्य his, वधम् to kill, क्षिप्रम् immediately, आज्ञापय order.

58_102.shloka: तच्छ्रुत्वा राक्षसेन्द्रेण विसृष्टा भृशदुर्जयाः।राक्षसाः किङ्करा नाम रावणस्य मनोनुगाः।।5.58.113।।
58_102.translation: "Ravana, lord of the demons having heard (the ogresses) sent invincible ogres called kinkaras who know his mind.
58_102.word_by_word: तत् that, श्रुत्वा having heard, राक्षसेन्द्रेण by the lord of demons, भृशदुर्जयाः who are invincible, रावणस्य Ravana's, मनोनुगाः those who know his mind, किङ्करा नाम called kinkara, राक्षसाः demon, विसृष्टाः sent.

58_103.translation: "I killed with an iron bar a battalion of eighty thousand demons who were guarding the garden with tridents and maces.
58_103.word_by_word: तस्मिन् those, वनोद्धेशे near the garden, शूलमुद्गरपाणिनाम् tridents and maces, तेषाम् with them, अशीतिसाहस्रम् battalion of eighty thousand (demons), मया by me, परिघेण by iron bar, निषूदितम् killed.

58_104.shloka: तेषां तु हतशेषा ये ते गत्वा लघुविक्रमाः।निहतं च महत्सैन्यं रावणायाचचक्षिरे।।5.58.115।।
58_104.translation: "Those who were left behind, the less powerful ones went and reported to Ravana that the great army has been killed.
58_104.word_by_word: तेषाम् them, ये who were, हतशेषाः left behind, ते they, लघुविक्रमाः less powerful, गत्वा went, महत् great, सैन्यम् army, निहतम् killed, रावणाय to Ravana, आचचक्षिरे reported.

58_105.shloka: ततो मे बुद्धिरुत्पन्ना चैत्यप्रासादमाक्रमम्।तत्रस्थान्राक्षसान् हत्वा शतं स्तम्भेन वै पुनः।।5.58.116।।ललामभूतो लङ्कायास्स वै विध्वंसितो मया।
58_105.translation: "Then a thought struck my mind. I took hold of a pillar of the tall, decorated mansion of Lanka and killed with it all the hundred demons stationed there.
58_105.word_by_word: ततः then, मे I, बुद्धिः intellect, उत्पन्ना arose, चैत्यप्रासादम् high rise mansion, आक्रमम् taking hold, स्तम्भेन with a pillar, तत्रस्थान् stationed there, शतम् a hundred, राक्षसान् demons, हत्वा killed, पुनः again, मया by me, लङ्कायाः in Lanka, ललामभूतः a decorative mansion, सः that, विध्वंसितः destroyed.

58_106.word_by_word: ततः then, घोररूपैः of terrific appearance, भयानकैः frightening, बहुभिः many, राक्षसैः ogres, सार्धम् together with, प्रहस्तस्य Prahasta's, सुतम् son, जम्बुमालिनम् Jambumali, आदिशत् ordered

58_107.shloka: तं महाबलसम्पन्नं राक्षसं रणकोविदम्।।5.58.118।।परिघेणातिघोरेण सूदयामि सहानुगम्।
58_107.translation: "With a dreadful iron bar I slayed Jambumali, who was endowed with mighty strength, and was an expert in war and other terrific ogres who accompanied him.
58_107.word_by_word: महाबलसम्पन्नम् endowed with mighty strength, रणकोविदम् expert in war, सहानुगम् and others who accompanied, तं राक्षसम् the demons, घोरेण by a terrific, परिघेण with iron bar, सूदयामि slayed.

58_108.translation: "Ravana, the demon king sent his mighty army of strong footsoldiers, the sons of ministers.
58_108.word_by_word: राक्षसेन्द्रः demon king, रावणः Ravana, महाबलान् mighty army, पदातिबलसम्पन्नान् strong footsoldiers, मन्त्रिपुत्रान् sons of ministers, प्रेषयामास sent.

58_109.shloka: परिघेणैव तान् सर्वान्नयामि यमसादनम्।।5.58.120।।मन्त्रिपुत्त्रान्हतान्च्छृत्वा समरेऽलघुविक्रमान्।पञ्च सेनाग्रगाच्छ्रूरान्प्रेषयामास रावणः।।5.58.121।।
58_109.translation: "I sent all of them to the abode of Yama with just an iron bar. Having heard about the death of the less powerful ones, Ravana  sent five heroic army generals.
58_109.word_by_word: तान् सर्वान् all of them, परिघेणैव with iron bar only, यमसादनम् the abode of Yama, नयामि sent, रावणः Ravana, समरे in combat, लघुविक्रमान् less valiant, मन्त्रिपुत्रान् sons of ministers, हतान् having been killed, श्रुत्वा heard, शूरान् heroes, पञ्च five, सेनाग्रगान् army generals, प्रेषयामास sent.

58_110.shloka: तानहं सहसैन्यान्वै सर्वानेवाभ्यसूदयम्।ततः पुनर्दशग्रीवः पुत्रमक्षं महाबलम्।।5.58.122।।बहुभी राक्षसैस्सार्धं प्रेषयामास रावणः।
58_110.translation: "Since I killed all of them along with the army, the tenheaded Ravana sent out his mighty son Aksha together with many demons.
58_110.word_by_word: अहम् I, सहसैन्यान् along with the army, तान् सर्वान् all of them, अभ्यसूदयम् having been killed, ततः then, दशग्रीवः tenheaded, रावणः Ravana, महाबलम् mighty, पुत्रम् son, अक्षम् Aksha, बहुभिः and many, राक्षसैः demons, सार्धम् together with, प्रेषयामास sent out.

58_111.shloka: तं तु मन्दोदरीपुत्त्रं कुमारं रणपण्डितम्।।5.58.123।।सहसा खं समुत्क्रान्तं पादयोश्च गृहीतवान्।चर्मासिनं शतगुणं भ्रामयित्वा व्यपेषयम्।।5.58.124।।
58_111.translation: "When Mandodari's son, an expert in war had risen up to the sky I caught his feet and whirled him round a hundred times and smashed him.
58_111.word_by_word: रणपण्डितम् expert in war, मन्दोदरीपुत्त्रम् Mandodari's son, खम् to the sky, उत्क्रान्तम् risen up, चर्मासिनम् feet, तं कुमारम् of that young man, सहसा at once, पादयोः both feet, गृहीतवान् caught hold of, शतगुणम् hundred times, भ्रामयित्वा whirled him round, व्यवेषयम् smashed.

58_112.shloka: तमक्षमागतं भग्नं निशम्य स दशाननः।तत इन्द्रजितं नाम द्वितीयं रावणस्सुतम्।।5.58.125।।व्यादिदेश सुसंकृद्धो बलिनम् युद्धदुर्मदम्।
58_112.translation: "When Aksha was done to death, the tenfaced Ravana was enraged and gave instruction to the second son, called Indrajit who was thirsting for war.
58_112.word_by_word: दशाननः tenfaced, सः रावणः that Ravana, आगतम् gone, अक्षम् of Aksha, भग्नम् destroyed, निशम्य after hearing, सुसंकृद्धः became very angry, ततः then, बलिनम् strong, युद्धदुर्मदम् thirsting for war, इन्द्रजितं नाम named Indrajit, द्वितीयम् second, सुतम् son, व्यादिदेश gave instruction.

58_113.shloka: तच्चाप्यहं बलं सर्वं तं च राक्षसपुङ्गवम्।।5.58.126।।नष्टौजसं रणे कृत्वा परं हर्षमुपागमम्।
58_113.translation: "When the army and even the Generals were done to death in combat I was very happy.
58_113.word_by_word: अहम् I, सर्वम् all, तत् that, बलं च even army, तम् them, राक्षसपुङ्गवं च even the army chiefs, रणे in combat, नष्टौजसम् having been destroyed, कृत्वा done, परम् very, हर्षम् happy, उपागमम् became.

58_114.shloka: महतापि महाबाहुः प्रत्ययेन महाबलः।।5.58.127।।प्रेषितो रावणेनैव सह वीरैर्मदोत्कटैः।
58_114.translation: "Thinking that Indrajit will surely kill me, the strongarmed mighty Ravana again sent intoxicated demon warriors.
58_114.word_by_word: महाबाहुः strongarmed, महाबलः mighty, मदोत्कटैः intoxicated, वीरैः सह including the warriors, रावणेनैव Ravana's confidence, महता great, प्रत्ययेन again,प्रेषितः sent.

58_115.shloka: सोऽविषह्यं हि मां बुद्ध्वा स्वं बलं चावमर्दितम्।।5.58.128।।ब्राह्मणास्त्रेण स तु मां प्राबध्नाच्छातिवेगितः।
58_115.translation: "Realising that I cannot be slain and that his (Indrajit's) power is reduced, he released Brahma's weapon on me with high speed and captured me.
58_115.word_by_word: सः he, माम् my, आविषह्यम् cannot be slain, बुद्ध्वा knowing, स्वम् his, बलं च strength, अवमर्दितम् is reduced, स तु that, अतिवेगितः with high speed, माम् at me, ब्राह्मेण अस्त्रेण Brahma's weapon, प्राबध्नात् captured.

58_116.shloka: रज्जुभिश्चाभिबध्नन्ति ततो मां तत्र राक्षसाः।।5.58.129।।रावणस्य समीपं च गृहीत्वा मामुपानयन्।
58_116.translation: "Then the demons bound me with ropes and brought me to Ravana.
58_116.word_by_word: ततः then, तत्र there, राक्षसाः demons, माम् me, रज्जुभिः with ropes, अभिबध्नन्ति also bound, माम् me, गृहीत्वा holding, रावणस्य to Ravana, समीपम् near, उपानयन् brought.

58_117.shloka: दृष्ट्वा सम्भाषितश्चाहं रावणेन दुरात्मना।।5.58.130।।पृष्टश्च लङ्कागमनं राक्षसानां च तं वधम्।
58_117.translation: "The wickedminded Ravana, then enquired me why I came to Lanka and why I killed the demons.
58_117.word_by_word: अहम् I, दुरात्मना wickedminded, रावणेन by Ravana, दृष्ट्वा on seeing, सम्बाषितश्च conversed, लङ्कागमनम् about my coming to Lanka, राक्षसानाम् ogres, तम् them, वधम् killing, पृष्टश्च enquired.

58_118.shloka: तत्सर्वं च मया तत्र सीतार्थमिति जल्पितम्।।5.58.131।।अस्याहं दर्शनाकाङ्क्षी प्राप्तस्त्वद्भवनं विभो।मारुतस्यौरसः पुत्रो वानरो हनुमानहम्।।5.58.132।।
58_118.translation: 'I have done all this for the sake of Sita, O demon king I came to your mansion desiring to see Sita. I am the legitimate son of Windgod. My name is Hanuman.
58_118.word_by_word: तत् that, सर्वम् entire, सीतार्थमिति for Sita's sake, मया I am, तत्र there, जल्पितम् burnt, विभो O king, अस्याः your, दर्शनकाङ्क्षी desiring to see her, त्वद्भवनम् your mansion, प्राप्तःreached, अहम् I, मारुतस्य Windgod's, औरसः पुत्रः legitimate son, वानरः vanara, हनुमान् Hanuman.

58_119.shloka: रामदूतं च मां विद्धि सुग्रीवसचिवं कपिम्।सोऽहं दूत्येन रामस्य त्वत्सकाशमिहागतः।।5.58.133।।
58_119.translation: 'I am a vanara, a messenger of Rama and minister of Sugriva.You may know that I have come here to convey the message of Rama to you.
58_119.word_by_word: कपिम् I am a vanara, माम् I am, रामदूतम् messenger of Rama, सुग्रीवसचिवम् minister of Sugriva, विद्धि you may know, सः अहम् that I, रामस्य Rama's, दूत्येन as messenger, त्वत्सकाशम् to convey that message, इह here, आगतः came.

58_120.shloka: सुग्रीवश्च महातेजास्सत्वां कुशलमब्रवीत्।धर्मार्थकामसहितं हितं पथ्यमुवाच च।।5.58.134।।
58_120.translation: 'Highly powerful Sugriva enquires your welfare. He sends beneficial advice to you for your righteousness, pleasures and wellbeing.
58_120.word_by_word: महातेजाः highly powerful, सः सुग्रीवश्च Sugriva, त्वाम् to you, कुशलम् welfare, अब्रवीत् enquires, धर्मार्थकामसहितम् in accordance with dharma, wealth and wellbeing, पथ्यम् that which provides, हितम् beneficial advice, उवाच sent.

58_121.shloka: वसतो ऋश्यमूके मे पर्वते विपुलद्रुमे।राघवो रणविक्रान्तो मित्त्रत्वं समुपागतः।।5.58.135।।
58_121.translation: 'While I was dwelling at the woodedmountain in Rshyamuka, a treaty of friendship was made with Rama, who is skilled in war.
58_121.word_by_word: विपुलद्रुमे filled with plenty of trees, ऋश्यमूके Rshyamuka, वसतः dwelling, मे I, रणविक्रान्तः skilled in war, राघवः Rama, मित्त्रत्वम् friendship, उपागतः was made.

58_122.shloka: तेन मे कथितं राज्ञा भार्या मे रक्षसा हृता।तत्र साहाय्यमस्माकं कार्यं सर्वात्मना त्वया।।5.58.136।।
58_122.translation: 'The king said, ' My wife was abducted by a demon. I request your help by all means to get her'.
58_122.word_by_word: राज्ञा the king, तेन by him, मे to me, कथितम् revealed, मे भार्या my wife, रक्षसा by the demon, हृता abducted, तत्र there, त्वया by your, सर्वात्मना by all ways, अस्माकम् by you, साहाय्यम् help, कार्यम् do.

58_123.shloka: मया च कथितं तस्मै वालिनश्च वधं प्रति।तत्र साहाय्यहेतोर्मे समयं कर्तुमर्हसि।।5.58.137।।
58_123.translation: 'Sugriva told the story of Vali in turn and asked for his help and to make agreement to kill Vali.
58_123.word_by_word: मया च I also, वालिनः Vali, वधं प्रति will kill in turn, तस्मै your, कथितम् story, तत्र thereupon, मे to me, सहाय्यहेतोः will help, समयम् agreement, कर्तुम् will do (said), अर्हसि is proper.

58_124.shloka: वालिना हृतराज्येन सुग्रीवेण महाप्रभुः।चक्रेऽग्निसाक्षिकं सख्यं राघवस्सह लक्ष्मणः।।5.58.138।।
58_124.translation: With fire as witness the great lord, Rama along with Lakshmana made friendship with Sugriva whose kingdom had been usurped.
58_124.word_by_word: महाप्रभुः that great lord, सह लक्ष्मणः accompanied by Lakshmana, राघवः Rama, वालिना Vali, हृतराज्येन kingdom usurped, सुग्रीवेण by Sugriva, अग्निसाक्षिकम् in the presence of fire as witness, सख्यम् ally, चक्रे made.

58_125.shloka: तेन वालिनमुत्पाट्य शरेणैकेन संयुगे।वानराणां महाराजः कृतस्स प्लवतां प्रभुः।।5.58.139।।
58_125.translation: 'In the combat Rama killed Vali with a single arrow and made Sugriva the king of vanaras.
58_125.word_by_word: तेन and then, संयुगे in the combat, एकेन with a single, शरेण arrow, वालिनम् Vali, उत्पाट्य slayed, प्लवताम् for vanaras, प्रभुः king, सः he, वानराणाम् vanaras, महाराजः lord, कृतः did.

58_126.shloka: तस्य साहाय्यमस्माभिः कार्यं सर्वात्मना त्विह।तेन प्रस्थापितस्तुभ्यं समीपमिह धर्मतः।।5.58.140।।
58_126.translation: 'We too have to help him in this task. So a message is sent to you on righteous grounds.
58_126.word_by_word: इह here, अस्माभिः we also, सर्वात्मना all of us, तस्य to him, सहाय्यम् help, कार्यम् in this task, तेन so, तुभ्यम् surely, समीपम् to you, धर्मतः righteously, प्रस्थापितः sent to convey the message.

58_127.shloka: क्षिप्रमानीयतां सीता दीयतां राघवाय च।यावन्न हरयो वीरा विधमन्ति बलं तव।।5.58.141।।
58_127.translation: 'Before the heroic vanaras exterminate your entire army, return Sita at once to Rama.
58_127.word_by_word: वीराः heroic, हरयः vanaras, तव your, बलम् army, यावत् entire, न विधमन्ति before exterminating your army, सीता Sita, क्षिप्रम् at once, आनीयताम् get, राघवाय to Rama, दीयतां च you may give.

58_128.shloka: वानराणां प्रभावो हि न केन विदितः पुरा।देवतानां सङ्काशं च ये गच्छन्ति निमन्त्रिताः।।5.58.142।।
58_128.translation: 'Who knows not the power of Vanaras in the past? Even gods had sought their help.
58_128.word_by_word: ये who, निमन्त्रिताः summoned to, देवतानाम् even devatas, सङ्काशम् for the help, गच्छन्ति पुरा earlier, वानराणाम् by the vanaras, प्रभावः power, केन who, न विदितः does not know.

58_129.shloka: इति वानरराजस्त्वामाहेत्यभिहितो मया।मामैक्षत ततः क्रुद्धश्चक्षुषा प्रदहन्निव।।5.58.143।।
58_129.translation: 'This I was asked to tell you by the king of vanaras wishing your welfare'. 'Ravana then angrily looked at me as if to burn me.
58_129.word_by_word: इति this, वानरराजः king of vanaras, त्वाम् to you, आह to tell, इति this, मया my, अभिहितः wishing your welfare, ततः that, क्रुद्धः angrily, चक्षुषा eyes, प्रदहन्निव as if to burn, माम् at me, ऐक्षत looked.

58_130.shloka: तेन वध्योऽहमाज्ञप्तो रक्षसा रौद्रकर्मणा।मत्प्रभावमविज्ञाय रावणेन दुरात्मना।।5.58.144।।
58_130.translation: "The evilminded demon, Ravana, who perpetrates dreadful acts ordered my slaughter, not knowing my power.
58_130.word_by_word: रौद्रकर्मणा one who performs dreadful actions, रक्षसा by the demon, दुरात्मना evilminded one, तेन रावणेन by that Ravana, मत्प्रभावम् my power, अविज्ञाय not knowing, अहम् I, वध्यः to kill, आज्ञप्तः ordered.

58_131.shloka: ततो विभीषणो नाम तस्य भ्राता महामतिः।तेन राक्षसराजोऽसौ याचितो मम कारणात्।।5.58.145।।
58_131.translation: "Vibhisana, a very pious brother of the demon king, interceded on my behalf.
58_131.word_by_word: विभीषणो नाम named Vibhishana, महामतिः very pious, तस्य his, भ्राता brother, ततः then, तेन him, असौ was there, राक्षसराजः demon king, मम कारणात् on account of me, याचितः  solicited.

58_132.shloka: नैवं राक्षसशार्दूल त्यज्यतामेष निश्चयः।राजशास्त्रव्यपेतो हि मार्गः संसेव्यते त्वया।।5.58.146।।
58_132.translation: "Vibhishana, a tiger among demons, asked Ravana to give up his decision as it was a forbidden course according to the science of royal polity.
58_132.word_by_word: राक्षसशार्दूल tiger among demons, एवम् in that way, न not, एषः that way, निश्चयः decision, त्यज्यताम् give up, राजशास्त्रव्यपेतः according to science of royal polity, मार्गः course, त्वया by you, संसेव्यते हि indeed not permitted.

58_133.shloka: दूतवध्या न दृष्टा हि राजशास्त्रेषु राक्षस।दूतेन वेदितव्यं च यथार्थं हितवादिना।।5.58.147।।
58_133.translation: 'The royal code prohibits the murder of an emissary. A wellwishing emissary should convey the truth.
58_133.word_by_word: राक्षस demon, राजशास्त्रेषु by the royal code, दूतवध्या killing of emissary, न दृष्टा हि not seen indeed, हितवादिना wellwisher, दूतेन messenger, यथार्थम् truth, वेदितव्यम् has to convey.

58_134.shloka: सुमहत्यपराधेऽपि दूतस्यातुलविक्रमः।विरूपकरणं दृष्टं न वधोऽस्तीति शास्त्रतः।।5.58.148।।
58_134.translation: 'O Ravana of immeasurable courage even if the emissary has done any kind of harm he may be mutilated but not murdered. Nowhere do the sastras allow killing (of an ambassador).
58_134.word_by_word: अतुलविक्रमः one of immeasureable courage, सुमहति any kind, अपराधेऽपि harm done, दूतस्य at emissary, विरूपकरणम् may be mutilated, दृष्टम् seen, शास्त्रतः in the sastras,वधः killing,नास्ति not there.

58_135.translation: 'On hearing Vibhishana, Ravana instructed the demons to burn my tail.
58_135.word_by_word: विभीषणेन by Vibhishana, एवम् in that way, उक्तः having spoken, रावणः Ravana, अस्य his, एतत् all that, लाङ्गूलम् tail, दह्यतामिति to burn, तान् राक्षसान् to the demons, सन्दिदेश instructed.

58_136.shloka: ततस्तस्य वचः श्रुत्वा मम पुच्छं समन्ततः।वेष्टितं शणवल्कैश्च जीर्णैः कार्पासजैः पटैः।।5.58.150।।
58_136.translation: "Having heard the king's words, all the demons collected and held my tail, wrapped it with saris of fibres and tattered rags of cotton.
58_136.word_by_word: ततः then, तस्य those, वचः words, श्रुत्वा having heard, मम my, पुच्छम् tail, समन्ततः all of them together, शणवल्कैः saris made of fibre, जीर्णैः tattered, कार्पासजैः of cotton, पटैः rags, वेष्टितम् wrapped.

58_137.shloka: राक्षसाः सिद्धसन्नाहास्ततस्ते चण्डविक्रमाः।तदाऽदह्यन्त मे पुच्छं निघ्नन्त: काष्ठमुष्टिभिः।।5.58.151।।बद्धस्य बहुभिः पाशैर्यन्त्रितस्य च राक्षसैः।
58_137.translation: "Many ferociously courageous demons got ready. They bound me and hit me with firesticks and fists. They fastened my tail with ropes and set in on fire.
58_137.word_by_word: ततः then, सिद्धसन्नाहाः got ready, चण्डविक्रमाः who had terrific courage, राक्षसाः demons, काष्ठमुष्टिभिः with firesticks and fists, निघ्नन्तः hit, बहुभिः many, पाशैः ropes, बद्धस्य tied, राक्षसैः by the demons, यन्त्रितस्य fastened, मे me, पुच्छम् tail, तदा then, अदह्यन्त set fire.

58_138.translation: "The brave demons took me round the city through the royal streets and announced loudly to let every one know that I am bound and that my tail has been set on fire.
58_138.word_by_word: ततः then, शूराः courageous, राक्षसाः by demons, नगरद्वारम् gate of the city, आगताः took, बद्धम् bound, अग्निसंवृतम् set on fire, माम् me, राजमार्गे in the royal street, अघोषयन् announced loudly.

58_139.shloka: ततोऽहं सुमहद्रूपं संक्षिप्य पुनरात्मनः।।5.58.153।।विमोचयित्वा तं बन्धं प्रकृतिस्थः स्थितः पुनः।आयसं परिघं गृह्य तानि रक्षांस्यसूदयम्।।5.58.154।।
58_139.translation: "I reduced my form and rid of the bondage. Then again I assumed my original huge form and took up an iron bar lying near and killed all the demons (present).
58_139.word_by_word: ततः then, अहम् I, आत्मनः my own, सुमहत् very huge, रूपम् form, पुनः again, संक्षिप्य assumed small form, तं बन्धम् that bondage, विमोचयित्वा got rid off, पुनः again, प्रकृतिस्थः into my natural huge form, स्थितः stayed, आयसम् near by, परिघम् iron beam, गृह्य took up, तानि रक्षांसि that rakshasas, असूदयम् killed.

58_140.shloka: ततस्तन्नगरद्वारं वेगेनाप्लुतवानहम्।पुच्छेन च प्रदीप्तेन तां पुरीं साट्टगोपुराम्।।5.58.155।।दहाम्यहमसंभ्रान्तो युगान्ताग्निरिव प्रजाः।
58_140.translation: "Then I leaped to the entrance gate of the city without being perplexed. With my burning tail I set fire to the boundaries and towering mansions which looked like the world at the end of dissolution.
58_140.word_by_word: ततः then, अहम् I, वेगेन quickly, तत् that, नगरद्वारम् gate of the city, आप्लुतवान् leapt, अहम् I, असंभ्रान्तः not perplexed, युगान्ताग्निः fire at the end of the dissolution, प्रजाः इव like the world, साट्टप्राकारगोपुराम् boundaries and towering mansions, तां पुरीम् of the city, प्रदीप्तेन by fire, पुच्चेन by the tail, दहामि burnt away.

58_141.shloka: विनष्टा जानकी व्यक्तं न ह्यदग्धः प्रदृश्यते।।5.58.156।।लङ्कायां कश्चिदुद्धेशः सर्वा भस्मीकृता पुरी।
58_141.word_by_word: व्यक्तम् after doing so, जानकी Janaki, विनष्टा may be burnt, लङ्कायाम् with Lanka, कश्चित् perhaps, उद्धेशः thinking so, अदग्धः rose up, न प्रदृश्यते हि not even one place was left unburnt, सर्वा completely, पुरी city, भस्मीकृता reduced to ashes

58_142.shloka: दहता च मया लङ्कां दग्धा सीता न संशयः।।5.58.157।।रामस्य हि महत्कार्यं मयेदं वितथीकृतम्।
58_142.translation: "Lanka has been burnt by me and Sita might have also been burnt. There is no doubt. The great purpose of Rama has been spoilt by me'.
58_142.word_by_word: लङ्काम् Lanka, दहता burnt, मया by me, सीता Sita, दग्धा has burnt, संशयः doubt, न not, मया to me, रामस्य of Rama, इदम् this, महत् great, कार्यम् purpose, वितथीकृतम् has been spoilt.

58_143.shloka: इति शोकसमाविष्टश्चिन्तामहमुपागतः।।5.58.158।।अथाहं वाचमश्रौषं चारणानां शुभाक्षराम्।जानकी न च दग्धेति विस्मयोदन्तभाषिणाम्।।5.58.159।।
58_143.translation: "Thus I was overtaken by sorrow and worry. Just then I heard the wonderful propitious utterances of charanas announcing that Sita was not burnt.
58_143.word_by_word: इति thus, शोकसमाविष्टः overtaken by sorrow, अहम् I, चिन्ताम् worry, उपागतः became, अथ and then, अहम् I, जानकी Janaki, न च दग्धा not been burn, इति this, विस्मयोदन्तभाषिणाम्wonderful utterances, चारणानाम् from charanas, शुभाक्षराम् propitious, वाचम् words, अश्रौषम् heard.

58_144.shloka: ततो मे बुद्धिरुत्पन्ना श्रुत्वा तामद्भुतां गिरम्।अदग्धा जानकीत्येवं निमित्तैश्चोपलक्षिता।।5.58.160।।
58_144.translation: "It was amazing to hear the words of the charanas. On hearing that Jankai had not been burnt, I understood that it is on her account (that he is also not burnt  although his tail was ignited.)
58_144.word_by_word: अद्भुताम् amazing, तां गिरम् those words, श्रुत्वा after hearing, ततः then, जानकी Janaki, अदग्धा not been burnt, इत्येवम् this way, मे my, बुद्धिः knew, उत्पन्ना arose, निमित्तैश्च on account of her, उपलक्षिता I understood.

58_145.shloka: दीप्यमाने तु लाङ्गूले न मां दहति पावकः।हृदयं च प्रहृष्टं मे वातास्सुरभिगन्धिनः।।5.58.161।।
58_145.translation: "My tail was burning but I was not burnt by fire. There was joy in my heart. The wind carried sweet fragrance.
58_145.word_by_word: लाङ्गूले tail, दीप्यमाने was burning, पावकः by fire, माम् but I, न दहति was not burnt, मे my, हृदयं च from my heart, प्रहृष्टम् joy, वाताः wind, सुरभिगन्धिनः very sweet fragrance.

58_146.shloka: तैर्निमित्तैश्च दृष्टाथै: कारणैश्च महागुणैः।ऋषिवाक्यैश्च सिद्धार्थैरभवं हृष्टमानसः।।5.58.162।।
58_146.translation: "For these two auspicious signs and the highly propitious words uttered by the sages I felt glad at heart.
58_146.word_by_word: दृष्टार्थैः by such signs, तैः those two, निमित्तै: reasons, महागुणैः great virtues, कारणैश्च and for these reasons, सिद्धार्थैः will accomplish, ऋषिवाक्यैश्च uttered by the words of sages, हृष्टमानसः felt very happy, अभवम् attained.

58_147.shloka: पुनर्दृष्ट्वा च वैदेहीं विसृष्टश्च तया पुनः।ततः पर्वतमासाद्य तत्रारिष्टमहं पुनः।।5.58.163।।प्रतिप्लवनमारेभे युष्मद्धर्शनकांक्षया।
58_147.word_by_word: वैदेहीम् to Vaidehi, पुनः again, दृष्ट्वा च and to see, तया like that, पुनः again, विसृष्टः seeking permission, ततः then, अरिष्टपर्वतम् mountain Arishta, पुनः again, आसाद्य ascended, अहम् I, युष्मद्धर्शनकांक्षया to see you all, प्रतिप्लवनम् leapt again, आरेभे started.

58_148.translation: "Passing along the path of the Windgod, the Moon, the Sun, the siddhas and the gandharvas  I came to see you.
58_148.word_by_word: ततः then, अहम् I, पवनचन्द्रार्कसिद्धगन्धर्वसेवितम् by Windgod, the Moon, the Sun, the siddhas and the gandharvas, पन्थानम् through the path travelled by, आश्रित्य came, इह here, भवतः to you, दृष्टवान् to see.

58_149.shloka: राघवस्य प्रभावेण भवतां चैव तेजसा।।5.58.165।।सुग्रीवस्य च कार्यार्थं मया सर्वमनुष्ठितम्।
58_149.translation: "Everything was favourable to me by the power of Rama, by your goodwill and for the great purpose of Sugriva.
58_149.word_by_word: राघवस्य Rama's, प्रभावेण by the power, भवताम् your, तेजसा चैव grace, सुग्रीवस्य Sugriva's, कार्यार्थं च on his account, मया for me, सर्वम् all, अनुष्ठितम् was favourable.

58_150.shloka: एतत्सर्वं मया तत्र यथावदुपपादितम्।।5.58.166।।अत्र यन्न कृतं शेषं तत्सर्वं क्रियतामिति।
58_150.translation: "Let all that could not be done there and still remains to be done, be accomplished by you. I have presented the entire thing".इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये सुन्दरकाण्डे अष्टपञ्चाशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the fiftyeighth sarga of Sundarakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
58_150.word_by_word: एतत् all that, सर्वम् entire, तत्र there, मया by me, यथावत् as it is, उपपादितम् presented, अत्र there, यत् whatever, न कृतम् not done, शेषम् remaining task, तत् that, सर्वम् everything, क्रियताम् will do.

59_1.shloka: [Hanuman gives an account of the plight of Sita in Lanka -- incites the vanaras to be ready for the next course of action]एतदाख्याय तत्सर्वं हनुमान्मारुतात्मजः।भूयस्समुपचक्राम वचनं वक्तुमुत्तरम्।।5.59.1।।
59_1.translation: Hanuman, son of the Windgod having narrated in detail all that had happened again started disclosing further details৷৷
59_1.word_by_word: मारुतात्मजः son of the Windgod, हनुमान् Hanuman, सर्वम् entire, तत् एतत् all that, आख्याय having narrated, भूयः whatever happened, उत्तरं वचनम् the good words, वक्तुम् told, समुपचक्राम again started telling.

59_2.shloka: सफलो राघवोद्योग स्सुग्रीवस्य च सम्भ्रमः।शीलमासाद्य सीताया मम च प्रवणं मनः।।5.59.2।।
59_2.translation: "It is due to Rama's exertions, Sugriva's endeavour and Sita's conduct that I have been successful. My devotion to Sita has further deepened.
59_2.word_by_word: राघवोद्योगः Rama's exertions, सुग्रीवस्य Sugriva's, सम्भ्रमः enthusiasm, सीतायाः Sita's, शीलम् conduct, आसाद्य attained, सफलः successl, मम I am, मनश्च in my mind, प्रवणम् developed devotion.

59_3.shloka: तपसा निर्दहेल्लोकान्क्रुद्धो वा निर्दहेदपि।सर्वधातिप्रवृद्धोऽसौ रावणो राक्षसाधिपः ॥ 5.59.3 ॥
59_3.translation: "The demon king is rich in asceticism. He can burn the whole world with the power of his penance. In spite of Sita's anger he was not burnt(Hanuman gives the reason for Ravana's survival).
59_3.word_by_word: सर्वधा ever, अतिप्रवृद्ध: rich in asceticism, असौ he is, राक्षसाधिपः demon king, तपसा his penance, लोकान् in the world, निर्दहेत् can burn, कुद्धो वापि even though angry, निर्दहेदपि not burnt

59_4.shloka: तस्य तां स्पृशतो गात्रं तपसा न विनाशितम्।न तदग्निशिखा कुर्यात्संस्पृष्टा पाणिना सती।।5.59.4।।जनकस्यात्मजा कुर्याद्यत्क्रोधकलुषीकृता।
59_4.translation: "Sita can burn Ravana with the mere touch of her body but because of the power of his penance, he was not burnt even though he touched her hand. If enraged, Janaki can burn the whole world (by virtue of her chastity) in a way that even the flame of fire can not do. (But she desired that her husband should kill him.)
59_4.word_by_word: ताम् her, स्पृशतः with mere touch, तस्य of her, गात्रम् body, तपसा by penance, न विनाशितम् not destroyed, क्रोधकलुषीकृता if enraged (she) can destroy, जनकस्य Janaka's, आत्मजा daughter, यत् such, कुर्यात् she can do, तत् that, पाणिना by hand, संस्पृष्टासती touched with hand, अग्निशिखा like flame of fire, न कुर्यात् not done so.

59_5.shloka: जाम्बवत्प्रमुखान् सर्वाननुज्ञाप्य महाहरीन्।।5.59.5।।अस्मिन्नेवं गते कार्ये भवतां च निवेदिते।न्याय्यं स्म सह वैदेह्या द्रष्टुं तौ पार्थिवात्मजौ।।5.59.6।।
59_5.word_by_word: भवताम् to you, निवेदिते relating to you, अस्मिन् your, कार्ये task, एवं गते to go there, जाम्बवत्प्रमुखान् with Jambavan and other important people, महाहरीन् great vanara heroes, समनुज्ञाप्य with their permission, वैदेह्या सह along with Vaidehi, तौ both, पार्थिवात्मजौ king's sons, द्रष्टुम् to see, न्याय्यं स्म is proper.

59_6.shloka: अहमेकोऽपि पर्याप्तस्सराक्षसगणां पुरीम्।तां लङ्कां तरसा हन्तुं रावणं च महाबलम्।।5.59.7।।
59_6.word_by_word: अहम् I, एकोऽपि alone, सराक्षसगणाम् all the demon troops, तां लङ्कां पुरीम् and that city of Lanka, महाबलम् the great army, रावणं च and Ravana, तरसा quickly, हन्तुम् can kill, पर्याप्तः is enough.

59_7.shloka: किं पुन स्सहितो वीरैर्बलवद्भिः कृतात्मभिः।कृतास्त्रै: प्लवगैश्शूरैर्भवद्भिविजयैषिभिः।।5.59.8।।
59_7.translation: "When strong, wise and accomplished persons are there with me desiring victory  why speak again?
59_7.word_by_word: बलवद्भिः strong, कृतात्मभिः wise, कृतास्त्रै: accomplished, शूरैः heroic, विजयैषिभिः those desiring victory, प्लवगैः monkeys, भवद्भिः are with you, सहितः together, किं पुनः why speak again?

59_8.shloka: अहं तु रावणं युद्धे ससैन्यं सपुरस्सरम्।सहपुत्त्रं वधिष्यामि सहोदरयुतं युधि।।5.59.9।।
59_8.translation: "I can also kill all the army,  his followers, sons and brothers of Ravana in war.
59_8.word_by_word: अहं तु I also, युद्धे in war, ससैन्यम् all the army, सपुरःसरम् his followers, सपुत्त्रम् his sons, सहोदरयुतम् his brothers, रावणम् of Ravana, युधि in war, वधिRष्यामि can kill.

59_9.shloka: ब्राह्ममैन्द्रं च रौद्रं च वायव्यं वारणं तथा।यदि शक्रजितोऽस्त्राणि दुर्निरीक्षाणि संयुगे।।5.59.10।।तान्यहं वधिष्यामि हनिष्यामि च राक्षसान्।
59_9.translation: "Even if the missiles used by Indrajit are Brahmastra, Indrastra, Rudrastra, Vayavastra, Varunastra which are difficult to see. I will destroy them in war and kill them.
59_9.word_by_word: ब्राह्मम् Brahma's, ऐन्द्रं च even Indra's, रौद्रं च Rudra's, वायव्यम् or Windgod's, तथा similarly, वारुणम् Varuna's, शक्रजितः Indrajit, अस्त्राणि missiles, दुर्निरीक्षाणि though difficult to see, यदि such, तानि of them, संयुगे in war, वधिष्यामि will kill, राक्षसान् demon, हनिष्यामि च and destroy them.

59_10.shloka: भवतामभ्यनुज्ञातो विक्रमो मे रुणद्धि तम्।।5.59.11।।मयातुला विसृष्टा हि शैलवृष्टिर्निरन्तरा।देवानपि रणे हन्यात्किं पुनस्तान्निशाचरान्।।5.59.12।।
59_10.translation: Now if I am permitted, I shall repulse them and destroy them with my valour. A  ceaseless shower of rocks sent forth by me in war is enough to destroy even gods what to say about the nightrangers?
59_10.word_by_word: भवताम् by you, अभ्यनुज्ञातः now permit me, मे I, विक्रमः with my valour, तम् them, रुणद्धि  shattered,मया by me, विसृष्टा sent forth, अतुला matchless, निरन्तरा ceaseless, शैलवृष्टिः shower of rocks, रणे in war, देवानपि even gods, हन्यात् will die, तान् those, निशाचरान् nightrangers, किं पुनः what to say ?

59_11.shloka: सागरोऽप्यतियाद्वेलां मन्दरः प्रचलेदपि।न जाम्बवन्तं समरे कम्पयेदरिवाहिनी।।5.59.13।।
59_11.translation: "The ocean may exceed its limits, the mountain Mandara may be shaken from its position but  no hostile army can move Jambavan in war.
59_11.word_by_word: सागरः ocean, वेलाम् shore, अतियादपि exceeds also, मन्दरः mountain Mandara, प्रचलेदपि may shake up, समरे in war, अरिवाहिनी flow of enemies, जाम्बवन्तम् Jambavan, न कम्पयेत् not move.

59_12.shloka: सर्वराक्षससङ्घानां राक्षसा ये च पूर्वकाः।अलमेको विनाशाय वीरो वालिसुतः कपिः।।5.59.14।।
59_12.word_by_word: वीरः hero, वालिसुतः son of Vali, कपिः vanara, एकः alone, सर्वराक्षससङ्घानाम् all the demon hordes, पूर्वकाः led, ये by him, विनाशाय to destroy, अलम् enough.

59_13.shloka: पनसस्योरुवेगेन नीलस्य च महात्मनः।मन्दरोऽप्यवशीर्येत किंपुनर्युधि राक्षसाः।।5.59.15।
59_13.translation: "Even the mountain Mandara would be shattered by great Panasa or Nila by the speed of their thighs. What to say in a battle against ogres?
59_13.word_by_word: पनसस्य Panasa's, महात्मनः great soul, नीलस्य च even Nila, उरुवेगेन by the speed of his thighs, मन्दरोऽपि even Mandara mountain, अवशीर्येत would be shattered, युधि in battle, राक्षसाः demons, किं पुनः what to say again.

59_14.shloka: सदेवासुरयक्षेषु गन्धर्वोरगपक्षिषु।मैन्दस्य प्रतियोद्धारं शंसत द्विविदस्य वा।।5.59.16।।
59_14.translation: "Who among gods, yakshas, gandharvas, nagas and birds can contend Mainda or Dvivida in battle?Tell me.
59_14.word_by_word: सदेवासुरयक्षेषु gods, and yakshas, गन्दर्वोरगपक्षिषु gandharvas, nagas and birds, मैन्दस्य Mainda's, द्विविदस्य वा or Dvivida, प्रतियोद्दारम् who can oppose in battle, शंसत tell me.

59_15.shloka: अश्विपुत्रौ महाभागावेतौ प्लवगसत्तमौ।एतयोः प्रतियोद्दारं न पश्यामि रणाजिरे।।5.59.17।।
59_15.translation: "The (two) sons of Aswini are outstanding and foremost fighters and proud of waging war. Who can oppose them? I do not see any one.
59_15.word_by_word: अश्विपुत्रौ sons of Aswini, एतौ so also, महाभागौ  outstanding, प्लवगसत्तमौ foremost fighters, रणाजिरे  proud of fighting war, एतयोः these people, प्रतियोद्दारम् to oppose, न पश्यामि I do not see any.

59_16.translation: "By virtue of the boons received from Brahma, they are very proud. They have also consumed nectar of immortality and are foremost among vanaras.
59_16.word_by_word: पितामहवरोत्सेकात् by virtue of the boons received from Brahma, परमम् very, दर्पम् proud, आस्थितौ filled with, एतौ both of them that way, वानरसत्तमौ foremost of vanaras, अमृतप्राशिनौ have consumed nectar of immortality.

59_17.translation: "Earlier Brahma, the grandsire of all worlds has given the Aswini sons immeasurable invulnerability to honour them.
59_17.word_by_word: पुरा earlier, सर्वलोकपितामहः Brahma the grandfather of all worlds, अश्विनोः for Aswini sons, माननार्थम् to honour, अनयोः given, अतुलम् immeasureable, सर्वावध्यत्वम् invulnerability, दत्तवान् given.

59_18.shloka: वरोत्सेकेन मत्तौ च प्रमथ्य महतीं चमूम्।सुराणाममृतं वीरौ पीतवन्तौ प्लवङ्गमौ।।5.59.20।।
59_18.translation: "The heroic monkeys, proud of their boons became intoxicated it and slaughtered vast army and drank the nectar of immortality.
59_18.word_by_word: वरोत्सेकेन armed with the pride of boons, मत्तौ च and intoxicated, वीरौ heroic, प्लवङ्गमौ monkeys, सुराणाम् of suras, महतीम् vast, चमूम् प्रमथ्य army slain, अमृतम् nectar of immortality, पीतवन्तौ drank.

59_19.shloka: एतावेव हि सङ्कृद्धौ सवाजिरथकुञ्जराम्।लङ्कां नाशयितुं शक्तौ सर्वे तिष्ठन्तु वानराः।।5.59.21।।
59_19.translation: "If these two become angry they have the power to destroy Lanka, the cavalry, chariots and also the elephants even if the vanaras stay away.
59_19.word_by_word: सङ्कृद्धौ if they become angry, एतावेव these two, सवाजिरथकुञ्जराम् the cavalry, chariots and elephants, लङ्काम् Lanka also, नाशयितुम् to destroy, शक्तौ have the power, सर्वे all, वानराः vanaras, तिष्ठन्तु even if they stay away.

59_20.shloka: मयैव निहता लङ्का दग्धा भस्मीकृता पुनः।राजमार्गेषु सर्वत्र नाम विश्रावितं मया।।5.59.22।।
59_20.translation: "I have burnt Lanka and have made my name popular even on the highways.
59_20.word_by_word: लङ्का Lanka, मयैव myself, निहता burn, राजमार्गेषु in the royal path, सर्वत्र everywhere, मया by me, नाम name, विश्रावितम् become popular.

59_21.shloka: जयत्यतिबलो रामो लक्ष्मणश्च महाबलः।राजा जयति सुग्रीवो राघवेणाभिपालितः।।5.59.23।।अहं कोसलराजस्य दासः पवनसम्भवः।हनुमानिति सर्वत्र नाम विश्रावितं मया।।5.59.24।।
59_21.translation: "Mighty Rama and Lakshmana and King Sugriva protected by Rama are renowned for their valour. I am Hanuman, son of the Windgod, a servant of Rama. This I announced.
59_21.word_by_word: अतिबलः mighty, रामः Rama, जयति will triumph, महाबलः mighty, लक्ष्मणश्च and Lakshmana, राघवेण by Rama, अभिपालितः protected, राजा king, सुग्रीवः Sugriva, जयति will triumph, पवनसम्भवः son of the Windgod, अहम् I, कोसलराजस्य king of Kosala kingdom, दासः servant, हनुमान् Hanuman, इति this, मया by me, नाम name, विश्रावितम् announced.

59_22.shloka: अशोकवनिकामध्ये रावणस्य दुरात्मनः।अध स्ताच्छिंशुपावृक्षे साध्वी करुणमास्थिता।।5.59.25।।राक्षसीभिः परिवृता शोकसंतापकर्शिता।मेघलेखापरिवृता चन्द्रलेखेव निष्प्रभा।।5.59.26।।।अचिन्तयन्ती वैदेही रावणं बलदर्पितम्।
59_22.translation: "In the wicked, Ravana's Ashoka garden under the Simsupa tree the noble lady Sita surrounded by ogresses, is sitting, tormented by tears. Her brightness is like the Moon's, veiled by flakes of clouds. She does not care for Ravana's glory. She is brooding over Rama only.
59_22.word_by_word: दुरात्मनः wicked, रावणस्य Ravana's, अशोकवनिकामध्ये in the midst of Ashoka garden, शिंशुपावृक्षे Simsupa tree, अधस्तात् under, साध्वी noble lady, राक्षसीभिः by ogresses, परिवृता surrounded, शोकसन्तापकर्शिता tormented by tears, मेघलेखापरिवृता veiled by clouds, चन्द्रलेखेव like the Moonrays, निष्प्रभा without  brightness, बलदर्पितम्  glory, रावणम् Ravana, अचिन्तयन्ती not even thinking, वैदेही Vaidehi, करुणम् piteous, आस्थिता remained.

59_23.shloka: पतिव्रता च सुश्रोणी अवष्टब्धा च जानकी।।5.59.27।।अनुरक्ता हि वैदेही रामं सर्वात्मना शुभा।अनन्यचित्ता रामे च पौलोमीव पुरन्दरे।।5.59.28।।
59_23.translation: "Chaste Sita of beautiful hips, an auspicious lady though bound is wholly devoted to Rama alone like Sachi, the wife of Indra who was bound by Nahusha.
59_23.word_by_word: पतिव्रता chaste woman, सुश्रोणी who has beautiful hips, जानकी Janaki, अवष्टब्धा though bound, शुभा auspicious, वैदेही Vaidehi, सर्वात्मना all her self, रामम् Rama only, अनुरक्ता devoted, पुरन्दरे Indra, पौलोमीव like Sachi the wife of Indra, रामे only on Rama, अनन्यचित्ता always thinking.

59_24.shloka: तदेकवासस्संवीता रजोध्वस्ता तथैव च।शोकसन्तापदीनाङ्गी सीता भर्तृहिते रता।।5.59.29।।
59_24.translation: "Wearing the same single cloth which she had worn before, filled with dust, Sita remained sorrowful and piteous wishing her husband's welfare.
59_24.word_by_word: तदेकवासस्संवीता wearing only one cloth, तथैव च with that only, रजोध्वस्ता filled with dust, शोकसन्तापदीनाङ्गी very sorrowful and piteous, सीता Sita, भर्तृहिते wishing the welfare of her husband, रता remained.

59_25.shloka: सा मया राक्षसीमध्ये तर्ज्यमाना मुहुर्मुहुः।राक्षसीभिर्विरूपाभिर्दृष्टा हि प्रमदावने।।5.59.30।।एकवेणीधरा दीना भर्तृचिन्तापरायणा।अधश्शय्या विवर्णाङ्गी पद्मिनीव हिमागमे।।5.59.31।।रावणाद्विनिवृत्तार्था मर्तव्यकृतनिश्चया।
59_25.translation: "I saw Sita often threatened by uglylooking ogresses. Wearing a single braid, she looked pathetic, thinking always about her husband, lying on the bare ground. She was like a lustreless lotus in winter. Spurning the advances by Ravana, she is rather determined to commit suicide.
59_25.word_by_word: विरूपाभिः uglylooking, राक्षसीभिः ogresses, मुहुर्मुहुः again and again, तर्ज्यमाना threatened, एकवेणीधरा with a single braid, दीना pathetic, भर्तृचिन्तापरायणा thinking of her husband all the time, अधः now, शय्या lying on floor, हिमागमे in winter season, पद्मिनिव like the lotus, विवर्णाङ्गी devoid of lustre, रावणात् by Ravana, विनिवृत्तार्था turned away, मर्तव्यकृतनिश्चया decided to die, सा that she, मया by me, राक्षसीमध्ये in the midst of ogresses, प्रमदावने in the pleasure garden, दृष्टा saw her.

59_26.shloka: कथञ्चिन्मृगशाबाक्षी विश्वासमुपपादिता।।5.59.32।।ततः संभाषिता चैव सर्वमर्थं च दर्शिता।रामसुग्रीवसख्यं च श्रुत्वा प्रीतिमुपागता।।5.59.33।।
59_26.translation: "I created a little confidence in the fawneyed lady by pacifying her and explaining her with great difficulty the alliance of Rama and Sugriva on hearing which she became happy.
59_26.word_by_word: मृगशाबाक्षी fawneyed woman, कथञ्चित् little, विश्वासम् confidence, उपपादिता pacified, ततः then, संभाषिता चैव after conversing only, सर्वम् everything, अर्थं च with difficulty, दर्शिता presented, रामसुग्रीवसख्यं च alliance of Rama and Sugriva, श्रुत्वा after hearing, प्रीतिम् happy, उपागता became.

59_27.shloka: नियतस्समुदाचारो भक्तिर्भर्तरि चोत्तमा।यन्न हन्ति दशग्रीवं सा महात्मा कृतागसम्।।5.59.34।।
59_27.translation: "Ravana is a great soul because, even though he has done harm to her, he is not killed. This is because Sita being a chaste woman of good conduct and deep devotion towards her husband (she refrained from killing Ravana as she wanted her husband to do that.)
59_27.word_by_word: महात्मा great soul, सा that, कृतागसम् has done harm, दशग्रीवं to Ravana,न हन्ति not killed, इति यत् this being so, नियत: of good conduct, समुदाचारः chaste, भर्तरि towards husband, उत्तमा high, भक्तिः devotion

59_28.shloka: निमित्तमात्रं रामस्तु वधे तस्य भविष्यति।सा प्रकृत्यैव तन्वङ्गी तद्वियोगाच्च कर्शिता।।5.59.35।।प्रतिपत्पाठशीलस्य विद्येव तनुमतां गता।
59_28.translation: "To Rama, killing Ravana is easy (since Ravana's power of penance has already declined by his abduction of Sita). Separated from her husband she is naturally emaciated. She has become slender just like a student on the new Moon day (on the first day of study).
59_28.word_by_word: रामस्तु Rama also, तस्य his, वधे killing, निमित्तमात्रं instrumental, भविष्यति will be, प्रकृत्यैव naturally, तन्वङ्गी thin body, तद्वियोगात् by the separation from her husband, कर्शिता च and also emaciated, सा she, प्रतिपत्पाठशीलस्य just as a student on the new Moon day, विद्येव shrunken, तनुमताम्  slender in body, गता has become.

59_29.shloka: एवमास्ते महाभागा सीता शोकपरायणा।।5.59.36।।यदत्र प्रतिकर्तव्यं तत्सर्वमुपपाद्यताम्।
59_29.translation: "Noble Sita is absorbed in grief. Let us do all that has to be done now."इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये सुन्दरकाण्डे एकोनषष्टितमस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the fiftyninth sarga of Sundarakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
59_29.word_by_word: महाभागा noble lady, सीता Sita, अस्ते being, एवम् in this way, शोकपरायणा absorbed in grief, अत्र there, यत् that, प्रतिकर्तव्यम् what is to be done, तत् that, सर्वम् all, उपपाद्यताम् you may do.

60_1.shloka: [Jambavan says it is advisable to follow Rama's instruction.]तस्य तद्वचनं श्रुत्वा वालिसूनुरभाषत।अयुक्तं तु विना देवीं दृष्टवद्भिश्च वानराः।।5.60.1।।समीपं गन्तुमस्माभी राघवस्य महात्मनः।
60_1.translation: After hearing Hanuman,  Vali's son said" O vanaras (Hanuman) having seen Sita it is not proper on our part to go without Sita to the great soul Rama.
60_1.word_by_word: तस्य his, तत् that, वचनम् words, श्रुत्वा on hearing, वालिसूनुः Vali's son, अभाषत said this, वानराः O vanaras, दृष्टवद्भिः even after seeing, अस्माभिः her, देवीं विना without Sita, महात्मनः great soul, राघवस्य to Rama, समीपम् near, गन्तुम् going, अयुक्तं तु not appropriate.

60_2.shloka: दृष्टा देवी न चानीता इति तत्र निवेदनम्।।5.60.2।।अयुक्तमिव पश्यामि भवद्भिः ख्यातविक्रमैः।
60_2.translation: "O vanaras, you are known for your valour. I think, to tell Rama that we have seen Sita but not brought her is not proper".
60_2.word_by_word: ख्यातविक्रमैः known for valour, भवद्भिः you too, देवी godlike lady, दृष्टा seeing, न आनीता च not brought her, इति this, तत्र there, निवेदनम् tell, अयुक्तमिव not proper, पश्यामि I think.

60_3.shloka: न हि नः प्लवने कश्चिन्नापि कश्चित्पराक्रमे।।5.60.3।।तुल्य स्सामरदैत्येषु लोकेषु हरिसत्तमाः।
60_3.translation: "O noble vanaras Indeed either among gods or among demons there is none who can match the vanaras in leaping and exhibiting valour.
60_3.word_by_word: हरिसत्तमाः noble vanaras, सामरदैत्येषु gods or demons, लोकेषु in the world, प्लवने in leaping, नः none, तुल्यः match, कश्चित् even few, न हि not indeed, पराक्रमेऽपि even in valour, कश्चित् are there, न no one.

60_4.shloka: तेष्वेवं हतवीरेषु राक्षसेषु हनूमता।।5.60.4।।किमन्यदत्र कर्तव्यं गृहीत्वा याम जानकीम्।
60_4.translation: "Hence, having killed the heroes among ogres what other task has Hanuman to do? Let us get Sita.
60_4.word_by_word: तेषु hence, राक्षसेषु  among demons, हनूमता Hanuman, एवम् in that way, हतवीरेषु dead heroes, अत्र there, किम् what, अन्यत् other, कर्तव्यम् action, जानकीम् Janaki, गृहीत्वा get, याम here.

60_5.shloka: तमेवं कृतसङ्कल्पं जाम्बवान् हरिसत्तमः।।5.60.5।।उवाच परमप्रीतो वाक्यमर्थवदर्थवित्।
60_5.translation: "Jambavan, the noble vanara, skilled in the execution of tasks thus commanded in a determined manner:
60_5.word_by_word: अर्थवित् knower of ways of execution of tasks, हरिसत्तमः noble vanara, जाम्बवान् Jambavan, परमप्रीतः very pleased, एवम् in that way, कृतसंकल्पम् determined, तम् him, अर्थवत् commnading way, वाक्यम् these words, उवाच spoke.

60_6.shloka: न तावदेषा मतिरक्षमा नो यथा भवान् पश्यति राजपुत्र।यथा तु रामस्य मतिर्निविष्टा तथा भवान् पश्यतु कार्यसिद्धिम्।।5.60.6।।
60_6.translation: "O prince what you think is  acceptable to us also. Even though we are capable of achieving, knowing what is in Rama's mind, we should act only according to his command to accomplish the task.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये सुन्दरकाण्डे षष्टितमस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the sixtieth sarga of Sundarakanda of the holy Ramyana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
60_6.word_by_word: राजपुत्र O prince, भवान् you, यथा this way, पश्यति thought of, एषा also, मतिः to my mind, नः none, अक्षमा acceptable, न तावत् we are capable, तु you, रामस्य Rama's, मतिः mind, यथा this way, निविष्टा should act, तथा that way, भवान् you, कार्यसिद्धिम् to accomplish the work, पश्यतु do it.

61_1.shloka: [Monkey leaders enter Madhuvan on the outskirts of Kishkinda and destroy it in their drunkenness.]ततो जाम्बवतो वाक्यमगृह्णन्त वनौकसः।अङ्गदप्रमुखा वीरा हनुमांश्च महाकपिः।।5.61.1।।
61_1.translation: In the midst of all the leaders of the monkeys including Angada, Hanuman accepted Jambavan's advice.
61_1.word_by_word: ततः then, अङ्गदप्रमुखाः Angada and other leaders, वीराः heroes, वनौकसः wanderers of the forest, vanaras, महाकपिः great monkey, हनुमांश्च and Hanuman, जाम्बवतः Jambavan's, वाक्यम् these words, अगृह्णन्त agreed upon.

61_2.shloka: प्रीतिमन्तस्ततः सर्वे वायुपुत्रपरस्पराः।महेन्द्राद्रिं परित्यज्य पुप्लुवुः प्लवगर्षभाः।।5.61.2।।मेरुमन्दरसङ्काशा मत्ता इव महागजाः।छादयन्त इवाकाशं महाकाया महाबलाः।।5.61.3।।सभाज्यमानं भूतैस्तमात्मवन्तं महाबलम्।हनूमन्तं महावेगं वहन्त इव दृष्टिभिः।।5.61.4।।राघवे चार्थनिर्ववृत्तिं कर्तुं च परमं यशः।समाधाय समृद्धार्थाः सर्वेसिद्धिभिरुन्नता।।5.61.5।।प्रियाख्यानोन्मुखाः सर्वे सर्वे युद्धाभिनन्दिनः।सर्वे रामप्रतीकारे निश्चितार्था मनस्स्विनः।।5.61.6।।
61_2.translation: Thereafter led by Hanuman, all the vanaras left Mahendra mountain and marched very happily. The vanaras were strong and huge like elephants and resembled mountain Meru. Moreover when they leaped up they seemed to cover the sky (so it was difficult to tell their numbers). Since Hanuman had accomplished the task, the vanaras were praising his strength, his swiftness and courage. They were looking at Hanuman without blinking their eyes, and seemed as though they were carrying him by their eyes. They were determined in their minds to please Rama. Remaining in a state of offering themselves, some of them more accomplished than others, collected together eager to wage war and talking pleasantly among themselves having resolved to assist Rama.
61_2.word_by_word: ततः then, मेरुमन्दरसङ्काशाः resembling Meru mountain, मत्ताः in rut, गजाः इव like elephants, आकाशम् sky, छादयन्तः इव as though covering the sky, महाकायाः of huge body, महाबलाः mighty, प्लवगर्षभाः bulls among leaping monkeys, सर्वे all, महेन्द्राद्रिम् from the summit of Mahendra mountain, परित्यज्य left, प्रीतिमन्तः very happily, वायुपुत्रपुरस्सराः led by the son of the Windgod, भूतैः all creatures, सभाज्यमानम् praised by, आत्मवन्तम् selfconfident, महाबलम् mighty, महावेगम् swift, हनूमन्तम् Hanuman, दृष्टिभिः seeing, वहन्तः इव like seeing without blinking, राघवे Rama's, अर्थनिर्ववृततिम् remaining in state of offering, परमम् supreme, यशः fame, कर्तुम् to do, समाधाय concentrating, समृद्धार्थाः better than others, कर्मसिद्धिभिः  accomplished ones, उन्नताः eager, पुप्लुवुः jumping vanaras, सर्वे all, प्रियाख्यानोन्मुखाः pleasantly talking among themselves, सर्वे all, युद्धाभिनन्दिनः anxious to wage a war, मनस्स्विनः determined, सर्वे all, रामप्रतीकारे to please, निश्चितार्थाः determined.

61_3.translation: "The monkeys leaped into the sky and entered the garden that resembled the garden of Indra filled with trees and creepers.
61_3.word_by_word: ततः then, ते they, काननौकसः forestdwellers, monkeys, खम् sky, आफ्लुत्य rising up, प्लवमानाः started leaping, द्रुमलतायुतम् filled with trees and creepers, नन्दनोपमम् like the garden of Indra, वनम् garden, आसेदुः entered.

61_4.translation: The Madhuvanam of Sugriva was wellprotected  and was difficult to access for the vanaras. It was enchating to all beings.
61_4.word_by_word: अभिरक्षितम् wellprotected, सर्वभूतानाम् all creatures, अधृष्यम् difficult to access, सर्वभूतमनोहरम् enchanting to all beings, यत् that, सुग्रीवस्य Sugriva's, मधुवनं नाम Madhuvanam, तत् that.

61_5.shloka: यद्रक्षति महावीर्य स्सदा दधिमुखः कपिः।मातुलः कपिमुख्यस्य सुग्रीवस्य महात्मनः।।5.61.9।।
61_5.translation: Dadhimukha, the foremost of all monkeys, of great valour and the maternal uncle of Sugriva was the caretaker of  the garden.
61_5.word_by_word: महात्मनः great, कपिमुख्यस्य foremost of monkeys, सुग्रीवस्य Sugriva's, मातुलः maternal uncle, महावीर्यः of great valour, दधिमुखः Dadhimukha, कपिः monkey, यत् that which, सदा always, रक्षति protected.

61_6.shloka: ते तद्वनमुपागम्य बभूवुः परमोत्कटाः।वानरा वानरेन्द्रस्य मनः कान्ततमं महत्।।5.61.10।।
61_6.translation: On reaching the vanara king's extensive, delightful garden all the vanaras highly rejoiced.
61_6.word_by_word: ते those, वानराः vanaras, वानरेन्द्रस्य Vanara king's, मनःकान्ततमम् delighting to all, महत् extensive, तत् that, वनम् garden, उपागम्य on reaching, परमोत्कटाः highly rejoiced, बभूवुः became.

61_7.shloka: ततस्ते वानरा हृष्टा दृष्टवा मधुवनं महत्।कुमारमभ्ययाचन्त मधूनि मधुपिङ्गलाः।।5.61.11।।
61_7.translation: The honeycoloured monkeys felt happy on seeing the Madhuvanam and sought Angada's permission to drink honey.
61_7.word_by_word: ततः then, मधुपिङ्गलाः honeycoloured monkeys, ते वानराः those vanaras, महत् large, मधुवनम् Madhuvanam, दृष्ट्वा seeing, हृष्टाः happy, कुमारम् young Angada, मधूनि honey, अभ्ययाचन्त sought permission.

61_8.shloka: ततः कुमारस्तान् वृद्धान् जाम्बवत्प्रमुखान् कपीन्।अनुमान्य ददौ तेषां विसर्गं मधुभिक्षणे।।5.61.12।।
61_8.translation: Young Angada asked old Jambavan's permission for the vanaras to drink honey and Jambavan permitted them.
61_8.word_by_word: ततः then, कुमारः young Angada, वृद्धान् old, तान् him, जाम्बवत्प्रमुखान् chief of monkeys Jambavan, कपीन् monkey, अनुमान्य permitting, तेषाम् them, मधुभक्षणे to drink honey, निसर्गम् leave, ददौ gave.

61_9.shloka: ततश्चानुमता स्सर्वे सम्प्रहृष्टा वनौकसः।मुदिताः प्रेरिताश्चापि प्रनृत्यन्तोऽभवंस्तदा।।5.61.13।।
61_9.translation: Permitted thus to drink honey the forestdwelling monkeys were motivated. They rejoiced very happily and started dancing.
61_9.word_by_word: ततः then, सर्वे all, वनौकसः forestdwellers, monkeys, अनुमताः having been permitted, सम्प्रहृष्टाः very happily, तदा then, प्रेरिताः motivated, मुदिताः rejoiced, प्रनृत्यन्तः started dancing, अभवन् they.

61_10.shloka: गायन्ति केचित्प्रणमन्ति केचिन्नृत्यन्ति केचित्प्रहसन्ति केचित्।पतन्ति केचिद्विचरन्ति केचित्ल्पवन्ति केचित्प्रलपन्ति केचित्।।5.61.14।।
61_10.translation: Some sang, some prostrated on the ground, some danced, while some laughed, some jumped from the tree, some roamed about and some jumped up and down.
61_10.word_by_word: केचित् some, गायन्ति sang, केचित् some, प्रणमन्ति prostrated, केचित् few, नृत्यन्ति danced,केचित् some, प्रहसन्ति laughed, केचित् while others, पतन्ति fell down, केचित् some, विचरन्ति roamed, केचित् few, प्लवन्ति jumped up, केचित् some, प्रलपन्ति jumped up.

61_11.shloka: परस्परं केचिदुपाश्रयन्ते परस्परं केचिदुपाक्रमन्ते।परस्परं केचिदुपब्रुवन्ते परस्परं केचिदुपारमन्ते।।5.61.15।।
61_11.translation: While some supported one another, some held each other, some exchanged secrets with one another, some entertained one another.
61_11.word_by_word: केचित् some, परस्परम् to one another, उपाश्रयन्ते comforted, केचित् some, परस्परम् one another, उपाक्रमन्ते held, केचित् some, परस्परम् one another, उपब्रुवन्ते exchanged secrets, केचित् some, परस्परम् to one another, उपारमन्ते entertained.

61_12.shloka: द्रुमाद्द्रुमं केचिदभिद्रवन्ते क्षितौ नगाग्रान्निपतन्ति केचित्।महीतलात्केचिदुदीर्णवेगा महाद्रुमाग्राण्यभिसम्पतन्ति।।5.61.16।।
61_12.translation: While some ran from one tree to another, some jumped down from broken branches, and some swiftfooted ones fell down from the top of trees.
61_12.word_by_word: केचित् some, द्रुमात् from tree, द्रुमम् to another tree, अभिद्रवन्ते ran, केचित् some, नगाग्रात् from the top of tree jumped down, क्षितौ broken, निपतन्ति fell down, केचित् some, उदीर्णवेगाः very swift ones, महातलात् from the huge trees, महाद्रुमाग्राणि from the top of trees, अभिसम्पतन्ति fell down.

61_13.shloka: गायन्तमन्यः प्रहसन्नुपैति हसन्तमन्यः प्ररुदन्नुपैति।रुदन्तमन्यः प्रणुदन्नुपैति नुदन्तमन्यः प्रणदन्नुपैति।।5.61.17।।
61_13.translation: While one was singing, others approached him laughing while some were laughing others fell on them laughing excessively. While some were roaring, others went pushing them down. While some were encouraged to do something others shouted at them.
61_13.word_by_word: गायन्तम् singing, अन्यः others, प्रहनम् laughing, उपैति on who fell, हसन्तम् laughing, अन्यः others, प्ररुदन् went roaring aloud, उपैति fell, रुदन्तम् roaring, अन्यः others, प्रणुदन्pushing, उपैति fell on others, नुदन्तम् encouraged to do some thing, अन्यः others, प्रणदन् shouting, उपैति fell over.

61_14.shloka: समाकुलं तत्कपिसैन्यमासीन्मधुप्रसानोत्कटसत्त्वचेष्टम्।न चात्र कश्चिन्न बभूव मत्तो न चात्र कश्चिन्न बभूव तृप्तः।।5.61.18।।
61_14.translation: The army of monkeys had lost control over their bodies due to drinking of honeywine. Not even one was quietly seated there. Not even one was not intoxicated. Not only that, none were satisfied.
61_14.word_by_word: मधुप्रसानोत्कटसत्त्वचेष्टम् lost control due to drinking honeywine, तत् that, कपिसैन्यम् army of monkeys, समाकुलम् collected together, आसीत् quietly seated, अत्र there, कश्चित् not even one, मत्तः intoxicated, न बभूव not there, इति न not only this, अत्र there, कश्चित् none, तृप्तः satisfied, न बभूव इति न not there like that.

61_15.shloka: ततो वनं तत्परिभक्ष्यमाणं द्रुमांश्च विध्वंसितपत्रपुष्पान्।समीक्ष्य कोपाद्धधिवक्रनामा निवारयामास कपिः कपींस्तान्।।5.61.19।।
61_15.translation: Beholding the destruction wrought by the vanaras to the garden, trees, leaves and flowers, and having drunk all the honey, Dadhimukha angrily asked them to stop and get out.
61_15.word_by_word: ततः that, दधिवक्त्रनामा named Dadhimukha, कपिः monkey, परिभक्ष्यमाणम् drank all the honeywine, तत् that, वनम् garden, विध्वंसितपत्रपुष्पान् leaves, flowers, द्रुमांश्च and trees, समीक्ष्य seeing, कोपात् in anger, तान् कपीन् the monkeys, निवारयामास asked them to stop and get out.

61_16.shloka: स तैः प्रवृद्धैः परिभर्त्स्यमानो वनस्य गोप्ता हरिवीरवृद्धः।चकार भूयो मतिमुग्रतेजा वनस्य रक्षां प्रति वानरेभ्यः।।5.61.20।।
61_16.translation: The elderly Dadhimukha who was the powerful protector of the garden reprimanded them and devised yet again a plan to protect it.
61_16.word_by_word: प्रवृद्धैः by the elderly, तैः by both, परिभर्त्स्यमानः reprimanded, वनस्य garden's, गोप्ता  caretaker, हरिवीरवृद्धः old monkey leader, उग्रतेजाः powerful one, वानरेभ्यः by vanaras, वनस्य garden's, रक्षांप्रति to protect, भूयः again, मतिम् in his mind, चकार thought over.

61_17.shloka: उवाच कांश्चित्परुषाणि धृष्टमसक्तमन्यांश्च तलैर्जघान।समेत्य कैश्चित्कलहं चकार तथैव साम्नोपजगाम कांश्चित्।।5.61.21।।
61_17.translation: He spoke harshly to some, to others he asked not to talk, some he slapped on the hind part with the palm of his hand. To some he spoke pleasantly and with some he quarrelled. And to others he spoke in a conciliatory manner.
61_17.word_by_word: कांश्चित् to some, परुषाणि in harsh words, उवाच spoken, अन्यांश्च to others, असक्तम् not to say, तलैः with the palm of the hand, धृष्टम् slapped, जघान hind part, समेत्य with good words, कैश्चित् with some, कलहम् quarrel, चकार made, तथैव in the same way, कांश्चित् some, साम्ना approached, उपजगाम in a conciliatory manner.

61_18.shloka: स तैर्मदात्संपरिवार्य वाक्यैर्भलाच्छ तेन प्रतिवार्यमाणैः।प्रधर्षितस्त्यक्तभयै स्समेत्य प्रकृष्यते चाप्यनवेक्ष्य दोषम्।।5.61.22।।
61_18.translation: In their drunkenness they were using abusive language and with their strength they retaliated without fear. They invaded without considering their mistakes. They caught hold of Dadhimukha and pulled him.
61_18.word_by_word: तैर्मदात् in their drunkenness, अप्रतिवार्यवाक्यैः speaking in abusive language, तेन by them, बलात् by their strength, प्रतिवार्यमाणैः retaliated, त्यक्तभयैः devoid of fear, तैः those, प्रधर्षितः roared, सः that, दोषं च mistakes only, अनवेक्ष्य not seeing, सम्ये held, प्रकृष्यते च pulled.

61_19.shloka: नखैस्तुदन्तो दशनैर्दशन्त स्तलैश्च पादैश्च समापयन्तः।मदात्कपिं तं कपय स्समग्रा महावनं निर्विषयं च चक्रुः।।5.61.23।।
61_19.translation: In their drunkenness some monkeys scratched Dadhimukha violently with their nails, some bit him with their teeth and others slapped and kicked him with their palms and legs.Getting together they looted the garden completely.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये सुन्दरकाण्डे एकषष्टितम स्सर्गः।।Thus ends the sixtyfirst sarga of Sundarakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
61_19.word_by_word: समग्राः all of them together, कपयः that monkey, मदात् in their drunkenness, नखैः with nails, तुदन्तः scratched, दशनैः with teeth, दशन्तः bitten, तलैश्च with palms, पादैश्च legs, तं कपिम् the monkeys, समापयन्तः getting together, महावनम् great garden, निर्विषयम् completely, चक्रुः looted.

62_1.shloka: [Guards of Madhuvanam headed by Dadhimukha move to report to Sugriva.]तानुवाच हरिश्रेष्ठो हनुमान्वानरर्षभः।अव्यग्रमनसो यूयं मधु सेवत वानराः।।5.62.1।।अहमावारयिष्यामि युष्माकं परिपन्थिनः।
62_1.translation: Hanuman, the foremost of the monkeys, bull among vanaras said, 'Enjoy the honey devoid of any fear. I shall prevent those who object to your action'.
62_1.word_by_word: हरिश्रेष्ठः foremost of the monkeys, वानरर्षभः bull among vanaras, हनुमान् Hanuman, तान् them, उवाच spoke, वानराः vanaras, यूयम् looking at, अव्यग्रमनसः devoid of any fear in your mind, मधु honey, सेवत take, अहम् I, युष्माकम् those, परिपन्थिनः who object to your action, अवायिष्यामि will prevent.

62_2.shloka: श्रुत्वा हनुमतो वाक्यं हरीणां प्रवरोऽङ्गदः।।5.62.2।।प्रत्युवाच प्रसन्नात्मा पिबन्तु हरयो मधु।
62_2.translation: Pleased with Hanuman's words, the distinguished Angada permitted the monkeys to drink.
62_2.word_by_word: हनुमतः Hanuman, वाक्यम् these words, श्रुत्वा hearing, हरीणाम् to the monkeys, प्रवरः distinguished, अङ्गदः Angada, प्रसन्नात्मा very pleased, प्रत्युवाच replied, हरयः vanaras, पिबन्तु you may drink.

62_3.shloka: अवश्यं कृतकार्यस्य वाक्यं हनुमतो मया।।5.62.3।।अकार्यमपि कर्तव्यं किमङ्ग पुनरीदृशम्।
62_3.translation: Even if Hanuman, the achiever, forbids me to do something, I will do it. And now when he has permitted you, why hesitate ?
62_3.word_by_word: कृतकार्यस्य one who has accomplished the task, हनुमतः Hanuman, वाक्यम् these words,अकार्यमपि tells not to do, मया by me, अवश्यम् surely, कर्तव्यम् what is to be done, ईदृशं पुनः when he has spoken again, किमङ्ग what to say?

62_4.shloka: अङ्गदस्य मुखाच्छ्रुत्वावचनं वानरर्षभाः।।5.62.4।।साधुसाध्विति संहृष्टा वानराः प्रत्यपूजयन्।
62_4.translation: Having heard the words that came from Angada's mouth, the bulls among vanaras praised him for his generous approval.
62_4.word_by_word: वानरर्षभाः bulls among vanaras, वानराः vanaras, अङ्गदस्य Angada's, मुखात् from the mouth, वचः spoken, श्रुत्वा having heard, संहृष्टाः very happy, साधु साध्विति good words, प्रत्यपूजयन् praised.

62_5.shloka: पूजयित्वाङ्गदं सर्वे वानरा वानरर्षभम्।।5.62.5।।जग्मुर्मधुवनं यत्र नदीवेग इव द्रुमम्।
62_5.translation: The vanaras praised Angada, the bull among vanaras and went to Madhuvanam swiftly like a fastflowing river going to uproot a tree.
62_5.word_by_word: सर्वे all, वानरा vanaras, वानरर्षभम् to bull among vanaras, अङ्गदम् to Angada, पूजयित्वा having praised, मधुवनम् Madhuvanam, यत्र there, नदीवेगः fast flowing river, द्रुमम् इव like tree, जग्मुः went.

62_6.shloka: ते प्रविष्टा मधुवनं पालानाक्रम्य वीर्यतः।।5.62.6।।अतिसर्गाच्च पटवो दृष्ट्वा श्रुत्वा च मैथिलीम्।पपुस्सर्वे मधु तदा रसवत्फलमाददुः।।5.62.7।।
62_6.translation: Overjoyed at the news of Mythili, being seen, the vanaras entered Madhuvanam and attacked the guards violently, drank the honey and ate the tasty fruits.
62_6.word_by_word: मैथिलीम् Mythili, दृष्ट्वा having seen, श्रुत्वा heard, अतिसर्गाच्च overjoyed with success,मधुवनम् Madhuvanam, प्रविष्टाः entered, पालान् guards, वीर्यतः violently, आक्रम्य attacked, तदा then, मधु Madhu, पपुः drank, रसवत् tasty, फलम् fruits, आददु: ate.

62_7.shloka: उत्पत्य च ततस्सर्वे वनपालान् समागतान्।ताडयन्ति स्म शतश स्सक्तान्मधुवने तदा।।5.62.8।।
62_7.translation: All the vanaras collected together, entered the Madhuvanam and attacked in many ways the guards protecting  the  garden.
62_7.word_by_word: तदा then, सर्वे all, मधुवने in Madhuvanam, शतशः in many ways, सक्तान् vanaras, समागतान् came together, वनपालान् guards protecting the garden, उत्पत्य risen up, ततः then, ताडयन्ति स्म struck.

62_8.shloka: मधूनि द्रोणमात्राणि बाहुभिः परिगृह्य ते।पिबन्ति सहिता स्सर्वे निघ्नन्ति स्म तथापरे।।5.62.9।।
62_8.translation: All of them now gathered at one place and drank honey from large containers. Others were busy preventing the guards.
62_8.word_by_word: ते सर्वे all of them, बाहुभिः many, द्रोणमात्राणि of huge size (large containers made of leather, a drona is a measure of two litres), मधूनि honey, परिगृह्य took hold of, सहिताः together, पिबन्ति  drinking, अपरे others, निघ्नन्ति स्म were preventing.

62_9.shloka: केचित्पीत्वा प्रविध्यन्ति मधूनि मधुपिङ्गलाः।मधूच्छिष्टेन केचिच्च जग्मुरन्योन्यमुत्कटाः।।5.62.10।।
62_9.translation: The honeycoloured monkeys drank honey. Some threw large chunks of honey combs after drinking and some went about intoxicated.
62_9.word_by_word: मधुपिङ्गलाः honeycoloured, केचित् some, मधूनि honey, पीत्वा were drinking, प्रविध्यन्ति throwing, केचिच्च some, मधूच्छिष्ठेन chunks of honey combs, उत्कटाः intoxicated, अन्योन्यम् with each other, जग्मुः went about.

62_10.shloka: अपरे वृक्षमूले तु शाखां गृह्य व्यवस्थिताः।अत्यर्थं च मदग्लानाः पर्णान्यास्तीर्य शेरते।।5.62.11।।
62_10.translation: Some took branches of trees and rested at the root of trees. Some totally languid lay down spreading leaves due to drinking of sweet drinks.
62_10.word_by_word: अपरे some others, शाखाम् branches of trees, गृह्य taking, वृक्षमूले at the root of trees, व्यवस्थिताः stayed, अत्यर्थम् on account of drinking, मदग्लानाः sweet drinks, पर्णानि leaves, आस्तीर्य spreading, शेरते lay down.

62_11.shloka: उन्मत्तभूताः प्लवगा मधुमत्ताश्च हृष्टवत्।क्षिपन्ति च तथान्योन्यं स्खलन्ति च तथाऽपरे।।5.62.12।।
62_11.translation: Intoxicated with drink, some behaved like mad people, some pushed others senselessly and some were unsteady and shaky.
62_11.word_by_word: मधुमत्ताः by drinking of honey, प्लवगाः vanaras, उन्मत्तभूताः like mad people, हृष्टवत् joyfully, अन्योन्यम् each other, क्षिपन्ति pushing each other, अपरे others, स्खलन्ति च were shaking unsteady.

62_12.shloka: केचित् क्ष्वेलां प्रकुर्वन्ति केचित् कूजन्ति हृष्टवत्।हरयोमधुना मत्ताः केचित्सुप्ता महीतले।।5.62.13।।
62_12.translation: Some roared, some warbled happily, some felt drowsy, drinking honey and somedropped off to sleep on the ground.
62_12.word_by_word: केचित् some, क्ष्वेलाम् प्रकुर्वन्ति roared, केचित् some, हृष्टवत् happy, कूजन्ति cooing like the birds, मधुना by the drinking of honey, मत्ताः drowsy, केचित् हरयः some vanaras, महीतले on the ground, सुप्ताः slept.

62_13.shloka: कृत्वा केचिद्धसन्त्यन्ये केचित्कुर्वन्ति चेतरत्।कृत्वा केचिद्वदन्त्यन्ये केचिद्बुध्यन्ति चेतरत्।।5.62.14।।
62_13.translation: Some made others laugh, some provoked others and some thought of doing something else having got over the intoxication.
62_13.word_by_word: केचित् some, कृत्वा having done, हसन्ति laughing, अन्ये others, केचित् some, इतरत् different, कुर्वन्ति doing, केचित् some, कृत्वा having done, वदन्ति were telling others, अन्ये others, केचित् some, इतरत् something else, बुध्यन्ति thought of doing.

62_14.shloka: येऽप्यत्र मधुपाला स्स्युः प्रेष्या दधिमुखस्य तु।तेऽपि तैर्वानरैर्भीमैः प्रतिषिद्धा दिशो गताः।।5.62.15।।
62_14.translation: All the guards engaged in protecting the garden were driven away in all directions by the fierce vanaras.
62_14.word_by_word: अत्र there, दधिमुखस्य Dadhimukha's, प्रेष्याः engaged, मधुपालाः guards of Madhuvanam, ये those, स्युः to cover, तेऽपि were also, भीमैः fierce, वानरैः vanaras, प्रतिषिद्धाः driven away, दिशः in all directions, गताः went.

62_15.shloka: जानुभिस्तु प्रकृष्टाश्च देवमार्गं प्रदर्शिताः।अब्रुवन् परमोद्विग्ना गत्वा दधिमुखं वचः।।5.62.16।।
62_15.translation: Some were dragged on their knees and tossed up. Some monkeys exhibited their private parts, showing indecent behaviour. Dadhimukha, highly disturbed at this, said:
62_15.word_by_word: जानुभिः knees, प्रकृष्टाः drawn forth, देवमार्गम् towards the path of gods, प्रदर्शिताः exhibiting, परमोद्विग्नाः greatly disturbed, दधिमुखम् to Dadhimukha, गत्वा having gone, वचः these words, अब्रुवन् said.

62_16.shloka: हनूमता दत्तवरैर्हतं मधुवनं बलात्।वयं च जानुभिः कृष्टा देवमार्गं च दर्शिताः।।5.62.17।।
62_16.translation: Permitted by Hanuman (to enter Madhuvanam and drink), they dragged one another forcefully tossed up  on their knees showing their private parts.
