62_16.word_by_word: हनूमता Hanuman, दत्तवरैर्हतं by whom they were permitted, वयं च and us, मधुवनं Madhuvanam, जानुभिः knees, बलात् forcefully, कृष्टा holding, देवमार्गं च  dragged to the private parts, दर्शिताः and showed.

62_17.shloka: ततो दधिमुख: क्रुद्धो वनपस्तत्र वानरः।हतं मधुवनं श्रुत्वा सान्त्वयामास तान् हरीन्।।5.62.18।।
62_17.translation: Then Dadhimukha, the guardian of the garden became furious on the vanaras. Having heard from the guards that the garden was destroyed, he said soothing words to them.
62_17.word_by_word: ततः then, तत्र there, वनपः guardian of the garden, दधिमुख: Dadhimukha, वानर: vanara, क्रुद्धः furious, मधुवनम् Madhuvanam, हतम् destoyed, श्रुत्वा having heard, हरीन् vanaras, सान्त्वयामास with soothing words.

62_18.shloka: इहागच्छत गच्छामो वानरान् बलदर्पितान्।बलेन वारयिष्यामो मधु भक्षयतो वयम्।।5.62.19।।
62_18.translation: "Come, we will all go there to Madhuvanam and prevent forcibly the vanaras who have consumed honey proud of their power.
62_18.word_by_word: इह here, आगच्चत come, गच्चामः will go, वयम् we, बलदर्पितान् proud of their power, मधु Madhu, भक्षयतः consume honey, वानरान् vanaras, बलेन forcibly, वारयिष्यामः will prevent them.

62_19.shloka: श्रुत्वा दधिमुखस्येदं वचनं वानरर्षभाः।पुनर्वीरा मधुवनं तेनैव सहसा ययुः।।5.62.20।।
62_19.translation: "The heroes, bulls among vanaras, heard Dadhimukha and quickly entered Madhuvanam along with him.
62_19.word_by_word: वीराः heroes, वानरर्षभाः bull among vanaras, दधिमुखस्य Dadhimukha's, इदम् this kind of, वचनम् words, श्रुत्वा having heard, सहसा quickly, तेनैव along with him, पुनः again, मधुवनम् Madhuvanam, ययुः went.

62_20.shloka: मध्ये चैषां दधिमुखः प्रगृह्य तरसा तरुम्।समभ्यधावद्वेगेन ते च सर्वे प्लवङ्गमाः।।5.62.21।।
62_20.translation: On the way, the energetic Dadhimukha took up a tree and ran to the leaping vanaras swiftly with guards following him.
62_20.word_by_word: एषाम् their, मध्ये way, दधिमुखः Dadhimukha, तरसा energetic, तरुम् tree, प्रगृह्य taking up, वेगेन swiftly, समभ्यधावत् following, ते they, सर्वे all, प्लवङ्गमाः च the leaping vanaras.

62_21.shloka: ते शिलाः पादपांश्चापि पर्वतांश्चापि वानराः।गृहीत्वाऽऽभ्यगमन् क्रुद्धा यत्र ते कपिकुञ्जराः।।5.62.22।।
62_21.translation: The furious vanara guards lifted rocks, trees and even mountains and went behind Dadhimukha the elephant among the vanaras.
62_21.word_by_word: ते वानराः those vanaras, क्रुद्धाः furious, शिलाः rocks, पादपांश्चापि also trees, पर्वतांश्चापि even mountains, गृहीत्वा took up, ते they, कपिकुञ्जराः elephant of monkeys, यत्र there, अभ्यगमन् went.

62_22.shloka: ते स्वामिवचनं वीरा हृदयेष्ववसज्य तत्।त्वरया ह्यभ्यधावन्त सालतालशिलायुधाः।।5.62.23।।
62_22.translation: The heroic vanaras held Sala and Tala trees and rushed at once keeping their leader's words in mind.
62_22.word_by_word: वीराः heroic, ते they, तत् that, स्वामिवचनम् leader's words, हृदयेषु in their heart, अवसज्य rushed, सालतालशिलायुधाः Sala, Tala trees as weapons, त्वरया at once, अभ्यधावन्त ran.

62_23.shloka: वृक्षस्थांश्च तलस्थांश्च वानरान् बलदर्पितान्।अभ्यक्रामंस्ततो वीराः पालास्तत्र सहस्रशः।।5.62.24।।
62_23.translation: Then the heroic guards in their thousands fell on the vanaras proud of their power on and under the tala trees.
62_23.word_by_word: ततः then, वीराः heroic, पालाः guards, सहस्रशः in thousands, वृक्षस्थांश्च on the trees, तलस्थांश्च under the trees, बलदर्पितान् proud of their power, वानरान् vanaras, अभ्यक्रामन् attacked.

62_24.shloka: अथ दृष्ट्वा दधिमुखं क्रुद्धं वानरपुङ्गवाः।अभ्यधावन्त वेगेन हनुमत्प्रमुखास्तदा।।5.62.25।।
62_24.translation: Having seen the fury of Dadhimukha, Hanuman the leader of the vanaras went to him swiftly.
62_24.word_by_word: अथ and then, हनुमत्प्रमुखाः leader Hanuman, वानरपुङ्गवाः foremost of vanaras, तदा then, दधिमुखम् Dadhimukha's, क्रुद्धम् fury, दृष्ट्वा having seen, वेगेन swiftly, अभ्यधावन्त went there.

62_25.shloka: तं सवृक्षं महाबाहुमापतन्तं महाबलम्।आर्यकं प्राहरत्तत्र बाहुभ्यां कुपितोऽङ्गदः।।5.62.26।।
62_25.translation: Seeing the revered, powerful and strongarmed Dadhimukha rushing to him, the angry Angada caught him with both hands tightly.
62_25.word_by_word: कुपितः angry, अङ्गदः Angada, सवृक्षम् with trees, महाबाहुम् strongarmed, महाबलम् powerful, आपतन्तम् coming, तम् him, आर्यकम् तत्र there, बाहुभ्याम् with both hands, प्राहरत्clasped tightly.

62_26.shloka: मदान्धश्च न वेदैनमार्यकोऽयं ममेति सः।अथैनं निष्पिपेषाशु वेगवद्वसुधातले।।5.62.27।।
62_26.translation: "Blinded by arrogance, the prince pushed him (Dadhimukha) on the floor forcibly,  forgetting that he was his revered granduncle.
62_26.word_by_word: सः he, मदान्धश्च blinded by arrogance, अयम् this, मम my, आर्यकः revered, इति this, एनम् therefore, न वेद not understnding that (I am his granduncle), अथ now, एनम् therefore, वसुधातले on the floor, वेगवत् forcibly, आशु him, निष्पिपेष pushed.

62_27.shloka: स भग्नबाहूरुभुजो विह्वलश्शोणितोक्षितः।मुमोह सहसा वीरो मुहूर्तं कपिकुञ्जरः।।5.62.28।।
62_27.translation: The heroic Dadhimukha, an elephant among monkeys, with his shoulders and arms broken, and body drenched in blood lost his consciousness instantly.
62_27.word_by_word: भग्नबाहूरुभुजः with shoulders and arms broken, विह्वलः battered, शोणितोक्षितः body drenched in blood, सः he, Dadhimukha, वीरः a hero, कपिकुञ्जरः elephant among monkeys, सहसा at once, मुहूर्तम् in a moment, मुमोह lost conciousness.

62_28.shloka: स समाश्वस्य सहसा सङ्कृद्धो राजमातुलः।वानरान्वारयामास दण्डेन मधुमोहितान्।।5.62.29।।
62_28.translation: At once Dadhimukha, the maternal uncle of the king became conscious and chased with a stick the intoxicated vanaras.
62_28.word_by_word: राजमातुलः maternal uncle of the king, सः he, सहसा at once, समाश्वस्य coming out of unconscious state, सङ्कृद्धः furious, मधुमोहितान् deluded by drinking, वानरान् vanaras, दण्डेन with a stick, वारयामास chased.

62_29.translation: Escaping from the vanaras with great difficulty, Dadhimukha,  a bull among monkeys, repaired to a secluded place and said to his servants:
62_29.word_by_word: तैः they, वानरैः vanaras, कथञ्चित् with great difficulty, विमुक्तः escaped, सः he, Dadhimukha, वानरर्षभः bull among monkeys, एकान्तम् secluded, आश्रित्य reached, समुपागतान् returned, स्वान् them, भृत्यान् servants, उवाच said.

62_30.shloka: एते तिष्ठन्तु गच्छामो भर्ता नो यत्र वानरः।सुग्रीवो विपुलग्रीवः सह रामेण तिष्ठति।।5.62.31।।
62_30.translation: "Let them stay here. Our broadnecked king Sugriva will be there with Rama. Let us go to him.
62_30.word_by_word: एते let them, तिष्ठन्तु stay, नः our, भर्ता king, वानरः vanaras, विपुलग्रीवः one with broad neck, सुग्रीवः Sugriva, यत्र there, रामेण सह with Rama, तिष्ठति will be staying, गच्चामः let us go.

62_31.shloka: सर्वं चैवाङ्गदे दोषं श्रावयिष्यामि पार्थिवे।अमर्षी वचनं श्रुत्वा घातयिष्यति वानरान्।।5.62.32।।
62_31.word_by_word: अङ्गदे Angada, सर्वम् all, दोषम् mistakes, पार्थिवे to the king, श्रावयिष्यामि will let him know, वचनम् these words, श्रुत्वा having heard, अमर्षि very furious, वानरान् vanaras, घातयिष्यति will put an end.

62_32.shloka: इष्टं मधुवनं ह्येतत्पार्थिवस्य महात्मनः।पितृपैतामहं दिव्यं देवैरपि दुरासदम्।।5.62.33।।
62_32.translation: 'Madhuvan has come down to us from our forefather's time. Dear to the king, its entry is prohibited even to the gods.
62_32.word_by_word: पितृपैतामहम् from grandfather and father, दिव्यम् wonderful, देवैरपि even for devatas, दुरासदम् forbidden, एतत् this, मधुवनम् Madhuvanam, महात्मनः great self, पार्थिवस्य to the king, इष्टं हि very dear.

62_33.shloka: स वानरानिमान् सर्वान् मधुलुब्धान् गतायुषः।घातयिष्यति दण्डेन सुग्रीवस्ससुहृज्जनान्।।5.62.34।।
62_33.translation: 'Sugriva will chase all the vanaras and their friends greedy for honey. They will be punished with a stick. They are doomed'.
62_33.word_by_word: सः सुग्रीवः that Sugriva, मधुलुब्धान् those greedy for honey, गतायुषः doomed, ससुहृज्जनान् their friends, इमान् these, सर्वान् all, वानरान् vanaras, दण्डेन with a stick, घातयिष्यति will be beaten.

62_34.shloka: वध्या ह्येते दुरात्मानो नृपाज्ञापरिभाविनः।अमर्षप्रभवो रोषस्सफलो नो भविष्यति।।5.62.35।।
62_34.translation: 'Indeed those evilminded ones who have disobeyed the king's order deserve to be killed.That way our fury and forbearance will result in success'.
62_34.word_by_word: नृपाज्ञापरिभाविनः who have disobeyed the king's order, एते they, दुरात्मनः evilminded, वध्याः हि indeed deserve to be killed, अमर्षप्रभवः forbearance king, नः रोषः our fury, सफलः will result in success, भविष्यति will be.

62_35.translation: Powerful Dadhimukha having said that to the guardians of the garden rose up to the sky and went off with them.
62_35.word_by_word: महाबलः very powerful, दधिमुखः Dadhimukha, वनसालान् garden protectors, एवम् in that way, उक्त्वा having said, सहसा at once, वनपालैः garden guards, समन्वितः along with them, उत्पत्य rising to the sky, जगाम went.

62_36.shloka: निमेषान्तरमात्रेण स हि प्राप्तो वनालयः।सहस्रांशुसुतो धीमान् सुग्रीवो यत्र वानरः।।5.62.37।।
62_36.translation: In a moment, Dadhimukha reached the place where wise Sugriva, the son of Sungod was there
62_36.word_by_word: सः he, वनालयः forestdweller, सहस्रांशुसुतः to the son of Sungod, धीमान् wise, सुग्रीवः वानरः to the vanara Sugriva, यत्र there, निमेषान्तरमात्रेण in a moment's time, प्राप्तः reached.

62_37.shloka: रामं च लक्ष्मणं चैव दृष्ट्वा सुग्रीवमेव च।समप्रतिष्ठां जगतीमाकाशान्निपपात ह।।5.62.38।।
62_37.translation: Seeing Rama, Lakshmana and also Sugriva from the sky he landed on an even ground.
62_37.word_by_word: रामं च Rama, लक्ष्मणं चैव and also Lakshmana, सुग्रीवमेव च and also Sugriva, दृष्ट्वा seeing, आकाशात् from the sky, समप्रतिष्ठाम् even, जगतीम् ground, निपपात landed.

62_38.shloka: सन्निपत्य महावीर्यस्सर्वैस्तै: परिवारितः।हरिर्दधिमुखः पालैः पालानां परमेश्वरः।।5.62.39।।स दीनवदनो भूत्वा कृत्वा शिरसि चाञ्जलिम्।सुग्रीवस्य शुभौ मूर्ध्ना चरणौ पत्यपीडयत्।।5.62.40।।
62_38.translation: Dadhimukha, a great hero and king of the guards protecting Madhuvanam surrounded by his servants, with a sad expression on his face offered painful obeisance with folded hands bowing down his forehead at the feet of Sugriva.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये सुन्दरकाण्डे द्विषष्टितमस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the sixtysecond sarga of Sundarakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
62_38.word_by_word: सर्वैः all, तैः पालैः those guards, परिवारितः the servants, पालानाम् king, परमेश्वरः lord, हरिः of monkeys, महावीर्यः great hero, सः दधिमुखः that Dadhimukha, दीनवदनः with a painful expression on the face, शिरसि head bowed down, अञ्जलिम् salutations with folded hands, कृत्वा having offered, सन्निपत्य surrounded by, सुग्रीवस्य Sugriva, शुभे auspicious, चरणौ feet, मूर्ध्ना touching with his forehead, पत्यपीडयत् painful obeisance.

63_1.shloka: [Sugriva tells Dadhimukha not to worry about the destruction of Madhuvanam. He asked him to send Hanuman, Angada and others]ततो मूर्ध्ना निपतितं वानरं वानरर्षभः।दृष्ट्वैवोद्विग्नहृदयो वाक्यमेतदुवाच ह।।5.63.1।।
63_1.translation: Feeling anxious on seeing Dadhimukha touching his feet with his forehead, Sugriva, the bull among vanaras said:
63_1.word_by_word: ततः then, वानरर्षभः bull among vanaras, मूर्ध्ना forehead, निपतितम् prostrated, वानरम् vanara, Dadhimukha, दृष्ट्वैव as soon as he saw, उद्विग्नहृदयः anxious at heart, एतत् these, वाक्यम् words, उवाच ह spoke.

63_2.shloka: उत्तिष्ठोत्तिष्ठ कस्मात्त्वं पादयोः पतितो मम।अभयं ते भवेद्वीर सर्वमेवाभिधीयताम्।।5.63.2।।
63_2.translation: "O heroic Dadhimukha, get up. Tell me why you have fallen at my feet. I give you protection from all.
63_2.word_by_word: वीर hero, उत्तिष्ठ उत्तिष्ठ get up, get up, त्वम् you, कस्मात् why, मम my, पादयोः feet, पतितः fallen, ते to you, अभयम् give you protection, भवेत् you be, सर्वमेव from all, अभिधीयताम् you may tell.

63_3.shloka: स तु विश्वासितस्तेन सुग्रीवेण महात्मना।उत्थाय सुमहाप्राज्ञो वाक्यं दधिमुखोऽब्रवीत्।।5.63.3।।
63_3.translation: When great Sugriva gave assurance to wise Dadhimukha, he got up and said:
63_3.word_by_word: महात्मना great self, तेन सुग्रीवेण by Sugriva, विश्वासितः given assurance, सुमहाप्राज्ञः very wise, सः दधिमुखः that Dadhimukha, उत्थाय got up, वाक्यम् these words, अब्रवीत् said.

63_4.shloka: नैवर्क्षरजसा राजन्न त्वया नापि वालिना।वनं निसृष्टपूर्वं हि भक्षितं तच्च वानरैः।।5.63.4।।
63_4.translation: "O king in your time or even before, during the time of Vali, that (Madhuvanam) was forbidden for entry. Now it has been laid waste by the trespassing vanaras.
63_4.word_by_word: राजन् O king, वनम्  garden, ऋक्षरजसा in Riksharaja's time, नैव निसृष्टपूर्वं हि or even before, त्वया your time, न not, वालिनापि even at the time of Vali, न not, तच्च accessible to go, वानरैः vanaras, भक्षितम् finished eating.

63_5.shloka: एभिः प्रधर्षिताश्चैव वानरा वनरक्षिभिः।मधून्यचिन्तयित्वेमान् भक्षयन्ति पिबन्ति च।।5.63.5।।
63_5.translation: "Even though the garden guards forcibly tried to prevent them they did not care and have devoured all the honey.
63_5.word_by_word: एभिः they also, वनरक्षिभिः garden guards, प्रधर्षिताश्चैव even though resisted, वानराः vanaras, इमान् them, अचिन्तयित्वा not cared for, मधूनि honey, भक्षयन्ति finished eating, पिबन्ति च and drinking.

63_6.shloka: शिष्टमत्रापविध्यन्ति भक्षयन्ति तथापरे।निवार्यमाणास्ते सर्वे भ्रुवो वै दर्शयन्ति हि।।5.63.6।।
63_6.translation: "Some have thrown off the leftovers, when others were prevented from drinking off the honey, they raised their eyebrows (to show their grouch).
63_6.word_by_word: शिष्टम् left over, अत्र there, अपविध्यन्ति thrown off, तथा similarly, अपरे others, भक्षयन्ति eating, ते सर्वे all, निवार्यमाणाः when we prevented, भ्रुवः eyebrows, दर्शयन्ति च raising to show (a sign of arrogance)

63_7.translation: "When the guards asked the vanaras to leave the garden the enraged vanaras misbehaved with them.
63_7.word_by_word: संरब्दतराः when enraged guards, तथा that way, तस्मात् from that, वनात् garden, वारयन्तः vanaras, इमे to go, क्रुद्धैः angry, तैः they, वानरपुङ्गवैः vanara leaders, सम्प्रधर्षिताः ill treated them.

63_8.translation: "O Sugriva the vanara guards were chased away by the many heroic monkeys, angry and redeyed.
63_8.word_by_word: वानरर्षभ bull among vanaras, ततः then, क्रोधात् in fury, संरक्तनयनैः redeyed, वीरैः heroes, बहुभिः many, तैः them, वानरैः vanara guards, हरयः monkeys, प्रविचालिताः chased.

63_9.shloka: पाणिभिर्निहताः केचित्केचिज्जानुभिराहताः।प्रकृष्टाश्च यथाकामं देवमार्गं च दर्शिताः।।5.63.9।।
63_9.translation: "Some were struck with hands, some beaten on their knees and were dragged as they liked and showed up their private parts.
63_9.word_by_word: केचित् some, पाणिभिः with the hands, निहताः struck, केचित् some, जानुभिः on the knees, आहताः beaten, यथाकामम् as they liked, प्रकृष्टाः dragged, देवमार्गम् private parts, दर्शिताः च showed.

63_10.shloka: एवमेते हताश्शूरास्त्वयि तिष्ठति भर्तरि।कृत्स्नं मधुवनं चैव प्रकामं तैः प्रभक्ष्यते।।5.63.10।।
63_10.translation: These heroes struck that way devoured the Madhuvanam on the earth at their will and devoured the honey even when you are there as king.
63_10.word_by_word: त्वयि you, भर्तरि when you are the king, तिष्ठति staying, एते these, शूराः heroes, एवम् in that way, हताः striking, तैः they, कृत्स्नम् on the earth, मधुवनं चैव Madhuvanam aslo, प्रकामम् at their will, प्रभक्ष्यते eating so.

63_11.shloka: एवं विज्ञाप्यमानं तं सुग्रीवं वानरर्षभम्।अपृच्छत्तं महाप्राज्ञो लक्ष्मणः परवीरहा।।5.63.11।।
63_11.translation: While Dadhimukha appealed thus to wise Sugriva, Lakshmana the killer of enemies happened to see them and enquired:
63_11.word_by_word: एवम् in that way, विज्ञाप्यमानम् having appealed, वानरर्षभम् bulls among vanaras, तं सुग्रीवम् to Sugriva, परवीरहा killer of enemies, महाप्राज्ञः very learned, लक्ष्मणः Lakshmana, अपृच्छत् enquired.

63_12.shloka: किमयं वानरो राजन् वनपः प्रत्युपस्थितः।कं चार्थमभिनिर्दिश्य दुःखितो वाक्यमब्रवीत्।।5.63.12।।
63_12.translation: "O king why has this protector of the garden come here? Why is he sad? What is he narrating, asked Lakshmana.
63_12.word_by_word: राजन् O king, वनप: protector of the garden, अयं वानरः this vanara, किम् why, प्रत्युपस्थितः came here?, दुःखितः sad, कम् why, अर्थम् for what, अभिनिर्दिश्य what is he telling, वाक्यम् these words, अब्रवीत् said.

63_13.shloka: एवमुक्तस्तु सुग्रीवो लक्ष्मणेन महात्मना।लक्ष्मणं प्रत्युवाचेदं वाक्यं वाक्यविशारदः।।5.63.13।।
63_13.translation: Great prince Lakshmana thus said, Sugriva the proficient speaker replied:
63_13.word_by_word: महात्मना great prince, लक्ष्मणेन by Lakshmana, एवम् in that way, उक्तः having spoken, वाक्यविशारदः proficient in speech, सुग्रीवः Sugriva, इदम् these, वाक्यम् words, प्रत्युवाच replied.

63_14.shloka: आर्य लक्ष्मण सम्प्राह वीरो दधिमुखः कपिः।अङ्गदप्रमुखैर्वीरैर्भक्षितं मधु वानरैः।।5.63.14।।विचित्य दक्षिणामाशामागतैर्हरिपुङ्गवैः।
63_14.translation: 'O venerable Lakshmana Dadhimukha as complaining that the fruits and honey have been consumed by the vanara heroes, Angada and others who have come after their search for Sita in the southern direction.
63_14.word_by_word: आर्य O venerable one, लक्ष्मण Lakshmana, वीरः hero, कपिः monkey, दधिमुखः Dadhimukha, सम्प्राह to search, दक्षिणाम् southern, आशाम् hope, विचित्य having searched, आगतैः have come, हरिपुङ्गवैः monkey leaders, वीरैः heroic ones, अङ्गदप्रमुखैः Angada and others, वानरैः vanaras, मधु honey, भक्षितम् eaten.

63_15.shloka: नैषामकृत्यानामीदृशस्स्यादुपक्रमः।।5.63.15।।आगतैश्च प्रमथितं यथा मधुवनं हि तैः।धर्षितं च वनं कृत्स्नमुपयुक्तं च वानरैः।।5.63.16।।
63_15.translation: "Those vanaras having entered Madhuvanam and broken the trees are quite right. Had they not accomplished their purpose they would not have indulged themselves that way.
63_15.word_by_word: आगतैः having come, तैः those, वानरैः vanaras, मधुवनम् Madhuvanam, यथा that way, प्रमथितम् entered, कृत्स्नम् whole, वनम् garden, धर्षितम् broken, उपयुक्तं च right, एषाम् they that way, अकृतकृत्यानाम् if they had not accomplished their purpose, ईदृशः this way, उपक्रमः indulged, न स्यात् not done.

63_16.shloka: वनं यदाऽभिपन्नास्ते साधितं कर्म वानरैः।दृष्टा देवी न सन्देहो न चान्येन हनूमता।।5.63.17।।
63_16.translation: "If they have trespassed into the garden that way, they might have done their duty. No doubt, Hanuman alone among them might have seen Sita.
63_16.word_by_word: ते they, यदा like that, वनम् garden, अभिपन्नाः entered, वानरैं कर्म their duty, साधितम् had done, देवी queen, दृष्टा saw, सन्देहः doubt, न no, अन्येन others, न not, हनुमता Hanuman.

63_17.shloka: न ह्यन्यस्साधने हेतुः कर्मणोऽस्य हनूमतः।कार्यसिद्धिर्मतिश्चैव तस्मिन्वानरपुङ्गवे।।5.63.18।।व्यवसायश्च वीर्यं च श्रुतं चापि प्रतिष्ठितम्।
63_17.translation: "Hanuman alone has the ability to do it, the reason being he has the capacity the wisdom, streneous effort, virility and enthusiasm to accomplish it. These attributes are wellestablished in him.
63_17.word_by_word: अस्य कर्मणः that duty, साधने capacity, हनूमतः Hanuman, अन्यः others, हेतुः the reason being, न हि not indeed, कार्यसिद्धि: capacity to accomplish, मतिश्चैव even wisdom, व्यवसायश्च even strenuous effort, वीर्यं च and virility, श्रुतं चापि enthusiasm, तस्मिन् for him, वानरपुङ्गवे to only the foremost of the monkys, प्रतिष्ठितम् are wellestablished.

63_18.shloka: जाम्बवान्यत्र नेता स्यादङ्गदश्च महाबलः।।5.63.19।।हनुमांश्चाप्यधिष्ठाता न तस्य गतिरन्यथा।
63_18.translation: Where Jambavan, Angada and Hanuman are leaders directing the task of the army it must have been accomplished.
63_18.word_by_word: यत्र where, जाम्बवान् Jambavan, नेता is the leader, स्यात् remains, महाबलः strong, अङ्गदश्च Angada also, हनुमांश्च and Hanuman, अधिष्ठाता directing, तस्य that, गतिः will be done, अन्यथा otherwise, न not.

63_19.word_by_word: अङ्गदप्रमुखैः Angada and other leaders, वीरैः heroes, मधुवनम् Madhuvanam, हतं किल destroyed the garden, सहिताः along with others, वारयन्तः च when they were obstructed, तदा then, जानुभिः knees, आहताः beaten.

63_20.shloka: एतदर्थमयं प्राप्तो वक्तुं मधुरवागिह।।5.63.21।।नाम्ना दधिमुखो नाम हरिः प्रख्यातविक्रमः।
63_20.translation: "Here is Dadhimukha, a vanara, known for his valour and sweet tongue. He came here this incident to tell.
63_20.word_by_word: नाम्ना named, दधिमुखो नाम Dadhimukha, प्रख्यातविक्रमः known for his valour, हरिः monkey, एतदर्थम् on account of it, वक्तुम् to tell, मधुरवाक् sweet tongued, इह here, प्राप्तः came.

63_21.shloka: दृष्टा सीता महाबाहो सौमित्रे पश्य तत्त्वतः।।5.63.22।।अभिगम्य तथा सर्वे पिबन्ति मधु वानराः।
63_21.translation: "O strongarmed Saumitri the Vanaras must have seen Sita. Or else, they would not have arrived to drink honey.
63_21.word_by_word: महाबाहो strongarmed, सौमित्रे O Saumitri, सीता Sita, दृष्टा would have seen, तत्त्वतः truly, पश्य seen, तथा so, वानराः vanaras, सर्वे all, अभिगम्य having arrived, मधु honey, पिबन्ति drank.

63_22.shloka: न चाप्यदृष्ट्वा वैदेहीं विश्रुताः पुरुषर्षभ।।5.63.23।।वनं दत्तवरं दिव्यं धर्षयेयुर्वनौकसः।
63_22.translation: "If the renowned vanaras had not seen Vaidehi, they would not have entered the wonderful garden granted as boon (by Brahma).
63_22.word_by_word: पुरुषर्षभ bull among men, विश्रुताः renowned, वनौकसः forestdwellers, वैदेहीम् Vaidehi, अदृष्ट्वा not seen, दत्तवरम् that which was given as boon, दिव्यम् wonderful, वनम् garden, न धर्षयेयुः entered.

63_23.shloka: ततः प्रहृष्टो धर्मात्मा लक्ष्मणस्सह राघवः।।5.63.24।।श्रुत्वा कर्णसुखां वाणीं सुग्रीववदनाच्च्युताम्।प्राहृष्यत भृशं रामो लक्ष्मणश्च महाबलः।।5.63.25।।
63_23.translation: "Then righteous Rama and Lakshmana rejoiced to hear the words of Sugriva, which were pleasing to the ears.
63_23.word_by_word: ततः then, सह राघवः also Rama, धर्मात्मा righteous, लक्ष्मणः Lakshmana, प्रहृष्टः very cheerful rejoiced, सुग्रीववदनात् Sugriva's mouth, च्युताम् delivered, कर्णसुखाम् pleasing to the ears, वाणीम् words, श्रुत्वा having heard, रामः Rama, प्राहृष्यत felt happy, महाबलः mighty strong, लक्ष्मणश्च even Lakshmana, भृशम् very, प्राहृष्यत happy.

63_24.shloka: श्रुत्वा दधिमुखस्येदं सुग्रीवस्सम्प्रहृष्य च।वनपालं पुनर्वाक्यं सुग्रीवः प्रत्यभाषत।।5.63.26।।
63_24.translation: Beautifulnecked Sugriva heard Dadhimukha, the protector of the garden, felt very glad and replied:
63_24.word_by_word: सुग्रीवः one with beautiful neck, सुग्रीवः Sugriva, दधिमुखस्य Dadhimukha's, इदम् thus, श्रुत्वा having heard, सम्प्रहृष्य च very glad, पुनः again, वनपालम् protector of the garden, वाक्यम् these words, प्रत्यभाषत replied.

63_25.shloka: प्रीतोऽस्मि सोऽहं यद्भुक्तं वनं तैः कृतकर्मभिः।मर्षितं मर्षणीयं च चेष्टितं कृतकर्मणाम्।।5.63.27।।
63_25.translation: "They went to the garden to drink only after having performed their duty. I am glad about it. Since they have accomplished the purpose, they are to be excused for their behaviour. I have pardoned them.
63_25.word_by_word: कृतकर्मभिः having performed the duty, तैः they, वनम् garden, यत् भुक्तम् for drinking that honey, सः अहम् I, प्रीतः अस्मि I am pleased, कृतकर्मणाम् having accomplished the task, मर्षणीयम् are to be excused, चेष्टितम् their behaviour, मर्षितम् excused.

63_26.shloka: इच्छामि शीघ्रं हनुमत्प्रधानान् शाखामृगांस्तान् मृगराजदर्पान्।द्रष्टुं कृतार्थान् सह राघवाभ्यां श्रोतुं च सीताधिगमे प्रयत्नम्।।5.63.28।।
63_26.word_by_word: हनुमत्प्रधानान् led by Hanuman, मृगराजदर्पान् with the majesty of the lion, कृतार्थान् acomplished ones, तान् them, शाखामृगान् vanaras (who live on trees), राघवाभ्यां सह Rama and others, द्रष्टुम् to see, सीताधिगमेन to see Sita, प्रयत्नम् endeavour, श्रोतुं च to hear, इच्छामि desiring.

63_27.shloka: प्रीतिस्फीताक्षौ सम्प्रहृष्टौ कुमारौ दृष्ट्वा सिद्धार्थौ वानराणां च राजा।अङ्गैः संहृष्टैः कर्मसिद्धिं विदित्वा बाह्वोरासन्नां सोऽतिमात्रं ननन्द।।5.63.29।।
63_27.translation: "Beholding young Rama and Lakshmana extremely delighted, their eyes filled with joy out of fulfilment of the purpose, Sugriva who was also highly delighted felt an auspicious thrill on his limbs and knew that good time had come.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये सुन्दरकाण्डे त्रिषष्टितमस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the sixtythird sarga of Sundarakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
63_27.word_by_word: सः he (Sugriva), वानराणां राजा king of vanaras, प्रीतिस्फीताक्षौ eyes filled with joy, सम्प्रहृष्टौ very happy, सिद्धार्धौ accomplished, कुमारौ young, दृष्ट्वा seeing, संहृष्टैः very glad, अङ्गैः limbs of the body, कर्मसिद्धिम् task has been accomplished, बाह्वोः shoulders, आसन्नाम् time has come, विदित्वा recognising, अतिमात्रम् highly, ननन्द delighted.

64_1.shloka: [Hanuman and Angada along with others approach Sugriva -- Hanuman tells Rama about the discovery of Sita.]सुग्रीवेणैवमुक्तस्तु हृष्टो दधिमुखः कपिः।राघवं लक्ष्मणं चैव सुग्रीवं चाभ्यवादयत्।।5.64.1।।
64_1.translation: Pleased with Sugriva's command (to send forth Angada and Hanuman) Dadhimukha offered salutations to Sugriva, Rama  and Lakshmana.
64_1.word_by_word: सुग्रीवेण by Sugriva, एवम् in that way, उक्तः spoken, कपिः monkey, दधिमुखः Dadhimukha, हृष्टः pleased, राघवम् Rama, लक्ष्मणं चैव and also Lakshmana, सुग्रीवं च and Sugriva, अभ्यवादयत् offered salutations.

64_2.shloka: स प्रणम्य च सुग्रीवं राघवौ च महाबलौ।वानरैः सहितः शूरैर्दिवमेवोत्पपात ह।।5.64.2।।
64_2.translation: Dadhimukha offered his obeisance to Sugriva and the mighty Rama and Lakshmana  and rose up to the sky followed by the vanaras.
64_2.word_by_word: सः he, Dadhimukha, सुग्रीवम् to Sugriva, महाबलौ mighty strong, राघवौ च Rama, प्रणम्य offering obeisance, शूरैः heroes, वानरैः vanaras, सहितः followed by, दिवमेव to the sky, उत्पपात rose up.

64_3.shloka: स यथैवाऽगतः पूर्वं तथैव त्वरितं गतः।निपत्य गगनाद्भूमौतद्वनं प्रविवेश ह।।5.64.3।।स प्रविष्टो मधुवनं ददर्श हरियूथपान्।विमदानुत्थितान्सर्वान् मेहमानान्मधूदकम्।।5.64.4।।
64_3.translation: Descending into Madhuvanam, Dadhimukha saw all the monkey troops free from intoxication (of honeywine).
64_3.word_by_word: मधुवनम् Madhuvanam, प्रविष्टः entered, सः he, विमदान् intoxication, मदूदकम् honey and water, मेहमानान् voiding urine, सर्वान् all, हरियूथपान् troops of vanaras, ददर्श saw.

64_4.shloka: स तानुपागमद्वीरो बद्ध्वा करपुटाञ्जलिम्।उवाच वचनं श्लक्ष्णमिदं हृष्टवदङ्गदम्।।5.64.5।।
64_4.translation: Heroic Dadhimukha went to Angada, holding his cupped palms reverentially and spoke these conciliatory words with joy:
64_4.word_by_word: वीरः hero, सः he, करपुटाञ्जलिम् cupping his palms reverentially, बद्ध्वा holding, तान् him, उपागमत् returned, हृष्टवत् with joy, अङ्गदम् Angada, श्लक्ष्णम् conciliatory, इदं वचनम् these words, उवाच spoken.

64_5.shloka: सौम्य रोषो न कर्तव्यो यदेतत्परिवारितम्।अज्ञानाद्रक्षिभिः क्रोधाद्भवन्तः प्रतिषेधिताः।।5.64.6।।
64_5.translation: "O handsome one, do not react harshly at these guards who have obstructed your companions out of ignorance and fury.
64_5.word_by_word: सौम्य prince of mild disposition, एतत् all this, यत् परिवारितम् that your companions, रोषः harsh, न कर्तव्यः not react, भवन्तः you, रक्षिभिः even the guards, अज्ञानात् out of ignorance, क्रोधात् fury, प्रतिषेधिताः have obstructed you.

64_6.shloka: युवराजस्त्वमीशश्च वनस्यास्य महाबल।मौर्ख्यात्पूर्वं कृतो दोषस्तं भवान् क्षन्तुमर्हति।।5.64.7।।
64_6.translation: "O mighty Angada you are heir apparent and also king. Out of foolishness I obstructed you. You ought to pardon me this mistake.
64_6.word_by_word: महाबल mighty, त्वम् you, युवराजः heir apparent, अस्य वनस्य at this garden, ईशश्च king also, पूर्वम् earlier, मौर्ख्यात् out of foolishness, दोषः mistake, कृतः did, तम् to you, भवान्you, क्षन्तुम् be at peace, अर्हति is proper.

64_7.shloka: आख्यातं हि मया गत्वा पितृव्यस्य तवानघ।इहोपयातं सर्वेषामेतेषां वनचारिणाम्।।5.64.8।।
64_7.translation: "O blameless prince I have already told your father's elder brother and all the forestdwellers about your arrival here.
64_7.word_by_word: अनघ blameless, मया I, गत्वा gone, तव your, पितृव्यस्य elder brother of your father, सर्वेषाम् all, एतेषाम् your people, वनचारिणाम् forestdwellers, इह here, उपयातम् your arrival, आख्यातं हि indeed told.

64_8.shloka: स त्वदागमनं श्रुत्वा सहैभिर्हरियूथपैः।प्रहृष्टो न तु रुष्टोऽसौ वनं श्रुत्वा प्रधर्षितम्।।5.64.9।।
64_8.translation: "He was not angry at your destruction of the garden. On the other hand, he was very glad to hear about your arrival.
64_8.word_by_word: सः he, एभिः these, सह with, त्वदागमनम् your arrival, श्रुत्वा hearing, प्रहृष्टः very glad, तु you, वनम् garden, प्रधर्षितम् destroying, श्रुत्वा having heard, असौ he was, न रुष्टः not angry.

64_9.shloka: प्रहृष्टो मां पितृव्यस्ते सुग्रीवो वानरेश्वरः।शीघ्रं प्रेषय सर्वांस्तानिति होवाच पार्थिवः।।5.64.10।।
64_9.translation: "Your father's brother, Sugriva, the lord of vanaras felt very glad and indeed asked meto send you quickly."
64_9.word_by_word: ते पितृव्यः your father's brother, वानरेश्वरः lord of vanaras, पार्थिवः king, सुग्रीवः Sugriva, प्रहृष्टः happily, तान् सर्वान् all of them, शीघ्रम् quickly, प्रेषय send, इति this, माम् to me, उवाच ह said indeed.

64_10.shloka: श्रुत्वा दधिमुखस्येदं वचनं श्लक्ष्णमङ्गदः।अब्रवीत्तान् हरिश्रेष्ठो वाक्यं वाक्यविशारदः।।5.64.11।।
64_10.translation: At these good words from Dadhimukha, Angada, the monkey leader, an eloquent speaker said this:.
64_10.word_by_word: दधिमुखस्य to Dadhumukha, इदम् this, श्लक्ष्णम् very good, वचनम् these words, श्रुत्वा having heard, हरिश्रेष्ठः monkey leader, वाक्यविशारदः eloquent in speech, अङ्गदः Angada, तान् to them, वाक्यम् these words, अब्रवीत् said.

64_11.shloka: शङ्के श्रुतोऽयं वृत्तान्तो रामेण हरियूथपाः।तत्क्षमं नेह नः स्थातुं कृते कार्ये परन्तपाः।।5.64.12।।
64_11.translation: "O scorcher of enemies I presume Rama has already heard the news of our arrival on accomplishment of the task. Hence it is not proper for us to tarry here.
64_11.word_by_word: परन्तपाः scorcher of enemies, हरियूथपाः leader of monkeys, अयं वृत्तान्तः about this here, रामेण by Rama, श्रुतः having heard, शङ्के I presume, तत् that, कार्ये task, कृते having done, इह here, स्थातुम् to be here, नः for us, न क्षमम् not proper.

64_12.shloka: पीत्वा मधु यथाकामं विश्रान्ता वनचारिणः।किं शेषं गमनं तत्र सुग्रीवो यत्र मे गुरुः।।5.64.13।।
64_12.translation: "The vanaras of the forest have taken rest after drinking as much honey as they desired. What is left here to do? We have to go wherever Sugriva is."
64_12.word_by_word: वनचारिणः forestrangers, vanaras, यथाकामम् as they desire, मधु honey, पीत्वा having drunk, विश्रान्ताः rested, किम् what, शेषम् is left, मे my, गुरुः king, सुग्रीवः Sugriva, यत्र where, तत्र there, गमनम् have to go.

64_13.shloka: सर्वे यथा मां वक्ष्यन्ति समेत्य हरियूथपाः।तथास्मि कर्ता कर्तव्ये भवद्भिः परवानहम्।।5.64.14।।
64_13.translation: Angada said to the vanara troops assembled, "Tell me what we have to do. I shall act as you wish.
64_13.word_by_word: सर्वे all, हरियूथपाः monkey troops, समेत्य assembled together, माम् me, यथा like that, वक्ष्यन्ति would tell, यथा in that way, कर्ता we are to do, अस्मि we, कर्तव्ये in our duty, अहम् I am, भवद्भिः as you say, परवान् have to do.

64_14.shloka: नाज्ञापयितुमीशोऽहं युवराजोऽस्मि यद्यपि।अयुक्तं कृतकर्माणो यूयं धर्षयितुं मया।।5.64.15।।
64_14.translation: "Even though I am heir apparent, it is not proper for me to order you.You have accomplished the purpose and to command you is not befitting on my part."
64_14.word_by_word: अहम् I am, युवराजः heir apparent, अस्मि यद्यपि even though I am, आज्ञापयितुम् to order you, न ईशः not lord, कृतकर्माणः accomplished dones, यूयम् troops, मया by me, धर्षयितुम् ordering, अयुक्तम् not proper.

64_15.translation: On hearing Angada's valuable words said in that way, the vanaras repled:
64_15.word_by_word: एवम् in that way, ब्रुवतः when said, अङ्गदस्य by Angada, अव्ययम् priceless, वचनम् words, श्रुत्वा having heard, वनौकसः forest dwellers, प्रहृष्टमनः glad at heart, इदम् these, ऊचुः said.

64_16.shloka: एवं वक्ष्यति को राजन् प्रभुस्सन्वानरर्षभ।ऐश्वर्यमदमत्तो हि सर्वोऽहमिति मन्यते।।5.64.17।।
64_16.translation: "O king O bull among monkeys we think you are an exception to those to whom prosperity brings arrogance.
64_16.word_by_word: वानरर्षभ bull among vanaras, राजन् O king, प्रभुः सन् who is lord, कः who, एवम् in that way, वक्ष्यति said so, सर्वः all others, ऐश्वर्यमदमत्तः arrogant on account of prosperity, अहम् I, इति thus, मन्यते हि think .

64_17.shloka: तव चेदं सुसदृशं वाक्यं नान्यस्य कस्यचित्।सन्नतिर्हि तवाख्याति भविष्यच्छुभयोग्यताम्।।5.64.18।।
64_17.translation: "You alone could speak such words. Your humility speaks of your fitness for a  bright future.
64_17.word_by_word: इदं वाक्यम् these words, तव च you alone would have said, सुसदृशम् your humility, अन्यस्य in others, कस्यचित्  you only, न not, तव your, सन्नतिः humble, भविष्यच्छुभयोग्यताम् fit for a bright future, आख्याति speaks of.

64_18.shloka: सर्वे वयमपि प्राप्तास्तत्र गन्तुं कृतक्षणाः।स यत्र हरिवीराणां सुग्रीवः पतिरव्ययः।।5.64.19।।
64_18.word_by_word: प्राप्ताः come here, वयम् us, सर्वेऽपि all of us, हरिवीराणाम् vanara heroes, पतिः lord, अव्ययः one who is immortal, सः सुग्रीवः that Sugriva, यत्र to him, तत्र there, गन्तुम् to go, कृतक्षणाः ready at any moment.

64_19.shloka: त्वया ह्यनुक्तैर्हरिभिर्नैव शक्यं पदात्पदम्।क्वचिद्गन्तुं हरिश्रेष्ठ ब्रूमः सत्यमिदं तु ते।।5.64.20।।
64_19.translation: "O Angada the best of vanaras without your command none will find it possible to put forward even a single step."
64_19.word_by_word: हरिश्रेष्ठ best of the vanaras, Angada, त्वया your, अनुक्तै: order, हरिभिः vanaras, पदात् onfoot, पदम् one step, क्वचित् not even, गन्तुम् to go, न शक्यम् not possible, सत्यम् it is true, इदम् this, ते to you, ब्रूमः appealed.

64_20.shloka: एवं तु वदतां तेषामङ्गदः प्रत्युवाच ह।बाढं गच्छाम इत्युक्त्वा खमुत्पेतुर्महाबलाः।।5.64.21।।
64_20.translation: Thus addressed by all the vanaras, Angada said 'Well, let us go'. Then the powerful vanaras rose up the sky.
64_20.word_by_word: तेषाम् those vanaras, एवम् that way, वदताम् spoken, अङ्गदः Angada, बाढम् very good, गच्छाम let us go, प्रत्युवाच ह replied, इति thus, उक्त्वा having spoken, महाबलाः powerful vanaras, खम् to the sky, उत्पेतुः rose up.

64_21.shloka: उत्पतन्तमनूत्पेतु स्सर्वे ते हरियूथपाः।कृत्वाकाशं निराकाशं यन्त्रोत्क्षिप्ता इवाचलाः।।5.64.22।।
64_21.translation: All the vanara troops sprang up into the air as though there was no sky, like stones shattered by machines from the  mountains rise up.
64_21.word_by_word: सर्वे all, ते हरियूथपाः vanara troops, यन्त्रोत्क्षिप्ताः  stones shattered by machines, अचलाः mountain, इव like, आकाशम् sky, निराकाशम् as if there is no sky, कृत्वा did, उत्पतन्तम् rising up, अनूत्पेतुः sprang up.

64_22.shloka: तेऽम्बरं सहसोत्पत्य वेगवन्तः प्लवङ्गमाः।विनदन्तो महानादं घना वातेरिता यथा।।5.64.23।।
64_22.translation: The swift monkeys roared aloud as though they went up the sky like thundering clouds driven by  the wind.
64_22.word_by_word: वेगवन्तः swift, ते प्लवङ्गमाः those monkeys, महानादम् roared aloud, विनदन्तः noise, वातेरिताः driven by the Wind, घनाः यथा like heavy clouds, सहसा at once, अम्बरम् to the sky, उत्पत्य went up.

64_23.shloka: अङ्गदे ह्यननुप्राप्ते सुग्रीवो वानराधिपः।उवाच शोकोपहतं रामं कमललोचनम्।।5.64.24।।
64_23.translation: Seeing the griefstricken, lotuseyed Rama, the lord of the vanaras Sugriva said this before the arrival of Angada:
64_23.word_by_word: अङ्गदे Angada, अननुप्राप्ते before he came, वानराधिपः lord of the vanaras, सुग्रीवः Sugriva, शोकोपहतम् stricken with grief, कमललोचनम् lotus eyed, रामम् Rama, उवाच said.

64_24.shloka: समाश्वसिहि भद्रं ते दृष्टा देवी न संशयः।नागन्तुमिह शक्यं तैरतीते समये हि नः।।5.64.25।।
64_24.translation: "Trust me, Rama. Be blessed. The vanaras have seen the divine lady. There is no doubt. It is not possible for them to come here after exceeding the time limit  (in their search for Sita).
64_24.word_by_word: समाश्वसिहि trust me, ते to you, भद्रम् auspicious, देवी queen, दृष्टा have seen, संशयः doubt, न not, नः us, समये time, अतीते exceeded, तैः they, इह here, आगन्तुम् to come, न शक्यम् not possible.

64_25.shloka: न मत्सकाशमागच्छेत्कृत्ये हि विनिपातिते।युवराजो महाबाहुः प्लवतां प्रवरोऽङ्गदः।।5.64.26।।
64_25.translation: "My heir apparent, the strongarmed Angada, and the best of the monkeys is endowedwith virtues. He would not come near me if his mission had failed.
64_25.word_by_word: युवराजः heir apparent, महाबाहुः strongarmed one, प्लवताम् leaping, प्रवरः endowed with good virtues, अङ्गदः Angada, कृत्ये mission, विनिपातिते has failed, मत्सकाशम् near me, नागच्छेत् will not come.

64_26.translation: "In case the vanaras have returned without accomplishing the task, Angada would have assumed a pathetic face, perplexed and unsteady in mind.
64_26.word_by_word: अकृतकृत्यानाम् in case they have not accomplished, उपक्रमः return, ईदृशः this way, यद्यपि स्यात् acted that way, सः he, दीनवदनः pathetic face, भ्रान्त विप्लुतमानसः perplexed and unsteady in mind, भवेत् would be.

64_27.shloka: पितृपैतामहं चैतत्पूर्वकैरभिरक्षितम्।न मे मधुवनं हन्यादहृष्टः प्लवगेश्वरः।।5.64.28।।कौसल्यासुप्रजा राम समाश्वसिहि सुव्रत।
64_27.translation: "If Angada, lord of the vanaras had not been happy, he would not have destroyed the Madhuvanam of my father's and my grandfather's time. O Rama, follower of righteous practices, Kausalya has an excellent son in you. Trust me.
64_27.word_by_word: प्लवगेश्वरः lord of monkeys, अहृष्टः not been happy, पितृपैतामहम् father and grandfather's time, पूर्वकैः ancestors, अभिरक्षितम् protected, मे मधुवनम् my Madhuvanam, न हन्यात् not destroy, कौसल्यासुप्रजाः Kausalya's son, सुव्रत one who pracitces good traditions, राम Rama, समाश्वसिहि trust me.

64_28.shloka: दृष्टा देवी न सन्देहो न चान्येन हनूमता।।5.64.29।।न ह्यन्यः कर्मणो हेतुस्साधनेऽस्य हनूमतः।
64_28.translation: "Hanuman is the one who has accomplished this task. Who else can? No doubt, he has seen Sita.
64_28.word_by_word: कर्मणो this task, हेतुस्साधनेऽस्य the reason for accomplishing, देवी Sita, दृष्टा saw, सन्देहः doubt, न  not, अन्येन not others, न not, हनुमता Hanuman.

64_29.shloka: हनूमति हि सिद्धिश्च मतिश्च मतिसत्तमः।।5.64.30।।व्यवसायश्च वीर्यं च सूर्ये तेज इव ध्रुवम्।
64_29.translation: "O Rama, the best among the wise just like the luminosity that abides in the Sun, capacity to succeed, energy, intelligence, even courage and steadfastness reside in Hanuman.
64_29.word_by_word: मतिसत्तम best one among the wise, हनूमति Hanuman, सूर्ये Sun, तेजः इव like the luminosity, सिद्धिश्च capacity to succeed, मतिश्च intelligence, व्यवसायश्च effort, वीर्यं च and even courage, ध्रुवम् steadfast.

64_30.shloka: जाम्बवान्यत्र नेता स्यादङ्गदश्च बलेश्वरः।हनुमांश्चाप्यधिष्ठाता न तस्य गतिरन्यथा।।5.64.31।।
64_30.translation: "Where Jambavan is the leader, Angada the commander of the army and Hanuman the guiding force, the end result will not be otherwise.
64_30.word_by_word: यत्र there, जाम्बवान् Jambavan, नेता leader, स्यात् remains, महाबलः commander of army अङ्गदश्च and Angada, हनुमांश्च and Hanuman, अधिष्ठाता the guiding force, तस्य that, गतिः end result, अन्यथा otherwise, न not be.

64_31.shloka: मा भूश्चिन्तासमायुक्तस्सम्प्रत्यमितविक्रमः।।5.64.32।।ततः किलकिलाशब्दं शुश्रावासन्नमम्बरे।हनुमत्कर्मदृप्तानां नार्धतां काननौकसाम्।।5.64.33।।किष्किन्धामुपयातानां सिद्धिं कथयतामिव।
64_31.translation: "You are extremely valiant and it is unbecoming of you to be anxious at this time Rama. Just then chatterings of the monkeys were heard from the sky as they roared in pride talking of Hanuman's achievement. Having successfully completed the errand, they have arrived at Kishkinda.
64_31.word_by_word: अमितविक्रमः extremely valiant, सम्प्रति at this time, चिन्तासमायुक्तः anxious, मा भूः do not, ततःat that time, हनुमत्कर्मदृप्तानाम् in the pride of Hanuman's success, नार्धताम् roaring, सिद्धिम् successfully completed the work, कथयतामिव talking, किष्किन्धाम् in Kishkinda, उपयातानाम् have reached, काननौकसाम् forestdwellers, vanaras, अम्बरे in the sky, आसन्नम् have arrived, किलकिलाशब्दम् chatterings, शुश्राव was heard.

64_32.translation: The great Sugriva heard the roar of the monkeys and was extremely happy. He kept raising and shaking his long tail in joy.
64_32.word_by_word: ततः then, सः कपिसत्तमः that great monkey, Sugriva, कपीनाम् of the monkeys, तं निनादम् that roar, श्रुत्वा having heard, आयताञ्चितलाङ्गूलः lifting and shaking the long tail, हृष्टमानसः extremely happy, अभवत् remained.

64_33.shloka: आजग्मुस्तेऽपि हरयो रामदर्शनकांक्षिणः।।5.64.35।।अङ्गदं पुरतः कृत्वा हनूमन्तं च वानरम्।
64_33.translation: The joyful monkeys with Angada and Hanuman leading them descended with eagerness to have a close look at Rama.
64_33.word_by_word: ते हरयः those joyful monkeys, कपिः monkeys, अङ्गदम् Angada, वानरम् vanaras, हनूमन्तम् Hanuman, पुरतः in front, कृत्वा having, रामदर्शनकांक्षिणः eager to have a look at Rama, आजग्मुः reached.

64_34.shloka: तेऽङ्गदप्रमुखा वीराः प्रहृष्ठाश्च मुदान्विताः।।5.64.36।।निपेतुर्हरिराजस्य समीपे राघवस्य च।
64_34.translation: Angada the chief along with the heroic monkeys very joyfully and exuberantly descended close to Sugriva, the king of monkeys and Rama.
64_34.word_by_word: अङ्गदप्रमुखाः Angada, the chief of the army of monkeys, ते वीराः the heroes, प्रहृष्टाश्च very joyfully, मुदा exuberant, अन्विताः descended, हरिराजस्य to the king of monkeys, राघवस्य च and Rama, समीपे near, निपेतुः landed.

64_35.shloka: हनुमांश्च महाबाहुः प्रणम्य शिरसा ततः।।5.64.37।।नियतामक्षतां देवीं राघवाय न्यवेदयत्।
64_35.translation: Then the strongarmed Hanuman with his head bowed down offered salutations and reported, 'Divine lady Sita with her constant devotion to Sri Rama is sound in body'.
64_35.word_by_word: ततः then, महाबाहुः strongarmed, हनुमान् Hanuman, शिरसा with head bowed down, प्रणम्य offered salutations, देवीम् divine lady, नियताम् with her constant devotion, अक्षताम् sound in body, राघवाय to Rama, न्यवेदयत् reported.

64_36.shloka: दृष्टा देवीति हनुमद्वदनादमृतोपमम्।।5.64.38।।आकर्ण्य वचनं रामो हर्षमाप सलक्ष्मणः।
64_36.translation: On hearing the nectarlike words from Hanuman that Sita was found, Rama and Lakshmana were delighted.
64_36.word_by_word: सलक्ष्मणः Lakshmana, रामः Rama, हनुमद्वदनात् only Hanuman, अमृतोपमम् sweet at nectar, देवी दृष्टा इति Sita was seen, these, वचनम् words, आकर्ण्य hearing, हर्षम् delighted, आप remained.

64_37.shloka: निश्चितार्थं ततस्तस्मिन् सुग्रीवं पवनात्मजे।।5.64.39।।लक्ष्मणः प्रीतिमान् प्रीतं बहुमानादवैक्षत।
64_37.translation: Sugriva and Lakshmana glanced at Hanuman respectfully with affection thinking surely Hanuman alone has succeeded.
64_37.word_by_word: ततः then, लक्ष्मणः Lakshmana, तस्मिन् पवनात्मजे that son of the Windgod, निश्चितार्थम्surely, प्रीतम् very affectionately, सुग्रीवम् and Sugriva, बहुमानात् respectfully, अवैक्षत glanced.

64_38.shloka: प्रीत्या च रममाणोऽथ राघवः परवीरहा।।5.64.40।।बहुमानेन महता हनुमन्तमवैक्षत।
64_38.translation: Rama, the slayer of heroic enemies was extremely delighted and glanced at Hanuman with unbounded affection.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकावे सुन्दरकाण्डे चतुःषष्टितमस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the sixtyfourth sarga of Sundarakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
64_38.word_by_word: परवीरहा slayer of heroic enemies, राघवः Rama, रममाणः extremely delighted, उपेतः became, महता great, बहुमानेन with unbounded affection, हनुमन्तम् at Hanuman, अवैक्षत glanced.

65_1.shloka: [Hanuman apprises Sri Rama of Sita's presence under the Simsupa tree surrounded by demonesses and presents the Chudamani to Rama in the presence of Sugriva.]ततः प्रस्रवणं शैलं ते गत्वा चित्रकाननम्।प्रणम्य शिरसा रामं लक्ष्मणं च महाबलम्।।5.65.1।।युवराजं पुरस्कृत्य सुग्रीवमभिवाद्य च।प्रवृत्तिमथ सीतायाः प्रवक्तुमुपचक्रमुः।।5.65.2।।
65_1.translation: Thereafter the vanaras arrived at the Prasrvana mount, with wonderful forests and bowed down to Sri Rama and mighty Lakshaman and Sugriva placing their leader, heir apparent in front. Then they began telling the story of Sita and her state.
65_1.word_by_word: ततः thereafter, ते they, चित्रकाननम् wonderful forest of Chitra, प्रस्रवणम् शैलम् to Prasravana mount, युवराजम् heir apparent, पुरस्कृत्य placing in front with respect, गत्वा having arrived, रामम् to Rama, महाबलम् mighty, लक्ष्मणं च and Lakshmana, शिरसा bowed down, प्रणम्य offered salutations, सुग्रीवम् to Sugriva, अभिवाद्य च offered obeisance, अथ and then, सीतायाः  regarding Sita's, प्रवृत्तिम् state, प्रवक्तुम् to tell, उपचक्रमुः began.

65_2.shloka: रावणान्तः पुरे रोधं राक्षसीभिश्च तर्जनम्।रामे समनुरागं च यश्चायं समयः कृतः।।5.65.3।।एतदाख्यान्ति ते सर्वे हरयो रामसन्निधौ।
65_2.translation: The monkeys in Rama's presence narrated all about Sita's detention in Ravana'sAshoka garden, the ogresses threatening her and the time limit fixed by Ravana (for her survival).
65_2.word_by_word: सर्वे all, ते हरयः those vanaras, रावणान्तः पुरे in the chambers of Ravana, रोधम् detention, राक्षसीभिः ogresses, तर्जनं च threatening, रामे to Rama, समनुरागं च her devotion, यः that which, अयम् thus, समयः time limit, कृतः set, एतत् all that, रामसन्निधौ in Rama's presence, आख्यान्ति told.

65_3.shloka: वैदेहीमक्षतां श्रुत्वा रामस्तूत्तरमब्रवीत्।।5.65.4।।क्व सीता वर्तते देवी कथं च मयि वर्तते।एतन्मे सर्वमाख्यात वैदेहीं प्रति वानराः।।5.65.5।।
65_3.translation: Hearing of Sita alive and not harmed, Rama asked the vanaras, 'How is Sita? How is she disposed to me? Tell me everything'.
65_3.word_by_word: वैदेहीम् Vaidehi, अक्षताम् not harmed, श्रुत्वा hearing, रामस्तु Rama too, उत्तरम् responded, अब्रवीत् asked, देवी divine lady, सीता Sita, क्व tell me, वर्तते she is, मयि to me, कथम् how, वर्तते is she, वानराः vanara, वैदेहीं प्रति her disposition towards, एतत् all that, सर्वम् every thing, मे to me, आख्यात asked.

65_4.shloka: रामस्य गदितं श्रुत्वा हरयो रामसन्निधौ।चोदयन्ति हनूमन्तं सीतावृत्तान्तकोविदम्।।5.65.6।।
65_4.translation: On hearing the words from Rama, the vanaras requested Hanuman who was aware of  Sita's position to tell Rama all about her.
65_4.word_by_word: हरयः vanaras,रामस्य Rama's, गदितम् words spoken, श्रुत्वा hearing, सीतावृत्तान्तकोविदम् who was aware of Sita's position, हनूमन्तम् Hanuman, रामसन्निधौ in the presence of Rama, चोदयन्ति requested to tell.

65_5.shloka: श्रुत्वा तु वचनं तेषां हनुमान्मारुतात्मजः।प्रणम्य शिरसा देव्यै सीतायै तां दिशं प्रति।।5.65.7।।उवाच वाक्यं वाक्यज्ञस्सीताया दर्शनं यथा।
65_5.translation: The son of the Wind god, Hanuman who was wise in speech heard the words of Rama, offered salutations to Sita in the direction in which she was located and narrated the story about her discovery.
65_5.word_by_word: मारुतात्मजः son of the Windgod, वाक्यज्ञः wise in speech, हनुमान् Hanuman, तेषाम् their,वचनम् words, श्रुत्वा hearing, देव्यै to the divine lady, सीतायै Sita, तां दिशं प्रति to the direction in which she was located, शिरसा with head down, प्रणम्य offered salutations, सीतायाः about Sita's, दर्शनम् finding, यथा these, वाक्यम् words, उवाच spoke.

65_6.shloka: समुद्रं लङ्घयित्वाहं शतयोजनमायतम्।।5.65.8।।अगच्छं जानकीं सीतां मार्गमाणो दिदृक्षया।
65_6.translation: "Having crossed the sea consisting of a hundred yojanas in quest of Vaidehi, I found her.
65_6.word_by_word: अहम् I, शतयोजनम् a hundred yojanas, आयतम् wide, समुद्रम् ocean, लङ्घयित्वा having crossed, जानकीम् Janaki,सीताम् Sita, मार्गमाणः searching, दिदृक्षया with the intention of seeing, आगच्छम् reached.

65_7.shloka: तत्र लङ्केति नगरी रावणस्य दुरात्मनः।।5.65.9।।दक्षिणस्य समुद्रस्य तीरे वसति दक्षिणे।
65_7.translation: "On the southern shore of the ocean is situated the city of Lanka , ruled by the evilminded Ravana.
65_7.word_by_word: तत्र there, दक्षिणस्य समुद्रस्य on the southern side of the sea, दक्षिणे तीरे of the southern shore, दुरात्मनः evilminded, रावणस्य Ravana's, लङ्केति in Lanka, नगरी city, वसति there is.

65_8.shloka: तत्र दृष्टा मया सीता रावणान्तः पुरे सती।।5.65.10।।सन्न्यस्य त्वयि जीवन्ती रामा राम मनोरथम्।
65_8.translation: "There in the inner palace of Ravana, I saw your lovely wife Sita, with all her hopes pinned on you, giving up all other desires.
65_8.word_by_word: रामा Rama, तत्र there, रावणान्तः पुरे in the inner palace of Ravana, सती your wife, त्वयिyour, मनोरथम्  her hopes, सन्न्यस्य giving up desires, जीवन्ती living, राम lovely, सीता Sita, मया by me, दृष्टा seen.

65_9.shloka: दृष्टा मे राक्षसीमध्ये तर्ज्यमाना मुहुर्मुहुः।।5.65.11।।राक्षसीभिर्विरूपाभी रक्षिता प्रमदावने।
65_9.translation: "I found her in the beautiful garden guarded by hideous ogresses threatening her again and again৷৷
65_9.word_by_word: प्रमदावने in that beautiful garden, विरूपाभिः hideous, राक्षसीभिः rakshasas, रक्षिता guarded, मुहुर्मुहुः again and again, तर्ज्यमाना threatening, मे I, राक्षसीमध्ये in the midst of ogresses, दृष्टा saw.

65_10.shloka: दुःख मासाद्यते देवी तथाऽदुःखोचिता सती।।5.65.12।।रावणान्तः पुरे रुद्धा राक्षसीभि स्सुरक्षिता।एकवेणीधरा दीना त्वयि चिन्तापरायणा।।5.65.13।।अधःशय्या विवर्णाङ्गी पद्मिनीव हिमागमे।रावणाद्विनिवृत्तार्था मर्तव्यकृतनिश्चया।।5.65.14।।देवी कथञ्चित्काकुत्स्थ त्वन्मना मार्गिता मया।
65_10.translation: "Sita, who did not deserve and yet was full of grief was detained by Ravana in his inner palace, guarded by ogresses. She had single braid (a sign of desolation), was pathetic,  and totally absorbed in your thought. She was lying on bare ground with her limbs turned pale, like lotus in winter. She was averse to Ravana and was determined to commit suicide. She has only Rama in her mind. Somehow I found her.
65_10.word_by_word: तथा in that way, दुःखोचिता mind filled with grief, देवी divine lady, दुःखम्  grief, आपद्यते not deserve to experience, रावणान्तःपुरे  in the inner palace of Ravana, रुद्धा  detained, राक्षसीभि by ogresses, स्सुरक्षिता guarded by, एकवेणीधरा wearing a single braid( a mark of desolation),दीना pathetic, त्वयि your,सती wife,चिन्तापरायणा absorbed in your thought, अध: शय्या now lying on bare ground, हिमागमे in winter season, पद्मिनीव like the lotus, विवर्णाङ्गी  limbs turned pale, रावणात् by Ravana, विनिवृत्तार्था averse to Ravana, मर्तव्यकृन्तिश्चया determined to die, काकुत्स्थ Rama alone, त्वन्मनाः in her mind, देवी Sita,कथञ्चित्  somehow, मार्गिता found.

65_11.shloka: इक्ष्वाकुवंशविख्यातिं शनैः कीर्तयतानघ।।5.65.15।।सा मया नरशार्दूल विश्वासमुपपादिता।
65_11.translation: "O sinless one O tiger among men To inspire confidence in her I praised the glory of your Ikshvaku dynasty.
65_11.word_by_word: अनघ sinless one, नरशार्दूल tiger among men, इक्ष्वाकुवंशविख्यातिम् all about the glory of Ikshvaku race, शनैः slowly, कीर्तयता praised, मया by me, सा she, विश्वासम् confidence, उपपादिता to inspire.

65_12.shloka: तत स्सम्भाषिता देवी सर्वमर्थं च दर्शिता।।5.65.16।।रामसुग्रीवसख्यं च श्रुत्वा प्रीतिमुपागता।नियत स्समुदाचारो भक्तिश्चास्यास्तथा त्वयि।।5.65.17।।
65_12.translation: "When the divine lady talked to me, I presented all the facts about the alliance of Rama and Sugriva. On hearing me, virtuous Sita, whose devotion is fixed on you became delighted.
65_12.word_by_word: ततः then, देवी divine lady, सम्भाषिता talked, सर्वम् all,अर्थम् all facts,दर्शिता presented to her, रामसुग्रीवसख्यं च about the alliance of Rama and Sugriva, श्रुत्वा on hearing, प्रीतिम् affectionately, उपागता became, अस्याः her, समुदाचारः virtuous, नियतः fixed, तथा so also, त्वयि towards, भक्तिश्च and devotion.

65_13.shloka: एवं मया महाभागा दृष्टा जनकनन्दिनी।उग्रेण तपसा युक्ता त्वद्भक्त्या पुरुषर्षभ।।5.65.18।।
65_13.translation: "O bull among men I saw Janaki,the delight of Janaka, a formidable lady filled with devotion to you and richly endowed with austerity.
65_13.word_by_word: पुरुषर्षभ bull among men, उग्रेण formidable, तपसा austerity, त्वद्भक्त्या devotion to you, युक्ता filled with, महाभागा prosperous, जनकनन्दिनी delight of Janaka, मया by me, एवम् that way, दृष्टा seen.

65_14.shloka: अभिज्ञानं च मे दत्तं यथा वृत्तं तवान्तिके।चित्रकूटे महाप्राज्ञ वायसं प्रति राघव।।5.65.19।।
65_14.translation: "O wise one, with your ring given her, she told me an anecdote of a crow that took place at Chitrakuta.
65_14.word_by_word: महाप्राज्ञ very wise, चित्रकूटे in Chitrakuta, तव your, अन्तिके provided me, वायसं प्रति with an anecdote of a crow, यथा so also, वृत्तम् told, अभिज्ञानम् as an identification for you, मे to me, दत्तम् presented.

65_15.shloka: विज्ञाप्यश्च नरव्याघ्रो रामो वायुसुत त्वया।अखिलेनेह यद्धृष्टमिति मामाह जानकी।।5.65.20।।
65_15.translation: (She said)'O son of the Windgod you should let Rama, the tiger among men know all that you have seen here.
65_15.word_by_word: वायुसुत son of the Windgod, नरव्याघ्रः tiger among men, रामः Rama, त्वया your, इह here, यत् that which, दृष्टम् seen, अखिलेन should tell, विज्ञाप्यः should let him know, इति thus, जानकी Janaki, माम् me, आह told.

65_16.shloka: अयं चास्मै प्रदातव्यो यत्नात्सुपरिरक्षितः।ब्रुवता वचनान्येवं सुग्रीवस्योपशृण्वतः।।5.65.21।।
65_16.translation: 'Within hearing of Sugriva, tell him about your efforts. Present this(signet) to Rama carefully preserved by me.
65_16.word_by_word: सुग्रीवस्य while Sugriva, उपशृण्वतः within hearing of, एवम् that way, वचनानि these words, ब्रुवता that I said, यत्नात् the efforts, सुपरिरक्षितः kept with great care, अयं च and I, अस्मै this, प्रदातव्यः be presented.

65_17.shloka: एष चूडामणिश्श्रीमान् मया सुपरिरक्षितः।मनश्शिलायास्तिलको गण्डपार्श्वे निवेशितः।।5.65.22।।त्वया प्रणष्ठे तिलके तं किल स्मर्तुमर्हसि।
65_17.translation: 'This auspicious (jewel) Chudamani has been preserved by me very carefully. Remind him of the decorative red mark he painted with a stone pigment on my forehead, indeed, it is proper to remind him of this.
65_17.word_by_word: श्रीमान् prosperous, एषः this, चूडामणिः Chudamani, मया by me, सुपरिरक्षितः very carefully preserved, तिलके red mark on the forehead, प्रणष्ठे when it was, त्वया by you, मनश्शिलायाः with the stone pigment, तिलकः mark on the forehead, गण्डपार्श्वे on my forehead, निवेशितः किल decorated indeed, तम् स्मर्तुम् remind him, अर्हसि is proper.

65_18.shloka: एष निर्यातितश्श्रीमान्मया ते वारि सम्भवः।एतं दृष्ट्वा प्रहृष्यामि व्यसने त्वामिवानघ।।5.65.23।।
65_18.translation: 'O sinless one tell Rama that this auspicious Chudamani born in the ocean is sent to him and I was gazing at it as if it was him (Rama) and feeling happy.
65_18.word_by_word: अनघ sinless one, दिव्यः wonderful, एषः this, निर्यातितः sent to you, श्रीमान् prosperous one, वारिसम्भवः born in the ocean, व्यसने in sorrow, एतम् this (Chudamani), मया I, दृष्टवा gazing, त्वामिव you only, प्रहृष्यामि was feeling happy.

65_19.shloka: जीवितं धारयिष्यामि मासं दशरथात्मज।।5.65.24।।ऊर्ध्वं मासान्न जीवेयं रक्षसां वशमागता।
65_19.translation: 'O Son of Dasaratha I will hold on to life for a month. Captured by the demons, I will not live for more than a month'.
65_19.word_by_word: दशरथात्मज Dasaratha's son, मासम् one month, जीवितम् living, धारयिष्यामि will hold on to, रक्षसाम् these demons, वशम् captivated by, आगता completion, मासात् after a month, ऊर्ध्वम् more than, न जीवेयम् will not live.

65_20.shloka: इति मामब्रवीत्सीता कृशाङ्गी धर्मचारिणी।।5.65.25।।रावणान्तः पुरे रुद्धा मृगीवोत्फुल्ललोचना।
65_20.translation: "With her limbs emaciated through austerities detained in Ravana's inner palace, eyes wide open in fear, Sita said this to me:
65_20.word_by_word: कृशाङ्गी enfeebled lady, धर्मचारिणी following righteous ways, रावणान्तःपुरे in the inner palace of Ravana, रुद्धा detained मृगीव like a doe, उत्फुल्ललोचना eyes wide open in fear, सीता Sita, माम् to me, इति this, अब्रवीत् said.

65_21.shloka: एतदेव मयाख्यातं सर्वं राघव यद्यथा।।5.65.26।।सर्वथा सागरजले संतारः प्रविधीयताम्।
65_21.translation: "O Rama I have spoken everything that has happened. We have to pay attention to the means of crossing the ocean."
65_21.word_by_word: राघव Rama, यत् that which, यथा like that, एतत् happened, सर्वमेव every thing, मया by me, ख्यातम् has been said, सर्वथा ever, सागरजले water of the ocean, सन्तारः means to cross the ocean, प्रविधीयताम् pay attention to.

65_22.shloka: तौ जाताश्वासौ राजपुत्रौ विदित्वा तच्चाभिज्ञानं राघवाय प्रदाय।देव्या चाख्यातं सर्वमेवानुपूर्व्याद्वाचा सम्पूर्णं वायुपुत्त्र श्शशंस।।5.65.27।।
65_22.translation: Coming to know that the two princes were sighing in relief, Hanuman presented the token of identification given by Sita to Rama, after having communicated in full the messsage of Sita in an orderly manner.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये सुन्दरकाण्डे पञ्चषष्टितमस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the sixtyfifth sarga of Sundarakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
65_22.word_by_word: वायुपुत्रः son of the Windgod, तौ राजपुत्त्रौ the two princes Rama and Lakshmana, जाताश्वासौ sighing in relief, विदित्वा knowing, तत् that, अभिज्ञानम् identification, राघवाय to Rama, प्रदाय communicated, देव्या by Sita, आख्यातम् having spoken, सर्वमेव everything, सम्पूर्णम् completely, आनुपूर्व्यात् in an orderly manner, वाचा spoken, शशंस  Hanuman.

66_1.shloka: [Sri Rama wails piteously after seeing the token chudamani.]एवमुक्तो हनुमता रामो दशरथात्मज:।तं मणिं हृदये कृत्वा प्ररुरोद सलक्ष्मणः।।5.66.1।।
66_1.translation: Thus addressed by Hanuman, Rama held the token (Chudamani) against his bosom and wept with Lakshmana.
66_1.word_by_word: हनुमता Hanuman, एवम् in that manner, उक्तः spoken, सलक्ष्मणः Lakshmana, दशरथात्मजः son of Dasaratha, रामः Rama, तं मणिम् that ornament, हृदये to the bosom, कृत्वा held, प्ररुरोद wept.

66_2.shloka: तं तु दृष्ट्वा मणिश्रेष्ठं राघव श्शोककर्शितः।नेत्राभ्यामश्रुपूर्णाभ्यां सुग्रीवमिदमब्रवीत्।।5.66.2।।
66_2.translation: Seeing the precious jewel, Rama's eyes were filled with tears. Overwhelmed with grief, he spoke to Sugriva.
66_2.word_by_word: तं मणिश्रेष्ठम् the precious jewel, दृष्ट्वा seeing, राघवः Rama, शोककर्शितः overcome with sorrow, अश्रुपूर्णाभ्याम् filled with tears, नेत्राभ्याम् both eyes, सुग्रीवम् to Sugriva, इदम् thus, अब्रवीत् spoke.

66_3.shloka: यथैव धेनु स्स्रवति स्नेहाद्वत्सस्य वत्सला।तथा ममापि हृदयं मणिरत्नस्य दर्शनात्।।5.66.3।।
66_3.translation: "Just as a cow fond of its calf begins to distil milk from its teats at the sight of the calf, so does my heart melt at the sight of this excellent jewel.
66_3.word_by_word: वत्सला fond of its calf, धेनुः cow, वत्सस्य at the sight of calf, स्नेहात् out of love, यथैव in the same way, स्रवति distils milk from its teats, मम हृदयमपि my heart also, मणिरत्नस्य at this excellent jewel, दर्शनात् on seeing, तथा  so does.

66_4.shloka: मणिरत्नमिदं दत्तं वैदेह्याश्श्वशुरेण मे।वधूकाले यथाबद्धमधिकं मूर्ध्नि शोभते।।5.66.4।।
66_4.translation: "At the time of marriage, this jewel was presented by my father-in-law. Vaidehi wore it on her forehead and it looked charming.
66_4.word_by_word: वधूकाले at the time of marriage, मूर्ध्नि to the head, आबद्धम् tied, यथा so, शोभते charming, इदम् this, मणिरत्नम् gem of ornament, मे श्वशुरेण my fatherinlaw, वैदेह्याः to Vaidehi, दत्तम् presented.

66_5.shloka: अयं हि जलसम्भूतो मणिस्सज्जनपूजितः।यज्ञे परमतुष्टेन दत्तश्शक्रेण धीमता।।5.66.5।।
66_5.translation: "This was found in water and was bestowed by Indra out of great joy on Janaka who had performed a grand sacrificial ceremony. So it was worshipped by elders of the family.
66_5.word_by_word: जलसम्भूतः found in water, सज्जनपूजितः worshipped by elders of the family, अयं मणिः this jewel यज्ञे in sacrificial ceremony, परमतुष्टेन great joy, धीमता wise one, शक्रेण by Indra, दत्तः given.

66_6.shloka: इमं दृष्ट्वा मणिश्रेष्ठं यथा तातस्य दर्शनम्।अद्यास्म्यवगतस्सौम्य वैदेहस्य तथा विभोः।।5.66.6।।
66_6.translation: "O noble Sugriva now when I see this excellent jewel, I get direct sight of my father and king of Videha (in the same way as I obtained the sight of Sita).
66_6.word_by_word: सौम्य noble, अद्य now, इमम् this, मणिश्रेष्ठम् gem of jewel, दृष्ट्वा when I see, तातस्य father's, तथा so also, विभोः king, वैदेहस्य of Videha, दर्शनम् seeing, यथा as if, अवगतः get.

66_7.shloka: अयं हि शोभते तस्याः प्रियाया मूर्ध्नि मे मणिः।अस्याद्य दर्शने नाहं प्राप्तां तामिव चिन्तये।।5.66.7।।
66_7.translation: "This jewel was shining on the head of my beloved. Now its mere look makes me feel that I am seeing her.
66_7.word_by_word: अयं मणिः this gem, मे प्रियायाः my beloved, मूर्ध्नि head, शोभते हि indeed shone, अद्य now, अस्य its, दर्शनेन mere look, ताम् her, प्राप्तामिव as if I am seeing, चिन्तये I think.

66_8.shloka: किमाह सीता वैदेही ब्रूहि सौम्य पुनः पुनः।पिपासुमिव तोयेन सिञ्चन्ती वाक्यवारिणा।।5.66.8।।
66_8.translation: "O handsome Hanuman Sita is like water for a thirsty person. Tell me again and again what Sita said to you. Sprinkle on me (lifegiving) water of her words in the form of message.
66_8.word_by_word: सौम्य O handsome (Hanuman), पिपासुम् for a thirsty one, तोयेन इव like water, वाक्यवारिणा in lifegiving water of words, सिञ्चन्ती sprinkle, वैदेही Vaidehi, सीता Sita, किम् what else, पुनः पुनः again and again, आह to speak, ब्रूहि asked.

66_9.shloka: इतस्तु किं दुःखतरं यदिमं वारिसम्भवम्।मणिं पश्यामि सौमित्रे वैदेहीमागतां विना।।5.66.9।।
66_9.translation: "O Saumitri I see this jewel born (formed) under water but not her. What can be more sorrowful to me?
66_9.word_by_word: सौमित्रे O Saumitri, वारिसम्भवम् found in water, इमं मणिम् this jewel, वैदेहीम् of Vaidehi, आगतां विना without her, यत् पश्यामि seeing this, इतः here, दुःखतरम् cause more sorrow, किम् what?

66_10.shloka: चिरं जीवति वैदेही यदि मासं धरिष्यति।क्षणं सौम्य न जीवेयं विना तामसितेक्षणाम्।।5.66.10।।
66_10.translation: (Addressing Hanuman again) "O dear, if she can live for a month it is living for long. I would not live for a moment without the black-eyed Vaidehi.
66_10.word_by_word: सौम्य O dear!, वैदेही Vaidehi, मासम् one month, धरिष्यति यदि if she lives, चिरम् for long, जीवति living, सौम्य O dear, ताम् her, असितेक्षणां विना without the (enchanting) black-eyed, क्षणम् for a moment, न जीवेयम् I cannot live

66_11.shloka: नय मामपि तं देशं यत्र दृष्टा मम प्रिया।न तिष्ठेयं क्षणमपि प्रवृत्तिमुपलभ्य च।।5.66.11।।
66_11.translation: "Take me to the place you saw my beloved. Knowing where she is I cannot stay here even for a moment.
66_11.word_by_word: मम my, प्रिया beloved, यत्र दृष्टा where you saw, मामपि me too, तं देशम् that place, नय take me, प्रवृत्तिम् where she is, उपलभ्य च and knowing, क्षणमपि even a moment, न तिष्ठेयम् not stay here.

66_12.shloka: कथं सा मम सुश्रोणी भीरुभीरु स्सती सदा।भयावहानां घोराणां मध्ये तिष्ठति रक्षसाम्।।5.66.12।।
66_12.translation: "She is always very timid. How can my fairhipped beloved remain in the midst of dreadful and fearsome demons?
66_12.word_by_word: सदा always, भीरुभीरुः सती very timid, मम सुश्रोणी my fairhipped beloved, भयावहानाम् fearsome forms, घोराणाम् dreadful ones, रक्षसाम् demons, मध्ये midst, कथम् how, तिष्ठति does she remain.

66_13.shloka: शारद स्तिमिरोन्मुक्तो नूनं चन्द्रं इवांबुधैः।आवृतं वदनं तस्या न विराजति राक्षसैः।।5.66.13।।
66_13.translation: "Her face resembling the autumnal Moon bereft of its stain, though covered with rainclouds does not shine so bright.
66_13.word_by_word: तिमिरोन्मुक्तः bereft of brightness, अम्बुदैः by rainclouds, चन्द्रः इव like the Moon, राक्षसैः by demons, आवृतम् surrounded by, तस्याः her, वदनम् countenance, न विराजति not shine, नूनम् surely.

66_14.shloka: किमाह सीता हनुमंस्तत्त्वतः कथयाद्य मे।एतेन खलु जीविष्ये भेषजेनातुरो यथा।।5.66.14।।
66_14.translation: "O Hanuman Tell me now truly what has been told by her. I am eager to know. Indeed, it will keep me alive just as medicne does. (I shall survive on the strength of her message)
66_14.word_by_word: हनुमान् Hanuman, सीता Sita, किम् what, आह to go, अद्य now, तत्त्वतः truly, मे I am, कथय told by her, आतुरः eager, भेषजेन यथा just as medicine does, एतेन that alone, जीविष्ये खलु indeed, keep me alive.

66_15.shloka: मधुरा मधुरालापा किमाह मम भामिनी।मद्विहीना वरारोहा हनुमन् कथयस्व मे।।5.66.15।।
66_15.translation: That lovely Sita who speaks sweetly, that fairhipped beautiful one who has been separated from me, my beloved, what did she say? Please narrate.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये सुन्दरकाण्डे षट्षष्टितमस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the sixtysixth sarga of Sundarakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
66_15.word_by_word: मधुरा lovely one, मधुरालापा one who speaks sweetly, वरारोहा fairhipped one, मद्विहीना separated from me, मम भामिनी my beloved, किम् what, आह did she say, मे to me, कथयस्व you may narrate.

67_1.shloka: [Hanuman once again narrates to Rama, Sita's condition.]एवमुक्तस्तु हनुमान् राघवेण महात्मना।सीताया भाषितं सर्वं न्यवेदयत राघवे।।5.67.1।।
67_1.translation: Thus asked by Sri Rama, Hanuman repeated everything spoken by Sita to Rama.
67_1.word_by_word: महात्मना great soul, राघवेण to Rama, एवम् that way, उक्तः spoken, हनुमान् Hanuman, सीतायाः Sita's, भाषितम् said, सर्वम् everything, राघवे to Rama, न्यवेदयत related.

67_2.shloka: इदमुक्तवती देवी जानकी पुरुषर्षभ।पूर्व वृत्तमभिज्ञानं चित्रकूटे यथातथम्।।5.67.2।।
67_2.translation: "O bull among men queen Janaki related to me as a token of identification an incident  that had taken place at Chitrakuta in the past.
67_2.word_by_word: पुरुषर्षभ bull among men, देवी queen, जानकी Janaki, चित्रकूटे at Chitrakuta, पूर्ववृत्तम् incident of the past, अभिज्ञानम् as an identification, यथातथम् as it is, इदम् this, उक्तवती she said.

67_3.shloka: सुखसुप्ता त्वया सार्धं जानकी पूर्वमुत्थिता।वायस स्सहसोत्पत्य विददार स्तनान्तरे।।5.67.3।।
67_3.translation: "When she was lying on your lap happily she awoke early and a crow came swiftly and scratched on her breast.
67_3.word_by_word: त्वया सार्धम् along with you, सुखसुप्ता lying down happily, जानकी Janaki, पूर्वम् earlier, उत्थिता woke up, वायसः a crow, सहसा swiftly, उत्पत्य got up, स्तनान्तरे on her breast, विददार scratched.

67_4.shloka: पर्यायेण च सुप्तस्त्वं देव्यङ्के भरताग्रज।पुनश्च किल पक्षी स देव्या जनयति व्यथाम्।।5.67.4।।
67_4.translation: "O Bharata's brother, when Sita awoke from sleep you slept on her lap. The same crow again hurt her.
67_4.word_by_word: भरताग्रज elder brother of Bharata, त्वम् you, पर्यायेण woke up, देव्यङ्के on her lap, सुप्तः slept, सः पक्षी that crow, पुनश्च again, देव्याः Sita's, व्यथाम् hurting, जनयति किल started hurting.

67_5.shloka: पुनः पुनरुपागम्य विददार भृशं किल।ततस्त्वं बोधितस्तस्याश्शोणितेन समुक्षितः।।5.67.5।।
67_5.translation: Again and again the crow came to her and scratched her. She woke you up as you were getting wet with blood shed from her body.
67_5.word_by_word: पुनः पुनः again and again, उपागम्य coming over her, भृशम् violently, विददार किल started scratching, ततः then, त्वम् you, तस्याः her, शोणितेन by blood, समुक्षितः wet by shedding, बोधितः किल woke you up.

67_6.shloka: वायसेन च तेनैव सततं बाध्यमानया।बोधितः किल देव्या त्वं सुखसुप्तः परन्तप।।5.67.6।।
67_6.translation: "O scorcher of enemies pained by the crow hurting her repeatedly, while you were sleeping happily, she woke you up and informed you about it.
67_6.word_by_word: परन्तप scorcher of enemies, तेन by that, वायसेनैव by the crow, सततम् repeatedly, बाध्यमानया pained, देव्या by the divine lady, सुखसुप्तः sleeping happily, त्वम् you, बोधितः किल woke you up and informed you.

67_7.shloka: तां तु दृष्ट्वा महाबाहो दारितां च स्तनान्तरे।आशीविष इव क्रुद्धो निश्वसन्नभ्यभाषथाः।।5.67.7।।
67_7.translation: "Seeing the blood flowing from her breasts you became furious like a hissing serpent and said:
67_7.word_by_word: महाबाहो one with strong arms, स्तनान्तरे from the breasts, दारिताम् flowing, ताम् her, दृष्ट्वा seeing, क्रुद्धः furious, आशीविष इव like a serpent, निश्वसन् sighing, अभ्यभाषथाः you said this.

67_8.shloka: नखाग्रैः केन ते भीरु दारितं तु स्तनान्तरम्।कः क्रीडति सरोषेण पञ्चवक्त्रेण भोगिना।।5.67.8।।
67_8.translation: "You are of timid nature. Who has scratched your breasts with the tip of the nail? Who is sporting with an enraged fivehooded serpent"?
67_8.word_by_word: भीरु timid, ते you, स्तनान्तरम् from the breasts, केन who, नखाग्रैः with the tip of the nails, दारितम् scratched, सरोषेण furious, पञ्चवक्त्रेण भोगिना fivehooded serpent, कः who, क्रीडति sported.

67_9.translation: 'Seeing all over, at once I glanced at the crow that stood in front of her with sharp bloodstained nails'.
67_9.word_by_word: निरीक्षमाणः seeing all over, सरुधिरैः with blood, तीक्ष्णैः sharp, नखैः nails, तामेव of her, अभिमुखम् in front of, स्थितम् stood, वायसम् crow, सहसा at once, समवैक्षथाः glanced.

67_10.shloka: सुतः किल स शक्रस्य वायसः पततां वरः।धरान्तरचरश्शीघ्रं पवनस्य गतौ समः।।5.67.10।।
67_10.translation: 'That crow, the foremost of the birds was the son of Indra moving about all over the earth swiftly. His speed matched the Windgod's.
67_10.word_by_word: पतताम् among birds, वरः foremost, सः वायसः that crow, शक्रस्य Indra's, पुत्रः son, किल moving about, धरान्तरगतः all over the earth, शीघ्रम् swiftly, गतौ flying, पवनस्य windgod's speed, समः equal.

67_11.shloka: ततस्तस्मिन्महाबाहो कोपसंवर्तितेक्षणः।वायसे त्वं कृथाः क्रूरां मतिं मतिमतां वर।।5.67.11।।
67_11.translation: 'O longarmed, wise and revered Rama, then in anguish you took a cruel decision'.
67_11.word_by_word: महाबाहो longarmed one, मतिमताम् very wise one, वर reverred, त्वम् you, कोपसंवर्तितेक्षणः anguished, ततः then, तस्मिन् its, वायसे the crow's, क्रूराम् cruel, मतिम् in your mind, कृथाः decision took.

67_12.shloka: स दर्भं संस्तराद्गृह्य ब्रह्मास्त्रेण ह्ययोजयः।स दीप्त इव कालाग्निर्जज्वालाभिमुखः खगम्।।5.67.12।।
67_12.translation: 'You took out a blade of grass from your mat and chanted the mantra to invoke the weapon of Brahma (Brahmastra) and hurled it on the crow. It blazed like the fire of the doom's day.
67_12.word_by_word: सः he, संस्तरात् from your mat, दर्भम् a blade of grass, गृह्य took out, ब्राह्मेण अस्त्रेण by the mantra of the weapon of Brahma, योजयत् chanted, सः he, दीप्तः blazed, कालाग्निरिव like the fire of the demon's day, द्विजम् bird, अभिमुखः towards the direction, जज्वाल hurled.

67_13.shloka: क्षिप्तवांस्त्वं प्रदीप्तं हि दर्भं तं वायसं प्रति।ततस्तु वायसं दीप्तस्स दर्भोऽनुजगाम ह।।5.67.13।।
67_13.translation: 'You hurled the blazing blade of grass on to the crow. That burning blade of grass chased the crow.
67_13.word_by_word: त्वम् yourself, प्रदीप्तम् blazing, तं दर्भम् that blade of grass, वायसं प्रति over the crow, क्षिप्तवान् burning, ततः then, सः दर्भः that blade of grass, दीप्तः glowing like fire, वायसम् tothe crow, अनुजगाम ह chased.

67_14.shloka: स पित्रा च परित्यक्तस्सुरैश्च समहर्षिभिः।त्रीन् लोकान् सम्परिक्रम्य त्रातारं नाधिगच्छति।।5.67.14।।
67_14.translation: 'He was abandoned by his father, even by great sages and gods. Then he went round the three worlds but could not find a saviour.
67_14.word_by_word: सः he, पित्रा च by the father, समहर्षिभिः even the great sages, सुरैश्च and gods, परित्यक्तः abandoned, त्रीन् three, लोकान् worlds, सम्परिक्रम्य went round also, त्रातारम् saviour, नाधिगच्छति was not found.

67_15.shloka: पुनरेवागतस्त्रस्तस्त्वत्सकाशमरिंदम।स तं निपतितं भूमौ शरण्यश्शरणागतम्।।5.67.15।।वधार्हमपि काकुत्स्थ कृपया पर्यपालयः।
67_15.translation: 'O destroyer of enemies the crow came back again to you trembling seeking protection from you and fell on the ground. Even though it deserved to be slayed, you saved him out of compassion.
67_15.word_by_word: अरिन्दम destroyer of enemies, त्रस्तः trembling, पुनरेव again, त्वत्सकाशम् that crow, आगतः came back, शरण्यः for protection, सः काकुत्स्थ: to Rama, शरणागतम् seeking protection, भूमौ on earth, निपतितम् fell down, तम् him, वाधर्हमपि that which deserved to be slayed, कृपया in compassion, पर्यपालय: saved.

67_16.shloka: मोघमस्त्रं न शक्यं तु कर्तुमित्येव राघव।।5.67.16।।भवांस्तस्याक्षि काकस्य हिनस्ति स्म स दक्षिणम्।
67_16.translation: 'O Rama since a divine weapon cannot be withdrawn, it did strike his right eye'.
67_16.word_by_word: राघव Rama, अस्त्रम् weapon, मोघम् divine one, कर्तुम् to withdraw, न शक्यम् not possible, इत्येव therefore, भवान् you, तस्य काकस्य that crow, दक्षिणम् अक्षि right eye, हिनस्ति स्म struck.

67_17.shloka: राम त्वां स नमस्कृत्य राज्ञे दशरथाय च।।5.67.17।।विसृष्टस्तु तदा काक प्रतिपेदे स्वमालयम्।
67_17.translation: 'Thereafter that crow left without killing offered salutations to you and king Dasaratha and returned to his abode.
67_17.word_by_word: राम Rama, तदा thereafter, सः काकः that crow, विसृष्टः having left it without killing, त्वाम् him, राज्ञे to king, दशरथाय च Dasaratha, नमस्कृत्य offered salutations, स्वम् to you, आलयम् his abode, प्रतिपेदे returned.

67_18.shloka: एवमस्त्रविदां श्रेष्ठस्सत्त्ववान् शीलवानपि।।5.67.18।।किमर्थमस्त्रं रक्षस्सु न योजयति राघवः।
67_18.translation: 'You are efficient, foremost among wielders of weapons, truthful and powerful. Why are you not directing weapons against the demons?
67_18.word_by_word: शीलवानपि of good conduct, राघव Rama, एवम् that way, अस्त्रविदाम् among wielders of weapons, श्रेष्ठः foremost, सत्यवान् truthful, बलवानपि powerful, रक्षस्सु on demons, अस्त्रम् weapons, किमर्थम् for what reason, न योजयति not directing.

67_19.shloka: न नागा नापि गन्धर्वा नासुरा न मरुद्गणाः।।5.67.19।।न च सर्वे रणे शक्ता रामं प्रतिसमासितुम्।
67_19.translation: 'It is not possible for nagas, gandharvas, even asuras or Marutas to confront Rama in war.
67_19.word_by_word: रणे in war, रामं प्रति to face Rama, प्रतिसमासितुम् to stand in front of you, नागाः nagas, न शक्ताः not possible, गन्धर्वाः अपि even gandharvas, न असुराः not even asuras, न not, मरुद्गणाः Marutas, न not, सर्वे all, न not possible.

67_20.shloka: तस्य वीर्यवतः कश्चिद्यद्यस्ति मयि सम्भ्रमः।।5.67.20।।क्षिप्रं सुनिशितैर्बाणैर्हन्यतां युधि रावणः।
67_20.translation: 'If you have any anxiety about me, you will certainly slay Ravana in the battle immediately with your sharp arrows'.
67_20.word_by_word: वीर्यवतः very valiant one, तस्य his, मयि my, सम्भ्रमः anxiety, अस्ति यदि if he has, सुनिशितैः sharp, बाणैः arrows, रावणः Ravana, क्षिप्रम् immediately, युधि in battle, हन्यताम् will slay.

67_21.shloka: भ्रातुरादेशमाज्ञाय लक्ष्मणो वा परन्तपः।।5.67.21।।स किमर्थं नरवरो न मां रक्षति राघवः।
67_21.translation: 'For what reason is the the scorcher of enemies, Lakshmana, the best of men also does not protect me at the behest of Rama, his brother?
67_21.word_by_word: परन्तपः scorcher of enemies, नरवरः best of men, राघवः Rama, सः लक्ष्मणो वा or even Lakshmana, भ्रातुः brother's, आदेशम् instruction, आज्ञाय getting, माम् me, किमर्थम् for what reason, न रक्षति not protecting me.

67_22.shloka: शक्तौ तौ पुरुषव्याघ्रौ वाय्वग्निसमतेजसौ ।।5.67.22।।सुराणामपि दुर्धर्षौ किमर्थं मामुपेक्षतः।
67_22.translation: 'Why are the two tigers among men whose power is like that of wind and fire and who are unassailable even to suras are neglecting me?
67_22.word_by_word: शक्तौ in power, वाय्वग्निसमतेजसौ equal to wind and fire, पुरुषव्याघ्रौ tigers among men, तौ they both, सुराणाम् suras, दुर्धर्षौ यदि अपि being even unassailable, माम् me, किमर्थम् why, उपेक्षतः neglecting.

67_23.shloka: ममैव दुष्कृतं किञ्चिन्महदस्ति न संशयः।।5.67.23।।समर्थौ सहितौ यन्मां नावेक्षेते परन्तपौ।
67_23.translation: 'Have I done any great sin because of which even though both the scorchers of enemies are capable, they are not doing so?'
67_23.word_by_word: ममैव have I, महत् great, किञ्चित् any, दुष्कृतम् sin, अस्ति done, संशयः doubt, न no, यत् that which, समर्थावपि even though capable, परन्तपौ the scorchers of enemies, तौ they both, माम् my, न अवेक्षेते not doing so.

67_24.shloka: वैदेह्या वचनं श्रुत्वा करुणं साश्रु भाषितम्।पुनरप्यहमार्यां तामिदं वचनमब्रुवम्।।5.67.24।।
67_24.translation: "On hearing Vaidehi's piteous words, I once again said this to the noble lady:
67_24.word_by_word: करुणम् piteous, साश्रुभाषितम् those good words, वैदेह्याः of Vaidehi, वचनम् words, श्रुत्वा on hearing, अहम् I, पुनरपि once again, ताम् आर्याम् her the noble one, इदम् these, वचनम् words, अब्रवम् said.

67_25.shloka: त्वच्छोकविमुखो रामो देवि सत्येन ते शपे।।5.67.25।।रामे दुःखाभिभूते तु लक्ष्मणः परितप्यते।
67_25.translation: 'O divine lady I swear to you on my truthfulness, that out of grief for you Rama is not interested in anything else and Lakshmana is deeply afflicted because Rama is overhelmed with grief.
67_25.word_by_word: देवि O divine lady, रामः Rama, त्वच्छोकविमुखः out of grief not interested in any thing, सत्येन truly, ते to you, शपे swear, रामे Rama, दुःखाभिपन्ने filled with sorrow, लक्ष्मणः च and Lakshmana, परितप्यते deeply afflicted.

67_26.shloka: कथञ्चिद्भवती दृष्टा न कालः परिशोचितुम्।।5.67.26।।अस्मिन्मुहूर्ते दुःखानामन्तं द्रक्ष्यसि भामिनि।
67_26.translation: 'O lovely lady somehow I could discover you. This is not the moment for lamentation.Your grief will end.
67_26.word_by_word: भामिनि O lovely lady, कथञ्चित्  somehow, भवती you, दृष्टा saw, परिदेवितुम् for lamentation, कालः time, न not, इमम् this, मुहूर्तम् moment, दुःखानाम्  grief, अन्तम् end, द्रक्ष्यसि will see.

67_27.translation: 'The two princes, tigers among men are blameles. They are anxious to see you. They will reduce this Lanka into ashes.
67_27.word_by_word: नरशार्दूलौ tigers among men, अनिन्दितौ blameless, महाबलौ mighty, त्वद्दर्शनकृतोत्साहौ eager to see you, उभौ both, तौ राजपुत्रौ the two princes, लङ्काम् to Lanka, भस्मीकरिष्यतः will reduce to ashes.

67_28.shloka: हत्वा च समरे रौद्रं रावणं सह बान्धवम्।।5.67.28।।राघवस्त्वां वरारोहे स्वां पुरीं नयते ध्रुवम्।
67_28.translation: 'O fairhipped lady Rama will slay fearsome Ravana and all his relatives and take you to his city. It is certain.
67_28.word_by_word: वरारोहे fairhipped lady, राघवः Rama, रौद्रम् fearsome, सहबान्धवम् and his ralatives, रावणम् Ravana, समरे in war, हत्वा च and slay, त्वाम् you, स्वां पुरीम् his city, नयते take you, ध्रुवम् certain.

67_29.translation: 'O blameless lady you should give me that which he would be glad to recognise as a token.'
67_29.word_by_word: अनिन्दिते O blameless one, रामः Rama, यत् that which, विजानीयात् he knows, तस्य its, प्रीतिसञ्जननम् that which gives happiness, अभिज्ञानम् knowing, इह here, दातुम् to give, त्वम् you, अर्हसि is proper for you.

67_30.shloka: साभिवीक्ष्य दिशस्सर्वा वेण्युद्ग्रथितमुत्तमम्।।5.67.30।।मुक्त्वा वस्त्राद्ददौ मह्यं मणिमेतं महाबल।
67_30.translation: "O mighty Rama, she glanced at all directions and untied the end of her garment  in which she had this best jewel worn on her hair preserved and gave it to me.
67_30.word_by_word: महाबल mighty Rama, सा she, सर्वाः all, दिशः directions, अभिवीक्ष्य glancing at, वेण्युद्ग्रथितम् that which is worn on her hair, उत्तमम् best one, एतं मणिम् this gem, वस्त्रात् from her cloth, मुक्त्वा untied, मह्यम् to me, ददौ gave.

67_31.shloka: प्रतिगृह्य मणिं दिव्यं तव हेतो रघूद्वह।।5.67.31।।शिरसा तां प्रणम्यार्यामहमागमने त्वरे।
67_31.translation: "O foremost among the Raghus I took that wonderful gem for your sake from the noble lady and offered her salutations, bowing my head, and returned quickly৷৷
67_31.word_by_word: रघूद्वह foremost among the Raghus, दिव्यम् wonderful, मणिम् gem, तव हेतोः for your sake, प्रतिगृह्य took, आर्याम् from the noble lady, ताम् her, शिरसा bowing down, प्रणम्य after saluting, अहम् I, आगमने returned, त्वरे quickly.

67_32.shloka: गमने च कृतोत्साहमवेक्ष्य वरवर्णिनी।।5.67.32।।विवर्धमानं च हि मामुवाच जनकात्मजा।
67_32.translation: "Seeing me eager to depart and growing in size, the loving daughter of Janaka said.
67_32.word_by_word: वरवर्णिनी of fine complexion, जनकात्मजा Janaka's daughter, गमने to start, कृतोत्साहम् witheagerness, विवर्धमानं च increasing, माम् me, आवेक्ष्य seeing, उवाच spoke.

67_33.translation: "She was dejected. Her face was filled with tears. Despondent at my departure, she shed tears profusely and said:
67_33.word_by_word: अश्रुपूर्णमुखी face filled with tears, दीना dejected, बाष्पसन्दिग्धभाषिणी throat choked with tears, मम me, उत्पतनसम्भ्रान्ता despondent at my departue, शोकवेगसमाहता shedding tears profusely.

67_34.shloka: हनुमन् सिंहसंकाशावुभौ तौ रामलक्ष्मणौ।।5.67.34।।सुग्रीवञ्च सहामात्यं सर्वान् ब्रूया ह्यनामयम्।
67_34.translation: 'Hanuman tell both Rama and Lakshman who are like two lions, Sugriva and his ministers about my welfare.
67_34.word_by_word: हनुमन् Hanuman, सिंहसंकाशौ resembling lion, तौ रामलक्ष्मणौ both Rama and Lakshmana, उभौ both, सहामात्यम् and his ministers, सुग्रीवञ्च and to Sugriva, सर्वान् to all, अनामयम् my welfare, ब्रूयाः tell.

67_35.shloka: यथा च स महाबाहुर्मां तारयति राघवः।अस्माद्धुःखाम्बुसंरोधात्त्वं समाधातुमर्हसि।।5.67.35।।
67_35.translation: 'You may go and tell mighty Rama to make arrangements to relieve me from thisocean of sorrow.
67_35.word_by_word: महाबाहुः strongarmed one, सः राघवः that Rama, अस्मात् from this, दुःखाम्बुसंरोधात् ocean of sorrow, यथा that way, तारयति to relieve, त्वम् you, समाधातुम् make arangements, अर्हसि is right.

67_36.shloka: इमं च तीव्रं मम शोकवेगं रक्षोभिरेभिः परिभर्त्सनं च।ब्रूयास्तु रामस्य गतस्समीपम् शिवश्च तेऽध्वास्तु हरिप्रवीर।।5.67.36।।
67_36.translation: 'O foremost among the heroic monkeys approaching Rama, you should tell him the intensity of my sorrow and the threatening of the shedemons. Let your journey be speedy and auspicious.'
